xdKjRQI-jowELRLXoNsfqA.text: Ok, so it's not perfection, but I have to give it 5 stars based on what I see passes as a "4 star" place for breakfast/brunch on the Strip. Eat blows them out of the water.  Service is friendly and efficient; helpful with a smile. What more do you need?  Ambiance is cute, mildly hipster, but nothing over the top. Just a bunch of people digging good food.  As for the food, the standouts for us were the Truffled Egg Sandwich and the pancakes. The pancake had a sublime lightness to them with a perfectly thin crispy exterior. Seriously one of the best I've had in a long time. Potatoes on the side were great as well. Other food was less than amazing (Chicken Fried Steak tasted good, but was just a little over done and the steak wasn't pounded quite thin enough, and Chilaquiles just lacked some oomph), but still good for the eating.  Well worth the trip to downtown LV. Afterwards, we walked through the Container Park right across the street. Neat stuff.

TfU17AgBI3I3BYxM_DXLQg.text: Just outstanding. The best eggs Benedict I ever had. Great atmosphere for a early Saturday morning. No drama.

YGscQvUBJz6ccluh_aJJnQ.text: Friends and I were in Vegas for the RiSE festival and EAT was recommended to us. we tried to go for lunch but it was a 45 minute wait so we decided to check it out for breakfast. I ordered the Egg Truffle sandwich. The sandwich was really tasty with a great flavor and the dish was filling with the potatoes. I added avocado to the sandwich which was another $2.00 but gave it a great extra something.  The coffee was good too.  Even though the place was busy for a Sunday morning (10 a.m.) the service was good as the wait staff was attentive. I would  definitely recommend this place.  The place is first come, first serve so unfortunately no reservations so if you are going to EAT come early for lunch unless you don't mind waiting 45 minutes.

GU_phdWV0Pl31J-7AD6UmQ.text: Overpriced for what it is. $10 for 3 pancakes (way too heavy/dense) and one index finger sized sausage. My husband got the chicken fried steak. Meat was gristly and tough.  Hostess tried to seat us at the worst table with metal chairs next to the window when it was 111degrees outside. There were plenty of other comfortable 2-seaters in the interior of the restaurant.

-sekktsRGBQiwBLJoQ0etw.text: Super cute, hidden place to eat. We ordered the BLT and it was amazing ! Really big portions and super nice servers .

kHGnry-mH0Fy5WM5jh_pAg.text: Always fresh & great.  Be prepared to wait and have all patrons in your party present or you won't get sat down.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled eggs appetizer! Delish
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese &amp; tomato soup

JEIrv0kRh0Vlg0GbDw-FQA.text: This was place is never a disappointment. Been here atleast 5 times this year and i always try something new. Food is delicious, service is great and friendly and not to mention the great atmosphere. Highly recommended.

qn3hZ2GFeBOi0Dnkmt364g.text: We usually eat breakfast at Egg & I but deciding to try this place.What lured us in were the pic of the beignets which we found out are actually no longer on the menu! WTF!..Talk about False advertising. ..Then what breakfast place worth its weight in gold doesn't serve freshly squeezed orange juice..Especially after a long night of dancing and drinking. THIS is essential. .. Small yet quait with indoor/outside seating and decent decor and ambiance but who really cares about that at breakfast. ..Good food, Freshly squeezed juice options and great service is how we judge our Breakfast  spots. Whats saves this joint is The Food...fresh ingredients and righteous spicing are key.. So if you're ok with decent service, no freshly squeezed oj but good food (without the beignets) Definitely give this place a try, at least once..

XHknqMv2wL5zOFG1dJ-0kQ.text: Great tasting food had the pancakes and also tried the grilled cheese and tomato soup,there also very generous with portions the only complain really was the waitress was a bit pushy coming by every other minute to see if we where ready to order even after I told her it was my first time at eat and I wanted to see all the options I would understand if it was busy but there was only like 4 customers at the time on a Wednesday just saying

-D1hxAWFPQEq-3ERXR5h6g.text: Had a chance to drop by here the Saturday after Mother's day. I'm guessing since everyone had been out to eat the week before it was less crowded than usual. Parking is metered (boo!) but there was plenty of it across the street and in the surrounding area. The ambience is very hipster, but also casual.  There was a big selection of food for brunch (although I do not think I saw anything vegan- I would call and check first) and there were NO CHANGES allowed to the menu. I don't know if this is all day, or just a brunch thing. For someone with allergies I would call ahead. The deviled eggs are apparently very popular and deep fried. I can vouch for their cinnamon biscuits, which are basically bisquick biscuits (to me) with some cinnamon and fruit preserves on top, the latin inspired eggs with salsa, beans, and bananas, and the ABLT sandwich. All were delicious.  Service was quick and friendly, but not overly so. It is obvious, but not unfriendly obvious, that they are trying to turn tables very quickly. Food comes out in 5-7 minutes and the check comes not soon after. If you are looking for a leisurely brunch this is not the place. There were no lines but I imagine on heavy days the fast turn around is nice for people who don't want to wait in line a long time.

l_Q2CdqmlRzL06WyIqsr7w.text: A fun breakfast place in DTLV.  Expect a bit of a wait, we had maybe 20 minutes, but not bad for a Sunday.  The food is very good and the service was friendly.  They do not do any substitutions or modifications and that is clearly outlined on the menu.  One awkward moment was when one of the members of our party asked if her sandwich can be cut in half as to be easier to handle.  The waitperson politely said they can't, but they could bring a knife for us to do it.  I understand the modifications and substitutions part, but I think not cutting a large sandwich is a bit over the top.  Having said that, we will be back though.  Fun vibe.

2xncIbjdHSKVB3Zi5OsVag.text: I've been here twice now and what a great addition to downtown! They've a variety of breakfasts items like chicken fried steak and chilaquiles along with a delicious bacon and egg sandwich with feta on ciabatta as well as your standard bacon and eggs. I've also had the roast beef sandwich and a nice salad with shrimp. The breakfast items are all great while the lunch items were good. That combined with a slightly high price point keep this from being 5 stars in my book but don't let that deter you. Check this place out!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle egg and bacon sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room and open kitchen

7ZlopU14JGTpq1SRSFLMCQ.text: Hip. Downtown. And Hip. This was one of the first places to put downtown on the map. EAT. is always crowded and the food is very good (alas not great). Nothing I hate more than to hear someone who hasnt been to Vegas in years start dogging downtown.   Past tense my friend.--- EAT. has a very cosmopolitan crowd and should be the first step in enjoying the downtown experience. And besides I think Natalie smiled at me- who could want anything more.

edkwn5bcQq8hAFGPgS3dGw.text: I am in love with this place. From the minute we walked in, it felt comfortable and warm. The servers and guests alike were smiling and obviously enjoying their morning! We were sat immediately, and our drink order was taken in moments. We had the perfect amount of time to peruse the surprisingly diverse menu and when our drinks arrived, the gal who delivered them took our order to streamline the process.  Speaking of our beverages: best cup of coffee I've had in a long long time! Mothership Roasters just gained a new supporter! When I asked another employee about it, she was friendly and knowledgeable. She referred me to where I could purchase it for home (there at eat. or Sunrise Coffee) and showed genuine interest in my curiosity. The OJ was also exceptionally good, the fiancee could not stop raving about it.  Food arrives very quickly and very hot- exactly how I want my breakfast! I had shrimp and grits which were so good I almost cannot even put it into words.. creamy grits, perfectly over easy eggs, crispy mapled bacon, tender butterflyed shrimps, savory creamy sauce and fresh lively pico de gallo. I almost cleared my plate, which is a huge feat for me. Man had chilequiles, with fresh crispy tortilla chips, delicious vegetables and fluffy eggs. The habanero sausage was the best part for sure, though it was all amazing.  Not too pricey, worth every penny no question. We will be going back and often!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Po Boy
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits

ZhW1feJeRKasETyEbUT_lw.text: I wanted to like this place alot since I like these off beat hipster places. I was in Vegas with the wife to have a fun time and meet my mom and friend. The late night search for tomorrows breakfast lead me to yelp and yelp let me to "EAT".... I offered this up to my crew for vote and we were all in!  So we arrive in this seedy little area in Vegas. Trestaurantunt is located underneath a old apartment building. Aside from the rest of the building the place is really nice. Its modern with black modern sign and concrete floors and lots cool kidkid type furniture etc. it has a buzz about it like its got a local following. Justeppingnbg in the door made me feel like we were experiencing a insider place locals are enjoying. I am up for that type thing.....  I ordered the Posole, this is a great hangover meal! Just the smell was good enough to pull me in. It has all the favorites Mexicanxican Posole would have, hominy, pork, broth etc. It was good. Although it was served in a shallow bowl so I would have appreciated to have a little more.  My wife ordered a wedge salad topped with huge shrimp. Her meal looked awesome. The shrimpCajuna cajun type seasoning that was spicy. It was good. the blue cheese dressing was excellent as well.   My mom ordered a uneventful chicken pot wasn'tShe wasnt impressed, And I trust judgmentjudgement.  Very difficulty to get a refill on my coffee. I had to approach the kitchen counter to get coffee.don'twice.  I dont think I will go here again, but if I "end up here" I know what to avoid and I know to expect to get my own coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Posole

GK4uWGWpW1zyJgIh8TCyPA.text: Best breakfast off the beaten path in Vegas! Delicious real food made from scratch. Best corn beef hash I've ever had. Not greasy. Eggs perfectly poached. My daughter had the mist amazing cinnamon biscuits with berries!!!! It was a little pricey for breakfast but with it, you get what you pay for. Very attentive service too. 9:45 Sunday morning they got us right in.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AMAZING cinnamon biscuits with berry compote

oGWUqc52yGPcojgpDYwoGA.text: The food at eat. is fantastic. The food, even despite the fact that it's a little pricey, might get 5 stars by itself.   My issue with eat. however, is how unwelcome I feel when I go there. I work nearby and have stopped by for lunch on a handful of occasions, never really loving the service, but my visit yesterday was the last straw. First, our table was given away after the hostess failed to step outside to call my name (the waiting area inside was full). Second, our order was never put in by the waitress and it wasn't until another server checked on us 30 minutes later that the food was finally prepared. Finally, when the food did arrive, one of our orders was wrong. At that point, we had both already gone over our allotted lunch hour, so my companion gave up and just ate what she had received.   The server who noticed we never got food did apologize for the issue, but the original waitress who took the order never bothered to come by to apologize. Over an hour and half after our arrival we finally paid and left. I'll probably avoid going back with co-workers in the future - I can't keep taking such long lunch breaks. And I can't justify paying so much on a lunch at a place that doesn't seem to appreciate my business.

wauV8a1Um-ScT3FdhZOi6A.text: I'm new to Las Vegas and I was in search of a new breakfast/brunch spot and stumbled upon this place yesterday and decided to take my partner here for their birthday. Big mistake. The food was decent. The cinnamon biscuits were amazing as well as the killer grilled cheese with bacon. But the service was absolutely terrible. I work in the industry and if I performed like Gary did yesterday afternoon I would be fired immediately. He was rude, uninterested, he forgot to put in an order for an item and didn't even care. For the prices the service should be even a tiny bit better. If I ever go back I will definitely request a didn't server.

_Ihc1zF9GQYN43obfxJ6qA.text: Cute atmosphere mix of modern expose industrial work and hippy art scene. Right when you walk in, you know you've come to the right spot by all the smiling patrons. The deviled eggs were amazing, I highly recommend trying them! The filling has a bite to it and it's topped off with a bit of Sriracha sauce and bacon. The chicken sausage is a bit sweeter than I'd like but that's more due to personal taste preference than anything wrong with the food. The full flavored coffee was aromatic and more importantly brewed correctly, not burned. The staff is friendly though I never got a water refill, hence the 4 star vs 5. We went early Sunday morning so the street parking isn't an issue. Nice thing about weekends and holidays, free street parking! Overall, it was a delicious breakfast in a cute cafe.

uk8QObyE5LtlgPOIse3JzQ.text: Yummy place to have breakfast. Especially if you stayed around the downtown area. The atmosphere is uban-y but cool, The service was great, the food was delish. I would recommend the poached eggs on an english muffin with turkey bacon. Parking right outside cost $2 due to parking meter. Our bill was about $75 for four peeps. I do think the food was worth the money though. Try it out :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict on english muffin with turkey bacon. Yummies.

n93JLI9ZoeehEHyL2FF6ig.text: Eat was truly delicious.    From the moment we entered we loved it. It has a very hip ambience and it is very modern. We got seated and my husband ordered the pomegranate tea which he tells me was wonderful, but I can't be sure because all tea tastes like mud water to me. Bleh.   We ordered the cinnamon biscuits which came drizzled in their homemade jam and fruit. We weren't actually too impressed with this dish, the biscuits were a little dry but the sauce made up for it. What was amazing was our main entree. We ordered two eggs, toast, potatoes and bacon. Perfection. The potatoes were amazing. I can only dream of a way to recreate their parsley potatoes. Even the toast was way more delicious than regular toast and I can't discover why. The bacon was also delicious. Something else amazing was their specialty honey. I could drink it for days.   Our waiter however was a bit rude, he made rude comments to a friend of ours for ordering two appetizers in lieu of an entree. Taking off one star for that and the dry biscuits. Other than that, magnifique!

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cinnamon biscuits. The sauce was delicious, the biscuits a bit dry.

Props to the staff for a well oiled machine! I would have submitted a pic, but the YELP app had a glitch so I could not add a pic. yorT1PwdY92GOJpbegT8uA.text: My coworkers and I wanted to find a place to have breakfast but also have a business meeting.  I suggested Eat. Located in the newly upgraded downtown Fremont East Community, this is one of the first new restaurants to open and it still thrives today after its opening three years ago.  It's been a year since I've been to this restaurant, and many of my coworkers have never been there.  I was so happy my coworkers was to experience the phenomenon that is from Chef Natalie's creative menu and her "stick to your ribs" hearty breakfasts.   My only concern was wait time to get in...good thing we came early.  We arrived at 9am and already the restaurant was 2/3rds full.   We were seated quickly and met up with a hostess who offered us drinks and the special of the day: scotch eggs.  Of course we ordered the scotch eggs over a small stack of pancakes as an appetizer, along with the cinnamon biscuits topped with fruit compote, & deep fried deviled eggs!  I ordered my usual favorite, chicken fried steak and eggs with country style potato hash.  Note: all eggs are prepared to preference.  Other plates ordered was the corned beef and hash, shrimp and grits and the steak, egg avocado breakfast sandwich.  The food was amazing as the first time I had come previously. It was not a disappointment!  The portions are huge!  Warning, this is NOT for the dainty eater, you need to come hungry. However, they do have to go boxes if needed!   If you're in downtown Fremont, stop by this place for a fulfilling eating experience, then walk it off while touring the shops at container park or go have fun in the casinos on Fremont experience.  Bon appetite!  :)

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle breakfast sandwich (I forgot the name of it) but I know it was delicious!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had to share this twice - I love it so much!

BmK9SSspQrXmiYBwWsmCJA.text: Horrible service. Longer wait time than was told which is annoying to begin with (over 30 min when the lady said 15) hostess.(some short blonde chic with a big dumb braid) must have had a terrible morning because she was SO rude. Its funny too because if the food was good I would have just ignored the terrible people there. Well.......it sucked. Bland, room temp and don't .....I repeat don't order the grits. They were so sad....I was sad for them.

iwDLsoKj6bmHjBjNVI6LtQ.text: I came here due to their highly instagrammed pictures!  This is located in downtown Las Vegas near the outlets.  Parking is $1 an hour, but an hour is all you need.  We got the Chicken Fried Steak and the Truffled Egg Sandwich.  I loved the mushrooms in the sandwich and the breakfast potatoes the two dishes came with.  I probably wouldn't get the Chicken Fried Steak again though, as it gets to be too heavy after a while. It felt like eating a breaded beef patty.   Over all, a great experience and will come back again to try their Deep Fried Devil Eggs and their Cinnamon Biscuits with Strawberry Compote!

lDBwoWq8BMxUImW22fYz9Q.text: The cinnamon biscuits were good but a little more cinnamon and sugar would have put it over the top.  I also ordered the two Esha which were tasty (great bacon) and thick sour dough toast.  Service was ok.  A little long to order after sitting down and just ok

1Kza1UqubKwReYZpX5A6xA.text: My table of 6 was treated so disrespectfully that I felt like I needed to write a review about it.  We came in for lunch and were immediately seated, which was great.  From there the whole experience went downhill fast.    1. There was a glass that was clearly dirty (a ton of lipstick on it). 2. We weren't told that they were out of sourdough for their BLTA's so they put it on brioche (not great) and no apology. 3. They asked how we would like our burgers cooked (medium-rare) and they came out medium-well.  When we asked if fully cooked was rare to them, they said that they don't cook medium-rare.  Why wouldn't the server mention that when the order and instructions were placed? 4. The BLTAs were both missing the A (avocado). 5. When we asked to talk to the floor manager about our experience, Jenna (with the dreads) came over and listened for about 20 seconds before smiling, shaking her head at us, AND WALKING AWAY.  It was the most condescending thing I've experienced in my life.  It was like she couldn't believe that we would complain about our experience there.   6. Since the floor manager refused to listen to our experience we asked to talk to the chef.  Usually, chef's take a certain amount of pride in how their kitchens are operating.  We were told that Chef Natalie (the owner) wouldn't come out to talk to us.  I just don't understand why we were treated so poorly.  We weren't looking for a free meal, we were only looking to be heard and treated with respect.  I would never come back to this place.

9fxPsk9SKoN7MpZ0_DkQAA.text: First timers here in a Sunday morning. Huge pancakes were nice and grilled on outside fluffy inside. Great team oriented service kept the drinks full. Nice job!

xknX2x4UTxFatxvrIRZtjg.text: The food was awesome. We went for brunch on a Saturday, and even with the crowd, the wait wasn't long. Sitting on the patio was super nice. This is definitely a hidden gem.

BEo38jwEyu7T0nIyO1EmrQ.text: After the last day if Life is Beautiful, we needed something epic before flying back to San Jose. The bf found this place and we of course had to go. Unfortunately, we came in a bit after 11am and therefore couldn't order off of that menu. I was a little upset inside that I couldn't order the chicken fried steak and eggs, but nonetheless the show had to go on. I ended up ordering the 2 eggs any style with bacon, chive potatoes and toast. Though it was a simple breakfast the taste was phenomenal. We also ended up ordering the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote. Those biscuits were ahhhmaaazzziing! They were super fluffy and not overly sweet. Overall, if you are in the area of Downtown Las Vegas then definitely make the effort to grab some brunch here.

NtyH4RZMv9ZVqaElUCrbcA.text: Good food and good service.  It was a busy Thurs. and our waitstaff was attentive.   Noticed another table requesting a different item cus they did not like what they chose(even though the menu says exactly what was in that item) I thought it was nice of the server to take that item off. Then ,said customers ,complained about something else. I am just amazed at how calm and kind the staff was. Next time we are in town we will be back.

The strawberry  was ok.... Honestly it was sour and really carbonated. I got the sandwich with chicken and mozerella and it was amazing. Definitely coming back here in my next trip

hvBPRpWBlBuSUBhOW6Q8zA.text: The grits and shrimp that I ordered is just okay nothing special.  my bacon is a bit soft not crispy.  They put too much salsa on top of the grits and shrimp.  The salsa is good but not a good pair for the shrimp and grits.  A sinple fresh chopped tomato will do.  And the bacon should be on top so it will remain crispy rather than all the way on the bottom

T6zmfLPokuYbEi_i27gt0w.text: I adore Vegas. The bright lights, debauchery and all. It was nice to stray away from Fremont Street to check out this hidden gem. I had a mid afternoon flight, so I was hype when I figured out that I could squeeze in a quick trip to eat. Added bonus is that it was within walking distance of The Golden Nugget.   I arrived a little before opening. There were just a few people waiting outside. They were nice enough to let us in a little early. The restaurants itself is adorable! My kind of a joint. It definitely doesn't feel like your typical Vegas establishment. It was small, quaint, and tastefully decorated. They also had a pic of Brittany Howard from Alabama Shakes. Yes! My homegirl in my mind. Ha! I was immediately greeted by the waitress and my order was taken. Although they had other tasty offerings, I just had to order their signature dish which is the cinnamon biscuits with warm strawberry compote and a side of chive potatoes. All of the pics I've seen posted were drool worthy. It didn't take long at all for my food to arrive. The biscuits were everything I imagined and more. Warm, flaky, light, and delicious. The compote was not overly sweet. The chive potatoes were a great side as well.   To make it even better, my bill was less than $12. Whaaaatttt? Yes! I'm a fan of delicious AND reasonably priced. I left Vegas full, happy, and glad I explored more of what Vegas had to offer. I can't encouraged folks enough to check this spot out. It will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Any place with a pic of Brittany from Alabama Shakes is my kind of spot!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These biscuits made me soooo happy!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another post worthy brunch. These cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote are everything.  #vegasbaby

wl950rsxLNQbFY1FnjT3dg.text: On the last day of our family trip to vegas, we decided to use our favorite app to find breakfast away from the typical strip breakfasts that usually consists of either coffee and donuts or AYCE. We wanted something a little different.  With a crazy amount of positive reviews, we decided to try eat. and they did not disappoint.   I ordered the biscuits with the berry compote. A healthy amount of toasted biscuits topped with a compote of strawberries and blueberries. It tasted pretty fresh and just enough tartness to keep it from being overly sweet.   Coffee seemed to be something they were also popular for so I decided to order one. It was pretty good. Low acidity and easy to drink black.  There's only street parking available nearby, but we didn't really have too much issues finding.  Overall, I'd recommend this place to anyone around the Vegas area looking for something away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lAqN0SyPv_9YdJxbo6MM1w.text: Very hip, right down to the pretentious menu. Something like "Substitutions are politely declined ." Still, very good food. I like pancakes and eggs, so I ordered them scrambled and set on top of the pancake. The waitress said she'd try, but no promises. Low and behold, that's how they came out. Fluffy where they should be and just a bit crispy -- just a bit -- on the outside of the pancake.  The menu contains much more and I'll be sure to go back again to try more.  The scene was a little loud for my liking, so don't bring grandma unless you don't want her included in the conversation.

YPo2uwA0C6NzBvwoC6cmLA.text: I found half a toothpick in my sandwich, makes me worry about cleanliness. Bad service.. food was good.

aVsHSWl_3L2qxCV8_d5s5A.text: I love this restaurant. One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Natalie the owner is the real deal. Great selection of classics and some of her own creation. The pancakes were aaaammmaaazzinnngg.

WPAT-sAaPaDvs9AXvxdDHQ.text: Good food, nice healthy take on some dishes! The ambience is very nice. We were sat quick, food came quick! I got their version of huevos rancheros, I really enjoyed it. It had both red and green chili, which was very tasteful! The potatoes were delicious! Whether you're a local or visiting this is the place to try.

T1sFNSrRzpb2kgl8vxe3ug.text: Staff was a little slow at greeting us at the table, personality of the waitress was not exactly cheerful. Considering that this restaurant is not on the strip "downtown" I felt like it was 15% overpriced. My 2 egg breakfast should have been 9.99, not 12. Potatoes were good although not very warm. Bacon was smoky but not really savory, breads were very good. I would imagine for tourists it's fine, but I would not frequent this restaurant as a local.

IlhDmkJXgKfU15feoe3m-w.text: Nice atmosphere, really hip, straight to the point and tasty menu. Great breakfast for reasonable prices. Loved the salt and pepper shaker made out of nail polish bottles too!

GOj7vg-FVPg6Vk3iUGyujw.text: My husband and I love this place. We come here every time we're Las Vegas . Great service and great food!!!!

rHLZ8CtajY7H5z2OWor7Ng.text: Went to Vegas for 3 days and tried to eat here twice. I went the first day for a something quick and simple. Service was fast and attentive. The food was exactly what I was looking for and well priced. We couldn't get in the 2nd time because of the wait, but that's expected at 11am on a Saturday.

-VSPvRgduopeM5yRO_vGIA.text: Overrated. I've read several reviews that said the pictures of the food look amazing, but the taste itself is mediocre. We came on a Friday afternoon for brunch. The breakfast menu is stopped after 11am. There was a short wait, but they sat us pretty fast. There is only street parking available. The service was not great. Our server came up to our table to take our order but he wasn't even looking at us while we were ordering. He called out a friends name in the middle of my order and continued to not make eye contact with our table while scribbling on his pad.   My table ordered the fried deviled eggs (only thing I would recommend), shrimp & grits, corn hash, grilled cheese & tomato soup, and the truffle egg sandwich.   Shrimp & grits: coming from the south, I've had my share of shrimp and grits and this one was just horrible. The grits had no seasoning what so ever and the sauce that came on top has no flavor at all. I don't eat my food salty and I actually enjoy grits just plain, but this dish was just horrible. I was tempted to send it back to the kitchen, but since we were there with guest I just poured hot sauce on it...   Grilled cheese and tomato soup: gigantic piece of toast with some cheese on it and watered down tomato soup. Pass.   I can't rate the other dishes. I love variety so I always taste the other dishes at the table, but I wasn't even tempted to get a taste of anyone else's dish.   Verdict: don't be fooled by the thousands of reviews and check-ins.

RQXp1mvx1F9_kXeVuH5MwQ.text: I have eaten here several times with family, and honestly it doesn't get better.. I had the shrimp and grits this time.. , it was flavorless, the salsa missed on so many levels, and the grits needed salt! And the check was dropped before I finished my entree..  too bad the chef is not more creative and changing the menu seasonally.. instead of opening another "ear in summerlin.. you better be creative there, summerlin has tons of options to dine..  the menu does change same old same old .. You want something different go across the street to vegetation, or 7th &Carson!   I'll pass on eat ...

UqDoV5xuGvvk12MFWUJSKw.text: Finally able to write a review on eat, after several visits. For those visiting the Vegas strip, this local eatery is well worth the 8 minute uber/taxi drive to downtown Vegas.   Eat's menu changes constantly, but I can tell you this: it's all excellent! My last breakfast had was a Huevas dish with: banana, chile, avocado. It was very South American - and delightful!   Chicken fried steak was also with every calorie that we consumed.  Decor is modern, and since you are downtown - it's with a walk around to visit the container park next door.

zHisrj9BVzWWCboiHFtiBA.text: Excellent egg sandwich, service was quick and on point, friendly staff. Leaving full and now heading to the Donut Bar for lunch dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent egg sandwich, service was quick and on point, friendly staff. Leaving full and now heading to the Donut Bar for lunch dessert!

Ef5p5koWNx1Om9DjgFonNw.text: This place was packed to the gills and with good reason: meals that deliver, great staff who actually seem to love their jobs, and a hipster crowd to boot. What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carefully curated set up and t-shirts in the waiting area.

YoZGK5wC-WvGMv4hQUrzVw.text: It's okay. Not bad, not great. Just okay. It's like a really nice Dennys. There was a fair amount of hype for this place but I'm convinced it's because people don't want to admit to themselves that they paid $14 for bacon and eggs. Just an incredibly average experience. This place is all vibe without the substance. Again, it wasn't bad, but there are 20 other places to get breakfast in the immediate area that are better.

49FyIi_TM85-RB6dzE-2Kg.text: I love there food but service is meh. I order a grilled cheese with a BOWL of tomato soup (2 cups) and a side of potato salad.  I got it with one bowl. I told the cashier this and she reorders and extra cup and then she charges me for a full tomato soup 2 cups. Not what I wanted. Not what I asked for. Plus my order is wrong because she gave me chive potatoes not a potato salad. This is not the first time this happens.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with out bowl of tomato soup

_dRw2mT7HvAp60_kZ4g-nw.text: No requests? I get it. It's not uncommon anymore. But for a sandwich. I asked for no pickled onions. Nope. Can't do it.   So I pulled em off. But the flavor lingered. Hot. Potent. Tomato Soup is pretty good. Had a fresh mozzarella in it i believe. Slow service. Great concept. Poor execution this day.

jWanqJnuNY-wc4-J5E6OxA.text: Came here with a large group (12 of us) on a Saturday around 1PM. We were seated in about 15-20 minutes which isn't bad.  The 2 stars essentially came from my specific dish. I ordered the country fried steak as did two other people at my table. They loved theirs, and I'm sure I would too if it didn't take me 5 minutes to cut off a piece of mine. I'm not asking for them to give each person a steak knife; I'm asking you not to give me a horrible piece of meat while the other two people got the good pieces at my table. I don't understand why it would take me twice as long to chew my food as it did for me to cut it. I left the place hungry because all I ate was th strawberry, eggs, and toast that came with this dish. Why I am paying so much to leave hungry? I even ate someone's leftover grilled cheese and soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with sunny side up eggs

hqpS6ma0gy3oxFPltTtVgQ.text: Out of this world flavor!! Hidden gem of Vegas strip on the old side of the strip. Minus all the hype of being in the center of the strip, hard to find but you will. Came here for breakfast after court and the place did not disappoint for a morning crave. Had the shrimp and grits because why not it's one of the sought after selection from foodies around. My date said it was out of this world! Hahaha. That bacon and melted cheese just topped the out of the world flavor of this dish.  I was craving for the eggs Benedict but only available on weekends. I came on a weekday to avoid the crowd and long lines. Got there when in opened and got seated right away but within minutes it was full.  I had the eggs mouloteno and it was s different flavor each bite! It was a combination of plantain, black beans, salsa, sweet sausage with eggs on top over easy. I finished the whole thing except for the potatoes with it. Also ordered the biscuits pancake, which was so so, just a bit of moist to it would have been perfect. The brew was so good I had to have two cups.   The place was clean and server was friendly and came with great recommendations. They always came to check up on us which was great. Would highly recommend this place for great food and the location was definitely out of your ordinary Vegas strip. It was a bit of nostalgia of the Bugsy side of Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moutoleno Meal
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My date

CE-p6pvzQrY16TqMqGSp7g.text: Nice breakfast spot!!  I ordered the huevos something..can't remember the correct name of it but it's two eggs over easy on a tortilla with pico, black beans and a bunch of other stuff I can't remember served with chive potatoes. Just because I can't remember doesn't mean it wasn't good because it was!!  It had some heat to it to so have your water ready. The potatoes were nice and crispy on the outside soft on the inside.  My husband ordered the pancakes....Super delicious!! The chicken apple sausage he ordered was also very good.  Service was great. So great we left a $20 tip on a $27 bill.  I'd be happy to go back next time I'm in vegas.

BTqsE-vbF1ULjp74COs5Bg.text: Came here for a nice brunch with my family and tbh I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. The fried deviled eggs were AMAZING!!!!! To bad everything else was not. I got the country fried country and it tasted like clam chowder..... YUCK. My mom got the Corn beef hash and she said she would have been happier with the canned corn beef. The service was ridiculous I tried asking for ketchup and hot sauce and the waitress rudely interrupted me and said she was already on it.... well she wasn't. I had to get up and grab my own ketchup then they brought the bill and we waited maybe 15mins for them to pick it up and again they never came so I had to walk up to the waitress and pay it. It was close to closing I'm assuming because it wasn't busy. I spent about 60$ and it was definitely not worth it at all.  VERY VERY VERY disappointed in this place. Luckily, the scenery was cute but definitely not worth 60$.

P8qxhkFpjMLk2fuMKnHO2A.text: Came here one afternoon for lunch with my girlfriend around 1pm on a Tuesday. Eat. is located in the trendy side of downtown right behind container park and at the edge of the action at life is beautiful. Parking is street parking and luckily we were able to get a spot close to Eat. We had to pay like $2 for parking and convenience but the machines to pay are all new and very easy to use.  When we went inside there were a good amount of people but it wasn't packed and we were still able to find a seat. I'd imagine on weekends there would definitely be a wait.   Service: Our server was friendly and offered/provided help when needed. Kept up with our waters and did her due diligence. The chef or owner? I'm not sure also came by to check on us and other tables which was a nice touch. Very laid back but prompt and knowledgable, which is perfect for a place like this.   Entrees: Killer Grilled Cheese x Roast Beef Sandwich. Both came with sides and my girlfriend chose tomato soup for her grilled cheese and I got chips for my sandwich. When I first looked through the menu I wasn't expecting much. I found the menu to be quite boring and dull as everything sounded so basic, but I was quickly proven wrong. The ciabatta bread was extremely soft and the sandwich was pleasantly warm and not cold. The combination of the roast beef, wild mushroom, mayo, and definitely the arugula provided a nice mixture of flavor and the crunch of the arugula made it just the more satisfying. The Grilled Cheese is very hearty and reminiscent of an english breakfast. Very buttery and tasted like a mix of brioche and french toast. This was also a pleasant surprise as I did not expect the grilled cheese to be like this. Fun to dip with the tomato soup but I'm not a big soup person so I wasn't too blown away. Tomato soup was simple as was the side of chips although the chips were a little too salty for my taste.   Extras: Stack of Pancakes: Ordered a stack of pancakes due to popular reviews as well as thinking that I wouldn't be as full from the sandwich. Not a pancake expert but it's definitely better than the normal ihop pancakes. Butter and Syrup is provided on the side and the exterior is crusted just right. Not too thick either which I like as I feel like pancakes can get real dry, real fast. Thankfully these didn't and I enjoyed it as did my girlfriend.   Thoughts: This is a fun little restaurant downtown as part of the trendy hipster revolution that's swept over this side of the city. Walking around and seeing the area definitely reminded me of places like Seattle, Portland, and Downtown La.  The design of the restaurant too with it's black/ white colors, natural sunlight, open kitchen, exposed bricks, and thrifty furniture. It's like  the neighborhood spot down the street that main character in romcoms go to for a bite to eat. Food is simple, clean, and delicious. Portions are generous, and it's a perfect place for breakfast or a quick lunch. I'm a big fan of this side of town as change is sweeping and I can definitely see a shift in culture. It's exciting to see the growth and change of this area from being the "ghetto" or "old" to the "new" and trendy side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stack of Pancakes
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast Beef

EyhX25enW0mc0NOfj0NiHA.text: Had no clue what "The Eat" was, but I figured I would give it a try after my lunch partners today suggested it.  While on the way down I checked out the trusty Yelp and saw it had very good reviews so my anticipation grew.    Upon entering,  this place was small to average in size, but had several tables to accommodate the lunch crowd.  As such this made it very loud and very hard to hear the conversation I was having, but the staff was amazing and the food looked very good as the staff was hustling it out.  It took  a few minutes for us to be seated, but our waitress was spot on.  The drinks and food were out very quickly.  Our waitress was happy and up beat all while dealing with a busy lunch crowd, and never missed a beat.    I went with a chicken sandwich, (added avocado) and the green chili pesole soup.  I was not ready for the flavor explosion that happened with each bite.  The portions size was amazing and for the price could not have been happier.  Both my lunch partners that day agreed.  This place is another fine Downtown eat spot.  Only draw back is the noise level and crowds, but it's worth the possible slight hearing loss for the food.  Will be back again, and will try non peak hours.  Well done!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Sandwich with house made potato chips!!

yUJdWsg5ls0fYCPVve4PhA.text: Best food we had during our Vegas vacation. Went there for brunch and tried the pancakes, grilled cheese, bacon and avocado sandwich with a side of tomato soup and the eggs benedict. Everything was fantastic! Even the coffee was extraordinary. My husband said the pancakes were the best he's ever had. You can tell the owner and the chef put a lot of thought into every dish. Our waitress was very friendly too. It was very busy when we got there but we only had to wait about 15 min to be seated.   The only thing I didn't like was we sat at the bar right next to the IPad kiosk thing. The waiters had to squeeze right next to me to use it and one accidentally hit my elbow when I was trying to drink my coffee.

e_X_KRd1AOfd1rQs2UEr9g.text: When I check out a new spot twice in one week, you know something is up!  Love everything about this place.  Location - eat. is located on the corner of Carson and 7th street.  There's plenty of meter parking and it is tucked just far enough away from LV Blvd to be easy access.  It wouldn't be downtown if there weren't a few questionable characters hanging around, but this place is an oasis.    Food - First time I split the DWBLT with homemade chips (and the really good pickle is aptly named) and the Argula Salad with added chicken breast.  Although the upcharge for the chicken was a little $$, I can assure you it is worth your money.  This salad was very nicely done.  Fresh argula, asparagus, roast almonds and roasted tomatoes.  Definitely unique. Loved both, but I prefer a lighter lunch (although judging by some of my frequent lunch hangouts, you may be calling me a liar) so may not order the DWBLT again.  That sourdough bread is seriously delicious and seriously heavy.     Second trip, I had the Banh Mi Chicken sandwich.  This thing was freaking awesome!  I just love jalapeno coleslaw especially when you throw some radishes in the mix!  Chips again because they are just that good.  I also stole a bite of the grilled cheese sandwich dipped in tomato soup.  Yum!  Service - Both trips, service has been great.  The servers are hipster enough to prove you are downtown, but not so hipster they forget how to smile.  Love the open kitchen, the entire decor and just the vibe of this place.  It really is something special and further proof that downtown is worth revitalizing and worth a visit for lunch.

OwNyrY0f6jFdm2Y0kbBO4w.text: A friend and I went there for lunch on a weekday and arrived shortly after opening.  Service was very slow and we were at the point of giving up and walking out when someone finally took our order.    The food was very good but too expensive for what we got.  Lunch for two ran over $40 minus tip.  I don't mind paying that much when the food and service are very good, but that wasn't our experience.  I doubt I will go back.

mTXN1ifdgqGydXAhdFx28A.text: My friend and I stopped by this place for brunch on a Sunday. I had heard very good things about this place, so I had to try it!   I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and we shared a side of pancakes. We had intended to order the beignets, but they were out. I was disappointed until I tried the pancakes. They were the best I have ever had! They were slightly crispy but soft in the middle. I still crave these pancakes and I'm sad that I'm now across the country from them. I highly recommend them. The Shrimp and Grits were very good as well. The jumbo shrimp were seasoned well, and the grits were just perfect. The servings are a good size and the coffee was delicious. I love their big coffee mugs, because I do love my coffee. Our server was great! She was attentive, friendly and always there when we needed her.  This is a place that I plan on visiting again, when I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm...pancakes
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits

vv8F1kyJOT7psi28-lu6FA.text: I love EAT! One of my favorite brunch restaurant in Vegas. Their pancakes are the best. The decoration and service are also good. The Benedict is their special but sometimes the egg overcooked but doesn't affect anything. Always come back with my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zp3EhWKuLpvAY9bjiUQCiw.text: Thank you, Yelpers for the great tip on this place! We were staying at the D and I didn't want a breakfast buffet for the second day in a row. I saw this place was only a couple blocks away, the photos and menu looked promising so we headed over.  For a Vegas visitor, the walk down Carson at 8am can seem a little sketch but have no fear! When we walked in it was cozy and cute and trendy in a very non-intimidating way. We opted to sit at the counter since every seat was full (30 minutes after opening!) and I'm really glad we did. Our pink-haired waitress was SO friendly, helpful and overall just seemed like a super positive person, which was a great start to our day. Plus, we got to watch the action in the kitchen and the chef was really commanding her own back there.   I had the Truffled Egg Sandwich, which was super tasty. Scrambled Eggs with sauteed mushrooms, chives, feta and kick-ass bacon on a ciabatta roll. So freaking good. It came with Chive Potatoes, which were cooked pretty perfectly. BF had the egg dish that came with beans, peas, feta and some other stuff on a corn tortilla and he loved it. The salsas that were on top were so good.   We HAD to split a pancake because they looked amazing. It was. Perfect crispy edges with a fluffy middle. I could eat these all day.  The lunch menu looked equally awesome, but it was 8:30 am so I passed.  We really really enjoyed Eat and would go back if we could!

7aseNswTN-Ehzfr68NMKwQ.text: It's exactly what we did when we got to this hip brunch joint. Eat!  I love the name of this place. I'm surprised that it hasn't been used yet!  My visit was on a Saturday late morning. Very hip downtown vibe, great for couples or friends to meet up for brunch after a late night.  Their menu focuses on supporting local farmers, making things in-house, and keeping it healthy. There are many unique items that are served here, Mediterranean egg white frittata, truffle egg sandwich, and shrimp & grits, which I'm always curious about. For lunch, what stood out was green chile chicken posole, salads, a Killer grilled cheese sandwich, even banh mi sandwiches! For dessert, shaved iced coffee. Interesting!  Our breakfast:  Steel-Cut Oats Cinnamon with roasted apples, cream and sugared pecans Beignets with jam and vanilla-scented mascarpone Golden-Brown Pancakes with chicken-apple sausage  How's the food? It tasted fresh and homemade. The pancakes were the star of this meal. AMAZING! Light, fluffy, and a little buttery crisp on the outside. My boyfriend and son shared the chicken-apple sausage and they loved it. We've had better oatmeal at other places and the beignets didn't have a light airy texture as I was hoping for.   Service was friendly and efficient. They don't have booths, which we always try to grab to corner in my toddler and their tables were a bit small for the three of us. When we asked if we can use the next table to adjoin to ours, our server said sure, even though I know, being a server previously, that it meant she won't get that table seated. We felt bad and made sure we left a bigger tip to make up for it.   I do wish they had a more convenient location and a slightly bigger menu. More pancake selections, for sure! That being said, EAT definitely intrigues me to return for more visits when I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets. Just ok..
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST pancakes I&#39;ve had in a long time!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steel cut oatmeal

uW7aOf9cHPViMks1NkkvWA.text: Great local spot! Fast service. The Huevos Motuleno is delicious! Tip: Add some hot sauce for some spice. And do yourself a favor. GET THE PANCAKES! They have a crispy outside and a fluffy inside. Best bite we've had in Vegas so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Individual maple syrup from Eat. So cute and so good!

oLVgSUnI8V0BFuEwEeKDzg.text: One of my favorite places for breakfast.  Always had great customer service, the food is always excellent.  I recommend the chilaquiles (the mango jalapeno sausage is to die for), the pancakes (ask for a side of the berry compote), and they have some really tasty coffee.

Aomw7xjxq2GLiCbmkyP0ZA.text: WORST PLACE TO EAT EVER! I don't understand how as an owner you think it's okay and very professional to tell a customer that it's just personal preference if you didn't like what you ordered?! No it's not personal preference if the food was nasty!  But let's start from the top. When we arrived it was a short wait. 20 mins for a party of 4. No problem. We ended waiting about 15 mins if that.  We get sat and our drink order taken. So far so good. The sprarkling strawberry lemonade was decent. Would get it again.  And then it went all down hill from there. Our server was very rude and short. Had no personality. How do you expect to make money with that dry personality?!  The food.....was just okay. Nothing special or out of the ordinary. Our two friends took maybe 2 bites of the oh so famous best seller shrimp and grits and didn't eat anymore. Said it was tasteless and nasty. So much for top selling dish huh?!   Then the bill came. Wwaayyy to expensive for what we got. Nothing was too notch nor worth the price.  In the end we will NEVER return to Eat. Nor will we be sending any business there. Stay far away and go elsewhere for better food, better service and better owner!!

ynP_kEEV9wweCo9eWrO-aA.text: Food was good! Service was okay but it's busy and holiday weekend, it's expected. We were seated in 10 min and got out food in 15. Got the eggs Benedict which I always get every brunch I go to and this was the one time where I thought the hollandaise sauce was off. We asked what was in their sauce that made it taste unusual and they said garlic and lemon. Well I usually like those things but too much of something made in inedible. We had to scrap the sauce to the side the finish the rest of our food. Potatoes-bomb. Bacon and chicken Apple sausage-bomb. My eggs were even cooked perfectly. I would try them again but skip out on the eggs Benedict

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

2KxqgP0RReJVk-2jssDfGQ.text: A previous reviewer acknowledged that being from Southern CA kind of makes this place not-so-amazing.  Which sounds elitist, but oh so True.  It IS good, and some of the menu items are tasty, but nothing worth raving over.  We had the chicken fried steak with sourdough toast, truffled egg sandwich, short stack of pancakes.    The chicken fried steak was not really crispy at all, and even if it had been, the flavor was decent but overall nothing special.  The sandwich did have a satisfyingly truffle-y fragrance, but other than that it was a solid egg sandwich.  A little dry but good.  Some sort of sauce would have set it off.  The potatoes were really nothing special.  The pancakes were probably the highlight....there was just *something* that made them really delicious.  Have you ever had malasadas in Hawaii????  The uniqueness of the batter tasted a lot like those warm, melt-in-your-mouth malasadas.  Yum.    Pretty long line, luckily the wait was only 20 min.  Anything longer, in my opinion, would not really be worth it.   And ambiance was SUPER loud.  Like felt like a nightclub loud.  There are so many places in Vegas, and glad we tried this one, but not itching to come back.

lYm47ESkti5Lb_wgFCc-YQ.text: Compliments to the friendly staff. Best breakfast spot off the strip. Less than 10 min away. Street parking.  Went here three days in a row and had pancakes every time. Even their coffee is kick a$$.  Ate: Strawberry compote - flaky biscuit, fresh fruit Pancakes - fluffy inside, nice bite outside Shrimp and Grits - hearty. Grilled cheese and tomato soup - cheesy and crunchy, not too creamy soup just with the right tang. Chicken fried steak - very crunchy!

RWHedNKr92x0b6WxxgjsnA.text: The best orange juice I've ever had!!! I got the pancakes with chicken apple sausage mmm  The only thing I'm sad about is I've been wanting one of their hats for so long every time I go there they don't have them! Then they said they don't make them anymore so I just wish they did hadn't teased me with the display one in the first place if they don't sell them anymore!!!

i1g7Fzz_v7CgUFYBVnJIjw.text: My husband and I came here on a Monday morning, and the breakfast was the best I've ever had. I had the tofu scramble and it was perfect. It's also a super cute restaurant with a VERY friendly staff. If we didn't live in Texas, we'd come here every day.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu scramble!

lTiDkNUvFw9T5W8P6b02Bw.text: I have been here a number of times and usually everything is just about perfect.  They are getting a 3 because the food is amazing...  The problem this time is the service has been beyond dysfunctional...a call for our name and table that never happened...35 minute plus wait times for food...an unbelievable amount of flies as we wait in the heat for our food..  And it's now just here...  More attention to detail makes a difference in the execution.  Love the food but don't like the dysfunction.

m5sBns2f2ro-CS4J92Z_hw.text: Loved this place! Look beyond the neighborhood.  It's large yet cozy, great waiters and AWESOME food!  We all tried different dishes ranging from eggs to sandwiches to pancakes to oatmeal.  And EVERYTHING  was delish!!!!

8vJEQGzXjsSJ5W3flBklkg.text: We are visiting for a few days and heard the story of the owner of Eat - very inspirational!   Came here for lunch yesterday and cannot say enough good things about the vegetarian tofu banh mi sandwich and their iced tea. Everything tastes fresh and carefully prepared.   The wait was long for a large party of 6 but once seated, service was super friendly!

FsxaqJMpv3elELVsGQvMrA.text: Stopped by for brunch on a recent visit to Sin City. Cool spot located close to the madness ... but not on the main drag. Well worth the 3 min walk from Freemount. Great buzz, great service and most importantly great food. We had between us a salad, soup and sandwiches and all were top drawer. I even managed to leave my sun glasses behind me and one of the waiting staff came running down the street after me with them .... good job!

iyaCv_RmljSkM19S_WmcUQ.text: I loved the truffle egg sandwich...bomb! Server was nice as well. I would definitely go again when I come to visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle egg sandwich was bomb

leVVeh_ioPbYzbl0hkFTCg.text: I'm from Tempe Arizona, I came in to have a quick bite to eat for breakfast. I will post some pictures. They really do make freshly squeezed orange juice and it's amazing. Everything was perfectly seasoned and cooked, the eggs, the sourdough toast, even the potatoes were not too hard not too soft and perfectly seasoned. I definitely recommend checking this place out, not only if you live in the area but also if you're visiting. We just happened to be at a motel down the street and it was about a four minute walk. I'm really glad I had a chance to stop by this was like a gourmet breakfast for me. Thank you for the great staff everybody seem so happy there
