N-HS7MPeBKImkml38hhrhA.text: Great spot for breakfast, hit it during the week and there was no wait to be seated. Parking was a little sketch, next to a hotel with questionable folk, but food was great.

O0yrETjznfLED9T90qqa9w.text: We come here everytime were in town.. Best Pancakes and fried Deviled eggs...but don't wait too go too late they cost at 2pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries Deviled eggs

UUz1DfC25ATJk2T-heJxRw.text: Corner location, kinda of a hidden gem downtown Las Vegas.  Enjoyed the simplicity of the interior, bustling noise from folks enjoying their meals. The interior decor is simple and clean. It felt cool inside, especially from the hot weather outside. I had the two egg breakfast, two bacon strips, and "oh so good" potatoes with sourdough bread.  My hubby had the corn beef hash which was good but portion a bit small. The single brown pancake was the best with a buttery slight crust and tasty pancake served with maple syrup. Yummy.  Oh, the passion ice tea fabulous! It kinda reminded me of refreshing tea in Hawaii.  Overall I liked the place and mostly likely would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small place at the corner. Cool and clean inside. Right off the strip. One block south Fremont and one to two blocks east of Las Vegas Blvd.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two eggs, two bacon strips, awesome potatoes with sourdough bread. I tried the brown pancake with maple syrup.  Tasty. Oh, get the ice tea!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good tasting food. Small place. Right off the strip, one block south of Fremont Street and east of Las Vegas Blvd.

8-0iG460lGsjvM6N6LeghQ.text: I love this place we have tried several items on the menu and we where never disappointed!!! The service is great Also!!!! Just try to avoid the busiest times because it can get very crowded.

z2OgAdpgxyd11N8quBNMKA.text: Very good and quick service. Coffee was bomb!!! Must try when you're in DTLV. Try anything here and you'll be happy.

k7TBU58R8ofFkQuioIu2XA.text: What a wonderful place to visit after a wild, tiring night of clubbing! First off, the design of this place is so cute and modern. I love the decorations inside, especially all the plants they have set up in the restaurant.   Back to the food--make sure you have a very empty stomach or room in the fridge because the portions are quite large. I ordered the golden brown pancakes with chicken apple sausage. The pancakes were cooked just right--not too overlooked/crispy with a burnt taste but also not too overdone. They had the perfect balance of a very slight crispiness on the outside coupled with a soft, kind most interior. Delicious. The chicken apple sausage had great flavor. I should have ordered extra on the side.   You can definitely say that you ate after coming here! If I ever come back to Vegas, I hope to return to this fine establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HGrnU1clTjJXIrFFKZAHLA.text: Went there for breakfast today. Had the chilaquiles, really good! The sauce is really good and tasty. We also had the biscuits with strawberries and blueberries. Absolutely delicious !!  They were a bit busy so the service wasn't as good as the first time we went. But still very friendly. We will back next time we stay downtown.

Nw5zLtf_2N05nb1RKwS7Mg.text: Horrible service! Food was ok at best. Server didn't come around to refill water or coffee.

6JdrxWXDfnjztfklEEa6Dg.text: This might have been the best meal I have had during my week long stay in Vegas.  Food tastes very fresh and homemade.  Pancakes are the size of manhole covers, and just as thick.  Eggs, bacon and apple sausage were amazing.  The chive potatoes are on almost every dish, and they are splendid.  The environment is upbeat and a tad on the noisy side, but, not too distracting from the meal.  Service is very fast and the team is very friendly.  I wish I would have found this place earlier.  Come to Eat., you won't regret it.

rZRjKxAf4jfUOukmk2Bzqw.text: A great stop if you're looking for a nice breakfast outside of the casino environment. Close to all downtown Las Vegas casinos we had breakfast it was great. Chicken fried steak and eggs and pancakes are wonderful.

WrY9Y5uplmLK_ZicUQLraQ.text: We arrived at 9:45, and were seated quickly. We ordered, me house special eggs bennie, David had chicken fried steak.   Mine was delightful, sauce was flavorful, it had roasted tomatoes which were nice. The potatoes were cooked perfectly   My husband liked his the gravy was divine, but the steak was way overcooked. He could only eat the edges as it was to tough. He loved the potatoes too.   We had coffee which I liked not sure if it's a local roaster, and honey had apple juice. Which was fresh and not motts!   We will be back to try other things our next Vegas visit!

59MIPibMrZAmea3ydGrQtw.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said ?? This place is the bomb !! I went with my roommate ( who if you have read any of my other reviews is a VERY picky eater ), we arrived and street parked which was easy as the meters do accept credit cards,  I ordered the truffles egg sandwich and was absolute heaven , the bread , the egg , the bacon , the mushroom all cooked to perfection , topped off with fresh sliced avocado and feta cheese , this was a dish to die for!! My only regret is not arriving sooner as I was craving some chicken fried steak and it's only served for breakfast !! Ugh curses!! The potatoes were awesome BUT some tasted as though they may have been sitting around from their breakfast time as I came later in the day , a few were hard and had a recooked air about them , but otherwise a minor hiccup in a great meal ! My roommate had the pancakes , which he was blown away by their freshness and lightness and all in all goodness !! I tasted them and do have to say they are easily the best pancakes I've ever tasted , lightly sweet and  cooked to perfection! Really my roommate raves about them and has even tried to wake me up early to go get some !! Lol all in all easily one of the best brunches I've had in quite awhile !!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fz-9dZ7xLisjt4RzIGPpyQ.text: We chose to come here as we were close by and it keeps being listed as one of the best places for breakfast. Obviously, expectations were high.  We thought it was absolutely awful. The only good part was the coffee which, I have to admit, was lovely. It is in downtown and it's a small corner restaurant. There are some different parking options and it was early enough that we were lucky. To begin with, I walked in as my friend was trying to park and the hostess told me that she wasn't usually allowed to seat people until the whole party is in the restaurant. She sat me regardless. The menu is limited... It has options like eggs or steak and egg or truffle sandwich or pancakes. For a breakfast and lunch restaurant only, I would have expected many more options but that was not the case.  Regardless, the truffle sandwich looked really good. It sounded incredible. When it got to us, I don't even know where to start... It looked like garbage on a plate. Do not expect a plate to look nice at this restaurant. The worst part is that the taste did not make up for it. On one side of it were potatoes, some over cooked, all very soft with no crisp to them and not enough seasoning. It was just mush. On the other side was one of the ugliest sandwiches I have ever seen at a restaurant.. It was these two large rectangular slabs of bread that contained some butter and truffle oil on them with unappetizing looking eggs, bacon that was thick and dry, amongst other ingredients. I was able to add fresh avocado which made it a little better. The worst part is how greasy all the food was. It was seriously laden in oil.  My friend wanted jam for the bread and they did not have any! They tried to bring her this strawberry 'compote' which was runny and disappointing... not jam. I ordered a side of the apple sausage...this is the first time I was not impressed with this sausage. What is up with this place?  Service? It was average. The guy was nice, but he didn't check on us all that often and waited to have a coffee refilled. It's nothing to write home about. Just average. The restaurant is on the smaller side but was nice... Once again average. The bill... expensive for what you get. $50 for 2 people.  With how expensive breakfast was with what we got and because we were so unimpressed and we were disgusted by how greasy all the food was, this place gets two stars. I am still baffled by its 'stellar' reviews. Did we go on one of this restaurant's bad days? We are foodies and we love going out for breakfast. We are local to Las Vegas and pretty much know a lot of the best breakfast restaurants in town. This place does not hold a candle to most of them. My friend said it best... for the quality and amount of grease, McDonald's would've been just fine and way cheaper.

7Jo1muZTDoCbPN_jfpJkTA.text: So much Yum   We had the BLT along with the shrimp  & grits. No wait time at 9am, but host will not seat you if you're whole party has not arrived.  Lots of servers, so everything was fast and never had to wait for refills or the check.  Both meals has the most delicious Smoked Bacon .  Crispy/Buttery sourdough bread was so good.  The tomato soup was a perfect side for the BLT along with the crisp pickle.  The pick de gallo mixed with the shrimp was perfect.  The grits were also buttery good too.  Although the food portions seemed perfect, it turned out to be too much.  I really should have taken some of the food home, but it was impossible  to stop eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT with tomato soup
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT

St3XC8ZPvdw6Wk72fbhX-A.text: I've been more curious to explore Vegas food outside of the Strip and Eat. came up on a lot of city guides I've found online--Local Wanderer, Goop, Vice, etc.   I expected the wait to be 1 hour+ as is standard with any trendy brunch place in LA, but we were seated within 15 minutes. I went with the truffled egg breakfast sandwich and my sister got the cinnamon biscuits. I could definitely taste the truffle in my sandwich, and the mushrooms were cooked really nicely; but the star of the show was the side of potatoes for me--so good! The cinnamon biscuits my sister got were alright--nothing special. She noted it could have used like whipped cream or sweet cheese or something to cut the tartness of the berry compote, and I totally agree. The cinnamon biscuits were definitely lacking that extra something to really round of the dish.   Overall, good, not great. However, for $22 between the two of us, I would totally come back again to give the other sweet dishes on the menu a try--the golden pancakes perhaps.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg breakfast sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits

_zKBH5z5RnBIdBZY2DUeLg.text: Cute spot to grab brunch! Loved all the decorations and thought that it was pretty clever of them to have the door say "eat" when you walk in and "ate" when you walk out. No wait, excellent service, and the food came out quickly. Everything I like to hear about a restaurant! I had the Truffle Egg Sandwich that I would've enjoyed more if it didn't have any blue cheese. This was a mistake on my part because I didn't read the list of ingredients outlined on the menu entirely. I tried taking out the blue cheese but a few pieces were still on the bread and the smell lingered. The blue cheese sort of overpowers the other flavors. I did, however, love the potatoes that were served on the side of the sandwich. They were perfectly crispy on the outside. I had some of my boyfriend's corned beef hash and it was pretty good but the portions were small. I also wanted to note that some of the brunch dishes are only served until 11 am like their Chicken Fried Steak. We arrived a little past 11 am and missed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9SubYm9gYye5BtnGp2Olag.text: Great spot away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.    Food was reasonably priced and oddly packed on a damn Monday morning.  Nonetheless, I sat torn on what to order until my waitress kindly urged me to go with the pancakes so I did.  I asked for strawberries to be added atop the thick and fluffy cakes and bacon paired with it.  Everything was great - strawberries were sweet as ever, pancakes were SOOOOOOO good and not overcooked liked places do making it hard to cut w/ a fork, and the bacon omg was thick cut, crispy, and godly.  All in all, great service and even better food.

lbFCF8XKsf3XFqwpX8yNgg.text: This place is great, all the food is fresh and delicious. It is a downtown Las Vegas staple, but my one issue is with the grits.  Those grits are super watery. They are as my southern friends would say, Yankee grits.  Keep away from the grits and the rest of the menu is solid.

-YMTSuWwjMiR5KrxpjNvbQ.text: Cute designs. Comfy little local spot in downtown area of Las Vegas. Bit of a wait to get seated but overall service was good. Pricing is fair. The food itself was pretty basic.

94g47vbpW8Azq59jKVEtnA.text: One of my go to brunch spots in downtown! Great atmosphere and good customer service. Try the BLT!

3Q9vuvEvaMJtK3wLNubJHw.text: Came in today for some breakfast with my little one and brother. Service was great! We ordered 2 eggs any style w toast, potatoes and bacon. My brother and I didn't like the potatoes. Too thick for us, we like them crispy! My little one had scrambled eggs and some of our potatoes and she seemed to enjoy herself! Will come back again for sure. 3.8 rating!!!

D6hMrMSayTPyrn9b2BgY1Q.text: Found this place randomly while in Vegas last weekend with my girlfriend. I was looking for a good breakfast spot that wasn't too far away from our hotel (we were staying at the Plaza in Downtown). This was right around the corner, about half a mile away.   When we got here the place was packed, but they cleared up a spot on the bar for us and we sat down within a minute. The service was top notch, everyone was friendly! We sat right in front of the kitchen, so we could see how quick and efficient they were.   I got the chicken sandwich, which was delicious! My girlfriend got the grilled cheese which was huge and super cheesy.   The place was beyond packed, and we were able to sit down, order, get our food and eat all under 30 minutes!   I would highly recommend this place if you want some great breakfast food, that's not overly priced, and made with fresh ingredients.

N-wVvP2IeGox8_i1fqjX0A.text: Interesting choices on the menu. The gravy fried steak was a little dry and tough. Cut potatoes were good. The strawberry cinnabun was enjoyable.

Wx9ovwvL9wR1uQn_zXSH-Q.text: Ate here once about a year ago. The hours are kinda weird for what my schedule was like while I was downtown a lot, so it was hard to get a chance to eat here. I had the tomato soup, which i enjoyed. Service was good for how busy it was at the time of my lunch. I wouldn't say it's special, but if you're downtown a lot (or visiting Vegas) it is definitely worth a try.

HhUOkqYrrWxwrNkKLa21rA.text: We came here with a party of 11. It was over 100 degrees outside and while waiting for my party to walk in, I requested to get a round of water to be ready at the table but the girl cleaning told me to go to the counter of get the small bottles. Not sure why but okay.   The menu was a small selection.  We tried: - cinnamon biscuits - chicken fried steak -corned beef hash - killer grilled cheese - argulla salad And more   But none of it was outstanding to me. We all shared since it was our first time. Food was okay. I would've given it a solid 3.   However, we found a piece of hair in our food and spoke about it in front of the server (she was literally right next to us) but nope.. totally did not hear us or avoided us)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ...
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not worth for 11 people
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese. Just ok

55g04bw1HohZW1kzxtxw_g.text: I will be back here for sure. My family and I spent brunch here. The decor, the staff, the food...I will be back again :)  What I loved was being able to get a bowl of milk for my son (I brought my own cheerios...he is picky and I have no idea where he got that from because his father and I love all types of food). Normally, I would ask and get a weird look or like a ....."uh ok." The staff was super friendly and was pretty chill about it and totally knew/understood what it was for.   My husband and I (great minds think alike) got the Two Eggs Any Style (mines scrambled...his over easy... I would have got over easy as well but due to being preggo I can't eat the yolk like that). It came with smoked bacon, chive potatoes and toast. It was the perfect amount of food...cooked to pefection. Delicious.   Loved the fresh squeezed OJ (I love pulp).   This place is super trendy and has a nice vibe to it.  Can't wait to go back there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sFQJjkKDnoK57Ps18EdZgw.text: If you are on the hunt for a perfect Eggs Benedict (with a twist), look no further! Chef Natalie's version has that gratifyingly creamy yet tingy hollandaise, eggs poached just right, crispy muffin and really, really, tasty turkey bacon. Don't bother looking for it on the regular menu though, as it's only available as a "special" on weekends. It comes in different variations (I had versions with sauteed spinach, and grilled tomato--both awesome). But if you cannot make it to Eat on the weekend don't despair: there are still other Southern-inspired gems. My recommendations are the grit dish, which is fantastic, and the pancakes are at once fluffy and crispy, and taste like donuts! I usually order a single pancake for desert AFTER the Egg Benedict. :)    Great place all around, with nice ambiance and one-of-a-kind decor. I just love those comfy green chairs!

VplnTA0gGqOiMf4SXl29zg.text: Initially when we walked in we noticed the interior design was cool, and staff were as attentive as possible it was a little busy.  We were seated quickly and service was prompt but the food is meh... my lady ordered a breakfast sandwich with avocado, the avocado was brown and pretty gross. I ordered the chicken fried steak and it was chewy & not flavorful. Potatoes were over cooked in our opinion, some people like that charred taste- us not so much. My lady ordered a coffee, and was never offered a refill (she loves coffee). Pretty disappointing or our expectations were too high.

E4HHfhDKJXdrDZlYnzpbkQ.text: This is a real gem in downtown Las Vegas!  My all time favorite comfort food spot at the corner of Seventh Street and Carson Avenue in downtown Las Vegas.  I love coming here for breakfast and brunch every time I visit Las Vegas with my girlfriends.  We managed to always have the same server, Gary.  He's always pleasant, courteous, and helpful.  Eat uses sustainable and organic ingredients supplied locally and grown which they turn into delicious, innovative breakfast food.  Eat has Sweet & Savory (granola Greek yogurt, cinnamon biscuits, and golden-brown pancakes).  Also has steel-cut oats, huevos motulenos, chicken fried steak, and chilaquiles served daily.  Eggs entrees are served all day.  They also have Soups (black bean veggie chili, green child chicken posole, and tomato soup) in 2 serving sizes (half or full).    We ordered the following - Shrimp & Grits - has smoked bacon, two eggs over-easy & pick de gallo $15. If you never had grits or do not like grits; order this dish and you will changed your mind about grits.  This lovely and heavenly dish is very tasty and delicious; my all time favorite and I craved this all the time. 5 stars plus Truffle Egg Sandwich (extra-Avocado) - comes with two scrambled eggs, wild mushrooms, green onions, feta, & bacon on ciabatta with chive potatoes $12. Plus $2. (Avocado) This is a gourmet sandwich! 5 stars Arugula Salad - served with asparagus, oven-roasted tomatoes, parmigiano-reggiano, toasted while almonds & lemon herb vinaigrette $10. We love the fresh taste of the Arugula with asparagus tossed together salad. Very yummy! 5 stars  5 stars for friendly atmosphere and staffs.   Eat's motto is "Good food for good people, made with love in downtown Las Vegas"  P.S. Changes to the menu politely declined.  Ample metered street parking. Hours - Mon - Fri 8AM - 3:00PM except for Weekends 2PM.  I cannot wait to try Natalie Young's new restaurant, Chow combines Southern classic fried chicken with Chinese dishes such as potstickers (dumplings).

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Egg Sandwich with extra Avocado
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula Salad with Asparagus
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Best Shrimp &amp; Grits

BuNAHdCmXGM4qw5cBme8gg.text: My friends & I are here for the weekend for a friend's 21st birthday (typical, I know lol).  Anyways, this place was recommended by my cousin (Vegas native), and we figured "Why not, we've got time to kill before we check in." DEFINITELY a good decision on our part! Wait time was about 25 mins, which made sense, since we came in right before noon. After we got seated, the server took our order right away, so service is on point and on the urgent side. As for our food, it didn't take long (yay), portions were suitable for hungry travelers and it all tasted amazing.  Eat is on my recommendation list for anyone, Vegas native or hungry traveler :)

RHfYehD1f5nnuBzNQ_nnGg.text: Food and service was great. Had the truffle egg sandwich.   Decoration was good as well. Liked how it was casual but still very nice and clean.  (Edit: I got sick from the food)

DC3vnhRcTIrb9HfoWiR7Hw.text: Everything we had was delicious! Waiters were attentive & the ambiance was casual and open. It was in a cute area of Vegas with a lot of other restaurants surrounding it that I wouldn't mind trying out next time I'm in town

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black bean soup, parfait, chicken apple sausage, grilled cheese, &amp; lemonade

ibpZfH8VW_lELDQioupY9w.text: I've been to eat a couple time while visiting Vegas, in a nutshell, the food is pretty hit or miss and it is a bit pricey. A hit for me were the deep fried deviled eggs and their potatoes, a big miss for me were the huevos rancheros. It was basically a lot of dry tortilla chips under a sausage, eggs, and pico de gallo with a little bit of salsa.   The atmosphere here is pretty cool, it has a hip and modern vibe with art on the walls and industrial style tables.  The food is overall pretty good here, especially if you stick to more basic breakfast foods here.

lVFweRqEPe8UkKU_5a2dUw.text: eat. was ok. Good food but nothing overly special. The strawberries over cinnamon biscuits was really good, also the eggs benedict was good. I was excited to see on the menu that they offer turkey bacon (since I don't eat pork and very few restaurants offer a turkey bacon alternative) however I was really disappointed in the taste of the turkey bacon, just wasn't good. The bacon was undercooked (on the verge of raw) and not crispy at all. It also didn't even taste like turkey bacon...so disappointing.  I think eat. is worthing eating at however it's not on the top of my list..

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey bacon -not so good :(
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Strawberries over cinnamon biscuits

FtQ6nkABIuoSLHULFnn9hQ.text: Came here for the first time in a Saturday afternoon. It was one of the best homemade breakfast spots I've been to in a really long time. There was a little bit of a wait but totally worth it! You can see the cooks and chefs working from where we were seated. We had a really nice experience here. Our food came out in a timely manner and it was delicious. There is so much I wanted to try but my stomach couldn't fit anymore then the one dish I ordered. Definitely have to come back to Try the rest of the menu. Thank you Eat. For starting off our day with happy tummies.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak!!

t4_vUBlR34aVQxwY0Qsvlg.text: The deviled eggs and brown butter pancakes are not to be missed. The service was superb and we left feeling happy and quite full. I can't wait to return here on our next visit to Las Vegas!

OkN2-35WV9uIy1Xxi13PKw.text: Nice restaurant. They should consider expanding since they have so many customers eager to dine. I went alone on a Saturday - late morning. Many of us had to wait for about 15-20 minutes. But the meal was worth the wait.   I ordered the deviled eggs. The yolk topping was delicately whipped and was topped with a hint of bacon. The cinnamon biscuits with a strawberry compote were good too, but the compote was just a bit too sweet for me. Decent prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Superb Deviled Eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Biscuits with sweet strawberry compote

T5bQWT8B5fUS-6KLogj7tA.text: Where do I start? There are SO many great things about Eat. The food is amazing and always tasty! I recommend the Cinnamon Biscuits and the Truffled Egg Sandwich but really anything on the menu is worth getting. The space itself is open and comfortable, never a long wait, but I do recommend getting there early, the wait can take sometime but only because the word is out that this is a great place. The wait staff is always helpful and attentive. So get downtown and experience Eat.

TZUbDWMRYXqkSdFCFbBshg.text: Yummy breakfast/brunch spot in downtown Vegas where the locals satisfy their cravings. Large portions of well cooked, flavorful food selections that make you feel like home. The egg truffle sandwich was a sight and taste to behold. The killer grilled cheese & kickass tomato soup made say "MmmMm" almost after every bite. Definitely will be back to try more of the menu listed and unlisted.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the foods
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle egg sandwich w/ avocado
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer grilled cheese w/ kickass tomato soup

0A2Z0k7k-GOlj6kIdOO9Dg.text: Went to eat! As a recommendation of one of the bartenders at Aria. Checked out the other Yelp reviews and was very excited to try for ourselves. Very cute trendy vibe but the food and menu was solid comfort food. Great to get breakfast for lunch! I had the corned beef hash with poached eggs. The portion was a tad on the larger side but I was really hungry so I had no problem finishing it all, tasty large cut sourdough toast included. My husband had the roast beef with blue cheese served with crispy homemade, which had a delicious seasoning sprinkled in. Clearly appeared to be a local favorite as I was observing the crowd which was diverse and from all ages. They had cute patio dining which was not used most likely because it was a little chilly outside. Highly recommend trying it if you are a visitor. Not a celebrity chef establishment but rather a solid addition to the Renaissance of the downtown area.

TZ4EyfyaW4XciP--Qsr-0g.text: Excellent food and service.  Pancakes were the best I ever had.  Prices are very reasonable for the exceptional quality of the food.

uzsfvCaghr-IafWFoEzANw.text: Awesome breakfast/brunch spot in Fremont district north of the Strip.  Makes me feel like I'm back home in Seattle.  Hipster vibe.  Had the traditional eggs, bacon, potato breakfast.  The potatoes were awesome!  Make sure to rub the potatoes on the sour cream powder on the sides of the dish, very tasty!  Forgot our beignets though :(

GpUoWND5TJtyZWU1C8Brdw.text: So disappointed!!! Arrived at Eat today at 11:45. We were so excited to finally try this place and had high hopes. We were a party of 13 and were told it would be an hour and 1/2. An hour and 1/2 seemed long but based on our party we accepted it and agreed to wait. We asked the hostess to take our number as we had 7 kids and wanted to let them play at the Container Park. The hostess agreed and said she would call us. About an hour and 15 min later we called to make sure things were on time. At that time I talked to a man who said they were running behind and it would be at LEAST 45 more minutes. This was VERY frustrating- not only would this be a 2 hour wait, it was 110 degrees we had 7 hungry kids AND they had our phone number and never called to tell us they were running behind. What ever happened to a professional courtesy or just good business practices.. We tried to wait and eventually 30 minutes later ended up down the road at La Comida. Later our friend called, talked to a manger who basically told her it wasn't their policy to "call" people because people "like her" usually don't answer their phones!!! Needless to say she was quite offended. We waited by the phone and were not "those people"! He then said they opened at 8:00 tomorrow if we wanted to come back. He said he wasn't prepared to offer anything for the inconvenience. Overall pretty bad experience and I don't think we will give them another chance. Get it together EAT!!!

cHDPmkPLQ1TmReqF7_DYBQ.text: Don't understand the high ratings. Atmosphere of the place is cool but the food is lacking. Mix flavors that should not be mixed and dishes lack the right type of flavor. I got the huevos with red and green salsas and both of the salsas themselves lacked flavor but then there were all kinds of random other things in the dish which just didn't fit. And I wouldn't be as disappointed if it was a cheap breakfast place by for the hefty price tag of this dish it is not worth what you get.

xf3uR2bP0YOu_E5x0evQVQ.text: This place is awesome. Great atmosphere. And the food is great! I got a basic two egg breakfast and it was all perfectly prepared. My boyfriend had the chicken fried steak and that was delicious a well. Service was wonderful. We never had to ask for water. Can't wait to come back another time and try lunch!!

lvsNSBJbGKKyOLoQBLVfHQ.text: Great service fast and a great feed had the truffled egg and bacon sandwich which was very nice the food was filling added a single pancake again was great with their homemade maple syrup definitely a return in the works lots of great things to try there.

92SUnG6q9JXU0jKROh-AHg.text: We wanted to come down here to eat breakfast because of all the hype in all the local magazines. The food was amazing. Everything from the bread to the chicken was top notch. The Cooks were doing an awesome job working there butts off trying to get everyone's brunch out quickly. The food was delicious. The sausage was especially tasty. I will defiantly be back for the food.  The waitress I had was a different story she was the dumbest waitress I have ever encountered anywhere. I don't know what her name was and I doubt she could remember it if I asked her. She was tall and brown hair and cross eyed. First it took forever to bring us drinks because she forgot us multiple times. We asked for straws and I understand sometimes you run out of things but she was back searching for an eternity and came back with two straws (there were four of us) and asked who wanted them. Awkward. She should have just said they were out. She then brought us our check but it had already been paid by someone else....ok do we just leave? So we confronted her about it and she gave us some BS dumb answer how she misused the plus and subtracted our....what?! She ran in the back and we never saw the brown haired blond the rest of our visit. Thankfully the good looking restaurant manager swooped in and saved the day by fixing our check she was on top of things. We will be returning soon but only because the food was amazing.49$ for 4 people

wBbIUzqy3-CWz-IdB5vGrg.text: Great place to stop for breakfast or lunch. Ordered the corned beef hash. Phenomenal take on it. The oj is quite pricy at 6$ a glass so be careful but everything is fresh hot and delicious.

C7Jpi1UrDGOEzQRI0oOePg.text: Order the grilled cheese and tomato soup. You won't regret it. It's the most delicious thing ever! Be prepared for a lot more food than you would expect from a grilled cheese though, I would advise sharing.

cE9-f1PzE0Q4gSQOhT5QCA.text: I visited here in August 2015 with a group of 5 other women, most of us from the Washington, DC area.  We all loved the food and ambiance; the service was also warm and friendly. The cinnamon biscuits were decadent and delicious.  The truffle egg sandwich was flavorful and innovative.  The pancakes were some of the best I've had in a restaurant: great homemade flavor.  Be warned, though, that the portions are generous.  Most of us were not able to finish our meals. I highly recommend this place.  It was well-worth the cab ride from the Vegas Strip.

xdBBjFWP61Hq24PI4xd-uA.text: Cool place live music kinda got that hipster vibe, whatever the hell those are.

ElFsJ9OQxSAVB85ArDlH2Q.text: I haven't had this combination of high quality food, service, and overall restaurant experience in Las Vegas in a looooong time. Every person working there takes pride in what they were doing. The menu was simple and delicious made with fresh ingredients and came out of a well managed kitchen. Another review commented how Las Vegas has desperately needed a restaurant similar to what you'd commonly find in NY, LA, or SF. I absolutely agree with this sentiment. This is a great representation of what can and should be Las Vegas culinary culture.

NjVUFeC9qcKpetOEibKD8g.text: Food is good but not spectacular. Had the BBQ kielbasa sandwich solid bread. Meat was tasty but could have been better smoked. BBQ sauce was what held it back. Sweet BBQ sauce not my favorite by a mile. Still overall a great place to eat. The Veg Black Bean chili was very good.

kk8PtgYfnAe2m5i0FHl5TA.text: The food is amazing! The service was great! We'll come back every time were in town

X_bEHhJje6WkP4hL2PlXZA.text: Eat is off the path of the freemont experience, but it has an urban, cool feel to it. The food is a bit pricy but really worth it. I had breakfast there, though there are lunch/dinner options as well. The bread they use is SO fresh and tasty, and our server was exceptional. I will be back

S0FTL4mcSSvIJcbobzP3Mg.text: Really enjoyed our meal here: I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy and my companion had the Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup. The Po Boy was extremely delicious; the Grilled Cheese likewise (and Texas toast thick), with a flavorful soup that tasted like the essence of tomatoes. The interior is a nicely-dressed industrial space, well-decorated with greenery throughout. It was a bit crowded when we arrived and so it took a little while to get a seat... but once we did, the service was fine & friendly.

Qw3cwG7DEqug07qHHomEPw.text: Great service and exceptional food. I recommend the deep fried deviled eggs. The homemade jelly was also worth mentioning.

CF-ttNNUTbRlrLaI4qlrFA.text: What a Great place for breakfast.  We were  tired of breakfast on the strip and was heading to old Vegas for the day. We looked up places to eat and found Eat and we were glad we did. A little less expensive than the standard breakfast placed we'd found over the week. Great atmosphere. Great service and they wee busy.  Food was awesome. I had one of their own unique dishes and it was awesome.  My wife eggs with pancakes which was really good. real maple syrup. I would go back often if I lived there.  Give it a try.  We did and and give it a 10.  Enjoy!

Ca5h8iU4EZBR3CelJ8nkEg.text: Very good food, very fresh, healthy and great service these ladies are on to something. I'm from California and I will definitely come back when I'm in town.

WYv3YJsP26K9-9IHA_u2WQ.text: Simply Fabulous! Super quick to be seated. Fun, chic  ambiance. Corned beef hash, grits,  fresh squeezed orange juice,  and the COFFEE!!!! Wait staff work together to make sure you have everything you need,  before you need to even ask. Excellent place to have breakfast or brunch. Parking is on the street. $2.00 for 4 hours, but I doubt you'll need that much time. Within a walking distance to Freemont Street.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice decor, music.

fxtUPQQaxerDee9B7liFeQ.text: Girlfriend and I loved this little place downtown. We ended up having lunch here twice while visiting Vegas.  Both times we had a short wait for a table at lunch. eat seems to be very popular. It is an open space inside so it can be a bit loud when full, but not bad.  My favorite was the chicken bahn mi. Girlfriend's favorite was the shrimp po-boy. We also tried the DWBLT and the chicken pot pie, as well as the tomato soup and green chile chicken posole. All were fresh and delicious. Service was quick and helpful.  This place is a winner.

eH5J7Y8Ul-Gz7rTxblCIwQ.text: Drove to Vegas this weekend and pulled in to this place for breakfast. The service was fast, the restaurant was quaint and clean and the staff was super friendly. To top it off the food was awesome. I had the scotch eggs on pancakes (odd over pancakes but it worked!) it tasted awesome! As a Brit, I'm skeptical about getting scotch eggs anywhere but back home, but this place nailed it by putting their own spin on it. The rest of my party had the truffle egg sandwich with potatoes and that was awesome. You really can't go wrong with truffle. The hubs also (yes also this man is a bottomless pit when it comes to food) got the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The grilled cheese is huge. Wow! But very good. Awesome breakfast place. Will definitely go back!!

KZ5qa24sbEDkOZO2Q-fa7g.text: Good food - kind of expensive - convenient to Fremont street - and don't miss the park across the street.

GB9eq_WYcFm53dDFs1azJQ.text: Great food! We split an order of beignets to start, they were awesome.  My wife had the shrimp and grits (which coming from the South was a gamble...it paid off) and I had the lox plate (equally as good). Food was filling and the prices were reasonable.  Great atmosphere.  Owner came up and chatted with us, which I always enjoy.  We will definitely "eat" here again on our next visit to Vegas.

h8yCdWn636SnXKUL_cbGow.text: Good basic breakfast fare but I was disappointed after all the hype and reviews. Not anything too over the top except for the pancakes --- fantastic! Get there right when they open to avoid the await.

W8rp5p0rExlzkk6ag79H_Q.text: Glad we choose this place great service. I had the truffle egg sandwich OH WOW! It was fantastic

8j10PoM6x5ifSfCbeM_Ybw.text: I have taken 2 breakfasts @ that place. It is super nice. The place is well decorated and inspires rest. The food is also super good. I would highly recommend this place.

B7ssM1gXhNguq_O4WQ4cnQ.text: This place is a wonderful addition to downtown LV! Came here for brunch before a Saturday matinee. The atmosphere is a great blend of cozy/hole in the wall. Service was quick and the food was so flavorful! I recommend the Downtown Benedict and the chicken sausage with homemade strawberry compote.

K1J24AWYmxvhapfauz7fyA.text: Me and my boyfriend went on a weekday. Not too busy with a good vibe! Waitress and hostess were very nice. Healthy option menu. He got the dwblta and added an egg. It came with a tomato soup which was equally bomb. I ordered the truffled egg sandwich, hold the shrooms. Was probably the best scramby egg sandwich I ever had. Potatoes I weren't crazy about but that's ok. Loved this place. Would go back again.

NQq3NfsqW2HRLMw51NBKSw.text: Delicious breakfast. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs.  Eggs fresh and their sourdough is crazy good. My only little criticism is the breading on my steak was a little oily (I get my gravy on the side ... yes, I'm one of those). Hubby had the grilled cheese with bacon ... to die for! Next time I'm trying the shrimp and grits.

3GqX0X1trPQ7jnEeG915_g.text: I give 3 stars because the food was great. I'm leaving this review solely because of Gary the server. I'm blown away that he still has a job and is there, representing this establishment. It's the second time he's waited on us, and the second time he was nothing but plain nasty, rude, and obnoxious. We are happy, cheery, easy going people to wait on. My sister and I are vegas locals. Our father was visiting, and we brought him here and were honestly embarrassed of how disgustingly his attitude was from beginning to end- FOR NO REASON. I'm a bartender of 8 years, I couldn't be more easy and friendly when it comes to dining out. We STILL left 20%, ONLY because our blonde drink server was the cutest and friendliest ever. Had we been waited on just him, we would have left a fat zero tip. You don't get rewarded for the way he acted. You need people skills to work in the service industry. He has none. Find a new line of work, Gary.

wK9wppUbbIYKBO3BtpDH6Q.text: Found this place easily and parked for free one block down. Walk in and leave my name as there was a wait.  She informed me 10min.  We got sat within that time a nice corner cushioned booth.  The house was full. Cement brick walls. Reminds me of a place I've had brunch in San Francisco.  Fabric napkins.  Condiment plate is the centerpiece with assortment of sweeteners.  The menu is presented on a clipboard. I had the passion fruit iced tea.  It was unsweetened tasted freshly brewed and refreshing. Read the reviews here and ordered the common suggested shrimp and grits as well as killer grilled cheese.  The server warned us they are known for food to arrive right away and there might be a bit of delay.  Service was on point, everything arrived in a timely manner. They were plated nicely.  The grits were topped with shrimp hidden underneath a pico de gallo like salsa.  It was good but maybe not my taste to crave again. The grilled cheese looked great made with thick toast. The tomato soup we asked to have with it was thick. The menu lists tomato salad.  Just the right amount of cheese!  Like this one!  Our bill came out to $32 for two drinks and two plates. It was a cute place to catch up with my girlfriend.

XQABzGDNZUddn6hHP6Kg5w.text: I have been here several times. The food is always fresh, good and of a high quality. The prices are on the higher end for the type of food being served but not unreasonable. It is usually busy so except at least a short wait and some noise.

-9DI9pQAixtSvXnscXcqJg.text: The food and service are always great.  I love the small owned business and how the restaurant is managed.  I'm very impressed with the recipes and how they are plated.  I would recommend this breakfast place to anyone in the valley.  Go downtown and support this local business!  Try any of the benny's they are my fave!

mFJNZ2cD2-jLI4oD_6-qfA.text: My new favorite place for breakfast. Friendly staff and great food. If you don't try the deviled eggs your missing out. I can't wait to go back.

y0J2rvB2IyyRQ4uBpUOo-Q.text: What can I say about this gem. Prompt polite and pleasant service.  Trendy hip vibe. Great tasting food on the lunch menu. I had a chicken sandwich that was fresh, not over cooked, and on a soft roll. The vegetarian had a tofu and veggie sandwich that she claimed was pretty good.  We also tried there vegetarian chilli.  I would order it and i am a meat eater. the one outright i didn't care for was the potato salad. It tasted some bought out of one of those plastic tubs.  Don't worry though because you should be ordering the  delicious home made potato chips anyway.

Zy0muD7jUUhYY5G9oocsEw.text: The coffee here is Amazeballs....the service was great! The food was the icing on the cake....I had the egg sandwich....such scrumptious  flavor and I have no idea how they made the potatoes. ...from heaven!!

W14UkBvrRU9zTp-x89Tncw.text: Let me get the food out of the way first. We ordered the corn beef hash with poached eggs, shrimp and grits, one pancake, tomato soup, iced coffee, and passion fruit iced tea.  Corn beef hash and eggs - corn beef hash itself was good. Diced and goes well with the egg yolk.   Shrimp and grits - grits had great texture. A good amount of shrimp but tasted frozen.   Pancake - tasted like funnel cake. Not bad.   Coffee - nothing special   Passion Fruit Iced Tea - refreshing  Here comes the horrible service. These are facts, not opinions.  We were seated by a nice hostess and given our drinks immediately. Our server whom I will not name for his safety didn't bother to greet us or introduce himself. After we ordered and was well into our meal, not once did he come up to us to ask "how we were doing?" "How's the food?" Or refilled our water cups. However, he did all those three service favors for others around us. I politely asked for syrup from him and he gave me a blank face. Came back and put the syrup in front of me with no word.   After we were finished with our meals and already annoyed, a busser comes to our table and asks (in a awkward tone) "are you done?". He stacked our plates quickly and never said a word further. Not to mention we thanked him for cleaning our table.   When I asked our waiter for the check, he came back with it and didn't say a single word. I paid and left him a tip because I understand servers make their money off tips. I left him a personal note to let him know our experience at Eat.  Extremely disappointed.... Our highly anticipated lunch at Eat. during our thanksgiving weekend getaway was ruined due to the poor service.

-8nsV9806_QF6VF5F4myoA.text: Not the place for a large group of people. Particularly if it matters.  I've been to EAT a few times. Generally I want to support the businesses in the new downtown, selfishly, as I really want this area to succeed as a genuine alternative.  The purpose of my comment today, is not about food or service, which I have generally found to be satisfactory without being outstanding. Breakfast offerings in LV are pretty low grade.  Today, I selected EAT to meet some friends who were in town from the other side of the world. I had called to make a reservation earlier and the staff explained they didn't take bookings. No problem. We had a larger party so I took the opportunity to ask whether they felt they could handle that without a bother when we came in. I was told that it would be fine. It wasn't.  They do a thriving business at EAT. Good for them. However, on this occasion we were not able to be seated together and once our guests had arrived, we were not made feel welcome to speak with them, not able to pull up a chair and join them or get a larger table.   As a result we were not able to spend any time with our visitors and ended up leaving without having enjoyed the purpose of the location. Sadly, the staff, whilst trying to a basic level, didn't really care. They were asking someone what was OK and not. I assume this is the owner based upon earlier reviews.  Seems that money, money, money, money is the big driver here and there clearly wasn't much consideration for the continued ordering that would have taken place from our party. OK.  As I had said to the member of staff (that I had spoken too before coming to the restaurant), if you cant accommodate have the courtesy to say so when people take the time to ask. I would have found another venue.

GDSUzcxMWRDnqKLp2LfLAw.text: Love the devilled eggs at Eat and the cinammon biscuits! Friendly service and a nice atmosphere.

P2yGYlwd4shZq7ChRiaxKA.text: Located across the street from Container Park. Metered parking for certain hours of the day. My friend and I came here pretty early on a Sunday morning (~8:30am). We were seated promptly and greeted within a few seconds by our waitress who brought waters over for us.   A few moments later she came back to take our orders; I ordered the Truffled Egg Sandwich with a coffee and my friend ordered the Shrimp and Grits. Both meals were not only delicious, but super hearty also. The Truffled Egg Sandwich was ON POINT. I'm always nervous about the bread to filling ratio, but this was perfect. Breakfast sandwich dreams are made of! I would try to recount what deliciousness was in the sandwich, but I think I was so sleep-deprived that I couldn't recall. It also came with a hearty side of breakfast potatoes. My friend's Shrimp and Grits were also pretty tasty. It's served with thick cut bacon on the bottom, topped with a runny egg, and an optional side of toast for dipping (this toast was more like Texas toast and not standard bread).   Service was great, food was great, coffee was great. All in a great day in DTLV.

rvhwZI6MGhViWB6Om4hTYQ.text: I wanted to try something new for brunch and this place came to mind since I have seen it. But since this place always closes early which is totally understandable since it's a brunch place. I went in already knowing what to try since I was digging thru other people's comments. So I ordered the cinnamon biscuit with powered sugar and strawberry and shrimp po'boy and my boyfriend ordered the killer  gill Cheese with bacon with a side of tomato soup. Sounds good right ? It really wasn't that good as I expected seems like any other regular place. Maybe I went in expecting a lot. Overall it was okay but not worth going again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Po&#39;boy

IkKI-p2E2crIABUaMJVerg.text: Every time I come here I have a great experience.. But never like the one we had last week.. I have a son who's a T1D. He had been struggling for about a week with his BG, when I was getting to order, I asked our waiter for the lowest carb dish on his menu. He quickly pointed me in the right direction. I told him my Son was a T1D & he pulled out his insulin pump. What a surprise! My son's face lit up. He met some one who spoke his language.. He was so kind & helpful & full of knowledge since he was DX when he was 7yrs old & currently 29yrs old. He gave us some pointers  & even gave us his personal number just in case we ever had some questions. Needless to say this was one of our best dine in experience thanks to him He totally made my sons day!

qHzvwKqeAJ8OVv64VSlSEQ.text: Truly a 'must dine' joint if you're lookin for bomb ass brunch in downtown Las Vegas (blocks away from Fremont Street). As a 1st timer, i knew i stumbled across a foodie's gem when i encountered the spillage of people waitin outside about 10'ish on a Sunday morning.   I dined w/a friend so our wait was about 20 mins (not too bad considering the bigger the party, the longer the wait time). Service was great, ambience was hip & inviting & food was bangin! I ordered shrimp & grits - 13 dolla made me holla when i saw that my grits were happily submerged in a savory sauce beneath a pile of goodness (2 strips of smoked bacon, 2 eggs over easy, & shrimps topped w/pico de gallo). I left w/a smile & my belly left happy so I'll definitely be back! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious shrimp &amp; grits for that ass! :)

SsdGBwweKPmO0SgeYrIRPg.text: The food and service was amazing. We waited about 20 minutes to get a table on a Sunday morning but it was worth the wait. I got the classic - 2 eggs with turkey bacon. The menu had plenty of options.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 eggs with potatoes and turkey bacon

eg6BdWdTWzlkLedDl78PLQ.text: CHICKEN FRIED STEAK  That's all you need to know.  Chicken fried steak is my go to meal for breakfast and it is what my personal mission in life is.  This high quality chicken fried steak is my personal choice for THE BEST on the west coast.  It is crispy on the outside, thick and juicy on the inside, and is seasoned perfectly.  It is not a frozen reheated hockey puck, but a handmade beautiful heart stopper.   I will confess, I don't remember what my wife had because I was so stoked about my meal, but she said it was good.  I like Vegas a lot, and I am so thankful (and sad) that my search is over for the perfect chicken fried steak!

83GdZp58el_NqYEIqs-x5w.text: To eat or not to eat... is always the question. If you're at eat... you should clearly EAT. You won't regret it.  We came here for a late brunch and sadly we missed their breakfast which they only serve until 11am daily. I was bummed because I was looking forward to trying their yummy breakfast items, but I guess that means I'll have to be back next time!  I ordered the truffle egg sandwich ($12) and would give it 3 stars. Their ingredients are all fresh and local which I appreciated and overall the sandwich was good but nothing to rave home about especially since I couldn't really taste the truffle. I did enjoy my friends' homemade potato chips and I had a bite of my friend's Reuben which was surprisingly delicious.   eat is very community based and fosters a lot of love for the local food, people and flavor. Their philosophy to eat local, happy, fresh, fast and smart definitely shows in their food and service. Such a great brunch place off the strip and definitely worth the trip.

3zaZKT12S_DW4DFW5Ci_SQ.text: My friend took us out of towners into this local brunch spot for some much deserved chowing after a morning hike at red rock canyon. For a Saturday morning, the wait was manageable and there was plenty to explore in the area to make time pass quickly. All the menu options seemed incredible. We split fried deviled eggs, a twist on the classic I've never experienced. Needless to say they were fantastic. I had the truffled egg sandwich and the flavor was on point. I'm generally not an egg or egg sandwich person, but between the AMAZING bread, truffles, bacon and avocado, it was an egg sandwich like no other.

N--1asMKm1re4rv4aEVS7w.text: This place was recommended to us by a local.  With high hopes we went for a late breakfast.  It was a very busy, bustling place!  Concrete floors and cinder block walls made it a noisy restaurant while busy.  Unfortunately, this eatery wasn't all it was cracked up to be.  The food is okay, but nothing special.  Two of us had shrimp and grits... It was okay, but didn't wow us.  There was a nice quantity of shrimp in the serving.  Another person ordered the egg truffle sandwich.  It was a large sandwich.  She said it was good but not something she'd go out of her way for.    The potatoes that come with the egg truffle sandwich had an odd taste, almost like they were tossed in rancid oil first.  My friend has a complicated palate and said perhaps they were seasoned with truffle oil...  I don't know but I would not order them.    We ordered regular coffee and it had an unusual flavor as well.    The parking is limited to metered street parking.  It's out of the way from the strip even though it is easy to get to off of Las Vegas Blvd.  Overall, it's not bad, but it's not amazing.

I7Png3IqoeBghTfDLHr1ZQ.text: Fantastic breakfast. Great decor, good vibe, solid service, delicious food. So happy we discovered this gem!

6kNL3cyo45O0TXa3U_lLbw.text: Four of us ate here:   Coffee: fragrant and smooth Food: - shrimp grits : fresh shrimp over grits and fried egg. Good sauce. I recommend it - egg n mushroom sandwich: love the bread on this one. Soft inside with just enough crunch on the outside to hold the sammy together without needing to bite down hard - huevo "something" (forgot the name): has egg , banana, beans, red chili sauce and corn tortilla. It was not cloying as one might expect. Banana added a fragrant sweet taste. Very good. -posole: spicy w lots of vegetable. Too spicy for me but the person who ordered it enjoyed it .  Great service

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg with tortilla, bean, and banana
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg n mushroom sammy
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp with grits

DB-voTm4PDSrBvFwAVuekA.text: Such an awesome little spot in DTLV! You must try it here! The staff was awesome and the food too! Go on a Friday for the Scottish egg with pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Went on the best day! Friday&#39;s special was the  Scottish egg. Yum!

f_8Jycs82VUTnqvli9Nzdg.text: I had high hopes for eat. based on all the reviews I had read of their breakfast, but they were sadly dashed one by one throughout the course of my meal. The hopes were mostly kind of silly (looking for a live DJ! Wanting to drink a mimosa!), but some of them were just basics of eating out (having a server who didn't treat me like serving me was the last thing they wish they were doing, bringing maple syrup with pancakes) and those were kind of a big deal.  I know that sometimes I like to order odd things. In the case of eat. I ordered a pancakes based "meal" and a side of grits. I asked to switch bacon for sausage. I don't know if that's considered a big deal in some areas, but I've never thought it to be a huge thing in the past. Then my husband ordered. Then the waitress said to our table, "guys orders are always so much easier than girls." Wha??? I think she was just talking smack about me to my face and to our whole table because I asked to switch sausage for bacon? That alone would have been enough to make me feel uneasy with my meal, but the rest of the meal kind of went along the same route - taking a long time for refills of coffee or water, not bringing any syrup with pancakes and not checking in on us for long enough we had to flag someone else down who did bring us the syrup so I could eat my lukewarm meal.  Anyway, the pancakes were actually really, really good. The other food was average. But, none of it was worth feeling like I was a hassle for trying to eat breakfast there.

BcvF-n9H_vk6Yg_2xuW1_g.text: Items selected include:  Coffee  Beignets - Made to Order with Raspberry Jam and Vanilla Mascarpone  Golden Pancake Short Stack  Fruit Cup  Huevos Motulenos with 2 eggs, red and green chili, black beans, peas, feta, sauteed bananas, corn tortilla  Shrimp and Grits with Ham and two fried eggs  Part of the downtown Las Vegas revitalization, Natalie Young's "eat." seemed a great choice for early Saturday breakfast and keeping in mind the total dearth of Las Vegas traffic in the early morning hours it was a mere 10 minute drive from the MGM to the small modern eatery where we would find Chef Young already hard and work and an acoustic musician filling the room with tunes from Pearl Jam and Led Zeppelin as we sat down.  Designed as a sort of upscale urban soul food space for locals and featuring a menu both familiar but interesting, all composed of locally sourced fresh ingredients I knew right away that I was going to like eat. and although our server J.D. seemed a bit hung over (or perhaps just socially awkward) the moment food began to arrive my suspicions were confirmed.  Starting first with great coffee, copiously refilled throughout our hour-long visit, and moving straight to shared plates of NOLA-quality beignets, crispy buttermilk pancakes with pure maple syrup, and a plethoric fruit cup it was obvious from first bite that Chef Young is not skimping on ingredient quality and although I favor sweet to savory 95% of the time the meal only got better when we moved onto our main plates; the shrimp snappy and sweet with exceptionally toothsome grits and the truly unique pairing of heat and sweet tossed with peas, feta, and two poached eggs quite unlike anything I've had before or since - the Motulenos an absolute must order and the restaurant more than enough reason for local or tourist to get up early and trek off-strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits with Ham and two fried eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets - Made to Order with Raspberry Jam and Vanilla Mascarpone
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gz0YxCMTA7hWb1S-3ZKYUQ.text: I've been hearing about this place and was excited for a new breakfast place that also sources local, supports local artist and is on the pulse of the growth of downtown. It's already sounding like my kind of place with a strong ethos for community and quality.  The banner says, "eat.  A breakfast and lunch place." was actually a breakfast THEN lunch place. Wish I knew before  going down there that they do not serve both together. Weekdays breakfast is stopped at 11am, then lunch until 3pm. Weekends is brunch until 2pm.    We order up the killer grilled cheese since that was sounding good to the BF. The tomato soup it came with was really good. It was a bit cheesy and creamy and like there was chunks of tomato in it, not just puree, which I prefer. The grilled cheese was just OK, though I generally will enjoy thick buttery toast. Nothing mindblowing.  I couldn't decide between the shrimp po boy or the pot pie and chose the chicken pot pie since it sounded good to the BF. I blackjacked on the wrong one. The flavor was decent, but as I got to the bottom there was soggy crust that absorbed all of the sauce from the filling and made the filling thicker than pot pies normally are. The top was crunchy enough and it would have been better if they just did the top and skipped the bottom crust as it won't crisp right in a thick and shallow ramekin. The egg on top was over medium-hard and had a bit crisp burnt edges and wished it was yolky good. The salad it came with was very light and fresh though. Very fresh mixed greens, shredded carrot, sprouts, tomatoes.   As much as I wanted to love the food here, soup and salad shouldn't have been the best part and nothing impressed my socks off.  Also, I thought for $4 for ice tea, it would taste better or be unique passionfruit. It was standard tropical ice tea flavor, but it had that oversteeped taste so I didn't really clamor for refills.  Service was on the cusp of adequate. It was odd how quiet our server was. I asked for something and he just made the slightest of nods and walked away to another table which left me a bit thinking if he was gonna get it or not. He did end up bringing me some hot sauce. He just put the check on the table, no acknowledgement or asked if there was anything else, while we were eating or checking to see if we want our ice tea topped. He wasn't mean, but I guess wasn't friendly either. Seeing their website talking about the importance of people, you'd think this would be the warmest just-like-home service spot.   I see that the hype and the love is for breakfast or weekend only items. If stuff like the shrimp and grits, the huevos montulenos and eggs benedict (weekends only) gets people talking this place up, then have that magic stuff available always!  I don't get why the switch in menus considering this place is open only until 3pm weekdays. Vegas is a nightlife industry so you would think they would try to catch as much local support as possible and have breakfast for swing shift and graveyard, not just the AM folks who work at the government buildings in downtown.   The menus are small that combining it would be 20 items. It's not impossible to make breakfast items as well as salads and sandwiches of the lunch menu. I get simplifying to make it easy to prepare, but then I would expect it to just KILL that execution and flavor when you're making a pot pie special, 5 sandwiches and plating already cooked soup and mixing salads. With small menus you would expect a jes ne sais quoi with everything you order. If they were to have breakfast items all day, I would maybe give it a chance again before heading into work.   I'm so so sad I had to rant instead of rave of this place. I started this review as a 3star, but it felt more suited to a 2star by the end of it. I haven't been this disappointed in a long while. This much talked about breakfast will have to elude us then. I just don't see us making the effort to wake up outside of our sleep pattern to be here early for a place that left us with doubt.
