Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie and spring green salad

kDd44H0yYw8qZ0HicL0j9A.text: Cool little hidden hip breakfast spot. Portions were huge, split the cinnamon biscuits and country fried steak with my mom and it was more than enough food. Will definitely be taking my friends here.

eBUrWoRBYTU2t-3ipJYxhw.text: The food here is fresh and prepared just right. I had a simple apple wood smoked bacon, eggs, home potatoes and a pancake. The home potatoes are seasoned perfectly. The bacon was crispy and full of flavor and the eggs were prepared as they should be. I had them scrambled but scrambled should be cook just before done then plated, that's where they finish cooking. Now the pancake.... A slight crisp to it and the inside fluffy and flavorful. The wait staff is pleasant and helpful if it's your first time.  I'll be back again and again. There is a wait and a little tight in the waiting area but again worth the wait. Enjoy your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pancake
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fgB9SzKsTPlzXIvzFNFMRg.text: The food was great. The portions are very large and we had a great server named Gary.. we had a large group and even though the space is cozy they accommodated us. I had a BLT w/ Tomato soup and it was delicious..  I have a healthy appetite and I had trouble finishing the food... The atmosphere and decor is an urban feel with warm lighting.. Its one block over from Fremont Street behind the Container Park so it's easy to reach.. I would highly recommend you stopping by!

p3Jp-WR62paZb9v2SRfuKQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast stops in Las Vegas! I don't know what all goes into those pancakes but they are amazing!   Wish they would serve liquor here because I have a feeling they would make an awesome bloody mary!  Must haves; Pancakes Shrimp & Grits Huevos Motulenos

V-u6fCkjzyfpUHTXF1Blxw.text: I ate there couple of times already. Yes, the price I think should be adjusted a little. A bit much for just a sandwich. I don't think you shouldn't pay more than $10 for any type of sandwich. Unless there's truffle, Kobe beef or lobster in it.  Anyways, I still love eat. I love the decor, and love the staff. But most of all I love their eggs Benidict. The flavor is so perfectly balanced and hollendaise sauce is made fresh. Eggs where cooked just right. Almost as good as mine. Hehe.  I love the fact that they have music for Sunday brunch, it was a bit loud but the music was good so I didn't mind. My table was bobbing our heads and jamming out to good music and good food. Who doesn't love that?  Service was great, kept our waters filled and coffees warm. Super friendly staff and fast services. Over all I give it 4.5!

spnXRKIBvUgxJOq0vS1FJw.text: Great food a must try while in Vegas!  Excellent breakfast! Everything here is fresh and it's a great escape from the buffet's or subpar food you will have while in Vegas.

5XbFSswkrRY8wnwIgnLo1Q.text: This is my very first review.  Usually, I don't have issues...but this place has gotten more positive reviews than it deserves.  I kind of depend on YELP reviewers to help me decide where I'm going to spend my hard earned cash or in this case, cash I won at the casinos.  Our table ordered several dishes and we all shared.  The Chicken Fried Steak was amazingly tough given the fact that the inexpensive cut of beef was tenderized!       The dwblta was served with a very hard, unripe, and inedible avocado.    The "made to order" beignets came to the table fresh out of the fryer.  They "looked" very good.  Unfortunately, they were very dense and really needed a lot of jam and mascarpone to give enough flavor.   I'm not sure whether they were really "made to order" or just "refried " to order.  The Huevos Motulenos dish wasn't too bad....actually not bad at all, but the potatoes were tasteless.   The coffee was good.  But, the mug it came in looked as if it had been previously used.  Coffee drips were on the front and back of the mug....not necessarily from someone drinking from it...but none the less, not a clean looking mug.  Later, I asked some server walking by to get me a clean mug, and without hesitation did so and filled it with fresh coffee.     We asked for an extra plate and got the smallest plate possible.  So, we asked again and finally received one after a wait.  We asked for extra jam and immediately got the jam, as well as attitude from some tattooed server/cashier. The servers were many...in fact there were so many different ones coming to our table to do things (two to take our order, two others to serve, another one to get the plate, and yet another one to bring the attitude, and still another to bring the check or it could have been the same one....bottom line it would be nice to have just one who tends to our table.   (BTW, our initial servers who took our order were out the door by 9ish that morning. We couldn't figure that one out.  Maybe that was why it seemed we had so many different servers plus it appeared some were in-training.)   I paid and left a small tip because not every server there was lacking "good waiter" qualities.   There are so many restaurants competing for our business and thanks to YELP it makes it a little easier to decide.  But it is unfortunate when customers don't take the time to critique bad experiences.  What we experienced today does not appear to be a one time thing.....but a lack of control over the quality and preparation of the food and the disregard for its customers experience.  I was disappointed that I wasted my money and  I will  NOT be coming back to this restaurant.

suHqIzmVFTAXqvn8iNov0w.text: We went a few weekends ago with a fairly large group (6) and I am happy to report that the venue lived up to the considerable hype it has generated in the short time it has been opened. Although they were very busy the staff was friendly and accommodating. We all shared the beignets and they were great - an unusual menu item that stacked up the ones I've had at Cafe du Monde (sp) in New Orleans. For my main entree I went with the shrimp and grits and was very happy with my choice. The sauce, consistency and seasoning was a great blend of savory and spice. I was pleasantly surprised to find bacon strip buried at the bottom! Topped with an egg that you can break up and mix - this is a dish I will order again. There is a good selection of teas and coffee - which I had to top off the breakfast.

yUcy_o-n9qss8YzFz0jOvQ.text: Let me start off saying the food is amazing . If it wasn't for the owner I would have given it a 5 star. We get there with a party of 5 . As soon as we get there we notice 2 table for 2 are open we also notice the owner is sitting at the only 6 top table with another guest. In so we wait and we wait and we wait . The host went up to her 3 times telling her that there are customers waiting hat need that table and she didn't even move. Three different party's of 5 or more came a left because the wait was going to be so long and being that there were  tables for 2 open she wouldn't even move. The worse part was when her and her guest were done eating and he left she sat there by herself on a table for 6 doing paperwork for another 30 min. Me and my husband would have left I'd it wasn't for our kids wanting to eat there. We will never go back and in fact 2 people have asked us about the place and we told them we wouldn't recommend it. Simply because the owner just doesn't care. The host apologized for the owner and after the 4 the request she finally moved. Take your money to a small Bussiness where the owner appreciates your Bussiness.

gA-ojzgYM87OFqFxItsdDw.text: My husband loved his Downtown Eggs Benedict and the coffee was good and strong. My shrimp and grits was more like seafood chowder. There was so much sauce I couldn't get a good bite of grits. The shrimp was pure rubber. Expect a bit of a wait but good for downtown.

IYJ3qPZAxlc4WfCupHKmDA.text: Excellent taste and savory menu.  My favorite is the pancake.  Crunchy on the outside and soft and most inside.

kVY09EwOuFJoUzdwUtgChw.text: I have been here about 10 times in the past few years and although I thought it was fantastic in the beginning, it has steadily gone down hill. The prices are not cheap and fankly over priced for the area it is in. Let's face it they are serving breakfast so the actual cost of ingredient is not that great compare to any other place. They are certainly not paying much rent and electricity as the place is dark in midday! They can't make the table smaller unless they plan to just serve coffee, then the cheap decor and the unbearable noise as they spend not one dollar in sound insulation, concrete floor, bare ceiling tht echoes the noise in this place to a level like eating in a heavy metal concert. The declining food and unchanged menu plus high prices make this a place I would not visit again and it is unfortunate as the place had a great start but no restaurant can rest on their laurel for too long before they become a has been.

u76RjxOsHzOdXgW9K0n9Hw.text: My friend and I were staying at the Ogden in downtown La's Vegas. As part of exploring the downtown project. We did not want to drive to the strip just for breakfast. Noticed "Eat" and checked it out.   The food is delicious, affordably priced (esp. for Vegas) and the chef is top class. I had the Huevos Motulenos and my friend had the special of the day, bananas foster. We both cleaned our plates.  Highly recommended!

H13hJ_bjd0_7bH1qY9jAqg.text: Food was delicious! The wait is insane but if you have the time then it's definitely worth it. We had the egg truffle sandwiches. The server offered us some extras like a side of avocado and I heard her offer extra cheese to someone at another table- she doesn't tell you these things are at additional costs. Other than that great place!

dNhAzTQC-w0X6RIwUJaudw.text: We arrived near the end of breakfast service and were told by our wait staff person that we would need to order from the brunch menu.  We moaned and told her that we were hoping to have breakfast.  Another person (the manager???) overhead our conversation and came over to tell us if we could order quickly that the kitchen would accomodate our order.  We asked what she would recommend; she suggested the Shrimp and Grits.  I had intended to have something really breakfast-like but since that dish was on my 'to-have' list, I thought, why not try it here.  My cousin ordered the steel cut oatmeal and the beignets.    When the food was served, I split off some of the shrimp and grits to share.  What a mistake; I wish I could have eaten the whole order myself, after having the first bite.  I'm not sure if the restaurant's recipe was traditional, but it sure was gooooood.  Buttered grits on the base, perfectly cooked shrmp, sweet crispy bacon, sauteed pico de gallo, two eggs, and finely chopped red onion.  There was a great balance of flavors and texture.  I'm usually not good with raw onion, but these were cut very fine and were extra sweet so they added an unexpected flavor and texture.  My cousin was also happy with the oatmeal.  This review would have been a 5-star except that the beignets were pretty heavy (suspect that if we had ordered them in breakfast prime-time that they would have been lighter.  But the homemade jam that they were served with was very good so that made up alittle).   Will definitely come back on my next visit and will recommend to my friends and family.

ZLGUqcgnv2rGtapC3z8Nhg.text: Followed Sunset Magazine's recommendation to the new downtown LV spot called eat.  Was very pleased with the food, the service, and the staff.  Took a moment to introduce myself to chef.owner Natalie and she was so gracious and knowledge.  Very down to earth, delicious food.  My husband loved his chicken fried steak...for breakfast!  Wonderful coffee, specialty baked goods, and I enjoyed the homemade granola with the seasonal fresh fruit and greek yogurt.  Run, don't walk to this great new breakfast and lunch joint in Las Vegas.  Wish we lived closer.  We  would be  regular customers.

PkDK2qInXZJutSXuRKPE6g.text: Went there for a relaxed breakfast with the Mrs.  The food had good flavor, the service was above average and the owner was nice and attentive.

x3o4o_Nt_g7FvxQuWA2s6w.text: I honestly didn't think that scrambled eggs and white toast could taste this good. I will make it a point to eat here every time I come to Vegas, and encourage everyone I know to do the same.  Came in for late breakfast on a sunday. Packed house, but we didn't wait too long. We had shrimp grits with eggs & bacon, and scrambled eggs with bacon & smashed potatoes. It was all wonderful. Even though the scrambled eggs had obviously been waiting too long under a heat lamp, they tasted so good that all was forgiven.  Very, very loud - probably not the best spot for hangover breakfast.  Really happy we found this place.

aeGnqWSe5BoUf2ylivHDTw.text: Great food and Great Staff what more do you want from a place to eat? Chef is OUTSTANDING!!

Uh0zqBjl_0dh0ICZj-ngVQ.text: Really good food. Definitely recommend the pancakes and any of their egg dishes. A bit pricey in my opinion but great spot.

C_4go1IkrfPx0XNUkX9uZw.text: The decor and atmosphere in here reminds me of cool quaint modern restaurants in California specifically Palo Alto University Ave. The outside and surrounding area wasn't so inviting and I was a bit worried about leaving the car. The establishment is really clean and spacious from the dinning area to the restroom and from what  I can see into the kitchen as well. They gave us way too much time to make a selection from a small menu but the food came out pretty quick and piping hot. We spent $30 on huevos (something ) and chilaquiles small orange juice and a coffee. Huevos had scambled eggs black bleans,peas, feta and small pieces of bananas. Side of potatoes and topped with red and green chile sauce. Chilaquiles similar to a nachos but so much more healthier and fresher. Corn tortilla chips around the plate, farm fresh scrambled eggs topped with this sweet sausage, cheddar and jalepeno mango salsa. The food is AMAZING! Quality ingredients, fresh and the flavors balanced perfectly. Nothing was drenched in oil or butter or over spiced. Portions were big also. We found out about this place off of the food network and its well worth checking out, I believe they only serve breakfast and lunch.

85Dsq1alC3XBumyIcZxDnw.text: This is a cute little lunch cafe. Very cool  decor with a trendy/artsy vibe. I loved the aesthetic of the place.  I love that it is downtown. Only serves breakfast and lunch. I went around 11:00 a.m. on a weekday and was offered the lunch menu; full of healthy and organic options. By the time I was done eating an awesome free-range chicken sandwich the place was starting to get packed. The restaurants maximum occupancy is 89...so maybe not a place I would go in peak hours. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. There is a counter for single diners and tables can be moved together for larger groups.

cmuKCNX2_-tG9Gob7NDNMA.text: Been there numerous times & always made excuses for their poor customer service. Today was the absolutely last time, after speaking with the own & being told I had the option to take my business elsewhere. I'm local & I'll take my business elsewhere from now on. It's not just about having good food if your attitude tastes like crap. Good luck with your establishment.

LcIHKruUbyrdcnr8qxWJ-g.text: run don't walk to eat for the best breakfast ever.. ms. natalie the owner, clearly is a  remarkable chef who must treat her employees with utmost love and respect.. our servers are happy and wonderful.. however..those pancakes.... to die for... love love love eat......

0jP7UgWzmUefFQBVxhkQ_A.text: I sooooo love the good here...and would usually give it 5stars....  But today I sat at the "community table" and observed how long it took to be served (after someone had to tell out a table # to server...I believe it was 25 or 45)..:then I was finally seen, asked for a drink and I was already ready to order.   Got my meal super fast which was great, but then never had a refill on my water...ever...or asked for a refill.  Then I had to out out my CC in hopes to signal I was ready to pay...yes...that signal worked...A FEW mins later I was given my bill...again never asked for any more water tho.  I've usually come on the weekends and maybe it's more relaxed then, or maybe I just need to sit at a table from now on....who knows but definitely not impressed by service today.   Food 5star, service 1star...makes it a 3.

jYUV_Gd8cZAj-BES4nCxOw.text: Amazing breakfast find! We got there about 20 mins after they opened and there was no wait. The Chicken fried steak breakfast is on my top 3 chicken fried steak list. The shrimp and grits were good buuuut not on my top 5. Our waitress was great and we had a god experience but I could see how other reviews saw the Staff to be 'cold'... they aren't they're just busy and deal with a lot of crap so I don't dock points for them not putting up with your bs.

AX-KLQGyryc0h4w0mqdHKg.text: Wow, if you can make it out here, you have to, at least for breakfast.  We got the chilequiles and the pancakes, both dishes were excellent.  The pancakes had a great texture, served with maple syrup, and were massive...what else do you want?  oh some sausage, yeah it comes with that too.  Now about that sausage that came with both dishes, some of the best sausage I've ever tasted, if you like it a little sweet.  The chilequiles you just have to try, so many contrasting flavors and textures that I just can't put into words...  Too bad it's a car ride away from the strip, but maybe that just means you can eat here without a crazy wait.  And the portions are very generous, don't plan on eating lunch after breakfast here.

nLf64DNw6VXSgwdIOoZmTw.text: Went there with friends. The place was packed so one of the waitresses took our name and told us to come back after 25 minutes for a table.  When we came back (on time) the other waitress told us the kitchen was closing so we could not stay... We insisted that we were told to come back and asked to speak to management. So eventually they gave us a table. The waiter was quite obviously upset to serve us and we could tell by the looks and tone of voice. Our order was taken, the food came after 5 minutes (which I can't tell if it's good or bad...) and the rucola & asparagus salad came without asparagus. They came on a separate plate after asking for them. Bad experience, (below?) average food. Will definitely not go back nor recommend...

5NAC1f6sDqH2ewdveJGRMQ.text: So I'm gonna be super cliche and give this place 5 stars. Well deserved of course! Arriving early is a must. We went right before 11am the Monday after SuperBowl and boy did that place fill up quick in the next 10 minutes. We were seated immediately but if we came any later, we would have been waiting for 45 minutes.   I ordered the truffled egg sandwich and my buddy had the huevo motulenos, both of which were excellent. Perfect hangover food.

77JQ7PUZrzEM-hZloNAB5w.text: On our most recent trip to Vegas, we landed on a Saturday morning and our first stop after picking up the rental car was to work our mouths at eat. We wanted to be sure we didn't miss brunch! Some passengers on our flight had the same idea, because when we were finally seated after waiting a few, the couple next to us was from our very same flight! How cool! Small world!   Based on some reviews I had read, we ordered the Shrimp and Grits and Huevos Motulenos. I've never had Shrimp and Grits before, so this first experience will forever be ingrained in my memory as "holy o-m-g, where have you been all my life. How do I recreate you at home so I can eat you all day long???" The shrimp was tasty, however, a tiny bit chewy. The bacon and tomato water mixture was heavenly. I love tomato. Yum. The cheesy grits were delicious and savory. So so so good! I didn't want to give it up, but I sacrificed it so I could swap plates and eat half of the Huevos Motulenos. I thought the flavors of this dish were interesting, but good. A nice combination of tortillas, eggs, black beans and cheese plus special sauce. The sauce was not something I was used to...a little sweet mixed with a lot of savory. Overall, I would definitely return for Shrimp and Grits and try those "so fluffy I could die!" pancakes.   Excellent high-quality well-prepared tasty food at a moderate price point in a very hip and trendy space.

zOBUmwWsYA7Dy2GhjkAxTQ.text: Meh is exactly what this place is.  I don't adore the metal chairs, the neighborhood, but also can't say the food is worth the price.  Don't care if i'm not "hip", because I am able to appreciate price for quality food.    I've been here twice, ordering with a total of 6 people, and the food was never exemplary in line with the prices.    suggest a e-reservations option to reduce wait times, discount for local or using the e-reservations - just something to reward a repeat customer.    two lunches with tea/soda for more than $30 plus tip?  I consider that pricey.

te1e-p5kgjSD0OuOr2PcjA.text: Was browsing around for someplace to have brunch while in Vegas and came across this place which had great reviews and pictures of food that looked delicious. The more breakfast type items on the menu are only server up until a certain time (11:00 am I believe). For a starter, we ordered cinnamon biscuits which came topped with strawberries and blueberries. For an entree, my mom and I both had the chicken fried steak and my sister had a Caesar salad. All of the food was good and not too expensive in the end. Service is quick and friendly. They do have a sign asking all patrons to be courteous and finish in a timely manner to allow those waiting a chance to dine. I'd say it's a place worth checking out for a quick and filling bite to eat.

e-79jfX54-hzo9IbYvLJjw.text: I absolutely love this place and am so glad parts of downtown was redeveloped. Parking can be tough because it was mostly street parking from what I saw. Wait times can get pretty long so if you don't want to wait, try and go before 10am on a weekday! You must must must get the cinnamon biscuits. Those are to die for... I could eat those every day. The chicken fried steak is very hearty and tasty. It's also a big portion too. The chilaquiles was flavorful. What I liked was the tortilla chips stayed crispy and didn't become soggy. And having sausages in there was different from other chilaquiles I've had and I liked it. It definitely needed more hot sauce though but overall I enjoyed that dish more than the chicken fried steak. I recommend this place to all my friends looking for a yummy brunch restaurant with a hip atmosphere.

VxIT0Hwb0NtrRzpsW6K67w.text: Short: Food: pretty good Ambiance: cute Service: really good - lots of people working  Long:  Food: I got the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup, and my boyfriend had the - prime rib? roast beef? can't remember - special hash. The grilled cheese and soup were good, but I was disappointed by how high the bread:cheese ratio was. 2" of bread for a very thin layer of cheese. The hash was also good, but I wish the potatoes had a little more bite to them, rather than just being mushy. The COFFEE, however, is fantastic and delicious  Ambiance: I really liked the way the place was done. Felt like a casual, industrial cafe. It's not easy to pull off the steel & concrete look without looking cheap, but they nailed it. The inside of the door says "ate" (as you are exiting), which I thought was super cute  Service: There were a TON of people working. They were all friendly and responsive without being intrusive.   If I'm in downtown, I'd definitely come here again, but not sure I'd make the trek all the way from Henderson *just* to eat here, if you know what I mean.

RCb9oV-SFBu94opobaYcTA.text: Such a gem, a unique & rustic little restaurant, excellent food and decorations, the food is super delicious!

Y8lEK0adYqaU9q4jzqMc9g.text: this place is soooooo good!! It's almost the equivalent to Country Way in Fremont, California. If you haven't been there, you should. I got the pancakes. There were 3 pancakes as big as my face, and apple sauce sausage. It came with the cutest little jars especially made for Eat. My husband got corned beef hash. His was also delicious - of course, I had to try for myself! Oh! The orange juice. Omg. The orange juice is so fresh and the perfect amount of sweetness. Oh gosh. This place was bomb. Too bad it isn't open all day.

5Vrq4rGiQHUP84KrgYaxbg.text: Very hearty, but high quality good here ..love the shrimp n grits, Rueben, and dBLT sandwich.  Quaint little place downtown and always busy ..good sign.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits .. maybe the best meal here
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rueben with tomato soup..awesome

astZSk17tu0kVzATxgseUQ.text: Eat was good.    Pro-Portions aplenty, quality was amazing.  I recommend the country friend steak because of the hearty portion. (5 stars for food)  Con-we were only 3 people, but we wait 45 minutes to be seated.  We arrived at 11:30 am, Sunday. (3 stars service)

FExBe_5QkzECrJucwfk_Sg.text: The food was good; the deviled eggs were amazing and the truffle egg sandwich was good, but a little stingy with the feta. The coffee was quite good (Mothership Coffee).  The two issues I have are the restaurant space and the service.  The restaurant is a hip, urban eatery with the requisite black ceiling, hewn wood, and minimalist booths paired with vintage looking chairs.  Nice.  But it's loud.  It has a show kitchen where you can see the staff work, and the sounds coming out are to be expected. Since there are all hard surfaces (ceiling, cement floor) the sound carries, but again, that's ok.  What made it uncomfortable was the music which added to the din. We were there at opening time on Sunday morning, and the music was turned up to industrial levels. It was difficult to talk to my husband, and I missed a few things the server said. I just wish the volume was a little lower. The other issue is the service.  Our server was reasonably polite, and that's good, but there were just too many workers there at that time without enough to do, so they wouldn't give us time to enjoy our breakfast.  Our server checked back right away to see how we were doing, which I appreciate, but what really bothered me is that the check was plopped down on our table before we were half done with our meals.  She said 'No rush', but it sure felt like it. There were only four other occupied tables in the place, and no line waiting for a seat.  Three other servers refilled our coffee and water enough, but each time asked us if we wanted to-go boxes and tried to clear our plates before we were half done. I noticed it happening at another table as well.  Whatever you do, don't put down your fork and stop to savor your food because someone will  attempt to take it away from you regardless of how much is left on your plate. I would have liked to have had the opportunity to enjoy my breakfast, but the noise and the servers gave a sense of urgency to get out of there. If we had been there for an hour and was taking a table away from other people waiting, I would understand, but we weren't. We spent $48 (including tip) on breakfast for two, and were only there for about 45 minutes which included being seated, looking at the menu, ordering, eating, and drinking coffee. This isn't supposed to be a fast food joint. We might come back for the deviled eggs, but I doubt it.

dixaxuNLV6DPWXkm_wDZIg.text: I'm sure it would be a nice place to eat if I knew who on earth was my server they had about 4 different people come to my table which was annoying Oh and to top it off the guest next to me ended up walking out after he found a bug in their drink! Too bad I had already finished my meal..simply disgusted.   I would not recommend this place to anyone.

viOd0iyvVE_TH1z6XcstZw.text: Happy to report that our second visit was just as satisfying. generous portions. flavorful. I ordered their homemade corned beef hash with eggs. I'm high maintenance when it comes to eggs -- don't cringe: over hard with the yokes broken and crispy on the edges. Well, the eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash was as good as homemade. Hubby ordered chicken fried steak again. Yum. Our go to breakfast place when visiting Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. homemade corned beef hash top with eggs cooked perfectly per my request
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak.

2SeISJzE2Xgll_XZc_TKDQ.text: We waited about 20 min for two, which on a Saturday (and valentines!) isn't bad. Service was stellar! They forgot the strawberry cinnamon biscuits we ordered, (which were awesome!) but remedied it quickly. The truffled egg sandwich was fantastic, and the dwblta my boyfriend had was huge! Would definitely go back if we lived in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e-KhRzLbQxcWS-Ja8_yzpg.text: The strawberry, cinnamon, sugar biscuits are my favorite and absolutely amazing!  As well as all the other menu items-- ingredients are fresh and everything is flavorful while not being over the top.  Service is fast & friendly and the portions are filling.  The place is busy so come early or be prepared to wait

Wse7Ew66OuDKGY_zxXxtDQ.text: I came to eat, I ate...and you should too! It takes an epic "Buzz" factor to divert my attention from the glitz glamour and opulence of the Las Vegas strip. After  several locals suggested this eatery, our brunch venue decision was unanimous. The location/building is quaint at first glance however the dining room is lofty, modern, and quite comfortable. My friend and I both ordered the 2 eggs brunch (I debated between that and the shrimp & grits). My meal included 2 eggs, country potatoes, bacon, and toast all of which I devoured within minutes. The portion size was perfect and while my selection may be quite comon in most American diners, eat quickly earned the #1 spot in areas of taste, value, and individuality. Our server (thin girl w/nose ring) was extremely friendly and warm, she offered suggestions and took care of us throughout our brunch hour. Will I be back, YES. Would I suggest eat to others, Yes! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready to grub!

8gdvEOsx89yzMdA3PAunrA.text: I ordered a chicken fried steak which tasted soggy. The service is a 5/10. The food tasted like a 2/10. I could cook better eggs,roasted potatoes, and chicken fried steak at home. Everything tastes bland unless you ordered bacon. I would not recommend this place.

9j-I2vn033rd0skAwP3qUQ.text: I love the small local businesses downtown and farm to table food. Eat has a great menu for lunch and breakfast. The only thing that kills me is I always manage to arrive at 11 am, just missing breakfast. The turnover from breakfast to lunch can take up to half an hour. The wait is too long if you only have a short lunch break. Just serve the entire menu all the way through. Then again the kitchen may not be appropriate to accomadate that many options.   Anyways aside from that, pleasant staff and great food. Cool vibe too. Eat at Eat!!

1YzY0Fb8PGTetDo0KpXHQg.text: I forgot to take a picture  of the Golden pancakes  and bowl of grits.  The food is always  good here ,never had a issue. I pretty muck explored  the whole menu of food all of it is good. As far as the service  good there has been a turn around  of staff and kitchen  from when it 1st open up, which is a good thing and bad thing  . THE OWNER Natalie  has done a very good job for her, employees  and people that like to eat.

abm1n-WzShOmHka7jvFj9w.text: Wow. DELISH. I'm writing this NOT ONLY because I'm hard core procrastinating on doing the writing I'm SUPPOSED to be doing right now, but because that truffled egg sandwich was amazing. And I had a sparkling strawberry lemonade. That's the first non-alcoholic drink I've ordered in an establishment since the Reagan administration. PLUS good service. See why I had to take the time to write a review? This isn't slacking. This is important news.

eb4zvPk0QBy1QUVKLYqtHw.text: Very very disappointed... we have been going to eat ever since it open, the food was amazing, service was great and the place was very clean.  We stop going about six months ago, mainly cause we felt the food quality was nos as good.  We ordered some pancakes, which is one of our favorite dish there, but that time, they tasted stale and they were cold, we left very disappointed. Today we stoped by the restaura again, decided to give it one more try...  it was awful, for starters our waiter was not very nice, my wife ordered milk for one of our kids, and she asked if there was a chance to warm it up, "Gary" our waiter look at her like it was the most outrageous to ever ask, over all his demeanor was just condescending and not very nice.  We ordered few things, pancakes, the corn beef hash and the two eggs with potatoes and toast.  The corn beef hash was average, not too flavored, and the pancakes were burned.  To top it off, I had to take my son to the restroom and it was very dirty.  I was very disappointed and we will not be returning to that place again.  It makes me sad writing this review mainly because we really loved this place and what it represented to what's been going on in down town Las Vegas, I had recommended so many people to that place.  Too bad.

sIHik64MdHYsLbhMSLmWhg.text: Totally worth going off the strip for.  The service is fast.  The portion sizes are huge.  I got the truffled egg sandwich for breakfast. It's a large sandwich and comes with roasted potatoes.  The potatoes aren't greasy and the truffle flavor definitely comes through.  I will definitely come back on my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast: Two eggs, bacon, potatoes and english muffin.

PsUBw01cMrmP9iYy-Ic0Dg.text: I love "Eat". The only problem is that it can be difficult to get a table. The place is popular and the line, waiting to get in, can be long

pSh9ecgvEjACjw40jvMVfg.text: Overhyped!  We ordered the passion fruit tea, truffle egg sandwich and the grilled cheese/tomato soup combos. Wasn't horrible, but not "all that and a bag of chips."   Passion tea was fragrant and unsweetened. Truffle egg sandwich was okay. Eggs were fluffy. Some of the potatoes and onion slices were nice and brown. Griled cheese was big (thick bread). the tomato soup reminded me of the tomato sauce on pizza.  Nothing to write home about. Tried it, not worth coming back for.   Service was decent. Had to pay for street parking ($1/hr), then we walked to the Container Park.

lwpSk5CkzX1O8V9gxUaarQ.text: Very good breakfast. We ordered the biscuits, pancake, truffled egg sandwich, and spinach salad.  Everything was great! Best thing on the plate was the breakfast potatoes... seriously the best cooked potatoes, soft on the inside, super crunchy outside. Just a quick 10 min drive from the vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits. Um yes!

q6WKo2mgMznFjbmpt9BzRw.text: Been so excited to try this new place! We mapped our way there and ended up in a sketchy neighborhood and parked on the street. (Bring your change for the meters). We were ready for the adventure.   We were seated immedietly. The menus were small but we both found vegetarian options that were delicious! The ginger ale was to die for as well! The food came out very fast and the server was very nice.   I will be back! Not 5 stars due to price, it was a little spendy and it said my meal came with the side on the menu then I was told when I got my food that it didn't. Just little hick ups-wonderful place over all!

Oq944BO79_4uhUs2J-UvtQ.text: On the unassuming corner of 7th and Carson Street in Downtown Vegas resides an old institutional blue apartment building which was once surrounded by undesirables and derelicts.  Now it's surrounded by a weekend brunch bunch, eagerly awaiting a table into a place simply called eat.  And to that one syllable name, I offer an equal one syllable description that says it all: good.      After running a 10k in a 80's get-up, a friend, who also ran it but didn't bother dressing up (because she's smart like that) suggested we have breakfast at the nearby eat.  I'm always up for exploring new places since I never get out.  She and her husband were not new to eat and so they suggested that I try the Huevos Motulenos.  I read the ingredients: 2 eggs, red and green chili, black beans, peas, feta, sauteed bananas on corn tortillas.  The discriminating, reserved me would have said, eh, maybe some other time.  But since I was already sticking out like a sore thumb dressed in neon pink leggings, teased hair looking like Madonna circa 1984, I decided, yeah, let's continue this wild new adventure and let me motorboat that dish.    And motorboat it I did.  I probably would've licked the plate, but I didn't want to look like an animal.  My friends stuck with the traditional pancake short stack and had chicken sausage with it.  They look great, but not nearly as adventurous as the Huevos Motulenos.    A band started to set up while we were still eating.  They moved perfectly good seating to make room for the live entertainment.  I've nothing against live entertainment, but it limits the seating to an already small cafe.  I'm glad we got there before the rush because when we left, people were outside waiting to get in.  They may have already solved that problem with setting up some patio seating, or at least it appeared that they were going to at the time when I went.  But honestly, it's Vegas, it's hot and getting hotter and it's doubtful anyone wants patio seating.    To sum it up: if I had to wait, especially if there was a live band playing, I'd probably go some place else.  If there was no wait, I would gladly eat at eat again.

nO9e6pW5RJE6mQJNfn1u-g.text: I have been here for lunch twice now. It's a smaller restaurant which makes you very in tune with the atmosphere.  The service I have gotten has been prompt and very approachable. The food comes out fast, and you can definitely see that they care about what they are serving here. I've had the Reuben, thick toast, not soggy with dressing, it was hands down one of the best reubens I have had the pleasure of eating.    I cannot recommend this place enough. Oh, and try the cinnamon biscuits with the fruit, your taste buds will thank you.

oDJBx0pWoAl7jcIV4VF5xA.text: Hands down one of the best places in town for brunch. Their menu is small but everything is delicious! My fav is the shrimp and grits followed by the fluffy, buttery pancakes. Mmmm my mouth is watering. And it's totally worth the drive if you're in Henderson like me.

9Am043Lp9g_R6K-VgysK5g.text: Excellent find! Friendly and efficient staff, sufficient selection on the menu, very flavorful food with large servings, cool vibe but unpretentious...excellent way to end our trip to Vegas.  I will be spreading the word that this place is a must!

eHUWwN4t7HgAOaerO0Ub8A.text: AWESOME! Cute place, great service, yummy food. The potatoes and eggs Benedict were so great! And the coffee is amazing.

MY639U14hBncqqkCRc2B5w.text: The cinnamon biscuits are a must have! Just wish they wouldn't leave the stems on the strawberries. My BF had the corn beef hash and said it was delicious and loved the toast that came with it! We will definitely be back soon.

HFtrLh4EV9PxzBGe6lCD8Q.text: BEST PANCAKES AND CHICKEN SAUSAGE i've ever had. I know that sounds crazy, right?? It's True. I don't know what kind of magic they add to that pancake batter, but it's damn good. Upon arriving, we waited about 20 minutes for a table. No complaints there when considering that we were downtown on a Sunday. Customer sevice was excellent. Food was excellent . I'll definitely be a repeat customer. Love it. YAAAAAAAY EAT!

PPtEAWtwvBci1FR3J91T8A.text: This place is hidden underneath what looks like an apartment complex. I went there for lunch with a few friends and was plesantly surprised at how nice the inside of the restaurant was.   We were seated promtly and the chef was there overseeing everything. The food was average. I ordered the posole and shared the roast beef sandwich. The sandwich was great but there was not enough meat for the bread. I had half the sandwich and then had to leave the other half of the bread alone since there wasn't enough meat to eat with it.   The only downside to this place is that it gets EXTREMLY loud when the restaurant is full. When we first arrived the place didn't have that many customers which was why we were seated promptly. Unfortunately when more customers arrived the louder the place got. It was also almost as if they turned up the music as well making it that much louder since people had to talk over the music. I felt I had to scream to my friend who was sitting next to me just so that she can hear me. :-(   I will be coming back again, hopefully they will have addressed the noise issue and mabe give me a sandwich that has a better filling to bread ratio.

9SXswQuR8yMwWUMfvrV2-A.text: While here for a friend's wedding, I chose to stay downtown rather than the Strip. I thought I'd miss out on some good meals, but I was wrong. My hotel's concierge recommended "eat" so I looked online and found great reviews. From the time I was greeted by the hostess, to when I was served by Ali, my waitress, to when I shook the hand of the manager as I walked out, I felt as if I were the only patron in the place. Clearly, I am no VIP yet I was treated like an important customer. Yes, the food was great (loved the Eggs Benedict!) but the service was fantastic. Thanks to the hard working cooks and staff for a marvelous Sunday brunch!

NwuSoIKQE8nargirJkO9ww.text: Would give zero if I could. Dumbass hostess was seating all the white people and hipster douche bags before people who were waiting there for longer. The hostess then had the nerve to tell us our table was ready, and I can clearly see there were a lot of open tables and told us oh wait another five minutes. One or two decent employees, but if you're not white I don't recommend you coming here. Menu looked decent but for the prices and short menu I expected better reception and decent human treatment. Places like this might serve you better if you walk in with a "make america great again" hat or dressed like a hipster douche. Even upon upsetting my wife the hostess was still rude and luckily for her I have more class otherwise I would have cussed her out and started a scene. Manager I'm calling you out, get your shit together, train your staff better and learn how to treat people of all ethnicities and backgrounds better than this sorry ass mess of a restaurant!

2ShbLnSmU7EIolFvxLz8NA.text: TOTALLY recommend to anyone who is brunching in Vegas! AMAZING food and FAST service. Everything is super tasty and great quality, and overall atmosphere is really cool, too. Try the truffle egg sandwich!!!!

gomyYunCFftfZyvFev3yNQ.text: Great service!  I really enjoyed the grilled cheese with turkey bacon, but I have had better tomato soup and would recommend trying a different side.

c1wOCB33Ykyep0qp5xWKFQ.text: I live around the corner and LOVE this place. Pancakes from heaven and great specials too. They have vegetarian options and lots of sides to choose from.

Mkr6T6A9X926DYF0oOHvmg.text: Food looks great but potato's cold and onion uncooked. Bacon and eggs fresh.  Coffee great.  Needs to prepare potato's fresh and serve hot

dLjWEa6xz4cQ79RlOmjXNQ.text: Thanks for seating us outside on those hideous chairs without being able to accommodate for a vegetarian so that we can get up and leave to go eat at VegeNation with peaceful, live music and an amazing brunch.  I have never been to any other Las Vegas establishment that had a manager approach us and not even try to accommodate any of my allergy or dietary concerns.  It is definitely not our fault that you do not have enough cooking space to accommodate a simple request to use a separate pan. I mean, really?! No room for a pan?! No time to quickly clean the grill?...and no, I do not want a salad for brunch or a $7 oatmeal that I can make at home for 50 cents. Thanks for nothing, as we will not be back.

TjfzQYsRt6i7-C3bItxYng.text: Amazing food tucked away in the downtown district. We had to do a yelp search to find it and it was totally worth the effort. My friends and I stopped in here after running the Sprinkler Sprint 5K and we were ravenous.   Very quaint place, small and interesting menu. Caters to vegans and vegetarians which I love. I ordered the Huevos motulenos which was quite good a little sweet, a little spicy. Served with potatoes which I didn't really like, and a sauce that had black beans and whole peas. The peas seemed a little odd in this dish, like they were out of place. But... still very interesting meal and I ate most of it. It also had tofu pieces in it which were a nice addition.  My friends had the fried chicken which was an enormous portion. They also ordered a side of pancakes for all of us to try. I have never been big on pancakes but I tried these, and HOLY cow these are melt-in-your-mouth pancakes. I can't even describe them other than fluffy. Really good. We will all definitely come back to try other things on the menu, great service and amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos motulenos
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes!

eSZ-DCQPCrHrexsbcwmw-g.text: Had the arugula chicken salad, balsamic dressing and tomato soup. Both dishes were delicious! The next time I vacation in Vegas I'm for sure stopping by!

-kT8-hZdfm8rNELgR_0MtA.text: * WALK IN ONLY. for some reason yelp says it's appointment only but that's not True. Head on over, put in your name and get ready for awesome pancakes.   Best breakfast spot in town. The menu is straight to the point, not to limit your choices, but to assure you that every item on the menu was created with care. I personally LOVE the pancakes and the grilled cheese. I've never had better pancakes before. The grilled cheese is served with huge slices of the most delicious and thick bread and a fantastic tomato soup. I'm honestly getting hungry just typing this.   The owner takes her job very seriously. You won't find a rude waiter in the place, and she makes sure of it. She's always around making sure things are running smoothly no matter how busy it gets. And trust me, those pancakes really do draw a crowd.

ZaOAPW79gXr4tNYb15gWbw.text: Hipster place that's located in the heart of Downtown Las Vegas. Did we have to wait? No. Came here around 8:30am on a Sunday morning. No wait at all as we were seated right away. Service was good as we were served right away as well. I ordered their Truffled Egg Sandwich and wow what a great choice I had made. Avocado, truffled scrambled eggs with potatoes on the side. The sandwich tasted really good! The egg melts in your mouth with that truffle. I gave half to my wife which I regretted but sharing is caring and happy wife = happy life. Just make sure you come early if you want to avoid the wait. You will need to pay for parking on the streets as they don't have their own parking structure.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Egg Sandwich

qZBCKjHHxbQLdfUjAxcBcw.text: Maybe the best grits and chile (that's the New Mexican type, for those of you in the know) I've ever had. Why a 4 star? Upcharge for a bit of extra chile. That's just mean.

d51MceawbtVoj-lv4RvGTw.text: I came here solo for brunch on a saturday and it was extremely busy.  I had to wait about 20 minutes to wait for a spot at the kitchen counter to open up for 1.  The groups were waiting more in the range of 30 minutes.  It is a popular weekend spot and for good reason.  I ordered the truffled egg sandwich with avocado and it was cooked to perfection.  The ciabatta bread alone was a must try, and accompany that with the fresh ingredients to create a great meal.  And sitting at the counter was very scenic as well, watching the chef work her magic in a very small, intimate kitchen overlooking the restaurant.  The menu is very limited (at least for brunch) but my meal was delicious.  I will definitely be back to try something else off the menu.

PddKolL4paqMJVCSIno55g.text: We specifically went downtown so we could have breakfast at Eat after reading the rave reviews on Yelp. In all honesty, I have to agree with the glowing reviews. What a great place! The main section of the menu is only available until 11am (the second time we went, sadly, we missed the deadline). Both days there was a line -- a testament to the quality of the food. The servers were so friendly, efficient, and worked well together. The food was delivered quite quickly, was delicious, and came in huge portions.  On the first day, we sat at the community table to get seated quicker. We were seated with a couple from LA, who were in Vegas for a wedding. They said EAT was their favorite place for breakfast and they always eat there when they come to Las Vegas. They gave us some great suggestions of what to eat before they left. We started with their recommendation of the cinnamon biscuits covered in strawberry compote. They were even more delicious than they sound. Oh my! Then my wife and I split an order of The Huevos Motulenos, which consisted of two fried eggs w/ red & green New Mexican chili, black beans, peas, feta, & sauteed bananas on a corn tortilla. Different, yet delectable.   Before we were served our Huevos Motulenos the server asked if four new people could join our community table. Of course we said, "Yes", and soon engaged them in conversation, it turned out that one of the four was Tim Olyphant, the star of the TV shows "Justified", and "Deadwood". That was a great breakfast!

C84CgKUEBOz0w5zL9GiZ2g.text: We ate here two mornings in a row while staying in downtown Las Vegas. The breakfast was out of this world funky little place cool music and great service. The grits were better than any I've ever had. Worth checking out it's a short walk from the Golden Nugget and Fremont

NX9QcUPV_56tN8I56BM_OQ.text: There's a lot of good here.  Here's the short list of amazing things, in order of awesomeness.  Green Chile Pozole:  It's cold.  You need soup.  This is some of the best soup you'll ever eat.  Anything with Bacon:  Their Bacon is KILLER.  Super meaty, cooked just right.  You aren't going wrong with this side.  Chicken Sandwich:  Sounds simple.  And it is, but it's PERFECT.  Pastrami Reuben:  Ok, not the most traditional Reuben you'll ever eat, but it's delicious.  Deviled Eggs:  You have NEVER had a deviled egg like this.  It's amazeballs  Grilled Cheese:  The way this is served, with the GIANT pieces of toast, is totally ridiculous.  But don't let that stop you. It's delicious.  Skip:  Cinnamon Biscuits with fruit: this is the only dish I have had here that I was uninspired by.  It just didn't work for me.  Potatoes as a side:  They're fine, just boring.

iXEan1HBLXS7pIu_zWV4ow.text: The setting for this place looks like the streets of San francisco or the cafes in Manhattan. This is a cute little eatery great to hang out with friends for brunch. I ordered the roast beef sandwich and my other friends had the veggie burger and the chicken sandwich.   What I thought to look really simple there was tremendous flavor in every bite. The tomato soup that my friend had was very delicious with tons of the buttery garlic flavor leveled to the extreme. Not bad for your wallet because pricing was very reasonable. Our small stomachs couldn't handle eating the other half of the sandwich so we took the rest Togo. Wait time isn't too long because it was a Monday. I bet weekends are jam packed.   We are def coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmm

CplM9-iAUAS2CeErJ3CI3A.text: Visiting for work and found this on yelp. The photos and the reviews looked good especially for the huevo motulenos.  Yummm!!!   The potatoes were crispy and tasty.  And the eggs, black beans, over the tortilla, and salsa blended very well together.    You got a pleasant sweet surprise with the fried plantains underneath.  I liked the uniqueness of that extra ingredient.   I devoured my meal and cannot wait to return here and bring my husband.

Q55D_qIc0lCck_JkMBrwfA.text: Great food  Fast Friendly Service Loved the fried deviled eggs:) The only part I didn't like was when our food was served the same time as the appetizers kinda had that rushed feeling.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FnI78cf8aOsTHma4VEUChQ.text: Definitely not as good as the first time we are here The shrimp and grits were very watered down and barely edible The truffle egg sandwich was delicious though loved the fresh squeezed oranges juice but a larger selection. Of beverages would be great

xfJAAFFkSfgMnbKtyir8yg.text: Being in Vegas and not wanting to eat at the Casino when we got in, I had bookmarked Eat after reading all the great reviews from LV Elite Yelpers and had to check this place out. Well I was truly glad that I got our group to let me choose the Saturday breakfast. (They actually had no choice I was driving) Eat is roughly about a 5 minute drive from the California Hotel making it really convenient. Waiting only 10 minutes after we arrived at 9:00am we were seated in this nice trendy hipster place in downtown. The sound level was a little loud with the music and people chatting but it didn't deter us from enjoying the food and decor at Eat. Some of the items we ordered: *Beignets yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... Great item to share, jam and mascarpone made this dish yums. *Eggs Benedict with turkey bacon and spinach: yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... I swear the hollandaise sauce must be one of the best I ever had! *Pancakes with chicken apple sausage: My friend took one bite and busted out a huge smile. I got to sample the pancakes, melt in your mouth and a slight crunch on the edges of the pancakes made this dish a must. *Eggs with smoked bacon and smashed potatoes: Smoked bacon was that standout of this dish. *Outside seating available *Street Parking *Friendly Service *Eat is a must for breakfast when staying in Downtown*

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign in door when leaving
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

QmbE3TyMoY6nz3_mVrCIYg.text: I gave this place a try twice with a coworker before leaving this review. We were seated right away both times (yay) but waited at least 10-15 minutes before the server acknowledge our presence. The place isn't big at all so even if you're busy you can at least say hello to your table!  The first time, I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with potato salad. The sandwich is ginormous and 90% bread and 10% cheese. While the cheese was yummy, you could barely taste it with all that frikkin bread. Should be more cheesy in my opinion. Shrug. But to each his own. And the server gave me chips instead of potato salad. When I asked her to bring me the salad, she seemed perturbed. Geez! It was your mistake, not mine.  The second time, we waited 15 minutes to order, very frustrating. Especially when you only have an hour for lunch. I ordered the two eggs over easy with chive potatoes and bacon. For $11 I expected something goooood. WRONG. My eggs arrived well over medium (no gooey yolk to dip my bacon in, booooo.) The potatoes were overcooked and maybe four bites worth, and the bacon way too crispy. Guess the cook forgot about my breakfast and just let it sit there overdone.   When I asked for jam for my toast, again the server seemed hassled by my request. Is it just me? Do I have a booger on my face? I didn't ask for new eggs because I don't like to complain (nor do I risk saliva or snot in my food). Very disappointed at both of my visits.  This place has let me down twice in guest experience and food. I will never go again. Overrated.

tOvI26KzQEgff0Jeq6tDOQ.text: Average service. Average food. Overpriced for what you get. The "truffles" on the sandwich were nothing more than regular ol canned mushrooms. Eggs were powdered and not real. Bread and potatoes were both greasy and soggy with no crisp. BLT was nothing special considering the cost, tomato soup was really over garlicy and oversalty. Would not recommend, considering IHOP is the same exact thing but cheaper. This is one of those places that likes to call themselves "botique" because they have framed art on the walls so they can justify overcharging you for cheap food. Also our waiter wasnt very warm either, kinda gave that vibe like your bother him.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DwBLT
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Truffled&#34; egg sandwich

nym3F6NTzf1NPVHTOlenuw.text: I went here today for a lunch meeting today and all I have to say is YUM! I had the veggie burger without a bun and the tomato salad on the side. My colleague got the killer grilled cheese with avocado and enjoyed every bite!   Everything was super fresh and delish! I highly recommend trying this place out.

yCmf1tAnqgyV77zeyGsXvg.text: The portions are great. The food is so tasty you can't stop eating. Best date for a breakfast.

hAx1_hWE4aZux91-xUy8qw.text: Woke up early looking for a good breakfast spot that wouldn't be filled with blinged out snowbirds, tourists in nascar gear, or dumbasses from Cali sporting their affliction gear.  Checked out yelp and was rewarded with this gem.  Short walk from the gold nugget, short wait, nice people.  Good breakfast, nice space, great prices. Only downside is no bloody Mary's :-  Also, it's nice to be in a building in Vegas that doesn't stink like an ashtray.  Thank you!!

wBlrGeQd-HjR1r2LKJWbGg.text: Another great breakfast at Eat. Having the chicken fried steak and eats. Sorry it's been awhile since my last visit.

r0HmlxHw_AuiyA0W9iJJ8A.text: This is a great addition to downtown Las Vegas that I really, really liked.  Across the street on the back side of Container Park it is ideal located.  The interior decor was great . . . from the paintings, to the wall art, to the hanging guitars . . . it was a pleasant change from normal.  I ordered the Corned Beef Hash and poached eggs . . . which were amazing . . . the beef, potatoes, and peppers were cooked perfectly . . . and the contract off the poached eggs, made this dish a True delight.  The service was a little slower than I would have like . . . and that was the reason for the deduction on one star . . . but this place could very easily be a five star.

wygDQ9zufGOPweB3XZF5lQ.text: This place was better than expected. Sure, the neighborhood might be a little...questionable, but eat. makes sure to delight. I ordered the grilled cheese, and BLT so my best friend and I could try two things and we still aren't sure which we liked better. I'm going to go back soon so I can try their breakfast menu. I wish they served breakfast all day considering they are only open till 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

MVJoK1jv1Ggxx3CO9DF9sA.text: The food, the service, the experience. These three things keep us coming back! If we came to Vegas just for the Deviled Eggs and the hospitality at Eat...I would be happy with that.  Thank you Chef Natalie and your customer service driven team for ensuring our second experience was very memorable.

fqwREqI65sYxhS9OGZhPug.text: Great restaurant. I went for brunch with friends and will definitely be back. The portions were large, the staff was friendly, and the food was really good. Try the deep fried deviled eggs! The only downside was no alcohol but we totally forgot about that once we started eating.

WYbU-kVuV5sgEoa9u9Gu3w.text: Great food, it was our first time for breakfast and the food was delicious. Great service and ambiance. We will come back next time in Vegas.

2oAlu6mXEFGf1L_furB_rQ.text: How could bfast be better?  No way!  Excellent attentive service.  Wonderful food options. Beautiful decor and set up.  Across the street from Container Park.  Right in the heart of the food renaissance in downtown LV.  Best culinary breakfast I've had in a long while.  Not cheap but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eat in all its splendor
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles to die for
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Posike!

3vQ4SXhek4Bd3H74j1JQxQ.text: First off, the food-- - Deviled Eggs: AMAZING! Best deviled eggs I've ever had.  - corn beef hash: also delicious. The food is really good here!  The Service-- - The hostess was nice and sat us quickly.  - Our waiter was super friendly. He makes up for the bad experience. However, he did not check on us at all once our entrees came. Although, he was charismatic about serving us.  - The Manager: absolutely rude. Being from out of town, we stopped by Dutch Brothers for some coffee. We brought it in not thinking about it at all. Many of the waiters commented on how much they love our coffee. So when the manager came around and said "You can have your coffee in here but you can't drink it," we thought he was joking and laughed. He goes on to say "I'm not joking. It's a law. You can't have it in here." It is an understanding rule, but we were so put off by it because of how rude he said it. If he would have been kind and humble about it, we would have been fine with it and would have complied. Instead, he decided to be an asshole about it. He went on throughout the meal with checking on other guest but not once did he come to us.   The food was great. The hostesses and the waiter service was great. The manager...he was an asshole. As much as I want to give 4 stars for the food, the manager killed my experience. I would recommend this place to others strictly for the food, but will warn them about the Hitler manager.

_dQSFFFaO1j7Un6eE03yJQ.text: Whoa...This place is legit! I had my doubts, but those were all removed after we began eating.  We got into Eat around 9:30 and were seated in around 10 minutes. The ambiance and decor was cool. The setting for kids will work, but I wouldn't say ideal. The community table is a nice idea or even eating at the bar.  I ordered the corned beef hash with cheese and avocados. My wife had the truffled egg sandwich.  This was arguably one of the best corn beef hashes I've had in a restaurant. My wife was equally impressed with her truffled egg sandwich. We also ordered a pancake on the side and was very impressed. Gary, our waiter, suggested we eat this while it was still warm, great tip Gary, thanks! The pancake was perfect! My only complaint would have to be the coffee. I normally would take away a star for this, but the food was so incredible I can't.  We will definitely make this a stop every time  we are in Vegas!

Iwpk61miNDd3DH0J72j9qw.text: Fun and yummy - but a lot of large carb portions on and with the dish and my tofu scramble was the smallest thing next to my TOWER of Toast and 2lb potato side! Coffee is delicious and pancakes pretty good too.

HtaBgzwBlZ4QbVGyC-ZPXg.text: Pretty disappointing, although this may be decent for Las Vegas cuisine. Checked reviews, so we had good expectations. Three of us, three fairly ordinary dishes, nothing great, nothing special. My arugula salad was supposed to include oven roasted tomatoes and whole almonds, both of which were missing. The staff had no interest when I mentioned the missing ingredients and our waiter was certainly not the least bit friendly. Don't bother.

FpsKwgbFECmgut9qdZvvwA.text: I loved this place! The portions served were perfect. the food had so much flavor and the pricing was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits with strawberry compote.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos motulenos. Very delicious an explosion of flavor.

lCcG5mVztCBJvp3e1p6SRQ.text: So this is what the new downtown is all about. My friends and I usually stay on or near the strip, but for this trip we went downtown because we kept hearing a lot of blah blah blah, about how much it has changed. We walked one morning from our hotel to EAT. It's about a 10 minute walk. EAT. is a prime example of what the new downtown can and will be in the future if all goes well. This little place gets busy, but it's worth the wait. I got the chicken fried steak, delicious and well seasoned. The toast they serve is about an inch think which is great if you love bread. The server was attentive, but she did seem a little overwhelmed the day we went. I saw the owner there chatting with regulars. If downtown continues to offer up similar types of places, I may be spending more time in the area to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Keep up the good work.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak breakfast. Delicious.

htUVtXrso4BaY2AeL8BDkw.text: My stomach was hungry and my hopes were high when we stopped at eat. for breakfast on a Saturday morning. We waited 15 minutes for a table, which wasn't bad, but after that we waited even longer before someone finally took our order... After waiting even more time we finally received our food and thankfully it was worth the wait. The Huevos motelenos was vey good and had an excellent flavor and the pancakes were fluffy and delicious with rich, maple syrup. If the service had been better eat. would be a solid five stars.

vro_22cz8BY2DnPsfK8RaA.text: Lovely breakfast foods! The waffles, pancakes, and bacon were the best I have had in Vegas.

yKUSDk5zYDEFEOCNP3oC1w.text: Oh my. I'm still dreaming of this food days later.   Went on a quick weekend trip to Vegas and after googling good breakfast/brunch places we decided to eat at Eat. The menu has a lot of personality -"eggs known to make a giraffe dance" and "really good pickles"- AND it had great reviews online.   I was a bit worried because it was located in old downtown. I was born and raised in Vegas and that area was always quite sketch. BUT I have to say things are totally changing down there and it's actually super cool! We felt completely safe although there are still reminders of the old downtown.   We went to brunch around noon on a Sunday. There were a lot of pay to park options near but they were all taken so we parked on a street south of Eat by Las Vegas Academy. Parking was M-Sat so we were good! We waited about 15-20 minutes and were immediately seated. One girl waiting in line was holding a Donut Bar box. Smelled amazing and we wish we would have stopped there as well but they closed at noon. So many other fun eateries nearby as well as the Container Park! Fun area.    Service was prompt! Background music was fantastic! It is a bit hipster but the place just has a fun vibe. I got the Dwblta sandwich with the tomato soup and my friend got the Truffle Egg Sandwich. My sandwich was bomb!! Big sourdough slices of bread with chipotle mayo dipped in a homemade soup with a bite was . Great portions as well. I couldn't finish my plate but I really wanted too! When all was said and done each plate was $15-16 bucks. Totally worth it. Can't wait til I can come back to this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ddwblta Sandwich w/Tomato Soup

wkQy4T5eHIyPFFUCoGYhKg.text: The absolute BEST breakfast in Las Vegas. The pancakes are like giant fluffy pillows to comfort you after a long ass road trip. They're soft and delightful on the inside, whilst the outside is crispy and flavorful. Just a wonderful experience. My servers name was Diana and she was lovely.

Z-ohr-IrsSOYJeTE52dNFA.text: Came here for brunch before heading home from a weekend at Vegas. We had a party of 9 and it took about 45 minutes to get seated. They weren't able to put tables together so we got split to 2 groups of 4 and 5. Many of my friends were looking at the menu online and felt kind of limited to its options but our friend had chosen it because there was something vegan for her. There were things on the menu we were all set to order but saw that it was only available until 11am so that brought our options down. I did see some people ordering eggs Benedict's but didn't see it on the menu so if you do want that, just ask the waiters and they should be able to put the order in for it!  That being said, I got the traditional Benedict that was $12-13 with potatoes on the side. I love potatoes and theirs was pretty good. They also had chicken instead of the bacon which is $3 more and since it wasn't on the menu, my friend didn't know and was sad he had to pay extra. The hollandaise was flavorful and I liked the hint of lemon and appreciate that it wasn't overpowering. The egg was cooked nicely as well. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp with grits and didn't really enjoy it and had me try it. It didn't have any flavor and I felt bad for him but he didn't want to order anything else. Overall, this place is okay but I'm going to give it another star because of its ambiance and how my friends and I still had a great time together.

0Z1WCzXmQciwPKPv42wFnw.text: Freemont street has struck out two for two. Food was delicious however it was a challenge to get service.    Waitress was a very testy, not sure if it was not a good day for her but a warm welcome was not provided. Tried to order the brunch Fried chicken they were out. It was 11:07 am. Um what? Why? Fine, ordered the Huevos Motulenos and Chilaquiles. Food came out quick no complaints there. Then we ran out of coffee and water. Our mistake I guess. Plenty of people walked by and no one took notice.   Three stars is low for the quality of food and quick service. It was the service and waitresses lack of a smile that took a star our from a solid four star review. We are not local, we were visiting, we will not come back. Nacho Daddy down the street was of a much higher quality food and service. Recommend check that place out, closer to Freemont street near White Castle.

cDFW1eP9fSpkaVyErYjpEQ.text: Not a big fan of the deep fried eggs, but the blt was delicious.  Lemonade was way too sweet. Service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. blt and tomato soup

IVef-bs6QhzwBODa3GUuWg.text: Swing by here for some Sunday morning brunch since I was in the Freemont area.   The one positive thing was the service was tentative. The food on the other hand, not so good.  We tried the new Mexican style dish that has an odd name which was a tortilla with red and green chili sauce and bananas. This was not a good combination at all. I almost got sick after the first bite.  Next I opted with something simple which was the chicken sausage and pancakes. It came with one small link of sausage and 3 large golden pancakes. The pancakes was average and drowning and very cake like consistency in the middle. The sausage was decent but there was only one small link.  Skip this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes and apple sausage. Meh
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wierd muchango dish.. don&#39;t get it!! Gross

D-_7yZp5hm0BWvCHvhH8jA.text: What did the evil chicken lay?  Deviled Eggs!  Please, please, please let your mind be blown and try the fried, yes fried, devilled eggs! (La'Kat's deviled eggs are known to make giraffes dance.)  Pretty much anything you try here will be good and the restaurant is cozy, modern and the staff is friendly.  What more can you ask for?  BONUS:  Its walking distance from Freemont area!

raIgLSV6HFa2oIEeQg1zog.text: This is the cutest place! This was my 1st time eating corn beef hash and it was amazing!! EAT was very busy when we was there but our food was out in less then 10 minutes. Our server was great as well. Nothing to complain about at all!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash f

avppqxhlsJZjfGXkSKS66w.text: Super friendly, great vibe. First time... just got the pancake Breakfast. Good apple wood sausage and we had three stacks of pancakes. Flavor was fine, some a little under cooked and others over cooked. I'll give a try again because the other food looked terrific.

z-I65Ucr3lm0M1Aq_9hfGg.text: The food was good but it was very overpriced for breakfast in my opinion. We spent over $50 with no alcohol for 2 adults and a 4 year old. Their pancakes were very delicious especially with strawberries on top. The portions are large so I probably could have shared my pancakes with my son. The service is superb and my water glass never was empty, which I always appreciate.

cbyoqLZHWDS77l6b3-8Zog.text: EAT!!!!! While looking up Eater-Vegas' top breakfast spots, this place was recommended & the name alone intrigued me to check it out.  Only open for breakfast/brunch, Eat serves up a quality breakfast using fresh ingredients. I recommend sitting at the bar, where you can see the action unfold in front of you. I recommend the New Mexico themed huevos motelenos with New Mexico chiles, black beans, and two eggs over easy.

56GDnxpi0s36MOJGoyg0lQ.text: This used to be my "go to" breakfast/brunch indulgence when in Vegas.  As with most restaurants that start popular, the quality control and service took a nose dive.   So I decide to order my staple; pancakes!  Used to be the best in Vegas so my mouth was watering.   Until they arrived literally within one minute of me ordering (I was  sitting at the kitchen counter).  I asked how this could happen and was told by a rude flippant waitress, whom professed to be the manager, that they make them ahead of time and they're "okay."   I then saw the pile of pancakes sitting back there on the counter, cold.     Mine were so cold the butter on top never melted.  I brought this to the "manager's" attention and she didn't care as there are too many other fools in line waiting to pay money for poor food and service.    Save yourself.....go to the freezer section of your grocery store, buy some frozen pancakes, pop 'em in the toaster and avoid the bad attitude eating old food that can just be warmed up.    Sad.....very sad.   AVOID THIS PLACE!! There are far better places in Vegas that care about their food and quality.  Find them and go there. Great food exists in Vegas, and you can tell this place is declining as it used to be listed consistently as number one.  Now it's getting pushed down the list for a reason.    Goodbye Eat....thanks for the memories.

7DnMqq7KokugxMYWWkhh2A.text: Well, let me start of with everything in this place is amazing! The food, the vibe and the price. I started off with deviled eggs which are life changing! The deep fried egg and secret sauce on top with the bacon just wow! Personally the sandwich was great! Truffles egg sandwich was amazing! Like butter in my mouth rich in flavor and very fulfilling then chive potatoes are to die for! The eggs Benedict are just beyond words! Super tasty and filling! Last I ordered the pancake and it was amazing! Fluffy and not overpowering when eating it. Dissolves greatly in my mouth and their maple syrup tops it off for great flavor! The coffee is a 10/10 and the orange juice is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Proper chicken Benedict
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich

QXY_TXiU1-SJ1FUeoQfikg.text: The truffle breakfast sandwich was hands down the best sandwich i have ever eaten in my life. I am a very picky eater, this place rocks

OEONZjmzhIOZZFea_ybiCw.text: Definitely worth going downtown from the strip.   The best pancakes, by far, I have ever eaten.  As a senior citizen, I have eaten a lot of pancakes in my day. When they arrived, I was cautious because they were thick, which can mean something so dry there is not enough butter or syrup to choke them down.  These were crisp on the outside, soft and fluffy inside.  So delicious they did not require anything.  They are served with real maple syrup which is unnecessary.  Just yummmmmm.

58za7LZUAU9ZY4FwxTCimg.text: Service is ok and menu is to small. They start off nice and get your food but after that you have to flag someone (if they dont pretend not to see you) down for a refill or your check. If I have a choose I wont be going back.

P-G119hzlIfgdeHTC_q2PA.text: Food was good until I had started to eat my potatoes which were not freshly cooked. I had 2 extremely hard pieces that were not chewable in them and I thank god that I did not break a teeth. I told the waitress and she pretty much brushed it off. My first and last time going.

RjUksreIMHB9VvCzF0PmHA.text: A generous 4/5 as our food was pretty salty, but we had only a couple items and great service overall.   We ordered the deviled eggs per other Yelpers recommendations and they were delish! Crispy, savory and would order again  We also shared the grilled cheese- thiccc sourdough bread and super salty tomato soup. Their soup seemed to be a signature item so I asked the server if it's normally that salty that is inedible. He just said he'd tell chef and took item off our tab.   Great location downtown, good service and cute ambiance- that said with all the breakfast spots I'm apt to try a new spot versus returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YAZm9ykmA_4oJJDWJ5L9lA.text: I'm surprised that this place has such good reviews perhaps they were just having an off day when we went. For one 4 waitresses kept asking us if we were ready to order as if they were in such hurry but then when we asked for the check at the end it took them forever. We ordered the chilaquiles and truffle egg sandwich. On their menu it states that they don't substitute but I figured I'd ask maybe they would say yes. So we requested pouched eggs w the chilaquiles and over easy on the sandwich. They agreed but did not deliver. The chilaquiles came w scrambled and the sandwich came with hard fried. They asked if we wanted to add avocado to our ordered and the avocados on both our plates were rotten. They took off 1 of the avocado from the bill and ended up not charging us for our drinks so there is always that.   See pictures of the rotten avocados and scrambled and hard fried egg.
