-8Y7L5H_1VBowazFinIfWA.text: Second time eating here. Worth the wait and the hype! Delicious food at great prices. We've tried half the menu between all our party with zero complaints. The pancakes are my favorite with a side of chive potatoes! So good!!

gVWdbJ9QgfAQjTREDk2Pbw.text: Good food. We went for breakfast with a family member who was visiting from out of town.  It was extremely difficult to hear our conversation throughout our visit. The waitstaff was friendly, but extremely busy. Our table asked for some preserves and it took a reminder and quite a while for the request to be addressed.  Portions are big.

ZQ-c7lX9ne4KDy-9ooB2xA.text: You can take the Chalula and Tabasco away - said me never. Until today.   At first glance of the menu I wasn't too excited. Not much to choose from and nothing really grabbed my attention. So, I went with the Mexican choice Huevos Motulenos (minus the feta). Incredible. Never had bananas mixed with eggs but it definitely worked. I didn't need to add anything to it as the flavor was beyond epic.  Hubby ordered the special Downtown Benedict. He loved it too. Coffee was hot, lemon water chilled and service fast and extremely friendly.  Totally hit the spot after drinking too much in DLV. Only thing that could have made it better would have been a Bloody Mary. Maybe next time they'll have them on the menu.   We'll be back!

lt5zGyxT6EQlMUWRyp1xpg.text: This place looks like a local breakfast spot near Fremont Street and Downtown Las Vegas. I tried the Shrimp & Grits for breakfast. While this meal looks phenomenal, it sadly wasn't as good as it looked. It lacked flavor and the shrimp was over cooked. The Pico de Gallo it was topped with did the dish a disservice as I feel it would've paired better with a chorizo/Pico topping. Oh well... I'm not the chef but perhaps the chef could take some advice from an avid food lover. ;)

-WjeXvVjLn6SC1-ZW093kA.text: This place is a really good breakfast brunch place, very good everything especially the pancakes and the shrimp and grits, but the service was very slow, otherwise 5 stars

ZB71Glb99YU7xuQfWMlnCQ.text: I ordered the truffled egg. It is pretty good. a big portion of food. I will say that it is a good place for brunch. We came here around 10:30 pm. Didn't wait too long.   My friends got the pancakes with chicken sausages. Taste nice, I will visit again to try this one next time.

I9chkU0ibQ9pwFJmpyputQ.text: Concierge at The D Hotel recommended Eat and he was on the money.  Short walk from the hotel and worth it.  Truffled egg sandwich, BLT and Tomato soup were outstanding.   Highly recommend!

oib8dZpoBwwe-S6He2z4Xg.text: Ie been here a number of times since my initial review and. Have been satisfied with the service and have received the food I've ordered as ordered and can now recommend Ea.

6UtRp3KjrWLqzPPWmEfz3Q.text: I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone. The service is over the chart and the food is just as good! Everyone should try this place at least once because they will not disappoint!

VH72XaXFpGvKVNqTqC0lug.text: Love the food and the vibe in this sweet breakfast spot. Service and coffee good, too.

SgPbZvT4BL9nO9UIzrLh_Q.text: Downtown Las Vegas. There can't be that much of a line out here, right? Right? Ri....ght...?  Wrong. It's not on the strip, but that doesn't mean this place ain't poppin'. Expect to wait it up, even when you think everyone else should be hungover. It's good here. Worth the wait? That might depends on how sober, hungry, and patient you are.  The portions are grand, make no mistake. Initially I thought the pricing was a tad extreme considering the location, but you certain stretch your dollar more than you would where I'm from, Santa Monica. Luckily enough, the recipes are decent as well. And yeah, I got one of the more popular dishes around, the truffled egg sandwich. The bacon is a bit of a detractor in my opinion, but whatevs. People love their bacon.  Parking isn't too bad either, which is a major plus. Streets are about $2/hr, and spots aren't terribly rare.  Make your way over. That is, if you're willing. Vegas still awaits.  GOOD: big portions, good food OKAY: service could be a tad slow even though it wasn't full BAD: recipes can be hit & miss

U6zTa21b5GcQ-TcmdQrEnQ.text: The food is good, but the menu is sooo small! Such limited options. I have kids, and there is almost no options for them, and no kids menu at all. Two of my boys can be picky eaters, which made it almost impossible to pick a plate for them.

B5r-teFfbLL06AohYJL5KQ.text: Ah-mazing breakfast spot. We're in town from LA and upon searching yelp discovered this gem.  From the second we walked in we were greeted with warm welcomes and despite how busy it was, got seated in about 3 minutes.   First off, the portions here are HUGE. Come hungry.  Secondly, expect to spend a decent amount of time choosing what you want - so many great options.  We sat at the bar so we were of course drooling at food in the window until we finally chose.  Grilled cheese with tomato soup - probably one of the best I've had.  Chicken sandwich with tomato salad - delicious, filling and hearty for sure. The bread was great.  Highly recommend. I'll probably be back tomorrow for the pancakes.

0MfSpwHJGu3c1E_dTnDWvw.text: What a awesome small local eatery 2 blocks away from the Fremont Experiencce.  Order the corned beef hash with poached eggs and sourdough. It's was so tasty. I'm not a fancy corned beef hash fan. I like the canned stuff, but his one was perfectly flavored and the poached eggs were cooked just right.  If you wanna get away from the standard casino buffets, stop by this place. You won't be disappointed.  As I was leaving, someone ordered the pancakes. I'm not even a pancakes fan, but the next time I'm in Vegas, I gotta try it!! They were so fluffy and enticing. Maybe this place will change my mind about pancakes.  I'll keep you Yelpers posted...

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash with poached eggs

Y-MMD9-RCctnYfp8tOONkQ.text: This place seems to be busy quite a bit. The food was very filling for a decent price. $10 for a grilled cheese on thick Texas style toast and a bowl of tomato soup.

3DEUZ7o2kfmI-iGox-8ZZw.text: My second time here ! The pancakes are amazing . Doesn't even need the maple syrup which is also amazing but today I had eggs Benedict for the first time AMAZINGGGGGG!!  Happy 6th year eat

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WBQoaYW1gXFiZBBabvPNtQ.text: I'm giving a 3/5 because I felt like not only was the menu limited, but there wasn't a lot of creativity and nothing that blew me away.   My corned Beef Hash was fine, but nothing special.   My friend Ms. W and Mr. P both got the Pancakes. It was a much better portion for the price compared to my dish. And the Pancakes were very nicely done. I particularly appreciated the little jars of  real maple syrup they came with. But getting plain and simple pancakes just isn't my thing - I need them full of granola, smothered in Nutella and topped with strawberries because I'm that kind of crazy girl.   The best, most special thing I had was definitely the deviled Eggs. They were panko-encrusted and fried, then topped with bacon. Now we're talking!  Maybe I should've tried their cinnamon biscuits topped with strawberries. It seems to be one of their most popular dishes and based on the Pancakes and the amazing bread the provide to go with just about every plate, they do Grain-based dishes best.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maple Syrup
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled Eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash

XQGkdIcBcjrlxekmvebntQ.text: We were downtown running some errands, so we decided to have brunch here.   What a great decision. I'd read the background story of the chef, so I was excited to try this place.   First thing I noticed is how cute it is here. It's like a hipster diner.   We started with the cinnamon biscuits and strawberry compote: delicious, and there was no added sugar. It tasted so fresh.   For breakfast I chose the corned beef hash. It was literally the best corned beef hash I've ever tasted.   They must cure it in house or order it special, because it wasn't the stuff you get at the grocery store.   Service was attentive and quick... and sincere.   I didn't feel like I was bothering anyone by being here.   Both servers made us feel welcome.   We'll definitely be back.   Even if we're not down here... I could see myself craving this place.

rata9Nu1lXcKIDXkyFyBtQ.text: I had to go downtown to replace an ID card, so I yelped"best breakfast in downtown LV?"  I had a very delicious shrimp and grits dish at the restaurant,and I was treated very well.  I saw several other dishes that l will have to order on another day, including the chicken fried steak and the huevos.

r2FglV-jHP_cha_znAbQxw.text: Low key place at the heart of downtown. I love the food except the pancakes it was dry for me. The way they are going green is really good. I love the concept and ambiance of the place too!

kVX0EzUzLb2H3-ovmYIJsQ.text: Terrible the chicken fried steak were greasy, literally the grease was sitting on batter. without flavor.  We asked to have it redone and the waitress rolled her eyes. No one came to refresher our coffees. The biscuit was so dry! And the pancakes were under done in the middle-ugh! The toast greasy with some kind of oil leaving bad flavor in our mouths.

hsidclAEv4n71utXzjJhZA.text: Went there for lunch and will not be going back. The host seemed angry and like he hated his job. He didn't smile or seemed welcoming at all. His demeanor was of indifference and that life sucked for him. The seats were hard and very uncomfortable. The food was mediocre. With all the great places to eat downtown I wouldn't waste my money here again.

BDw7buMEOxoq-tPaIJakhw.text: Started elsewhere but ended up here...this place is adorable!!! I recently moved here and came from an art district in California and am a chef myself and this place made me feel like I was at a place back home...my gf got the pancakes and wasn't to thrilled with them but loved her apple juice, I got the chicken fried steak and a coffee...mine I loved and was extremely full when I was finished...but in all we will definitely be back and highly recommend this place

7fwaJ8oRZC0BWqkzeJi2lw.text: I yelped several times of a breakfast place close to Fremont street. "Eat" came up several times with great reviews. When we got there the hostess said 10-15 Mins, with that being said 30-40 Mins later we we're seated and let me tell you it was well worth the wait. The service was okay but the food came out very quickly. We both had the bwlta and it delivered! It was delicious and I would order it again in a heartbeat. The bread was soft and fluffy, with thick cut bacon, tomato, avocado, and a chipotle mayo that left a tiny kick. Would highly recommend this restaurant!

4vTI0tUzZXFzsj1y0tecoA.text: Three things make a great breakfast joint, Atmosphere, value, service and of course taste...wait, that's four things! Well, eat. has it all. Yes it's hip, with the reclaimed wood paneling, Edison bulbs over the community table, polished/distressed concrete floors, bar in front of open diner style kitchen and oversized black and white photos including one of Alabama Shakes, Brittany Howard... But isn't that what we want?!! Especially since it's authentic, which reflects the neighborhood and the diversity of its customers: black, Hispanic, white, Asian, big, small, bearded, shaved, bespectacled, tattooed, bare, guys, gals, young, old, gay, straight and who knows? It's a melting pot and a nice one at that, I just sneezed and the tall gal with long dark hair next to me said, " bless you."  The service is perfect. Efficient, on time, informative and uninvasive.   The potions are huge!! I got the country fried steak with pork sausage gravy, scrambled eggs and huge chunks of fried potatoes... Huge slices of wheat bread.... The steak was huge... Everything was big and very delicious!   Overall eat. is the new American diner for the new American landscape. Hip, diverse, with great affordable taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8EFc61yHu2BW3G0pRp96Jw.text: My favorite place for breakfast and lunch in Vegas. Everything is always fantastic.   You won't be disappointed.

y7bJi0NMiE4R46EN8hhZ5w.text: So cute! Prices are affordable. Service was excellent - our server gave us several recommendations for our trip!   Ordered the two eggs any way (came with bacon and toast) and it was delicious!

G5fbvc9CK1dCXD6SLkstFw.text: EAT is one of our go-to places to being hungry, out of town guests. We have brought people here from all walks of life, and have yet to have any friends leave hungry.   They get busy, especially on the weekends, but service has always been prompt and friendly. The pancakes are the best I've ever had, including my mother's...and she would agree! Lunch is good here (BLT!!), but my favorite thing to order is breakfast.   Besides the pancakes, I love their oatmeal, their Apple chicken sausage, the biscuits with strawberry jam...I could go on. It does get a little loud here, but you can still carry on a conversation. I'm really excited for the owner's next venture, CHOW which will also be opening in DTLV.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bf2eQZieqn0Eu2Sf6v2mhg.text: I was brought here by yelpers thinking everything would be amazing, unfortunately the first thing i ended up returning was my coffee because of the bitter(medicine like) coffee. Truffle egg sandwich  was pretty good, and tomato soup was sour.  What turned me off the most was the small menu since 1/2 of it is not made past 11am (best plates).  Servers are friendly, ambient is okay but not worth the drive!  We wont be returning again!

nOkbkFFlrSJ3ATzHxmwQYQ.text: Pretty good breakfast/ brunch spot!!! When you don't want to eat @ the strip or hotels, cool location in downtown Las Vegas. Area might seem a bit sketchy but place is legit. There coffee is really good and the deviled eggs are just soooo delicious!!! Must add to any order!!!

HwCqIAirZ4QCOcHTLZb6Hw.text: Downtown Las Vegas keeps getting better and better. I really enjoyed breakfast at eat. with my parents over the holidays. They usually stay way "out there" in Henderson and I'm usually north. Finding a safe, "meet in the middle" restaurant that's not inside a casino and with street parking is harder than one might think.   We shared an order of biscuits with jam - which was more like dessert than an appetizer. For some reason, starting breakfast with something sugary seems to be socially acceptable. Why isn't this the case for dinner?  For my main course I had to try the shrimp 'n' grits. It's my new thing, and I've been told that the chef has some history with NOLA. As expected, the grits were buttery and bacon laden. Just how I like 'em. A very rich start to the day, indeed!  No mimosas, wine or Bloody Mary's this time around. Yes, we were in Vegas but still... my parents are wild and it was like, a Tuesday morning around 9 am. We save our drinking for later at night.   Breakfast for four people was about $75. Not bad. I'm always blown away by prices of food in Vegas vs. San Francisco. I'd be much fatter if I lived in Sin City for sure.

B-wTvLabWV-g-lWn0TcIeA.text: It saddens me that this place is not in Sacramento Ca, because this place would be a hit in Sacramento, like it is in Vegas already. The atmosphere is lovely & the food... The food... Is awesome. The grits are the best grits I have ever had. The deep fried deviled eggs are crazy good. I never thought or seen anyone deep fry deviled eggs before. This is a place to checkout while you're in Vegas. This will be my breakfast spot for the next 3 days. Worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damn!!!

MQQExUP6sgMl2xCb_HeEKg.text: Super fast service, eggs Benedict was phenomenal. Deviled eggs are the bonb! And the pancakes even had crispy edges    Thanks everyone and especially thanks to Jessica for greeting us not even 1 minute after we sat down. Great hospitality. Super awesome staff and cool environment.   The great food makes up for the fact they there's no bar! Haha we will return!

4ufXnUWLzGMEPvPhun_DVA.text: Great atmosphere and Gary was an excellent server. Vegan options are only two but both are very good. Love the sourdough.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Bean Veggie Chili is also vegan
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu Scramble with Potatoes and AWESOME Sourdough Bread and kudos to Gary as our server.

_1PpJNY5CAxk0lcuUy4Ukg.text: Wow - what a gem, amazingly friendly staff and one of the most scrumptious breakfasts ever. Natalie the owner has created something special here. Had the deviled eggs - deep fried, bacon topped with a bit of spicy heat, lots of flavor and texture. Next up the cinamon biscuits with strawberry compote, the fruit is fresh and has that wholesome, home preserve taste. The poached eggs on corned beef hash was also a winner.  I will definitely make a stop here every time I return to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits topped with fresh berries and strawberry compote. Fresh and flavorful
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs, recomended by two of our servers. Amazing, a bit spicy, deep fried and topped with bacon - winner
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poached eggs on corned beef hash

E_c0-E_Rfmd9oBIpSpf1DA.text: This is one of my favorite brunch places in town. I don't come here as often as I would like to because of its location downtown and its popularity..especially on weekends. Nonetheless, I've only been here on weekend mornings for brunch. There is often a wait if you don't come earlier when they open, or if you come with a larger group. There is a good amount of seating but it does get filled up and becomes a bit crowded. Their food tastes super good. Everything is full of flavor, and the portion is very reasonable for the price, which isn't too high either. Their food has always filled me up. Their grilled cheese is perhaps the biggest grilled cheese I've ever eaten..more so like two sandwiches in one. If this place isn't a bit far from me and so busy on weekends, perhaps I would reconsider coming here more often. Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. grilled cheese

WxIjFjPA6y2dVNhygSmfEw.text: If you're looking for something other than an over priced omelette on the strip, take the time to cab or walk to EAT.  My second time here and it hasn't disappointed . From their green chile to their savory pork belly entrees, I hit this spot every time I'm forced to the city of sin.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Hash with Green Chile

vJy0ZDi836cokaeCoYUv-w.text: Great place to have lunch at a moderate price. The wait can be long, so have patience. I had the Cherry Tomato salad which had a great dressing on it. The free range chicken sandwhich was good. The chicken was moist and not over cooked. It was well seasoned and tasty. The tomato soup also was quite  tasty with quite a bit of cheese in it.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato salad and free range chicken sandwich.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blt sandwich

rt5_mLm0i89-lhoQXtuAjA.text: My reviews are usually some long rambling story. In light of my 100th review...I decided to catch up on my yelping to make eat lucky number 100 by keeping it 100.   Upon reading the other reviews, I was still interested in eating here. Mainly for the hipsterism of it. However, the reviews about service...do not lie. We came in after stuffing our faces at donutbar. Who does that? Lol. We did and we are still feeling the chubby from it and this was a week ago. That's another review. Anyway, hostess seats folks infront of us, then seats us. Seating was quick, perfect. She wasn't rude nor was she anything near the good morning sunshine vibe I like to spread. No biggie.  We were a party of 4 that day. 2 adults with 2 minions. We sat down, menu pages clipped to a clipboard... spiffy. As I scrolled through the menu I immediately get the I should've done a u-turn because nothing genuinely appealed to me and nothing on it was something my minions mouths could be entertained by. Now note....MY minions. So if you have kids and they're into such selection, don't go talking about my review and how there are plenty for kids. =P  It felt like we had forever minutes to go through our menu. I must've flipped those 3 pages as long as it takes to watch Titanic. Of course I'm joking, but you get the drift. I'm going to skip the fine details inbetween but by the time our waiter got to us, he seriously asked us if we needed more time. At this point, I had told my husband numerous times I am not feeling the vibe and I'm ready to exit to prevent anymore disappointment. The waiters didnt even look happy to be there, people are staring at their cellphones like they've been sitting through the Titanic movie for the 3rd time in one sitting.  I immediately replied, noooope, we are ready. Waiter seriously didn't even look at us in greeting form or just to connect. He was seriously distracted by something. He was taking our orders but looking up and around, as he was jotting it. Imagine your waiter not looking at you, looking around, looking behind his back like he is being chased, and is pretending to be a waiter until his assailants have passed by, then he can rip the waiter uniform off and be on his merry way.   The meal took too long to come considering what we ordered. My husband had the half bowl posole with a stale piece of tortilla chip. He said the stale tortilla chip ruined the vibe. I side ordered their chive potatoe and scouts honor...a bowl of burnt potatoes were served. I don't know if there were garlic pieces in it or whatever...but they were burrrrrnt. Did I say anything? No. I was tired of waiting and our metered parking by then was down to 20minutes. Eat what wasn't charred and move on. I ordered the free range chicken sandwich and decided for the house chips. For the waiting time for our meal to what was serve...it definitely did not live up to what it looked. Chicken is supposed to be pan seared...but my chicken tasted more like pan seared in bulk just to reheat later. I didn't like that my chicken was a bit cold. Not to mention it was pretty bland. I had to open it to double check if the pesto mayo was even smeared in there.  Even their house chips were over cooked--abandoned.  Our server was MIA the whole time...which made everything about our experience here a reason to not return. I literally had to catch him as he was clearly planning on by passing us, failing to realize my husband needs an h20 refill. Just give us our check.   I seriously walked out with regret. That says a lot. I never want to make negative reviews, but it is my quest to eat somewhere and decide what is True annnnd if I personally find it kid friendly.  Negative reviews on service....very True in my experience. My kids were the only kids there at that time. I didn't find the menu too kid friendly. But scope the menu ahead because I didnt. It's good to not be so planned in such a calculated world. I loved the decor and concept, and imagined it being a cute place to eat at with a friend or partner after a walk or something...just didn't live up to the hype or what I hoped it'd be.  Sadly, I won't return. Unless, a friend wanted to go. I always say give it a shot because my experience doesn't necessarily mean it'll be everyone's experience.  High chairs available with working buckles, yay. I'd leave the stroller in the car just to make it less of a hassle.   2 stars is what the gut said to click.  Just keeping it 100 for the 100th review.

g2Ce50JEaI6UOxrnpxv0PA.text: Huevos motulenos were yum yum! Flavor and texture combinations were spot on. Don't be afraid of the banana! It's kind of like sweet plantains and adds a nice sweet kick that goes really well with the spicy sauces, creamy eggs and egg yolk and hearty black beans. And the crisp on the outside soft on the inside potatoes on the side are very good too, especially eaten with the huevos combined.   Cinnamon biscuits were nice too. The strawberry compote adds a good acidity and moisture.   Pancakes were also great with a nice crisp edge and fluffy body.  I would for sure return! Plus the wait staff was great too.

N9YTzoA9xZ4WoyqewnceOA.text: Great food and priced well for what you get. Plus service is attentive and feels like they genuinely care

hGoQpCQAKjy9g-daBJqaeQ.text: Cool place to stop when visiting Fremont Street. Great food, large portions, and very attentive staff. (Shout out to Gary our awesome server).  Couldn't decide between the shrimp po'boy or BLT, but was happy I ended up with the po'boy. It was nice and refreshing, not to heavy on the mayo, and definitely had a little kick to it.  While I wouldn't make a special trip from the main strip, if you happen to be on Fremont Street then stop in!

gMJCnLC7gH5WWlxHxPoxWw.text: Love, love, love little places like this! Eclectic decor with the popular industrial feel.   The cinnamon biscuits and fresh strawberry sauce were sweet and delicious.  My husband had the two eggs with bacon, potatoes and toast that were done perfectly. Holy moly the toast was huge! Chewy and fresh too. Just yum.  I had the truffled egg breakfast sandwich with potatoes-  simply AMAZING!  Coffee was hot and fresh. Waitstaff were friendly and appeared to help each other out. Like every table was "their" table also.   It felt very comfortable in the restaurant. I could've stayed all day and sipped coffee.  The location left a little to be desired but it wasn't like we were going to camp out overnight.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE breakfast for two... Could&#39;ve served three!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior. Cute space!

5REaheEzSNTUvqOajn-Xjg.text: Super delicious and super friendly staff. I had corned beef hash but I feel like I could have had anything in the menu and I would have been pleased. The coffee was pretty good too!

IZlc0FzuHPk9laGwQAiuBA.text: Saw EAT on yelp and decided to stop in for lunch. I am so glad we did.... wow.... I was really impressed. Atmosphere is so nice, even though the neighborhood is a little rough. I had the DWBLTA sandwich (smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado, and chipotle mayo on sour dough bread) with the tomato soup. The sandwich was fantastic... everything was fresh and the sourdough bread was perfect. The tomato soup was seriously the best I have ever had! If you go to EAT definitely try the tomato soup! My husband had the Shrimp and Grits, which is one of their signature dishes, it was incredible as well. We will definitely be back!

kru7ykoRUujXNX5OMKgzFw.text: I was more impressed with the place than with the food and prices.  The place being situated under an apartment complex felt like a scene from San Francisco which was nice.    We ordered the Benedict which was not the greatest. the English Muffin was hard and the whole thing was lacking flavor.   Thank goodness we also ordered their Huevos Motulenos which were pretty good.   We may come back for that dish only but they need to work on their pricing.

yKPmlubrjLWk6UO4BA6S3g.text: Went to breakfast doe birthday weekend.  2nd time to Eat.  Place was packed.  Wait was 30min not a problem. Food was good waitress V was incredible.

N05sHsf0DtkGWRf-wiVegQ.text: So I had to get breakfast and lunch menu. By the time I ate it was brunch so it was good reason. I was really hoping it was amazing or worth the drive. It was good but not amazing. Place was trendy, very new scene downtown chic.   I'll give it second try and try more items. I can't nor want to judge this place by the 3 items I tried. For now I give it a 2. For now.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak, grilled cheese with bacon and tomato soup and huevos something. Not worth remembering.

R3haht4StxEf-QbJRjgWug.text: I ordered the house made granola and it was super fresh and tasty. Service was fast as well

50t0ZYUK4O-2fGt0qRFLNg.text: The deep-fried deviled eggs might be the best thing I had, for the price, while visiting Las Vegas.  I visited the restaurant and ordered them twice while I was there.  They are a little spicy.  I definitely plan on going back for more on my next trip.

56vWp6TiHU1j8xw7SalHUA.text: I woke up hungry with a sudden craving for beignets. Realizing I was in Vegas and not NOLA I want expecting to find anything but I stumbled upon Eat in downtown.   We were seated quickly during a holiday weekend. I like the decor with the modern lights and the greenery inside. There was a lot of personality like a typewriter in the waiting space and a wall that says, "I'll see you in the flowers." I appreciate the open kitchen layout.   We shared the biscuits which came slathered in very sauce and topped with a generous portion of whole fruit: strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries. We also ordered the corn beef hash. Surprisingly flavorful, it came with two perfectly poached eggs and four pieces of sourdough. The two dishes were the perfect pairing of savory and sweet.   My only qualm: Drinks are a little pricey. $3 for coffee & $3 for an Arnold Palmer? I'm used to only paying a dollar or two for drinks, especially coffee.  The coffee here wasn't anything special but my fiance pointed out there were free refills on both drinks.   I was happy with the service. One of the waiters (who wasn't even our waiter) came over and told me he was worried about someone stealing my camera. I appreciate the gesture & I'd totally return to give business to kind-hearted people.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The biscuits have replaced the beignets I came here for... topped with strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries

KxPn34zw9qbbvWjwt0gHSA.text: Amazing breakfast...forget the overpriced buffets and go to Eat. Fast service, great coffee and the best breakfast potatoes I have ever tasted! Friendly staff too...I'll definitely be back!

yy0AsQ_kaf2mlAspSZfLgw.text: This place likes their food THICK! Thick toast, thick bacon, thick pancakes! Atmosphere is extremely fun and retro. I had to give 4 stars because I wasn't a fan of the "thickness" of my food. Service was excellent! Would definitely come back and try a lunch maybe I will like that food a little better.

SQGtnhIajWJhkd5r-6Jhcw.text: FIVE STARS.  I'm bumping up my review of eat to a fiver after my breakfast yesterday morning.  I entered eat around 10 AM hungry for some breakfast action not knowing exactly what I would get. I've been here once before for breakfast and had the truffled egg sandwich (delicious!), but this time I went with the Chilaquiles Scrambled Eggs, What the... this is what breakfast is made of my friends. Everything about this meal from the ingredients, to the execution, to the presentation was perfect. I was so satisifed with this meal I was thinking about the great review I was going to give it while I was eating it. Not to mention, I cleaned my plate.   This delicious meal is scrambled eggs, turken, jalapeno mango sausage,  corn tortilla chips, cheddar, red & green new mexican chili. The mango sausage is the star that pulls everything together because it has an amazingly sweet, savory, and spicy taste to it that plays on your taste-buds.  I've been in here when there were a few more people (as in the place was packed) and the loudness leaves a bit to be desired for ambiance, but my breakfast was calm with minimal noise even though there were quite a few patrons (and myself) sitting at the bar.  What also gets to my heart is the fact that they use locally grown produce here from Caliente, NV. I love it. We need to get back to that idea of using what is near us instead of stuff that is miles and miles away.  Overall, love eat. I will go back to eat here again and again.

OEIZnElhUOgVwefP8VZJHw.text: Thanks to the chefs who recommended eat. during my dinner at e, I have a new favorite breakfast joint in Vegas. Their pancakes were one of the fluffiest I've ever tasted! The truffle egg sandwich was awesome (um... Hello.... It comes with bacon!) and it comes with a side of potatoes that are seasoned so well! Delicious! I read a tip to try their chicken fried steak. I couldn't find it on the menu, but when I asked about it, the waitress checked to make sure the kitchen can still make it. Stoked that they were able to and it was one of the best I've had! Friendly staff and delicious food? You can't go wrong!  Oh, and (I think) the food network was filming while we were there. So awesome!

VY8db9ZwCiiyLoY4bKKLAg.text: I met a business colleague for lunch and found many healthy options for lunch.  One tip - this place gets busy so get there before noon to get a sit.

7d5ocurAIOa_L-GBr4FxiA.text: Eggs Benedict is delicious served automatically with turkey bacon, poached egg was by far the fluffiest I have had. Highly suggest stopping by.

_24rIDKLFYn5FLPNk9z1PQ.text: Checked this place out with my boyfriend after he had read about it online as well as getting good recommendations from friends.  The menu was small but everything looked really good.  I ended up choosing the free range chicken sandwich with house made potato chips.    Everything tasted so good and fresh.  Really enjoyed the food there and would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free range chicken sandwich

RHy7hDUVDk7TkT9SwiW0dQ.text: Such a great local spot! Eat's popularity in the past three years speaks for itself! I'm happy to see tables filled with visitors and tourists who stop in to dine and see Vegas in its natural element off the glittering hoopla of the Strip. Thank you Eat for representing our neighborhood with charm, hearty hangover-worthy nosh, and community oriented business practices. I'm always pleased to visit again and again.

TJ-408K9HDrtp2z2IJzb7w.text: I'm so glad that we found this place and will definitely come back. It's a little bit of drive off the strip and as you pull up, it seems a little sketchy due to the neighborhood/attached to some kind of motel/travel lodge, but luckily it's a pleasant surprise as you walk in. It has a really homey/welcoming decor, great service, & food.  The highlight of our breakfast was definitely the cinnamon biscuits with strawberries - it was like a dessert, but SO DELICIOUS. I got the truffle egg sandwich which was a B+ (it was good, but not great and the potatoes that accompanied it was just ok as well), but my partner got the Chilaquiles which was an A++ due to flavors and just really  yummy.    Anyway, I hope this place does well and that more people make it off the strip to try it. It's just a different experience than some place like Hash A Go Go so if you want a good breakfast - definitely try this place out.

FNRPlNbWrfKmXH-XrDdKiA.text: Everything we had here was excellent! The eggs were cooked to perfection. The bacon was of the highest quality and tasted great. My wife loved the eggs Benedict and the service was very good. I would definitely eat here again.

L_wMhjFy4t7gfby0pvAvGg.text: Downtown Las Vegas treasure! So happy to try it! We had the chicken fried steak (my husband tries this everywhere and says it was pretty dang good- his top 3) and the eggs any style were good, but what makes the entire dish is the smoked bacon. We couldn't not try the biscuits with strawberry deliciousness that others have reviewed. Fresh berries and just amazing! Well worth the stop and we would absolutely go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs any style with must-have bacon!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits with strawberry deliciousness.

YOzGV0l_AaVBb0xUBQrSbA.text: The food was absolutely incredible in portion and taste!! Only issue was our server, Gary. He was not very friendly and appeared annoyed the whole time. All other staff seemed friendly and welcoming, guess we just got unlucky. Overall, however, great food!  Visited on July 13, 2016 at 1:30-2:30 pm.

hgi2jP2m3QtV8unppEzrNw.text: Chef Natalie has changed my life. Before I had her food, I had no taste. Now all other breakfast in Vegas is not worth the effort. Although off strip and small, this plave is worth the trek. Andy provided great service. Natalie knows how to make a mouth party. Praise Jesus, I'll be back on Sunday!

kmXfSc5qaogJiPgZyBRdFA.text: This truly is a 4 star place... It could be 5 because the food is so good. But no surprise the service is horribly slow, unaware, and not friendly.  I had the chicken sandwich today with out of this world potato salad. I highly recommend both.   I also ordered coffee which sadly never got refilled. The owner/chef used to check in with tables and greet people but that's a thing of the past as well.    Last time I ordered the grilled cheese with "kickass tomato salad" which turned out to be soup? I don't know..  Overall, the food is is just so good that I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My sad, empty cup of coffee. Reflection of the poor service...
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and eggs.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict.

KY_QW53r3mKZ2ncXZDgTrg.text: Was looking for a brunch spot while my friend was still asleep so naturally I turned to Yelp to find a good place to eat breakfast off of the hustle and bustle LV Strip and this place came recommended so decided to give it a try and was so happy that we did; their food was amazing!!!! I ordered their eggs in sandwich that came w/ potatoes and my friend got the biscuits; plenty of street metered parking the ambience was great really family oriented by 11am the place had a line of ppl waiting to be seated get there early! Reasonable prices it's a True brunch spot no lunch no dinner check their hours of operation place closes at 2 or 3pm

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U9GzJezCa68yQ8skUnvrOQ.text: Eat is FANTASTIC! I don't understand why they aren't open for dinner or why breakfast ends at 11am (on weekdays)....their food is so great I want it all the time.   Highlights: Huevos Montulenos: amazing breakfast/brunch dish that feels relatively healthy. Basically a more exciting huevos rancheros with over easy eggs, two delicious salsas, black beans, feta, and bananas (they were a little surprising at first, but added an interesting element of sweetness).  Bahn Mi Sandwich--this dish is no longer on the menu, but it was super delicious and sometimes available if they have the ingredients in house.   Downtown Benedict--classically amazing in every way.   perk: super comfy seating.   Don't order tea or orange juice, it's crazy over priced.

IaIM583WzQuEAblJxHLTVQ.text: If you are in the Fremont area and want a good breakfast, go here.  I went here twice during my stay and both times food was delish.

1knAWejBGCRVXgWR9U3RAw.text: So good! Had the huevos motulenos and it was so delicious! So many flavors and textures especially with the potatoes on the side! Also had an order of the biscuits with strawberry sauce- perfect size to end the meal on a sweet note!

1JQPAjm__HfffkW4bRVrLA.text: Food was homemade and amazing!  I got the Huverovos --it was an odd combo I would never normally think of--from black beans, eggs, to bananas, and feta and home fries. It was delicious and very filing.  My boyfriend got the fried steak and was very happy.

cCqbkGtW4ZMtFSV3uwrS0A.text: Thank you, fellow yelpers for another great find! Just a few short blocks away from the Fremont St. Experience, you'll find eat. tucked away on an unassuming street. BF and I came here on a Sunday morning (thank you daylight savings and east coast time difference) around 9:30am. We got a table within 10 minutes. The restaurant is spacious and you don't feel like you're sitting on top of each other, which is nice. Everyone working there is super friendly. Although Charity was supposed to be our waitress she was very busy with other tables, so another waitress helped her out. I even noticed Charity find a woman's credit card that was left on the table after the group had already left and she ran out of the restaurant to find them (they were parked across the street). Although Charity didn't take our order she still checked on us while we were eating.   Speaking of food, we ordered the Eggs Benedict, Chicken Fried Steak with sunny side up eggs, and a side of short stack pancakes. The eggs benny was deliciously light and perfectly poached.  One of the best I've had! The Chicken Fried Steak and gravy was comforting and flavorful. The pancakes.... OH the pancakes! BEST BEST BEST! The edges were crispy and while the middle was fluffy and perfect. WOW. I want more.   Next time I'm in Vegas I know where I'm going for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. country fried steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pancakes

PXbCcFY28DpySay7pHHaVw.text: This place is awesome. The sandwiches are huge and I recommend sharing them.  I had a Blt  that had avocado and a chipotle mayo with homemade chips and don't forget the pickle. My husband had the Ruben with potato salad. Nothing on the breakfast or lunch menu is bad. If your downtown Vegas do yourself a favor and stop in.

4xazo_vMWdCZXSIV-rCDEw.text: I think maybe I need to give this place another try. I'm from Louisiana and all Im saying is Pico de gallo does not belong on shrimp and grits, so when I go back I need to order something different. Other than that it was a super cute place.

c6EGv9Xb8fLRafGQYwn6QQ.text: Food here was delicious. Simply put, I enjoyed the entire experience. The reception by the hostess, the food (wait time was not long at all), the coffee (tasty and bold... Just my type!), even the owner came over to talk to us and see how we heard about this place. I made a wrong turn about two weeks ago at 3am, drove by, and knew I needed to come back. Made him laugh with my story but he was pleased and thanked us with our patronage. Every detail at this place is key - the maple syrup, the fresh lemon garnished water. These are little details I only see in small towns, but the fact this was in Vegas... Made it that much more welcomed. Check it out if you want a quality breakfast and experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you don&#39;t love pancakes, you don&#39;t have a soul.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sourdough toast, over easy eggs, and potatoes!

lrDQvNzzr-nZSP5-YnqY4g.text: We were a group of 5, we watched as a table of 4 that was sat after us gobbled their food as well as at least 3 other tables sat after us  happily eating while we still waited for ours.  The food was good once it arrived.

cKWCNimTh-BluzAUujC9HA.text: This must have been a great week full of culinary finds and updated reviews.  I haven't been back to Eat since my birthday in April, probably because I didn't really have the best sandwich for my taste buds.  This place is super convenient from my office and should have been frequented more.  Well, I came back to this place for business meeting and I was glad I did!  The place is still the same charming location from last time.  I really like the color scheme: medium tones of green and white.  Looks retro, clean and modern at the same time.  Seating includes a bar top, tables and booths.  Lots of space, but it packs up!  We ended up waiting about 15 minutes, but don't leave!  It's worth it :)  For this lunch date, I decided to try the Free Range Chicken sandwich for $12.  My side was the popular potato salad and chips combo from last time.  Homemade chips, lightly seasoned and homemade potato salad, this time super flavorful, was a great combination.  The sandwich is free range chicken, fresh mozzarella, tomato, mixed greens, sprouts, pesto mayo on a ciabatta bread.  Let's talk about the star of the show, the chicken.  These were breast meat chickens, so tender, so flavorful, so perfectly cooked!  LOVED IT :) mozzarella melted on the top of the chicken cloaked over and brought a lightly salted element.  The veggies offered lots of fresh texture to the meal and of course, the pesto mayo sealed the deal!  Such a great sandwich and really made my day!!  Alright, this was the dish that made me say, "I've gotta come back real soon."  No joke, this sandwich is awesome!  I also love the staff and got to meet the owner of the place. She's lovely and has done some great work with this joint.  Come check them out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free range chicken sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wNt4aeGz0YtYdIeAbnsKMg.text: Great breakfast! I had the Truffled eggs which were amazing.  Arugula salad with shrimp ordered by the wife was just so-so. But this is probably not the place to go for that.

SMyk8HIYrCukhcgY1RU6Dg.text: The best shrimp and grits in Las Vegas. Very clean! Very Friendly Staff! Overall Extremely Great Restaurant!

Q6fexJ_XuFeAysiZvhmsow.text: Large portions and laid-back atmosphere. Country Fried Steak and Grilled Cheese sandwich (where you can also add your breakfast meat of choice) were delicious.

Vc-DXjAhK5feXnNAmkeHrQ.text: This is my second favorite place to go for breakfast! Too bad I don't live in Vegas. I went her twice during my stay, I had to go back a second time before I left.  I was a little upset that they didn't serve omelettes, but that feeling went away when I bit into their food. The tofu scramble is by far the best on the menu. Try adding some jalapenos to it for a little spice!   I also had the posole. Mind you, this was my first time trying posole. IT WAS THE BEST! I went with my boyfriend, and he didn't believe me when I said it was so great. He tried it, and instantly fell in love. He rarely does this with Mexican dishes because he is Mexican himself. We were so impressed by the food, we said to ourselves that we had to come back the morning before we leave back to California.   Surely enough, we did. I went there looking to order the exact same thing: tofu scramble with light jalapenos with a half bowl of posole. We were burdened with bad news. They change the menu on the weekends, so the only time you can get the posole is during the week. This the ONLY reason why I had to give it four stars instead of five.  Either way, if you go here, you won't be let down! It's very healthy and and great alternative to the buffets in Vegas.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu scramble: first visit.

7QyzSP1tK25lkWTfQAMHnw.text: Good food with great ambiance. I like coming here for breakfast. Try the golden brown pancakes and a cup Of Coffee. It'll set your morning off right.   Great downtown Las Vegas gem.

GrxbGiLMkl1jd665k1lbIQ.text: Eat is located close to the heart of downtown Las Vegas.  We met my cousin here before heading home.  She heard they made good breakfast meals here, and she heard right based on what we tried.  I had the pancakes ($9.00).  My cousin tried the corn beef hash ($14.00).  My wife had the shrimp and grits ($13.00).  Shrimp and Grits looked good, and it tasted even better.  ( 4 stars )  Corned Beef Hash came with sour dough toast.  Nice combination of food.  ( 4 stars )  Pancakes were yummy!  On the menu it says Golden-Brown Pancakes.  Well, they were golden brown.  The maple syrup they provided with the pancakes complemented it very well.  The Chicken-Apple sausage on top of the pancakes was delicious!!  ( 4.5 stars )  Eat is worth venturing away from the Strip.  They make very good food here while providing a clean atmosphere and good service.

sDK2d1eFVtjKxYNy0Xd7bg.text: I had been wanting to come here to 'eat' for over a year, and finally got my chance this morning with my business partner.    I liked it.  The service was good, the food was tasty.    My only critique was the menu which I thought was limited.  I know that is good for the owner, as it increases the profit margin (and I'm all for that) but I am not sure, I just felt it needed some omlettes, and other items to make it a real breakfast place.  It just might be me, but that is what I felt.  I would go back, and I want to try lunch next time.

LWyRP36Du5PD_f4x_XZBNA.text: The best breakfast/brunch/lunch experience in Vegas. Get off the strip, get down town. Honestly, after the 2nd time I'd been here, I thought I saw the owner on an amex commercish.  The food is great, but honestly the service keeps me coming back. These people know how to treat customers!  The food is well done, and affordable for the quality. Its a wonderful staple for me, to the point where if I bring friends with me to Vegas, we go here at least once. Sandos are HUGE!

ew0g_t_qSTqtKwVO0wB2YA.text: So this will be an odd review. I just saw Tony Hsieh, CEO of Zappos speak at a technology conference. And he talked about another of his ventures called Downtown Project, which is investing in revitalizing part of downtown Las Vegas. To that end, the Downtown Project offers loans to people wanting to start interesting and exciting businesses I the area. He told us that he met Natalie Young, a cook at a casino, and learned about her and her dream to start her own restaurant. So he invested in Natalie's vision, and "eat" was the result. It proved to be so successful that Natalie paid back her loan within a year due to the wild success of eat (she's now starting another restaurant, called "chow"). American Express learned about Natalie and did a commercial about her: m.youtube.com/watch?v=0G... I've never eaten there, but will the next time I'm back in Vegas. This story alone should encourage more of you to try her restaurant. And thank Tony for making an incredible investment.

ePP7LdtUep8EssSei6eYgA.text: We ate here last year, and couldn't wait to have breakfast here again. So Eat was our first stop in Vegas this year. Again I had phenomenal pancakes on one visit (real Maple syrup, yay!). But I did want to try something new.  On a second visit, I tried the Huevos Motulenos: 2 fried eggs w/ red & green New Mexican chili, black beans, peas, feta, & sauteed bananas on a corn tortilla. It was spicy and sweet (due to the bananas), very different, and quite delicious! My boyfriend stuck with the pancakes and was very happy with those.  We were there twice this trip and service was excellent both times, with coffee refilled often without ever having to flag down a server. If you want something original in a place with a great vibe, check this place out.

_e9r8ggopY_PtA-MtL1Nkg.text: Not ringing in as the last expensive breakfast but I'll give it to them, they have some great food! I had the huevos man..something. It was bomb! The banana was something out of left field but a great addition to the dish. The wife had the Fremont Benedict. It was really tasty too. We sat outside because we could bring our pups. Our service was perfect. They didn't bother us every two seconds but didn't leave us forever before checking on us. They were very friendly and pleasant to order from. I got the large o.j. which was freshly squeezed and a good thing since it was $6. The wife got coffee for $3. I thought it was cool they offered her another cup to go when we got our check. Like I said, great service. Well be back. Wonder if they have French toast?

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The inside of my delicious huevos man...something
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos man...something ($12). can&#39;t write remember the name but I surely won&#39;t forget how good it was!

Hy8kTgjW6F_lxEFVhLMyew.text: This place is a gem!!  I drove by this spot a lot and have been wanting to go in. Finally made time and took my girls with me.   THE STAFF was crazy attentive and sweet. I think four different servers came by our table at different times to check on us. A very Indy/hipster vibe with them so it has a very young downtowny feel here. The  positivity here is infectious!   THE PLACE was very clean. Tables are stuffed in tight but there's a coziness to it. Rustic/industrial decor. Simple.   THE FOOD. ... I might have had the best pancakes of my life. Seriously. And I didn't even a have the pancakes. They were so creamy and fluffy with a fried crispy edge. So good. I had the country fried streak which was huge but you didn't lose quality for quantity here. A crispy hunk of meat the size of a grown mans hand. A handful of breakfast potatoes with Caramelized onions and two eggs over medium. Perfect. This place is a perfect comfort food spot for those hangovers downtown is usually responsible for.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak.

LxvASiBXAcPPK0869h8ITA.text: We are sitting at the bar because we didn't feel like wait ing. So we are here 10 minutes away from the hotel.   Parking: is a pain. Just heads up its all street parking pretty tight so you have someone get ahead and put your name down.   Decor: looks very modern.  Sitting at the bar. You can totally see the potatoes being chopped up. Bacon is grillen. Potaotes are sizzling.   Service: everyone is pretty helpful. This place is crazy busy.  Luckily we didn't have to wait to sit down but all good food takes time. So I'm writing this review live pretty much as I'm waiting.   Food: these were the best pancakes of 2016. Super amazing super fluffy super light. Doused in butter.  Super amazing. Highly recommended for pancake lovers. The truffle egg sandwich was light. Needs a tab bit more truffle but I was satisfied. (4/5)  Notes: street parking is a pain.  Parking away from the main street. 10-15 dollar range. A gay guy kept on touching and hitting on. He said he doesn't normally touch other guys ( he was drunk and he was....happy.  Lol. )  Verdict:  bring the crew if you are on this side of the strip. Might be a wait tho. Have a blast !

5WOTMgIblla8f1KpcUtuRA.text: My boyfriend and I come basically every weekend. It's our absolute favorite place for brunch! Yes, there is usually a long line but SO worth the wait. I normally get the 2 eggs scrambled and trust me is much better then you can get elsewhere! My boyfriend usually gets the truffled egg sandwich and he love it! Sometimes when we're feeling extra hungry we will get the strawberry compote biscuits   Ambiance is great! Cool nice people there and the wait staff is always nice!   A must!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 eggs scrambled. Tastes way better than this picture looks!!!

Kz-cokMqME4cn0gKGdm74A.text: I come here every time I'm in Vegas (and will continue to). It's a welcomed break from the gross food & cigarette stench of the casino scene. It's not the best meal you'll ever have in your life, but it is on the short list of your best options in Las Vegas.   Everything I've had has been tasty. It's well-lit and clean. They only serve drip coffee- man do I wish they made espresso!  My advice: if you're not dining alone, get an order of cinnamon biscuits for the table. They're delicious and compliment a savory breakfast perfectly.  Their classic breakfast options are tasty and reasonably priced, chilaquiles are good, even the tomato soup + grilled cheese is great (though be warned, their bread is super big).

EGhe441P26VoaKKVKNaBsg.text: Eat at Eat! This is actually one of the first restaurants I've eaten at in DTLV. I'm definitely not use to the parking, aka parallel parking. But that did not deter us from eating here. It's actually very spacious inside, it didn't take the hostess long to seat us, however there was just two.  I'm easy to please when it comes to breakfast food. All I need is a nice big cup of coffee and good food. Both of which this restaurant has plenty of. We both tried the truffle egg sandwich. The sandwich was pretty good. The sandwich was a little hard to eat though. It was pretty fat. The bacon was also a little to crispy for my liking, but I guess thats what I get for ordering something with bacon when I don't actually like bacon that much. The truffle part just sounded too good to pass up.  The service could have have been a little more attentive. It was a little hard to get a refill on my coffee. I tried asking and the girl just kind of walked away before I got the chance. I just need a refill to save me from the food coma..

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich

WUtjE-0vw5pFNuEG3FJ_aQ.text: Order the cinnamon biscuits!  Soooo my friend called to ask if they serve alcohol because that's a must for us for brunch and they didn't, but they said we could bring our own, jackpot!  We ordered the cinnamon biscuits which came with a berry compote that was so amazing the tables on either side of us ordered them after they saw our reaction.  My simple eggs were great and my friend ordered a stack of pancakes which were amazing, eggs Benedict which he crushed and turkey sausage which was very very good.    Great experience, very cool wait staff, and a nice break from the overpriced Las Vegas strip which lacks the hipster character of this place.  It's on my list next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath of the cinnamon biscuits!

I-N4ix_al3z7YKYyP-_rdA.text: I found this place based on all the high yelp reviews. I went in today for Sunday brunch around 11 and this place was poppin! We were on the waiting list for about 10-15mins and seated promptly. My guy and I ordered the beef hash, eggs Benedict and a side of pancake with chicken Apple sausage.  Beef hash = good bite size but on the salty side (more than it needs to be)  Eggs Benedict = biscuit layer is thin and the eggs were perfectly cooked. The turkey bacon was a nice touch. Comes with a side of potatoes (super crunchy). Overall, I would recommend it!  Pancake = it was topped off with powdered sugar and comes with there own maple syrup! This is a must try!  Chicken Apple sausage = BOMB!  I am definitely coming back to try the other things on the menu! I want to try the shrimp grits and the chicken fried steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

idtEZh4_R4LS1mNTol29zg.text: Tried lunch and enjoyed it so much that we went back for breakfast the next day.  Was busy and service was definitely.  After waiting over 15 minutes for our check which we had to ask for!  Food is definitely good and would probably return if I return to the area.

Ql4jH1VV7eTnYMfv-KkSmw.text: I took the advice of my fellow Yelpers and stopped here for breakfast.  I had looked at the menu online, and I had practically decided what I would have before going, but I looked at the menu in any case.Coffee was brought quickly while I was looking at the menu and reaffirming my decision.  I had to go with the Huevos Motulenos.  What an interesting breakfast!  A corn tortilla topped with black beans, peas, sauteed bananas, and feta cheese with two over easy eggs on top and then topped with red and green chili sauce.  The dish comes with home fried potatoes.  Since this is a breakfast and lunch restaurant only, these home fries are made from scratch. These aren't cubed potatoes left over from last night's baked potatoes.  I watched as the one cook cut the potatoes and then stirred them as they grilled.  The menu states that this is a zesty dish.  It was excellent!  I could have used a little Cholula, but I decided to have it as it was served than eat breakfast with lots of hot sauce like I'm known to do.  Service was very good.  I like this small new place--open only 2 months--and it does have a "loft" kind of vibe like another reviewer stated.  My only complaint is parking over which Eat has no control.  ----End of review  ----Editorial follows:  ** Note to the mayor and city council **  If you're going to have meters, convert them so you can pay with a credit card like other cities.  I don't walk around with parking meter change in Las Vegas.  Better yet, take them out.  If you want us to continue to come downtown, make it a bit easier!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One more photo of Huevos Motulenos.  The white object is a large wedge of fried onion with the home fries.

rOkA9ucDnZvK-HZssrSCBA.text: Great staff, warm and welcoming, food was fresh and came out quick.  can't really complain .

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Today&#39;s Special  biscuits and gravy

Rkz7E_b8INgO7fjOoU8YLA.text: Country fried steak was super delicious that I pretty much inhaled it all as fast as I could LOL.

1PjZedgGmG3xzzbXAcWfaw.text: Really Enjoyed our brunch here a few days ago. Food was delicious and service was great. I only wish my lemon wasn't so tiny couldn't taste it in my water. But overall great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hhp6EAutzbXT2HqOnArxHA.text: EAT, pretty simply put, how could I go wrong as I Yelped up a something to eat this morning for some breakfast before returning home from Vegas? I generally stay clear of the places that appear so sublime on Yelp, but I was hungry and I was biting on the the Yelp hook again for a relatively new place with a short track record. My GPS in the rent-a-car told me this place didn't exist WTF was this some kind of Yelp trick? I found it anyway a half dozen blocks down from the Fremont Street Experience downtown, nestled under an old apartment complex. yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... Maybe 707 never existed before Eat made her home here??? After feeding the meter across the street I crossed and hesitantly I walked into a nicely appointed, clean semi industrial, semi earthy space of a restaurant yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... with only a few customers and was greeted by a tall dude (forget his name) with face full of jewelery, a punker hair-do and a dark gothish demeanor. He showed me to a table and got me some coffee right off. Nice guy. As I read the menu I knew I wasn't in Kansas anymore Toto, there were a bunch of menu choices that were out of the box and sounded very promising. eatdowntownlv.com/breakf... FOOD ORDERED: Truffled Egg Sandwich Two farm-fresh scrambled eggs with wild mushrooms, chives, feta, bacon and smashed potatoes WHAT I GOT: Truffled Egg Sandwich and some country style fried potatoes. The sammy was great, yummy thick sliced bacon atop a couple of fried eggs laced with shrooms and some chives and a kiss of feta cheese crumbles on a croissant roll. This sammy was good! And the taters were well seasoned and tasty as well. 4.5*****STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... The service was great too. Plenty of refills, checked on me couple times too. Had their s**t together. 4.5 **** Stars I also briefly met Natalie Young yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... the chef / owner as she was kicking it with a few patrons at the table next to me. She seemed like a very nice and down to earth gal. She explained that breakfast crowd for some unknown reason was always a bit slower but lunch and later times were always slammed full of customers. I can believe it if the Lunch and Dinner choices are anything like breakfast food. While a little pricey (still cheaper than the Vegas strip restaurants) it's so worth it. This place is as cool, hipster, and the food is as good as you are likely to find in a local Las Vegas eatery. Its a local downtown eating establishment that's not on the beaten path when it comes to locale or food. This place is what most trendy LA places wish they were yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... hip with legit with great food and real atmosphere. I gotta try the chicken fried steak next time it looked awesome! I'll be back, next time in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Storefront

RFZSBIdaHVTYO4UoHpswgw.text: Yesterday I went to my first Southern Kitchen Pop Up and it was a success!  Southern food is not all about fried chicken, collard greens, and macaroni and cheese (although it is all about that) it's about the individuality, love, and soul that you put into it!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top Left: Fried squash, Duck, Pig w/ okra and peach mustard, Wild berry pie w/ sweet corn &amp; Mint basil ice cream.

dvWYxfny607fKK2c_kC-ew.text: Great fast service, line when we showed up but wait time was short. Kitchen was fast and delicious. Staff is super friendly.

XY0DljLAg5W2wDXxTCcMQA.text: This is a common staple for any Vegas local who really just wants to wake up and get a really good meal A lot of good flavorful fried foods definitely try their deviled eggs that is what I kept hearing about and I do not really like deviled eggs but they were absolutely fabulous They also have a great grilled cheese sandwich with soup and lots of other really tasty things that you can get at any given time when you're in there Make sure you check when it opens and when it closes because we have ran into that problem this is not open 24 hours It would be awesome to have a 24 hour restaurant like this on Carson especially after a fun night out this is exactly the kind of food that you want Great for brunch

xEJQnMfHH3y6Biq5qR6ppw.text: I really wanted to like eat. I was really excited to go there. But it was just average and that left me disappointed, especially with all the rave reviews and delicious looking photos from other Yelpers.  We came in Sunday at around 12pm for brunch. Our visit started off on the wrong foot. The wait was long and we were a little discouraged since they were closing in an hour. The hostess who greeted us at the front was very rude and we almost left because of her bad attitude. But we decided to stick it out since we were excited to try the food.   Luckily, after we were seated, we were assisted by different employees and our visit picked up. We ordered the pancakes with chicken apple sausage, egg Benedict daily special, and an avocado BLT. Hubby was not impressed with the Benedict and my friend complained that the bread used for the BLT was too thick and overwhelmed the sandwich. I thought the pancakes were really good.   Another con was the sticker shock. There are a lot of places in Vegas with cheap breakfast specials with similar quality or better food. Anyway, I won't be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily special benedict
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden brown pancakes with apple sausage

Cs3DncBqAZj06hjNlJkysw.text: It's crazy that this place has 1K reviews! I've been interested in trying out this place for about a year now, but due to a busy schedule and their TIGHT hours (8am-3pm) I never had the opportunity to try it out! :(  Yesterday we were in the area and interested in trying something new, and luckily they were open! As soon as we walked in, we were worried about a long wait time due to the fact that there were SO many people eating and also people waiting to be seated. But as soon as we walked in, we were seated right then and there, which was convenient. I assume it was because we were a party of two.   I ordered my food, (see photos!) and my boyfriend ordered his. Our food was okay. The service was okay. The food looked so good, but after eating it, it just felt.. greasy and heavy in my stomach. Not alot of healthier options in my opinion. And the bread that they add onto your plate... HUGE... Huge slices of sourdough bread, and 3-5 slices on your plate! I could hardly finish my bread, while my boyfriend didn't even touch his.   The food portions are quite large, much more than we expected when we ordered. Had I known that, I wouldn't have ordered the cinnamon toast strawberry dessert, because even though we shared it, we still couldn't finish it.   About $40.00 for brunch.. kind of pricey. Overall, my experience here was okay.. maybe in the near future I will try it again.

d0ev4ibwviz4H1435eYbYA.text: Can I add a 6th star? So friggin awesome ambiance. The place was packed and the food the service and the smiles never missed to treat us like family will come back for sure

Z1QGDQQYDvwe7ldJlBAUhw.text: Until today, Mon Ami Gabi was our brunch spot in Vegas but we can add this one to our list! Loved the vibe & their offerings. If you are a breakfast/brunch person - go check them out! I loved what I had - shrimp & grits. The pico de gallo was an interesting addition.  The fried deviled egg is a must!!! They are so devilishly good - you will love them!! Orange Juice is freshly squeezed and coffee tasted good. Parking - pay street parking $2/hr Service - nice & friendly... although our main server could have used little more friendliness/attentiveness~ Yes, they're not cheap - $58 was our bill for two this morning but overall a very satisfying breakfast!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rpkg-uv6gvLnQUhydSlUCw.text: Great spot and off the strip  but worth it. Food was good wish they had this in Texas

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best chicken fried steak I&#39;ve had in a long time and it wasn&#39;t all crust.

PTyhg3it0ZptpEClnzztFQ.text: Had the corned beef hash here. Great portion size and the taste was on point. Their orange juice I had tasted fresh. Wait staff was attentive and polite.

Pk2vsdHS5cS4CVCLuGrh8w.text: SUPER LET DOWN. This place was SO hyped we had to try it. Group of 6. Five of us were present with one parking his car. We were told we would not be seated until the whole group was present. We countered with the logical point that our friend was literally two minutes away. Still, we would not be seated because "we can serve people in less than 20 minutes." Not sure what that had to do with it. We could have easily sat down and ordered his coffee within that two minutes. Oh well, gotta love rule followers.   Anyway slightly annoyed we eventually sat down and started with OJ and coffee. Our server was awesome. She had a great attitude and was fun.   The cinnamon biscuits were crazy hyped as the thing to get so we got 2 orders. Yea, not sure what that was all about. Dry, bland. Sure yea it's awesome I guess, when you sprinkle cinnamon on biscuits and call it a craze? Fail.  Most of us are huge fans of deviled eggs so we ordered those as well. 5 star presentation but 1 star taste. Again, bland. Was hoping for some horseradish taste or seasoning. Just tasted like a deep fried egg which was a unique twist on the item but lacked flavor.  I ordered the eggs benedict which happened to be a special. I love eggs benedict and order them any time I can. I took two bites and pushed the plate back. The hollandaise sauce was bland and the turkey bacon or whatever it was tasted like cardboard. Again, horrible absence of flavor. Hollandaise should catch a slight lemon flavor and bacon of any kind should be exploding with flavor.   Our server graciously took it off the check but that didn't help my breakfast hunger any.   So, yea, sorry. Don't get the hype. Won't be back.

0jOUU83xsd33CckfhYq0oQ.text: This was, sincerely, the best breakfast I've ever had in Las Vegas. I'm not big on eggs, but my meal came with poached eggs and they were perfect . The corned beef hash, I can not recommend enough. Get it! Try it! My mom had chicken fried steak, which I tasted, and when we come back, I'll be getting that. The atmosphere is welcoming and artsy. The wait was a little long, but so worth it. There's nothing I'd change about EAT.

wV2VwqnEaLQaUthuOsE3RQ.text: Stopped and loved it. Went with my parents & brother for some breakfast. My dad got the pancake stack! The pancakes were huge!. My mom and I shared the biscuits. They were amazing. The strawberry compote was delicious! My brother got the fried steak, something like that, and that was also amazing. Portions were more than enough. Coffee was great also! Definitely recommend this place.

-wUUT8uUD-okV-OhPOJoNg.text: The Pancakes were so great! Slightly crisp on the outside and soft in the inside with plenty of flavor. The staff were super friendly and my water glass and coffee mug was never empty. Looking forward to eating at EAT next time we are back in town

mRmGuld3BPO1Sc8XhMk7ng.text: Food was fine. Service left something to be desired. Was fairly busy so whatever, just seemed very disorganized.

LSDYeJ15ajJqirLioC3BYA.text: The pancakes are delish, egg Benedict are my fav the potatoes are so good. Save yourself some money and ask for water.
