DxghcjcekWvuumdmMD3Fpg.text: Always good. Highly recommend if you visit Las Vegas. Great coffee, food is always hot and fresh.

P0CmRfUKKdboLZTTzpwtVQ.text: Great downtown breakfast spot.  Friendly,  attentive service and tasty, fresh food.  All the food looked like some care and attention went into its preparation and it showed in the way everything tasted.  I'll be back.

rchQJghcYKPkVT-iCyq5WQ.text: We love this place in Vegas! My husband and I have had their breakfast sandwich and thought it was one of the best ones we've had. It's really cute. The service is great. It's a little out of the way but that is another plus.

Fl9mb0-vLhkzQxlFSUJDIw.text: Eat? Yes, yes I will.   My husband and I wanted to get away from the strip for a bit and grab some brunch before we headed out to Red Rock, so after a quick Yelp scan we showed up here and had to wait about ten minutes prior to getting a table.  The staff is super chill; turns out it's a quirky little restaurant with great coffee and amazing food and they are all pretty pumped to work there.  We both got sandwiches, and they aren't kidding about having wicked good pickles...   We didn't really talk to each other much through brunch... so I think it's safe to assume he liked his meal too. lol

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best sandwich ever
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wiQydvRLCyScQScc3KkobA.text: While staying in Vegas for a 4 day birthday trip, we wanted to get out of town a little and experience some of the other great restaurants with 4 and 5 star Yelp reviews.  So we took an Uber from our hotel and landed at this very fun breakfast and lunch spot.  The service is very friendly and swift.  Although, we were there in between breakfast and lunch and didn't experience the huge crowds as so many other reviewers had.  The food is very fresh and cooked perfectly.  I had a standard 2 eggs poached with smoked bacon and their house potatoes.  The poached eggs were cooked perfectly.  The bacon was slightly greasy, but the potatoes helped with that.  They were spiced and cooked crispy, just the way I like them.  A bit pricey I thought, but overall a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poached eggs, smoked bacon and chive potatoes
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits

HEWvX6oln4ibo5RTW2tUpQ.text: This is a cute little quaint spot in downtown LV. I truly enjoyed having breakfast here, for the place was clean hospitable and great fast service. The food was so yummy! I couldn't complain about a thing if I wanted to. I had the shrimp and grits and bf had the eggs and bacon. I would just like to see the food preparers wear hairnets is all. But I definitely recommend this place for a great "EATS"

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits

veQGk-DZ2kzLeK7MJCiuaw.text: I really enjoyed this spot. I loved the modern hip vibe I got from walking in. The service from the hostess and waiters was on point. Even the timely service of when we got our breakfast served was far from complaining about. I just wished the waiters smiled a bit more and were a smidge enthusiastic to serve us. It's weird because they were very attentive but not the friendliest.   We strolled in here on an early Friday morning. The place was pretty busy for a weekday. I can only image how packed it gets on the weekends. There was plenty of seating so we were sat right away. We ordered drinks and breakfast not long after we got seated. When our drinks came, the waitress didn't drop off straws. So I asked her if we could get straws, and she said she'd have to look to see if they had any left. Right. Ok. So why did the people that sat down after us get straws. Interesting. Any who I wasn't gonna make a fuss about straws. We were here for the breakfast.   I ordered the pancakes with sausage plate. My bf ordered his own plate also. I figured we could share the pancakes. Geez these pancakes were as thick as an old dirty novel! It came with three and I could only eat one. I loved the cute little syrup jars they served with the cakes too. Delish. They were pretty good. I could care less for the sausage. It was pretty fatty.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bisGsRSLEIcmimBIsJRiJg.text: Came here for breakfast on Christmas Eve with my family. The place seemed continually busy, but we only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table.  We tried the Truffled Egg Sandwich, Chicken Fried Steak, Shrimp & Grits, and Corned Beef Hash. The sandwich was definitely my favorite; the truffle flavor could've been stronger, but either way the sandwich tasted delicious! My least favorite was probably the shrimp & grits; the shrimp was yummy but the grits seemed water down.  Service was very quick and friendly.  Not sure how difficult parking normally is, but there were plenty of metered parking spots on the street.  Overall, the food was yummy and the service was good. The portions were huge and the prices were very reasonable.

qAacUPlPXakvSudUjUoV6A.text: Deviled eggs are a must try! Eggs benedict also runs out quickly, so make sure you come early! The service is also great. There are limited seating though, so get there as soon as you can as it tends to get filled up quickly.

jPh_MT6Q955wZDqT9338og.text: First time to this place and I'm thoroughly impressed. Everything was made just the way I personally like it. The environment was good. Good decoration, Industrial. It's definitely my New Vegas breakfast spot. Good overall service

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes with apple chicken sausage &amp; home fries
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E-XM5jFn60a0CDfCJVZVNA.text: Found this place just 5 min walk away from Fremont St. Small and quaint, it's reminiscent of a BC organic diner. They focus on fresh, simple ingredients, organic coffee and smiley service. We were seated quickly by the window and had our coffee topped up many times.   I had a shrimp po boy on a crispy grilled baguette with slaw and jalapeno. Served with a tomato basil salad. Very tasty!  Hubby had corned beef hash which I tried. Meat was good served with eggs and toast. I would return here for a good meal that's decently priced. With taxes and tip, $42.

s_lA6G-SasiCY2wR2AaPvQ.text: Great breakfast spot in downtown Vegas. We came early enough to not have any issues finding parking and the wait was barely 5 minutes. So many things we wanted to try but settled on the truffled egg sandwich and the corn beef hash. Both were so good! Also, got a pancake on the side which I would highly recommend -- buttery crispy on the outside while soft and fluffy on the inside. So so good. A superb meal with excellent service!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich

kIMImfDPdDyJ8otz_sfhgw.text: Chicken fried steak. As Robert Irvine would say, "salt and pepper" man. I am not sure if they purposely not put salt or pepper on the chicken friend steak but neither mine or my friends had it. The steak is cooked well, non-greasy, crispy, but utterly devoid of flavor. The gravy was cooked well but it did not have salt either. It had bits of bacon in it I believe and sausage. I don't eat high sodium, heck i am the green soy sauce guy at sushi restaurants, but I would like a little seasoning.  The potatoes and eggs were cooked well.  The place was not busy when we went at 10ish. But no one came to refill my water. I don't need a straw in my glass but the common trend is that tall glasses of ice water generally come with an Earth polluting straw. $16 for an unseasoned chicken fried steak. Pass.  The place is friendly but subpar service is just a turnoff. Go to Denny's and give the server a bigger tip from the money you save from Eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N_TUgUptgFhW37Cd8LJbtw.text: Okay, I think I just found my favorite breakfast place back home in Vegas. I've heard good things about this place over the years & finally made it here with some friends when I came home for the weekend. In summary - this place is simple, intimate, and a great staple in DTLV for both locals and tourists.  I had the truffled egg sandwich and omg it was sooo yummy. I'm a big fan of breakfast sandwiches, and this one was delicious and different than most I've had. It was flavorful and the mushrooms, to my surprise, were a good addition to the sandwich. I'm thinking about it right now and my mouth is watering.  The service was SO quick despite a busy Sunday brunch. I was very impressed. Food came out quickly and they moved the lines fast. Eat is located downtown so parking is a challenge but there are parking meters all around the restaurant.  I think what made me fall in love more with this place is hearing about Chef Natalie's story. She was on the CW documentary 'My Last Days' that featured a Vegas local with a terminal illness (I since then learned that's how La'Kat's deviled eggs came to be). The authenticity, the passion, and the vision behind Chef Natalie's story is inspiring & I think we are lucky to have her in our Vegas community. I'll definitely be back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h66b7FYXFLrYylW8TrnVOQ.text: Location/Service - Within downtown core, very close to Fremont street - Street parking is available around the restaurant - Loved the interior decor. Very modern, but also has a hipster and great cafe feeling to it. Love the little succulents on the table - adds a whole new vibe.  - Restaurant is relatively big (also has patio), nice for small groups. But gets pretty busy during peak hours (nice waiting area available) - Staff were attentive, fast with order and very friendly  Food - Ordered an ice coffee. Love they used a paper straw, very environmentally friendly compared to plastic. Ice coffee was nice, smooth and blends well with the milk on the side. - Food ordered the Deviled Eggs. It's an appetizer, but can be a little filling for one person to eat it all. Love the little bacon bites, mixed with the eggs on top of a fried croquette. The sauce also compliments well (not exactly sure what kind of sauce it is) and it's not spicy/sweet.  Overall loved the vibe and atmosphere in the restaurant. It is not within the stripe, but if there is time - definitely check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled Eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice Coffee

b4G0yiUJ47g_keU0j9rGqg.text: Looking for a bite to eat solo while my friends were sleeping off their hangover, I found myself at Eat. Lucky for me I came solo because this place is very popular and had quite the wait. I was able to snag a seat at the counter (score - party of 1!). From the counter I got to enjoy the organized chaos that is the kitchen at Eat. Watching the chefs work was truly an experience. The staff were all super friendly and attentive and the food is phenomenal.  To start, I couldn't resist trying the deep fried deviled eggs. Being a midwest girl, deviled eggs are about as sacred a food as it comes. These deep fried variation made my mouth water and I devoured the four eggs they served up. Yum, yum, yum.  For my entree, I decided to try the truffle mushroom egg sandwich which also came with bacon, chives, mayo, and feta piled high on fresh ciabatta bread. The sandwich was an interesting blend of flavors but everything worked together in harmony, and I finished every last bite.  I only wish I had time to come back and visit again to try the infamous grilled cheese and tomato soup, but next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lift the lid and get up close and personal (truffle sandwich)
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Mushroom Egg Sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Deviled Eggs - out of this world

BRi4bzzuibVGocMme2BpRw.text: I'm not a huge breakfast person, but my husband is so we decided to go off the vegas strip to stop by here since someone recommended we check this place out.   The place does get pretty packed. We went on a saturday morning around 9am. We did not have to wait too long for our table , but the minute we sat down it started to get a lot more packed. There was a live singer performing, which made the environment really upbeat and livly for morning. Noise level is loud, so if you are hung over and looking for somewhere to have a quiet breakfast... that would not be here.   By far the best pancakes I've ever had. Have no regrets. No matter what you order.. ORDER THE PANKCAKES too! It comes with 3 pancakes and their AMAZING syrup. It is also topped with sausage. There was no disappointment there. I'm more of a waffle person, because I prefer it to be more crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.. well these pancakes were JUST that. Crunchy/crispy on the outside and super super soft on the inside. Gosh just writing this review now and thinking about the pancakes and making my mouth water!!  I ordered the basic, egg, bacon, potatoes plate. The potatoes were a little undercooked. The bread that comes with my plate.. OH. MY. GOSH. THE. BREAD. It wasn't just a small slice of typical white bread. no. it was a HUGE slide of white bread...IT WAS SO GOOD. It was toasted to perfection.   My hubby got the chicken fried steak was not disappointed either. But We were def moved by the pancakes.. ORDER THE PANCAKES!!!! Don't skip the precious pancakes. I wish I could eat more of it now..

39hzbFYD5LwBP2lVF4kOSQ.text: It was only at 10 min wait 30 mins before they closed on a Sunday.  The service is so fast!  5 minutes from ordering our food arrived.  The devils egg and country fried chicken were soooo good!!   The simple white bread was even delicious.  I have booked marked it and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food Menu

7_TslKdhd2zHlcQ6WT7OoA.text: My favorite brunch spot in Vegas. They have a really cool patio and the food is high quality and original. The one thing that they are lacking is a liquor license, so if you like boozy brunches this is not your spot.   Recommendations: the deep fried devils eggs are delicious. The BLT sandwich with avocado and egg is very rich and filling. If you buy it you might want to share it, unless you're really hangry and need a big meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio view. As you can see, it&#39;s very shaded so you won&#39;t get hot in the Vegas sun.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT + avocado and fried egg (you have to request the egg) with a chipotle mayo sauce. Creamy tomato soup on the side.

lYKjmF1dDIaMSdip3w1Xjw.text: Hello deliciousness. Wow I what a great spot for breakfast. We stumbled on this while on vacation. This is an adorable spot. I had the oatmeal that was delicious. I live the way the cinnamon apples are sliced in here and cooked perfectly. But really the way they are sliced way everything to these oats.   Also I had to get the chive potatoes. Talk about being happy I made that choice. They were very good.   My husband had the country fried steak and I had a bite of that. It is something I never order but I had to sample it just to taste. It was very nice.   Great service too.

AnFGAu1PRFkDxUP2keuRGA.text: WOW!!! This place was a life changer. The food was excellent and one of the very best breakfast places I e been to.

IT1dZm9V37L0aURGWqyS5w.text: Just had a breakfast that will haunt me for ages - Eat's huevos motulados. This dish was just perfect - ideally seasoned, beautifully cooked eggs, crispy but tender potatoes, and well-combined flavors and textures. All served by friendly and attentive staff who provided frequent coffee refills and accommodated my dietary restriction requests without complaint.   Also, three cheers for WOC-owned businesses.

CFYW88VJkzZFItfRjONfAw.text: This place was amazing! I ordered the breakfast sandwich with truffle and mushrooms, so much flavor! We also got the fried devil eggs never had them before and they were great. Great service and cheap prices! I would def go back & it's worth ubering to if you're staying on the strip.

haWcYAMy-nb0rVixuXRLow.text: We found this little spot years ago when it was relatively new. We try to stop by everytime we're in Vegas. Really loved it the first few times. Super friendly and great food. Now it seems a little hot and miss, but they're always worth a try.

kCriSFyjsGRX3vyiKqToNg.text: Absolute must visit.  Take the lyft from your strip hotel to get one of the best breakfast around.  We came around 11:30am on a Saturday morning.  There was a small wait but not bad at all.  The deviled eggs where definitely unique and a must try if you like egg salad sandwiches.  The breakfast potatoes and bacon were nice and crispy.  The pancakes were soft and delicious.  My mom thought the vege sandwich was a bit cold but she is a picky eater.  Lastly the service was just awesome.  Thank you Diana.It was a great meal to have before heading out of Vegas.  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 egg breakfast
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our bill
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short stack pancakes

Z3Cp4q3Aj9sl-kpo4ccVrQ.text: I really enjoyed brunch at Eat in downtown Las Vegas. The menu is full of hipster versions of classic American diner foods. Take their house-made pancakes. Unlike diner pancakes, they are fluffy like pillows and instead of being served with bacon, the pancakes are paired with an organic chicken sausage.       The ambience of Eat is actually quite enjoyable. Even though the restaurant is usually jam packed, the restaurant is pretty quiet, so you can enjoy your meal and the people you are (most likely) sharing it with.       I ordered the truffled egg sandwich. It took a while until I got my food, but it was worth it. The sandwich was the perfect combination of creamy avocado, fluffy scrambled eggs, earthy mushrooms, and pungent scallions. The only complaint I have about the sandwich is about the bread. It was way too soft so my sandwich fell apart when I held it. I had to eat it with a fork and knife (the hipster way to eat sandwiches!) Instead of using such a soft bread, I recommend using a hard crusty roll or better yet, since the restaurant is "hippy", wrap it in collard greens.      Eat is definitely on my top 5 list of best breakfast destinations in the country.

cU9Tab638MLwWa1B3XVxKw.text: A mixed bag.  Some items were great, such as the massive slices of sourdough bread that came with the eggs and the orange juice was fresh.  The eggs however were very boring, but the potatoes that accompanied them were terrific - well cooked and seasoned.  The sausages in the chilaquiles were boring.  The whole dish was missing oomph; maybe a tomatilla salsa would have helped.  At 9:00 am on a Monday it was about half full, but by 10, there was a wait.

ZNtA3JW47HOKOSqn9omP_w.text: Really solid breakfast eats with great coffee. Homey hipster diner feel in the rejuvenated downtown area off the strip. Not sure I would spend another $30 for the cab ride but glad we tried it. Had the truffled egg sandwich and the strawberry cinnamon biscuits!

g7SaSxEAXyNoftat6__LYQ.text: If I'm only going to judge it off of the food, I would give it five stars. Personality a little lacking but they must know it's the place to be. Everything we had was delish! I need to go back next time I visit vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panko deep fried deviled egg topped with bacon and shiracha. Oh so good!!!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT, grilled cheese and tomato soup and corn beef hash. Oh and a side of chips and strawberry lemonade.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled egg appetizer topped w bacon and deviled egg! Definitely recommend!

-ygzOcKEgrGXvEEPs7VDvw.text: This place is wonderful. If it's crowded (which is always is) it is totally worth the wait. The service is always friendly and attentive and the food is never sub-par. My only gripe is that you can't get pancakes past 11am. They are the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best places to hang! Love it at eat.

pS_HDbLJfwfVQwzbDDkOnQ.text: While staying at the Bellagio was nice, I had to get off the strip to find a good, local, hole in the wall brunch spot. Brunch is my wife's middle name and she put this place at the top of her list. Great service, fun atmosphere, and amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iyCTgAK4M4JYLhKZO71BFA.text: Adorable little eatery in downtown. Love eating off strip and super love it when it's amazing. This melrose-style place serves up some serious grub. The decor is adorable, unique, slightly hipster. The people keep it real and give honest opinions about their menu- which is short and sweet. Their food is clean, simple, but with tastes that meld together in a satisfying manner.   The cinnamon sugar biscuits and fresh fruit compote were so amazing. The biscuits were light and fluffy, with cinnamon sugar crunchies on the bottom. The fruit was perfectly saucy, not overly sweet, with tons of fresh fruit and powdered sugar sprinkled on top. Bread is thick cut (no joke) and fluffy. Chicken fried steak is well seasoned and cooked. The potatoes that come w it are perfect and seasoned so well. Tomato soup is yummmmmmmmmm. Pickles are great. Pancakes are so fluffy and light. I'm normally not a pancake eater but these were amazing!!! The syrup is real syrup and the eggs were cooked perfectly to order.   I have way too many good things to say about this place! But to sum it up, new favorite Vegas bfast spot. I'm reluctant to spread the word but it must be done. It does get super crowded on the weekends! Get there before 10am and you'll be happy. Service is great!!!  Must try's- biscuits and fresh fruit, tomato soup, country potatoes, pancakes.

zEUovkuHmUT4zilg81fezw.text: Great spot for breakfast. The cinnamon biscuits are to die for. Will definitely hit this place up again on my next trip to Vegas.

DLuKiK7oDSlA52gqEaBkAw.text: Came for brunch. We had the shrimp and grits and BLT, coffee, OJ, toast.   - We liked the energy of the restaurant.  - the shrimp were just a little over cooked - the grits were good, and dipping the toast into the surrounding sauce was fantastic! - the BLT was good. - the house made chips were great.  - the best part was sitting at the counter and watching the kitchen staff. Best show in town :P

9IITHNXXInfxtOOrPXcqVw.text: Eat is my new favorite downtown venue.  It's located in the more sketchy part of DT, but with good food and good vibes, it's worth the risk.  This venue has plenty of character, reminiscent of either Portland or Frisco spots, but beware, it's first come, first serve.  Prepare yourself for some downtime because it can get pretty busy during lunch hours.  It seems as if they have locked in the perfect spot right behind Container Park for when hipsters, foodies and white collars have an appetite.  The only thing they are missing as far as my concern?  Alcohol.  THE MUST TRIES: Veggie Burger Shrimp and Grits Biggnets

429P59yeg4gHhyw_gkvmKw.text: Wow!!... What took me so long to finally get here.  When you finally go. . All If they have deviled eggs...simply AWESOME!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato soup! How can you go wrong?
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finally a classic Reuben with a great ratio and perfectly done bread not overdone to Krispy Bravo!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best deviled eggs in Vegas!

7RzZFCOLpq_0fiA6Ve0ZEg.text: I'd never been to DTLV before and really didn't know what to expect from the downtown area in the ways of food establishments. I was pleasantly surprised by almost all of the places we ate, but eat. was probably my favorite.  We stumbled in here after a late Vegas night for some hungover brunch food. There was a long wait, but we were able to sit down right away at the bar. And boy, were we glad we did! We had the huevos mutalenos and the pancakes. Apparently the huevos dish was voted best hangover food in Vegas... It was delicious, the perfect blend of spicy, sweet and savory. The fried bananas were a great touch! That dish was great, but what really shocked us was how delicious the pancakes were! They were so unique too, perfectly cooked and crisp on the edges, they were the best pancakes I have ever had! So flavorful and the texture was perfect, they are huge too...no way we could finish them. Another cool thing was that the owner and chef was there working away! She's done a great job with this place, fun, creative and delicious comfort food at it's finest!  MY GO-TO DISH: I don't think you can go wrong here, but the pancakes are not to be missed! You gotta try the huevos mutalenos too. We were eyeing the country fried steak too, getting that next time!

17-2js3gbzsPQT1LP-V9dg.text: Amazing food and fun atmosphere.  My only complaint is it's too popular and hard to get a seat.

jENnwffVuZOm0JA3UImAnQ.text: Great place to have breakfast and great service.  The prices are very reasonable for Las Vegas.  I strongly recommend it to all.  Good for families or couples.  We had a cute table by the window...very nice.

dkbpc1md9AIxH6XTLZHeFQ.text: Never coming back here again! We walked in and were told the wait was 10-15 minutes for a party of 5. 35 minutes later, we were still waiting. In that time, they seated 7 parties of 2 and 3 that came in after us. They kept assuring us that they simply needed a table large enough for us (and they couldn't possibly put two smaller tables together, for unknown reasons).  After waiting for 45 minutes for a table, two tables opened up at the same time. One was a 6 top, one was a 4 top. They tried to seat the 5 of us at the 4 top. (Side note, their 4 tops are NOT large by any means). Now, at least 2 of the other parties that came in AFTER us and were seated BEFORE us were seated at other 4 tops.   At this point we politely said no, we wanted the 6 top so we could sit comfortably. They went the consult the owner (I'm assuming she was the owner, she was a female with short curly hair who wasn't wearing the standard black uniform). The owner then rolled her eyes and, said, "Yeah, well I want a million dollars." She didn't realize our party was standing directly behind her and to the left, so we were able to hear the conversation very clearly.  Isn't that lovely? After making us wait 45 minutes, we are being unreasonable by asking for a table that will actually seat all of us, when there is one available right there. They did eventually, reluctantly, seat us at the 6 top.  Pity, several members of our party were actually big fans of this place, but you can't come back from such terrible customer service. The biggest problem, honestly, was the fact that they tried to seat us at the 4 top after a 45 minute wait with an open 6 top right next to us. Several of our party has worked in food service and we understand waits taking longer sometimes due to parties sitting around chatting. But treating us like we're being demanding for wanting space to sit AFTER such a wait is unacceptable. The owner's comment was the final nail in the coffin to assure we never return. Clearly this place has no appreciation for it's customers.

XCcYHKwtKoLYVqNhm14PDA.text: My boyfriend and I came to eat some delicious food and we were definitely not let down. I had looked up the menu earlier to make sure they had vegetarian options and I saw a few that sounded awesome, so we went.   My boyfriend ordered the shrimp and grits and said "it was my first time ever trying shrimp and grits and I'm glad I tried it at E.A.T." They were butterflied shrimp that looked gorgeous!  I ordered the Huevos Motulenos and I am so flippin happy I did. Seriously, I could eat this dish every day. They use bananas instead of plantains so it's a bit sweeter but it works well with the spice of the salsas on top. The potatoes that came on the side were massive and so yummy. I devoured the huge breakfast and would do it again and again and againnnn. I am actually salivating thinking about it right now.  The only reason I gave a 4 star rating was because our server didn't check on us as much as I'd like. I understand not bothering people while eating, but there was a little while that we went without drinks. Nothing too major, I would definitely come back! I plan to soon... :}

pWrlc-XJSJ3Zy24gGJVEKw.text: I was slightly disappointed.  EVERYONE and their moms have been raving about this place via all sorts of social media channels.   The concept is wonderful. I love the location, decor, the art. I REALLY want to fall in love with this spot.   I had Sunday Brunch here. The wait was long... but I was ready for it. After all only the best food attract the longest lines. I have high hopes when we finally get seated.   The menu was uniquely standard - your basic breakfast items with their own flavor. But the moment of truth when my order Downtown Eggs Benedict was about to approach my mouth.... ehh.  I wasn't blown away by the taste - I didn't grin in happiness with how tasty my food was. It was just alright.   I will try again in hopes that I just had a rough day.

1IuBpsjWrM8OKeY4DlUzUg.text: Eat is for a different demographic than me maybe?  I think you have to be a 'cool hipster' that rides your bike there or maybe skateboards.. I don't know.  I'm definitely not part of the Downtown chic.  Went here mid-week a couple weeks ago for lunch with a friend.  It was a chore to find a parking place, and you do have to pay for parking, but it IS downtown, so that is to be expected.  We had a 10-15 minute wait I think for a table for 2.   The place was tiny, and the tables are packed in.  This makes the ambiance what I would call 'Uncomfortably close and LOUD'.  My friend and I both were like 'whew' when we left and got out of the wall of sound.  The food was plentiful but nothing special.  My friend said hers was 'okay... nothing to write home about'.  Service was lacking.  Don't expect to be asked if you want a refill on your drink.    I was pretty unimpressed, but then again, I am not 'hip'.

uXlEIjWGmu3UloKseom2xg.text: I've been here more than five times and thoughts:  Tasty pancakes, good corned beef hash, chicken fried steak very tough, very rough to cut, that dwblta, though...very nice.   Food is good. Yes.   The decor is lovely. Neato seating, and those groovy incandescent lights with the warm looking filaments the whole bit.   Here's the thing. When it is busy in there, it is loud... VERY LOUD!!   Hard painted concrete floors and a hard ceiling painted black.  When the place is packed, it is rough to enjoy the conversations you're having with the people at your table. There comes a certain point where enough people leave after a rush and you realize that there is background music just below the noise floor of the very loudest rush so it never settles down completely there volume-wise.   I've never had a single experience there where I've been completely happy at the end.   I'd love if they spent a few bucks on some black acoustic treatment on the ceiling to match the decor. It would absorb so much of that hard edged uncomfortable noise and make it a place I would come back to and really truly recommend to my friends.

vf2bnFD2yBm9MLvKZKOgBQ.text: Amazing everything. I got the Saturday special their version of eggs Benedict, amazing. Great flavor and special ingredients they treated well. Also got a side of grits which I could have done with out because they sucked. Also on the plus side the portions are big and not too pricey.

CwANE-DLPXCjUxwENT5P4Q.text: After several long, booze infused Vegas nights, it was nice to have a sit down, tasty breakfast of pancakes with sausage.  I wish there were more sausage, it was a great compliment with the cute jar of syrup provided.  The pancakes were decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cakes and cute syrup.

uqQXAeShjfnspQbih9Zztw.text: Amazing breakfast. I was originally disappointed that I couldn't have a mimosa with my Sunday breakfast, but the minute I put the food in my mouth.... That was forgotten! Oh my... The eggs Benedict with turkey bacon was the special served with their wonderful chive potatoes. I'm seriously gonna dream about their food. I can't wait to come back to Vegas just to eat at 'EAT' again. Yummy yummy!

a5wByKBXkCN-enAc82XVpQ.text: Amazing breakfast place! Possibly the best I've been to.

yPfWb4WjUvPWFQIkfV9fYQ.text: We have been here multiple times! Everytime everything is delicious. The chicken fried steak is the best we have ever had. The iced tea is so fresh and my favorite. Had the shrimp and grits and corn beef has today. Great food, great vibe, love coming to Eat!

KohiI0iDnWFdDvqDeaH-2A.text: $13 for 3 pancakes with chicken sausage.  Or you can get 2, ditch the sausage for $7. Ok.  $4 for a cup of tea. Is this magic tea?  I could only eat one pancake because they're dense, not fluffy. And when they arrive, they are not hot so the butter didn't melt on them. Also, had to ask for butter. Do millennials not use butter on pancakes? Then they sat like a rock in my stomach all day.  Uneventful is all I can say. Not enough to come back.  Eat is too big for it's britches now. Probably subsidizing the Chow now.

WTXOZ0Qo5FPAalF5sG93_g.text: Food was great and fast....a little pricey but it's a trendy spot so to be expected. One hostess was a little bit of a stickler for her rules, but we killed her with kindness and she warmed up to our group.  I recommend the salad and add protein, but watch the price inflat. One other in our group had a cup of Pozole and said he wished he had gotten the bowl.

vXeSPiQsf3BNF-bTvjUg9w.text: Once we got our bearings right, here we are. Quite the cross section of people here. Never sure what you'll get for clientele, but this seems alright.  Points awarded for having GLASS for drinks.   Service has been outstanding. Everyone is very polite and attentive.   Coffee... Oh. My. God.  I know coffee tastes are very, very subjective, but if you like strong, well flavored coffee, this is for you.   For breakfast we ordered the truffle egg sandwich and the chicken fried steak.  Sandwich was amazing. Fresh avocado made it nearly perfect. The steak, well, the gravy was outstanding. Unfortunately, the steak tasted like oil.  No flavor other than that, but hey, things happen.   Again, the staff was very polite about it. I hate sending things back, but I just couldn't eat it.   Would certainly try again sometime, it just didn't work out this time.

sgwm34s3-8jhS-ISSKSFgg.text: I'm almost glad that I don't live in Las Vegas because I would "Eat" here every single weekend!! LV certainly has it's fair share of memorable restaurants in the hotels and on the strip, but Eat. is one of the best breakfast/brunch spots I've ever laid my palate on...period!   Thanks Chef Natalie for the awesome recommendations. The roast beef sandwich was simple yet complex...full of flavor and texture. My friend loves shrimp & grits more than life itself, and she raved about it the rest of the afternoon!   Next time I'm going to try those amazing pancakes that I hear so many good things about.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a little something to wash it all down with!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast Beef Sammy with house made seasoned chips. Nomm...nomm
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits. Having sweets before lunch. #I&#39;mAnAdultDamnIt

ZyLiE_74ew1n8deHiv64cw.text: Awesome service.  Ordered: Cinnamon biscuits with strawberries (delicious) Pancakes with chicken apple sausage (really really good pancakes) Truffled egg sandwich (i'm not a fan of the truffle flavoring, so just okay for us) Chicken fried steak (really tasty gravy)  chicken fried steak & sandwich served with delicious potatoes.

5jY8sJ6ywjnR9tsa5YWxqQ.text: Brought here by some locals and what a gem! I had the chicken on ciabatta and "kick ass tomato soup" and they had the truffled egg sandwich. 5 stars all around. Will def return to try the truffled egg myself. Friendly and unpretentious service.  I will return. Thanks, Eat, for a great meal.

ijWG_A5bu1fmfpyo8PoI0g.text: If you want Eggs Benedict, what this place is known for- don't come except during the weekend because all they have is Sandwiches made with Texas toast and 4 breakfast choices

nD064uBdIj7m3fOQ_dVe3Q.text: Everything we got here was AWESOME!! We had the cinnamon biscuits, killer grilled cheese and their special which was a breakfast burrito and man, oh, man everything was sooooo good! Definitely looking forward to trying more! Oh, and the staff was not only friendly with us but had really great camaraderie. Helping each other out naturally. You don't see that warmth a whole lot. The owner came over after our meal to chum up some conversation and I LOVED that he did that. We were in a bit of a hurry because we were supposed to be marching in a parade and "detoured" if you will, but him taking the time to try and learn who we were was ultra impressive.

5_ibnS6J3KGTWRJ_1NhqIw.text: Literally the best place in Vegas to eat breakfast! For real - stop reading this review and get your ass to eat! REAL FOOD! No BS! Great service - stunning photographs on the walls. Laura C was amazingly helpful - knew the menu and was soooo fast!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MRAPxZFZPGs0gWsUKoKTmw.text: Left after sitting at the counter for 8 minutes and not even being acknowledged with a hello.

8p7rDOkQnU6M8RJ3hJ5SlQ.text: This is a great local restaurant, and the food is excellent. The service is friendly and fast. This is a small joint, though, so if you come on a weekend expect it to be very crowded (I've only ever visited on the weekend so I'm not sure what it looks like on weekdays)! It is much easier to get a table if you have a smaller party (think 2 or 3). I'm not sure that I would ever try to bring a group here for brunch, because you'd have to wait such a long time!  The food is really great. The last time we visited I tried the 'blta' - a blt with avocado, but man, is it good! It came with tomato soup which was very, very good. My husband got their truffled-egg sandwich (can't remember the exact name) and was extremely pleased with it. Both times we have been to eat we have left very full and very happy with our meal!  The prices are a little higher, but you are practically downtown, and the quality of the good is just so good that it is worth it. The menu had changed since the last time we had visited, so I'm sure there will always be something new to try! Honestly, I probably would have given this place five stars if it wasn't such a bother to get a table!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dwblta with tomato soup and a sparkling strawberry iced tea!
