Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yMQg26tMI4I59zUtMxU_qA.text: Eat has great food and good service.The only thing that I see wrong with it is the prices are a bit inflated for a small establishment. It's only open for breakfast and lunch.

NCwAbgK0ahWtj6NdMmS0Pg.text: Had brunch here on a whim. It was amazing. Good service in an eclectic atmosphere and most importantly the food was amazing. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast of champs!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best breakfast I have had in a long time!

YxPUP5dKXVpVgJASzBxQCQ.text: A cute and trendy breakfast/lunch restaurant located in the outskirts of the somewhat-slummy downtown area. TRUFFLED EGG SANDWICH yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... Two farm-fresh scrambled eggs with wild mushrooms, chives, feta, bacon, & smashed potatoes. Simple, but delicious. This dish combined a handful of my favorite things into one awesome plate! A safe and delicious way to start the day. CHILAQUILES SCRAMBLED EGGS yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... Scrambled eggs, Turken jalapeno mango sausage, corn tortilla, aged cheddar, red & green New Mexican chili. Smokey and flavorful. This is a bold and daring dish, which I'd highly recommend to adventerous eaters. I love spice, so this was perfect for me. VERDICT When in the DT area, this is a place to go. It's a great breakfast / lunch option fo'sho. And much better than the casinos/hotels. I will definitely return on my next visit to LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tDEW8ZEYYdFp9TVysGQM6A.text: Was staying close by for the past week and for some reason kept skipping this place- Big Mistake! Went for the Cinnamon Biscuits the next to last morning. Talked myself out of them because I was afraid they would be too much (many). Big Mistake/Convenient excuse. Got the Truffled Scrambled Egg Sandwich- WHOA!! I was slightly disappointed in myself for ordering something so..."safe". Heh, perfection is NOT safe. There was nothing in there that I couldn't/haven't prepared before for myself BUT this was seriously delicious and well balanced. I like spicier food or interesting combinations but this sandwich was on point. I would have it again and wholeheartedly recommend it to less adventurous friends. HOWEVER, the hash browns....I spent pretty much each bite trying to determine why they were so good and how I can make mine as delicious. Not spicy like some places, but very flavorful. Soft but crispy, NOT greasy like so many others. Thick but cooked through and the few onions were perfectly cooked to coincidence. I'm not lying, I'm from the South and I've eaten and cooked hash browns my entire life but these really were that perfect and I almost feel like a dork going on about them!  While contemplating my egg sandwich and hash browns, the couple next to me ordered and received the Cinnamon Biscuits. So not as intimidating. I was afraid they'd be huge- nope, normal size biscuits. Made a plan right then and there to return the next morning after checking out from my hotel. Quick note on the coffee- no fancy table presentation but just a good, well balanced cup of joe. Not strong but not bitter either. A really good coffee choice. I almost asked for a cup to go but thought I'd try a nearby coffee shop- Big Mistake!! Went to the other place, crap coffee and it was barely warm!!! Did not finish- should've taken it back but I was in such a contented state from my eat. experience I just dumped it.  Next day- Cinnamon Biscuit Day! Ran over from hotel. To spare the details- I ordered the biscuits minus the powdered sugar, with the compote on the side. I feared sugary overload for something which should stand alone. I also got a side Chicken Apple Sausage. Alone, the Cinnamon Biscuits are very, very good. Delicious in fact. I pride myself on my traditional Southern biscuits, which these are not, but a tasteful alternative. NOW, with the compote (as designed)-SLAP MY MAMA!! So, so, SO good and the flavors don't clash, they totally compliment if not reinforce. Fresh berries accompany. Great concept and execution. Even better than I expected! I can wholeheartedly recommend the Chicken Apple Sausage, also. Split and grilled, not greasy and went great with the sweet of the biscuits. Learning from yesterday's mistake, I asked for a to go cup for the awesome coffee.   Two times service, both early morning before the crowds- exceptional- especially for Vegas. Seated quickly, someone at my table moments after seating for my drink order, quick turn and back with recommendations and helpful advice for my food order. Food turnaround both days was super quick. For a town known for ambivalent service at best, this place gets it. I was recognized the second day and thanked for returning. So nice to be appreciated as a customer.   Exceptional menu, superior execution, great service, fair pricing. That's a five for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Biscuits without powdered sugar and compote on the side. Chicken Apple Sausage in the back. Great cuppa Joe, too!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Scrambled Egg Sandwich and unbelievably good hash browns.

7Oua99QMa-x3aZ_LZTCUIQ.text: I had a very pleasant experience here at eat. with my party. We went right when it opened, so we didn't have to deal with any kind of lines. We were sat immediately and we were greeted kindly for our drink requests. Our waiter Gary was very friendly with us and struck conversation with us. He recommended to us some specials and favorites.   I ended up ordering the Downtown Benedict with a short stack of pancakes. Our food came out within 15 minutes and surprisingly, it was more food than I expected. It definitely looked like it would be a challenge, especially with my pancakes, but needless to say, mission accomplished. Everything in the Downtown Benedict fit so well together from the tomato to the hollandaise sauce. The potatoes that the dish comes with were soft on the inside and crispy on the outside, with grilled onions, perfection. The pancakes were cooked well, and the simple fact that it was served with 100% pure maple syrup made it all that much more delicious. I had a great time with the food, staff, and parking even though it was all downtown. I can see where parking can be a mess and how easily it can become busy, but I didn't have to deal with any of that luckily and I'll be sure to come early in the morning next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Downtown Benedict

ZHQ6uacaQfl5XiQkO44Y4A.text: i come here everytime i come to vegas.  A little loud inside, but the food makes up for everything.

lRoLReoUL_5DHFskjgMTQw.text: Have gone 4 times since it opened and each time I kick myself for going back.  Is it beyond their ability to make one change to their already limited menu to make it more interesting.  FYI.  Roast beef should be rare not "poop" brown. And if a customer does not want tomato soup with the grilled cheese is it so difficult to substitute a side salad.  God forbid you put something slightly healthy on menu.  In short bad menu bad service no clue about how to make good food or provide hospitality.

OJcHQTl_qlR9vFpGKoKvBA.text: Bad attitude and bad policy overrides any kind of food here. No coffee while waiting - that's a first at a brunch place. Curt responses to EVERY question with a bit of pretentiousness that makes me say, "What did I do wrong?"  Perhaps Vegas is not used to brunch culture.  I cannot recommend this place unless you wanted to be treated like you're not welcome and they don't want your business.

zfDqLLiN7oj6FMG1BOAduQ.text: Stopped by eat w/three of my friends and we all left horribly disappointed. Not only was our waitress rude, condescending, unwelcoming, and clearly hated her job but the service was slow and the fact that there was no options for vegans was disappointing to say the least. When I asked the waitress if there was any vegan options she rudely stated "we have salad."  Clearly she had no idea what vegan meant as the salad on the menu had animal products in it.  I had to settle for a $7 bowl of oatmeal which they served to me with carmelized apples/pecans (carmelization requires the use of butter...an animal byproduct) which irritated me to no end as I already stated I was vegan and ordered it plain.  We were also never offered refills on our water or coffee, and halfway through our meal our waitress abandoned our table and never came back.  The staff has no regard for your concerns. The four of us agreed we will definitely not be going back.

ZA80xYVeKc0figElcucf0A.text: I am so sad to report that I was disappointed with my meal here. I know many people who love it and wish I had had a better experience. I came here for breakfast on a weekday. I had the pancakes which were good, but for this giant stack you get 1 little maple syrup and I had to flag down a server to beg for more, Second issue, my mom ordered the corned beef hash after the server strongly recommend it. She did not like it at all, she did not eat it. When the server who was missing for most of the meal, asked if she wanted to take it to go, she said no and recommended that she not tell people to order it anymore because it was not good. She said ok and left. They did not even discount the meal that she barley touched. I know that they get busy, but it was a weekday and the customer service was disappointing. I do not plan to go back, but please try for yourself. Everyone can have an off day.

f9bLiwtk8ew1JtXpw7hg1w.text: I have had the pleasure of eating at EAT twice the both times were fabulous.  I had the shrimp and grits both times.  The grits were creamy perfect and the shrimp were huge.  It gets kind of loud around the heat of lunch (go figure), but everything else is fantastic.

XdX3gdNu5cBVavG2exVJCA.text: We were looking for a good breakfast joint near downtown vegas and pulled this up on yelp. Decided to try it based on reviews and we were not disappointed! I ordered corned beef hash which was very flavorful and cooked perfectly. It came with 4 slices of amazing sourdough toast. My husband ordered the eggs benedict. The potatoes were ok (they needed a little salt), but we both loved the eggs benedict. The hollandaise sauce was light and delicious! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the limited menu choices.

RaUv0mcKb60Q8GUgr8Lysw.text: The pancakes and Benedict are spectacular! Very cool interior with a great atmosphere and communal table. A phenomenal addition to the Vegas breakfast scene.

q5r4x6RAd9WUAvpCzi27AA.text: I had never heard of it until today. Walked in and was taken aback. I ate a roast beef sandwich... It was excellent! My friend had another type sandwich and she devoured it. What a place. A little noisy but the quality of food makes up. Right across the street from container city. It is a place to come back many more times.

T31Vz2dOzYCmDx79fzo1jQ.text: I work downtown and the choices for a delicious lunch are extremely limited. I went for lunch today and it was amazing! I ordered the Free Range Chicken Fresh mozzarella, tomato, greens and pesto mayo on ciabatta with house-made chips, a friend ordered the DWBLT Smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado with chipotle mayo on toasted sourdough, and our other friend ordered the Killer Grilled Cheese Aged cheddar on sourdough with kick-ass tomato soup - the menu online says salad, but it was a nice big bowl of tomato soup. We purposely ordered different items so that we could try them all.  They were all delicious, fresh, and made with quality ingredients. The house-made chips are a must, they are crispy, with some kind of parmesan, chive, garlic seasoning, delish!!! My favorite was the DWBLT, it is huge!! and the sourdough bread is toasted just right! The grill cheese and tomato soup was also great! The bowl of soup is large, the meal itself is very filling. Good portions for the price. My chicken sandwich was also very good, I wish the ciabatta bread was toasted a bit more, but that is just my personal preference, the bread was fresh. I couldn't really taste the pesto mayo, it could of used a bit more. Overall the food was awesome! A great find in this new downtown! It is a small restaurant, a bit loud, but the ambiance and decor makes it so hip! There is a cute long bar height table in the middle for a larger party. There is also a very nice looking courtyard for outdoor seating! I can't wait to go back for their breakfast. Overall, our experience was great, there was a bit of a wait for our server to approach our table and take our orders, our food did take sometime.. but I guess that's what happens when you eat at place that makes it all fresh! We walked there from my office - I do see how parking could be a bit of a hassle.. Just bring coins for the meters or park and walk a few blocks away! Don't let the construction across the street or the surronding buildings fool you, this is a must if you are looking for a place to eat downtown!! Wish they would deliver!!

cRIFmG6KIqO0MWaqZzxVBg.text: Get out your GPS and hunt this joint down. Well worth the trip if you are an out-of-towner in search of seriously good eats.

yK_VzD301LBLQ02hw0US6Q.text: I love eating breakfast and brunch here.  Great food and amazing ambience.

K6e1rI77Q5aBkjtSKeIbIQ.text: The food and service was great until the owner of the place came up to our table and was absolutely rude to us about using more than 2 credit cards for a party of 11. We had no idea we couldn't use more than 2 cards and there was no point of her yelling at our table and showing how sad and ungrateful she was for anyone dining there. She ruined our entire experience here. I would never come back because of the way she approached us and even was rude until we left by talking to other patrons about us. So rude.

95Wpy5-8KdNPRRzu_cqSVw.text: It's a shame that everyone doesn't get an automatic tweet when in Vegas to check this place out. Thanks for a recommendation from a fellow tweeter I found my way to eat. Skip the buffet and try this out. Had the poached eggs on hash with sourdough. Perfectly seasoned, usually reach for salt and pepper at these places but not this time. Good portion size not too much and not too little. Friendly staff, clean and quaint atmosphere.

Swrwv9xBALRA3sV0kJcEyg.text: breakfast was great - simple casual space with good honest food with nice twists and flavors.

5KIN_xMCODmzewALJ0JSPw.text: Everything we have tried here has been spectacular!  Eat is a truly special place with exceptional food, service, and ambiance!

AKA36RNoFTcwTrGV_015Gw.text: This is our new favorite breakfast place. Try the biscuits and warm strawberry compote, so good!  The staff are very friendly and helpful and the service is fast.

gt8UDLXoBYtHuehY2HcgTw.text: Delish! I ordered the tomato soup and grilled cheese which tasted like a reimagined version of my childhood favorite :) my taste buds were in heaven. The only downside was the wait but because of the size of the restaurant it's pretty understandable I waited 30 min without a reservation.

HgYWATE7JMYXkwBxL10eVA.text: Located in Downtown LV this quaint little place had a lot a character. After being sat we were immediately greeted and offered recommendations. My wife doesn't drink black coffee and after being convinced by our server she ordered it. She loved it and also bought a bag of the coffee beans. A little pricey at $15 but it is great to support a local business. We started with an order of beignets. They were absolutely amazing. Light, crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. Served along side a strawberry preserve and flavored cream cheese. It was delicious together and by itself. A definite must have. I ordered the chicken fried steak and a side pancake (another recommendation by our server). The steak was filled with gristle and hard to cut and chew. This took away from my enjoyment of the dish. The batter was light and crispy. The big plus was the gravy, absolutely delicious. Creamy with chunks of sausage, perfectly balanced, not overly creamy it oily. They claimed to have the best pancake. It was served with pure maple syrup. It looked like it was cooked in a cast iron skillet. It had crispy edges and a fluffy center. It was an absolutely perfect pancake. Next time I'm ordering just the pancake stack. This is a definite place to stop by any time you're in Vegas for breakfast or brunch.

KojoQjlkGJ9OZEWnz_txrA.text: IT says you close a 2:00 but when I came  in on Saturday at 1:40 a rude snobby lady at the front told me you were closed....You should really have on your that you close at 1:40 unprofessional and dissapointed...

ZW6g6-oLd2blQrYTooFfLA.text: Really a 3.75.  I had the shrimp and grits.  I too though they were watery like many of the reviews here.  I love shrimp and grits and have it it all over the south.  If EAT would just tighten them up a bit with some sort of cheese it would make them loads better.  My friend had the truffled egg sandwich and he said it was great.    Be warned, it's very loud so don't expect to have much of a conversation.

vcU2PPphl_-pQ45VmoGa2w.text: 3.5 stars.  What a fun place this is.  The shrimp and grits were a little bland and made watery by the fresh tomatoes in the dish; also, I found a clot or two of grits in my entree (~$11).  The side of one pancake was delightful (~$3).  It was light and fluffy and just what I expected of a pancake.  The chilaquiles were a-ok (~$11).  I wish they used thicker corn chips though.  The panko crusted deviled eggs were good (a special and not on the menu, ~$8).  The corned beef hash was pretty great and definitely didn't come out of a can (~$11).   Other important info: service was great, located in downtown, metered street parking, trendy/hipster joint, closed early, everything tastes like it was homemade and made from scratch.

FPevYqLP6ktFpbE4VEgKHA.text: 3.5/5  We came for lunch on a weekday. Wasn't too busy but service was kinda slow.   dwBLTa - smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado, with chipotle mayo on a toasted sourdough. Bread was buttery and soft, bacon crisp and thick, but couldn't really taste the chipotle mayo. Potato salad was meh.   Roast Beef - blue cheese, wild mushrooms, picked red onions, arugula, with mayo on ciabatta. Roast beef was tender and moist. The mushrooms were a great addition and added a nice sweetness. The bread was soft and warm. Satisfying sandwich. The fresh-still-warm potato chips were fantastic.

0c-k3p3d_ls-yKavCXIweQ.text: Food, great. Service, leaves something to be desired.  Food: I got the biscuits and turkey sausage, and both were great. The others I went with ordered a combination of breakfast and lunch foods, and all agreed their dishes tasted delicious.  Service: Came on a Friday, mid morning. Took about 40 minutes to be seated. Initial drink orders were taken pretty quickly, but everything after was slow. My friend got coffee served in a cup that had lipstick on it. Took forever to flag down the waitress, who took it away and then forgot to bring more. Even though the place is small, finding and getting the attention of our waitress was a challenge. I know the restaurant hasn't been around long, and it still has some kinks to work out.

lA_KOloq_GjW0pajJ9uA6A.text: Went here based off of location and reviews. It was delish, had cinnamon biscuits they were amazing with berries on top. My main meal was biscuits and gravy, it came with huge pieces of bacon and a perfectly runny yoke egg for dipping. The atmosphere was great for a random Tuesday, will be taking others there soon to share the biscuits!!!

nVB6GIkorRX8wXWXYgXfxQ.text: 4.5 stars! Love everything about this place for the most part. It has been on my bookmark list for awhile and finally got to try Eat last month. Myself and 2 other friends came after the Color Run. I was really worried the wait would be super long from the other color runners, we were told it would be half an hour, but it only ended up being 15 minutes. I already knew I wanted the chicken fried steak since it had good reviews and looked delicious from the pictures on here. I also ordered passion tea, which was okay I wish I would of ordered the strawberry drink instead. I was very pleased with the chicken fried steak, the breading was well seasoned and it was a huge piece, a sharable portion. The gravy and seasoned potatoes went with it pretty well too. I ordered the house made chips instead of eggs and I was really disappointed because they look good in the pictures but didn't have the texture I was hoping for. I also had the English muffin as my side, which was nothing spectacular. My 2 other friends both ordered the chilaquiles scrambled eggs, they were both kinda whatever about it because they didn't expect it to be vegetarian. I did I have a bite and liked it, but I always welcome vegetarian options in my diet.  The inside is awesome, hipster type of fare I must say. I cannot wait to come back, I just don't know what I'll order because everything else looks so delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits with strawberry compote
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with English muffin.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion iced tea (unsweetened)

r6CIkF_6etJC0WZwlr4PSw.text: I have never felt the urge to write a review before, but I've noticed that Eat has more positive reviews than it deserves, while most of the negative reviews are buried in the "not recommended" section although they paint pictures similar to my experience.  The atmosphere is nice, but the service and food are mediocre at best. My party of 3 arrived and were met with a line where no one had been asked for names or the number of people in their party yet. The hostess milled around and offered no explanation. We waited 30 minutes even though there were several empty tables. Again, the hostess offered no explanation. A party of two who came in after three other parties of two-three people was seated prior to us because they asked to sit at the counter (which was never offered as an option to the parties who arrived before). Once the food came, the hostess approached and asked if we needed boxes for our food before we'd taken a collective five bites. We waited about thirty minutes for our check after asking two different people: this was weird because they obviously needed the table...

e0y2fWbzck04nMoZSijnIA.text: THE BEST!  Had the rwblta it was so delicious! Added cheese for $1! Fiance had the truffle egg sandwich which was inhaled on site! Great service! Our waiter was so nice extremely friendly and mad great suggestions! Must try the tomato salad with the RWBLTA and the ginger ale!

yf0wSdtyVoI4Y1xYGilVQw.text: Great place to eat at, eggs potatoes were well done and the wheat bread was nice and soft. Looked very fresh. Will come back and eat here!

JuItUIpb5aKpo_bxfgzmDg.text: Yummy! I love discovering wonderful new places off strip, and eat. was definitely a wonderful new discovery! It came recommended by my roommate as somewhere to try for brunch, so we made it a point to go as our last meal of the trip. The place was definitely busy, and for a group of 4 on a Sunday around noon, it was a good 15-20 minute wait at least? The food was worth it though. The portions are generous and the price is inexpensive! I got the grilled cheese and asked them to shove a side of bacon into it, and they were more than happy to accommodate me! Think 2 huge french toast slides grilled to crispy golden perfection, but still incredibly soft on the inside, with a big pile of crispy bacon with yummy cheddar cheese in the middle! The thing was huge, I only needed half of the sandwich to fill up! It came with a yummy tomato salad on the side, and if you know me, tomatoes, bacon and grilled cheese is possibly the best combination ever. I also tried their pancakes, and for $9 you get 3 huge fluffy pancakes that are serious some of the fluffiest melt in your mouth pancakes I've tasted! Definitely worth the price!  Staff are friendly and the restaurant is dog friendly too! Love love love!

hJ1R2GNIMyCMnrbZX1amKQ.text: Located in downtown Vegas. Our server (I can't recall his name) was fun and attentive. Great spot to have a quick lunch with friends. Try the grits!

buRXpynSSoFCwKAoy3rseQ.text: I had the Huevos Motulenos and my partner had the Downtown Benedict Special (we switched plates halfway). The eggs were perfectly done and the bananas were an unexpectedly welcome addition to the palate. The Benedict had a flawless hollandaise with fantastic flavors and perfect proportions. The hipster vibe was super comfortable and Lauren provided excellent service. We will definitely stop again if ever we return to Vegas!

7btWcIzV_OjzMIn5AibBeQ.text: This is my second visit. I just had the Huevos Motulenos, and it was exquisite. If I had to guess it's origin, I'd say Cuba (but maybe somewhere in Central America, because people tend to liken Cuban foods with blandness). It was an unlikely mix of eggs, black beans, PEAS, and sauteed bananas. Crazy, right? Well, it worked!   I should have asked for more tortillas. It was a shame to let that salsa and yolk return to the Earth. One of the reasons I made the decision to come back was that the coffee and juice are fresh and definitely on point. Didn't need to add anything to the coffee, so that says a lot.   The only reason that I didn't rate all five stars is that there is no free parking (Downtown blues, ugh) and they open at 8am. It's hard to consider it an actual breakfast place when it opens halfway into breakfast time. ;)   Great job, guys! I'll be eating at eat again, that's for sure.

_YNO8haIj95brd_u3e5mqA.text: What a delicious place! We were downtown for the day, trying to escape the Strip experience, and found this little spot. I got the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup. The other people I was with got shrimp & grits, pancakes, and chicken fried steak so I was able to sample a little bit of everything.  The grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup was great! The sandwich was nice and thick and the cheese was nice and melty. I felt a bit ridiculous eating hot soup when it was 100+ degrees out, but I do love tomato soup and ended up scarfing down the whole thing.  The shrimp and grits were good as well and the pancakes came with sausages which was a nice touch. I've never had a chicken fried steak I've liked, so I'm a bad judge as to how the one at eat. compares but the guy who ordered it had no complaints. Our waitress was extremely hospitable as well! Highly recommended!!!

H3umn0q4W-9tLZscOQ4iAA.text: Swanky breakfast/lunch place downtown. I would say brunch HOWEVER we all know the quintessential brunch item is a mimosa... They don't have this.  So! The PIC & I ventured through the urban jungle that is DTLV & walked in. We were promptly greeted by the hostess and seated. Browsed through the menu, and got the cinnamon strawberry biscuits. WOW order these, you will not be disappointed.   For the main entrees we got the truffled egg sandwich. Yum, really good & the chive potatoes that accompany their breakfast dishes are on point. The grilled cheese with tomato bisque is delish as well.   Why not 5 stars? Service can be improved just a bit & some of their more popular items (the chicken fried steak) should be available all day. Nonetheless, I will be back.

_upx2JfEef_ArWHh-FY3wA.text: The food and the quality is amazing here! Prob the best breakfast we had in Vegas. I had eggs Benedict and husband had corned beef hash. Both meals were  if we are ever in Vegas again we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash with Amazing Jam for the toast
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Florentine style eggs Benedict

nE_VBNUrj-FTgdaSvaYAfg.text: Amazing food here! Split the breakfast sandwich and shrimp& grits both of them were excellent. Great service, quaint comforting space.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits with strawberry compote!

B2Du4g4hS32rbX5LjBqZ9g.text: Golden brown pancakes, best pancakes in Vegas. Beats the pants off of chains like IHop and Denny's. I also had a side of chived smashed potatoes, also very good.  Service was excellent.   Warning: They do not have sugar free syrup! I was eating here post workout, so I didn't mind having the simple sugar from their pure maple syrup. This is a great spot. Would make the drive to eat here again.

6nWlyH8yxuvr1_wRprA_3w.text: Lovely meal!   It's been so long since we ate here that we cannot remember what we had, but we remember the owner being a doll and the food was divine!   Local. Small. Fantastic.   Go, you!

r2cYUO5GROiw4cFniqb3Gg.text: My husband and I went here for breakfast after hearing good things and seeing Anthony Bourdain go there. We were not disappointed! Really nice atmosphere, great service. We started off with the cinnamon biscuits and berries- a must try! They tasted as good as they looked. The strawberry sauce was not overpoweringly sweet; it was just right. Since it was Good Friday and I don't eat meat on Fridays during Lent, had the steelcut oats which had sugared pecans, strawberries, and apples. Not too sweet, and a large portion. My husband had the chilaquiles which looked, and according to him, tasted amazing! I was a little envious. We would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steel cut oats at eat.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles at eat.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits &amp; berries

RqTpMMsYSyB__ojVh3QcJA.text: Best brunch in town! Super friendly staff and the food was delicious, served within 15 minute of ordering. It's a must try!

SMMingWEQ2pbYgFlRhDq1w.text: Nice place for breakfast for sure. The hash (when they have it) is the star of the show. Like the pancakes as well but the syrup comes in a very small little container. All in All very solid place and worth checking out!

uYr3Dgtbw9IveC_SqAWJuw.text: My family are locals so they found this little gem .... its packed allll the time it is a awesome spot,  the waiters are edgy and nice, they have live music sometimes  i got the pancakes and sausage they were good and they serve REAL maple syrup holla.. u can see the kitchen so u know everything is clean and u can see what they're doing back there  would def go back and its a must try

WVSgCuN_WtVa8T4vskOHPA.text: Eat is a new restaurant one block east and one block south of the El Cortez.  First of all, I don't care much for the name.  Too clever by half.  But I'm here for the grub, so I'll overlook the too trendy, too cute name.  Dined at Eat early on a weekday morning, there were only three other customers.  This gave me a chance to talk with my server, the manager, and the owner.  Everyone was very nice.  Sat at the counter and ordered the huevos motulenos.  They tasted fabulous (lots of flavor going on here!) and the presentation was perfect.  The manager DID make the chef re-plate my food and made sure I saw him do it, which was kind of pretentious in retrospect.  The space feels urban and trendy and doesn't fit in with the run down (but improving) neighborhood surrounding the restaurant.  I'll be back, hopefully for brunch.  Lots of interesting items on the menu.  You should try it.  ---------------------------  Here's an actual conversation I had with a Middle-Aged Lady with Wild Hair (MALWWH) on my way back to Fremont.  I was about to cross the street against the light.  MALWWH:  Hey, don't do that! Me:  What? MALWWH:  Don't cross against the light!  The cops will arrest you and take you to jail, and they won't let you go until you give them $35. Me:  Really? MALWWH:  Yeah.  Like the cops don't have anything better to do.  Don't they see all the f-ing crackheads around here? Me:  Well, it wouldn't be that big of a deal - I've got $35. MALWWH:  Don't tell anyone you have $35...they'll take it from you! Me:  LOL

t9MjYbA-RtZTniEnJ8nliQ.text: Solid local vibe.  Walked there from Fremont St.  Area is a bit sketchy, but it's Vegas.  Enjoyed the food. Would go back.

Ojt3hQClL1h_J5tifDwufg.text: Add me to the list of people who LOVE this place.  I had the Huevos Motulenos - I don't think there is any other restaurant in LV that offers a breakfast this flavorful and unique.  The atmosphere was cool and the selection of tea was awesome.  If you have not checked this place out yet, you totally should!

eNINxc9olH4bxWYIXYrxKA.text: Came at lunch after hearing great things from friends. So happy to get a cute restaurant downtown in LV! Ordered the chicken pot pie- ( they apparently only make 12 a day, so I was glad I got there early) It was sensational! The pie crust was out of this world .. all in all delicious.   Wished they had desserts- they should definitely add as i am sure they would be fantastic!  Owner stopped by and chatted with us - everyone was very friendly.  Great original place to eat in Vegas :)

RHoH6QndLgE7sUFNPQ11mQ.text: If you enjoy week or weeks old food out of Boxes and bags this is your spot.....  The prison cafeteria would be a step up from here.... Service would be better too

-vtZ5eNAX5Ia5bu5oCKf1w.text: Best place to eat in Vegas. Might be the only place I eat in Vegas from on. Amazing food, great service, very friendly staff. Didn't expect this in the land of disgusting buffets and $10 prime rib!

NITZAuKChRCPT_Fm2I4q-g.text: Such a good breakfast place.  It's a small restaurant and can get kind of loud inside but it's definitely worth a try.  I had the truffle egg and bacon sandwich with some avocado.  Such a good hearty sand which with the breakfast potatoes on the side.  You can definitely taste the awesome truffle flavor .  Also the coffee is worth a try along with the cinnamon biscuits with fruit. Can't wait to try other things from their menu.  Staff was very friendly :).

fbRUznGfyJaFGazmS6vSiA.text: I have been told many times to get here! I finally made it! Me and wife for breakfast! Simple! Refreshing for the food scene and we will be back! Had the truffled egg sandwich, very clean and good, wife had killer grilled cheese that was crazy good! Very inspiring atmosphere!

pb3qp6sBF5wlzdlg5W6uWA.text: I saw this place featured in a spread in Sunset magazine and that's when I began looking for good ole Yelp reviews to confirm Sunset's accolades. Turns out Yelpers love this place, and why wouldn't they?   The location is off the beaten path, just in the outskirts of Fremont street situated on the corner of an obscure corner of LV.  We walked to the restaurant from the Golden Nugget and we were second guessing our sense of direction. However, when we saw a line and more people heading toward the corner we knew we had reached our destination.    The wait was a litttttle on the ridiculous side. But, we were finally seated and the waiter was really nice and friendly. Everything we ordered was delicious. The first round of coffee was blegh, but they redeemed themselves on the second round.  Don't expect to get your mimosa fix at the restaurant though, no alcohol served.

xoXnCoQ0OjrgAU7Z8gLCcA.text: You want a unique cuisine in a hip place in Vegas, come to Eat. The food is honestly so different, I am not educated enough in the culinary arts to describe it. However, I am pretty good at guessing when some food will be too strange for many, and this is not that place. So, be prepared to go to a fun place and try some food you may never have had before and love it. Then step out and enjoy Downtown Las Vegas!

sjaFiig_c0rfxBvuXHmpOA.text: Eat never disappoints. The best pancakes ever! Somehow they manage to create light, fluffy cakes with perfectly crisp golden goodness on the outside. I've never had a bad meal here. From breakfast to brunch to sandwiches that always satisfy. Eat is an oasis in Downtown Las Vegas

o5n80LrZU5H_NmTz-Ig-hQ.text: Just met Natalie. Like this place!  The food was decent here but the service, decor and vibe made up for it pushing me to give it a 4 star.   Natalie is the owner and she is awesome. Probably go back for her and the good tunes.

LCWvF7ATa2PqhqjnniPiOA.text: Great little spot near downtown Las Vegas! Food was great. Service was friendly. I would recommend the truffle egg sandwich and the stack of pancakes side dish. Both were delicious!!

IonQ4Eg6KPya8oiqDmkP_w.text: Good service, clean atmosphere, and interesting concept.  I liked that a counter was available with a great view of the kitchen action.  Great pancakes! Some of the best in Las Vegas (stiff completion with DuPar's and Babystacks).  Pancakes are as good as advertised.  Golden brown, crispy edges, well cooked middle, fresh-tasting batter.  Nice touch serving real maple syrup and a seasonal fruit garnish.  Unfortunately, the chicken fried steak I had didn't live up to expectations.  The meat had tough spots that made it hard to cut and eat.  The gravy is not the classic white gravy I like, but a brown gravy with a green herb and scallions (?).  The gravy had plenty of sausage, but the green herbs/scallions dominated the flavor...which I disliked.  I think it was fried in a fryer, while I prefer my chicken-fried steak be pan fried.  I would stick with the pancakes or try one of their unique breakfast dishes on my next visit.  The place is somewhat pricey ($9 for three pancakes and a sausage).

JA2GGZQm1a5UotMzDZdrHw.text: Had the shrimp p'boy and I was extremely impressed. When the dish first arrived I had a mixed reaction. It was a colorful sandwich, but very simple looking and the shrimp were not fried. I felt slightly dubious, but the first bite blew all my doubts out the water. This sandwich is a perfect mix of sweet, spicy, and salty, with perfect texture. The chef has mastered the transformation and balance of fresh ingredients and demonstrates it well with this simple, unassuming sandwich bursting with flavor. My wife ordered the chicken fried steak and my mother in law ordered the corn beef hash. My son got a single pancake and applewood sausage. Everything was excellent, but I felt my sandwich was exceptional. I highly recommend this place.

CKDx19xWvB5XEPK_VQG8tw.text: I've been here twice and gotten the free range chicken sandwich with their homemade chips. The food is amazing and the ambience is really cool. The last time I was there, there was a live band and it was a lot of fun. The only downside I  see is that they are only open for breakfast and lunch.

n_iDJyct4yfsBWQeClOHcA.text: Huge dissapointment. Seems to me its just a trendy place to go for now with nothing to really back it. The staff was nice. Once waiting 30 mins for a table, the resturant itself is a little too cramped for my liking, and it was so stuffy inside. Besides that, the menu was too small to choose from for a Sunday brunch. I had the pancakes and my friend had the corned beef and hash. Neither was nothing to write home about. Mediocre food with high prices. Wont be going back.

waCRoAc-72Q0tOEMFJ7jJQ.text: Great service  Cool atmosphere  Good food  Cool Downtown spot !!

oji1HlaiZLZri0FNYgsv5g.text: great for breakfast/brunch.  there was a short wait when we went.  the bread is very tasty.  I had a huge grilled cheese sandwich; the tomato soup was a bit thin for my taste, but the flavor was good. the atmosphere was cheerful and the art was instagrammable :)

ojJ73JilHUDlLLVPS1s8yQ.text: We were visiting from Texas and made a point to stop in for breakfast.  The food was outstanding and the service was very friendly.  Even the owner took the time to talk to us.  We both had the chicken fried steak and eggs.  I can not stress enough how great it was.  Perfect crispy steak, creamy flavorful country gravy with a side of potatoes and eggs to order.  We will not make another trip to Las Vegas without visiting eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chicken Fried Steak is out of this world.  Maybe the best I have had, and living in Texas I have eaten a lot of them.

pN-kQu8jbKyi3F41lrphng.text: Awesome brunch spot in downtown. Friendly, attentive staff, fun, inventive and tasty food, and a cool location. I spend a lot of time in Vegas for work and this is my new go-to spot. I love that downtown has all these new, independent businesses popping up left and right. Eat is a stones throw from Container Park (another cool local business hotspot) and I haven't seen a brunch menu this creative in awhile. Coffee is great too! Check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

q_pe0CLEDnHg4dcgrV6ZaA.text: Cute place and great service. Loved the cinnamon biscuits! I also had the breakfast sandwich, but it was a bit too greasy for my liking. The food is fresh and high quality and the vibe is great. Looking forward to going back.

uip2yXbzgU_PoQ_0hLI6AA.text: Went here for the first time with my friend and loved it!  Simple menu, with great choices. Was very impressed that such simple food could be dressed up at taste so good! I got the soup that resembles posole, was probably the most disappointing thing I got, but still good. A very subtle spiciness everyone could enjoy.  I also got the spinach salad. Strawberries, pecans, feta, and onions. The option was available to add chicken or shrimp, but they were not necessary. The salad was perfect! The best thing I got, and I would enjoy to get it again, or get these ingredients and make the salad at home. Don't use to much of the dressing though :-) I also got the two egg  meal. I got them poached. Delightful eggs, amazing toast, and a perfect amount of potatoes. Bacon is crispy, and well made. The service was quick, they brought everything out to my friend and I in rounds, ( we each got 3 things). The things were placed in front of us with perfect timing between meals, and the busses were on top of clearing the table.  Didn't get a chance to try the savory menu ( it's only before 11) but will definitely be back to try that.

uJSVOTEcXUtWsB8TtjGKBw.text: Really glad that the truffle egg sandwich is back on the weekend menu! The service is great and it's a really cute space. Portions are quite large, so you definitely won't leave hungry. My friend had the shrimp and grits, which she really enjoyed and my brother loved the chicken fried steak. We also tried some cinnamon biscuits for the table, at our servers suggestion. They were pretty good, too.

Ofo63yyZwwDU5fpZ1ME2cw.text: While in Vegas we were looking for places to eat off the strip that a foodie would love. I read lots of reviews and decided to give EAT a try. In the downtown area, this little place is worth the drive. We went on a Wednesday around 10a.m. so there was no wait and we were seated right away. Staff was friendly and attentive. My husband went for the chicken fried steak. It was huge and fantastic! Crunchy coating, meat was cooked perfectly and the sauce was one of the best I've tasted. Served with potatoes this is a belly buster for sure. I opted for the Shrimp Po boy...good choice! Absolutely delicious. No fried or bay shrimp here. This was large juicy, perfectly cooked shrimp in an excellent tangy dressing. Served with freshly made potato chips this was enough for two...but I ate the whole thing...I couldn't help myself. Wasn't hungry till later that night.  There were lots of other things I wanted to try on the menu so we will definitely be going back next time we are in Vegas.

sUGKXJZvfHRygOGp1c4BZA.text: Cinnamon Biscuits with a strawberry compote, and their truffled egg sandwich (Bomb).   I would give it 5 stars, but our service wasn't on par. We had asked our waitress multiple times for iced tea and water, and she kept forgetting. Plus, we were only checked on 3 times from when we sat down, to when we left. But all around, this is a great place to eat downtown. Great environment and friendly staff.

n521eTTcuQQnvNFfeWv7AQ.text: By BF decided to try this spot out on our last morning in Vegas. And I am so glad we did. We went on a Sunday...mid morning. I was expecting a huge wait. Considering this was prime brunch hours we ended up waiting 30 minutes, which isn't too bad. coffee was excellent! I love a good cup of joe. My BF ordered the corn beef hash. It came with poached eggs and these lovely pieces of toast that was oh so good. I got the golden brown pancakes which were sooooooo good. I love the buttery golden brown crust that they had. I honesty didn't need syrup as the cake themselves was bursting with sweetness. I would have given a 5 star rating however the service could have been a lot better. Our waitress only came by once, and the person who took our orders was the bartender....which i thought was weird.

ctfoAcDPREWkSyzeiUEjIw.text: I went here on my first (and possibly last) trip to Las Vegas, and boy was it a welcome change from the mediocre excess of the Strip.  Well worth the trip Downtown (just make sure the cabbies don't rip you off, which they're better at doing than driving).    We had the green chile posole and wedge salad and both were very tasty with high-quality ingredients. The posole had just the right amount of spice and had ample, good-quality meat.  Both portion sizes were very generous and appropriate to the price, which was reasonable. The service was quick, friendly, and attentive.  The decor of this place is refreshingly normal and clean-looking.  It's about the furthest thing you'll find from typical LV fare, which is tailor made for either poseur high-roller wannabes or smokers on oxygen tanks with no remaining sense of taste.  My only regret is that we didn't have the opportunity to try more dishes or come back for breakfast. If you're in Vegas, GO.

jaxx421RrkbDyb96zmBBdA.text: Hands down the best breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas.  We drive 35 mins to have breakfast at this location.  The owner/chef has tremendous food pride in her menu and establishment.  She has an amazing sense of savory and texture and of course chooses to serve up high quality ingredients to her patrons.   Whether you order Shirmp and Grits, Benedict or just plain old eggs, you will be served up the most delicious morning experience of  'wonderfulness'.  The atmosphere has an urban/rustic feel to it with a splash vintage elegance.  My only complaint is that  EAT is not open for dinner -- serving breakfast.  lol.  Parking is off street, easy and convenient. It isn't uncommon to see the proprietor enjoying fresh air seated on the bench in front of this gem of a restaurant.

T1DIE3B41Y4wW9HNnAKRbA.text: I really enjoyed this place get the shrimp and grits it was amazing tell them to add cheese

3xEIopEZcSABusvkENvg3g.text: I really wanted to like this place.. It is trendy place with a good vibe.  But.... While the service was great the food was average at best.  I got Shrimp and Grits, the presentation was awesome but the food lacked flavor, the shrimp were medium sized and the grits were awful, clumpy and tasted instant. For the price ... My expectations were much, much higher.  My friend got the hash and again looked nice but once you dug in... All you got was very expensive fried potatoes. Not sure I will give them another chance.. Their prices are just to high to get average food.

cCvK6qaeL-FvItOBDCu8Ng.text: Pleasant fare at a fair price. I ate lunch here twice in three days if that's any indicator. It's a short walk on a nice day from old Vegas. #1 was the BLT with avocado and chicken-chili soup. Lunch #2 was a simple breakfast. The bacon in both instances  was memorable but everything, including the service, was consistently good. None of my dining companions had anything negative to say about their meals either.

dpTBXvjHKM3PquKyHAbc2Q.text: I've come here before and service was great. This time, service was terrible. Gary (I think was his name) comes to the table and goes "what do you want?" No "HI", no nothing. Then after he brought our food out, he kept walking past us over and over like we didn't exist. When we finally asked for the check and a bag, he seemed very annoyed like we were bothering him....mind you he never checked on us once. This was extremely disappointing because I suggested this place to my mom for a celebration breakfast she wanted to take me to (based on a past experience I had here which was great) and Gary completely ruined it. We did mention it to the manager, and she did apologize, but this is so unacceptable. I work in the service industry and you just don't behave this way. If it's that hard to behave like a decent human being at work, do yourself a favor and get out of the customer service industry. I'm paying for a great experience all around, not for someone to act like I'm bothering them at home. Get real. Ugh! So sad this happened, we really wanted to enjoy it because the food is good, but I'll think twice about coming back now.

aC41Q8n-NDlKHrc7FManNQ.text: I had breakfast at the bar here one beautiful Sunday morning. I had the pancakes with bacon. I didn't realize how large the pancakes were going to be. It was so good that I didn't wan to stop eating them. The bacon was cooked to perfection. It's a nice little place and awesome for people watching which I love to do. I will be returning. This may just become my favorite breakfast spot.

4wsbXwq2Y8EB7LQS0Ix6kg.text: Great place... I love it the cinnamon biscuits are the best. I eat there almost every week great food and wonderful service

kli4WYX9LyOL28oNrFujQg.text: By far my favorite place to eat in Vegas after living here for 8 months and trying so many new places. The vibe is cozy like a Seattle coffee shop, the food is divine, and the owner walks through the small dining area talking with guests. I love everything about this place. 5 stars all the way.

IrQQmbPCoIjCECQ0ZzDNig.text: Very pleasant surprise!  Food was creative and mad my mouth happy.  We are already thinking about having breakfast tomorrow!

ryzM2UDNwP1-hceKe2fJSw.text: Delicious breakfast off the strip! Friendly and fast service. You need to try the huevos - we weren't sure given the addition of the bananas but somehow it worked and was delicious. Definitely worth the trip!

3B1TQxi0lC0PTosZhy22Hg.text: The  shrimp and grits  were the most flavorful I've had. The shrimp was  topped with a pico and the gits were in a flavorful broth from the shrimp. Shrimp perfectly  cooked. Portion were of good  size. Service  was quick. Definitely  would eat  here again.

ULgPhUDjTf-DRyumFf1Rcg.text: This is great food, I am a corn beef hash snob. These guys have their own take on a classic and the do it deliciously. You can see the food being prepared and the quality ingredients they use.

wgZDOyUG1uZ1qyzacZ0yYw.text: Brilliant service and awesome food! Best brunch place!! The best pancakes I have ever tasted! Service is excellent....big plus...u have a charging point inside at every other table almost which is awesome ;)

ayyaTL3_cQgS-CyzTTl7dA.text: The pancakes are AMAZING....crunchy of the edges and so damn fluffy.  The best pancakes I ever had...granted I don't eat much pancakes but these were the bomb.    The waitstaff was awesomely amazing as well.  We ordered the eggs Benedict and the pancakes to share.  The Benedict was fresh and the potatoes was yummy.  The plates came to our table hot, so you know if was not just sitting back there for awhile.  I love my food hot.    The waitstaff was awesome because they brought us an extra plate without us asking and they replaced my plate when he saw we were going to share the pancakes and wanted me to have a clean plate.  Love it.  Great experience here with great food.  This place is such a hipster place...u could not tell from the outside or where it is located.

grFfSPfrGnYOq1dQiR-tRQ.text: Bf and I were on vacay in Las Vegas from California, I was yelping good restaurants to eat around the area & this came out ..we went on a weekend ...it was packed, we waiting for about 15min & sat in the bar. Food was quick in about 10min it was out, regardless of how packed they were. I also liked how they had a bucket of cold water for people to drink outside while they waited to get seated. The food was spectacular & the service was amazing. A little on the pricey side ($50.00 for two peeps)  but overall great experience!

stifIMEIPfDQ5ccZzBBiFw.text: My love for brunch drove me to this spot. Its tucked away outside the strip (close to old town). The atmosphere and food is what will bring me back, oh and did i mention service. On the sweet side, I got pancakes, which were cloud soft and tasty. Hope they had fresh maple syrup. On the savory side, I got truffle egg sandwich, which was burst of flavor combination that I hadn't imagined. It was slowly cooked in truffle oil, which you could taste in every bite. Highly recommended spot to checkout, pictures can't capture the tasty goodness.

4Xv1PkR_G4Y1-14vFpLnOw.text: Decent brunch food, very friendly service.  Shrimp and grits! - plain grits (not cheesy or flavorful on it's own) in a light broth that tasted slightly like the sauteed shrimp. Eggs were nice and runny just how I like. the shrimp was the star of the dish.  it was a little garlicky, a little smokey, and quite juicy.  however it only came with 6 pieces.  Shrimp po boy  - Yummy shrimp with a bit of heat, with crispy bread and a pickle and veggies in the middle. the potato salad that came with it was very plain. there was super salty chip stuck in the middle of it. Weird how some thing have flavors and others don't  Service was great!  I felt very well taken care of and the staff was very nice  The food itself was OK and just a little bit above average overall (i would say 3.5 stars), however due to great service i'd have to give this place a 4 due to awesome service!  maybe next time i'll wake up early for their breakfast!

YS-QfBmlk8Khq_x4nlWE9w.text: I chose to eat at Eat for my birthday breakfast.  We got there probably around 10AM on a Wednesday morning.  The restaurant was half full and despite there being a plethora  of places to sit we were sat at a tiny two top.  When we asked if we could sit on the other side of the restaurant we were told "it is reserved for when we get busy" not the welcome that one would expect for a little boutique spot.    I ordered the pancakes which came with a tiny jar of maple syrup and one packet of butter.  Almost laughable.  When I asked our waiter if I could have more he looked a bit taken aback like I had belched in his face.  He wasn't extremely friendly but he was helpful telling my girlfriend to not order the shrimp and grits over the chilaquiles.  The chilaquiles were much better than my pancakes.    When we were about half way through our meal our server unceremoniously dropped the check on our table.  Having been a server in one of my many past lives, I don't care for having the bill brought before I ask for it.    The pancakes did reheat well, which I enjoyed with an abundance of butter and maple syrup when I ate them at home.

YgXUy22-DADlCuiqGTUlvA.text: Fast service and good food. Very cool vibe.  I had the huevos rancheros ($11) very interesting flavor.  It's sort of just a hot mess, with salsa beans, eggs, peas, tortillas and potatoes. The flavor was great.  My girl had the short stack pancakes, which was only $5, cheap date. The pancakes were a tad dry and just not enough syrup. The soft drinks where the typical Vegas price $3 , ouch.  Overall a great place to eat breakfast or lunch just a short walk from Fremont st.  They are right next to the new container park, which is cool.  I would defiantly eat here again.

i_LZpL4bLdoqotamfWsbkg.text: I really enjoy the brunch here. It's good though it has a bit too much of a hipster vibe. The food is not amazingly stand out, though the beignets I recently had were pretty amazing.  It's a nice place for a casual lunch as well if you have the time. During the week it can be a bit busy for lunch though so be warned.

A0FjyzhZ66bsExjthkmK4w.text: I had the deviled eggs and the shrimp "po'boy".  The deviled eggs are good and unique, they deep fry the white part and then put the yolk on.  Really good but not worth  $8.  The shrimp "po'boy" was tasty but not a po'boy. The tomato was soggy, the were hardly any shrimp, the bread was wrong.  It tasted fresh but I wouldn't call it a shrimp po'boy by any means.  Not worth $14 either.

bmWFhzAuYiBOMDzQsl9ekQ.text: Must try this place.  Their breakfast is as good as any 5 stars hotel on the strip in Vegas.  Price is very reasonable. Service is good.  Very friendly staff.  I had Deep-fried deviled eggs and pancake.  They put may spicy ketcup, mayo and bacon over the fried eggs.   They were outstanding.  The pancake was pan-fried crispy on the top but soft inside.  It was the best pancake I had so far.

qYpivKA5FmLt3iZHLEI4Lg.text: Killer Cheese with thick-cut applewood smoked bacon and avocado, with a Bruce Cost Ginger Ale Unfiltered is probably one of the best meals here in Las Vegas. Everything felt fresh and wholesome. Staff is also quite friendly!

vA8UR1DSsU12b_BOATnzAg.text: The food was great and our drink server was awesome!  But our main server Gary sucked!!!  One of the most rude waiters I have ever had.  Who comes up to a table and just says "what".  Really!  The server Gary just destroyed my experience here at Eat.  Won't be coming here anymore.

6WO2PZ0Lw0JfCkjS6vDNHQ.text: It's funny reading other Yelp reviews about how this place is located in a sketchy part of the neighborhood makes me think these people must not have been to the older version of the Lower East Side in New York City. True, this part of Las Vegas isn't part of the Strip and it doesn't have the frills of big hotels and casinos - but that's the beauty of Downtown. I love that the restaurants around here still carries the vibe of old Las Vegas.   Eat is no exception - it's located on the corner of an old apartment complex. The decor is very unpretentious nor is it trying to be hipster. It's very clean with an open kitchen concept. The staff is friendly and so is the owner, Natalie.   We came here on a Sunday morning, expecting a long wait. I guess we came at a perfect time because everyone else must have been asleep or something coz there was no line at all. The bar counter had seats available which was perfect coz that's where we preferred to sit anyway.   We ordered the Corned Beef Hash, the Strawberry Biscuits and BLT with tomato salad.  The corned beef was really good - just the right balance of saltiness and it was also quite tender. Also I liked that it didn't have too much potatoes. I could also tell that they source their bread from a good purveyor coz I loved how their sour dough tasted. I took a bite of my friend's BLT - delish!  And I'm finicky about the coffee in breakfast places coz 8 out 10 places don't serve good coffee. This place certainly cares about the coffee they serve their patrons. Love their coffee!  I take mine decaf - but it was still full bodied. It's really good, they even have them in packages for people to buy!  Reviewers complaining about the prices being high - I don't really care about that. I would much rather spend money on good food than waste a few dollars on lousy food. This place doesn't take shortcuts on preparing their food and the ingredients that they use. And that takes money hence the price is reflective of that. Now if they charged high and served crappy food, that's another story.   This place is certainly worth my money. I shall be back.

gUPFw7wWowsKQnEBJ3Hsqg.text: Glad we woke up a bit early to get here before a larger crowd arrivedd.  We got seated right at the bar in front of the kitchen so we could watch a live Hell Kitchen like in action!  Definitely entertaining to see how all the chefs work together in a small area to make all those delicious food for all the customers in the restaurant.  Our server Jordan was very friendly and provided great service.  We ordered the Truffle Egg Sandwich and Cinnamon biscuits.  Generous portion that filled both me and my hubby up.  Great brunch place!  Highly recommend!

px287-RC7z6iSbLrli3dfA.text: Awesome awesome awesome. Not only was the service spectacular but the food was even better. It didn't cost an arm and a leg either. Great coffee, and almost everything is made from scratch. Christina was our server and she was excellent. Definitely stop by here it's worth the 20 minute wait for breakfast or lunch

tHSDMezdpTuBTfRgjN5yPA.text: A bit off the path near old downtown Las Vegas, across of the container park shops.  Reminds me of Outerlands in SF or some of the other rustic brunch eats in Portland.  The area and staff have the hipster/artsy thing going, fits the atmosphere.  High recommend for breakfast-lunch.  Large fluffy pancakes with sausages, a breakfast sandwich to die for, and hash/eggs that will burn your socks off (ask for the jalepenos on the side), all so good, so satisfying!

a0tYLml0bCbarPyx6iXKfA.text: We decided to try a new place based on the reviews and thought we may have found a new spot.  The service was awesome and everyone there was friendly and helpful!  The food though was mediocre at best.  The truffle mushroom sandwich was not very flavorful.  The mushrooms tasted and looked like they had been cooked in a large batch and then thrown on top.  The potatoes were not very good either overcooked with burnt chips scattered throughout.   The Huevos was an unusual combination and probably good if you like the strange combination of flavors.  We should have read the menu more closely, the peas were out of place. Unfortunately, this will not be our new goto breakfast spot :(

ZhW5zMbxn0XesG_U1Y7U_w.text: Awesome! Great food. Very flavorful. The menu is small....that's a good thing. We had breakfast there on a trip to Vegas. From the coffee to shrimp and grits. You can't go wrong. "Eat" here!

4wcwlET-yCWMYBViyXwEnw.text: I heard great things about this place and really wanted to like it, but it disappointed me, both in food and service.  The location didn't bother me as it seemed to bother other reviewers. You have to pay for parking which is inconvenient if you don't have change, but I was willing to do that if the food was good. Sadly, it wasn't.  First of all our server was very aggressive. He put his hand on the back of my chair and leaned in close to my personal space. He creeped me out. I appreciate friendliness but I don't appreciate you getting really close to me. My husband noticed it right away too.  We had coffee while waiting for our order. It wasn't horrible or anything- I've had much worse- but it tasted over extracted, like they were skimping on the amount of coffee used to brew it. At $3 a cup (yep, $6 in total for two mugs of coffee), it should taste better than that.  My husband ordered shrimp & grits and he loved it. He ordered it because that's the dish he heard others raving about.  I ordered the eggs benedict and holy moly, the sauce was SOUR! Not a good kind of sour either. The bacon was also limp and chewy. Yes, it was turkey bacon, which I eat at home all the time, but it didn't even taste like it was cooked. It was really gross.  The serving size was small, but that wouldn't have bothered me if the food actually tasted good. I don't like stuffing myself with huge portions at breakfast, but it's hard to not feel ripped off when you paid $13 for english muffins with limp bacon and sour hollandaise sauce.  The ambience was cool and hipster-ish. I think it's cool that they let their waiters have tattoos and dyed hair, but that doesn't make the food taste better or the waiter less creepy. Also the music was far too loud, my husband and I could barely have a conversation.  Final verdict: waste of money for now. The place is new, maybe they'll work the kinks out. If they changed a few things this place could be great but I'm not returning for now.

7-JFtd9UIIl_P1NioF2YlQ.text: Found this with the help and reviews on Yelp. Our lunch was delicious. I had the chicken sandwich and my husband had the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The soup was excellent. The sandwich was good but I liked my chicken sandwich more. Great service. We will definitely go back next time we are in Vegas! The only thing I would like to suggest is that you work on your regular coffee. The decaf was good, but my husband's regular was very weak and he couldn't drink it.

kmz6acH-zZ-3BjfXI1-tIw.text: Sit outside if you can.  Chicken fried steak is some of the best.  Bread is also very good.   Go hungry, leave happy.

hnYXsXgLOzdN-mgvCtdAgg.text: Here on holiday for Thanksgiving with family.   Great to get out of the noise and smoke of casino for an nice breakfast  - one that doesn't cater to the masses.    I came alone and sat at the counter and was able to watch the work of the cooks and the staff.  All fresh/homemade ingredients, uptone setting, wonderful host that walks the tables to make sure everything is okay.  Very very nice staff.  You can tell the owner/manager works hard to make sure it is a great experience.   I'll be back.

VOi2zQx4ZEMf3rjWS9gYlw.text: YUM!   Love the food at eat. Love the coffee, too!  I dream of Natalie's poached eggs. My husband loves the Huevos dish and my son LOVES the pancakes. It's all so good and well worth the wait.

ps7iUxV1IHLRP8r3KQgkiA.text: Great unexpected find! The food was really fresh and everything our table had, everyone liked! We got the bignets to share for the table, and they were delicious - tiny pockets of fried dough with powdered sugar on them and delicious dipping sauces. What's not to like? We mostly ordered the eggs (tasted very fresh) different ways, but one person got the pancakes, which he said were very good, and another ordered the grits, which he said were very good. Their roasted potates were very delicious as well.

s_rFehERrLxDRTVjp_MzAw.text: It's can be hard to find good food in vegas. Happy to find this great cafe. Friendly staff ,good food and big portions.

KhKEDXHEB2_vXGgS07QRjA.text: Their breakfast is AWESOME if you LOVE BREAKFAST FOOD you need to go here.  The service was on point it was friendly and prompt.  The food was hot and fresh and mouth watering delicious.  The prices were reasonable i would come again if i was not moving out of state.  The only resin i gave this 4 stars is because i wanted a bloody mary and they didn't serve alcohol.  other than that awesome!

V-YmlugEa43CDO5KSYKIUA.text: The city needs more of these treasures that one might find in LA, SF, or NYC. Limited menu, but great food and lots of personality. Service is ok, but it is only the first week.

Picf7WTM7Gl1NSxgdhEGcw.text: Crowded but why??? I had skinny jenny salad--pounded chicken breast and arugala.  Toughest chicken ever.  Tiny @ $11 bucks.  Cheap.  Friend had reuban. Plate was 95% carb. Little bit of of corned beef w some unknown melted cheese.  Big bread and lotta chips. In a word lousy.

ghtGISqTNLXl5CzJVKE7Nw.text: Leaving Vegas & my brother wanted to check it out.  Was a little annoyed at the 45 minute wait to be seated (possibly from the hangover.) The food was well worth the wait and I would recommend huevos montelones or the grilled cheese.  The service was very good & kept my coffee filled.

sKeO3Tb-MdIDriFpsfJUqQ.text: I saw this place online and read awesome things about it, so went down with my husband to try it out on a Sunday morning. The place was ridiculously packed... 20 minute wait to get a seat for 2.  We sat down and looked at the menu, which looked awesome.  I ordered the eggs benedict ... which was cold when I got it... other than that everything was "meh" I definately will not be bringing my family over there when they visit on a Sunday morning.

EdLcHnFeozXhPorofZlxhg.text: 1st visit was ok experience. 2nd visit, waitress got annoyed I changed my order last minute. Sorry?! 3rd visit, with party of 6 and staff refused to seat us until all 6 ppl were physically in the restaurant. We were not aware if this policy until after we arrived but even when the staff was informed that 6th person had arrived and was out front paying for parking (clearly observed from their standing position in front of window), still wouldn't seat us...overkill of policy. Moreover, after being seated, we requested plastic silverware because regular utensils was blatantly, obviously dirty, yet wrapped in a cloth napkin; clearly disregarded by staff person. Waitress made several attempts to bring us clean silverware but to no avail, we opted and requested plastic silverware. Whole party was annoyed by unprofessional staff but waitress serving us was very courteous. Clearly our final visit.

ZCO-Hfn3LpEmQWyJC3rQ2w.text: Chef Nat is amazing, and her food combinations are new and delicious! I love this place!

6itzmjuVLaYt-HsonATKTw.text: a bit on the extra loud side, but the service was great and the food was fantastic! great options for vegetarians and vegans :)

owlirsbtZ4xSQlhfJNIzWg.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas! The food is always outstanding and the service is great. Dine in or take out, you can't lose!

EXU_OxhILJ2hYThCdmlzyQ.text: The owner Natalie is really cool! The food is absolutely delicious. Depending on who is cooking it can come out a little greasy so just ask for light oil and it's perfect!!! Love this place. Grilled cheese sandwich is awesome

pYPJ0DbNKzQxhwpjvxAf4w.text: What a wonderful place with an even better startup story. The breakfast we had was amazing. The toast is THICK and buttery. The chive potatoes with fried onions are crispy and delicious. Check this place out when in Vegas.

8LI5tBg2ZMvh-DPgcygc1w.text: I am so happy that Eat has opened up downtown!  I think we've found our pre Smith center show meal!  Our receipt says that JD was our server and he was very friendly and helpful.  The homemade potato chips were very good, the coffee was nice and strong, the owner was walking around saying/smiling hello at people.  My suggestion would be to punch up the flavor of the tofu banh mi.  I am always appreciative when there is a vegan option at restaurants.  I ordered the tofu banh mi veganized and it was pretty plain.  My lunch mates enjoyed their chicken sandwich, salad and grilled cheese.  It's a great restaurant with huge potential.  A soy milk option for the coffee and oatmeal would also be great too!  It's always nice to support a new local business, go eat at Eat everyone!

I0vOkkOKurJTbcwvN-_Mmg.text: I came here with my friend Meghan L., we had spend like an hour and a half driving around the strip looking for my friends stolen phone at omnia... anyways.   we ended up at eat! They were closing at 2pm, but we arrived at 1pm and were able to be seated right away! I ordred the corned beef hash, and my friend had the truffled egg sandwich. I really enjoyed the corn beef hash, it came with four large pieces of buttered sourdough, and a decently sized portion of corned beef hash.   The food wasnt overly salty or anything, and it tasted great with some tapatio, cholula on it.  My corned beef hash was $14, which was a bit pricey, but I think its still more worth it than eating at some overplaced restaurant on the strip.  I also like to support businesses in fremont street since fremont street gets less traffic than the strip.   GO to donut bar after!!

8gZ337R6hX4ohEwvk4czLw.text: Had the shrimp and grits topped with pico de gallo with an under base of scrambled eggs and apple smoke bacon. Everything was perfect down to the texture the actual grits themselves. Very well prepared and seasoned. I don't know if I'll have it again the future, just simply because the serving was a little large for me, but definitely worth the order.

_HrZH2jtybUg8dMIe3spfA.text: After finding this place on Yelp, my boyfriend and I decided to try it out. While the atmosphere was cozy and casual not sure if this would be on my top list of places to visit in Vegas. The prices were decent but the food was mediocre at best. We ordered the cinnamon biscuit after a raving review we saw, however we didn't care to eat past the first bite. The food was warm ish and like lil Dickey jokes they are the company that charges extra for ice in your coffee. Not terrible but not worth a second trip.

lCW7lXTfPmdWiPqzmDqqbA.text: Very cool vibe. The menu for breakfast, brunch and lunch are quite different. But very eclectic. Whatever you do, do not order extra toast. Lol. Their toast is Texas sized toast. I had the brisket and eggs which were phenomenal and my wife had he mountain of pancakes. Wee seated very quickly by courteous and competent staff.   The atmosphere is as eclectic as the menus. A must do those who crave good ol' fashioned eats. We will be back.

yTC3cgcYwGN9i6byp5YlmQ.text: It was so easy to find its a great lil location to come in and brunch with friends and family . The menu is so nice and easy to understand their dishes. I highly recommend this lil place and close to Fremont experience . Its simply really nice n classy and delicous. wD_wB_LcujYoJ5jwBCaxng.text: The first time I came here it was delicious  and friendly and they were really nice this is my second time it was a horrible experience  we sat down nobody came to take our orders or drinks our waiter was completely  avoiding us other people came and sat down she went to help them out and they had there drinks and there food was in process and we were sitting waiting for 20 min  and it was ridiculous  we left with no food or nothing I dont recommend it when its busy

fFESJNAhyxGyYGVL3ywumw.text: This is an amazing local place for breakfast/brunch/lunch. They're located in downtown Las Vegas and the location is charming and welcoming.  The service staff is quick and friendly. My party and I arrived 30 minutes before they opened and there was already a line. Always a good sign.  The coffee is quite good and always filled. My friend and I shared the deviled eggs and cinnamon biscuits which are memorable. I would come back for those alone. The special that day was prime rib hash and it was AMAZING! Basic breakfast of eggs and bacon was also really good. The chef lives there locally and was present in the kitchen. She checked on the guests personally which was just awesome to see. This place is definitely worth stopping in and it's a nice break from the busyness of the strip.

JYLWuIH_ZIwl6eypnxk4ng.text: Stopped in for breakfast after reading good reviews in Yelp. It was pretty busy so we had to wait about 25 minutes for a table. I had the chicken fried steak breakfast which came with potatoes, eggs, and your choice of bread. Overall, my dish was pretty good. My husband had pancakes which were amazing. They were huge, fluffy, and buttery. So I would recommend pancakes over the chicken fried steak. We had a pleasant experience. Quick service and close to Fremont street downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with potatoes and scrambled eggs

Po91d49xYftec81rzPNmdw.text: The deviled eggs were ON POINT. Really glad my better half was insistent on getting them. I had the truffle egg sandwich and she had the shrimp PO boy. Glad we stopped in before leaving town. You should too!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute little place off the strip

qIY6GNrxLqibDN4ZUtuxrw.text: Quick service, waitress was nice to adjust our order so it was cheaper instead of individual items. My boyfriend didn't care too much for the potatoes because of the skin still on them. Syrup bottles were cute.

kG3dE_D3GYZD4eBFRLq7rA.text: Everything was amazeballs!!!!! We had the deviled eggs and oh my gawd they were so good! Who would have thought to deep fry an egg! I had the truffle egg sandwich and it was the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. My husband ordered a pancake which melted in your mouth, and the country fried steak with fantastic potatoes. Even the tropical tea was divine. The servers were remarkable. We will be back to try more yumminess!

ZGuqTabZ4pRGGDQdjOzEEA.text: I first visited Eat 5 years ago when we were in town for a wedding.  We enjoyed the food and the great service.  We went again on Sunday morning, 5 years after our first visit and the food and service are still outstanding!  My only criticism is that the menu is quite limited.  I had the eggs Benedict and my Wife had the oatmeal, both of which were great, but the service was stellar!  Service can be tricky and a lot of places can't seem to get their staff to team well at all (Waitstaff will not help each other out), but that isn't the case with Eat, they have their steaming down pat.  I think every member of the staff (except the cooks) stopped by our table at some point.  Nicely done, keep doing what you are doing!

VxYCuXR_m9U8tlhk7HZjMQ.text: I stopped in for a late lunch on a busy Friday quick-service great atmosphere order the very flavorful veggie burger with a nice thick wheat bread add to cheddar cheese to it came with Sprouts as well as avocado potato salad and a pickle great flavor a nice hearty lunch I enjoyed it and Ice-T was always full
