uMUW5anY-6A1jd_p56FKVA.text: I've heard great things about this place and my guy and I decided give it a try today...I'm glad we did, we won't return!  We ordered the Shrimp and Grits with the Pancakes. The shrimp and grits were the worst I've ever had. They were extremely gritty. Grits are to be cooked super creamy without the grittiness of the grit. The shrimp was good, well seasoned, & the bacon was too soggy. The Pancakes were pretty good. I did enjoy the crispy outside of them. Although, I found them to be a little too thick they are flavorful.   Our service was sub-par and our waiter didn't come to check on Us during our breakfast. Only a cute blonde lady who I would assume is the manager, possibly? I'm totally bummed that I didn't have a great experience like the other Yelpers. I for sure won't return.

pdQikjNfG900y6YENOXGuw.text: If you are in Las Vegas, you probably expect to pay far too much for food and walk away disappointed about 80% of the time. EAT was a completely different experience. You'll get the sense that this is more of a neighborhood restaurant and more of a passion for the people who work there.   We had about a 20 minute wait and sat outside watching hipsters wander back and forth which is always entertaining. The streets were quiet due to an upcoming iHeart Radio event which made other businesses in the area a bit tense but not the people at EAT.  Service was fast and many people came by our little party of three asking if everything was ok. They were very patient when I had to run out to take a call and I appreciated that. We ordered the two eggs with potatoes, cinnamon biscuits, grilled cheese sandwich and the BLT. Everything was perfectly made, hot and fresh.   The sourdough bread was a hit as it was thick cut and surprisingly light. The potatoes were very well seasoned and the bacon a delight. Cinnamon biscuits were light and fluffy with a strawberry sauce and powdered sugar and blueberries. We plan to go back every time we are in town.   Get off the strip and have some good food. Eat at EAT.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KIuuy4JXRx2Cpa4ByJ3DBw.text: Aside for quick service, this place is overpriced and overrated. The food is just ok.

tPJwZ7Pq_SrXr5eNhUu4CA.text: I was looking for a brunch place outside of Strip, and yelp helped to find this place. Our Uber driver had also added his high praise for this place, so I kind of figured I wont be disappointed. The menu was simple, no nonsense brunch stuff. The quality of the food was exceptional. I will definitely back again if I ever in Vegas.

X14VBYpwQEjWRkS6OWvoQg.text: The pancakes were thick and fluffy and good but the poached eggs benedict were best I ever had!  Potatoes are very good also.  I sat at counter and saw all the food on menu being prepared and it all looked delicious.  The staff is friendly.  This place is a couple blocks away from Freemont street and is small and crowded at breakfast time but was quickly seated.  Highly recommend for breakfast if in downtown Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fszrRHbS3V3mOlFwzVg9ww.text: Expect to wait a little while (about 20 minutes or less.) They don't take reservations unfortunately but it very much worth the wait.   They do not have mimosas either if you are looking for a boozie brunch. But it has excellent food and service!   I got the BLT sandwich with tomato soup and both were very delicious and refreshing. It is hefty with the bread, but evens out well with the amount of bacon, lettuce and tomato.   We didn't wait long for our waiter to get to us and waited about 10 minutes for our food.   We don't come here very often, as it is downtown Vegas, but when we do it is worth it!

owaHlzhiVqhNf6rgV8mvpg.text: Cute spot, no wait on a Monday.   Service was pretty good.   I had the truffle egg sandwich, and my friend had the pancakes. Both were a decent sized amount of food, and I LOVED the pancakes!

f-C8IGFO8paQSJ6PSs_KiA.text: It's hard to choose the amount of stars for this. The food was really good and our beverage server was super sweet! So as you read this you think, wow a five star review right here.....ummm NOPE!! Unfortunately it takes one person to ruin it ALL! That one person?? GARY! He was rude. Didn't introduce himself, came up to us and said "what?" when we asked a busser to get our waiter. He was then clearly rude to that poor girl - you could tell by body language. Anyways - this would be a 5 star, but GARY ruined it all!! I do not think that Gary should be in any customer service type of position! To the EAT Owners & Management - get rid of him!! He's not worth losing business or having bad reviews over!

0JlPgEavlQxPwAyDvYnMRw.text: Drove here today very hungry and had to wait 30 minutes. I would have to say it was not the kind of food that would get me to come back again. It was just ok, especially when you have to wait and you leave not safisfied. I'm giving it 3 because the only thing I really enjoyed was there coffee that they make there.

gq8bu0FRNz_I99eMmm8eCQ.text: Stopped in for breakfast before our Elvis wedding! Food was fabulous, coffee outstanding.  Bought some to take home with us.  Great service too!

vLc6iXZzIIEhkEKFSxzLTA.text: I don't think the hosts are pulling their weight here. On a busy day they have no idea how long it might take to get a table, if its busy be prepared to wait a while.   The food is great. The service was great but its so loud.  The menu looks good, we missed breakfast twice and we had to settle for lunch. The breakfast menu looks to be about as good as it gets in Vegas and for the price its just right. The menu is nothing out of the ordinary on the surface but the details are filled with love.  I got a the roast beef with with blue cheese. The details are the  wild mushrooms, pickled red onions and arugula, It was perfect. I wish I had also had the BLT with avocado, it looked so good, were going to have to go back.    The atmosphere is deafening at best, the music is so loud I couldn't hear anyone at my table talking to me.  I saw some one rating the chicken pot pie, it looked amazing.

ulVMm_ZiXN3C2xUptUVqJQ.text: We had the shrimp sandwich, hot pastrami sandwich, tomato soup, chips and delicious coffee. Everything was very tasty. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that there was a hint of rancid oil in the shrimp sandwich. The coffee was so good we bought two bags. The staff is very friendly. Atmosphere is loud and bustling.

wpuC6OOZP8mDIQt6I0tcbQ.text: Amazing! Their pancake is the best pancake I've ever had. Fluffy, delicious perfectly cooked. Pancake heaven has a name and it's eat.  The truffle egg sandwich is one of the best things I've eaten this year. Just perfect. The service is good, presentation okay - but the food!! The food is awesome. Can't wait to come back and seriously considering moving downtown.

515iPQUNzy3MXrnEn6x_xA.text: Walking distance from Fremont Street (but I wouldn't walk there at night), we found the food to be excellent. We went our first morning in Vegas (7/18/15) and was told it'd be a 45 minute wait. We were starving and had things we wanted to do so we decided to go somewhere else and come back the next day. I am SO glad we did. My wife and I had the chef's special which was eggs benedict with avocado and other stuff (you had me at avocado). It was freakin' delicious. My son was with us and he had the Huevos Montulenos - honestly, I think they should take that off the menu. He seemed to like it okay but I had a bite and didn't care for it at all. Neither did my wife. The place is kinda hipster and the service is excellent. I think this place has overtaken first spot from Peppermill as our favorite breakfast place in Vegas. We will definitely be back!

NwFKqFrDQnAxb0GzUIAqxQ.text: This place did not disappoint. I got the tofu scrambled eggs and my friend got the shrimp and grits and both were absolutely delicious! Wow. Usually I hate breakfast foods y they are greasy and leaves you feeling guilty but this place was amazing

oFGpPgwnTaKFqDw7rqPGag.text: Stopped by during lunch which was busy but was able to seat me at the bar.  I ordered the passion fruit iced tea which was lacking flavor then ordered the chicken mozzarella with tomato sandwich, I also asked for potatoes with chives as a side.  The service was very good; however, the food lacked any spices and the chicken was frozen and processed.  The potatoes were burnt on some sides, lacked spices and was just very bland.  It was as though I walked into the El Cortez and got a sandwich there instead of a restaurant being highly recognized.  Pricing was adequate but food needs to have spices.

U08wVDj8eGNhCEyEU60f5w.text: Such a delicious place for big breakfast/brunch/lunch meals! Perfect for families and groups.

pZz9EZ6SD4dSUsqtvQ4bNw.text: This was my first time here. AWSOME. I had the chicken fried steak. Service was fast for how busy they were. The kitchen ran like a well oiled machine. I can't wait to return.

AqCcxCavsrjkR8oUJ90_Lw.text: What up, Downtown?  First of all, let's start with the location and restaurant.  Located in the downtown area and within walking distance from the Fremont Experience.  For someone that is not familiar with the area, it can easily be missed since it's literally below some apartments.  Just remember that it's at the corner of Carson & 7th.  The outside and inside brings me back home.  This establishment reminds me of the historic North Park area of San Diego where restaurants, cafes, and stores sit below apartments.    I met fellow Yelper Terri R for breakfast and we were both ready to chow down.  The menu is as simple as it gets.  No folding laminated menu, just a one page sheet.  Everything looked good, but I decided on the Smoked Salmon. Yes, fish for breakfast.  Besides, I was going to have eggs for lunch.   The Smoked Salmon is served with tomatoes, cream cheese, and rye bread.  I have to admit, this is one of the best raw salmons that I've had in a while. Seasoned just right, thinly cut, and not fishy at all.    I thought that the staff was as good as it gets.  They were attentive and kept our drinks filled.  The owner was also around making her rounds.  But what I noticed is that she was genuine and sincere with her guests.  One of my biggest pet peeves is when you're in a middle of a conversation and a waiter/waitress interrupts you.  Our waiter was great with his timing and was around when he was needed.  Kudos Eat!!!  I will definitely be back because there's still more that I need to try.  My only regret...I forgot to try their Beignets.    TIP:  Bring some Quarters for the parking meters outside.

Xav03_AyBFQxQ4x1yt4yaA.text: I would have gave 5 stars if weren't so loud in the place. Eat does not have an extensive menu but the quality of food is amazing. It is worth the 30 minutes wait that is typical. Breakfast and lunch only to be had. Shrimp and grits some of the best I've ever had. The "dwblta" is a blt sandwich on thick sourdough with avocado that is quite amazing. We also had cinnamon biscuits as an app. The plate came with four English style mild cinnamon biscuits, covered with strawberry compote, fresh strawberries and blackberries. Delicious! Even though they were very busy the food came quickly in the servers were very attentive. I highly recommend eat.

E4v2AdION-OIFK8B8A8KGQ.text: The shrimp and grits here are a fan favorite but honestly everything is great. The food is great; the atmosphere, the customer service, the speed of service... I do not think I have ever given a 5-star rating anywhere but I do not believe I could even talk this place up enough. If you live in town and have not tried it A FEW TIMES then you are missing out, if you are headed anywhere in Las Vegas it is worth the trip. Today they are actually having some dishes professionally photographed so it is great to be able to see the presentation of so many dishes and the owner is giving them away to customers for free after the pictures are taken. Love, love, love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (near) free-range chicken sandwich and house fries, side of applewood smoked bacon (far) shrimp Po-boy and tomato salad.

zqFYG_av82984Zs1uOgR2A.text: This made Vegas a worthwhile stop on our road trip. Neither of us enjoy the Las Vegas Strip, so we ventured off-strip for breakfast at eat. Staff were super-friendly and attentive. The coffee was good. Breakfast was excellent.   My truffled egg sandwich was ridiculously good. It was strong on flavor, and the eggs were cooked perfectly. Bacon, feta, mushrooms...just terrific. The chive potatoes were also great. The bf LOVED his huevos motulenos--so much that I didn't get to taste them.  I don't expect to be back in Vegas if I can avoid it, but if I am driving through on a road trip, eat. will be my choice for a meal in town.

cY8mUCpyDV5ULr57E8Uvdg.text: It's always busy, which is a good sign, but the service is still quick and friendly. Had the shrimp and grits and loved it. The shrimp are cooked well and the grits are so buttery. My wife had the grilled cheese, and it is a beast of a sandwich. Thick-cut bread and lots of cheese. We will definitely be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffles egg sandwich

OAh-y8aEbbU1ZZTjohZ3Hg.text: Stopped by eat on a Tuesday late in the afternoon, about 1:45.  The place was about half full, but most of that was a large group that pushed together 3 tables in the middle of the place.  It's not huge, but has a patio which seemed nice, although I ate inside the restaurant.    Service was very quick.  I had the shrimp po boy.  I'll say, I was excited to try the chicken fried steak.  I had heard great things and was the reason I went.  But, they stop serving breakfast at 11:00 or so.  So, that was a disappointment.    I was fortunate, because the po boy was excellent.  The ciabatta was maybe the softest version of this roll I've ever eaten.  Despite this, it held up to the toppings.  It wasn't overflowing with shrimp, but you got shrimp in about 85% of the bites.  The veggies were crisp and fresh, and the sauce was spicy.  They should bottle it, it added so much.  The homemade potato chips were good, but nothing to write home about.  Overall, very cool atmosphere.  Friendly people and a great lunch.  I'll have to get downtown earlier to try the CFS for breakfast...

nzs6xRiP5W9Rc7biDM9SKw.text: An article in Sunset Magazine about downtown Vegas revitalization drew us to this restaurant. It delivered. The pancakes were a version of amazing I'd never tasted before and the chilaquiles rocked my tastebuds. I wished I'd have tried everything on this menu. Truly incredible vibe, atmosphere, and affordable delicious crafted dishes. I'm returning when the Container Park opens across the street for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes. Order them. Order them now.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles!!! Perfect blend of flavors.

a5ws0sk0GutZzhj_HM77_Q.text: This place is on the noisy side so I recommend trying to sit outside. I do like the atmosphere. The waitstaff was ok. I had eggs Benedict which I did enjoy. Overall, it was just OK. I had that plus an orange juice and with tax was $17. Not worth it.

-cCsb1RL0HG6XDhSzpjdkw.text: This place was uniquely centered in downtown right across the container park. The location was a nice stroll from Fremont (7mins away walking). It's located on a cute corner with benches outside of people waiting to eat. They only open a few hours for brunch & the menu is limited but incising. The inside is sleek, very design forward but all the waiters make it casual. Had a very LA type of feel. Our male waiter was nice, in a rush I felt tho. At least my water was filled at all times. I went for the eggs Benedict that wasn't on the menu that our server said right before we ordered Their potatoes were good & the eggs Benedict was awesome. Flavorful but yet still nice and consistent with the rest of the dish. We waited about 15 minutes until the hostess came over and took our check, not sure where our waiter was the entire time we ate & finished. We left filled and happy. The wait time went by quickly which was nice I will say tho, for those picky eaters this is not the best place to bring. Very limited & no sides. I wish some plates came with your casual eggs & pancakes but that's not the case here. It's a good spot if you have an open pallet!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen is open and viewable, I enjoy restaurants that do this! Clean &amp; sleek.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen is open and viewable, I enjoy restaurants that do this! Clean &amp; sleek.

WWl6huRFEIZj_ooENe9yig.text: Came here on a recommendation from a relative and it was good, I had a reuben, with potatoes it was very good. However the highlight was the deep fried deviled eggs with bacon Wonderful flavor! Our other family members order the shrimp and grits! Its was just ok to them, they said the Pico de Gallo take away from the overall flavor. I thought everything was Pretty Good

-W3eY9g6OyaOCaEAVVmpLQ.text: This place was alright! I found this place on Yelp and we ubered here shortly after. Staff and service was great! We were sat pretty quickly. My boyfriend got the fried chicken steak and I got the ciabatta sandwich with scrambled eggs, mushrooms, feta cheese, and bacon. The food didn't have much taste. I was sick so I thought it was just me not being able to taste my food. So I had my boyfriend try my food and he said he couldn't taste anything either. All in all, we didn't love our food but we enjoyed our service there.

MTpm9rrxOeG3hTf_leUoMg.text: Stopped by around 10:30AM on a weekday. There were plenty of people inside and we were seated immediately. I had the Huevos Motulenos (bit.ly/2lHdja9) The overall flavor profile was pretty good though the sweetness of the bananas definitely stood out. It probably would be a bit better with plantains instead of bananas. It was an interesting dish and I certainly enjoyed it but I did find the bananas a bit overwhelming. We also had the Deviled Eggs (bit.ly/2CFVBLz) Each egg half was deep fried with panko crumbs. The yolk had small strips of bacon on the top and a bit of sriracha. I thought the overall taste was solid but not quite worth $2 per 1/2 egg. The bacon flavor and texture got lost between the fried egg crust and the strong sriracha flavor.

P10d7pQqO7XClXn9XsQAoQ.text: First time here came in with my family for breakfast was little hard to find not knowing the area paid for parking right up front super cheap restaurant was little busy about a 15 minute wait definitely worth it ordered 2 orders of scrambled eggs toast with potatoes and bacon simple but very delicious ate every bite orange juice fresh squeezed little bit pricey but well worth it decoration inside was nice different from the usual basic restaurant decor everyone was patient helpful our waiter was on point will definitely return

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UwjYulri-PViUJL0GMIBvw.text: A low key place for great breakfast. The only problem I have is some of their menu items are only available before 10 or 11am. They're some of their better items too which really sucks. Overall though everything we've tried was great. Metered parking is close to the restaurant and it's in a convenient part right next to container park

-rk_6rimuN_ftzXN7Eb0JQ.text: Spectacular.   I don't really like or eat breakfast food. I will if I'm going out with others, but I don't of my own volition.   But this place...I'd eat here daily with a big smile.   I ordered the chicken fried steak, eggs sunny side up runny, rye toast, coffee.   The toast was nice and thick, evenly toasted to just crisp.   Eggs, flawless. Exactly as I make them at home. Crisp golden edge, just solid white, slightly cooked thin layer of yolk, and the rest of the yolk nicely warm but runny.   The potatoes were glorious. And I don't actually like breakfast potatoes and wasn't expecting much. Really great flavor and texture. Well seasoned, but not salty.   Chicken fried steak had a magazine ready crust, crispy and delicious. The patty was juicy and tender. Again, not salty, just perfectly seasoned. The gravy was a revelation. I'm not sure I've had better country gravy. Full stop.   And lastly, holding a dear place in my heart, the piece de resistance: mothership coffee in a cup that's never empty. This alone is enough that I will always consider Eat as an option. Absolutely adore mothership, even from a coffee pot.   Very impressed. Definitely returning.

ZAD_2aQfTWZFldwfnB-OhA.text: One of my favorite brunch / breakfast spots in Vegas. If it's not too hot outside, they have a nice little patio where you can also eat. The food is pretty incredible.. the hype on the deviled eggs is real -- no disappointments here! Delicious AF!  Awesome brunch spot in DTLV. Try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of entrance from street.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes and chicken sausage
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N75vYfjSG_9m1h05CIKuhg.text: This place was amazing! Food came out fast, proportions were big! Highly recommended!

Dqr0n08GFIx9UrZCHCquhw.text: Hey!  Vegas tourist, over here! Listen.  Want to temporarily escape the fake corporate glitz of the strip and experience a slice of life in real Las Vegas?  Well, come for a visit here.  Owned and operated by young folks.  Vibe is contemporary.  Food is pure American comfort.  Portions are large and the prices are low.  Friendly, sincere, cheerful service folks accommodate every customer desire (well almost, keep your clothes on Bucky).   Food delivery to the table is fast after ordering.  The house coffee is good tasting.  If I have one criticism, it's that the vaunted breakfast biscuits with fruit on top ain't that yummy.  Barely more scrumptious than the kind you get out of that Pillsbury pop n' bake tube.  Overall, solid 4 star rating.  You'll like.  Go.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuit

EtiuUt8zuwwd6DA6kHgekg.text: DOWNTOWN STAPLE.   "Eat" is a wonderfully situated breakfast/lunch spot whose intimacy and wonderful food make it appealing to all. The menu is perfectly balanced that combines many must have entrees with a solid stable of quality sides to order. One could order an entire meal off the a la carte section and be completely satisfied with its pricing and portions.   The Cinnamon Biscuits are well made and complemented perfectly with the strawberry sauce. The pancakes uniquely feature their own packaged butter and syrup, a nice touch because of the quality of both items. "Eat" has single handed turned me on to chicken sausage. Never had it before my visit first visit now I try it whenever I see it on a menu.   When friends visit me, as they often do, "Eat" is the the type of place I show them to give them a True glimpse of Las Vegas. A community integrated restaurant that offers great food and atmosphere. Bravo to the owners and staff. Much success ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PANCAKES and chicken sausage.

VvEgKdRKdQnDfm2v8kI77g.text: Let's go eat! No, literally. We are going to eat. The restaurant.   Ok, bad jokes aside, this place serves some hearty, good food. The pancake had the best thin crispy crunch and the pancake itself was hearty and slightly dense. This is a hefty pancake. It is delicious and it will own you. When it is gone, you will cry for it. Or was that just me? Sshhh.   The shrimp and grits were tasty. I really enjoyed the smooth grits the most and the salsa served with it gave it a kick you don't usually get with the mild mannered grits.   The corned beef hash was also good. The deviled eggs are kicked up a notch - the white is breaded and fried, the whole thing is topped with a squirt of siracha and slivers of smoky good bacon. That bacon. Get the bacon.   Hostess and waitress were welcoming and friendly. Sitting at the counter and watching the action was entertaining, especially seeing the boss lady calling out orders, finishing plates and containing the chaos. Mad respect kitchen mama.   eat. is located in downtown Las Vegas. Definitely come here if you want to eat. Haha. Ok. Ok. I'm done. Really.

LTb7gTburrzCyWl3M4TE2g.text: Eat is located a block away from Container Park, and if you're in the neighborhood then I highly suggest you give it a try.  It is only open from 8am - 3pm and I suggest not waiting until the last minute to go because they're usually busy before closing.   I ordered the enormous pancake breakfast with a yummy side of potatoes. The pancakes are huge and if you don't eat a like myself, then I suggest just ordering one pancake and a side of potatoes. My pancakes were delicious and I love the crispy edges. I also loved the delicious maple syrup that come with your pancakes. My fiance order the fried steak and he raved all day about how good it was and how he can't wait to go back.  We also received outstanding customer service.   I also love the sign as you exit on the door it spells out ate.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It spells out ate :)

380Uro-Wx9dGXp6FGDIesA.text: My favorite brunch spot in Vegas, hands down. The food is consistently delicious and the portions are very large for a somewhat affordable price. I highly recommend the pancakes--they're the same as they were five years ago when I first tried them. I also really enjoy the fried deviled eggs, shrimp and grits, and their sourdough grilled cheese! The workers are always friendly and quick with service, but beware that there is almost always a line for breakfast/brunch, and you should expect to wait about 20-30 minutes. If you're out of town traveling in Vegas, I highly recommend checking this place out if you get the chance!

v9r7v24IMjPHaEwgkgxL7g.text: This is the best breakfast/brunch spot we've been to in Vegas. We're visiting from NYC and we're searching for a great breakfast spot. "Eat" is a nice spot located downtown Las Vegas near Fremont St. "the old Las Vegas." I highly recommend trying the chive potatoes and cinnamon biscuits--delicious! All the servers are extremely polite and service was quick. We visited twice during our 5 day vacation and it definitely won't be our last!

aWmLjeH-XHBTCDUL0tmsMw.text: I truly enjoyed this place! There was enough cheap parking by the restaurant so I didnt have to drive for miles before I found a spot, nor did I have to pay a million dollars to park.  I came around 11am on a Saturday and didn't have to wait to be seated. The vibe of the place was nice, with live acoustic music and chill singing. I ordered and waited 10mins or less for my food. The corned beef hash was just a tad bit salty but otherwise the food was very good the lemonade was fresh, the pancakes are a deliciously homemade!! Customer service was incredibly friendly, professional, and attentive. I would return here again for breakfast.

cDarcdycOwU-RmI6hC8cvQ.text: I loved the friend deviled eggs omg! One of the waiters didn't seem too interested in helping me but the ladies made up for his poor service! I had the chicken fried steak, it was good but For me the steak was too chewy! The place is so cute and the pancakes are amazing!!

Y8sAXKNSfmu3fp7xqLIeyQ.text: Great tasting food and good service.  The truffle sandwich is delicious......so are the pancakes.

bN5DDmXX3aGTVbCs0frIdg.text: I would be givin dis here place 5 big stars but da fruity waiter done refuse to splits my checks up fo me! What be happenin to da customer be rights always

3IO2h_rewiMZHzgAXUhlBg.text: I really enjoyed my dining experience.  Had planned to go elsewhere but the establishment was crowded and noisy, so I googled "Best Breakfast Restaurants in Vegas" and Eat was one of them.  I ordered the Shrimp & Grits with a Passion Fruit Iced-Tea and LOVED it!  Service was friendly and swift.  Restaurant was clean.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is there seemed to be limited parking...unless I didn't see it.  Otherwise, good experience!

KFnvpbb9JR_fqUGm7YFjwg.text: Heard a lot hype about this place, and finally got a chance to come down here and give it try. What a disappointment- service was horrible. Friendly staff, but no sense of time management. No one ever came and asked how we were enjoying our meal until at least 20 minutes into receiving the order. The chicken fried steak came out and the potatoes were so salty, the eggs were overcooked, and the gravy had a odd sweet flavor to it.  The corned beef hash with poached eggs also had a funny fishy taste to it. Not sure if it was the scallions in the hash or the beef itself. I only got one poached egg because the other was overcooked. The one pat of butter they served with two entrees just seemed like an after thought. The water they serve with the slice of lemon is not hiding that nasty tap flavor so we had to order a bottle of flat water. So $28 dollars later, and that's with one of the entrees removed, it was an expensive water and coffee adventure. Would never come back or recommend.

b-lNTyVqMjLPWH3OKjyRzg.text: I can accept that they are very busy on a Sunday morning and that I have to wait for a table. What is not okay that there wasn't an employee at the door taking names. There are too many great places in the area to tolerate bad customer service. I won't try again.

tUZr0RyAAGxTf0TAQyl77g.text: I cannot say enough good things about Eat, not only is the food good but the overall mission of the place is amazing. I have had both breakfast and lunch at Eat and everything that I have had is just amazing; my personal favorite is the caprese panini but truly anything that you have there is amazing. When I worked downtown we used to order take out from here quite often, they don't deliver mind you but if you call in a to go order they are always happy to do it for you.   The overall atmosphere of the place is very cozy and inviting, granted it is a small space and they are almost always busy so it can feel a bit cramped at times but its well worth it. I am very fond of places that give back to the community that they are in and Eat is no exception; this is a locally owned diner who set up shop in this neighborhood (which at that time was very much on the lower end and just becoming transitional) specifically to help with the Downtown revitalization effort. When she opened shop I can only imagine it would have been a gamble but thanks to small and large business owners like her Downtown is well on its way to restoring its former glory. I also appreciate that she displays art pieces from local artists in the diner, I think that I a very kind way to give back to the community.  In addition to Eats philanthropy in Las Vegas they also have a commitment to quality foods which is also very nice. Most of the items on the menu are organic, natural, and where possible locally grown (though to anyone who is not a local locally grown usually means California, with a few exceptions our climate out here makes farming most produce near impossible) which I love to see supporting local farmers and I am a strong advocate for the natural foods movement. SO basically Eat has amazing food which is made from good organic locally grown foods, the owners is very much involved in the community and the day to day activities of the restaurant, and they are actively involved in supporting the community that they work in; I wish more businesses would follow in Eats' example.  The only couple of downsides to eat are one they are only open for breakfast/brunch/lunch so get there before 3 so you can enjoy what they have to offer. Second the diner is very popular, fairly small, and always busy; it is not unusual for there to be a wait to be seated and at times the service can be a bit on the slow side. Finally this is just not the best area of town and parking can be scarce, so if you have to park a couple blocks down please lock your car and don't leave you valuables in view.   That said you are in for a treat

onqECsSRB1IoYnk4wJE5fQ.text: Eat is the go to place for brunch in Las Vegas period. I've never had a bad experience here and never ordered anything that wasn't exceptional.

N7hoaePCie4mT24Ufw8XLQ.text: This hipster joint in downtown Vegas is a must-visit while in the city of sin!  The witty-ness of the decor and the art and culture this place has are all just extras though....  Scrambled eggs, feta cheese and sauteed mushrooms between two fat pieces of lightly buttered sourdough bread: the Truffled Egg Sandwich. That is really all that needs to be said about Eat because this meal is so amazing!  (It is also so kick-ass that they serve it all day... yum!)  Other highlights of the meal included the coffee- a delightful bold blend with almond milk and raw sugar available!   Justin really wanted to try the chicken fried steak (which they stop serving exactly at 11am) so we ended up here for brunch on day 2 also!   This time I had a delightful cup of chamomile tea and the cinnamon apple oatmeal with strawberries. Both were great choices for a lighter breakfast!   The service was excellent and the food was consistent- I would definitely recommend this spot for an awesome brunch downtown!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steel cut oats with apples and pecans!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUM

oo1v53bYR1zHHS0xGLu1fQ.text: Hands down, best breakfast eats in Vegas. Walkable from DTLV's Fremont Street Experience and surrounding. The wait can exceed 40 minutes, but IT. IS. WORTH. IT!!!! Biscuits and Strawberries are off the charts. (So it everything else, but really I had to pick one fave.)

iqtZ1CvN1hzdoswd-0FG9A.text: Good food, good service, big price tag.  Based on waiter's recommendation I had the corned beef hash with cheddar cheese this morning. It was simply delicious and the added cheddar cheese was a good recommendation. The two poached eggs were of differing doneness though: one was a little runny and the other boiled hard. I am not sure how that happens unless they were prepared separately or the eggs were of different age. Coffee was good and constantly topped off. I am just not entirely sure that a single breakfast dish and coffee should run $20+ with tip.  Parking on the street is $1/hr by parking space number at the automatic meters.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash

U0QhVn2QG1GbNij6ibKLEw.text: Great- awesome food, great service. No alcohol. Very reasonable.  Great mimosas and a playground across the street. Can't beat it.

oa9O6O_Tiq4hmkfjsS6sjQ.text: It's fine. I had the Shrimp and Grits which was fine, nothing spectacular. A regular diner with a nice interior. Staff is friendly, but they won't make any substitutions or requests to their menu which is surprising because it's really just so basic to begin with. They won't let you use their wifi but suggest that you connect to the apartments upstairs. Wow.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vlNhnpAYtoYpHPLSorPjZw.text: Simply amazing food and staff. Eggs were perfect, toast was out of this world and food was just simply delicious with a touch of friendly people serving. Made the trip even better. Thank you

9HOGhF2rsKa1Lh1iAksFWQ.text: It's my second time here, I had to come back for their addicting crispy fluffy pancakes. Their truffle sandwich is great too!

EJCEvVfpJ3Z4QaXNAskhxQ.text: I hesitate to give this review because I want to keep this place all to myself. I had one of the best breakfast ever. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs. All of the eggs at our table were PERFECTLY prepared. The beautifully seasoned potatoes were a reason to buy a plane ticket back: perfect caramelization making the simple potato exquisite! The service is spot on, unobtrusively handling every detail. This place takes pride in a job well done and it shows!

1rKOM2rY0v9MX2JzxSUZwg.text: Favorite Downtown brunch place by far!  My girlfriend suggested it after we participated in a fun 5k run because I was starving.  This place was casual enough that I didn't feel out of place in my running outfit, so it's a definitely come as you are restaurant.  The food:  amazing.  I only had eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast, but the flavorings in all of it were so tasty!  The service was friendly and so quick.  It was packed, but the 2 of us were in and out in less than 45 minutes, never feeling rushed.  You must try this place!

hD50FsZ2n5SiYoRbFmxVIQ.text: First time here, and I was excited to finally eat here. High hopes, but I was a bit disappointed.  Walking in I was greeted and seated right away. Cute little area with an open kitchen. Service was good, maybe too good cause my server and a few others kept checking up on me every 5 minutes which was annoying. It was just myself so they probably thought I was the health inspector, food critic, or some shit like that. Lol.  Anyway, asked my server what was the best seller, she said the Truffle Egg Sandwich. 5 minutes later she came out with my food. THE FOOD WAS COLD! Every thing was not fresh to order. Wanted to say something, but I was too hungry to even bother. The sandwich was eh. Truffle oil wasn't over powering. Wish the bread was toasted more. And the feta added an additional flavor. Potatoes were bland. Not a lot of seasoning to them. The onions in them were burnt, and the strawberry on the side was an unnecessary garnish though.

I'm my opinion, This location should never make nor sell Chilaquiles, ever.  They looked and tasted the same as I would have made them if I ate them once and never looked up a recipe of Chilaquiles. They were horrible.

IZvgOBoSM4otgub2XrBMDQ.text: I really enjoy eat. It's a great place with great food. I usually get the grilled cheese with tomato basil soup and it's to die for!!! It's large so I always have left overs. One thing I don't like is that it's a small place so the wait time can be crazy so you just have to plan ahead can't just drop in but other then that it's awesome!!

gQaJuQ-lp8gALqq11p3-Lg.text: Stopped in for a quick bite to eat after a morning meeting. I was greeted promptly upon coming in the door, and seated with ease. I had a small table near the kitchen so I could see the buzz of the staff. They were definitely working hard! When I sat down Laura gave me a menu and took my drink order. I quickly asked, "Do you have any specials?" And she told me about the prime rib hash which I ordered and thoroughly enjoyed. A quick experience however, a very pleasant one. Good early start to my weekend!

LPK1kc3Bep3_rMdpbiNsdw.text: This place was fantastic!  As a semi-frequent visitor of Vegas, it's always nice to discover new places. In the case of eat., I may not try to discover any new brunch places.  The food is amazing. The flavor is rich and the food came out super fast, despite how busy they were.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  I feel it's best to sum up this review with a quote my partner made over brunch, "it's easy to find good food, but it's very hard to come across great food!"

UJG4XzjVf2JhEk1iQ_fozA.text: Hands down the best breakfast I've ever had! The cinnamon biscuits are amazing, and the orange juice was worth the 6$...the freshest oj I've had while dining out. Definitely a repeat customer here!

pIkB51hIO1iMNnMfkIr3iQ.text: I LOVE BRUNCH. The truffled egg sandwich makes my tummy happy!   Parking is on the street, so unless you park right across the street, you'll have to walk. It's a bit small inside the restuarant but so far, the waits haven't been too long each time I go. The staff weren't amazing, but they also weren't bad. They're kinda just doing their job.   The food is amazing though (only reason for the four stars). The pancakes are golden with yummy, yummy syrup. The deviled eggs are pretty good too; though; I wouldn't just order that. Again, the truffled egg sandwich is delicioussssssss. Truffle is just YUM. You must order this sandwich.

_54qcWYHxVqRaaVcW2t_ng.text: This was a great breakfast place which we enjoyed. We both had the Corned Beef Hash and the chef poached the eggs perfectly! I believe the orange juice was fresh squeezed and it was yummy. The staff was very nice and I will definitely return. Thank you.

net13KcrwlpKPjFAqNBW6w.text: Holy cow! Let me start by saying I'm absolutely in love with this place. I've been dying to get here for a brunch but turns out a coworker and I dropped by for lunch instead.  Props to the interior designer because this place is totally my cup of tea. It's got that downtown, upscale hipster vibe that just makes you feel welcomed.   Now to the good part, the food. Our waitress recommended the biscuits to start. Ah-mazing! They come with a fruity syrup and fresh fruit. Seems like more of a breakfast or dessert item so maybe next time I'll save it for later. For an entree I chose the grilled cheese & tomato soup. No joke this was the best grilled cheese I've ever had in my life! The portion size was huge so it lasted me for lunch & dinner. Enjoyed each and every minute of it! My coworker had the BLT which looked great too.  Can this place get any better? I'll definitely be back soon for brunch & more.

akPWWhl_4a9mMV-PfDWqMg.text: This place is a joke. Food never consistent, service is always slow and rude. I have had several servers that were down right rude. Have seen the owner on several occasions talking down to staff and critiquing the manager in a hostile and rude way. Food was not all that impressive. While eating my wife and I heard the owner, I believe her name is Chef Natalie or something like that cussing at her manager. Actually called her a stupid ass just outside of the kitchen area. She was arguing with the manager that she was not a chef.   I'm done with this place. To top it off explosive diarrhea from food illness is never fun. Every time my wife and I eat here we get uncontrolled diarrhea that last for a couple of days. Think it is the slice they use or just a total lack of cleanliness. It's time for a better option in Downtown.

hHfemVFy1kNLrUNMibQLOw.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots downtown. There is always a wait to get seated. Both times I went we waited for almost an hour and half. But I must say it is definitely worth the wait time. The food here is phenomenal! Excellent pancakes if you love them

m5C8zoZNVGs0TqO7HFHXWg.text: Cute little place in the Market Center. Got a salad and added chicken. The dressing was delicious but the chicken tasted like microwaved chicken breast. Didn't realize I was a chicken snob until I ate here.

IQfZhtkP85vhssim142Ysw.text: Fire! Everything is delicious, even the  bread   I had the chicken sandwich with a tomato salad. Great duo. Sandwich was a nice size unlike other places downtown that give you an appetizer size sandwich. Salad was really light but went great with the sandwich.  My friends got corn beef hash and also said it was good. My other friend got eggs, potatoes and bacon. He let me try them and they were best potatoes, bacon and eggs I've had at a restaurant.  5 out of 5 will definitely come again.

cFlIce2btkY-08cP0KeeaQ.text: Cool place.  Perfect change of pace from the strip.  Friendly staff.  Quick service.  Good atmosphere.  Corned beef hash, coffee and juice, 5 stars.  Food was totally delicious.    All Yelp reviews should be exactly this long.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WlYfFS9_KeN_elF_cZJRCw.text: Went here for brunch with several friends and their babies/toddler. I arrived with my pregnant sister, a friend with a toddler and a baby, her mom and sister. The majority of our party was there aside from one friend with a baby. They wouldn't seat us until the entire party was there, which I normally understand though I think they should make an exception when babies are involved and all but one member of the party are there. I would not recommend this place for families.   They closed the patio as apparently it's not open during the week, which was disappointing. It was a beautiful day and that space would have been perfect for our party.  My sister and I split the breakfast burrito, which was delicious!, and the biscuits, which were not worth it.   The service was slow and the credit card machine was down, which didn't help, but I understand that definitely happens.   Overall, I wouldn't choose this place for brunch again.

vwDmSwyFB4GZYymsh9ga4g.text: Love this place. Get the shrimp Po'boy with the AMAZING homemade chips, and I'm not even a chips fan.

AAsmTm0vCnnvJOh4X2hVZg.text: Prime rib hash special in the picture.  This place was amazing.  You know it is an awesome place when everyone around you is sharing the bits of their meals which I saw everyone around me doing.  The service was amazing and friendly, my coffee cup was always full and the meal. OMG the meal.  Good food simple and fast.  Amazing!!! Eat here at eat. And then get the ate!!!  I come here every time I come to Vegas and I drag everyone who comes with me to Vegas here and everyone loves it.  So much of everything is awesome.  There is no appointment required at all so ignore that piece (wth yelp) but they are open until 3.  Come on down!!
