u3s1pxoAzna71aDAe8hutA.text: The restaurant has a artsy neighborhood restaurant feel. when we entered the host/server was one in the same he seated us. he didn't really have any personality and seemed unsure. he seated us and asked if we wanted drinks. we ordered water and one coffee. coffee was really good. we ordered the gokden brown pancake combo $12 comes with apple chicken sausage but can be substituted we did one with bacon, side of grits, and La'kats deviled eggs.  the pancakes are too thick for my liking. the maple syrup was in individual containers from Dickinson's farm in Oxnard, CA it was delicious. the grits were made well , my partner's pancakes were a little burnt but alright.  tje deviled eggs were phenomenal I'm thinking of how to make them at home. Our server wasn't that attentive never coming back to refill water or coffee not really checking on us. I'd like to try this place again for lunch.

21Owm4Pzw7IOx73Pq55UOQ.text: It was delicious! I asked if they had the eggs Benedict were so tasty. Altho it wasn't on the menu for Brunch, the waiter asked the cooks if they could make it and they did. The best food i had this weekend!

LXJH4Tj95QVQLPHsiXiaPA.text: I've been to this place three times in a year. So it's safe to say that this place is our go to Breakfast place in downtown. Parking sucks but that's downtown vegas for you.  Shrimp and grit is my personal favorite while my wife loves their chilaquiles. If only they have better brand of coffee. Not my liking. Service are decent but am not here for service. Am here for their great food and creativity. Go ahead try it!! I am pretty sure you will love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My one and only. &#34;Shrimp and grit&#34;

G0o2Yq_ZcaFGXbHu06JFag.text: Meh! We went for a brunch and tried the tomato soup / grilled cheese sandwich both unfortunately were nothing to write home about. I have had awesome grilled cheese in my time this was not one of them. The Texas toast was a bit greasy and was overstuffed with cheese. It was almost inedible. The soup was ok not great. We won't be back.

NvIif6D33wdnvchQHhzPaw.text: Came here for a late breakfast before hanging out on Fremont. My husband loved the country fried steak and eggs and we really liked the cinnamon biscuit in the strawberry compote. My entree of shrimp and grits wasn't what I expected - prepared well but not what I was looking for at breakfast.

WpRVKm3jhHC4yYKVkRchoQ.text: My friends and I were looking for a place off the strip to eat breakfast. A person I met recommended "EAT". In one word "WOW."  The service and food was AMAZING. It is a small restaurant but there was no wait to get in and out food came fast. The pancakes were so so good. The parking is limited but even if you have to walk or wait to get seated, it is worth it.

uaTA1xcU6rnsNF9mDxNmNg.text: Still the bomb.  Had the truffled egg sandwich & a pancake on the side... oh and their crack coffee!  Not sure what is in that or where it's from but it's EVERYTHING.  The truffled egg sandwich was heaven, just enough truffle to be delicious, not overwhelming.  Their potatoes are always delicious, a crisp edge and savory flavor.  The pancake is a flat cake with a crisp edge and a fluffy heavenly center.  Try their homemade strawberry compote on your toast.  UGH I want to go back!!! Eat is the BOMB!

dIUxsOS2xbI0avV1rF3tuQ.text: My husband suggested we go to Eats for breakfast since we were going to be downtown for a tour and I am so glad he found it! Great place!  Great Food! & Great Service! It's a very small place and there was a wait but it went pretty fast. There menu is small but that is Okay because what they do cook is great. We read the reviews about the deep fried deviled eggs and WOW!, can't wait to have those again. My husband had the Shrimp & Grits and he loved them, I took a tasted and really thought they were good and I am not a big fan of grits. I had 2 eggs/bacon and potatoes, for something that is simple and I have all the time..this was different, everything was so good..one of the best breakfasts we have on in a long time. We will be going there again on our next trip to Las Vegas!

tfiAMVWKZihazLlZPU43XA.text: I'm actually being quite nice for giving them 4/5 because of the blahhh service.   FOOD 5/5: I came here with my friends on a holiday. Although it was super busy, the food still tasted amazing.   -Truffle sandwich ($12): Super good, everything put together well. Potatoes are DELICIOUS.  -Shrimp&grits ($15): Loved this but wish it had more shrimp.  -Corn beef hash ($14): The corn beef is in cube-like form, and it was kinda hard. Still good, but wish the corn beef was softer.    SERVICE 2/5: We got sat down after 30ish mins. As we got seated our server came, jotted down what we ordered, but that was the last time I saw him. He never checked up on us AND WE HAD TO ASK 3 TIMES ABOUT REFILLING OUR WATERS to some other server.  -The server we asked about the refills obviously was getting super annoyed at us....like girl, we don't know where your coworker went AND we are eating savory dishes, we have to drink a lot of water to wash it down.  -Being a small restaurant, I expected that service would be pretty efficient...guess not.   The restaurant itself is small and cute. Reminds me of SoCal hipster brunch places. Definitely fits in the Downtown LV area. I would come back here for the food, just don't have high expectations about the service....   Tips to know beforehand: -There are meter parking spots, no free lot.  -Restaurant may be hard to spot, it's under an apartment complex.   -Wait can be about 30-40 mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits: soupy-like, love the taste.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle sandwich and potatoes = very good!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash. Pretty good but the corn beef itself was kinda hard.

rvr80V3BV4yOnR475xc6Tw.text: Breakfast...the best Chicken Fried Steak in Las Vegas, I had grits instead of potatoes I swear my mother was in the kitchen making them.  Two eggs cooked to perfection had a couple slices of applewood bacon...fantastic, the toast is so thick you think you have 3 slices glued together to make one...sorry no pictures to busy eating breakfast at Eat.

zKT6lUN-aSJvXcH2qD5K0g.text: The country fried steak was so small they need to rename it the county fried steak. They would have gotten 5 stars if my waiter had been a waitress.

CTacI4TqInnWbeF1puJdLA.text: Cute little place, hipster-ish like the ones we have here in NYC. The food was delicious!! Went here while visiting Las Vegas because of the reviews raving about it. I got the 2 eggs with bacon, my husband the country fried steak with eggs, and we got a side of 1 pancake which was the best pancake I've ever had. They give you maple syrup in a small glass jar which a cute touch. Was too cute to open it so we kept it as a souvenir. The pancake was so good on its on that we didn't miss the syrup. The coffee was good too and the bill was surprisingly reasonable for the amount and quality of food. Went here for the beignets originally but they didn't have them! Wahhhh! Otherwise great place! Oh and the toast! THE best toast! Don't want to know how much butter is on them but they're supper fluffy and thick! How could I forget those!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 eggs, bacon, loved the potatoes and wheat toast
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried steak with eggs and toast

CE9YODWCoWA5SumdpERefw.text: To start off, I had the Killer Grilled Cheese Sandwich (WITH BACON!!!) with Tomato Soup. I came on a trip to visit my friend who now lives in Vegas with a party of 7.  Food: the food was so awesome. My sandwich was loaded with bacon. It's not one of those places that charges you several bucks for bacon and only puts two strips. They LOADED the bacon. (Thank you, Eat. I love you for that) The soup was super fresh and very tasty. It was topped with aged cheddar that was pretty much the cherry on top.   The servers are very attentive and the cafe gives off such a good vibe. The decor is very hip and gives off an essence that Downtown Las Vegas is definitely trying to give off and own. I would come here again definitely.  Note: I wouldn't suggest coming in very large groups.

X8sTCG7HQaGG2z39dQuaGQ.text: They have vegetarian friendly menu . The food is to die for . Fresh and organic . The coffee is special, please make sure to order a cup . This place is worth the wait.

EsRE2_CsbjQh_ocI8Dbkpg.text: Stylish, open decor, cozy but not crowded.  Quick breakfast service with water and coffee quickly, taken black full of flavor and not at all bitter, a great cup o' joe.  Huevos montulenos (I'm close but not exactly right) a variation on Huevos Rancheros, filling with black beans and eggs over easy, ranchero and verde sauces side by side.  My dining partner completely ordered a la carte, fluffy egg whites, a lone pancake fluffy and thick dusted with powdered sugar and accompanied by a classy single serving of maple syrup in a small sealed bottle, and chicken apple sausage.  Want to go back, the entirety of the menu seemed appetizing.  Quick coffee service kept my cup full until I said stop. :)

S-cCrFQR0PYtD-lySGyeKg.text: We tried this place and will definitely be back! My 6 yr old son is a picky eater but had not problem eating up his Pancakes and wanting more. The price is right on for what your getting, the food, the vibe, the nice view of the Container Park. It was nice to be Downtown and really enjoying it. Can't wait to go back.   Sparkling Strawberry Lemonade: GREAT Lemonade: GREAT Pancakes: INCREDIBLY GREAT DT Benedict: GREAT

Bmc0wjoqFH1kSBMPSrj0xw.text: I found this place on Yelp and decided to try it based on the reviews. I took my boyfriend and a couple of friends for breakfast. Amazing service, amazing food!!!! I got the truffled egg sandwich without the bread and my boyfriend got the shrimp and grits. Both dishes were mind blowing.   This is in a not so nice area of downtown and is a fantastic little gem. I'm hoping to go back tomorrow for breakfast before we fly home. Their lunch menu looks great too!!   A couple of tips: they don't split checks when they're busy and they only seat complete parties.

zXksRZteTgxWjkkcoG_e_w.text: Shrimp and grits to die for...and I don't even like grits. Funky vibe. Trying some new stuff today. Truffled egg sandwich and simple egg breakfast. Very busy on a Sunday morning.

iDk71ZnA8TlV0NA34xa5tw.text: Love this place. The pancakes are the best I've ever had. And their homemade syrup is so delish. Oh and do not forget about the beignets, they melt in your mouth. I also had their tomato bisque soup and grilled cheese sandwich. It was another hit! The music is great the waiters and waitresses are delightful. Love love love this place. I moved to California and I miss this place so bad. But when I visit friends n family this is where we meet.

xDOajARd1-ezYMoQcolRNA.text: Worth the journey out here from the treachery of the Strip. Probably the most authentic experience I've ever had in this heap of a town. Absolutely loved every bit of my experience, meal, service, etc.

VGAw8cxqzyIFrpW-iIDwUQ.text: Deviled eggs was good. Shrimp and grits seemed popular but it wasn't very flavorful. Didn't even taste the shrimps in the shrimp po boi.

4rEZm8SGfnuAD5gdeMMnyg.text: Went for lunch and this place never disappoints when to food!  Had the grilled cheese with bacon and avocado! Delicious x10!  Our server suggested we try the fried deviled egg. He said it was a life changing moment.  We tried and WOW!  Let me tell you my life has changed as I will gain a few extra pounds because I want to eat those over and over again.They are for sure a must!  Just remember show up early because the place is busy and sometimes you have to wait for a table a little long. However worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with avocado and bacon!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled eggs! A must!!

5kd9nnpyk3vivOEZPUv7fA.text: Fresh ideas and options on the menu, cozy and inviting atmosphere,  Chilaquiles, cinnamon biscuits with strawberry puree, pancakes,  and shrimp and grits... Thumbs up across the board! Friendly and knowledgeable staff, great energy, they have made the cut

qAITqud-vJSztav4k6pswQ.text: eat. Was absolutely amazing. The grilled cheese is not just your average grilled cheese... It's amazing!!!! The bread was perfect soft with a crunch! The cinnamon biscuits... To die for! Deviled eggs... AMAZING! How can you go wrong with a fried boiled egg and bacon! Num num! Everything that I tried was absolutely amazing and everyone was super nice especially Gary! If I lived in Vegas I would be here everyday!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled egg
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle egg sandwich! Yummy

bAZAtmpj3HS0UgfAgepfMw.text: I went here for Sunday Brunch (which f.y.i. is a slightly different menu).  Prepare to wait a bit, a sign of any good restaurant.   They were out of the corned beef hash so I got the pancakes instead with a chicken apple sausage. I'm not usually a sweet breakfast type of person ....rather savory instead. However, these pancakes were AMAZING! I hold pancakes at a high standard because of a place back home that's been around before my grandmother dined there (Liliha Bakery, Hawaii).  The three pancakes are thick and fluffy,  have a golden crust on the outside and a very soft, moistness on the inside. Big bonus: they serve them with real maple syrup.....not that imitation fake corn syrup stuff. I will be coming back for these again!

KOr3G4-hYev2m5mM-sZ0Tg.text: First time here, service was great, food was indescribably  good...my compliments to the chef (if he ever reads this).

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UVdotz370iRgNTfILQGoAQ.text: Super delicious!!!   The portions are a good size and they have delicious grits! That's a rare thing to find on the west coast! Warning all of the toast huge is Texas toast. Very big. Even on sandwiches. But it is very tasty!   Definitely worth it to come here!

Wk2KVVh5vRsPGoY2vCo_9w.text: Fresh baked breads (the Rye is to die for) Fresh squeezed juice, farm fresh eggs, FRESH EVERYTHING!! fantastic coffee... all topped off with excellent service. This place makes me happy, no better way to start the day in downtown Vegas.

Odp0r3Wa87h4hgFaH619vQ.text: Truffled Egg Sandwich had straw mushrooms with the scrambled eggs, chives, Greek feta cheese, and sweet, smoked bacon - Extra thick slices - With chive potatoes home fried with the potato skin still attached on ciabatta bread rolls. The straw mushrooms were a delicious surprise that my taste buds didn't expect. From now on, if I try to cook with eggs at home the way I ate at EAT, I will use Asian sauteed straw mushrooms the way the chef did, because the taste was a brilliant dim sum likeness in flavor. The service was great, not only friendly, but helpful, because my son wanted a pancake, and the server helped him go through the menu to find the right pancake. Than to add to my boy's surprise, our server brought him his own individually sealed maple syrup jar, which thrilled him. Not just a bottle of maple set on the table like hot sauce or ketchup, each child gets a little individual glass jar of sealed maple syrup with their pancakes. Huevos Motulenos was eggs in a combined peppered green sauce Mexican chili. Motulenos breakfast dishes originated in the town of Motul in the Yucatan. Again more surprises, the spicy eggs had sauted bananas on corn tortilla. Perfect combination! Sweet fruit, bananas, but not too sweet, reminded me of dishes in Harlem, New York City with the addition of the bananas combined with peppers, eggs yolks, whites, and fresh stewed beans. There was a line of people outside when we arrived and leave the lobby. The place was packed. We heard stories of food networks and cooking channels coming to Las Vegas to visit the EAT restaurant Anthony Bourdain eats breakfast at when he visits Las Vegas. I guess he hosted a CNN TV special where he promoted EAT as the place to go in the Entertainment Capital of the World. People used to go to Hash House a Go Go, but now all the talk about the globe is the restaurant EAT if you visit Las Vegas. Afterwards, my family and I went to the most famous donut stand in town, which is directly across the street, Donut Bar. Their donuts are collecting awards all over the nation. All the kids had fun at the Downtown Container Park which is also directly across the street from EAT. Visit Kappa Toys with this kids. Extraordinary collection of specialty toys. This restaurant EAT is brightening up the whole neighborhood landscape with all the attention the chef is bringing to the corner with his fine cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Egg Sandwich had straw mushrooms with the scrambled eggs, chives, Greek feta cheese, and sweet, smoked bacon - Extra thick slices -
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Egg Sandwich had straw mushrooms with the scrambled eggs, chives, Greek feta cheese, and sweet, smoked bacon - Extra thick slices -

ASF3pi_2ZyLsC2_gA-wEHQ.text: Unique and delicious! Loved everything about this place. Food, service and ambiance. Yes you have to pay to park, but you always do downtown! (Only downside) had their pancakes and let me say hands down best pancakes I've  had in a while. The coffee complemented the pancakes incredibly. I would highly recommend eat. To anyone looking for a new place to get your breakfast fix!

KPAR3ANh7YZC4JNWdb5Mgw.text: We eat here every time we come to Vegas. This is a must! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is trendy. We recommend this place to all our friends and will continue to eat here. A must go! :)

h9ygPR2WBQja7ebCfb2GFA.text: The first thing you must know before eating here is not to come here on an empty stomach. I showed up on Sunday morning and waited between 30-45 minutes to get a table for two. The hosts were friendly and kept us up-to-date about the status of our table. Unfortunately, when we finally got our table, our server wasn't as helpful. He had zero sense of urgency and didn't do a good job of remembering our order. A second and a half after we ordered, another employee came back to double check our drink order, which was all wrong. Our food, which was good, was unceremoniously slammed down on the table moments later. I ordered the huevos motulenos and they were great, but not good enough to make up for the bad service. We kept having to ask for things like ketchup, even though there were potatoes on both of our plates. My friend had to ask for a coffee refill twice. These seem like basics the average IHOP waitress can do. Why can't downtown's "hippest" breakfast place do the same?  What ultimately convinced me not to go back was when the check was delivered. A little note from management was included telling patrons that Eat does NOT split checks because they're so "busy." I just don't think that's good customer service, and I think it's a lie. They probably don't want to pay two credit card fees per check when they can pay one. Eat, this is Las Vegas. Excellent customer service is expected. Furthermore, who do you think you are, Joel Robuchon? Your food is not that good and the restaurant is not a place I would take out-of-town guests or even go back to. They don't serve alcohol, so you won't be able to wash down the bitter taste of bad customer service with a mimosa. Don't waste your time people. Brunch elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good customer service is NOT on the menu at Eat.

QlrlWjh15OvRIuoASudaAw.text: I've been wanting to try this place and am glad I did!  It's a cute, modernesque, hip little restaurant that's open only for breakfast and lunch and definitely does fill up!  We got there just before the lunch crowd - 11:30 per my boss' recommendation - and watched people wait for tables at about 12:00 on . . .   The servers are very friendly and relaxed, they stopped and chatted for awhile as we had some questions about the food and later about the area (the same owner is opening another restaurant (bar type food) in the development across the street).  A little slow with the bill because they apparently only have one credit card machine and wouldn't you know, everyone wanted to pay at the same time with a credit card!   FOOD - the posole' is great - I love their posole'.  It tastes fresh and not too salty!  YUMMM!  We also ordered the ruben which was definitely one of the best I've ever had, but was huge!  Others at our table ordered the BLT which looked amazing and the egg truffle sandwich which was yummy for what it was, but isn't really my thing!!  We ended with the beignets and they are a deep fried donut.  So yes, naturally they are greasy, but that's what they are!!  It's like a pot roast that tastes like meat - well, of course it does!!  But they are fresh and just crisp enough with a two dipping sauces that you simply can't do without!!  I'm a fan!  Parking stinks, there is some curbside parallel parking for free across the street.  Pay curb parking on the side of the restaurant too.    We will be back - I love local eateries and this one was well worth the trip!!

J0D9FqVelz83mIWlWvn1VA.text: The family and I decided to go here for brunch. It was my first time there and it's a cute little place with a fairly inviting atmosphere.   I had the Huevos Motulenos and it was fantastic. There is an interesting mix of flavors within it but they all work very well. We also ordered the pancakes. I am not a pancake person, however those were very tasty and I would order them again.   I will definitely be back!

0yMTt8Rhm8ul-nnfB3imhA.text: I stopped by this place with a few friends to grab some lunch and check out the joint. The food was delicious, but the prices seemed a bit high especially for the small quantity that is served. The menu was limited and I found myself uninterested in any of the options so I opted for something simple, more choices would have been great!   Aside from the food, the place had a positive atmosphere and the service was great. The only downfall to the service was towards the end when we were all ready to pay. We pulled out our cards and placed them on the table, only to have the owner walk up and say "Can you pay with one card?", abruptly leaving and then coming back with a receipt paper that had "only one payment per table" written on it and harshly walked away again without saying anything. I felt this was very unprofessional and rude especially coming from the owner. The payment rule, I feel, is such an inconvenience to the customer since everyone splits checks now a days. Putting up a sign or having the severs mention the payment rule would be great for the customers and restaurant to avoid any problems.  Overall the experience was good, the interior design was great, the customer service was iffy, but the food was delectable.

06Lkr8l6AOrQnmUxUUqQLQ.text: Best breakfast place to eat at so far! I've lived in Vegas 10 years.... I work at a hotel and when someone asks for a good breakfast place this is exactly where I send them :)

K2d4zCe1zl8ZugZzBHoYtg.text: We finally tried eat this past weekend and I'm sorry to say that I don't think the experience matched my expectations.  We came for brunch, and the brunch menu is different from the breakfast menu online so the truffled egg sandwich I wanted to order wasn't actually on the menu. :( Instead, I had beignets, which were just ok. They were moist and doughy, not the light fluffy texture I associate with beignets. There was a box of Cafe du Monde beignet mix sitting on a shelf in the kitchen so I guess maybe they use that? But the texture was unlike the real thing and not even like the ones I've made with the same mix at home. They were served with a really tasty jam that greatly improved the flavor, though.  I also found the coffee to be a bit weak, which is normally not something I would not even bother to mention, but I think it's important for a breakfast/brunch spot to have great coffee.  My husband had a chicken-fried steak which I did not sample. I did try all of the accompaniments, though, and the potatoes, eggs and especially the toast were all pretty delicious. Maybe savory food is the way to go here!  Our waitress was pleasant if a bit scattered and we did get seated right away despite it being basically peak breakfast time. I am willing to give eat another shot- I hear that a dog-friendly patio is in the works so since we live, like, ridiculously close, we will be back, pug in tow, for weekday breakfast or maybe lunch when that opens up.

7XoaGrA1rGH8a-YnlHRwEg.text: Service is very slow and we didn't even get to try the food. We waited 45 mins to be seated then when we got seated our waiter waited on someone else's that was seated after us. Also had to pay  $3 for parking per hour. Not sure if it's always busy or if it was due to the local event. Menu was limited to breakfast and brunch items. Only pancakes, no waffles or French toast. When we got up to leave the waitress told us to have a nice day and hope you enjoyed the food...we didn't even eat!!!!

nub3YslyNrO6spkHSVomGA.text: This is a great place to enjoy some good, fresh but simple eats. It seems like a neighborhood spot. Open concept, casual dining.. feels like you are at a big outdoor dining room. I booked through Open Table. They set us up with a great seat to accommodate our baby stroller. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and the staff took the extra time to put together a special birthday dessert for us without us requesting.

ElFaX680fbmxpPCnj3r-cw.text: Oh, Eat--I really wanted to like you, especially after hearing such glowing recommendations from friends, but you just left too much to be desired.  As far as the good: the decor was really cute and reminded me of some farm-to-table eateries in Denver or Portland, and I really appreciated the variety of menu items, which included healthy options and vegetarian-friendly dishes.   The execution, however, desperately needed work. My boyfriend and I came in for breakfast on a weekday morning (meaning the place was busy but not slammed), and we ordered water and coffee upon our first interaction with the server. Neither came out until our food arrived. (And it should be noted that my breakfast didn't come out until my boyfriend was almost finished with his plate.)   As far as food quality, I was again disappointed. I love the idea of beignets, especially with jam and mascarpone, but they were pretty overcooked. My egg white frittata was so wet that I literally had a pool of water on my plate, which made my English muffins soggy and water-logged, and my boyfriend ordered the tofu scramble, which was flavorful but unbelievably greasy.   I love the concept of this restaurant, and I think a lot of people want Eat to succeed, since it provides a sense of authenticity to the burgeoning neighborhood, but the actual execution needs some refinement before I could recommend it to anyone.

oSYofk59IfWkx5qqizywLw.text: Drive by this little gem the other day and decided to walk over this morning. It was perfect. The food was fast and delicious. The coffee was amazing, with a nice bold flavor that wasn't overpowering. The staff was nice and friendly even though the restaurant guy crazy busy right after we got there. I had the cinnamon biscuits and he had the chilaquiles. Both meals were out of this world. Good home cooked food that was very satisfying. They say the best food in the world is on the Strip... I say there best food in Vegas are little hidden gems such as this one. If we ever come back we will eat here again.

Bg7lh-VItyKxUl-8uWYmDA.text: Wow! Anytime I'm in Vegas, I will be making this one of my stops for sure. Open for breakfast and lunch, Eat is truly a hidden gem downtown. So hidden, in fact, you might drive right by and miss it. But that would be sad. Just sad.   Came in for lunch and it was pretty crowded, but our party of two was able to get seated right away. The atmosphere is casual and fun. Servers were all great as was the food. I had the DWBLT and it was to die for. And if you like ginger ale, order theirs. It's the best in the world. They shake the bottle up for you and pour it into your glass. James Bond style.  And there's real ginger in the bottom of that bottle! Just take a look!  You can sit at the counter or a table. And even get a way cool black t shirt if interested. I meant to but forgot on my way out.   And parking is pretty plentiful by meter all around the block.   Some places just find a way to get everything right. This is one of them. So please don't miss this opportunity if you're in town (or better yet, live there). You won't be disappointed.

uvShQlHlRumVlSsH49i46A.text: So when I told my bf that I wanted to go here he immediately started to complain about the parking meters.  I told him to suck it up and we headed down there.  I first ordered a bottle of water and the waitress told me that they don't have bottled water.  My bf grinned and said "I think I'm going to like this place."  I was debating about what to order and then decided on the shrimp and grits.  I asked if I could have poached eggs instead of fried.  The waiter came back and said "the chef said no to the poached eggs."  My bf then got a bigger grin on his face and said, "I think I really like this place."  He claims to be tortured by myself and all my bougie girlfriends that are always trying to modify menu items - whatever.    Anyways the food arrived and was delish.  The shrimp was perfectly cooked which is a nice treat, since frequently, even at some of the best restaurants shrimp gets overcooked.  Everything is made in house and the fruit was excellent.  The fruit bowl consisted of berries and orange slices, not a mangy slice of tasteless cantaloupe or honey dew to be seen (blech).  The portions are regular sized, not grossly gagantuan and the food was beautifully presented.  The bill came to $38 for both of us.  Maybe a little high for an off-strip breakfast/lunch spot.  But when taking into account the technique used to prepare the food and the quality of the ingredients quite fair.        The service was relaxed but attentive.  The owner was walking through the restaurant and checked in on all the tables.  The vibe of the restaurant was more consistent with something that I would expect in Austin or Seattle, so a nice change from what you usually get in Las Vegas.

08Fe45PrjP9hlwNGb1V8AA.text: Thank you for being off the strip but neighborhood was a little sketch. Food here was above average but not superb.

21VUr9tN9p8kph1hanKP-A.text: Probably one of the cooler restaurants I've been to in a while. I just had breakfast there and I was so compelled to immediately write a review. Eat is located in an area of Downtown that is being redeveloped. I'd say that this place is probably the impetus of redevelopment in its immediate area - the area looks like it could be kinda sketchy at night. But it was fine when I went in the morning. In fact, they are only open until 3pm, so don't be scared and check them out!  Walking in to the restaurant, I really got a hip, trendy, downtown feeling - exactly what I'm looking for when visiting any downtown restaurant in any city. I was promptly greeted and seated. I sat at the counter, which overlooks the open-kitchen.   The staff working there seem to match the hip, downtown look the restaurant is going for - tattoos, t-shirts and funky hair. I must've stood out with my clean cut look, but hey there are a lot of businesses in the area so I'm sure the "corporate" folk come here too, especially for lunch.   I ordered the truffled egg sandwich, which, thanks to Yelp, seems to be one of the more popular items. My food came out quickly and I was a lot of food! The sandwich was in a perfectly toasted croissant and was topped with eggs, mushrooms and very crisp bacon. It came with a side of potatoes.   Overall a great breakfast to start my day and a place you should check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xAI5JPtqBb6wY9TeIxHKIg.text: I've been coming here since the doors have opened... Phenomenal food, always consistent and quaint atmosphere. Great edition to downtown!  Highly recommend the posole soup and The Reuben.

VUx_FbNFHxkHZYqh3DVTAA.text: When I heard this place has beignets, I was completely sold. I have been craving beignets for so long, you'd think there would be more places that serve them! Anyway, I came here on a Friday morning and parking was not difficult to find. It was just street parking so bring quarters for the meter. The place wasn't too busy, there were plenty of open tables, but we still waited close to 10 min.   Food wise, we had to get the beignets to start. When they came, they were smaller than expected. They're also denser than I like, but still quite good. They reminded me of a sugar doughnut hole. The best part of them was the seasonal jam and vanilla scented mascarpone as the dipping sauces. I put so much of those on, it was like eating the dipping sauces with a side of beignet.   For the rest of the meal, the 2 others joining me had the Two Eggs any style with the smashed potatoes, while I tried the Chilaquiles. The Two Eggs any style was nothing to write home about. It was exactly as described, two eggs any style, a slice of bacon, bread, and some potatoes. The "smashed potatoes" were just cubed potatoes with some seasoning, which was a bit lacking. We all thought it was overpriced since nothing was particularly outstanding. My Chilaquiles was pretty tasty, it was essentially scrambled eggs with tomatoes and peppers over tortilla chips, a sort of breakfast nachos. But the chicken sausage that was sitting on top was a bit too sweet for the dish, it just stood out too much.   The staff was fairly friendly, however the one waitress that brought our check was not exactly rude, but she had some attitude when holding the check out for us. She didn't say anything, but from her body language, she looked annoyed at us for no reason.   Overall, this place was alright. It's a decent breakfast spot but I don't think there's much here to actually crave.

hee1e4F4Wa9XRe9MrE1VKg.text: Amazing! The best breakfast I had EVER!!! For those OC peeps, the potatoes remind me of The Omelette Parlor, which is no longer around.  I had the egg breakfast with potatoes, bacon and toast.  Orgasmic food. I would go back a million times over!!! Great food, great people...just great!!!

AA3kT5GYLRnV_UzM8v5ZWw.text: We took a cab from LVH to downtown Las Vegas to check out "eat - the breakfast & lunch joint". A few of our friends had checked it out the day before. It has a relaxed industrial vibe. I particularly like the light fixtures. But the overall feel of the place is cool without pretentiousness.  We had a chance to eat at the bar which looks into the kitchen. From this vantage you could see the chefs hard at work creating great food. On our visit Chef Natalie was sitting at a table doing admin work near the bar, but even though she worked on these paperwork duties, every dish still went out with her keeping a watchful eye on quality. She would occasionally banter back and forth with the chefs and comment about how they garnished the meal. The waitstaff was professional and friendly and checked on our needs throughout our meal without being obtrusive.  As for the food, I got the Huevos Motulenos - two eggs over easy with red and green chili, black beans, peas, feta and sauteed bananas on corn tortilla. And Rachel got the Mediterranean Egg White Frittata - Spinach, tomatoes, Kalamata olives, feta and micro-basil with whole wheat Toast. We were both very happy with our orders.  I liked the sweet and spiciness of my dish and I thought the peas added a great texture and flavor. I would definitely order it again. Rachel really liked how the spinach inside of the frittata was cooked so that it still had texture. The feta on top of the frittata was flavorful, and the olives had a good brininess but didn't over power the dish. She thought each bite had a good combination of flavor and it didn't need any extra seasoning. Our meal including fresh ground coffee was about $24 (not including tip). Considering the breakfasts and lunches we had at LVH, we thought the price was comparable if not cheaper and the food was a billion times better at eat. Even with the extra we paid for the cab ride, to us, it was worth the trip to get amazing food. Eat has only been open for about 7 months and I hope that they have continued success. We only get to Las Vegas about once a year and I really hope to get a chance to check out the rest of their menu. We would eat every breakfast and lunch here each time we come to Vegas.

adVo6FfN1Dtgo04d3vIJSg.text: Great brunch experience, waited 30 min but the order came very quick.  Limited menu but definitely worth trying. Go for the signatures!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-M2GpXw169B9TAju7XBk1g.text: I ordered using doordash, the order arrived on time which was great. But who would send a to go order without utensils or syrup for pancakes. I am disappointed because now i have three fluffy pancakes that taste like batter

K9P03TiowOBiV4V61Nrg3A.text: Be warned, you will not be seated until everyone in your party is there. I can see why, but it pained me to see people go before me that arrived after I did. First off, the house coffee is delicious. I had the shrimp and grits, mainly to avoid potatoes, and they were great. I definitely got out of my comfort zone with something new, which is a good thing. The sauce was really interesting.  My husband had the eggs Benedict with avocado which was awesome. Nice runny yolks and amazing potatoes. Great, popular, spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict special.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits.

z-14EOvXLFCuM3Uvix4rzA.text: Great brunch place in downtown Las Vegas.  Right by container park- amazing food.  Egg truffle sand which was amazing is reasonably priced and the service was great. 2 issues I had:  1.  There is only one bathroom and the line can get backed up especially on a weekend brunch day.  And 2.  The have no alcohol...so it's not a True "brunch experience". But the food is GREAT.  It's a must for anyone in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg truffle sand which

cns5eST-HGKnbahxCw82yQ.text: To me this was not a go to place to eat, it's more like a last resort when nothing else is available. The menu is three sheets of paper on a clipboard and has barely any choices that actually sound edible. Possibly just too hipster for me but not a place that I'd personally recommend.

jtY9-mXC9Z03WdtHdyabgg.text: Not sure why this place has such good reviews. Food was tasty but not for the price. The HOSTESS extremely rude and defensive. It was clear she did not care to lose customers. No matter how busy the restaurant, Hostess, manager,waiters etc. should always treat guest with respect. BAD I WON'T BE BACK.

tefrm1lq8t-hNP-4fWz8hw.text: I wanted a good non-touristy spot with great food so after reading a bit about this place we decided to come for brunch. It was a weekday and the place was pretty busy with the lunchtime crowd but we were still able to get a table as soon as we got there. After sitting down and getting a quick introduction from our server my impressions of the place was immediately favorable. It was obviously a local joint and the atmosphere reflected that. There were quite a few regulars there as evident from their familiar interactions with the staff and with the friendly service I knew that if we were locals we would be regulars here too.  And of course the food was delicious! My boyfriend and I shared the shrimp and grits and the corned beef hash. Both plates were amazing in that comfort food goodness kind of way. I loved the chunky corned beef and the way the grits were seasoned was just perfect! The toasts that both plates came along with was also good and you'd want an extra helping to sop up the creamy grits. Last but not least, the coffee was really good! I thought I'd be disappointed that they didn't have an espresso machine but we liked their coffee so much that we ended up buying a bag! Turns out they use beans from Mothership Roasters, a local roasting company that sources single origin beans. Yup, exactly my kind of place. We were definitely happy to have found this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits

_4zxQM4Dz8RC45Dc-6votg.text: Had breakfast here again 9.17.16.  Again, it was delicious.  This time around had the corned beef hash and eggs.  It was different than other corned beef I've had... but it was good.  Still, the deviled eggs are the star of this place.  Service was fast and efficient.  A favorite when I'm in town.

el-fb5BJSqCpviVVWcnupw.text: Very good food. Smaller spot than expected but very good food and service. The grilled cheese was awesome and the shrimp and grits as well. We will surely be back soon to try more of their food!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R-vtuVCGb71JkdU9qm-hAA.text: This place was so cool! I really loved how it was decorated - the ambiance! I ordered the pancakes and chicken sausage, cause pork is not good for me! My friend ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup, my other friend whose birthday is today, ordered the biscuits with strawberry compote, my friend Mariam got these potatoes with hollandaise sauce, and let me tell you, it was bomb dot com! Especially since people can mess this delicacy up! So needless to say, I tried my friendS' plates- yes PLURAL, because it was that good!!! My regret is not finishing my pancakes. Hahaha!!! #tapeworm

gNMy3y3jK2M8-bg7gjOzmw.text: Everything from the food to the environment screams trendy coffee house... but wait! The food is actually awesome. Juices are fresh, kitchen is clean, lots of interesting things on the menu... this is done very well.  The place is memorable, I stumbled on it a year ago and couldn't wait to bring friends here during my current visit.  I would love to have given them five stars, but our waitress was more interested in seating new clients than dropping our check. We literally waited with empty glasses and plates while finally standing up and leaving for us to checkout.  I wouldn't let that discourage you from visiting. When in vegas, this is a must to visit and enjoy.  Shrimp and grits were a very cool change, but pancakes and fresh orange juice is awesome too!

cptghpEZMmgTmE3anIfA-A.text: Came at about 8:45am right before the brunch rush on a Sunday. Sat outside on the patio on the only 2-seater. The rest were picnic family style benches. Inside the style is contemporary.  Ordered the huevos and fried steak dishes. Both were delicious. Their huevos dish has bananas in it and wasn't too spicy with both of the sauces. The steak was delicious and the fried breading and gravy made it even better. The sourdough toast was sick!  They have fresh squeezed oj here. It isn't squeezed on-site, but is fresh squeezed not from concentrate.  Service was pretty good for us but we came right before the rush. Servers stopped by within minutes of themselves and others to check in on us. We felt like we were celebrities. Gary, our server, was friendly and took care of us!  I'd come back again to try another of their interesting twists on a classic. There's street parking outside. Bathroom was clean.

tza62H5QVt6wGJtdwPaLYw.text: One chilly Sunday AM that we happen to be on the Eastside of town, we dec'd that we wanted to have breakfast and try something new. My husband wanted to go to Ellis Island, always a safe choice and unfortunately, would've probably been better off going there.   So to start, it's downtown. Parking can be difficult, the crazies roam around-- deal with it, they're about to pass out to sleep lol. It was about 9:00am so there was a little bit of a wait, 20 mins for us.   SERVICE: We were greeted by someone who we thought was our sever, turns out she only brought out drinks, ok. Server finally made his way over to our table and he was a borderline D. We were greeted with a very bland "Ready to order or do you need more time?", took out order and we rarely saw him after that. Everyone else other than our server was attentive and very nice.  SHRIMP & GRITS: Lacked the flavor that I was looking for. Lola's has their version of Shrimp & Grits that blows this one out of the water. The shrimp was way overcooked, practically rubbery. Grits is flavorless so you have to add things to it to give it some taste and it usually mellows out a dish and takes on the flavor of the sauce that the shrimp is cooked in. Unfortunately, the grits  muted the flavor of the shrimp rendering it to be practically bland and an all around disappointment.   CHICKEN FRIED STEAK: Tasted like it was a few days past its use by date, husband was so disappointed in it.  PASSION FRUIT ICED TEA: The best part of my meal. WTF.  AMBIANCE: Hipster and beyond. This is something that reminds me of what you'd find out in SF or SoCal. Menu's presented on clipboards, urban chic decor, great idea and if we went by ambiance alone, then this place would be 5 stars! Too bad, so sad it's not.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion Fruit Ice Tea

WBs01XeKvi7Qpv0WEOznaw.text: Breakfast before Life is Beautiful Festival....  We knew we were up against a crowd but honestly, we only waited around 20 minutes.  EAT came highly recommended so we had to try it.  It's located in the downtown Las Vegas neighborhood on a corner right behind the festival, so it was easy walking distance for everything.  The pancakes!  Yes...These were the best pancakes I've ever ate.  The were Golden brown with a perfect crisp to the top.  Full of flavor and not dry at all and it was served with a chicken sausage. Now the Huevos Motulenos, another great choice.  The menu is not huge my any chance, but they definitely have some really good options.  Next time we will try some of those biscuits and fried deviled eggs that I saw everyone having.  Prices are very affordable.  Don't miss out...

rfBddi9d3mikDwdvWgNNcg.text: Tried out Eat. because we saw it on Anthony Bourdain's Parts Unknown Vegas episode and we were there on Wed morning early so it was easy to get a table.  Street parking in the front is meter, but around the corner where we parked is residential apartments.  It's a hipster kind of place, people are friendly and they give good service.  We got:  Tap water - FREE  1 coffee $3 - she kept asking if we wanted it refilled and even if we wanted a cup to go.  B. got a full size bowl of green chile chicken posole $9 - it's a huge bowl we shared.  Soup was tasty enough, chicken dry.  I got Arugula salad $10 - even at 9am you can get salad.  I wanted it for fiber since when we travel we don't eat enough greens.  It was tasty enough.  Our total with tax $23.78 but before tip.  Separate bathrooms available.

BHxELfQiyercVjA8NPvj-g.text: EAT is for serious eaters. It's all about the food here. It clearly takes itself seriously in a good way. The best dish is the shrimp and grits, but all of the breakfast foods are well-prepared and high-end. The chef circulates and the vibe is one of a trendy farmhouse.  You will likely dine with a lot of locals, many of them professionals on lunch break. You may even find Tony Hsieh here from time to time, an early benefactor of the restaurant, and champion of downtown Las Vegas.

lH2KkAo0lVxhuwXKJ-6UFQ.text: Loved the breakfast dishes at this little gem. They also served Mothership coffee which is delicious. Perfect portions and excellent flavors. My husband had the eggs, potatoes (cooked perfectly crunchy) and bacon. I had the eggs and grits. So good!

h5T23MEgl_W4sutUPeJlpg.text: The reviews on this place raved so I thought I'd try it out- first off incredibly NOISY- food was ok but when the tall red haired waiter came and bussed the table next to me he REEKED of stinking cigarettes- every time he'd pass by I thought I would vomit! Really ruined an expensive $20 egg sandwich - wont go back- EVER

FzzuLzfVDBlfrn0G0ogswg.text: So yummy! Presentation is Instagram worthy! Try the Truffled Egg Sandwich. You won't be disappointed! Also- the coffee!?? It's velvety and borderline tastes like hot chocolate. What more do you need for a perfect breakfast or brunch? Lovely service and location.

Lq_ov7eit2Bas7JDfIVpNw.text: Fantastic breakfast menu. Small restaurant - we sat at the counter, which allowed us to watch food preparation. The chefs do an amazing job in a very small area! Everything is freshly made. Be sure to try the strawberry compote when offered. Yummy!

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RO7y0OV7fN_zyxLbJ3q9ag.text: Eat. What better name for a place to come to eat. A breakfast and lunch joint that covers all the bases. Service is on point and timely, staff is very friendly and attentive. The corn beef hash is homemade and oh so delicious! It came with a side of thick toast that was buttered and toasted perfectly and a pleasant surprise. Every bite of this dish made me want more. Tried the devil eggs! The menu says it can make a giraffe dance, and it was absolutely fantastic. Ask about the beautiful story behind these eggs. It's very moving. Indoor and outdoor seating and everything on the menu looked bomb.dot.com and I can't wait to go back and try more!!

KGTrtLqC5I5fF0NCVxtI0g.text: Checked our this place for brunch based on a tip from a friend and it was awesome!  I ordered the DWBBBLTA Sandwich  (bacon, bacon, bacon,  lettuce,  tomato, avocado).  It was stacked so high I really couldn't get my mouth around it but it tasted amazing.   There's a mild Chipotle sauce on it which makes it unique.   The homeade chips were great, too.  Everyone else with me ordered breakfast items and none were disappointed.   I'd definitely go back and recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute decor

_yM_Q-d0VXXtQ9QhfqH6vw.text: Amazing super cute super yummy had the chicken fried steak and egg amazing the toast was awesome will come back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak

qRtLj87tdObRiGYuFTVLjg.text: Absolutely impressed. My husband and I went on Christmas Eve for brunch. We got right in and we're greeted my two servers immediately. Coffee was quick and good and we asked our waiter for recommendation because we wanted to try a couple things. He suggested the short stack of pancakes. It came immediately. Literally. It was so fast. We both ordered an entree. I got the Mexican dish with green and red chile. Delish! I've lived in Albuquerque so I'm picky about chile and his was perfect. Great spice. Great flavor! The pancake, by the way, was also SO good. Fluffy and had a nice crisp to it. My hubby ordered the chicken fried steak. New take on it-- had maybe some chipotle flavor. Excellent. Then the server heard us saying we just moved here and he gave us a list of his favorite spots around town. Overall--- IMPRESSED! Def going back for the grilled cheese. The bread looks incredible.

hfbKApFt0eL_swRKZ9X_Dg.text: Before starting a day of outlet shopping with the husband, we decided to grab brunch at Eat based on some helpful Yelp reviews. The staff was friendly yet they seemed like they can barely keep up with the customers. I asked our waitress for some recommendations but she didn't have much of an opinion other than the portions were large.  We got our food and we sat for a bit realizing they forgot to bring us our utensils. I ordered the cinnamon biscuit with the strawberry compote. My husband felt like having their "killer grilled cheese" with some "kick-ass tomato soup." My dish was decent but unremarkable except that I couldn't taste any cinnamon at all. I felt that I may have punted and should have ordered the chicken fried steak despite the waitress thinking the portions might be too large for me. I tried my husband's grilled cheese. Frankly, I make a far superior grilled cheese. The bread was too thick and it seemed more like a cheese sandwich with melted cheese. I could give this place another go since we might not have ordered the right items. But in my opinion, if a place is going to name their dish "killer grilled cheese," they really need to back it up.

77fRyt_6GGMg9mPuXZqkEA.text: I was so excited to try Eat after a recommendation from a co-worker. This was my first stop Saturday morning arriving in Las Vegas. We got there around 8:30, found parking on the side of the building (you only have to pay the meter Monday-Friday). The 4 of us were seated right away however, by the time we left there was a line (get there between 8-9am). The fried deviled eggs were a winner, the eggs benny was good, especially after I added hot sauce. I tasted the shrimp and grits and it also needed hot sauce. To be honest I expected a bit more flavor however it was good... I just wanted it to be as GREAT as the Yelp reviews made it seem. I was mostly impressed by the service. The managers are all over the floor making sure you're taken care of. It's a real team effort there! I would 100% go back but I'll be sure to bring some extra seasoning with me :)

LPBCV9sFDEB5CJR-27HzSA.text: The food was really, really good The service was okay We are the cinnamon biscuits and the truffle egg sandwich  Food was A+ Service was maybe 6 or 7 out of 10 I recommend it

BM40i6bUMGIhkatLSyNMPQ.text: Came here for brunch on a whim and were so happy we did! Very generous portions and absolutely awesome food. EAT THE CINNAMON BISCUITS. Friendly staff - a little slow because they were so busy but they have great recommendations, be sure to ask your waiter. We'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CINNAMON BISCUITS SO GOOD

Cj22ThP-l_Sdt0BaR1Y5AA.text: I eat here pretty frequently, as it is the most consistent and probably the best breakfast / brunch place downtown.  That being said, it is ridiculous to me that you serve strawberries that haven't had the greens plucked or sliced from them.  If you don't want to spend the time doing it then serve them on the side with a cutting board and knife.

g6AMF8LHBmqtBd8bonTzwQ.text: Best food I've ever had in Vegas. And I've eaten at a lot of restaurants in the city. I'm a pescatarian  and was still able to enjoy a complete dish here. I order the shrimp & grits dish and was blown away. The flavor was beyond amazing! I ate every single drop. And the short stack pancakes were cooked to perfection. This is the type of restaurant I would expect to find in Los Angeles or New York. I will definitely be returning to this gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits, wheat toast, scrambled eggs and short stack pancakes

_a3BfvE6S_cAPYGnpMp0Ug.text: Jeez we hat s great place, I h as d the shrimp as N grits....Delish as and for desert berries and bisquets. I saw soooo many things that I have to try on the menu that for sure I'll be back........ ;) The service was super! Very friendly staff and ready to explain and suggest things on the menu. I give the a 10 all the way ;)

ocr9ft2FtoFbuoEChHNxog.text: This is a modern looking eatery serving both breakfast and lunch.  Located at the corner of Carson and 7th Streets, it faces a vacant lot which I believe is included in Zappos' Dowtown Project initiative.  The staff was very friendly though numbering more than seemed needed.   We requested a single order which turned out to be 5 small beignets served with strawberry jam and mascarpone cheese.  Owner/chef Natalie Young stopped by our table and cheerfully accommodated my request for a photo.  I feel menu prices are too high given the restaurant's location and the small portion size though the coffee and beignets had a high quality quotient.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets

HOiidzpExfJ-5P3RMy94CQ.text: I am in LOVE with this place for putting such a unique twist on breakfast and brunch! Grilled cheese on texas toast?! Where do you see that?! Almost nowhere!  We were staying near the strip, so going to Downtown Las Vegas was a nice change from the hustle and bustle. We got seated right away during peak breakfast time on a Wednesday morning. The menu was very organized into different sections, with a few options in each section. I have a belief that the smaller the menu, the better the food (usually) because they know what works and what doesn't, and there's less of a chance for you to order something that's just "okay". Anyway! I ordered the tofu scramble that came with chive potatoes, with a side of vegetable chili. My friends ordered the grilled cheese that came with tomato soup, and some egg dish (I forgot the name!).  My tofu scramble was very different from all the other tofu scrambles I've had in my time being vegan. I usually have it in little pieces so that it looks like..scrambled egg. Mine was in cubes. Very oily cubes. I wasn't a huge fan of the oil but the tofu wasn't too bad. The potatoes were very good. My chili was flavorful but too salty.  I accidentally had some tomato soup that had cheese in it (we had no idea), but that was one of the better tomato soups I've ever had. The grilled cheese was huge. For light eaters, I think that could've satisfied two people. The housemade chips were delicious as well (I think they had cheese in it, too?!). The egg dish was given a thumbs up from my friend.   All the servers are very efficient at what they do, but do not sacrifice customer service while doing so. Many other places should take pointers from here.  Overall, our meal was enjoyed and we left with our stomachs full and hearts happy! Come stop by if you're in Vegas to eat something a little different!

loM7b7pUtLMyz_VfsXd6AA.text: Went downtown to get marriage liscence the clerk recommended this place. Food was excellent ordered grilled cheese it was ginormous came with tomato soup which was also very good. Husband ordered huevos rancheros also very good.  Definitely would recommend you try this place out.

W-_4-WS9Sh8vVKgkSgzb3g.text: eat. projects an almost unbearable hipster vibe. Complete with a manual typewriter in the waiting area.  It also has the best darn pancakes I've ever had!  Perhaps there is some hipster drug i "probably haven't heard of" lacing the Golden Brown Pancakes, but wow. They were incredible. Fluffy and light, but also with a nice crispy Golden Brown texture that is making me hungry for them even now.  We arrived at a strange time between Breakfast and Lunch so parking wasn't a problem. I can certainly see how it could be though considering it's mostly pay street parking, and it doesn't appear to be in the best part of Downtown Las Vegas.  I certainly hope to stop in at least one more time before we leave Vegas this time, and plan to make it a must-stop for future trips!

aDeQcH7r5mb8mPQIa4Tx3w.text: This place has a super cool ambiance and served me the best shrimp po boy I've ever had. They sauteed the shrimp, rather than frying them and damn was it good. My family had a Reuben and a chicken sandwich of some sort that were both unreal. And they serve Stump coffee, so that's a huge plus. Props to our awesome waiter (T something?) and the chefs!

1kcuwsjJ-qKfAhOABufQvA.text: Went for breakfast, Food was excellent, coffee was great, staff was pleasant. Expect to pay 20$ per adult (Bottomless cup of coffee included) plus tax, plus tip. I Would recommend to stop for a bite and then walk to the Las Vegas North Premium Outlets to burn off those calories...about 30min walk or about 7$ Uber.

Is-O_qIz_xSVPklf8f5AbQ.text: BLT was amazing!! A little on the cold side, but still very good. Atmosphere is very simple and modern and fits in well downtown. Lots of young people eat here. We came in at 1pm when they closed at 2pm and the hostess was very cold and did not even say a word - I would somewhat understand if it was 10 minutes until closing but even then she needs an attitude adjustment.

zEY-y7IVwzoZd9fqiogq9w.text: All great!  Service was great and food was even better. Highlights were the pancakes and the tomato basil salad.  Highly recommend.

mPP1MG6uGke4oWvHAj04Gw.text: Went at 11am on Sunday morning. Place was packed and line out the door. Took about 15 min to get in and place was great. Loved the service and they were very polite and observant. Got the deep fried deviled eggs, chicken fried steak ( home made and not out of a box) cinnamon bisquits with a strawberry syrup and corned beef hash. Loved the place and can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried deviled eggs

KCGlKVd32BW2dX21GMkNng.text: The wife and I stopped in today and had some brunch at eat.  The verdict? Oh. My. God.  This place was amazing!  We started with some of their fresh baked berry biscuits which were freaking unbelievable. We're talking hot, fresh baked biscuits topped with fresh fruit and jam. Simply amazing.   For our mains, I had the chicken breast sandwich with mozzarella and a side of bacon on a ciabatta bun while my wife had the eggs benedict. Both dishes were awesome.  The chicken sandwich was cooked perfectly, and the bacon, mozzarella, and greens complemented each other perfectly.  The sandwich is topped with an amazing pesto mayo and the entire things rests on a delicious, toasted ciabatta bun.  I had the freshly made potato chips as a side and they were fantastic.  There were tons of them too.   My wife's eggs benedict was easily one the best she's had, with perfectly cooked eggs and fabulous hollandaise sauce.  The dish came with delicious potatoes, which were perfectly prepared. I also have to comment on the coffee, which was outstanding.  Rich and delicious and perfectly brewed. Absolutely fabulous coffee.   Service was friendly and impeccable.  We were greeted promptly by the chef/owner who offered us a pick of the available tables (we popped in an hour from closing and the place was nearly packed).  Orders for drinks and biscuits and then our food were promptly taken and served, with the food coming out just as we finished off those amazing biscuits.    This was a great find - we had amazing food and an outstanding time.  We already can't wait to return!

0OYe6TW6YrReRdbiENHGvg.text: I am utterly disappointed with my brunch experience at eat. Let's start with the food...  I ordered the eggs Benedict, which seems like a weekend special only (It wasn't on the menu). It was ok--I think the presentation was better than the actual food. There was a little too much hollandaise sauce and it tasted like any other eggs benedict; not a "special" if you ask me! The potatoes were good--it was due to the seasoning though...just the right amount of salt!  My friends got the corn hash, tomato soup and truffled egg sandwich. While the pictures all depict a salivating taste in your mouth, collectively, we thought otherwise. It was okay....I guess we were expecting more since the reviews had high ratings. But then again, we are from southern ca--the land of innovation and delicious food.   Let's just move on to the part that caused me to give this establishment a 2 star rating: Customer Service. Coming into the restaurant, we had a 20 minute wait, which was reasonable for a Sunday. Upon sitting, they took our drink orders and brought it out fairly quickly. Our server took a while to finally take our orders and from there it went downhill. My friend got the soup and it came out first. Thus, we can assume our order was put in (since one person in our party got their meal). But nope! For some reason, the rest of the orders were "cut off" and the kitchen didn't receive it. After 30 minutes, our server still hasn't checked up on us (not even to refill our coffee and waters!) and I had to ask another server for our order. You could imagine how annoyed we were seeing tables paying for their meals...even though they were sat after us! Yep...pretty sucky! With 2 apologies and no compensations for the lack of error on their part, I would not come back to this, nor recommend it to others. There are better brunch places out there that are worth trying and I'd rather give those establishments my time for their service. Eat definitely failed me and my friends. While some people won't take my review into consideration, I hope someone from eat will look more into this to ensure it doesn't happen again.

IoVhCuVGoQKsMItnGWDNbQ.text: Came here with my gf to meet a friend of ours.  Everything I got to taste was really better than I had been expecting so that was all pretty satisfying but I did notice it was priced as if we were inside a casino.  I made some mental notes of a few of the dishes I especially liked and I make them at home on the regs now.

eysF3RKI72oFglRRKymCCg.text: Food was amazing!  Make sure to get the biscuits and strawberry compote. Melts in your mouth. And the wait staff is awesome.

TmIbzWIOOnePZ53kHgaE7Q.text: Eat. Yum! Try to go as much as I can since it has opened. I love the place and love that it's downtown. Think I've tried something new each time and always impressed. Those beignets ah and the grill cheese.. Perfect early morning weekend place-  its good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cutest place

vv6wNumcekKfWpTwbqnWDA.text: The place is very cute and personal unlike many things in Vegas. They serve organic very good coffee. The food presentation is beautiful and the pancakes are to die for. It also appears that their owner is very involved. She was helping out the staff. The table are well spaced out abd the place is very clean and taken care off. Great :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Organic coffees

KAZqeIFGOnCZCVBmi6NLXw.text: I had never been to Las Vegas before, and brunch here was my first stop once I got into town. It was casual and bustling on a Saturday morning, but luckily we were seated right away. The main attraction for me was the deviled eggs. The menu simply says that they "are know to make giraffe's dance" but here are the details: there are 4 halves. they are DEEP FRIED. they are also topped with bacon and sriracha. Get them. I also got the Truffled Egg sandwich (I like eggs ok?) which comes with yummy chive potatoes on the side. I did notice that the menu politely declines changes or substitutions, but I am a vegetarian so asked for everything with out bacon (sigh....) and they didn't seem bothered or phased at all. Would definitely come here again next time I visit!

8OqEVcX0cjLJJpZPi6fJow.text: My boyfriend surprised me with a visit to Eat today. I though the atmosphere was really cute and chic. The service was prompt and friendly. Everyone dining there seemed to be in good spirits. I was a little disappointed in the fact that breakfast was over. Ok, I understand that it was already 1pm but breakfast all day should be the way to go.  I was torn between the salad selection and the free range chicken sandwich.  My Boyfriend ordered the BLT. When the food arrived we each shared a half. The BLT was the far better sandwich, although I thought the bread was a little over buttered. The free range ciabatta was bland tasting in comparison, not to mention the soggy ciabatta. Which really disappointed me because I was longing for that crisp addicting crunch factor.  I will be back to try the breakfast.

ZhiBRfev3YcokKs6hDwscA.text: Breakfast is like no other.  I recall my favorite meals over the years, my breakfast favorite will always be at eat.  The grits are like nothing else I've ever had for the first meal of the day. Absolutely perfect.  The setting, the service, the food.  Exactly what a downtown eatery should be.

cpfdVAiedq5KoCHSBK62fg.text: Ate here on a Sunday morning during brunch time, when everyone is out and about. They had a wait (10-20 minutes). We were sat within 10 minutes. Excellent service, our food arrived faster than we expected. We ordered the shrimp and grits/sausage and pancakes. Wow awesome food! The pancakes were so fresh and fluffy. Next time we're in Vegas we'll be sure to stop again for brunch. Not to mention how cute the place was.

koTItG4dXf3HV-4QpEzbmg.text: Great value, awesome food. Only downside....no mimosas......what Vegas? Haha! But I would totally return!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AeHUzif8ItzszKpAINAweg.text: Service was over the top (5 stars). I've worked in the restaurant industry and the staff here really made my dining experience exceptional. I came in with my parents and they enjoyed their meals: oatmeal and an egg dish. I had the tofu scramble and although it wasn't the best, it wasn't bad. They do need to kick that up a notch and add more vegan friendly dishes on the menu (I had to ask for the tofu scramble because it wasn't on the menu when I arrived yet it was on the menu online). The menu said it came sauteed with onions, peppers and mushrooms and I assumed it would be firm tofu scrambled but it was fried squares with little flavor and no onions or peppers (I told them to hold the mushrooms). The potatoes were delicious and so was the very thick cut toast! Yum! I will definitely be back next trip to Vegas but hope to see more vegan items on the menu.

0mBhO6dHb4AbzGfZi-zWXA.text: I must've gone on a good day because I did not have any of the service problems numerous people have commented about. The food, in terms of ingredients and recipes, was not anything special or out of the ordinary, but everything tasted great. We arrived around 1 pm last Saturday and were seated within 5 minutes. We chose the chicken sandwich and BALT, each with a cup of tomato soup. Everything had a lot of flavor. I don't live in Vegas but I'd go out of my way to eat here when I visit again.

q2edVXOXyBr8O7_POgMrTA.text: The staff was awesome and friendly. The food was beyond amazing . Definitely be coming back here. The ambiance is hipster cool type of vibe. Not too loud. Service was impeccable . Also is very clean

nqOC5L6_lkKz_iTviuSuwQ.text: Hands down the best meal and value I ate in Vegas during my two days. It's a simple spot with all the yummy, wholesome and perfectly crafted good you could ask for. My shrimp and grits was perfection. The bacon they use (in my meal and a few others on my table) was the best I've had in ages. They didn't charge for soda water, which I always order and hate being charged for. Loved this place and we went to container park when we were don't. Downtown is really coming along and I hope this spot will stills be in business when I make it back

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ambience perfection
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits perfection

OLDvREXiNfQ83TFrmBWHiA.text: Back again last week Nd Happy to report they still rate 5 stars! I had the special of Prime Rib Hash.  Watch out the Regular Stack of Pancakes would have fed my wife twice! Nice location a short walk from all the glitz of Fremont Street Experience.

uNAkWL-3zXPSpwG-HmQBmA.text: Even being near Fremont and having huge portions, I've had better for less.  I stopped in for breakfast and was immediately turned off by the coffee and the food didn't fair much better.. I know I'm lacking details, but so was the food.  Yeah, you're going to want to Pasadena on this one..

qY-NJu_ig9gSUeK9LFi4uA.text: Great service and great food.  Especially loved the potatoes that came with my eggs Benedict and the waffles were fluffy and tasty.  Finding a parking space is a bit of a challenge:)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict and pancakes...yummy!!

UODyxgoPzWPz7xobN9UAQQ.text: Great breakfast joint! Def won't be back to Denny's or IHOP in a while. This place is hip, service is great, food is delicious and so is the OJ!

keuk_QCu4pH7xVKysH4-1A.text: Visiting from Kansas City and this place is a nice little hole in the wall. Great atmosphere friendly staff and very good food. I sat at the bar and was greeted with a smile and prompt service. I also sat next to the cash register and got to hear the working chatter. They are very friendly! I will definitely come back!!!

ryMXt3QiZ4cb7V3YbC5yig.text: My husband and I shared the chicken fried steak and the biscuits with strawberry compote. Both were phenomenal and if I was local, this place would be on my regular rotation for breakfast spots. I wish I had more time to try the many items on the menu that enticed me. The biscuits were memorable and I will attempt to replicate them from my Southern California home!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor entrance to this adorable restaurant
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits made from scratch with warm strawberry compote and garnished with blueberries. So, soooo good!

s5fhu4bJz1DQSJI68tJHnQ.text: Eat was on my list last year when I came out here. I think I ended up going to MTO Cafe instead. Stopped here this morning for breakfast. Ordered shrimp n grits because it sounded good. Plate was out within minutes. Huge portion! It was awesome and full of flavor. Definitely come here on an empty stomach. Walking distance from Fremont Experience.

tUj4cFrdI52a4yj9kIeN-g.text: Lucky me to be able to try this place without a wait. We came here after our festival experience at Life is Beautiful (monday morning). There was no wait and we were seated immediately even though we didn't have our whole party (they were like 1 min away).  The decor of the place stands out! I loved it. You can totally do a photo-op here. We were seated by a cute wall and people kept approaching our table to take pictures of it.   Food was great (a bit pricey, but that's brunch for ya). I tried the truffle egg bacon sandwich, the biscuits, and the deviled eggs. The sandwich was really good! I wouldn't eat that every day though since the flavors are so powerful. The potatoes, unfortunately, were a disappointment. I needed so much ketchup since the potatoes were so bland. The biscuits were good but they reminded me of those strawberry shortcake. The deviled eggs were different than what I'm used to... that fried panko crusted egg gave some texture to the usually smooth taste. Flavors were there and I would definitely eat it again.  Overall, the staff were attentive in getting us water despite the busy crowd. Note: they do not serve alcohol.  For those who are waiting, there is a cute (and kinda large) wait area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle egg bacon sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs

lLk3FeH6YdqjIVsBy-VaeA.text: Oh man, I wish Eat. would come out to San Jose, CA. I visited my recently transplanted friend in Vegas, and she asked me to find somewhere for brunch. Well, thanks to Yelp, boy did I find THE FIND.  What an awesome place! First of all, we found metered parking on the street easily. As we walked the block closer, we could smell the B-A-C-O-N. No joke! The aroma wafted to our nostrils and led us right to Eat.   What a cook vibe this place has. Think industrial hipster. It's casual, good for groups, and kids. My friend, her 5-year old son, and I were seated right away. Since I did my homework and read up on the menu and everyone's recommendations, I had an idea what I wanted to order. The menu is just one page, so you're not inundated with too many confusing choices.   I told our waiter I was a wimp when it comes to spiciness, so he recommended getting the siraccha sauce on the side for La'Kat's Deviled Eggs. Those deep fried babies topped with bacon were awesome! My friend ordered the Corned Beef Hash & Eggs, her son got scrambled eggs and thick cut applewood smoked bacon. I tried the Truffled Egg Sandwich, which had scrambled eggs, bacon, wild mushrooms, feta, and green onions on a ciabatta served with potatoes. It was a little dry, but super tasty.   The next time I go to Vegas, I will definitely try to swing by Eat. If you live in Vegas or go downtown, you have no excuse. Go!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of strawberries
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La&#39;Kat&#39;s Deviled Eggs (siraccha sauce on side)

zfP2bA_dcq07nvd8lMqF8A.text: I swear this place never disappoints!!! The first place I came to as soon as we arrived in Vegas! Shrimp and Grits were amazing! Had the BLT and wow!!!! The serving is so big I could only eat half! Delicious!!!! I recommend this place to everyone I know! Service is great too!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Egg Sandwich!

W8RDgqZ3ySSuYur0Y-Alog.text: My favorite brekkie place in all of Las Vegas.  It's hidden around the downtown area.  My ultimate brekkie is the truffle egg sandwich.  I don't particularly bacon but I'll eat it because it's on this sandwich.  I enjoy the coffee they serve which helps on Las Vegas vacays.  Would I come back?  Everyday if I could.  The service is always always outstanding.  I bring my friends who come with me on trips.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle egg sandwich - my fave!  I replace the potatoes with tomato soup.  Perfect combo.

Qam9Bds3bLGoIvNoNtCEhw.text: DELICIOUS as always!!!!! Thank you Eat for yet another fantastic breakfast!!! Ordered our favorites and as always, service was spectacular! Marco was wonderful! This truly has remained our favorite breakfast spot!!

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancake Close-Up

BbT5PB6LF-i8S34TEp2H5g.text: Awesome breakfast/brunch place in downtown Vegas. The things we got below were all fantastic, which is what I would recommend getting. I would definitely come back if I were in the area again. The prices and portions are reasonable.   Chicken fried steak - The steak was hearty, tender, and nicely battered and fried. It was savory and delicious. Served on a bed of generously seasoned potatoes and side of eggs.   Cinnamon biscuits - The biscuits themselves had a nice texture. It was drenched with a tasty, well balanced strawberry compote, topped with fresh strawberries and powdered sugar.   Deviled eggs - The eggs were cooked perfectly. The filling was light and creamy. It had a light crispy batter to add a  balanced texture. And the crispy bacon topping was the icing on the cake.
