jfzdZKjihtC6lljVi_ZrWw.text: Wanted to check the hype out.  I saw so many good reviews. So when we got there there was a line.  Of course there is a long waiting to get in. Thought that was a good signed.  Asked if we can sit at the bar and was told no.  Since we walked there and was a little thirsty and i asked for some water while we waited.  The  hostess was like not sure if I can. I guessed she got approval.  to give us some water. We waited for about 15 minutes and finally got a table, the place isn't that big.  If you have a big party wish ya luck. A lot of 2 tops and 4 tops.  The wife ordered pancakes and wow they were a good size.  I ordered the chicken fried steak breakfast with scrambled eggs soft.  Egg came out over cooked and so was the chicken fried steak.  Services was good but I wasn't really impressed with the food.

D85vSmoWyvTlYSKXa57pdw.text: This cozy little gem is well worth the drive over from the strip. We ventured out to check out the Neon Museum and had this place bookmarked. We had to wait about 30min, but once we got to eating, we didn't care one bit.  I had the shrimp and grits dish that was divine. The shrimp were plump and plentiful and the grits were cooked just right. It got a little soupy towards the end, so I borrowed some toast.  My Father had Chilaquiles and he may have licked the bowl. He's usually an egg and turkey bacon guy, so this was a step out for him and he really enjoyed it. My guy had the corned beef hash...another winner.  Service was impeccable, deviled eggs are a must. We will be back.

MI43CE0Nby0c2eKFACl1HA.text: Excellent Restaurant. Loved it! Staff was friendly and attentive My husband had the corn beef hash and it was very good as well.  Oh and they have Fabulous coffee too!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits with Strawberry Compote

ZvlraOS0-rVUAvL4msNEGQ.text: This is the premiere place for breakfast/lunch in downtown Vegas.    Eat offers a wide array of elevated dishes - many with a New Mexico influence.    Red and green chilies abound.  My shrimp and grits breakfast fused a South Carolina classic with some southwestern ingredients.   Yummy.      You'll find the owner and head chef on premise all the time.  This place is her baby and it shows in the food quality.    I pop in every trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits breakfast
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting area

VU7AH4P4vQJ9iNEr_5i0AA.text: Had brunch on Saturday. Very excited to have shrimp and grits. Not a bad wait time for one. I made an error not reading the menu in full, because shrimp and grits came with bacon, eggs. Interesting, however unnecessary. Hate to be the guy that counts the shrimps in the meal, they could have added more then five baby shrimps. Honestly the meal was a bust. When the hell did coffee become $3!?!? Won't waste my time going again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eat some merchandise

yuO2QatDj_Wih6zDY1VTAQ.text: From reading all of the positive reviews and seeing that this restaurant is #30 of over 4,000 places to eat in Vegas (on TripAdvisor), I had to check out Eat with my boyfriend. It is about 20 minutes from the Strip, but as we had a rental car, it was easy to get to and situated right in downtown Vegas. If you don't have a rental car, you can easily catch an Uber to get here. My boyfriend and I came here midweek for breakfast, and had no wait to be seated. We both ordered the 2 egg any style. This dish is served with smoked bacon, chive potatoes, and your choice of toast. My bacon came out exactly to my liking, and to my surprise, they had some of the most amazing fresh rye bread. I also really enjoyed their Mothership Roastworks fresh brewed coffee. Eat will definitely be on our list of places to revisit when we are back in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our delicious &#34;2 egg any style&#34; breakfasts.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At the entrance of Eat.

KSOIqpeZwRfETXS1EHAwaQ.text: The food was overshadowed by the poor attitude of our waitress.  Not very pleasant!  And it took over an hour to get our food.  We were really hungry when we got there and famished by the time the food finally arrived.  It was a nice Saturday morning that was wasted on this place.

S0kHITAxYM-n7uMvHryIYw.text: The FIRST time my Fiance and I came was back in December 2018. We were in search a different breakfast place in DT Vegas that had a good selection of brunch items.  After searching the area, we found a few places. They all looked pretty good.. BUT, the Deviled Eggs caught our attention! So we decided on EAT.   If a little off the main DT Vegas strip, but fairly easy to locate with the gps.  The wait was very minimal. Staff was very friendly. And the food was GREAT!  Let me tell you...the Deviled Eggs did not disappoint! I almost didn't want to share with my other half.  Since then, its been our go to breakfast spot when we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Special Eggs Benedict
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 of the four Deviled eggs.

4tS1UAnarjXR4RTK_vXrKw.text: I found out about this place from a blog and what intrigued me was the chef/owner's story so I made a concerted effort to visit while in Vegas.  There was a decent wait BUT it's well worth it.  Once your order is taken the food doesn't take very long to come out. In fact it was so fast we were a bit confused and wondering what kind of vudoo are they doing in that kitchen.  LOL.  But no worries, everything was hot and well prepared.  I was there with 3 other people and none of us had any complaints.  The food was that good.  This is definitely on the list of places to get grub when in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These pancakes!! So so good. They&#39;re huge, share them, plan to take some home or order the shorr stack
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the scrumptious deviled eggs

Msp5YJJIZcRtdQG6cY8Uqw.text: The pancakes were amazing, best pancakes I've ever had.. hubby is an egg person and even he enjoyed pancakes. We came on a Sunday, their menu was very very basic like 5 items for breakfast... they said regular menu has only 2 more items. So basically you get pancakes, fried chicken steak, 2 eggs any style, eggs Benedict, or a sandwich.   At first the breakfast menu seemed weird three other tables around us thought the same thing and we were all flipping for more menu pages. When we got our food it was the perfect amount. The coffee was amazing. It's more of a youngster hipster place.. again there are only about 5 items on menu .. I ordered eggs to go with my pancakes... the pancakes were good alone. Customer service was amazing! Everyone asked how we were doing it's almost like there was no specific table assignments.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pancakes crunchy on outside fluffy on inside
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some breakfast sandwich

wVGAg8v4FGtatLlzZ6jqfg.text: This is a simple cafe, but it's not average. There are typical breakfast options, and there are options with unique ingredients.  Take the truffled egg sandwich, for example. It seems like it's just a typical breakfast sandwich, yet it's anything but.  The eggs were fluffy, the truffles gave the eggs great flavor, the bacon was also flavorful and crispy, and the bread was soft. It seems like that would be average, but it is rare that all elements of a breakfast sandwich are made well.   The only thing I didn't like about my meal was the side of potatoes...they were pretty dry, though well seasoned.  I try to experience new places each time I visit Las Vegas, but if I am in the mood for something I know will be good, I'll definitely return here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich

ReBIMkiSqsMeTkoRa9Tslg.text: This place was awesome! There was a relaxing cozy atmosphere with very friendly and helpful staff. The dining area was open and felt welcoming. This was a great place to eat away from the hustle and bustle of Vegas. Perfect for a Sunday morning to enjoy your vacation without the tourist-aimed strip atmosphere. This  restaurant was clean and nicely decorated, and the food was to die for. Everything sounded so delicious it was hard to choose!  Try the truffle egg sandwich it was a 10/10 with the country fried steak coming in at a close second!

DNfGu3nZcoeFgDzNUUA36g.text: The girl in the front not only forgot to write my name down but when I went to the host stand to ask why three other groups that came after us got seated she asked for the name I gave two more times. I told her SAM! Then my friend walks up and she said "are you sure it's not Jose?" THAT WAS THE MOST INSULTING AMD IGNORANT COMMENT IVE EVER HEARD! When I told her "no. I put it under Sam." She KEPT INSISTING THE NAME WAS UNDER JOSE. FREAKING RACIST AND STUPID IN ONE!!! I'm not even Hispanic! I was so disgusted in her stupidity we left, still hungry, extremely angry and most of all disappointed. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE

9OCZLFN6NZMhAU2VmSpdlA.text: Best breakfast I had in Las Vegas. Wish I could've stayed longer to come back and try anything I missed!

gL9dEKa3I1Zj4Hq_jO-fSg.text: We had pancakes and eggs Benedict and split it.  Pancakes were huge and fluffy.  Eggs were perfectly pouched hollandaise sauce delicious and potatoes were seasoned and crispy.  We will be back.

fpFzb-sWQsnSA1XELB6saQ.text: Had the truffle egg sandwich and it was delicious. Don't recommend it if you're on a diet because it seared in butter to perfection. Comes with a side of crispy Parmesan potatoes. Simple and very well done. Can't resist a perfect cooked piece of bacon!

MNgMgim6STmdBpOAsCuo0g.text: Had brunch here today... the restaurant was clean, a little cramped but not terrible. I had the two eggs anyway that came with bacon, chive potatoes, and toast. The toast was awesome! The eggs and bacon were cooked well, the potatoes were average. Hubs had the golden brown pancakes w/ apple chicken sausage. The pancakes were HUGE! We shared the cinnamon biscuits which were delicious. I would say everything was priced fairly and the service was good.

_P0lS6jufPGQFbmMNbW-pg.text: This place was pretty good.  We went on Saturday morning and the wait was supposed to be about 30 minutes.  At around 30 minutes they skipped over our name and let another party of 3 go, so it actually ended up being more like 40 - 45 min wait.  The cinnamon donut things were pretty good.  The chicken fried steak was a large portion and solid, but could have used more flavour.  The pancakes were fluffy and not dry, which I find is uncommon at restaurants.  I'd probably get pancakes if I ever go back.  All in all it was a good breakfast, but not terribly memorable.  A place I'd go again but wouldn't seek out.

GpewfOViPwh1ij8oIZJxVQ.text: Welcoming reception from the host. Friendly, professional service. Great food enjoyed by the entire group. A bonus of fun conversation to make us visitors feel more at home.  Pancakes were delicious but the kind that are so thick they make the syrup disappear.

7F1Tg2UQYkgC8_xx7uH-hQ.text: Perfect local place for breakfast & brunch. Pancake wasn't special but I liked rest of foods there. Especially, Deviled Eggs is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XAb1iM7DFnPEFmzvWd0FOg.text: According to yelp I checked in here 27 days ago and that's how long it has taken me to almost stop being disappointed. We waited about 35 minutes, no big deal. We were sat at a shared table when lower tables were open but I assumed a 4-top needed it but for at least 30 minutes nobody was seated at either of the open tables, no bid deal. Then the server came over and it went downhill from there. No greeting, straight to "have you decided on drinks" okay she's busy, no big deal. She returned and asked "are you ready to order" okay she's still busy, no big deal. The food came, we took ONE bite and she dropped the check and said "no rush." Unacceptable. We are locals that did a stay cation for Valentine's day weekend (no kids, adults only, special weekend) and this is the worst service we received in 4 days. The soup and grilled cheese was good, deviled eggs were good and my mans sandwich was good but nothing was great and the service was horrible. I take it back, the young lady playing the guitar was GREAT! She played No Scrubs by TLC on a guitar and killed it, she made my meal. If you get someone who says more than a few things, this experience probably isn't bad. Good luck.

VR5TEEpkfaemEcHz6l3g2A.text: Decided to try something different than the typical buffet and omelette station and I found a place that I will go back to every time I'm in town. It's a small cozy spot near a few blocks walk from the Freemont Experience.  I went around 9am on a Friday, and luckily I was able to be seated right away.  There's tons of street parking available for a fee and a convenient loading spot right in front.  It's a little dark inside, but I like the vibe.  Ended up trying a little bit of everything.  I liked the strawberry biscuits better than the pancakes.  Not that the pancakes weren't good, they were just on the heavier side and I prefer fluffy.  The pancakes were a little crispy which is a plus.  I tried the corned beef hash and the eggs benedict, all winners.  I ended up on the tomato soup and grilled cheese.  That might've been the best I've ever had.  It just reminds you of home.  What must've been a pound of cheese was melted between crispy texas toast served with a bowl of creamy tomato soup. Sooo good.  As you leave the restaurant the door says "ate."  Love it!

fzz2w5S5-dFFXM_Brk0uXg.text: First let me say this is the best ginger ale I have ever had in my life. The food was terrific. I love to sit across from the kitchen and see all of the magical ballet that goes on. We had the shrimp and grits and the chicken fried steak with eggs and potatoes. This place made me feel like I was in my father's kitchen as a child because I haven't tasted potatoes like that since I was little. Bravo. I absolutely cannot wait to come back and try more from their menu. If you are in downtown Las Vegas you need to come and try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zQAJUY28JMwxH4u_3LJ_Kg.text: Solid food. Great staff. They were quick and efficient and the place was packed our whole visit.

GQ9BGqElf-HPInsaLjlT2g.text: Great place! We are in town from out of state and wanted to venture away from the strip for a good brunch. Found this place on yelp and it was worth the short drive. Start out with the cinnamon biscuits! No much cinnamon, but more like melted strawberry jam on tiny English muffins. Yum! Two of us had the two eggs, bacon and potatoes and it was great. One friend had the grilled cheese and soup and she loved it. Venture away from the strip and try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese and tomato soup.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two eggs, chive potatoes and bacon.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits. Amazing.

bBFa309Q6ob7iB6NkTlSPg.text: We were searching for a local eatery and Eat did not disappoint. The shrimp and grits were scrumptious. Grits were not over bearing and  all flavors complimented each other for a tasty treat. The Egg Truffle Sandwich was phenomenal. This sandwich was mouth watering from the first bite!  It's extremely tasty - very favorable. The combination of flavors sing a melody in your mouth.  This is a must get if you visit this restaurant. It's locally owned and a neat place place for brunch. The only downside (that has nothing to do with the food) is a bit noisy. A special shout out to Darnell - who was attentive to clear our table. A nice addition to the dining experience.

dvPQgylhhqvccbC5Q0HJKA.text: This place was a little off of Fremont, totally worth the short walk and worth the short wait! It was packed inside and stayed that way the whole time we were here! The portions were great. We got a  couple sandwiches and sides of tomato soup, and potato chips. The bread for the sandwiches was thick and delicious. My favorite part were the freshly made potato chips, they were lightly seasoned and crispy but not heavy or greasy. The service was also great and quick. Would recommend!

JlkVhDRYuwZCJ-AzsVndAw.text: Beat kept secret in Vegas!  We walked over from the Golden Nugget, walked in and sat right down. We ordered the avocado toast which had arugula, avocado and 2 poached eggs. We also ordered the dish that had 2 eggs, black beans and banana plantains. Loved both dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MzvHpfSV9ewp44v84x24Gw.text: Eat was a hipster-y brunch spot located by downtown Fremont. It was cool, with little succulents on the table and a nice ambience. The food was good, I had the Truffle Sandwich, which was big and tasty. I would recommend checking out eat if you are staying in the area.

xWWq4rObBAnS5noLK0gVtg.text: Enjoyed the look and feel of EAT! Service was friendly and accommodating. If you are looking for some good, hearty breakfast close to Fremont Street, I would highly recommend!  A bit small so make sure your entire party is present when being sat. Recommend the chicken fried steak and special eggs Benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fries Steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

oPBx-xMFK45Z9cavxzQLaA.text: Looking for a place for breakfast with some character while visiting  Vegas, as the Strip sucks Pancakes were good, a bit doughy inside, not fluffy enough The sausage was dry For $12 the dish needed an egg or bacon, kind of poor I wished they asked if it was our first time, give us some directions. The 3 pancakes only you get bored, as there is nothing else on the plate, except a small dry out sausage. Other dishes we saw look good Well I hope it improves, I still would recommend

6aKXjgZV6lvcpCc0TFTL5Q.text: My husband and I have wanted to try this place F O R E V E R!!! But they always looked busy from the outside.  This past Sunday we were in need of some delicious breakfast and decided to pop in, regardless of how busy they seemed to be.  ABSOLUTLY NO REGRETS, in fact, we questioned why in the world it took us sooo long to try them!   It's far more spacious inside than it appears to be from the outside.  We ordered the Truffled Egg Sandwich & Kick Ass Tomato Soup to share and they did not disappoint!  Portions are good sizes; we took 1/3 of the sandwich and about half the soup home for later :)   The cibatta bread for the sandwich was so soft and wonderful.  The soup was hearty and great left over. The wait staff was attentive, refilling our waters and bringing the check without us even asking!   We will definitely be back to try more of their other offerings!! Thanks EAT for such a great experience!!

FKJc-bsbXOS5a9Xgkhfgag.text: Excellent food, not your ordinary breakfast spot. Great service and not so great parking but worth it .

m38-aCOgD45pKvxqFTlJ2w.text: Stumbled across this little gem on my weekend get away to Vegas and i gotta say my only regret is.... Not taking a picture of my food before feasting lol. But what can you say after a long night of partying your stomach gets the best of you. Their BTLA with the chipotle mayo is absolutely PHENOMENAL with a side of their famous spiced potatoes and its heaven on earth. The only disappointment were the their house made potato chips. Delicious but they have so much salt that it takes away from the taste.  That aside will definitely go back to eat here on my next visit.

0QqGhpTZHNoh-Da9UaXEuA.text: Had brunch from here while we were at las Vegas downtown.excellent place.good location and ambience.we had the egg truffle sandwich which was delicious and filling.we also had a pancake for our baby which was great as well.overall we had a good experience .

uYRrNNo4jeY7qz7W_8xiKg.text: After the Alzheimer's Walk, we opted for an American breakfast and since we've hit up Du-Pars quite a few times when we're in the downtown area, we decided to check out Eat after the rave reviews from fellow yelpers.  Chef Natalie Young has helped re-ignite the downtown area by giving people a hip trendy spot to start their day. As you step inside, it makes you feel like you're not in the desert, but somewhere in the Bay Area or even NYC. Serving breakfast and lunch, The menu items at Eat definitely has something for everyone. We decided on the Huevos Montulenos and the Downtown Benedict (Served on the weekends only)  Our server was very attentive and offered suggestions as well as answered any  questions we had before making our decision, and kept our coffee mugs full with the tasty coffee from the Colorado River Roasting Company-YUM!  The Huevos Montulenos is layered with tons of flavor-a tortilla with sweet peas, black beans, saltiness from feta cheese, more added sweetness from bananas(not sweet plantains) covered with two fried eggs and topped with a nice heat from the christmas sauce(AKA salsa rojo y salsa verde) served with a mound of potatoes. The benedict was kinda small in portion size but definitely made up in flavor with the wheat english muffin, turkey bacon sauteed spinach and two perfectly poached eggs that oozes out as you cut into it. Being in the food biz, I can tell whether a place cuts corners, but the hollandaise sauce is the real deal Hollyfield folks...it is dangerously good!  If you happen to be in the area, stop by for a tasty bite. You will not be disappointed! Looking forward to returning to try Chef Natalie's other creations...ALOHA!!!

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Montulenos(before being attacked)

PZsyQK3emb-IxIcuexcsIA.text: My favorite place to eat breakfast downtown.  Everything we've eaten here was all good.  - Golden-brown pancakes with chicken apple sausage and maple syrup - Shrimp and grits - smoked bacon, two over easy eggs, pico de gallo - Truffled Egg Sandwich - Green chile chicken posole  In particular, the crispy outer texture of the pancakes was just perfect, my wife's new favorite. All other items were great, too.

xJWD9HmuU3V_67-L7-rWpw.text: I stopped here during a layover on my way home to Portland after the holidays. In fact the food and atmosphere reminded me of home...it was delicious and well worth the wait. The tomato soup was amazing, along with the Truffled Egg breakfast sandwich I ordered. The staff were friendly and efficient.   Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rsHY5IFMcBKgpeJS6WSajw.text: EAT is my favorite breakfast spot in the downtown area where I live. I've been there at least 30 times and counting . If I'm going to have eggs Apple smoked bacon and  delicious thick toast EAT is a much better choice than Denny's or IHOP. I love the free range chicken sandwich and the Caesar chicken salad. the deep fried panko crusted deviled eggs with Apple smoked bacon and a touch of sriracha are to die for. it's an orgy in your mouth with a happy ending and well worth the money. Corned beef hash and eggs it's delicious, pancakes delicious, truffle egg sandwich delicious even the grilled cheese with basil tomato soup is delicious . So far everything I have eaten there has been delicious.   Natalie the chef and owner has brought a great burst of sunshine to the downtown area with her fresh twists on traditional American breakfast and lunch. I hear she's going to open a fried chicken spot can't wait to taste that.  If you're going to go try to go early it gets kinda busy around lunch time. A nice touch is they have some counter seating for single person or a cool community table if you like conversation. weekends are really busy so I usually go on the weekdays. The staff is pretty awesome and all very friendly. The line chef runs a very well oiled machine of a kitchen.   I never really have too much trouble finding a parking spot there's a lot of meters in the area. If you're in the downtown area I recommend making EAT a ATE.

D_s0omxXThu23YQJyxfy1w.text: Saturday morning. Seated pretty quickly. Located downtown Las Vegas & parked on the side where we paid about $2 for parking. Not too bad.  Our server informed us he could not split the checks and we would have to split the checks ourselves. There was no gratuity.   Had the chicken steak with gravy sauce and replaced my eggs with bacon. Also had a stack of pancakes.   The chicken steak tasted a bit plain. So I ended up pouring a lot of syrup on almost everything. Lol their syrup containers are among the cutest I've ever seen. Lol   All in all , I had some expectations for this place with the reviews. It was just okay.

NmSD00nSRsl-Ehjkr_DtVg.text: Why haven't I heard about this breakfast/lunch place sooner?  This place is located in the heart of downtown Las Vegas, adjacent to container park which is by the way a pretty neat park/shopping/dining area.    The ambience inside the place was perfect. It's more of a like hipster/breakfast vibe w/ wooden decors and stainless chairs.    One of my old time favorite breakfast is country fried steak and I was a little iffy getting it here but I had to try it.....and let me tell you, it met my expectations! Eggs was perfectly cooked right and steak was perfect, not rubbery or oily like other breakfast joints. And the potatoes that came with it  was pretty good as well. The only thing that really surprised me was the toast, it's not like a thin bread that they just took out of the package, but a thicker bread slathered perfectly with butter and the bread is fantastic!   Also had the golden brown pancakes which is WOW! It's 3 pieces of buttermilk w/ chicken apple sausage on top!! Very creative and the pancake just melts in your mouth w/ there honey syrup which is finely made at the restaurant!   Drinks we had apple organic juice...and let me tell you for me being a big foodie and not really a health freak....this made not want to drink just a regular "Apple juice".    Overall, great ambience, great location, great staff. Try to come early as it gets packed fast.  Will definitely bring family and friends here.  Worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden brown pancakes w/ chicken Apple sausage.

WjOESxV4xjBFnYMaQh5CrA.text: This place is a staple location to visit for my husband and I every May and October  (yes, Vegas twice a year. It's an addiction.) When they are with us, we always make sure our friends come with us so that they may partake in the awesomeness of this joint as well.  Eat. was discovered by a dear foodie friend of ours a couple years back, and ever since, we all make sure to go there at least once. Their coffee is awesome, their golden pancakes are oh-so-fluffy and ever so sweet, and their biscuits with the strawberry/berry sauce are OMFG AMAZING. Like seriously, I don't know how to better desribe them other than by using hip, youngster acronyms. We always get a plate or two to share with our group before eating the rest of their menu.   I almost failed to mention their adorable (and, of course, delicious) mini-syrups that come in little jars. I always try to get at least 2 to go just so I can keep them at home and never open them--they're too perfect and cute.   Service has always been wonderful--we have never had a bad experience. All the waiters, waitresses, hosts, and hostesses are always so nice and professional. We have had Gary two times in a row the last year, and he is very funny and sweet, and also very attentive.   To sum all of this up: you should eat at Eat. It's not even an "if"-- it's a "no question at all, you should". I'm glad this place exists.

_NtFHKRtsYZOpWx2CSo_QA.text: Not that impressed with this place, and won't bother returning. I wanted to take an out of town guest somewhere fun for breakfast and had this place bookmarked for a while.   What we didn't like was the slow, unfriendly service: We came about 10 am on a Sunday morning and were quoted 25 minutes for a table of 3. We waited 45 mins later after questioning why groups were being sat before us the hostess said "oh I didn't know you were willing to sit at the high top table." Well, you didn't ask and I'm starving now!  When sat...we waited for someone to greet us...5 minutes beverage busser got our drinks...10 mins after our server Robert shows up asking if we were ready to order and realized we still didn't have a menu. Didn't feel welcomed. Bummer wanted to love this place   The good: the food was very delicious and we all got the same 2 eggs any style, chive potatoes, bacon ($11) they use high quality no hormones/organic etc food and the taste is great.   Maybe consider takeout? Never tried it for breakfast but the service is so bad and the food is so good it may be worth it.

nxv9KTrOKJamWVEuQUBFCg.text: I'm two years late to the party, but I finally ate at Eat. A few weeks ago, my husband was downtown on business and called me up asking for a recommendation for lunch. I told him to try Eat. Afterward, he told me about the awesome blta w/ egg sandwich he had. He took me to check it out the day of the Santa Run, but the santas kept us from getting to Carson and 7th so I'd have to wait to try Eat. Then, last week; success!   If driving be prepared to feed the parking meter. The restaurant sits on the lower level of Park Avenue Apartments. This tired building is sure to experience a revitalization thanks to the Downtown Project. Carson Ave has become a hot spot for downtown dining and it began with Natalie Young's Eat. She was the first to partner with Tony Hsieh and see her dream to fruition. She is currently working on her next venture, Chow.   Eat bustled on a late Saturday morning, while there was no line out the door. There was a wait for a table, but counter seating was available. We settled in and gazed over the menu. Our server asked, "Can I get cinnamon biscuits started for you?" Many might be duped by the question thinking they are complimentary, only to be surprised later by an $8 charge on the bill. It is a bit sneaky so be warned. Yet, we said, "yes, bring them on!" The tender biscuits swim in strawberry compote and are topped with berries. It reminds me very much of strawberry shortcake, add some fresh whipped cream and it'd be the perfect dessert.   When it came to ordering we skipped right over the breakfast items and went straight for the sandwiches. I had to try the dwblta ($11) myself and the husband went for the killer grilled cheese with tomato soup ($9). During the week more sandwiches are available, they all sound fantastic. However, if I ever get a chance to dine on a weekday, the chilaquiles will be mine!   I added cheese to my dwblta, I skipped the egg; I don't dig runny eggs, blasphemy, I know. This sandwich was great! All components married beautifully and the sourdough bread held it together without being too bready. It was a thing of beauty, truly. Sandwiches come with a side of house chips, potato or tomato salad. I really enjoyed the tomato salad. Despite my best efforts I could only devour half of the sandwich. I took the rest home. This sandwich could easily be shared.   He added tomato, egg, and avocado to the killer grilled cheese. It was a tasty twist, especially when dipped in the soup. However, as good as it was we agreed we enjoyed the dwblta a bit more. In fact, it might just be the best damn sandwich in lv.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. killer grilled cheese with egg, avocado and tomato.

iaOya3Tq8tImFST8tB0lIQ.text: Lovely brunch spot! I came on a Saturday and waited for about 25 minutes for a party of 3, which wasn't bad at all in my opinion. Only downside is that the location is in downtown and the parking can be a bit difficult if you come by on a busy day.   Me and my friends all ordered the Eggs Benedict which was delicious! I usually order Eggs Benedict at any brunch places and eat's benedict by far has to be one of my favorites. We shared an order of the cinnamon biscuits which I really enjoyed and wouldn't mind ordering that next time if I was craving something sweet for brunch.   I'm happy that I finally got to try one of the most popular brunch places here in Vegas and will be coming back soon for another brunch date!

PoXLs4UmBtMNPM5-JNfq3Q.text: Stopped by on my vacation to LV, turned out to be the best meal I had in town.  Something about the local vibe, the location, the staff - just everything clicked.  Upon asking, the server recommended the roast beef sandwich (it was lunch time) and that's what I ordered.  On the page, a roast beef sandwich doesn't sound too appealing to me but I went with the recommendation and was not disappointed.  It was fantastic...like, it's a shame it's just called a 'roast beef sandwich' - it's too bland of a name.  I wake up thinking about that sandwich sometimes.  Will be back next time I visit, most def.

bj_2JrzjQfZjMl-WYX4CVQ.text: I wanted to love this place, but maybe I ordered the wrong thing... my shrimp and grits was more of a soup than I'm used to when ordering this dish. The fresh OJ was nice, but overall nothing stood out here to me.

VK9td7jHTHnHVjTHlHhT_Q.text: I really wanted to like this place, but too many things led up to this being a 2 star review based on my experience. We have tried several times to eat here but they were either closed or I just was pressed for time and couldn't wait as they're always packed.   We arrived at around noon and it was stated it would be 25 minute wait. I waited outside patiently with my guy and we were seated about 20 minutes later. We sat down and my guy went back to the car to make sure we paid the parking meter. I waited about  10 minutes to even be acknowledged by anyone. The wait staff and kitchen staff were very busy and everyone running around this fairly average sized place. After a gentlemen took our drink order I waited patiently for my guy to come back. I thought he brought sanitizer back as I didn't bring anything in with me besides my phone. So I got up to head to the restroom so I could wash my hands. As packed as this restraunt gets I had to wait for the restroom. The lady who exited explained they ran out of paper towels and let a wait staff member know , but she just continued to fill drinks and then completely disappeared. So i made serveral attempts at making eye contact in hopes of being able to flag down someone to refill them. While staff members just gave me blank stares and ignored me. Finally a waitress with her hands full informed me they were in a cabinet inside the bathroom and tried to open it with her shoe while her hands were full of dirty plates and ketchup and hot sauce bottles mind you she's all the way inside the bathroom. Finally another girl came to put them in, informed me they didn't carry toilet seat liners when I asked about them. It was brought to my attention after my guy had used the restroom told me the girl who I had asked about liners was talking about me to other employees saying I was lucky they had toilet paper.   This is not the type of service I hope to recieve in a McDonald's. After an almost 30 minute wait and the rude customer service I was hoping the food would be okay. Which it was decent. I won't lie about that.   Shortly after we received our food but I was just so upset I didn't enjoy my meal. My guy had the shrimp and grits and since I'm not a fan of shrimp I didn't even bother to try. My corned beef was a bit on the small side but I did enjoy the sourdough toast it came with. Very buttery and crispy. Yum ! The pancake was a standard pancake nothing special.  Usually after a first time disaster I would give them another try but I definitely will not be returning to Eat.

tFc5xxJ1QrzfoIqkSYj_eg.text: Great pancake, egg is egg bacon is bacon. Great vibe good location. Originally I ordered shrimp ok boy sandwich, asked if they put any Cilantro, waitress told me there will not be any cilantro, but napa slaw came with cilantro, they were nice enough to take the food away, still it made me feel sorry for them. But still I will come back and try other items on the menu

q3qMO7u0zFF_YznyFZz7Iw.text: This place came highly recommended by local foodie friends.  Cute place.  Service was great, portions were more than generous, food did not come close to meeting expectations. 1) Golden Brown Pancakes and chicken sausage - cakes were definitely golden brown.  They were moist but VERY dense, resembling a True cake like texture... imagine eating a 6 inch cake stacked 4 inches high!  Plate was served with one chicken sausage which seemed to be more of a garnish in comparison to the large portion of cakes.  Ended up ordering a side of bacon which was thick and tasty.  The bacon side was generous (5 slices)!!! 2) Huevos Motulenos - Very interesting combo of flavors especially with the bananas in such a savory dish.  Did we regret ordering, no.  Would we order again, no. 3) Green chicken chili posole - awesome flavor, pleasant amount of lime notes, it was served a little above room temp.  Not hot, just warm. 4) grilled cheese and chips - 7 year old was pleased but only able to eat 1/4 of the sandwich (would've been great if they had a Childrens menu or smaller portions available).  Chips were homemade and DELISH.  5) veggie burger and kick ass tomato soup - veggie patty lacked flavor and consistency was unpalatable, almost slimy.  I enjoyed gutting the burger, eating the alfalfa, tomatoes and Avos as a small salad on its own.  As a veggie foodie, I would not recommend.  Tomato soup did not kick my ass.  Flavor was okay, but the generously thick Parm shavings were unable to melt due to the again, tepid temp of the soup and possibly that the shavings were too chunky.  Still had a mild acidic tomato flavor (which I love)... just "cold".  The bread is thick and well grilled... if you love bread, they've got a lot.  If you don't, maybe explore the anti-which options.  Coffee stayed hot and filled to the brim. Again, service was great... although no one noticed that my entire veggie patty and bread sat on my plate as a deconstructed mess.  I was never afforded the opportunity to voice my dissatisfaction, would I have complained and sent it back? No but I would have definitely given my opinion.  I think it's a nice addition when servers ask about your experience and quality of food.  Otherwise you rely on yelp for constructive criticism/opinions.  Cute place, although off the beaten path.  Solid base, but room for improvement.

QDRlIuqgJdfr0cV3z878Mw.text: Really disappointed.... I ordered the shrimp and grits and am going to say that I should have asked more about this.  This came with bacon, eggs, pico, and shrimp and grits. Everything was piled into a bowl which left it like I was eating soup cuz there was so much liquid in the bowl. The bacon was at the bottom and gross cuz it was so soggy. I ate the shrimp and some grits and left everything else. My hubby got the chicken fried steak. This had good flavor and the batter on the steak was good but we couldn't even cut through it, it was so dry and chewy.... Spent $40 on this and won't be returning. The two stars is because it was a nice atmosphere.

Yq1ZccQGSxUkr_5fjq_5-w.text: I will never go into this restaurant because of the way they treated my friend when she went there. How rude! When a waiter has the balls to tell you to move and speaks disrespectfully, it is very sad.  It matters not how great the food might be, I will never try it.

1798O2raEyPfwZcQU0n6iA.text: Yay for an update with an added star! If you read my initial 3 star review, I said I will return in hopes that the breakfast is above average. Well it was, and again the owner/chef was very much involved.  I sat solo at the breakfast bar. I enjoy this because the kitchen is in clear view and you can see everything that's going on. Including communication and hustle of the staff. The girl who cooked my food even came over after to make sure I enjoyed, and suggested something for next time. I LOVE THE INVOLVEMENT!! From everyone!!  But anyway on to the food!  First off, the don't have beignets anymore, boo :( They were fresh and perfect and the mascarpone cheese (that is also a goner) went perfect with the bread and raspberry preserves. Instead they do offer a raison cinnamon bread. I passed because I had my heart set on something else.  By suggestion of the waitress I went with the ever so popular Huevos  Motulenos. It is a mix of fried eggs, green and red chili, bananas, black beans, peas, and feta served on top of a corn tortilla. I loved this dish. The chili alone was wonderful and had just the perfect amount of spice and flavor. It also blended real well with the other ingredients. I wasn't a huge fan of the banana, but I do not really eat bananas anyway, so no shocker there. I could see how it accompanies the dish for those who do enjoy them. I was told next time try to truffle eggs, which I intend to do.  Also, the orange juice was great. Some may not make a big deal about that, but a big glass of fresh OJ with a filling breakfast hits the spot!  It is great to see the success of this place downtown, and I will continue to be a customer and a fan!

Sq_4G1NY7OwjetjPDS0tJw.text: I have returned to Memories of a great restaurant with great food. This time I tried the deviled eggs with just a side of the chicken sausage and a bowl of grits for breakfast with a large glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. The deviled eggs were a warm creamy and spicy which gave me a bit of a shock but a thrill  I ate every last one looking  the sauce off my fingers.  I will definitely be dreaming about this one! The service was great the food was even better just like I always remembered. This breakfast was taken place on a Tuesday at 10 o'clock and the restaurant was full with buzzing locals. This will always be one of my favorite breakfast spots everything that I have tried here is very good so please, eat up!

s9wybrSCjBuibkRlJLzAXQ.text: Grabbed some breakfast with my girl. She had a two egg breakfast, basic but good. I had the truffled egg sandwich and it was amazing. Big portions!!!

SPEeq8F_nz9Jd8fk7JCB9A.text: This was my first time here and it will be my last, Jamison welcomed us and had great customer service, a lovely lady took our order for the drinks (great service as well) and said Andy your waitress will be right with you. Andy was a little rood but I just ignored her negativity. My 11 month old son accidentally threw up so we decided to leave. I told Christian my son threw up and I apologized over and over. He answered "I'll have someone clean that up" of course he told Andy and I saw when she made her stank face and refused to do so! Christian then told Jamison to clean it up, he immediately did and once again I kept apologizing. He replied with don't worry guys I have kids of my own and I totally understand. The food was amazing but the service needs help ! Maybe Jamison should teach them a thing or two !!

fMEhHpxylrEyd-9XVkqfOQ.text: I was excited to eat here because of all the Yelp raves about it. It's about 10 minutes from the strip and parking was easy (meter parking). Also the name of the restaurant is in a cool stylized font with the whole period thing at the end of the word eat--just makes you want to eat, right?  I went with the Huevos Motulenos which I honestly didn't like--I'm not sure why so many people are nuts over this dish. I feel like the salsa just doesn't go well in a main course. It was an interesting concoction of food items I've never really had together but I wish I had gotten something else. I wanted to try the Truffled Egg Sandwich but they only serve it Monday through Friday. Their pancakes are huge.  I want to give this place 4 stars, but I can't because were somewhat duped into buying an appetizer. So, you know how lots of restaurants give you free bread before your meal? Our waitress asked us, after serving us water, "would you like some biscuits?" Well, to us this sounded like pre-meal free bread so we said yes. What she really meant to say is, "would you like to start with an appetizer called the 'cinnamon biscuits, warm strawberry compote'?" The money wasn't the issue, but the trickery into ordering more on the menu. She might as well have started by saying, "would you like to start with the Dom Perignon?"  The staff was very nice/efficient. I recommend checking this joint out if you want some breakfast off the strip. Is it worth taking a taxi here? No. I really only went because I had my car. Albeit, this is a decent breakfast eatery.

ZUDafbWM5Eq3Z2QgmnBp5Q.text: Now I've had this place bookmarked for nearly a year so I had very high expectations for this place. One of my Besties and her husband were in town and wanted to meet for breakfast. Since they haven't been in the newly renovated DT I figured that this would be the perfect place to have breakfast at. FYI We parked at El Cortez and walked over, which the restaurant is located right behind/after The Container Park heading south on 7th.   It was about 930am and the place was relatively full so we waited about 2-5 minutes to be seated. Customer service on this end was good as the hostess greeted us immediately upon entry and as she stepped away to clear up a (or perhaps even our) table one of the waiters walking by asked us if we have been helped. I like that. The place is a lot bigger than I was anticipating it to be however it's very DT. I can understand how this place can get packed especially if there are larger parties.   Anyway we got our seats and overlooked the clipboarded menu. Our drink orders were obtained off the bat however it did take a while to get our food order. Which our waiter politely apologized for the wait. The food did take a while too but I didn't mind as it gave me the opportunity to catch up with The Newlyweds however my tummy wasn't too thrilled about that as it couldn't stop growling.   For my drink I opted for the EARL GREY SUPREME tea ($4). It's basically just a tea bag of earl grey with a side of honey, which I dumped the whole lot into my cup. Refills of hot water are allowed....as with the coffee which my girlfriend ordered.   For food I ordered the EGG TRUFFLED SANDWICH ($12). It was superb. I knew I was getting into something tasty and delicious as I could smell the aroma of my chived potatoes waiting to be devoured. I didn't need to add any hot sauce(s), which are available upon request. There were perfect amounts of scrambled egg, bacon, and  mushrooms in between slices of the warm cibatta bread.   My buddies both got the pancake stakes($9)--so typical of Newlyweds, order the same exact thing. The stack was three full/large pancakes and had a sliced chicken sausage atop it with a strawberry and powered sugar to garnish. I'm not much of a pancake girl--maybe with my makeup time to time when I'm rushing--so my review on them will be bias. It was okay. They are very popular here so feel free to order them. Both of them liked their pancakes.  [Note: we really wanted to order the beignets to share however the waiter said that they are discontinued. I know I heard discontinued. Which is a real bummer as they seemed very, very popular so I'm hoping the waiter was just misinformed or meant to say that they were not being served the morning we went. That was a real bummer. Hence the knock of a star for the rating.]  All in all I'm pretty positive that I will be back again. And I'm already thinking I'll be back with the other (Yelp/Xtian) Bestie as she's jelly that I ate here. Awaiting that CES check first!!!   It's really a 3.75 star rating if we had decimals to rate with. Would I recommend it-yes. Would I come back-probably. Would I reorder what I ate & drank-definitely the sandwich, however I'd opt out of getting tea again as I can't justify the pricing for it. Maybe I'll just get another drink. There are other options on the menu that I would like to try and maybe I could give an updated review then!   Happy eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $12 truffled sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $9 pancakes

cUwQTyMJEwc_r9tZqBRPDg.text: I love breakfast joints and finding somewhere near North Las Vegas with a good reputation that's not part of some international chain. It was my first time here and I came with two friends. I was expecting a rush at 830am but we were seated right away and they even had a little awkward table for a group of three. I thought that was really cute.   The service was great. Drinks and food came out quickly. The waitress made sure we were satisfied with our food but didn't come around often enough to make it annoying. They had a smile on their faces and made me feel like they genuinely wanted us to enjoy our time.  The owner was sitting out in the diner overlooking the operation of the restaurant and even pointing the staff to make sure things were getting done. I add this to point out the hard work and diligence that goes on at 'eat.'  We started off with the strawberry compote and it was amazing. It disappeared in all of five minutes. (Split this with a couple people before your meal. You will not regret it.) The berries were so fresh and so were the biscuits.  The orange juice is fresh and a bit pricey. I had the Downtown Benedict. The poached eggs were perfect. I loved everything about this place and plan on taking others with me. It is a little pricey. But you will come out of there very satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits with strawberry compote.... Amazing.

YRI29a7s0Z43hzoYC2W-BA.text: Just ok! We missed breakfast, I was with a party of 4. Fairly long wait time. Average service. Meals were mediocre at best. I probably had the winner of the bunch...the Shrimp Po boy with homemade chips---great!

mF3ZsCK3NDLfnFXkCWiOGA.text: Decided to eat some breakfast and Yelp led us here. I decided to go with the shrimp and grits since I had this dish at Brenda's in SF. The shrimp and grits at Brenda's was more creamy whereas this version is a bit watered down but still very flavorful. There was shrimp, bacon, grits and salsa which some how made the perfect combination of flavors. It wasn't too heavy but really tasty.   I also got to try the biscuits with strawberry compote which was a flop to me. The biscuits were not warm or flaky and felt like eating dry bread with strawberry compote. I don' t really care for biscuits unless I'm eating them with fried chicken so maybe I'm biased but I'd rather have a pancake, waffle or crepe.

bydwFbPtWMfJchQrWow30w.text: Summerlin Proper Location. Service was great. Chicken fried steak was worth the calories. I asked for my potatoes to be crispy and they came out mostly burnt. I will return but not make that mistake again. Iced tea was fresh and refreshing.

E7P2sHrBkXW17Pq2gsS1uQ.text: One of the first places I think about visiting when I am up & early, and hungry. It's just wholesome, fresh food done right with a comforting feel and a refreshingly hip, clean decor. An unexpected surprise that is unique for the downtown area.    I almost always go for their short stack of buttermilk pancakes served with your own little jar of real maple syrup. Fluffy, creamy, sweet, homey goodness. Some of the best I've had. Hopefully more variation and play with the recipe in the future.   Truffled egg sandwich is amazing. Soft fresh bread, sub style with the most decadent but lightest scrambled eggs, bacon, mushrooms etc. A must try. Also comes with seasoned home fries.   Tomato salad is refreshing and light. Might just change your mind about the flavor tomatoes can posses.   Other items to check out-Corned beef hash, biscuits with fresh strawberry compote/ fresh fruit.  My only con would be that some menu items aren't available from time to time, maybe due to acquiring fresh product? (Paper & clipboard menu) I've also tried some other items that often miss the mark on just flavor.    Service from the lady's is great. Always on point and genuinely attentive. Nice, knowledgeable, caring.   Parking may be a little ways away and most often, pay to park.

KlW_qNBQDjSOjqYLUZlBhA.text: Awesome service, awesome food. Love the  TRUFFLED EGG SANDWICH and the GOLDEN BROWN PANCAKES. Will come back again.   Note: Parking is on the street for 2 hours.

uvxRbpRXQ3jEG6YJnNjj3Q.text: Great taste pushed me to five star side of the fence. I put a lot of weight into my cup staying full. During my breakfast visit my cup went dry and stayed dry too long. Everyone was friendly and acknowledged me during each pass but I would have much more appreciated a refill from any of the servers. That was the only missing piece of the puzzle. Food was fantastic home style taste with mod presentation. The pancake taste took me back 50 years to my child hood kitchen and my dad's flapjacks.  I will be back and do highly recommend a visit  to EAT

U5LW-PZ3fQJNzmQp57ATng.text: I love how fresh the ingredients are. i had their eggs Benedict and everything tasted so farm fresh like it was just picked that morning. Had the biscuits and strawberries before breakfast and it was the most amazing thing I have had in a while. We came on a weekday after 9am and were seated right away.   I would've given them a 5-star, but I've been here for lunch and it was so loud, had to wait to get a table and I had a tummy-ache afterwards.   For breakfast however, I would come back, but I'll pass on lunch.

WQaZR-Ughp2FhJ66srDHuw.text: Great place!  Very unique menu and great service! Very hipster with menu items such as fried deviled eggs and biscuits topped with strawberry and powdered sugar.  Pretty heavy food but very yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yup.  Those are fried deviled eggs. A must try!!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT with chipotle mayo and avocado! So yummy! And the tomato soup is great with it

c7TceHTL81WPF6LchDWjLw.text: Maybe I waited too long to try this place? Maybe it was great when they first opened? Pretty solid 5 star rating on here, something is awry.   Came in on a Saturday morning, we had expected to wait so that was no big deal, gave us a chance to look over the menu and yelp pics.   After seeing all the reviews and praise for the Huevos Montulenos, I decided to give it a go, even tho on paper it sounded horrid. I like weird combinations, so I was willing to give it a shot. My friend got the Eggs Benedict.   Food arrives. A few bites into our food, both of look at each other, and I know exactly what she is thinking. I told her mine was really gross and she agreed. I like peas, I like bananas and I love feta. But the combination of them with black beans and eggs and sauce didn't work for me. I made her give it a try and she was mad at me once she put it in her mouth (hey, sharing is caring). I tried her Benny's and I agreed they were underwhelming. Turkey bacon had no flavor, and the addition of spinach and tomatoes really overpowered the Hollandaise.   In addition to two terrible entrees, this place is ridiculously loud. I had to raise my voice a couple octaves to talk to my friend who was sitting 2 feet in front of me.   Overpriced  Loud  Gross food Parking sucks

c8xuefhwHKh5eky13_M8VA.text: Oh my effing god, where has customer service gone?????  Waited for over an hour for a table for six and just ended up leaving because there was such a lack of care for the customer.  Literally  I was told it would be a half hour wait and then ended up watching at least 15 2-4 tops be seated....and still no tables available.  Hostess said they are seating in order yet I watched group after group be seated, all of which came after us.  Told hostess why not push two four top tables together rather than keep seating others before us.  I'm sure the food is ok, but truthfully never had and will NEVER go back!!!!!

6w1Cw4Ptzhlx_qaYE5Cbeg.text: Wasn't bad but wasn't good. My parents raved about it and gave me the cool story of this up-and-coming neighborhood plus the investment opportunities given to local business owners while we were driving here. I was pretty hyped on arrival but left with a lot to be desired.   First, Pepsi products. Meh.  The $4 sparkling lemonade was poured into a glass from a bottle. No real fruit or labor. Definitely overpriced.  The pancakes were too bready  The Huevos Motulenos: Eggs, chili, beans, cheese, tortilla and... bananas? Would have been okay except for the bananas. Didn't add anything to it and definitely tasted as weird as it sounds.  Service was attentive so that knocks them up to 3 stars.

8F1ATYzbN5HJE1oSju0lJQ.text: eat. is a local-focused place worth checking out!  I haven't been here for the lunch options, but the breakfast options are on point!  Their Truffled Egg Sandwich is solid and so is the Eggs Benedict.  The Truffled Egg Sandwich comes with eggs, bacon, creamy feta cheese, wild mushrooms, chives, and is served on ciabatta bread with potatoes.  I was a fan of the Huevos Montulenos and would certainly recommend it for the slightly more adventurous eater...lots of flavors coming together to party on you palate.  The Huevos Montulenos consists of a tortilla layered with black beans, sweet peas, feta cheese, caramelized bananas or plantains, covered with two fried eggs, and finished with slightly spicy red and green salsas.  It is also served with a pile of potatoes.  The interior is aesthetically pleasing.  Artistic. Hip. Positioned well.  eat. fits perfectly in it's downtown surroundings...you could say that eat is right up DTLV's alley...no literally it is right up from that one alley downtown...on Carson...you know?  They are doing a lot of things right here, and I will be back again!

RAkwLsxEiu9rY4Zgo8ESOw.text: Great quality food in a hip atmosphere with friendly helpful service.  I ordered the chicken sandwich with tomato soup. The chicken was moist, tender, delicious, not salty, & topped with mixed greens on a ciabatta bun.....perfect.  Tomato soup.....yummy.  We walked from the Cal Hotel in the middle of the afternoon.  Though, worth the walk, it's smarter to call Lyft or Uber.

7iEl5J29rsdTtV6FhD1wbg.text: Service was on point even tho our server was slammed his whole team helped him and we were in and out in no time. The food was nothing short of spectacular...like a breakfast orgasm in my mouth. I munched on the truffle egg Sandwich...don't even look at the menu just order that...you're welcome

A6ibdgXbTpowTWUfGnOWHA.text: Called to see how busy they were since its Mother's Day and the person answering the phone said that they can't quote any wait times over the phone which is curios because we called yesterday and was told it was about a 45 minute wait. I said ok I get that you can't give me a wait time but could you let me know if it's busy and she said "No."  Well, if that's the kind of service you get when you call, not sure how service will be if we actually showed up. Been here 2 years ago and loved the food but don't think I'll be back next time we're in Vegas. No matter how good the food is, a little customer service goes a long way. Oh well. Luckily there are so many great places in Vegas to eat.

r8tMs5xkOva0VT3PcAvBig.text: The food was good-- I really liked the OVERSIZED sour dough toast.  Gary did a great job of serving all 6 of us & our coffee cups were never empty.  He took our orders quickly & we were out of there without any delay

k-WRXZAfiCHpiZmrN5yN8w.text: One of my favorite breakfast restaurants in Vegas. I always make a point to come here when I'm in town. My recent visit didn't disappoint. Their pancakes are fluffy and delicious. I absolutely love their bacon! The atmosphere and service is always great.

8iPD2C9edVGYBT2xdvPShQ.text: This is a must-go place for me in Las Vegas. The service is great and fast and the food is so good. The deviled eggs are totally amazing, although they're rather heavy so don't be surprised if you can't finish your entree afterward.

xfAkSxTRsXEkj3i6WlG5Qw.text: Great food.   5 star food and service and 1 star front desk experience.  Hubs was parking car and we were ready to order -- lots of tables available and can't let us sit down 2 minutes before he walks in the door.  We were ready to place order for biscuits and coffee but NO GO. Great food and servers but a very poor front desk experience.  In the end, we did not order coffee so their loss on the tab.  Felt a bit rushed once we sat down and ordered.  Food came quickly and was Delish, but they came with the check when we were half was done with our meal and asked to pick up our plate an inordinate amount of times before we were finished.  At no time were the tables full during our visit.

KgPxIHUtnLwWiWFNRESFNw.text: Place is clean was is always a good sign of a good establishment.  Had the chicken fried steak the breading was perfect and eggs were scrambled perfect as I requested soft. Rachel our server and she was amazing.  The fresh brewed tea off the hook. Definitely a must stop if in las Vegas.

xPVM7PZBuz9fDC5pMpLCmA.text: Decent portions, cute modern ambiance, definitely where you'd find hipsters dwell..hence the name 'eat.' Lol I love that it's across from Container Park, which was convenient for us to park ($1/hour BTW)... we brought kids with us so some had the grilled cheese, which were humoungous & came with awesome tomato soup. Their Wedge Salad was great! Huge with lots of bacon lol (not very healthy but looked sooo good!). I had the Truffled Egg Sandwich, which was ok... my cousin & I were disappointed because we really wanted the Eggs Turkey Benedict but we got there too late. This should be a breakfast item serve til closing. My son had the cinnamon biscuits w/ strawberry sauce.. omg sooooo yummmy! Other than that? I would most definitely go back again! I love any good downtown eats!!

We did try to go on a Sunday morning and there was a 45 minute wait.    The deviled eggs are a MUST.  The corned beef hash is a MUST.    This is a definite return to restaurant when we are in Vegas next!

daxR_nr_dGU6LDN8acPvTg.text: Came here with a friend for brunch. Had to wait a little bit, but we perused the menu while waiting. Very quaint/cozy restaurant, but gets busy during peak times. Our waiter was not very friendly during our meal unfortunately; maybe he was busy but he just seemed disinterested. Though, when he waited on other tables during our meal, I overheard him mentioning the specials for the day, which he completely failed to mention to us. =\  Prices were moderate. Food-wise, the food was pretty good. My friend and I shared sweet and savory dishes (see photos).  Decent dining establishment in the Downtown Las Vegas area.

-F8yOa1QqXGxBV-Klp7TuQ.text: Super cool delicious place for breakfast/brunch. Can't go wrong wit chicken fried steak, pancakes, prime rib sandwich. Super good service everything fresh

2HWdscodcgnQbkq_VKHErA.text: Came here early on Sunday around 9 and there was no wait ! But soon after there was a line so come early!! Service was good, everyone was very friendly, and the decor is super cute & warm!   Our group ordered: fried devil eggs $8 - really yummy spin on your normal deviled eggs. Crunchy & spicy kick! Very interesting  Egg truffle sandwich $14ish - yummy and lots of flavors! I took a few bites and was almost a little overwhelmed with the truffle and eggs haha but the bf liked it and demolished his whole plate  Cinnamon biscuits-$8ish- I would give this 3/5. It was good but nothing too spectacular. The biscuit had good cinnamon flavor and they do give you a good portion of fruit which I appreciated.   Huervos M something haha my friends ordered this and they both really enjoyed it. They said it had a spicy yet sweet kick (they have bananas in it!) I didn't get to try it but they both also devoured their plates   Overall a pleasant experience, and it's nice place to be away from the strip, but nothing stood out too much to me, probably would try another brunch place next time!

o4CoFzjNjacP2UK99V5MOQ.text: First time to Eat and it was a great spot to set up shop and get some work done while enjoying a really good lunch. Rachel was a great server and recommended the Shrimp Po Boy once I told her what I was thinking. I had that and a cup of Green Chile to start. The Chile didn't have as much kick as I like but a little hot sauce did the trick. It's an inviting environment and very comfortable. Enjoy!

id9GLC2rL0Tyex2ODcTQmw.text: This place is great. Walking distance from Fremont and over the fence from container park. Service is always great. This place is our go to breakfast spot hands down. Every time we're in Vegas this is our must stop  This place hasn't disappointed yet.

X-JlTc2IBRI_B6wfS0l2zQ.text: First time here for breakfast.  The food was delicious and the service was fast.  The chive potatoes are yummy!

OG_UKOB1ZlUAwT62-FortA.text: Perfect breakfast spot. Very fresh ingredients and reasonably priced. I will definitely be back on our next trip.

xeZHglaYP09TxVRB50zC-A.text: What the f. I couldn't even get my sandwich because the person picking it up for me said they didn't want to give the place any money because the people were rude as hell. They went on a 30 minute story about why I don't have my sandwich. Shape up! I'm hungry.

Q_xnCtJNTsB_Kwy6EjR5GA.text: Amazing place for brunch. Shared the burrito that was on special that day and the biscuits. Sooo good! The service was great and no long wait on a Monday. Must have again when in Downtown LV.

xCmrKLSR9n4MrmnZkgfZvg.text: Not sure how eat. garnered all this hype, but it's a solidly mediocre "New American" spot. The concept and the space resonate with me, but the devil is in the details and the execution just isn't there.   For starters - the service is not there. Neither our hostess nor our waiter were particularly warm or accommodating. Our table didn't have any silverware - not even after our coffees were served. We instead had to ask for them as our food was coming out. We noticed this happened with a bunch of other tables as well. The waiter just couldn't be bothered to do anything beyond the bare minimum necessary.   As for the food - the food was decent. The truffled egg sandwich that everyone raves about was a-ok for an egg sandwich in my book (a $12 egg sandwich btw). I was most excited about the mushrooms and truffle flavors - but it was disappointingly light on the mushrooms and the truffles. I maybe caught only one bite that had a hint of truffles. The sandwich also comes on a giant toasted ciabbata roll that wasn't sliced - a minor detail, but those details adds up.   The cinnamon biscuit with strawberry compote was decent - the biscuit is more like a toasted chunk of cinnamon bread. Not particularly buttery or hard on the outside like a True biscuit. The strawberry compote was good - it came with some fresh strawberries and blackberries. Another minor detail- but the leaves weren't removed from the strawberries. The color of the tiny leaves didn't add anything aesthetically - and needing to remove them just became a bit of a pain in the butt.  I'm impressed by how far downtown Vegas has come. Eat. is a good choice if you're looking for generally reliable, slightly more hipster brunch food - but given all the options in Vegas, eat. wouldn't be my first choice.
