OJt4OSQPkDjiuvGBOPV-cA.text: Yummy food. Got the organic oatmeal.   Delicious crusted nuts and apples on top.  Best oatmeal I have ever had! Seriousl

31qXD0TvgdpPVerGuRaoYg.text: The food at EAT is super fresh and delicious!! Very cool little spot in the heart of the hip area of freemont east. The only negative comment I would have is that they aren't open later.. Having a dinner service would be awesome!! I've wanted to try the chilaquiles but they stop serving them at 11am I believe. I have been to EAT about 3 times and each experience was great food was amazing and very friendly and helpful staff.

2SKo8GHw5-n-Sb0l4uNLvg.text: This was my first time here and I had been wanting to come here for a very long time! We got here around 1:00 in the afternoon so most of the breakfast things we were not allowed to order. NOTETO SELF: come before 11am next time to try the other deliciousness. We were immediately seated and asked what we wanted to drink. By the time we had gotten our drinks, we knew what we wanted. I opted for the Hash and the boyfriend wanted a free whole range chicken?? sandwich. My hash came with the normal - potatoes, onions, peppers, and corned hash or whatever. It was really good. the portion was perfect too. It was topped with two poached eggs. When I cracked the yolk, it came oozing out all over the hash and potatoes..mmmm. It also comes with four half slices of thick sourdough toast! It was SO good. My boyfriend got the sandwich as mentioned and it also tasted really good. It tasted really..clean. It wasnt greasy, it tasted healthy and clean. It came with these chips that had some type of seasoning on it and the boyfriend could not stop eating them. We also got a side of chive potatoes. SO GOOD. The waitresses were all very friendly too. It was busy so we really didnt get a refill on our drinks until we were almost done with our meals. But then again, I didn't think it was THAT busy sinc there were open tables and all. Ill be back again for breakfast but will try to come at a time when its not so "busy".

gJJFPawCSk8sBo-j8bNnpA.text: Casual and lovely atmosphere.  You feel like you have arrived somewhere special when you enter and you just know the food is not going to be ordinary.  The menu has a little bit of everything.  Eat is delicious and above all, memorable.

KTke1txosVztlnyjjfyxwg.text: Have to say come here a lot. And I'm loving their server Gary . Great personality and gray service. Good at Eat is always amazing. Can't wait to come back. #teamGary

zVaMbNdXi8AyTJhBprt5Fg.text: Great breakfast.... Pancakes were old fashioned style and hubby loved the eggs & hash!

G0Ai93MaYfsICaXGlz6fAw.text: Love the grilled cheese and tomatoe soup. Found th is place through yelp, and now I never visit Vegas without a stop here.

IFVLzftzbiofSAc7pJiUzQ.text: Best breakfast I have had so far in LV. Ambiance and decor was great, and definitely looked at home in downtown. My GF and I left stuffed. The meal was more expensive than most places, but well worth it.

IdvfsKD0gCoFkp_s8hhjSA.text: Egg truffle sandwich is the bomb. I was really impressed with this...if you are a Vegas local you better know about this spot :-) Amazing!

ql6CQiEEHnsPSDRST0DJ-g.text: With an excellent following this place is only open for breakfast and lunch.  It has good food at reasonable prices.  The place is always packed with customers and the line is out the door with more. It is definitely a place you must try if only once. Once you have though you a find yourself coming back again. So if you are downtown in Vegas get off the e beaten path and go eat.

LmpfjBllgfGAMExhTBVoKw.text: Amazing. Great food, quick service. I had the shrimp and grits. Shrimp was perfectly cooked and the salsa on top was so tasty. We shared the beignets which were very good. Coffee was the only disappointing part. Burned, blah.

DPNL6yAIhvdQtdcMAR7JTw.text: The food was great and absolutely worthy of 5 stars. The service was 3 stars because we were given our food then abandoned. After waiting 20 minutes for our waitress to finish stocking mugs and sweeping the floor after the lunch rush we finally asked someone else for boxes. I can't say enough about how good the food was and it is a small but solid menu. I loved my chicken sandwich and my friends chicken fried steak. Unfortunately with the metered parking we didn't have an extra 30 minutes after finishing eating to wait for boxes, the check, and not receive any tea refills.

0SX2nqsLbK_lnTZW2jCzfg.text: The Truffled egg sandwich and cinnamon biscuits were a great breakfast.  Downtown is not my favorite place to visit when in Vegas but Eat was worth the trip from the strip to get away from the casinos and buffets.  I went on a Monday at 10:30 and it was pretty busy (but not so much that I had to wait) so I expect that weekends are packed.  The staff was friendly and service was prompt.  I'll definitely come back.

CJ3kRyHiVO-gtA36KkLHYw.text: I heard and read about this place here from yelp and others I know. So finally I went to give it a shot only to realize ehhhh it was not really worth the long wait (45 minutes for party of 4)  and the drive for me. I ordered the egg Benedict one of my only favorite breakfast items. I just did not care for it!! Something about it and the textures of the whole thing did not go together. I ordered it standard with no tweaking or changing and to me it just did not do it, the other dish I had tried was the coned beef with potatoes and eggs that was alright. Probably better in my opinion than the egg Benedict if you had to choose.   Over all I do not think I would do it again.

7kAy9EEm32jlGbY3lRsDYg.text: The chicken fried steak was probably the best I have ever had. The gravy was outstanding and definitely home made with a lot of love. The pancakes were perfect. I have never tasted a pancake that was so buttery and sweet and the house syrup they provided was a perfect match. I loved it. I can't send enough people here to enjoy their food. You must stop if you're in Downtown LV. You won't regret it!

Sd91mLcHZ4D6GHMlLH_niQ.text: Just curious about this place as my daughter suggested that we go check this place out. Didn't disappoint.  Will come back again

ah1G3CxU_akpV5Y4yCBmtg.text: This place is wonderful! The food is fantastic. The staff is very friendly. You can't really ask for much more. I had the blt and it was probably the best sandwich I've had in a LONG time. It's not a huge restaurant and I think that definitely adds to the charm. I'll be back for sure!

yRJLNnr4GGTfqxqgSu4bgQ.text: Server was rude. Chicken fried steak was tough, flavorless, and breading was falling off. Rushed us through the entire meal giving us our check directly following finishing our food. Would not recommend. Visit hash house a go go instead, it's a better value for your money. To top it off they brought a to go cup of coffee to my boyfriend and completely ignored me.

OWNs8T-ULfL_386w14-nXg.text: Breakfast was great. Food was delicious and the staff was very nice. My husband had the Easter ham special and I had oatmeal. The only thing I didn't care for was the $6 glass of oj.

9QuSrT_egGKEF3L2HAZsNg.text: Now that I work downtown, I've had to come up with new lunch options, and those options are few and far between downtown. But I prefer to support local businesses, and I rarely want to deal with the hassles of a casino, especially at lunch, so I thought I'd give Eat a try.  It doesn't look like much from the outside, and it's in a sketchy neighborhood, but inside it's filled to capacity with downtown hipsters. Seating was quite limited so I opted to sit at the lunch counter. Not a great choice because I spent my whole lunch impeding the flow of waitresses and listening to the expediter shout orders. I kept thinking I should lend a hand and plate some food or deep fry something.  The food itself is good. I had the roast beef sandwich, potato salad and iced tea. The quality of the ingredients was above average, and they seem to take care with presentation and little added touches. But the price was what stopped me dead in my tracks. $16.50 plus tip for a sandwich, side and a drink. Ouch! I hadn't planned on spending $20 on lunch, and if I had, I would have gone someplace better.   I gave them a fair try, but unless I get a raise or someone else is buying, I won't be back. I'll leave the $4 cup of coffee for the hipsters.

fudRexI3XS4KGXOShobN5g.text: Service was excellent.  The food was fresh and tasty.  Very reasonable prices.  We will likely be visiting again on this 4 day vacation as they change up the menu on the weekends!  Highly recommended!

5hUPverL26g3V--FuMKWKw.text: We took the family here for a fourth of July treat. Parking was a breeze.  Food was amazing. I had the special of the day, prime rib hash. It was perfect!!! Service was good with a nice atmosphere. I will definitely go back.

D1IJCrAa0KtceXWQnF8ySw.text: I had the truffle egg sandwich which was pretty tasty. Overall a pretty good breakfast. If you're staying at The Cortez it's a block away and worth the walk. For some reason I still think Bob Evans has the best bacon. BTW, I would have installed your security cameras for next to nothing. We could have bartered free breakfasts for my service.

KV1ig9VwmO8or3spsnoeyA.text: Great breakfast. I had the chicken friend steak and it was great, homemade comfort food. Everything was fresh and tasty. We didn't order the beignets, but regretted that decision when seeing them go to another table.  If you're staying in a downtown hotel, you owe it to yourself to skip the coffee shop one morning and take the short walk to "eat."

OS1yFnYyWxFPJXsWCIXiEQ.text: Outstanding. Fast,friendly service. Wonderful menu selection. Food came out fast,hot and delicious. I had the truffle egg sandwich and was not disappointed.

CmwG-7A3nlJpMFoSnv47iA.text: Fun place to go and the food is average, but there are lots of choices.  Went back once, but will probably wait for a while before I go back.  Omlette House is still the best!

rXtOmv6Rq33JZ3BIgO39dw.text: This place is great, its just what vegas needs in the new downtown.  Food, service, experience were all fantastic!

Jd3q7fuJnlSexXCD8o9DRQ.text: The food was amazing. I had the privilege if meeting the owner and she is great. I definitely will be back. Such a great addition to downtown.

Is7xnoFqF_tBC4HNWABX_Q.text: Great taste but low rating thanks to chicken bone I found while eating my sandwich. Staff response was " fresh chicken daily".  Remind me to share the with ER physician had I swallowed that bite.  Though I did get a sorry.

se5H52Ky6-bXUZYpajZhWw.text: They had me at truffled eggs--then piled on a fresh croissant, wild mushrooms, feta, smashed chive potatoes--yes please!  My mouth is savoring this exciting menu full of fresh ideas which is obviously created with lots of love.  Eat is perfect for vegetarians and meat lovers.  Tofu scrambles and Veggie sandwiches are listed right along with chicken fried steak and roast beef with blue cheese.  The menu is short enough to try it all in a week but with ample variety to make u wanna come back. Our server, Kenna is beautiful, super-sweet and bursting with enthusiasm for both her job and downtown Las Vegas. Not sure where they get their bread from (we tried the sourdough toast and the croissant) but it is SO fresh, light, delectable. The prices may seem a tiny bit high but this is definitely a get-what-you pay for kind of spot. I am so impressed I will not take any stars for as many onions as potatoes in the smash mix or that my BF's egg whites were too salty.  Kenna fixed it right away with smiles and a new, saltless order. I can't wait to come back for the black bean veggie chili!

Q_IDT6tEAzFErS_FssvXAg.text: Hipster vibe, minimalistic decor, a menu with about 10 good breakfast choices.  Good option for a night after drinking.  Good sunlight, lots of windows, friendly staff, decent coffee.   Not as amazing as Bronze Center Cafe but I would go back.

QOImUgTGUJsKBj4QdPVyLw.text: Great blt & the breakfast huevos dish in out of this world

qc3nioMYclv1v1vlYTLSYA.text: Excellent place off the strip. Good for couples, families, friends--especially people out of town looking for something without a slot machine in it, and yet, with delicious, local food.

PAo82kcBmp2_iyE-6tWQbg.text: The wife and I have gone to "eat" a few times now... Food's great, ambience is Portlandesque, and service is solid. Nice place to take visitors to Vegas on Sunday mornings. We went by this last weekend and they had live music which was a little loud for our taste, but they were accommodating by letting us sit outside which was awesome. Advice: The Benedict with a short stack on the side should be ordered with regularity.

VUza0c5HzYPbXFsjh4cpjA.text: Truffle egg sandwich kills me every time. I haven't eaten anything there that I didn't really enjoy. Appetizers, breakfast, lunch, and even the juice.

QNxIrMdtU5CPtw0_agS_EQ.text: My sister and I had lunch here 5/24/13, it was very good.  I had the Chicken Posole and side salad. The soup was absolutely the best tasting soup I've ever had - ever! My sister had the Tomato & Grilled Cheese combo - these were good also.    It was pretty loud in there, at times hard to hold a conversation.  Some people say good for kids, but I disagree, seating was close together and no softness to keep the noise levels down.  Wait staff was great and helpful.  The location is off, but the food is worth it for sure! I will be back next time I'm in town, hoping to make it for breakfast!!

hKiEH0EM9qfvr7_acrjUrA.text: In Las Vegas for a wedding and happened upon this place for breakfast....amazing!! We sat at the bar and from the first moment we knew we hit the jackpot. Ali O. Was our server and it was like we've known her forever. So friendly and personable...love her! The food was incredible..fresh and delicious. Fun to watch it all being made and served and you can see the cook staff want to make sure your food is perfect when it is delivered to your table. You must try it if you ever find yourself in the area!

00cM8lOUiunU_8LUIE3Btw.text: Best breakfast downtown. Staff was great! Everything was unique and tasty :)

lfn4I8Bg9eLZHjq0GK6CWQ.text: This is definitely a good eat!!! I went here 2 days ago and what a surprise...the service was fast and the food not only taste good butlooked good too...I already know what I will order on my future visit (s)...when guests come to town this is on the top of the list...they need to expand because people are literally walking in constantly...what a great business and we'll organized. Thank god I don't live close by to that place. ..lol

KKV1PQriW1A0KB-KxHpdaA.text: I went in with my mom and we were seated at a small two table seating. However, the ambiance was very loud and I could not hear her during the meal. I ordered the truffle egg sandwich and it was delicious! I also added the potato chips and it tasted just like Glazier's homemade potato chips! I was amazed! I will definitely go back her but probably with a larger group of people so we can get a more secluded table!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Egg sandwich with potato chips

8Bm56WxRMm3tETysQ8vgrg.text: Definitely a place we WILL be returning! Service was wonderful, if a bit over-attentive. The comfortable/friendly decor & ambiance suits the food, location and the folks working :D   Grilled Shrimp Po-Boy: holy cow, the total BOMB! Perfect combo of savory & sweet & spicy. An absolute must!   Grilled Cheese: although grilled to perfection, the bread to cheese ratio was waaaay off. Very disappointing... even adding the bacon.   Homemade Potato Chip: rock-so-hard-core. Perfectly cooked; crisp not soggy. NOMS!!    Tomato Soup: meh... Nothing special, sadly. Kinda bland. Not enough pepper/spices. Didn't really enhance the grilled cheese any.  Side Salad: super yum! Great mix of fresh unique veggies... W a killer lemon vinaigrette dressing  Pancake: omg, yes please, moar please! Perfectly cooked. Soft on inside & crisp on outside. Soaked up the 100% maple syrup like nothing I've ever seen.   The po-boy and pancakes totally won us over... We WILL be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Shrimp Po-Boy w cole slaw and jalapeños, served w homemade chips
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese w / side salad (normally comes w tomato soup)

TU6cDdTsuqGO3UugYDj_IA.text: Ok, so I've been here a few times (I visit every time I go to Las Vegas). I went twice on this trip and was very disappointed. The first day I ordered the corned beef hash with 2 eggs and received 2 eggs with potatoes and chopped beef/steak. The beef wasn't cured at all or maybe it was old. Either way, it wasn't what I've received on previous visits. Ok, so at this point I'm going to give Eat the benefit of a doubt a revisit the next day. My mistake. I ordered the chicken fried steak breakfast and I think I could have chewed my leather shoes easier. The accompanying eggs and potatoes were good, but of course, the real challenge was making a delicious steak and they've failed. Remember, these choices were not new, so expectations were high and I was let down. I gave 2 stars for the friendly staff, but unfortunately that doesn't satiate my hunger. I doubt if I will ever return to Eat.

IG0lSkTZFDk2dFdBhuTxfg.text: This should be a 4-plus-star place to eat but the seating policy is silly and pretty much put a downer on my meal.  I had the pancakes, they were light, fluffy, and delicious. The iced tea was very nice and the staff were courteous. It's also clean and attractive inside, metered parking outside.  I came in solo and wanted to sit near a window to enjoy the morning sun. Large windows with tables at them surrounded the dinning area. But they were tables for four and I was solo. But the whole place was 70% empty, there were 5-6 of these 'window' tables, and when I came in they were all EMPTY. All the patrons were either at the counter or crowded together in a dark pit-like seating area in the center. So despite my asking nicely they denied me a seat at the window.  I can understand saving those tables to accommodate parties of four when the place is busy, but if a customer wants to be seated at a window, you should just seat them there.  I hope the management rads this a makes some changes. It really does seem a nice place to eat, but they are shooting themselves in the foot with this seating nonsense.

cdHPngpX-U84-0Xvm4yhbA.text: Went a couple of months ago and apparently my review was rejected. Terrible service, some of the worst food we've eaten in a long time. Natalie has a great story but may be stretched too thin. Went to 7th & Carson and had a wonderful experience.

WlFzgDGzIDJaBmJzgRpuFQ.text: Was told a 20-25 minute wait and ended it being a 35 minute wait and that is to be expected some times.   Ordered the chicken fried steak and it was the toughest, grisly one I have ever had.  They had whole grain English muffins but wouldn't let me have it and insisted on sourdough bread which was great but if you have something on the menu and they won't let you order it WTF?

kBCScWnM9F-UhjrLFyY_JA.text: Eat is special.  The food is outstanding! I've been here numerous times and have never had a bad meal.   This trip I ordered the truffle egg sandwich with taters. The pair of fluffy scrambled eggs were nestled with two thick strips of bacon and feta and sauteed mushrooms that tasted of truffles. This all rested between warm soft chiabata bread. For $12 I was winning life.  I also had a cup of Guatemalan coffee, creamy smooth and perfectly brewed for $3.  This place is often packed. Be ready for a long wait if you come at peak lunch hours. Today we arrived at 11:45 and happily only had a 10 minute wait to be seated.   Come try Eat. You will be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cafe de Guatemala. Smooth and delicious. $3.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich $12 as of May 2014.

1KzU6fNuqguDN0KBsNFBVg.text: They may have good food, but unfortunately we're unable to find food I could eat their with my food allergies. They have most of the food pre-prrpped a certain way to be able to make it fast when ordered, so I could not make the modifications needed. Manager's words - there will be cross contamination, so I do not recommend that you eat here.   I appreciate the honesty, but my friends were disappointed.

VQsBv35Ws3mJ9L0xrPntiA.text: Trip 2 to eat.  Just as ahhh-amazing as last time.  I had the Downtown Benedict.  Their hollandaise is super creamy and just the right balance of flavors.  I'm not a fan of cooked tomatoes so next time I'll order it without it but the spinach is a great addition to the classic Benedict.    Sat at the counter this time and had a blast watching the kitchen.  We couldn't believe how efficiently they pump out such delicious food.  Young blonde expeditor was great to watch her control the kitchen! Super job!   Oh we'll be back....soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Downtown Benedict..I forgot to take a picture before I took a bite! Plate was beautiful before I dove in! Haha!

CBVpSVUejgzwJn9d5QAm6Q.text: Nice spot in Downtown. Right behind Container park, you can find "eat", which is a fairly nice place for brunch.   Overall the food was pretty good. Their egg Benedict (my first ever) was great and served with a side of potatoes and a plentiful single strawberry. I also had a bit of the Apple chicken sausage and cinnamon biscuits, which were also really good. The orange juice was good, but a bit pricey for me ($6), but it did have pulp, yum!   Service was decent. It was a busy Saturday morning with the Color Run in town that Might have overwhelmed the employees here, but think they did a decent job. It did take us about 25-30 for 3 of us to get seated, which we were completely okay with.   I love downtown and this place offers that uniqueness that every restaurant in downtown has. It has a lot of nice decor, seats are comfortable, and has a hipster-ish vibe to it.   Overall, I would definitely come back for brunch and recommend to anyone coming out of Vegas. Just be aware that this place closes a lot earlier than other places do in Downtown.

ZNbac8tpSM15qawmPauxYg.text: I ordered the Huevos Motulenos and it was so good.  Great combination of spicy (red & green Mexican chili sauce) and caramelized banana slices. Served on a corn tortilla with black beans, peas, & feta cheese over the top of eggs over easy.  Served with roasted potatoes.  Very good.

q5GPJMJ3eZDuDgkPQsXKyg.text: Was excited to try this place.  It is in a weird spot with pay street parking.  I looked at it and thought are we at a crummy motel converted to apartments. Indeed it is on the corner of a cheap apartment. The place was fun and quirky inside and very busy. We went for lunch.  They had a very limited menu.  I opted for the grill cheese. It was huge and I mean huge. Talk about carb load. The bread was delicious soft and perfect texture. I could only eat one of the humongous slices the tomato soup was just okay tasted like tomato sauce with very little seasoning.  My hub had the chicken fried steak which was very tough and peppery  all in all I was not impressed with this place maybe we chose the wrong items. Our Neal total was 40 bucks. Too much.

OTBADl1b6TNz6wndqRPy3Q.text: My favorite breakfast spot in downtown. Order the truffle sandwich! You could thank me later.

40tvQl5Gt-cKkerDvIr0Qw.text: We really like Eat! Nice crowd. Not too touristy! Service was solid, friendly and efficient ! We all liked what we ordered.... from the special of the day egg benedict to waffles and huevos palamentos

lnqYLAxu5I7Akk5RPtaYrg.text: This place was loud if you are sitting inside.  The veggie burger was not as good as I was hoping.  The food was decent but I don't think I would go again unless invited.  There was soooooo much bread regardless of what sandwich you order.  So that was a bit of a turn off.  The chips were good and I think that the ingredients seem fresh.  All in all this place was just OK.

ElfCnLieOCv2y79dwdE96A.text: First off, the food was FABULOUS. Then reason why I give this place 2 stars is because of the service/staff. Every point of contact from the hostess, to our server, and the food runner were rude, short, and had very bad attitudes. The hostess gave us a hard time about seating us when our table had already been set up with high chair and everything, but wanted to wait till the rest of the party showed up; which, understandable but you already set up the table. It seemed as though the service staff were so overwhelmed with the busyness that they were frustrated and were taking it out on us. After we told the hostess the rest of our party was parking, she made a snide remark that we need to order before they closed (and they closed in 2 hours). The food runner had dropped our food at the wrong seats so while we switched them she sighed and rolled her eyes. Our waiter dropped off our check before we were even finished eating our entrees without even asking for it. We then wanted to order more coffees and desserts after our meal, but didn't seem to have the option to because we felt rushed and pushed out. It's such a shame because all the food was absolutely amazing.

AzwLvR4wF6_c92AMHEQdTw.text: I stroll off Fremont to Carson Ave on every visit to Las Vegas. EAT is a must for any downtown Vegas vacation. The food is pretty simple. Most of the food is just breakfast and lunch classics  prepared with the highest level of quality ingredients and short order cook skill. There are definitely a few inventive dishes that speak to the chef's talent, but for the most part the food at EAT doesn't reinvent the wheel. There is something to be said for simplicity. In my last few visits, I've ordered the fantastic Pozole as a starter. After that, you really can't lose with any of their selections. I particularly like the Shrimp and Grits for Breakfast and the DWBLTA for lunch.  After I've enjoyed my meal, I always buy a bag of their house coffee beans for the road. I like to continue enjoying EAT's bean juice for weeks after my trip.

xDzYUBM-fxtz7K6YPh2OBg.text: All of the staff were very friendly and the food was just as good. A group of 3 of us shared two appetizers- fried deviled eggs and cinnamon biscuits (YUM to both!), and each of us had an entree- 2 had the egg truffle sandwich and one had the shrimp and grits (all of which were very tasty!!). I would recommend this place, but there can be a wait since it is a small building.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;I&#39;ll meet you in the flowers.&#34;
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled eggs- yes please!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits- delicious

uiePliUc0qYV_nSvVXXp8Q.text: This place rocks! My mom, grandma, and sister were all in Las Vegas recently and were heading toward downtown to get away from the Strip for a day. We were all starving and wanted something in the realm of breakfast/brunch food. We were very satisfied when we stumbled upon eat.  We only waited about 5 minutes to be sat and we all ordered coffees that came out very quickly. We spent some time browsing the menu because everything looked so good! I opted for the breakfast sandwich without the meat and subbed it for avocado. It was recommended by the waiter to do it that way and it was a great decision! My mom got the pancakes and they were amazing! I kept picking off her plate which wasn't a problem because the portions were huge.  This is a great place to go if you are looking for a pre-exploring downtown Las Vegas meal!

Aac1KAMJDXF5V7mVKs0ugQ.text: Our go to breakfast downtown.  Fantastic pancakes and you can order just one - with real maple syrup! Today I tried their BLT and it is delicious.  Thick grilled bread loaded with bacon, lettuce, avocado and tomato with a kick from chipotle mayo!  Comes with a side and I had the tomato salad and also flavorful and so good!   Walk to the container park after.

rENE8q_RKOCB2epNdYC2Zw.text: Our server was great!!! The wait was really long. It's kinda crammed in there. We ordered chicken fried steaks and they were VERY hard to cut thru. Our poor grandma couldn't eat it, so she ate everything else but the steak. They have really good orange juice. I might come back but leave granny home next time and def order something else.

PDJqrY9H_7Z1fCUxvd4ZFw.text: I've heard good things about this place from a friend who lives out of town, so I've been meaning to eat here for awhile now. On a Saturday morning I get a text from my friend who says he just flew in and the people he was supposed to hang out with on the Strip are all hungover and sleeping still, so my husband and I swoop him up from his hotel and suggest eat. since we wanted to show him the downtown area. The location itself is very unique and just walking distance from Container Parker. Being from SF/Bay Area, we're all used to extremely long waits for brunches, so eat.'s 20 minute wait was no big deal. Once we finally got seated, the 3 of us ended up in a 2-top that was in a corner. It was very.. cozy, but what's a little bit of discomfort among friends? The hostess was very sweet and wanted to make sure we didn't wait too long, so I appreciated that. We ordered the corned beef, eggs benedict, chicken fried steak and pancakes for the table. The pancakes were mouth-watering, and probably the best part of the meal, but one of the servers did give me grief about asking for more syrup (I swear the dinky little serving they give isn't enough!) My friend ate all of his corned beef, so he had no complaints; however, my husband hated his chicken fried steak with a passion. It was very tough - just looking at it you could tell it was completely dry and devoid of flavor. He left a large chunk of it uneaten and didn't bother taking it home. Since we didn't have that much room on the table, I wasn't really feeling my eggs benedict, so I placed it behind me in the booth and stuck to my pancakes. As other people have experienced, waiters are somewhat hard to track down. Someone who wasn't our waiter asked me if I was done with my benedict plate and if he could take it away. It was barely touched, so I'm surprised he didn't ask what was wrong and didn't ask if I wanted to take it to go (my husband eventually ate it at home to make up for his lack of a meal). Maybe we should have ordered a few different items like the truffled egg sandwich, but my husband probably would never want to come back here. I came here wishing that we had spent our morning eating at Mr. Mama's since I haven't been there yet. Hopefully that place doesn't disappoint. Eat. does look like they have a pretty big and devoted following, so I hope they continue to do better and improve on the shortcomings guests have pointed out as of late.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short stack
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak

hNsHyMIqPxp_V4QpmTxaXg.text: Came in for brunch on Sunday and ordered Shrimp & Grits and the Killer Grilled Cheese. Neither impressed me. The Grilled Cheese was probably the best thing I had--the bread was high quality and it was fairly tasty. Unfortunately, it came paired with "kick ass tomato soup," and that was truly middling. Not only was it not good by itself, but dipping the grilled cheese/bread in it didn't help either. The Shrimp & Grits were downright not good, and I'd recommend strongly against ordering them.

3QQacHnPwR-Pqdzs18lXag.text: We went there last Monday.  I liked the shrimp and grits but my husband hated the BLT.  The bread on the sandwich was too thick for his taste.  He ate about 1/4 of the sandwich and didn't want a to-go box and the server didn't bother to ask what was wrong with it. Server was very blah. It was fun to try cuz' it's very hipster-y (I feel cooler just being there) but for the price I can find better food elsewhere. And I wish the server would have asked why my husband paid so much money for a sandwich he didn't eat.

DjeI0sdHcodx56qQKQenMw.text: Love their Guatemala "mothership roastworks" coffee.  I got a bag of coffee to go $15.  My companion was not impressed with the pancakes, nor the sausage.  They seem fluffy enough.  Portions were big.  I had the huevos motulenos.  It is unusual, two eggs (poached and runny), black beans with sliver of cooked bananas on a tortilla.  The feta cheese was soft and not salty.  Service was friendly and they took the time to time to explain.  This place sure gets busy!  Did you know Las Vegas charges for street parking on Sundays!

AjQt2NLGNKWOfnno55EvyQ.text: Just back from a fabulous brunch experience at Eat.  The kind that makes you wonder why I ever doubt Yelp in the first place!    Food:  Phenomenal!  Cinnamon biscuits, truffled egg sandwich, huevos motulenos, pancakes and good, old fashioned eggs/bacon/toast/grits were devoured - - but servings are so generous we still had some to take home and enjoy later. Okay, I lied.  We got as far as the car and started digging in to our leftovers. Sooo good.   Location:  Phenomenal!  You MUST eat on the patio! Beautiful urban garden feel, perfectly shaded and oh-so comfy.  And best of all, PET FRIENDLY!!  Our bulldog puppy Archie languidly laid on his blanky with his toys, assuming the role of Unofficial Eat Ambassador.    Service:  Phenomenal!  Though a 45 minute wait was quoted (we had to wait for patio seating due to our pup Archie the Unofficial Eat Ambassador we literally were seated within 10 minutes.  From the hostess to our waitress and busser, smiles were plentiful and service expeditious, yet unobtrusive.   Verdict:  Phenomenal! I hope you are finishing this review while in line for your table at Eat.  Just go enjoy, experiment and Eat!

OukaXAJBbGNYX7knF1R7yA.text: We sat at the bar and had a view of the kitchen and the team cooking and prepping was working their butts off to get orders out. I don't think they (at any establishment except sushi) get the credit they should and deserve a share of the tips.   Food was good and served as requested (edit from the menu).

KW2sA8W10RaEmFPmqfvWog.text: Eat is a super cute little restaurant Downtown Las Vegas. The parking is pay to park and it's easy to miss if you have never been there before.   Their breakfast is pretty delicious, they have the biggest slices of bread that I have ever seen and their pancakes are ridiculously good!   I also fantasize about their cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote.  The few things that I don't like, is that we have never had a friendly waiter/waitress. For some reason, the 4 times I have been there, the waitstaff always acts like they are doing us a favor by helping us and they try to suggestively sell you sides of everything or bigger sizes of whatever you ordered, I understand the concept but it gets pretty annoying when you are trying to place an order on a table of 6 and 2 to 3 extra things are suggested to every person.   I also have to warn you that their veggie burger is terrible! So the next time I went I ordered another dish without the bacon and the waitress said "we are too busy right now to make any substitutions" uhmm I wasn't making a substitution, I just said no bacon.... Anyway!   Eat is actually worth a try because everything is made from scratch and their food is high quality, I just wish the staff was friendly.

AueVdhm0Sj5o-d8W4dG8UA.text: We found this place by mistake and we are so happy that we did. Far from the strip, good service,  great price, and best of all... great tasting food.  Go, tou will not be disappointed

DoN4ZSpzDwgOPdEn9gzYkA.text: Cute place! Exceptional service and the food is amazing!!!! Take the walk/uber/drive just come here!!!!

HfdyXxqm2KUhPQdECm4Hlw.text: Great food, fast kitchen, friendly server. I got the worst seat in the house though basically AT a computer terminal. Employees literally hit my silverware as they swiveled the terminal around. It definitely takes away from the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating with the staff

ArdHGxgbON3SvTSuiavFTg.text: When you're visiting a new city, you want to find the places that speak best to you. In the Fremont Arts District, we found Eat. It sounded like a foodie brunch paradise in the middle of the Vegas hipstertown.   That type of description usually means we waited an hour for mediocre food and meh service. We waited ten minutes for amazing food and ridiculously on point service. I had the short stack hot cakes (beautifully done with crunchy edges and real maple syrup!), a side of bacon and chicken Apple sausage, and a bowl of grits (!) to round it out. To say it was great is an understatement. My partner had the truffle egg sandwich and it was amazing! The place is great and the best reason to come downtown that we've found.

a9zo2Pd_QBGgMB9bWS0u_A.text: I saw this place in a magazine and decided to try it. I had the shrimp & grits and a pancake on the side (I love pancakes) awesome savory satisfying dish, only thing I didn't like so much was my shrimp weren't hot. Not a fan of cold shrimp but it didn't take anything away from the flavor. The best part of the meal was the PANCAKE!! Sweet Baby Jesus the pancakes are like manna from heaven! Better than any pancake I've had EVER IN LIFE and I've eaten a lot of pancakes.   These pancakes were soooo delish, I had them 4 times that week... yes 4 times, i thought I was gonna need rehab. I believe they are laced with some sort of highly addictive drug and I mean that in the BEST WAY! I would eat these pancakes off the floor they are so good! I wanted to hugg and kiss the owner they are so good! I would fight my momma they are soooo good! I'm having withdrawal symptoms as I'm writing this review they are soo good!  If you're reading this, stop and go get some pancakes. Don't think just do it, i promise you your life will be brighter and filled with rainbows. They are soo good!

qUkMEP4TkyqQXl-ikCpiXw.text: I know this place has a million reviews but I go here so much I might as well throw my 2 cents in! Eat has the best breakfast in Vegas, the food never disappoints, service could be better some days, but mostly good. I love the atmosphere, right in the heart of downtown Las Vegas. However I wouldn't suggest placing to go orders because each time I've done so they make a mistake, but I always catch it. Still worth going back, food is that good!

qQRl7WkFZEeZ1hyOulY2kA.text: The kind of place you'll brag about. The food was great and prepared as well as it possibly could be. The service... Couldn't have been better.  A gifted kitchen!  Start your meal with the deviled eggs, total new and memorable. You've never had this taste before. Start your meal off with those.  Eat outside if you can. Enjoy bragging about where you just ate when you're done.

12ibrRhyY5r4w4xRp8QU2w.text: Truffled Egg sandwich was delicious. Amazing flavor. I also loved the fried deviled eggs-Absolutely genius...my boyfriend ordered the free range chicken sandwich and raved about it too.

Q12qfxv7Vn_Zb7XUvMIOOA.text: Yum!  I got here a little before 9:30 on a Saturday, and there was a 5-min wait.  I got a table for 1 (because I didn't know it had counter seats), and everyone was nice about it.  Gary, my waiter, said lines can start forming by 8:15am (opens at 8am!).  Food was SOLID!  I had the Eggs Benedict with potatoes (special that day) - good balance of flavors and perfectly poached eggs; single pancake - just the right amount of density and fluffiness, plus it came with real maple syrup; and coffee - good beans and roast.  Service was attentive and friendly.  I would totally come back!  P.S. Free parking on 9th and beyond if you don't mind walking a bit more.

6KhiqzPibYYVS59S7Q7C1A.text: I've been here 3 times now. First time I got the French toast. The second time I got a turkey sandwich. The third time my wife and I went for breakfast.  This establishment is downtown in a pretty rough area. It is behind the container park. It is one of those cool sexy new restaurants downtown. The staff is made up of a bunch of edgy hippie types. It's got a cool vibe to it. When you're there you feel hep. It's usually fairly crowded but they move people through quickly.   The food is unbelievably good. It is made fresh with the highest quality ingredients. You can really taste the difference. For example they used real maple syrup on their pancakes, fresh fruit, and thick applewood bacon. Who does that these days? Real maple syrup! Unbelievable!  Anyway, I would give them 5 stars except for the service. Maybe it is just the nature of the beast from being so successful but they can be somewhat aloof and no-nonsense to move the people through.  Be sure to give this place a try if you are looking for a great restaurant downtown.

XewJGPOykSllooFcDWSpIw.text: Solid 4, just, definitely not a 5.  Food: *Cinnamon Biscuits: 5/5 The cinnamon biscuits, basically and appetizer for breakfast (score!), are so unique! I loved the fresh berries and exciting cinnamon flavor. The berry compote was a bit much, but I'd rather have too much sauce than too little.  *Huevos Montulenos: 2/5 I had the huevos montuenos after recommendations from yelp and my love of hispanic flavors.  The bananas were WEIRD. Just, ugh, weird in the worst way. They absolutely, definitely should have been plantains. No question. The banana flavor was jarring and unpleasant with the salsas and eggs. Also the plate was split between red and green chile sauce, with the green sauce being far superior.  *Chive potatoes: 5/5 MMmmmmmm! So great!  *Truffle Egg Sandwich: 4/5 Good, if a bit plain  Service: 4/5 *So friendly!  The wait was massive though, even at noon for a breakfast place.  The wait was overestimated by double, which, I get not wanting to create False expectations, but overestimating to that extreme was also quite irksome.  Atmosphere: 4/5 So cute and definitely I light, lovely, casual brunch spot.

c4qJAmj-It9tvdz1bdZm6A.text: Very impressed with this place! In Vegas on vacation and found this place on Yelp. Even though it was a busy weekend morning, the wait was only 20 minutes. Service was excellent, and attentive. The food spoke for itself. We got the biscuits with the fruit compote (biscuits were made in house), not too sweet which we loved. My husband got the chicken fried steak. The batter was delicious, very crispy...gravy was kind of sweet and also had some spice, delicious! I got the shrimp and grits. Came with over easy egg and pico de gallo on top. So fresh, so good! Food came so quick which was awesome because we were starving. The decor was clean and had an eclectic feel, which I loved. Honestly, I have no complaints! Recommend to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K0vGwaOFk7hf611OGoL-Qg.text: EAT ... ATE ... Enjoyed it!  Corned Beef Hash ($14): Chunks of corned beef with savory potatoes, 2 poached eggs and 4 pieces of sourdough toasted to perfection. Realy enjoyed the toast here. The portion size was fair but a little on the pricier side for a brunch item.   Eggs Benedict ($13): Wasn't my favorite item =/ breadding on bottom was sweet and turkey bacon was used instead of regular. Poo. I love turkey bacon but a girl's trying to get some delicious bad food in me while in Vegas!! However, the caramelized onions and potatoes were on point.  Free-Range Chicken Sandwich ($12): This dish sounds average and something you can get anywhere but my oh my. The chicken wasn't dry. The pesto, mozzarella cheese and pesto blend was beyond perfect. I tried savoring every last bite of it! YUM. I tend to lean more on brunch items during brunch hours but this dish is one to get!  All dishes were decently sized. Hipster type of atmosphere. Location is off.. it's underneath an apartment/studio complex! Lots of metered street parking for $1/hour. Something to try while out in Vegas!

0IJniQ5ZXpfbW8XXJN1XWw.text: Busy but good fast service.  Pancakes were Delicious!  They tried to be too different with the huevos Rancheros.  Some things just aren't meant to be messed with.  Too many flavors going on. Texture was also a little off but wasn't horrible

FkVIdSqWnbYetp3EtjHn8w.text: From 2/23/16 Came to Eat for some late breakfast, and some grease to soak up our hangovers. This is my second time coming here, wasn't able to check in though since my phone died, but we loved it our first time around, so I knew they would not disappoint.  We ordered our food; I got a grilled cheese sandwich with tomatoes and bacon. Let me just say that tomatoes soup was freaking amazing! It was so flavorful, and the perfect consistency. The grilled cheese sandwich was colossal, couldn't finish it, but it was delicious.  The service here is good, and I will be back next time I'm downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colossal size grilled cheese mmm.

_yeZixJp3VbT7ngnNwRbJQ.text: Eh...nothing special. Don't know why it is so hyped. I'm from San Diego and was told this was the place to go to..apparently it's the hot spot for locals.  I had the corn beef n hash..with coffee. Coffee was okay and the corn beef was mediocre. Nothing special. Food tasted like I was at Dennys. Okay maybe 1 star above Dennys.  Bottom line is that this place is way too expensive for what it is.  Would I come back? No.

UA1jH8HeXk3lxsHVzE0IBA.text: A 20 minute wait is about my limit for any restaurant. When we dropped by it on a Saturday morning we put our name in and 18 minutes later they called us in. So glad they did! The menu is small and funky just like the atmosphere in this quirky downtown Vegas spot. I had the corn beef hash with A poached egg and my better half enjoyed the specialty egg sandwich. Both were really good and feeling. I wish they would have more fresh juices to try, and maybe some espresso drinks would be cool too? But beside those minor imperfections, the food and the service was fabulous. The seating arrangements are tight and the room is loud but I would certainly go back to Eat next time I'm in Vegas.

qDgUipqy-5ZHauwZZRQm6g.text: A hidden gem in Vegas. As a "Philly Guy", I can really appreciate a good sandwich. This place has a great BLT and tomato soup.  The staff was friendly and very attentive. My ice tea was never empty. Speaking of ice tea, that also was very special. Flavored with passion fruit I believe.  Their breakfast all day menu looks appetizing. I'll have to stop back to try it.

HTMGFBsXXMuJKuUW5OqB1g.text: Just had another incredible breakfast (cinnamon biscuits and tofu scramble). The service was truly exemplary. And the awesome 1990s music!

xD7ZLJRVCa05BzqNfq-mXA.text: HUGE portions. I got the special egg benedict with fresh squeezed OJ, and the fiance got his breakfast with iced coffee. Mine came with a side of potatoes, and it was so filling, that I gave one of my benedicts to the fiance. I came in on a Sunday around 10am and the wait was about 15 minutes. The server served us fairly quickly. I loved the fresh squeeze!

SE2X-7qXhmz3wzfXFRyMRw.text: Best breakfast ever. Don't go to the breakfast buffets... wasted money! Come here and enjoy the specials! Especially the pancakes!!! #foodgasm For two people we paid $35. With coffee. Must stop here at least once on a Vegas trip.

TeKy6dgYjsWTmxMekVbFpw.text: eat. is one of those breakfast joint that you want to go when you feel extra hip. Located in the heart of DTLV and is fairly easy to find. Parking is tricky in the area. I pulled up by eat. only to find that there are only pay parking available.  $1 got me about an hour of parking. AJi%4adh !?Really? Ain't nobody got time for that.   ATMOSPHERE Small and quaint. Love the open kitchen and the whole design of this place. We went there little bit after they opened (8AM), and place was somewhat packed.   SERVICE Attentive and friendly staffs. Warm greetings in and out.   FOOD I was craving something sweet (Yes, from early in the morning). After scrolling through some pictures I knew I was sure to get their Cinammon biscuit. It;s a cinammon biscuit with strawberry sauce, garnished with raspberry and strawberry. Beautifully presented and it was good! Biscuit itself wasn't warm as I expected it to be and was very crumbly. I liked how strawberry sauce wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. 4/5  Also got to try Chicken fried steak which I had no clue of. Never had this in my life. I learned that although it's called chicken fried steak, it's not a real chicken. This southern dish is a steak that is coated with flour and pan-fried, like a fried chicken. I can't really compare this with chicken fried steak from other places as I never had it before, but I enjoyed this hearty dish a lot. Came with crispy potatoes and few toasts on the side. What a great way to start a morning...5/5  CONCLUSION Awesome place. Great breakfast/lunch join in Downtown. Will be back!

Trbos2a1NDqzJ0QTMZATHw.text: eat. is my new favorite restaurant. I've heard nothing but good things about eat. and finally got to stop by for breakfast. Even on a Wednesday morning at 10AM, eat. was poppin'. The hostess who greeted us was beyond friendly and sat us at a small booth. I was immediately taken by the decor of the restaurant- It's simplistic and trendy at the same time.  Now for the food. My oh my the food was delicious. I ordered a short stack of pancakes ($6) and my husband ordered the truffled egg sandwich with a side of seasoned potatoes ($12). My pancakes were golden brown, thick, moist, and fluffy. They were hands down, the BEST pancakes I've ever had. The syrup presented with the pancakes was in an adorable little jar. There were 2 pancakes, but they were so huge I couldn't even finish my plate. The Mister pretty much demolished his plate and stuffed himself into an "itis" state.  The service was amazing! Can I just say that eat. has the cutest handful of waitresses I've ever seen in a restaurant? Bottom line: All the staff at eat. pitches in to make sure customers are happy. Me and the hubs can't wait to come back and try out their lunch menu!

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Lxko7qKWfM2uTDDBS-O3Q.text: I got the corn beef hash. Very very very delicious!!!! Friendly staff, super cool interior, great food / food choices.

cdwqoGd5CcrDXklOVGFycg.text: The quantity of food is a lot! The pancakes and grilled cheese sandwich is amazing but too much for two!

C6Z7S7N-gLq7NglK2-BspA.text: I had some time to kill before a show at the Smith Center, so I found eat. on yelp for good brunch!  Eat. is in downtown Vegas.  Since it was my first time, the area really didn't look as good as the strip. Eat. is on the corner of 7th and Carson.    I found street parking easily on 7th ($1 / hour, max 2 hours).  There are pay stations everywhere conveniently.  I had a party of 6, so I had to wait to be seated until entire party was present.  I was on a time crunch though, so when the rest of the party was still parking, the manager let me be seated first.  We were able to get a table right away and put in our orders before it got too late.  On a Saturday afternoon, I thought it was still busy.  Some parties had a short 10-15 minute wait.  This restaurant reminded me of Cheeky's in Palm Springs - very good brunch place with outdoor seating.  Food was really good.  As I was perusing the menu, I wanted to order everything!  I couldn't decide what to get because they all sounded really good.  My shrimp and grits had plenty of shrimp ($13).  I did not feel ripped off, and there were 2 big pieces of bacon in it!  The portion was enough to share with 2 people.  The cinnamon biscuit with strawberry compote was perfect ($8). The 4 biscuits were not dry at all, and the compote was not too sweet.  They looked so cute - disc-shaped.  My friends who had Huevos Montulenos $12, Chicken Fried Steak $14, and the eggs benedict $13 thought their dishes turned out really well, too.  Everything pretty much had huge serving sizes.  I love that!  Next time I'll probably try the arugula salad or the pancakes..mm..  I really like the service here.  Everyone is so friendly and NOT stuck up, which is something I'm used to with a popular hipster cafe/restaurant.  The hostess was  accommodating, even though she had to get a manager to authorize seating us early..She was still nice about it.  Our server Marissa was nice and helped us quickly since we were in a rush.  I will definitely be back next time!

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen with counter seating

3z5D_Xq6KSrtZVMGRS5pFQ.text: I didn't feel very comfortable from the start walking in. It seemed like everyone looked at us weird. The girl who took our drink order was really Nice and our waiter was very strange and not very attentive at all. I was kinda bummed that our breakfast burrito was mostly tasteless even though it was covered in red chile and the potatoes were definitely not my favorite. But they get an extra star for that insanely amazing pancake that I got. I would definitely go back just to get pancakes!

2ZVsf1ffAiJ_xP3tDTKk2w.text: I usually don't write a review until after I've eaten at a restaurant more than once.  But today was my first experience at eat.  They nailed it!  I arrived at 1240p and waited less than 5 minutes for a table.  The place was busy - plenty of locals (business folks), which is always a good sign.  The water was served promptly and the waiter was back to take my order right on time.  Service appears to be a team effort here and they are good at it.  Manager was present and actively working.    I had a Chicken Cesar (easy on the dressing) and a side of turkey bacon.  Both were served quickly and the salad was exactly as I requested.  The chicken was fresh and flavorful, nicely sliced.  The lettuce was first-rate and crisp.  And the bacon was awesome.  This was an excellent meal.  I had coffee for dessert and again it was hot, super-good and fresh.  eat is popular for a clear reason.  Highly recommended!

F903Igsxmov9XQpko-OE5Q.text: First off we arrived at around 11:30am and this place was packed! Looked like it was a hot ticket! We went here for our friend Lisa's birthday and celebration of her pregnancy. We brought a bundt cake that we thought we could bring to the restaurant/table, but to our surprise THIS WAS A NO GO! They said that it was health code and that it could be a possible infraction and what not. I was actually kind of impressed by that. They really do care about the well being of their restaurant and they really stuck to it.     I want to say that the place is SUPER CLEAN. Like my moms house clean lol. I'm a clean freak so this was exactly what I like. Everyone inside seemed to be loving their visit here. We had too many brunch club members with us so they gave us a private dining section outside, which was amazing. It was like a feel good picnic table received just for us. A+++    Our server was so freaking nice, I loved her! I didnt catch her name but Im sure MGMT knows who I'm talking about. We had two little ones with us and they were running a muck and causing havoc but she still kept her cool.     The food came out at a good speed even with the 10 people we had. I had the grilled cheese with tomato soup. It was delicious. First I may have thought that there was too much bread (too thick of bread) but when I bit into it I fell into a limbo of cheese butter and bread that someone had to snap me out of it. The tomato soup was good even though I do prefer mine to be a little thicker or heavier. The real highlight of the meal was the Veggie Burger our photographer had. I had a bite of it and thought maybe going Vegan wouldn't be so bad if I came here every morning! Haha!    Overall the place is a success and the food is astonishing by look, and as tasty as it looks. Don't sleep on "EAT DTLV!"  - Gabe (@DoYouEvenBrunchLV)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger!

DF7PeGMzTxkJbykApi2skQ.text: Food was tasty and the service was friendly and quick. The interior is nicely decorated and spacious. Cool spot!  We got the truffled egg sandwich and golden-brown pancakes. Portion size was more than enough for two people. Downsides were: potatoes were undercooked and the egg to bread ratio was a little off (could've used more egg).

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden-brown pancakes and truffled egg sandwich with chive potatoes.

_VWOlWqLYdA5A6EUnHk4FQ.text: After seeing Anthony Bourdain dine here I drove directly to Eat after landing from So Cal. It was during a workday and found metered parking for a hour/$1.00.  I was solo and sat at the counter which gave me a view of the chefs in action. Started off with a tasty satisfying cup of Joe. For my main entry, I had the pancakes, chicken sausage and added two poached eggs. The pancakes were some of the yummiest I've ever had. The chicken sausage went nicely with my medium poached eggs and the service from my waiter was friendly and spot on. Overall satisfied!  The menu is southern influenced so I'm looking forward to returning and trying the  shrimp & grits or beignets.

qxpIgTqTSgzufg1x2wNMog.text: Yes please! While visiting Vegas we stopped into this little place. We have a rule when traveling, no restaurants we can eat at home, and this one didn't disappoint. Thanks to the great Yelp reviews, we located this hip brunch spot. The food was amazing, crowd was cool, and the atmosphere had us wanting to come back again. When in town, stop in, you'll be glad you did.

sA376926hILLDD51BO9weg.text: My sister picked this place as our parting breakfast spot, I wasn't disappointed. The menus are on clip board, and it was a hipster-y spot. Fairly certain that our waiter was high. The food was decent. My husband ordered the big grilled cheese that I envied. My sammich had feta cheese and bacon on it, with potatoes on the side.   Not a bad place to check out, food is a little pricey, but you get a large portion.

0ssaOn1rdZ4NZ4wez0G8CQ.text: We've only been here once so far, but as someone who's new to Vegas it was really refreshing to find a place with amazing food and a rad ambiance. I had the truffle breakfast sandwich, and my boyfriend had the BLTA. I'm sure I'm messing up the names of these dishes, but they are totally worth ordering. I was also really impressed with the quality of the coffee! We went around 9/10a on a Saturday, no wait, but it stared to fill up as we were finishing. Check it out!

CgzsNtQ1_8dPlv9-_dFNKg.text: Best damn breakfast I've had in a while.   There are a LOT of great options in Vegas for a hearty breakfast/brunch, so it's not easy to find a place that really impresses. But Eat managed to serve up some ungodly portions of delicious breakfast food, with a level of quality and execution that was nearly flawless. Let's start with my country fried steak, which was fried to a beautiful crisp, while maintaining a nicely tender center. Matched with chunks of thick gravy and streaks of the runny egg yolk, each bite was beautifully savory and satisfying. The corned beef hash with eggs and toast was equally generous in portion, and came nicely seasoned with an appropriate ratio of potatoes. Each dish was hearty and flavorful, without being overly greasy or heavy.  As equally as impressive as the food, was the organization and execution coming from the kitchen. We sat at the counter and was able to observe how Chef Natalie was constantly hustling and communicating with her staff. They were like a well oiled machine, and it was both impressive and refreshing to see someone that on top of everything coming out of the kitchen. It's no wonder that the food came out promptly, was prepared well, and tasted great.  So if you're looking for a nice little breakfast spot that serves up some creative dishes with quality ingredients and generous portions, come eat at Eat. At the very least, you'll get the satisfaction of knowing that your food was prepared with some attention and care. And that's actually worth something to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash.

vicuHMbExTzCTg0FlQs0Cg.text: My friend was the one who recommended us here because he Yelped it and it got a lot of great reviews. I am now another one of those reviews.   The place isn't hard to find, but you do have to get street parking that you'd have to pay for. But, it's all good because once you're done with brunch or what not, you can walk across the street to the Container Park.   We walked and were seated right there and then. I do want to add that this place can getting pretty packed so try to be here early.   I ordered the country fried steak and it was bomb! A little salty but that flavor was so good and the potatoes were cooked to perfection and had a little bit of butter. Also, they can add cheese to your eggs to make it like an omelette mmmmmm! They do have the fried deviled eggs that we ordered but the main dishes were so filling. I will add that the orange juice is freshly squeezed so that will be like a $5-6 drink right there

bhzQ46KTLwxkSfBVJLwyXQ.text: We got here on a Sunday around 1000. There was no wait for a party of 2. We left around 1100 and there was a line. The service was friendly :)  I love deviled eggs, but never really see restaurants serve it. This place has deviled eggs, and they take it to the next level. I definitely recommend ordering La' Kat's Deviled Eggs.   We also ordered the Country Fried Steak and the Golden Brown Pancakes. The pancakes are incredibly fluffy. Good brunch place.

nwSBr9l9VX9UcVRtw8lTKg.text: This was our 1st time here. We were so excited to dine here as out of town guests. We came with our family (party of 8). They would not seat us together. When we asked if they would seat us next to the table that opened up next our family the manager Micheal (rude) was like "what's the point?" (Umm, we came to sit as a family is what's the point) and they wouldn't let us put our table together (so lame). At this point I'm not even interested in eating their food even though it gets great reviews. Part of the dining experience is the hospitality and Micheal just made it suck!!  Avoid this place if you have a party of more than four people.

3K4r84vysc2UoVxU3my7rQ.text: My main factors of rating a restaurant are the food quality vs food costs, customer service, cleanliness, uniqueness of decor, and lastly if I can make it at home or find similar food somewhere else. I consider all of those things against each other and sometimes they balance each other out. I wanted to like this place more, but it was just a turn off for me.  eat. has been on my radar forever, but they don't fit into my work schedule since they only serve breakfast brunch. It's in a cute space downtown where you'll find a wide variety of patrons.  Our server was so blah. He was super rude when he walked up to us and asked us rather rudely what we wanted. I want to say it was a , "know what you want?" No hi or anything. I really hate patronizing places with bad customer service but I whatever, I paid for metered parking. lol jk he also brought us one refill on our drink. When we were paying. Enough about that.  My food was good. It wasn't great. It wasn't drool worthy. It was picture worthy though.  We got the deviled eggs, shrimp and grits, and the Reuben with tomato soup. We got their house brewed citrus tea.  The shrimp and grits was good. The bacon makes the dish. I wish the grits were thicker and more flavorful. It was good and the portion of shrimp was good.  The Reuben sandwich had the thickest slices of bread. The meat was okay. It was all just okay.  The tomato soup was good, but not special. Just a well done basic tomato soup.  The tea was good.  The deviled eggs were good. Deep fried hard boiled egg whites then filled with the traditional deviled egg filling and topped with bacon. I could have eaten a dozen of these.  Overall I liked the place. After hyping myself up for months I'd probably not rush back. The service was disappointing, the food wasn't memorable or special, and the cheap tactics of using the huge bread slices was a turn off.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grits, bacon, poached eggs, shrimp, sauce. Grits were too thin. Couldn&#39;t tell the difference between the grits or sauce.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs. 2 eggs halved, deep fried, topped with bacon. $8 my favorite thing.

5PHiXvS4qqLixrmaurV3IQ.text: Looking for something off the strip for breakfast. You know it's the most important meal of the day. Life is short, don't eat hurry up food!   So I went to "Eat". Simple enough. I'm by myself which is always interesting. I sit at the bar. Order the shrimp and grits. The guy asks "do you want cheese on that?"  Should you even ask that? YES!!!   Now I love shrimp and grits and this goes to close to the top of the list. Presentation was on point and the taste was amazing. I could not finish it. But the last bite I took was as good as the first bite. I would so recommend coming here. It was worth a come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits with over easy eggs. Wonderful!

3u5x6qxKSe4VBNwF45o_Eg.text: So I recently moved to Las Vegas and wanted to give this place a try. There are tons of places in Vegas to have brunch at but I wanted to try something that reminded me of Los Angeles.  First and foremost, if you come on a weekend make sure you allow yourself an extra 20 minutes before you know you'll be hungry. There was only two of us but we were seated within 20 minutes.   The atmosphere is kind of loud so if you're looking for a quite place to relax and have a bite while reading the paper, this isn't the place for you.  The menu is very minimalistic with 5-6 options in the sweet category and the savory category. I went with the truffle egg sandwich. Pretty darn good. The ciabatta was fresh and the smoked bacon that's inside the sandwich was nice and crispy. Potatoes were decent. Not oily and cooked throughout. I should've asked if I could of substituted the potatoes. If you're a homestyle potato person this is totally for you.  Our server Gary was pretty helpful. We told him what we were kind of craving and he pointed us in the right direction. He was very attentive and other servers in the restaurant were very helpful as well.  I'm giving it four stars because overall everything was amazing. A little pricey for what you get but still pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The truffle egg sandwich. Added avocado but comes with bacon!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled eggs. The yoke compote was a little bit better, almost pickle tasting but good.

9Z27qDFgTL8gNUWUiGdvfA.text: Me and my girl loved this place. The service was great and those POTATOES...thy best in Vegas. Great Spot for first-timers

rKBjbyWUitfHtwzCMYGiAQ.text: So turned off by the rude hostess up front.  Yes girl with the dreads and 3 inch holes in your ears, this review is for you!  Came around lunch time and I must say it isn't too crazy busy. Walked in with my coworker and asked for a seat of 5 (lunch time with the office). Was completely ignored. Another group came in seconds right after us, asked for a seat of 5, was immediately seated. Two of my other coworkers came in, asked again for a party of 5.. Again to remind you, there were 4 of us at the time because we were waiting on the doctor to arrive!  We were immediately rejected and told that she cannot seat incomplete parties. WELL DAMN, maybe if you would've said something initially, upon arriving, and actually telling us nicely.. I would've known that information! Word of advice miss, please let "incomplete parties" know that such rule before rudely ignoring them and seating the party behind them right away ...  Wooooosah.. Now let's talk food.. New thing tried was the Fried Deviled Eggs - fried egg with a creamy yolk center, topped with hot sauce and bacon pieces! Simple yet yummy! Then got my usual Shrimp & Grits - always a hit!  Service from Gary was great, he has great personality and very tentative!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep Fried Deviled Eggs!

hlmf6lMVbMymz408ip1Rqw.text: A great place for breakfast. The pancakes  were so delicious! It was worth the wait in line.

V9BJysbCCH9SGLZJKJoS2g.text: YOU HAVE GOT TO TRY THE PANCAKES! Honestly everything was sooo good. The only thing I'd complain about is the service.. waiters are in a rush and they come off kind of rude.. but I mean the food is bomb.

4-iMES7yGh77cYeuzCtG1A.text: Had a dr appointment in the area and decided to check this place out. I ordered the veggie burger and my hubby had a Ruben. Both were delish. We got a chance to meet the chef named Sherry !! She's amazing with her yummy creations. We will be back to try more of the menu !! I'd steal her if I owned a restaurant !!

s9tgop_MRf7n-mIIlQpoBw.text: Best breakfast place in Vegas that I have found so far, and I am a Bay Area food snob. Only drawback is weak coffee. I bring my own. Ask about the specials.

3Q0mUChq9zMNbgReUdz7fA.text: I visited this little restaurant with my best friend on our way out of Las Vegas on my birthday weekend.   We were greeted and seated promptly. The menu had some super appealing items on it, so it was hard to choose. The service was good although I felt like we were mis-heard on a few occasions, and it's not as though it's terribly loud in there. (I asked for water and said it three times, but he brought me coffee AND orange juice? Not sure how water sounds like coffee or orange juice.)   The decor was modern and cool, as was the staff.  After a lot of inner turmoil, I decided on the two eggs any style with chive potatoes and toast. The potatoes were awesome. The toast was soft and thick, which was nice. My friend had deviled eggs, if I'm not mistaken. She was happy with hers. We shared a large pancake, which both of us thought was just OK--nothing special. But it looked so fluffy!  I think that overall it is worth the price and the experience. The food quality is great, as is the atmosphere. Definitely hit up this place if you're ever in North Vegas.

f2_gF1mjH9hKXqQib-XIrQ.text: eat is now a go to place for breakfast for me when I visit Vegas. The food is pretty darn innovative. I mean, who would think to deep fry deviled eggs. Or wrap a soft boiled egg in sausage and deep fry it.   My mom had heard about eat from a TV show she watched. So when we visited a few months ago, we took our first trip to eat. This restaurant is on Carson street right off of Las Vegas Blvd. I remember back in the day, the neighborhood that eat is in wasn't the best, but I noticed that there is a revival going on. Hats off to the people at eat for helping the revival along.   My family and I arrived at eat around 9 a.m. On Friday morning. Just so you know, if you go on a Saturday or Sunday, you are going to have a wait. Up to an hour in most cases so be patient. The menu is small, but mighty.  I would say that the menu is eclectic and foodie friendly.   The star of the menu is the deviled eggs in my view. The hard boiled egg is deep fried, then the yolk mixture is put in the center as usual, but then a little bit of Sriracha is drizzled on top and then to kill it, carmelized onion is added. You get 4 for $8.00. I could eat several plates if they were put in front of me, but you know what happens when you eat too many eggs. Lol For my main dish, I had the Chicken Fried Steak. It was breaded perfectly and had a rich brown gravy on it. It was served with potatoes and eggs cooked to your liking. I suggest over medium. That way, you can cut into the egg and mix it up with the potatoes and a little bit of the steak. My mom had the specs oak of the day, which was a soft boiled egg, wrapped sausage(yes, sausage) then deep fried. It was served with pancakes. It was incredible. My mom loved the pancakes and said they reminded her of my grandma's greasy pancakes. The coffee is really good as well.   The decor is industrial and the restaurant itself isn't very big. The service is good and attentive. Parking is available on the street for $2.00 for an hour. You have to pay at the parking kiosk on the curb. I have never really had trouble finding parking, but I can imagine it can be tough at times.   I feel like eat is very much a local place and not so much a touresty place. At least not yet anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heaven

dDVQPjxeXSXTeil-D_NsRA.text: I'd seen so many good things about this place and wanted to check it out, so we went for breakfast on our last trip to Vegas two weeks ago. We kept it simple (eggs, bacon, toast, potatoes), which meant we got our food quickly -- very much a plus -- but while the eggs were fresh and hot, the potatoes were obviously reheated from the day before and were soggy with oil. I didn't mind the reuse, but the poor preparation killed what would otherwise have been a tasty side. Our server was friendly and professional; a lot of people came in shortly after we did and she had to hustle to keep up, but she was as attentive as she could have been under the circumstances and we were satisfied with the quality of the service. If I'm back in the downtown area on my next trip, I might give Eat another try, but I'll probably go for a lunch item instead.

5bG1MTOxoq7PbpBKde-XSQ.text: Beautiful Food.  Beautiful Service.  Simply Amazing.  Even the presentation was really phenomenal.......And "GARY", our waiter was SOOOOOOO AWESOME!!!!  He literally gave us the best customer service!   Thanks Again Gary and well see you when we're back in Vegas!   HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2fYu6aR2gJz_hx1xlmNTvQ.text: Everything you need to know about Shrimp & Grits for breakfast can be learned here at Eat...exceptional!

NREe_byQZF3y8NlGFxlTsA.text: Stopped by on a recent trip.  I ordered the hash (in my continuing effort to find the perfect breakfast hash), it came with 2 poached eggs and one piece of Texas Toast.  Sat at the counter, with fairly attentive service.  Both the potatoes and the corned beef were cut into tiny cubes before being grilled.  The poached eggs had about half of the yoke runny.   The food tasted good, but the small cubes didn't give me the mouth feel that I prefer, and if you go in thinking you will get the volume of food like Hash-House, you will be disappointed   My friend had the Shrimp and Grits, her comment was that it was some of the loosest grits she has ever had  I might try again on another trip - but I won't go out of my way to do it

VBm9EVoAwh2GXyTHviM_Yw.text: Gary is the best server on the planet. He's always on point. I've brought dozens of people for breakfast and each have commended the food and service. We love Eat!

qg5Q3WQTg0vR8O30Zmrl1g.text: As a local, wanted to try out a different place. The menu is very small, only a handful of choices, the space does not regulate sound well so it's very loud. The staff was very friendly, we did sit without water toward the end of our meal. We had the pancakes, fried devil eggs, eggs Benedict, and chicken fried stake. It was my first time having a bene and probably my last. not sure how the sauce is supposed to take but I didnt like it at all. My daughters pancakes were tasty, the bf didnt seem too impressed with his meal. The chive potatoes were good though. I gave it 3 stars for the prices and lack of choices. $4.00 for a glass of lemonade? Our meal with tip was $70 for 2 adults and 1 child.
