JIBEd1HnVO8TKyJsM9Rhkg.text: Amazing place for breakfast.  I stopped in right as they opened with my 3 year old daughter and she loved the pancakes.  The staff was incredible and the coffee was perfect.

fKPCaYG9e6f-CWBNIjphlg.text: This hidden gem is great! Friendly staff and great affordable breakfast/lunch! The menu isn't too long or overwhelming and the choices are great! I highly recommend. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because they don't have a liquor License and I really wanted a bloody mary

hwaqPFNmkfri9LStSvBhMQ.text: Great ambiance.  Average price for the area.  Brunch closes early, at 2pm.  Huge portion, pretty hipster like but still enjoyable overall.

UdfEZJY4eSujttCx3rHMTQ.text: Reading is purely on services.   Visiting Vegas to see my family. They all said we need to go to EAT because of the food. Wish we would have had a chance to try the food. This is how things played out   11:30 am Called to make a reservation for a group of 10 at 1:00 pm. I was told that they don't take reservations but since I called in with enough notice they would work it out for us to be seated.   12:20 pm I arrived early with my husband to the restaurant to put our names on the waiting list. My husband was told "we will see what we can do", in regards to seating our group.   12:30 pm I confirmed with the hostess that we would be seated and the owner came by at the same time and said we would be seated at 1:00 pm. (Happy to hear this)  12:50 pm My enter party arrives and three tables are open two right next to each other and one in a separate corner. And the rest of my group arrives  1:00 pm Other people are seated that came in after us.  1:10 pm No updated from the Hostess about us being seated and more people are being seated that arrived after us.   1:15 pm My brother call "La Comida" just one block up and one block over from "EAT" to see if they can seat us. They said "Yes!". I told the hostess we were leaving and we all walked over to "La Comida"  Very disappointed on the Customer Services and lack of communication. Granted the location is small but if I was told when I originally called they couldn't seat such a large group we would have never wasted our time waiting.

4PRyXaceJI7kPnCHmOKzSQ.text: Since i'm not in Las Vegas as much as i use to be (I'm a local). The new Revamped downtown area is shedding some light on the hipster way's that popular and trendy.  I like this place, NOT LOVE. they do something right, not everything, but i expect them to get there.  We ordered off the brunch menu, had the chicken fried steak and pancakes.  The pancakes were great, nice and yummy and good maple syrup. DROOL  THe chicken fried steak was good, not amazing. THe breading needed some work, it wasn't that crispy and felt like it was just a layer of flour on top of the steak. 7/10

rs48GvbBkbSAFbsD3b7vZA.text: On a recent trip to Vegas we ventured off the strip and into Downtown to try the brunch at this place. We had heard it was a local favorite and the line outside proved that what we were about to experience was good.   The hostess said it would be a 30 minute wait so I asked her if I could have a glass of water. We waited outside and decided to check out the cool container park next door while we waited. When we got back the hostess let us know that she had gotten me my water and I wasn't there! I felt like a jerk but she was very nice about it and didn't make me feel bad about it at all. I appreciate that she went out of her way to get the water for me because at the time 5 other people were barking in her face at the same time. I wish I could bump up the review to 5 stars just because she was so cool about it, but this review has to be about the food.  That isn't to say the food isn't great. We started off with the cinnamon biscuits covered in a strawberry compote and powdered sugar. Eat that! Its fantastic. Your waistline will complain at first but just tell it to hush up because its worth it...  For brunch I had the truffled egg sandwich and my gf had the huevos motulenos. Both were really good. The banana in the huevos motulenos was a little weird at first but after a couple bites the sweetness of the banana balanced the dish well. My egg sandwich was good but kinda plain. It was basically egg, bacon, and mushroom for most of it which isn't a bad thing. I was thinking the whole time eating it that it could use some salt but it wasn't until I got to the end of the sandwich that I got a taste of the feta. That was the tang that really made the sandwich. I guess someone just forgot to put it throughout because that was certainly how the chef intended it to taste.  Pro-tip: The coffee is awesome, nutty, and smooth Super pro-tip for out of towners: The street parking on 7th street is free on sundays yet you will probably not see the one sign that tells you that and pay by accident.  Solid food but not blow me away the best so this gets a solid 4 stars.

N8QoYw7UgGarJ4Wjys9Z6g.text: Great bfast probably the best weve had in a long time. Pancakes were unbelievable a def must. Friendly and quick staff. A def must when in Vegas.

h53if6axDHS_P4OYMShlmQ.text: Small humble modern place. Wait wasn't bad like 20 minutes for brunch. Very good food. There aren't a ton of choices but there is something on the menu for everyone. We ordered the grilled cheese with tomatoes with tomato soup and their BLT with avocado. Both were delicious. Potato salad was pretty good as well. The staff was welcoming and attentive. Only complaint was the tea. We weren't sure if it was old but had a bitter taste. Would definitely recommend and we will be going back when we are in town.

pnBl3d_0QXi6mHioLHOSLw.text: typically would have enjoyed this restaurant but todays experience was subpar in terms of customer service. i will never dine here again. ever.

QT91NOTondQc2ZnORqz5HA.text: The only thing that ruined our experience at 'eat' was the view from my seat of some big guy showing off his hairy ass crack. Along with that view, was a not-so-attractive woman at a different  table showing off her crack too. Despite the horrid visuals around me (and slightly throwing up in my mouth as I saw the dude's ass) the food was great. The BLT was as good as you'll find and the same can be said about the pancakes. With slightly crispy edges and a fluffy texture, it can easily be billed as one of the better pancakes in town. Syrup is available, but isn't needed. The chicken apple sausage on top was great, as well. It wasn't a cheap breakfast, but the quality is well worth it. The brunch menu on weekends is fairly small, much more so than the usual breakfast or lunch menu on weekdays. So, plan your visit accordingly.

oLNXJ3mQT4ObRLHIORZKrQ.text: Christina the server was amazing. Suggested a delicious sandwich since I was undecided. Place is super close to to where I love. With the fun, cute atmosphere I'll definitely be back to try more.

pntRuAGjuuWKJPIHFLnx6A.text: I was in town for work and was looking for a breakfast spot before some client meetings.  Eat was right around the corner from my first meeting and the place was great.  I had the huevos motulenos and it had a little bit of spice but just the right amount.  The staff was great and I love the location that Eat is in.  It's in old Las Vegas and there is a lot of cool happenings here.

VeLbpnL7h-vwdn7Jkyhauw.text: I found "Eat" while trying to get away from the Vegas scene and boy did I! The atmosphere is refreshing and welcoming and a good place to even come by yourself. Good coffee and the cinnamon go perfectly with your cup of joe! I had the truffle sandwich which was not too light and not too heavy. My guy had the huevos moltulenos... we swapped forks and we were both torn over who's was better. The moltulenos is an experience. Each bite has a different taste and the bananas hidden under the eggs give you a sweet surprise amongst the Mexican flared beans and chiles. Service is friendly and enthusiastic! If you are a foody and want some peace and good grub in Vegas check out Eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6JCA3nTVn9vwTqw4v_r0AQ.text: Really cute atmosphere, but the service is awful. Gary took our order, he seemed so condescending and unhappy to be there. We ordered the cinnamon biscuits and he brought them out first as an appetizer even though we would've much rather had them after our meal, he should've at least asked. Menu is so limited, and I know that it's supposed to be a sort of "minimalistic style" type deal, but they close at 2 or 3 AND their menu doesn't give much range. I wish they would give us something to work with. Maybe if the service wasn't so bad I wouldn't mind it as much, but the food wasn't all that great either. Customer service is putting on a show, Gary. Your customers can feel your bad attitude.

X94177KVPw-qZN0ly0Ma2w.text: Great breakfast spot. Trendy and they have a unique menu. I enjoyed the shrimp and grits. Good coffee.

tmy0oBxhPcWPjgSGCUZhJA.text: Yay! I was so happy to finally get to try this place! I'm so happy to see it doing well! The place was busy last Monday during lunch, full with very little wait. It is a casual breakfast/lunch joint. Breakfast ending at 11am. :( The BF was sad about that, he wanted to try the Chilaquiles. Which I think did say on the printed menu at the restuarant but that's not what we were worrying about at that time...it was what are we going to choose!!   I had the free range chicken sandwich with fresh mozz, tomato and pesto mayo on ciabatta. So yummy!! You can get house made chips or potato salad and 'a really good pickle'. The waitress, who was nice and attentive, asked if I'd rather have the tomato salad, why of courese I want the lighter option!! The tomato salad was good! Cherry tomatoes with fresh sliced garlic, balsamlic dressing, basil...simple and yum! However, I wish it was not served in such a big bowl because it made the portion look super tiny.   The non adventrous food eating BF had eggs, home fries and bacon. You can't go wrong. Their home fires are big pieces where most diners are smaller and end up mushy(but still yummy) I liked the stability of these yummy nuggets!   I also of course love that they serve coffee from my friends at Colorado River Roaster!! SO glad to see more resturants serving their delicious local roasted coffee!  We'll be coming here more often on Lunch Date Mondays, as it is super close to the BF's work! Yay! BF approved!

atOexJIG6XQY_U10EtdM0Q.text: Nice place, small menu but all quality food here. Outstanding service, not sure why it did not open till 8:00am though. I had pancakes & they were more than enough. Nice smoke-free area, a few blocks from dirty Fremont Street.

nuy_12gbm0lZNetkPEQsgA.text: Friendly staff, fast service, great food! Nice prices.  Good vibes inside, great downtown LV. location, away from the hustle and bustle of the Fremont Street Experience.

tThr_O_8okesoBS1psBuEw.text: We stopped here on our way out of town and the breakfast was incredible. It was packed and we were in a hurry so we sat at the bar but the server was friendly and the food was delivered super fast! We both had eggs and bacon with potatoes and toast, a simple breakfast but delicious! The potatoes are amazing and the eggs were cooked just right. Do yourself a favor and skip all the nasty dives and just go to eat!

8KyPcH0KEyImuMpOU86vKQ.text: Such a unique little spot in downtown. It can get crowded and the wait can get super long, but all very worth It! It's definitely worth getting up early and getting there before 11am to catch the early morning specials. My usual is the country friend steak. Generous serving for a good price with some great gravy. The pancakes are always super fresh and fluffy too! If you're a sandwich person, I recommend the grilled cheese. Add bacon and avocado for an extra bite. The soup is good and a bit rich. You'll have to unhinge your jaw to bite the super thick cut bread they use on the sandwich though! Hahah. Overall, a really good spot. Sometimes you can catch the owner there! She's doing something great, one shop at a time. Check it out!

5R9GRnMr3u2HlsFCa2f5Fg.text: I went here for my birthday this year and was mostly disappointed.  The main issue was service.  We came in for brunch (10:30ish) and waited for roughly 15 minutes before our waiter came over to take our drink order.  During this time other wait staff glanced in our direction, but didn't take the initiative to assist.  When the waiter finally came, I felt like we were inconveniencing him.  He didn't really speak to us, it was more like a drive through: "Drinks?", "Eat?", "That it?".    In regard to food, it was okay.  I had chilaquiles (being from New Mexico) and was disappointed that the red chile was overpowering the green.  The sausage was also fairly bland.

XmlbxG0viAienaNvWMIpFg.text: Vegas has needed a farm to table restaurant like this for quite some time now! Seriously, EAT could be found in the hip downtown epicenter of Austin or Seattle, but instead we are lucky enough to have it right here in downtown Las Vegas. The inside is super cute and small! There is a long communal table in the center, which forces you to interact. I love this! Beware it does get pretty crowded around breakfast and lunch time, OK so it's crowded all of the time, but it is worth it. I have been here a couple of times and my major pain point is that they don't serve breakfast all day, I mean they are only open until 3!   The pancakes are probably some of the best I have ever eaten. They are slightly crispy around the edges and perfectly fluffy in the middle. You didn't even know that you liked your pancakes crispy along the edges, but you do, trust me, you do! The Beignets are absolutely divine. I want to bathe in the vanilla-scented mascarpone, seriously we almost fought over it. The truffled egg sandwich also has so much more flavor than it advertises, super yummy! I tried a bite of my friend's shrimp and grits and the grits were super bland, no butter, no cheese, no salt. That's the only disappointment I have experienced here. If you happen to be here around lunch time the free range chicken sandwich is delicious and it's always a toss-up between their perfectly fried homemade potato chips or their delectable potato salad. You really can't go wrong!

FEZo0XJVzYkN1Tb_1Qi7Bg.text: A co-worker told me about eat. being an amazing place for brunch a couple of months ago, so I made it a point to try it out this past winter break.  I came here with my husband at around 11:00 on a weekday and easily found metered street parking.  When we walked it we were greeted warmly by staff and seated within five minutes.  I love the hip atmosphere and decorations.  It was such a fun environment to be in and you could see the owner going around to tables and meeting with customers.   Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomachs so these three dishes were way too much for us, but Yay for yummy left overs later!  Here is what we ordered:  Chilaquiles scrambled eggs - The sausage on this dish was savory and sweet and amazing.  The sausage was my favorite part of the dish.  The meat was halved and rested on a bead of eggs, cheese, salsa, and chips.  The salsa wasn't my favorite because it was a bit to smokey in flavoring for my taste.  Overall it wasn't a bad dish, but I'll likely explore other things on the menu before in re-order this dish.  Truffled egg sandwich - I can totally see why this dish is so popular on Yelp.  It was amazing!  The eggs, the bacon (and I'm not even a bacon person, the ciabatta bread, and the potatoes.  I highly recommend this for first times to eat.  It will definitely be a great introduction to the food at eat.  Short Stack - The best pancakes I have ever had.  They were super thick and fluffy and mind blowing.  A short stack comes with two 1/2 inch pancakes, topped with lots of powdered sugar, with jarred maple syrup on the side.  If you have a sweet tooth this is a must!!!  When friends and family come and visit in the future, I will definitely bring them here for brunch.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chilaquiles scrambled eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Stack

bo8QIOX_JuxLevJORQhc0g.text: The food was amazing here. I had the corned beef hash, which comes with poached eggs. The coffee was okay. However, the service was questionable. The drink server was good but our food server was short, non-attentive and not very pleasant. If the service was spot on, I would give this place 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash with poached eggs

cs56B2tBd24U2-yJeJHnfQ.text: I thought my food was good, ordered the shrimp and grits. What I absolutely loved was the quality of the shrimp and I had about 6 nice sized shrimp in my grits. My friend ordered the deviled eggs which was a huge hit. They were absolutely delicious, and when was the last time you had a fried deviled egg...........yummmmmmmmmmmers!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Deviled Eggs, they were amazing!!

ec17DADHIffTxXLwzXXTsA.text: Staff was very attentive even though they were obviously slammed (Saturday Morning breakfast). Food was fantastic! We were a little surprised by the prices because google listed this as a $ breakfast joint.. we were expecting greasy diner food- this was not the case AT ALL. Everything was fresh and felt gourmet. Well worth every penny. Must try: the tomato soup. It's made in house and it's some of the best I've ever had. Five star place!

-o2vK_DOatXURWrbc_Y8zg.text: honestly, I think this place is all hype. I WASN'T impressed at all. the service was crap. our server took our order by saying "ready?" didn't even greet us or introduce himself. and even after we got our food, he barely checked on us, just a casual "you good?" when he walked by. and he didn't even ask us if we were ready for our check, he just placed it on our table as if he was ready for us to leave.   the food was just alright, nothing mind blowing. we ordered the cinnamon biscuits, shrimp & grits, and the shrimp po boy.   I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon, sorry eat.

kLYBDmo3-07PiAZrtau0ag.text: Discovered this place behind the container park after we spoke to several local las vegans, is this a word??? Anyway, we are so impressed with the FOOD, the servers are fun, happy, and efficient.  But it is the food that keeps us driving from CA.  We discovered this place a month ago and there hasn't been anything on the menu that has not wowed us.  Great food spot.  Can't wait for our next visit. Wish we had one closer to home.

Q-1mRAKqc9X6M95xL2Dviw.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots that never disappoints! I have been coming here for years and their food is always amazing. I would highly recommend their corned beef hash, and deviled eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash with a perfectly poached egg
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled eggs

rlYemQr9otIIyat2YSXtSg.text: If you want a good breakfast, I'd recommend venturing outside of the strip to this small joint a block outside of the main street in downtown Las Vegas. Expect a wait, because it tends to get really crowded. There's not much shade or seating outside while you wait so beware of the heat during the summer. We were taken here by a LV local, but I dunno if it's really a "local" place.  I got the eggs benedict, and wow, I don't know if it's because I was nearing the end of my road trip from San diego to Denver and back again and was eating subway/in&out everyday, but that Benedict just made my DAY. ShOOt. The benedict was topped with a perfect little egg - poached to perfection - covered with hollandaise, under which lay strips of thick turkey bacon, swiss or thick cheese of some sort, tomato, greens, and a nicely toasted piece of bread. The egg had a GREAT ooze to it as you slowly cut into the center of the yoke, adding to the taste and texture. The bacon was so thick i had to chew slower than I wanted to. On the side was a heaping of potatoes, seasoned well.   Definitely a great change from huge and not very good portions served at quick joints on the strip, but super filling! Friends got shrimp and grits, pancakes, country fried steak, all of which no one complained about. I'd come back again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. downtown benedict. .. yummy yummy YUMMY!

vAFYKUC_1Ss31BKSY-jeLg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place! I went in on my own one morning. I chose to sit by the window cause I wasn't sure if my back would allow me to sit on a bar stool. Even though I really wanted to watch the action I ended up enjoying my view of downtown.  First of all Eat has the friendliest staff! From the moment I walked in to the moment I walked out the door everyone was helpful and really nice. The service was spot on. They never let my tasty cup of coffee get empty and even brought me more cream.  It was hard to pick what I wanted from their menu because everything sounded so good! I decided on the corn beef hash. I was glad I did!! It came with chunks of meat and potatoes perfectly cooked with green onions. On top was the best looking two poached eggs I've ever seen! I broke them open and let all the yummy yellow yolkie goodness melt over my hash. It also came with some tasty toast that I could not resist eating one piece of. Definitely was an excellent meal to start the day.  Eat is a little pricey, but for the quality, taste and service it's more then worth it! I'll be back again to try something off their lunch menu! Yay for Eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash!

J5wJxUaC_Kml8D5YfMOgSw.text: Wish I could give this place a negative rating. Who would ever know if the food is good or not. The front door staff is so rude and nasty I would never attempt To go there ever again!!

ZQ-nf1VltbssDcZPxC8DmA.text: Shrimp & grits & a shrimp po boy. Believe the hype people!! Would've done 5 stars but service kinda lagged altho it wasn't super busy our waiter left our drinks empty for a awhile..but food is 5 stars for sure !

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ldWx0n5Hq_rjHs5fBhIiHw.text: Delicioso!!!! everything was excellent, the Food, the service, very nice and clean, totally recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect and delicious
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fwmpwsyZFmzhkAGogucFIw.text: From the street I would have never guessed this Unique Eat would be so rock star. The place is casual with many regulars of all kinds. I loved how some were very dressed up while others were casually brunching. This was my first time and I felt like the other diners were repeat customers for sure.   The decor is Up-Cycle cool and comfortable.  We ordered the Shrimp and Grits, Pancakes, Spicy Egg Dish (sorry I forgot the name), and Chicken Fried Steak.  I can not stop thinking about the Chicken Fried Steak!  It is so perfectly crispy, flavorful, and FRESH! Everything was fantastic. The coffee was so good we had to take a bag home with us.  The Chef and Owner made it a point to check in with us and ensure everything was wonderful.  I don't live in Vegas, but I can not wait to visit EAT again.  A +!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Egg Dish. So many different flavor sections. Loved it!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CHICKEN FRIED STEAK!!!!!

1LK8VqSr9Vu8WY8ZaUOHkg.text: Stopped by here for lunch with my dad and I was very impressed.  I love little hole in the wall places like this.  The exterior isn't the greatest obviously because of it's downtown location, but once you step inside it's like you're in a whole different area.  The restaurant is cute and very well decorated right up my alley.    Once we stepped in we were greeted and seated right away, there were alot of people from law offices and downtown restaurants eating there on their lunch.  I decided to try the Truffled Egg Sandwich although everything sounded really good.  The sandwich consisted of eggs, feta, mushrooms, chives, and bacon on ciabatta bread.  They also served it with a side of Chive potatoe's.  I have a thing about feeling sick after eating too much eggs but I had no problem finishing this sandwich.  I'm very excited that I have found another good spot downtown near my job!  I can't wait to try everything else on the menu.

d5_drvVNdNrhY_bwn05k4A.text: Located in downtown LV, nice hipster vibe. Came in for brunch and they were able to adjust to my vegan preferences. Food was good, coffee was alright. Service a bit slow for a Monday.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and egg with grits and salsa
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool ambiance

AcsReE-5W4wmMb6EtrJ9CA.text: EAT Your heart out.   I love this local joint the grilled cheese and tomato soup is delish. Can you guess where the party is? And it's not in your pants. The food here is a straight party in your mouf!

pbVOXkJdIHrumXB7k9TQrQ.text: The breakfast food is amazing here. I highly recommend the egg truffle sandwich. The service is pretty good too . Gary is always a nice guy.   The wait can be a little long during brunch on the weekends.

_B-3OGP9IlJnBQXDJ_MeQQ.text: Alright, I wasn't particularly impressed. The wait wasn't too bad - about 15 minutes - for a table for 2. Much longer if you have a party of 3 or more. Apparently, there were specials, but we never were told them. The menu has a fair amount of options, but still feels rather limited. No alcohol. (Brunch without a mimosa??!) Our dishes were tasty and very filling. (We both took home half of what we ordered.) But the dishes also weren't crazy good or unique. And for the price, it felt a bit like a let down. All in all, I wouldn't be opposed to coming again. And maybe ordering something different would make it better. It ain't bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3fqGEt0jkLvJYuIu_PWaTQ.text: Great breakfast spot. The atmosphere was chill and hip and servers friendly and nice. My water and coffee were always full.  I got the shrimp and grits. It had a nice presentation and the bacon was thick. Though there wasn't as much shrimp as I thought there would be. Regardless the savory flavor was killer. The rye bread I had on the side was a great addition to help scoop up the grits. Literally licked my plate clean. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Detail of the shrimp and grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits

8Ug9AzF8RAQYD8GlXjF-8A.text: After what seemed like looking at endless photos of this place, I finally decided to give it a try. Maybe I'm just getting too old but the vibe wasn't my thing. I noticed they closed at 3. All I could keep thinking was they closed early so everyone could still make it to their auditions. On a serious note, I feel like I've been a victim of marketing.  The pancakes were ok.  The sausage was delicious. The potatoes were eh. I've had better. The coffee was eh eh and the bill was yikes.  Granted my child kept ordering things and not finishing them.  If you love great marketing, this place is for you. Otherwise, stick to the pretty pictures.

w35fBYku-DdzZZsUR2YnTw.text: What a find!  Away from the strip but an awesome place for breakfast and lunch. I had a Reuben sandwich and my wife had a BLTA sandwich.    I ordered a cup of coffee because it sounded good on their menu.  Boy was it good!  Gary our server recommend the fried devil eggs and they were great.   Can't wait for next time we come to Vegas and try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLTA
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben

ghFQytwx17uQ2GL__bFQrw.text: Always a great visit and good food when I come. Good atmosphere and great food, with a healthy twist! Decent prices and in my favorite part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y_L1G4b6_bN03Wf6TYdBLA.text: EAT. serves delicious, healthy-ish food in a small cafe in Old Vegas; don't expect EAT. to be Applebee's or a buffet.  I went to EAT. quite some time ago. It was the best food I had eaten while I was in Vegas for a business trip (week-long). I wish I had been there sooner. I heard about it from Anthony Bourdain's show and how he raved about Natalie Young's talents as a young up-and-coming chef.   The menu is smallish, but what EAT. does make is delicious, quality food (over quantity). Anyone who has been to an upscale restaurant or a specialty restaurant recognizes right away a smaller menu means the chef has chosen meals with the finer ingredients and has a technique that surpasses that of a larger menu.  Their portion-size actually is quite large. But...this is the U.S. and Vegas (if you're a mainstream tourist you expect a certain variety and type of food).  Also, it's a small cafe and not a huge banquet room restaurant. Complaining about a party of 11-people is ridiculous.  I was actually at the end of a vicious cold when I was in Vegas, and the food there was healthy-ish and also delicious. (Take note of the veggie burger but also the gourmet meat selection.)  I even took a meal with me for the plane because it was that good.   Also, a side note is the area around EAT. should be explored. It's in OLD VEGAS meaning it's the historical sites for the BRAT PACK (original one with Sinatra Sammy D. Jr.) and many films classic film fans might recognize! I enjoyed being away from the crowd, and being able to walk without smoke being blown in my face. There are also many grassroots efforts in the area as art galleries. I even walked by the PAWN STARS pawn shop on my way back to my hotel (that is in the main "new" strip of Vegas).   ENJOY!!! Also, I highly doubt there was a hair on the plate and the waitress ignored that one writer. More likely the writer was disgruntled from something about the food/restaurant and then plucked out the hair and wrote a crappy review.    Most Americans consume food seasoned with salt (in many cases MSG for pre-made sauces and fast food), and sugar. EAT. makes their food fresh and from scratch which also makes some of these comments moot points for me. For example, see the review on a critique of a Hollandaise sauce and bacon. Likely these "bold flavors" she describes comes out of a package not fresh cream or real bacon (that hasn't been treated with a ton of nitrates). And also, the comment about the "banana" on the bottom of "Mexican food goodness"--likely this writer mistook a different Latin-American inspired dish (perhaps from El Salvador where the cuisine uses plantains) for Mexican food. Because, duh, all Americans know Mexican food, but not much else in terms of different Latin-American national foods.  If she would have tasted the said "banana" she might have discovered it was delicious! (And discovered a new national cuisine). Many of these bad reviews are proof there's not a lot of food in our food anymore. I suspect, some of these readers don't recognize (or don't have a palate for) real food anymore. In short, take some of these reviews with a grain of salt and look at their website or listen to Bourdain's review.

1fOFdJRftF8jzxpe-33n9Q.text: This place was awesome!  Cute decor, nice staff.  Food was fabulous and they give plenty!  Will definitely be coming back again!

wK3nufm61PQ3iogsBY1vsw.text: Came to try this place out after reading good yelp reviews during our visit to Las Vegas. We came from San Diego for a family trip.   Service: This is where they lost 2 stars. Very first strike was when we arrived and asked for a table for 5 adults and 1 WHEELCHAIR. The hostess at the front responded "Why don't you put her in a high chair??" Are you freakin kidding me?! Our response: "You're going to put my grandmother in a high chair??!" She apologized and said she was thinking we brought a child. Regardless if it is a child or adult, if we ask for ADA compliance, that's what we should get. She was insensitive and her comment made her seem like a complete idiot. Here is some advice for that hostess: Listen to UNDERSTAND, not listen to respond. Maybe you wouldn't come off as so incompetent. I really wish I got her name. Second strike was our server, Gary. Granted, we are a large party (6 people) and it was a busy morning. But we would appreciate if you don't come up to us and talk to us like we didn't know English. There's a difference between talking clearly and concise and talking like an asshole. Learn the difference.   Honestly, all the OTHER servicers, expediters, and bussers were extremely polite and friendly. They worked quickly and were very attentive. Just a couple rotten apples in the batch.   Location: Easy to find with GPS and the large sign out front makes it easy to spot. Right across the street from the Las Vegas Container Park. Near Fremont Street.  Parking: Street parking. $2 per hour, plan accordingly. Good thing is they do it in 30 minute increments.   Wait: We were quoted 15 minutes upon checking in and waited about 30 minutes. But they have a larger waiting area inside and a bench outside.   Food: Food was exceptional. We waited probably only 10 minutes for our food to be brought out. Our food was cooked really well and nothing was missing from our order. Coffee is good and a good portion. Our food portions were large but not obnoxiously large.

iaUUom2NsrY2Js1zkVxExA.text: I can't believe I didn't review this place earlier. Holy moly wow. The shrimp and grits all the way. The staff are attentive, friendly and uber fabulous. It's become a staple every time I come to Vegas.   It's a bit off the strip for those of you tourists, but so worth the detour. Highly highly recommended.

LRlaqK60If6PK7CqX0F5PQ.text: We stopped by for brunch at around 11am on a Sunday. There was no line so we were seated right away by a very prompt hostess.  The restaurant and its location are both interestingly quirky. The interior and ambience of the restaurant felt fun and inviting. It just feels like a cool place to go have a meal.  The server was friendly and quick. There was a good variety of dishes to choose from. We ordered some coffees, beignets, oatmeal and some pancakes with sausage.   The coffee was delicious. There wasn't a trace of bitterness in the coffee. The rest of the food was very good as well. It tasted fresh and well made.  All in all a delightful place to have a meal. I would definitely go again to try out the other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn Beef Hash and Poached Eggs Special

YdnKavqm-Gpw7h5dDPgssg.text: Decided to come here for brunch after reading the reviews. Located in a up-and-coming "hipster" neighborhood in downtown LV.  We arrived around 10am and there was no wait. The prices are fair compared to other brunch restaurants on the strip. The service was friendly.  We ordered the deviled eggs - Deviled eggs with a breakfast twist. These were very good. There's a light batter coated around the egg, which provides a nice crunch. The bacon is also a nice touch. Has a breakfast-y feel for deviled eggs.  Country fried chicken with potatoes - Looked and smelled amazing. However, the chicken steak, I felt, was under seasoned. The gravy was also under seasoned. I wish I had ordered the shrimp and grits instead.   Reasonably priced brunch spot in downtown LV. 4 stars for the deviled eggs and 3 stars for the country fried steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak with gravy

jNsJFh234LOeTrDxF7iehw.text: The atmosphere is great! The sitting area is a little small, but it wasn't too busy doing brunch on a Tuesday. I had the huevos motulenos and it was delicious! The potatoes had a nice crunch to them. My husband had the chilaquiles and they were also delicious! I never chilaquiles with actual "chips" (they're usually served with soft tortillas) but they were still amazing! The food was amazing! However, The service was TERRIBLE! Again, it was a Tuesday afternoon and they had plenty of open tables. I waited 5 min before someone acknowledged me and my party walked in. After we were seated, we waited almost 10 min before a serve even acknowledged us and took our drink menu. They was one other table that was sat after my party and their order was taken before mine. During this wait, we had time to look over our menu, and knew what we want d to order by the time they came to get our drink orders. I said to the waitress "were ready to order" and she said she'll be back to take our food order but walked over and took an order for an other table that had just arrived. If the service could match the food, they would be a solid 5 stars.

g73XCyALeP0-0epmhS41kw.text: Among the buffets and restaurants that serve up greasy (delicious) foods in Downtown, there is Eat: a new restaurant serving up tasty, healthy meals to help jump start your day or revive you from the morning grind at mid-day.   RESTAURANT Located a few blocks away from the Fremont Street Experience, Eat is located on Carson Street. Inside you'll notice the urban-industrial decor and potted greenery, which is always nice to see especially if you're so used to seeing brown dirt all the time. The floors are concrete and the ceiling has an unfinished appearance with its exposed pipes. I mention this because the restaurant was very noisy when I visited, so the sound was bouncing off the floor and ceiling.  FOOD Free Range Chicken Cibatta Sandwich: Does free range chicken taste better than ones that are pumped up with steroids? I can't say for sure, but I guess I feel less guilty.  The sandwich was delicious with its melted mozzarella cheese, pesto mayo, and mixed greens.   The sandwich can be paired with your choice of homemade potato chips or potato salad. You'll also receive  a "really good pickle", as stated on the menu. The potato chips were crunchy and not greasy. Both my friend and I didn't receive pickles with our meals since they were all out of them. Unfortunate since we were really looking forward to trying this supposed, "really good pickle" which I imagine would complement our sandwiches.   SERVICE Even though it was busy when my friend and I arrived, the service didn't disappoint. We received our orders fairly quickly, and if we needed anything our waiter wasn't too far from our table.   TIPS + Seems like this place can get packed during lunchtime hours, so it might be best heading down here right when lunch is being served at 11:00 a.m.  +There's meter parking across the street from the restaurant, although you could just park at one of the nearby casino parking garages.   OVERALL I think Eat is on to something here with its fresh, delicious, healthy food that leaves you feeling good without any of the, "I hate my life! I shouldn't have eaten that" regrets.

TP6SsFLuganjAetZcBZ1eQ.text: Located at downtown Las Vegas. This place was pack when we got in. Luckily we got seated asap. Coffee was the best. My truffle egg sandwich was delicious but too greasy for my taste. My boyfriend had the rubben which he said was delicious but too much bread. We had to wait a little while for our check. Our server was busy. Over all I would come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious strawberry biscuit. A must have.

TP2xx2RtpnLhWihuIccNcg.text: Over 1000 reviews with an average of 4 stars?! Is it worth the hype? Yes, for the most part, it is. I'm going to spare you the details since so many people have reviewed it already so a couple of key notes:  -parking IS hard to find. We came on Sunday around 11AM and all street parking was full. We lucked out to one last empty spot. Also, you don't have to feed the meters on the weekends so that was a plus.  -Expect to wait for a table. The restaurant is small and constantly busy so don't come here hangry. We were quoted 15-20 minutes for a party of 2 but only had to wait about 5.  -The cinnamon biscuits were hyped up the way it should be. It was delicious!!!! I'm not normally a sweets kinda gal for breakfast items but wow....the strawberry syrup along with sliced strawberries and whole blueberries were yummy. This plate came with four small sized cinnamon biscuits...which to me, looked like pancakes.  -Boyfriend got the country fried steak with scrambled eggs and chives potatoes. He really enjoyed it. We both agreed we made the right choice with what we ordered and would definitely order it again.  Only reason why I knocked off one star was the bathroom situation. ONLY ONE BATHROOM EACH for men and women. One bathroom!? Are you kidding me? Is this a gas station? I'm sorry, I understand it's in downtown LV and there's always homeless and drunk tourists roaming around asking for bathrooms left and right but damn....the least you can do is supply two bathrooms each for us! Of the 45 minutes we were there, both times I tried going to the bathroom and there was always someone in there. Thank goodness I didn't need to take a number 2!  At one point, there were 4 men waiting to use the restroom. When there's a line for the men's bathroom....it's time to do something about it. So don't come eat here if you're hungover (because you'll either be peeing all morning or hugging the toilet bowl) or if you drank a lot of mimosas/coffee. You might have to empty your bladder at one of the downtown casinos cuz there's no room for you here to do just that!

xNJxKAbTfDce8T99kdYc-g.text: This place had a very pleasant atmosphere and the staff is very helpful. The music is wonderful and the place is very roomy. I would recommend the pancakes here, they are ridiculously good. Would recommend for an upscale and trendy people to come to. Eggs were okay.

gZw55CKxDRRAOgLmBxdZYg.text: This place is awesome and just what I like...nice place, not too expensive, and offering food with unique twists/additions than the usual or outright inventions.   The coffee is awesome. Drink the coffee. I haven't eaten chicken fried steak in about a decade but that's what was calling my name. It seems like that is the biggest breakfast and just what I needed: a massive piece of chicken fried steak with sausage gravy dumped on top, plus some eggs, plus some potatoes, plus some mongo thick sourdough toast! Awesome!   My frau got the truffled egg sandwich and I had a bite of that - delicious! We went on a Saturday around noonish with a party of four and were seated in about 10 minutes. No complaints about the service - everyone was nice and chipper.

iK_x-R1qNob5xDxTZW2FHQ.text: Awesome breakfast place! I would highly recommend on eating here for breakfast or lunch. Gets you out of the city. Very nice meal. Lots of flavor. My pancakes were super good and my maple syrup was even from Canada. Super good ! Very Hip spot! Coffee was good too

gjQJbU7eMqvnnaafx8wFRA.text: As I was leaving my hotel this morning, I asked the valet where he would go to breakfast if he didn't want to go to a casino buffet. Without hesitation he said, "Dude, you have to go downtown and try this place called Eat. I've only been there once, but it was one of the best breakfast I ever had." Well who was I to argue with the hotel valet, so I jumped in the car and headed right over there for breakfast.  I will say this, it's located in a sort of seedy part of town, but you shouldn't let that stop you. There is no free parking, but they do have pay per space on the street, and it only cost me a buck, so no harm or foul there.  The restaurant itself has a really cool, casual, hip vibe to it. Almost like one of those little boutique coffee shops. The staff was all very friendly, and eager to make suggestions. I started out with a cup of coffee, which was really amazing. I mean I didn't ask where the coffee came from, but I'm pretty sure it was some Latin dude with a burro bringing the beans in fresh.  I usually try to get a combo plate to get a feel for the restaurant, but the combo plate that they had didn't have any sort of pancakes with it, so I asked the waiter what I should get. He recommended getting the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote if I was looking for something sweet and yummy. And of course, my usual glass of milk to test the serving skills of the staff.   Those biscuits? Oh my God, he was absolutely right! These amazing fresh hot little cinnamon biscuits smothered in strawberry compote with fresh blueberries and sliced strawberries, tasted like they were delivered Straight from Heaven itself!  The food was delivered to my table,  buy another one of the servers. And there was no milk. Two seconds later,  my original server shows up with my glass of milk. And there was no milk. Two seconds later, my original server shows up with my glass of milk. Another amazing save by the wait staff!   The eggs were really good, scrambled just the way I like them, their home style hash browns were really tasty and spiced well, but the real star of this plate was the Applewood smoked bacon. Like I mean this stuff tasted like it just came out of the smoker this morning. I would have seriously ordered three more plates of it, but I didn't want to look like a total hog.  The bottom line? Awesome food, great atmosphere, so really, what's not to love? It's a really great place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambled eggs, hash browns, and applewood-smoked bacon. I&#39;m telling you, this bacon will change your entire existence!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are the cinnamon biscuits I told you about. I&#39;m telling you,, these things will change your life.

HR8gmLY8yxkQ5emHEKOsuQ.text: After seeing how many reviews this place  got, I thought "I had to try this place". After seeing the reviews we decided to try this place on a Monday morning for breakfast to avoid the crowds and long waits.  When we (7 adults, 3 kids and a baby) checked in for a table the people weren't friendly at all. No smiles, just a "How many you got" with a stone face.   We get to the table, we're short a seat, and when we asked to add a small table, the guy seemed irked that he had to adjust the table because someone set it wrong. Even when the server arrived to get our order he didn't even crack a smile or from. Another stone face no expression person.   We ordered the cinnamon biscuits, which was a HUGE mistake! It was so dry (yes, I know biscuits are suppose to be dry, but this was like, extra dry, gotta drink water sort of dry) and that gross thick strawberry cough syrup tasting nasty sauce was straight up disgusting! A short stack (2 pancakes), which was just OK. Corned beef hash which came with 2 poached eggs. When I thought of corned beef hash, I thought more of a hash patty type of hash, but it was the type of hash with the tiny cubed potatoes with the tiny cubed pieces of corned beef. We also ordered some Mexican breakfast thing which had a banana under all that Mexican yumminess. Eewww! Wth! So fricken gross! Mexican food with a banana in it! Who's stupid idea was that!?  Anyways, long story short, I would never recommend this place or ever go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short stack pancakes (2 pancakes)
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican breakfast with a banana under...yuck!!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash

ac17vw89H8YkEgbyu8ibgQ.text: I just want to aay how great their homemeade potato chips are. They come with a sandwich meal and they're perfect... not hard but you still have a good crunch to them. I ordered the killer grilled cheese. The tomato soup was warm and creamy- the grilled cheese was so cheesy. The bread was thick and buttery and the sandwich was huge.

4OHS57VDQAkuDGLESRCzKQ.text: This was our first time here. The service was excellent. The ambiance was bistro ish. We enjoyed the place. We ordered breakfast and they did make substitutions. The bacon was perfect! The eggs were perfect! I was impressed! The water however was nasty! I did put a few drops of salt into it so that I could drink it. They do filter maybe but it is not efficient. The potatoes looked good but the chives were mostly for looks. There was not much chive flavor. Will we go back ? Yes but I will take my own water!!

Zew5pa0DI-i4EylHK51qCg.text: This restaurant is not by appointments only. It is a great breakfast/lunch place Mon to Fri & brunch on Sat to Sun.  Yelp changed the listing, being wrong, they changed their times to having it by appointments only. That is inaccurate information, but Yelp won't let this be corrected by the owner & won't correct it without a monthly payment!!

HUyNNTJ2sF8iA0GP2q_lnw.text: I have loved this place for a long time.  Get the deviled eggs...seriously life changing!  Never had anything I didn't enjoy.    Corned beef and hash, BLT, tomato salad, chiliquiles, pancakes, truffle egg sandwich, I can't remember everything I've tried...but seriously I love it all.   Only complaint would be the noise..it gets loud and the space does not absorb noise...it magnifies it!

UaMAPY42XIESurQHmqYQFw.text: A breakfast joint in Downtown Las Vegas.  The decor is pretty hipster.  The bread they give is actually really good and I'm usually not a fan of bread.  The coffee is decent too.  Wait times can be long so come early.  Deviled egg - Above average - 3.5/5 The deviled egg is pretty good.  It's good because they deep fry the soft boiled egg :P.   if you want it, grab it.  Otherwise you can pass on it.  Chicken Fried Steak - $15 - solid 4/5 The chicken fried steak is solid.  Portions are large and comes w/ eggs, potatoes, and bread.  My only gripe was the chicken was kind of soggy due to the gravy.  I'd recommend getting the gravy on the side that way it doesn't compromise the breading on the steak.  TIPS: -Parking sucks.   -Area is kind of ghetto. -No alcohol served

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sourdough bread

k6qiSAGjlAGv5G0DfMN8NA.text: One of the best brunches in town. They have tasty breakfast food, we usually get the strawberry pancakes as an appetizer and then our breakfasts or lunches. I love the hash also the avocado BLT is sooo good.

7fkbWTo8nJ0i0PBIWh4bSg.text: Decent food selection, it's a small menu but they have diverse options. The environment is very warm and friendly, great set-up. It's a small venue so there is normally a wait to eat and can get loud. You tend to wait longer to sit then you do your food and drinks. I was impressed with their coffee selection! Great customer service, the servers are always walking around! It's important to note, they don't have any adult drinks so if you are looking for a day brunch this is not a venue I would recommend.

Pf2CTqQxgVfI34tL5KHHTA.text: A short walk from Fremont Street. Tasty food and good size portions. Didn't give them 5 star because they weren't so quick with the refills. We would return.

aAHTvneoqyUGE2cz1vQR-g.text: Best Pancakes I ever ate!  Crispy on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Pancake Stack

EL_kk8DrJeTJSisAQPwKRg.text: Meh. Nothing wowed me after eating here numerous times. Staff is friendly and good, nice ambience, but the food is just average. The shrimp and grits leave much to be desired. No flavor. Someone in the kitchen needs to be overseeing the food that comes out of the kitchen, and tasting it, making sure it is on point.

LAzCtAlRDHXibiGRLsfcZA.text: Fantastic food! Truffled egg sandwich and banana pancakes were delicious! The pancakes are super thick and come with tasty chicken sausage on top. Only giving four stars because it has terrible AC and we were all sweating while dining inside. If you go try this place, I would go when the weather is cooler!

p4K4hJsosp2vVGpHd0BX7g.text: Love this place! Best breakfast I ever had compared to home. We got seated immediately all stay is friendly and courteous. Service was great they refilled our waters constantly and checked up on us all the time.  The only con I can say is that the food take a long time. But then again it's busy so you can't complain for the food that comes out! It's delicious and worth the wait. I do recommend if you come by. There is parking on the side or if not you can go around the block and pay for parking. I believe it's $2 for 2 hours.

DTqhHg_5MJ_7RM011H2x-Q.text: This place is alright.  But they take forever to go to your table and circle around.  I've seen my server once this whole time.  My coffee was not refilled, but the seat next to me was.  No one really came around to ask how our food was or if we needed anything once the food arrived.  I ordered chicken fried steak and was sorely disappointed.  The gravy was good, steak was bland and super dry.  The pancake was alright.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only thing I liked, but it tasted like something I&#39;ve made from a bisquik container.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good. But bland.  Salt or ketchup is much needed.  Super dry

ZwTZRD2SFEW9ScJQi3NpMg.text: Great food. Great people. I ordered the two egg breakfast with bacon. It came with potatoes and toast. Everything was cooked to perfection.

zslDL59Ml90HUQ18Xvx6Dw.text: Delicious food and quick, friendly service. We had the posole, huevos motulenos and egg truffle sandwich and were left full and happy. The huevos motulenos are like a twist on huevos rancheros -- the bananas added such an interesting flavor to the dish. The coffee was tasty too. Highly recommend.

YbNQjAbcZISujvI4H1Q9OQ.text: Stayed in Downtown Las Vegas for a couple of days and really wanted to start the day out right before heading down to the strip. Checked out the menu and reviews online and definitely pinged my interest. Was not disappointed. Country Fried Steak with potatoes was bursting with flavor from every angle and the serving was huge. Sadly I didn't have time to try out any of the other delicious looking dishes.

TuLL5MMGw-2HKjXEml-7BQ.text: Ordered 2 eggs, bacon and potatoes sourdough toast was thick and yummy - added a side of one pancake. Pancakes are large and tasty. Everything was good. Husband had chicken fried steak which was chewy but gravy was good. Coffee was great. Service to be seated was terrible and once seated was so so.  This was our second time and we would visit again.  Enjoy the ambiance.

xepjIjtUV8kXaKKVyP6gQg.text: Busy place Area was a lil sketchy- im with my young chldren there was a woman with no top on! Also im sure my waitrr was on something, which was typical given the area  Oj tasted funny- not fresh Pancakes were really good.   Due to area- tourist spot. I wont be back

Mbi_3z7g4w3owO55nBsqWw.text: We waited a REALLY long time, mostly because the hostess didn't have two brain cells to rub together. But the food was worth the wait. The cinnamon biscuits with strawberry puree were delicious, and my chicken fried steak was near perfect. Everyone loved it; we'll be back next time we're in Vegas and want to escape the douchebags on the strip.

zHR76n2G_GmzfrNYJ_dtMA.text: Highly recommend the small eatery off the strip. Flavorful, good portion, great service. Breakfast of eggs potatoes and bacon simple but super flavorful. The Rye bread was very unexpected. Fluffy and very good. The biscuits with fresh strawberries was delicious. Not too sweet, this outs were not dense just the right consistency. Very good. Overall I would highly recommend coming to eat at Eat. It's pretty crowded on a Monday late morning so I can imagine the weekends quite a wait. Make sure to get here early they close at three.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Highly recommend the breakfast with the potatoes. Good flavor. Rye bread like I&#39;ve never seen. Very yum.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuit with strawberry compote. Not too sweet and just the right biscuit consistency. Not dense.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice, relaxed vibe.

NISiV_36AEqzJyIvFeXVGQ.text: I'm a breakfast lover and honestly eggs & toast gets boring. Eat. adds a unique spin on breakfast. It has a modern New York cafe vibe with extra class. The huevos motulenos is a must have! Don't let the banana discourage you, I promise it adds the right taste! Natalie the owner is a sweat heart. Make sure you say hi!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The restaurant from where we sat!

tPy_OXas65T_gNezQxEyig.text: eat... except for your limited seating and limited hours - you are 5 stars.   Every daydreamer restaurateurs - wants to be you - except, you were first.   Exactly as you are, exactly as you have set out to be...True, honest, no hipster can deny. Real poached eggs - with liquid centers, better than decent drip coffee, hollandaise not from a packet in sight, crispy, deep and crunchy waffles, good lunch/brunch non-eggy offerings...thank you for your foray to the fringe, to the edge of the streets of revitalization. You - just rock.  More than once, the line...was too long, but more times than often - have just given ourselves over and said...we will just wait it out...to be amused by the back end street life that the the last tip of downtown offers.   Should you be early..grab a seat, if you are late, and want an authentic real meal, one that just feels like there is luv and sweat (not in your food) delivered to the table, as what you would only want for a chef focused plates to be served, just -  don't scoff at the hours or wait (eat owners must have a life - beyond serving YOU!) and enjoy...this is, what it must feel like...to have a real chef in the family that finds the work/balance we all strive to achieve.   Much love, we will figure it out.

6hfMW8ifMrDarMC2hCqJAg.text: When this restaurant was first opened, their sandwiches were really good and the place was always packed.  Past forward to present day. I visited this place recently when I took an out of town vendor to visit this joint because he wanted a good sandwich. Anyway, we went during peak lunch hour and I was nervous about the long wait, but when I got to the joint, we didn't have to wait at all. That should have been a sign.  Anyway, I ordered the BBLT sandwich and he ordered something else. For a place that wasn't that busy, it took a long time for the sandwiches to come out. When I took a few bites, I realized the quality really went down hill from the time it first opened. The other guy wasn't impressed with the sandwich either.   Now here is the main reason why I will never come back to this joint beside the mediocre sandwich. A few days before this visit, I received a new credit card with new numbers on it and I used it only at a few places (markets and gas stations) and the credit card was never out of my sight and hand. By the way, I always checked for skimming devices at the gas stations. The only transaction where the credit card was out of my sight was at this restaurant and I started getting fraudulent charges on this card about two weeks after my visit. Now I'm not and won't directly accuse someone at this restaurant of skimming my credit card numbers, because I don't have any proof. But knowing that this was the only place that my credit card (with new numbers) was taken out of my sight made me nervous of potential credit card theft.

xEhRPUXZKwW-FrKcY7m-MA.text: Brunch -Sunday Morning -no wait-live music and GREAT FOOD !!!  If you stay downtown-Fremont Street it is easy to get to- lots of street parking.. but we had a great walk just about a block or so away from Fremont East  I ordered the PANCAKES-super light and the best part-REAL MAPLE SYRUP.. and not in some mystery container either- your own little jar! Sausage and a couple eggs I added on the side-  Coffee is great-no after taste-very balanced and refilled often!  My other dining companions got- the Grilled cheese w. tomato basil soup-the soup was excellent-little bit of a spicy taste which was great- the bread on the cheese sandwich was super thick but looked very yummy!!  The whole place looked very CLEAN- servers were very friendly up beat and the tables were very comfortable size wise.. not too small and not too big...   I can't wait to go back for Breakfast in Vegas- off the strip-HIP and Good EATS !!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes at eat. -super yummy-could possibly share it but it&#39;s really GOOD !!

CTQhp1-xiPltn6CIznCbcg.text: The food was really good. The service was amazing. Best part? Real coffee. Not that awful instant stuff you find at diners and most breakfast places. They actually use decent beans and free refills. The waitress even gave us to go cups when we were finished. It's the little things that restaurants do that male me happy. That and the adorable wooden cat on one of the light fixtures.

BAg-kFVk596zTHAJw18Qyw.text: Food was good here. Fast/good service. Prices were a little high for portion size on my corn beef hash IMO. Would come back, but not a 5 star first choice.

uzKrvnzh18XprHgRAQ7zBQ.text: Amazing little out of the way gem near Downtown Container Park. After reading the reviews on YELP, we chose this restaurant based on the unique menu items that sounded really yummy. It's about a 10-15 minute walk from Fremont Street. I am going to tell you now, even if it was a one hour walk to get there, the food is worth it. We went about brunch time  and were seated almost immediately by very friendly staff. I chose the corn beef hash, my wife the truffled egg sandwich, and la kat's deviled eggs to share. OMG! The deviled eggs are absolutely scrumptious and worth the visit alone. The portions are huge and either the egg sandwich or corn beef hash could easily feed two for a light meal. I thought the corn beef hash was very good, very fresh tasting but I ended up being envious of my wife's truffled egg sandwich. The tastes and flavors of our food was just amazing. I cannot write any faults for this restaurant as the food was great and the staff was awesome. E.A.T is a must go restaurant and I would highly recommend it. Go visit Container Park afterwards for a fun day out Downtown.

mKsG-It9bkExwS4ya9aBNw.text: Chef Natalie Young and her staff challenge the downtown hater's surmise--that downtown revitalization will fail--with tasty comfort food, great service and a beautiful interior. Praise and love for the Eat Team who transformed the prosaic spot beneath an apartment complex into a great breakfast and lunch joint. Although, parking is limited and you have to pay via meter. So, I just ended up parking for free at the nearby El Cortez.  Think of it as a way to burn those calories post-meal.  Before my friend and I even stepped inside, the hostess opened the door with a smile and a cheery welcome. The place was loud and busy; luckily for us, there was one table available. The decor was tastefully done with some nice touches; for example, I love the "I'll See You in the Flowers" art piece on the wall.  The lunch menu is focused, unintimidating, and conventional: sandwiches, salads, and soups. The free range chicken sandwich with chips was delicious, moist, and slathered in pesto. Just the way I wanted it. The chips were crisp and seasoned well, but unmemorable. I wish they had seasoned fries or a side salad option. To most people, this will sound blasphemous, but one annoyance was the untrimmed fat on the chicken (personal preference). As for my friend, he happily inhaled his DWBLT and gave it two greasy thumbs up. Throughout the meal, our server beatifically refilled our waters and checked-in on us, while juggling his tables. While the food is not groundbreaking, Eat serves up good classics dishes while improving downtown's reputation.

7cEC3eS1XdPdTh27HX_UTQ.text: The corn beef hash, oh the corn beef hash. The cinnamon biscuits make me heart skip. Visited on a Friday with a party of 4. Service was great, young staff very friendly. Serving sizes were nice. Will definitely return. It was worth my 6  minute walk in the inferno of Vegas.

1KSJsEbnhurTUYfR-vsqhQ.text: Really good food, the egg in the Downtown Benedict could be poached a little bit harder, but it's very good in general. The chicken steak is really good, savory is awesome. I love their toasted bread especially, it's very good quality.   The only reason for four star is it takes a while for the server to come.  There is street parking near by.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Benedict

KV4Ha9jCXZcRKyzTKdWziQ.text: Best meal experience I've had in Vegas! Great food & fast, friendly service. I'm so glad we came here after several bad experiences. Thank you, Eat!

2iDSsk445c1seF3gFF-J1w.text: So many choices downtown these days... 3 1/2 stars  We were looking for lunch around 11:30 on a Friday afternoon. We ran into a wait time at a few places, then sought out eat. We had to wait 20 minutes here too. Apparently unavoidable. It was bustling inside and noisy. It's a cute place with an industrial vibe.   The service lacked any sincerity. We got everything we needed but there was no explanation of the menu of suggestions or conversation at all.   The menu had a grilled cheese with tomato soup. I asked to substitute the green chicken chile pozole instead.   She said that would be A-OK for a $1 up charge. She also offered avocado and bacon on my sandwich. Of course! By no means did I expect this to be a free addition; however, it turned out to be a $6 charge which made my grilled cheese and soup somewhere in the neighborhood of $16. Yowsa. It was delightful. The sourdough bread was giant, no less than 1" thick for each slice. It was soaked 3/4 of the way through with butter. The sandwich was crispy, chewy, yummy and decadent. The pozole was spicy, and very flavorful. Loads of veggies and shredded chicken. Very good. I shared it with my little guy and still had leftovers to take home. It was a generous portion.   My compadres enjoyed their arugula salad and chicken sandwich very much. We all drank water. The bill was $45 for 2 sandwiches and a salad. So $18 each for lunch. I guess not bad. Gotta pay the price to hang with the in crowd!   I would certainly return for more delicious food. Many of the brunch menu items sounded intriguing. Expect busy, noisy and delicious!

YsJR_zHwyVMB5emwNPtqeA.text: We were in Vegas to visit my brother and he brought us here. Said it was one of his favorite spots for breakfast. We went at lunch time and had a bit of a wait but there were 6 of us.  The place is small but very cool. The outdoor patio looked like you were sitting in a friend's backyard, very cozy and cute.  Everything on the menu sounded amazing and 4 of us zeroed in the same thing...the killer grilled cheese with kick ass tomato soup. The other 2 in our party ordered regular breakfast of eggs, bacon and home fries - which were delicious, they call them chive potatoes and the huge chunks of potatoes were seasoned perfectly!  Back to the grilled cheese and soup...the sandwich was made on thick sourdough bread with a couple of different gooey cheeses, the tomato soup was good but kind of too garlicky. Overall awesome combo!  Cool place, great food!

P8Uq-QZzpJ87gEr5XMx0ew.text: Really great service and delicious food! My only complaint would be the meals were too big to eat! Not quite a complaint for some!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EReBWEhNjpQjDvphOlZubg.text: Great find off the Strip. Cozy, artsy, hipster-ish. Had the Truffle Egg Sandwich without bacon. Was pretty tasty.

TDYUIyCSVomW_GFrujTHig.text: Thank goodness I don't live in Vegas or I would add more inches to my waistline. Can't get over how many good food choices there are here.  This establishment needs some signage outside. It's barely noticeable. I guess word of mouth is good enough because this place is really delicious. The breakfast menu is simple with just the bare essentials. I loved the truffle egg sandwich. The ciabatta bread was perfect. The huevos motulenos are excellent as well. Service was great!

9P1wwDNa0zMfVjme94jfMw.text: It's really good but brunch should consist of a lot more then their menu offered. If they do that I'd be there at least 2 times a month.

FXUsu1GJ-VOHlc5aaO9_Wg.text: Don't be fooled by the pictures or amount of ratings (I was). Thought this place would be better and worth the long wait (42 minutes when they said 20 minutes). Street parking at $1 for 30 minutes. Overall safety of the area a little bit questionable especially at night.  I feel like we only got seated sooner than 42 minutes because we pretty much complained. We did get a free strawberry biscuit thing, but I am almost sure it had high fructose corn syrup. Was expecting better quality but hey free $8 dish for our wait.  I looked at the menu and also didn't seem to have many healthy choices. Felt like a slight increase in quality than your neighborhood corporation breakfast restaurant. Had a water that was a bit unusual. I had to take a look at it and realize there was lemon in it, but didn't seem to match with my brain (like artificial flavor). I had a BLT sandwich and wife had truffle sandwich. We both thought the dishes were not anything to be worth the hype. A feeling like like I could cook it. Potato chips were good, not out of this world.  Service was awesome though. I just didn't feel like I would ever come back considering popularity and what I'm looking for in quality and value. If you have a big stomach, the portions would work well for one dish. Also, does not seem like a good place for kids (infants I should say - a bit cramped and your wait time will increase).

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MUrxopUupUxo9B-v9_4bHQ.text: First time here to eat but, I've had their fried deviled eggs prior that a friend brought to me. Those things were dang good and yes I said fried! Lol.      So I ended up wanting to try something I haven't had and went with the truffle egg sandwich on a long ciabatta bun. It consists of 2 scrambled eggs (cooked perfectly), bacon, wild mushrooms, feta cheese, green onions and a side of thick crisp country style potatoes. This thing was bigger than I was expecting and those potatoes were cooked far better than I thought they would be being they were so thick. Bravo   although I didn't taste much truffle.       The restaurant was clean with a bit of an industrial/hip vibe. Good service and priced accordingly for that imo. I'm satisfied over all and may return again to try that chicken fried steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich

LXdyCCt_A7_E5Li4g5ldxw.text: Chicken Fried Steak! Get it! I love finding places like this. This spot is very popular with the locals and now I know why. Fresh/delicious food and of course the Las Vegas hospitality. I'm a fan and will be back down when I work downtown again.

G-3ZItXdQOEZh9AaGSOYDA.text: I don't typically like to repeat restaurants when I'm traveling, but my family returned to Eat. for brunch and it was an excellent decision.  Since our last visit, the Downtown Container Park opened which I'm sure is a big draw for the downtown neighborhood.  We readily found street parking out front and were seated relatively quickly.   We ordered the chicken mozzerella sandwich with kick ass tomato soup, the golden brown pancakes, and the two eggs any style.  The foundation of our meal was the two eggs, a standard breakfast every spot should have.  Our scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast, while not memorable, were well prepared.  The other dishes really took center stage.  The golden brown pancakes had this really crazy crust, like they hard seared the pancake on a very hot griddle and the insides were fluffy.  The texture was awesome.  The sweet chicken sausage wasn't my fav but they again did a nice hard sear on the flattop.   From the lunch side of the menu, the chicken mozzerella sandwich had fluffy bread, juicy chicken and textbook perfect tomato soup.    I like that Eat.'s menu changes (it was not the same as when we last visited) and that they mix classic with new and interesting dishes.  Most importantly, everything tastes great.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken mozzarella sandwich, kick ass tomato soup
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden brown pancakes with chicken maple sausage
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wheat toast

OpY_CWo8K0kHxEYyUZXs7A.text: Looking for brunch downtown on a weekday your options are limited. That is what brought me back to Eat after a bad experience 5 years ago.  This visit was better than the last but didn't leave me wowed.    We arrived and were ready to order as we had looked online at the menu.  We wanted chicken fried steak and chilaquiles.  Apparently even though they are under the "All Day Egg's" section of the menu they are not served all day.  We had missed the cut off by a few minutes.  Our server seemed annoyed when we needed a few minutes to decide on something else.  We ended up with deviled eggs, shrimp & grits and corned beef hash.  Food was OK.  Shrimp and grits are my favorite meal but this version doesn't do it for me.  It is also what I had on my first visit which is why I wanted to try something else.  Oh well maybe in another 5 years.    No boozy brunch here.  Not even a mimosa.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1_RoZkpVjQht5JkzG_tNlw.text: Hip restaurant in downtown Las Vegas a few blocks away from Fremont Street.  Great donut shop down the street with interesting flavors. Check it out after!  Street parking is available but I believe most of it is metered parking so be prepared to pay a few bucks.  If you are staying at a nearby hotel that is also fine as well.  During the daytime the walk here isn't too bad.  I've been a few times and it usually starts getting busy after 7:30-8:00 AM on both the weekdays and weekends.    My most recent trip's meal  Corned Beef Hash (4.5/5) - A cut sausage and diced potato hash - I think corned beef is supposed to be more soft? (If I'm wrong please correct me!) I like the poached eggs and the thick cut piece of sourdough that they serve with it.  My preference in corned beef hash is the softer meat but this was extremely delicious as well!  One Golden Brown Pancake (5/5) - AMAZING PANCAKE.  Best pancake I think in Las Vegas although some would argue other places have the best pancake.  It is a thick pancake with the flat sides being slightly crispy.  They serve the maple syrup in a cute little mason jar with a halved strawberry.  Great decor, good food!  Please be prepared to wait 30+ minutes if you come during the busy hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;one golden brown pancake&#34; indeed!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash with two poached eggs and sourdough toast

JNKax-ThC2moyl0S_H2rnQ.text: I was meeting my friend here. I got there earlier yet I was denied a table as my party was incomplete. I should have said I was alone and I could have ordered already and been seated. After ten minutes someone came out and ended up giving me a table. I ordered the deviled eggs. Shortly after my girlfriend finally walked in. She wants to order a mimosa only they don't have that even we picked the because in the yelp search for "mimosas" this place was in the list??... we ended up eating the deviled eggs which were really good and leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

ZGXpO84DSOR_uTqWTldBaA.text: Another Downtown favorite for brunch. Get there early because wow once I left because I waited so long. This was the very first restaurant I went to right after my move to Las Vegas, so I get rather nostalgic when I go to Eat. The memories of starting out in this town, right after some major life changes always gets me a little bit choked up. The food here is the best comfort food imaginable, and always, always GREAT! YUM! Writing this reminds me that I haven't been in a while.

EgLhdzZUNO7clTzRvWfMfA.text: Just a few weeks before my trip to Vegas, I had asked my coworkers what I should do in Vegas. Before answering my questions, they asked me what I want to do and all I said was eat.  My boss had suggested I go to a place called Eat. Lol. Owned by a WOC, he said that the menu was DELICIOUS. I'll be guilty and admit that I didn't do much research, none the less look it up on Yelp. But sure thing, it's got great reviews! Lol Thanks Neal.  Parking was surprisingly easy. There's a bunch of paid parking lots right on the side of the street next to the Container Park. $2.00/hour, card only.  I was warned to go there at about 8:30 a.m. or at least when they open because it gets packed. Luckily on a Monday (Christmas Eve) we were able to get one of the last tables. Everyone was wearing a Christmas sweater and the restaurant, in addition to its hipster finesse, was decked out in Christmas gear. It may not mean a lot to other people, but it meant a lot to me. It just adds to the magic of Christmas!  Anyway, let's get into it. Here's what we ordered: La'Kat's deviled eggs that makes giraffes dance. lol - I remember my boss telling me it was one of his favorites so i decided to get it. It comes in four and is definitely a favorite of mine. I've never had deviled eggs battered, and fried. It was DELICIOUS. The waiter also came with some hot sauce and we spotted some Cholula. BAM. Yum.  Corned Beef Hash - Not your typical canned corned beef hash like some locals from Hawaii are used to. It's cubed with potatoes and onions and topped with poached eggs. Served with sourdough bread, crisp and soft and wonderful. I was picturing something like an eggs benedict but but love that i was able to mix it all together and have the bread dip in the yolk. Oh. Man.  Shrimp & Grits - Grits with two fried eggs, salsa, shrimp and two pieces of sliced bacon. It could've done without the salsa.  We though cheese could have been a better topping. Maybe bits of crispy bacon.  Altogether spent about $50 for two people. Not bad. Definitely one for the hipsters. LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aAUfBuG_d677-XYk_KzB7w.text: When they said killer grilled cheese with tomato soup, they are not kidding. It is the best grilled cheese sandwich I have ever had!!!! Be aware, they use two slices of super thick sourdough so you really have to get your hands in it.   My boyfriend got the chicken fried steak because it was recommended. Wasn't a big fan of it... The creamy gravy on the steak was bland and it got soaked in the steak by the time we took us first bite so it made to chicken a little gross. Not ordering that again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer grilled cheese
