Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak

SsCQTbUtdfBOSHk1uU2K-Q.text: Easily within walking distance of the Downtown Strip, this wonderful little eatery is unique and creative.  The serve a variety of staple breakfast plates while adding their own unique flavor and flair.  We both had Eggs Benedict served up differently.  Both were excellent.   I'd return in a heartbeat

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Benedict

4L_RuqVKBfEglUD9L3dERg.text: Overall, this place is a great place to dine into for breakfast and lunch. I took my family here for Mother's Day.  I ate the corn beef hash and everything was fresh.  The bread was drenched in butter, which is delicious there wasn't any additives that I needed. Additionally, my mom had the Shrimp & Grits. She wasn't too pleased with her order because she felt as if it felt more as a porridge, but overall quality was great.  The ginger drink is absolutely refreshing, you can taste more of the ginger when you're almost finished with it (really opened my sinuses).

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash

Xr_KyTgii64ISsOdFaBXng.text: Come hungry!  The plates are big and the flavor is bigger. I could eat Breakfast here all day any day and all night too if it were open that late! The coffee is roasted and rich with a clean full flavor.   The staff is attentive and polite so no worries there.  EAT happy!!

5-ohDC2n99k6owMKc5VgIA.text: We stopped by here for brunch on our roadtrip to Utah. I was looking for a brunch place that was off the strip so that we didn't have to pay a expensive parking fee/fight traffic and found this place in Old Town Las Vegas. Parking is on the street, remember to pay at the parking machine so you don't get a parking ticket. Parking was only $3.00 for 1.5 hours if I remember correctly.  It was still relatively empty when we came at 11AM, albeit got busy once we finished ordering. I went with their vegan dish of tofu scramble that came with roasted potatoes  and bread on the side. I added in an order of scrambled eggs since I opted out of bread and was afraid I might get hungry fast with the tofu dish. The dish was actually really tasty, I'm always a fan when someone can make a yummy vegan dish without emphasizing how bland tofu can be (don't get my wrong, I love tofu, I eat that sh*t right out of the box LOL). Our waiter was also very friendly and attentive, made sure our water was filled and that we got everything we needed.  They also have a cute patio area, I'd try and sit there the next time I'm here (it was too hot the day we came so we sat inside). Would definitely come again!

YWUmwjbDBsfDJ5GIo5UcMw.text: I was looking for a place to meet friends in Vegas today. I saw EAT in a review and all looked good so this is where I told all 10 of us to meet. When we arrived I was unsure of the place but also thought this might be a little gem and by the reviews I had to try it.  We order pancakes, chicken fried steak, truffled egg sandwich and many other items. All I can say is I am the hero for finding this place.   I, myself ordered the Truffled Breakfast Sandwich, my gosh, this had to be the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had and then it came with unbelievable breakfast potatoes. The tomato soup and sandwich my other half ordered was AMAZING, the pancakes came out and were so fluffy and huge that I don't think anyone finished them at the table.....I only have one complaint and that is after eating all that food we were too lazy to do anything the rest of the day. I can't wait until Sept. when I am back in town as I will be here again. Awesome job you guys on a great place to eat! If your looking for a nice little place away from the strip go to/and EAT!

ReF9deFXDpGGppiKIse2nw.text: The pancakes here are my absolute favorite out of anywhere!! They're sweet without the syrup and they're crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I'm from LA but every time I go to Vegas I make sure to come here for breakfast. They seated us very quickly and the service was great.

5ahqLl_2-YKhk3ArmSgmmw.text: I had a lunch during a fairly bustling Monday, eating the huevos motulanos with an addition of avocado. And wow, was that a great meal. The basics of the dish resemble the common huevos rancheros but with the addition of peas. But there were two sauces, one red and one green, both tasting like they were fresh and homemade. The potatoes accompanying the dish also tasted freshly made. In general it was just a delicious item, and at $20 with tip included, not unreasonably priced (considering the quality). Misc: It took a minute or two for someone to get me seated. No big deal but I wish they'd been a bit more attentive. I grabbed a seat at the counter; not too many tables were available.  This is close to a derelict, half-torn-down building, but I don't think the locality feels particularly shady, unlike some other parts of downtown.

6iksJXEqafFeehAPJeKQ_g.text: Food was fantastic, the service was horrific.  Hostess could not figure out how to handle a party of five with the POS, couldn't adapt, made us wait for over an hour. There were four open tables during this time. Additionally the server was fast to start but didn't check in whatsoever so no coffee refills and no water.   Chefs were on point but service was so bad during a slow time (1:30pm on Sunday) I cant recommend

hQ7EP58M-AVIfB5ZwBU7Pw.text: Well everything was good.  Not one problem. Actually there was a problem .. I ordered a second order of those things that make giraffes dance.. the combination the textures the tastes was down right delish!  The cinnamon biscuits will be made at home now ..because I doubt we will get back this way anytime soon :(  and the rueban....and the blt lawrd have mercy !  Keep up the great work chefs!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mother&#39;s got a big mouth ..but not according to y&#39;all!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The two approved appetizers and a big mouth BLT!

PXUryOzCdUud8Ab_4b262w.text: I just left a place and I spoke to the host about my experience today before I leave.   Food, coffee and most of the staffs - great!!  My server, Rachel, was awful.  Straight up, rude, maybe hates Asians who knows!--I know it's ridiculous to think this way--but I'm not sure why she was such a B towards my sister and I this morning.  It got to the point that we left the place w/o finishing the food because I couldn't handle the vibe.  I was watching her serving 2 tables next to us.  She was relatively nice.  Then why to us?  We were very polite to her and asked a few questions because we didn't know the little jar she delivered with coffee, looked like a small "jam" container btw, was the syrup for our one of the orders--pancakes.  She cut us short and delivered this attitude-- Right. There.  I had to apologize, oh sorry, I didn't know.. A few more episodes, but I guess I don't have to list them all because I'm sure you've got the point.  I paid money this morning to have such nasty experience.  Oh! Btw- our orange juice order was dismissed, and she never apologized to us that she didn't provide that to us.   She didn't check on us; I asked for my check to Christopher who was another server passing by, he was very very nice and gave us our check and a to-go box.   If my whole experience this morning was with Christoper, I might be giving a 5 star review here.  Shame.  However, service is a significant part of up-and-coming restaurant's winning point.  People, all in all, I moved into near by high rise condo last year and pretty much tried ALL the restaurants in DTLV.  Recommend trying this place once unless the server is Rachel.  Me, personally, because of today, I will not return.  We have PublicUS, Vesta and Makers & Finder!!!  Why would I deal w/ BS again?  Neh.... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As a proof that I&#39;m not BS-ing about my experience today.

GnEKLyRBlWJXVLh6eJAIfg.text: We came here after reading about Eat in Sunset magazine. So glad we did!  Hands down, the best pancakes any of us have ever tasted! The eggs benedict with homemade hollindaise sauce was amazing! Patio dining atmosphere rounded out a perfect breakfast.  Thanks to a very friendly staff too!

h_4ZbJ9ENbk9C-EN8reUdg.text: I heard great things about this place, but I thought it was just ok. The shrimp po boy was ok, very messy. My husbands BLT had so much bread it really could have made two sandwiches. I think one of the things that turned me off the most was that our table was shaking alot, and my husband went to stuff a couple of sugar packets under the foot so we could enjoy our meal. Just then Natalie Young, the owner, came over and said "Those cost money!". I really wish she wouldn't have said that. I hope our $40 lunch ticket covers your sugar packet costs Natalie. Probably won't go out of our way to eat here again.

ORS8SvDFTn4XiOijEBUzYg.text: Everything I've ever had at Eat has been delicious. That being said, the pancakes are my very favorite. They aren't fruity candy filled treats.  Instead, they are plain buttermilk serviced with butter and actual maple syrup. Despite having an extreme sweet tooth, these pancakes are THE VERY BEST I've ever had - a little buttery and crisp on the outside (just enough), and fluffy deliciousness on the inside. I realize this review has turned into an ode to pancakes, but they deserve it!   If I'm being at all critical, I must point out that there is almost always a wait to eat at Eat. However, it is run well and you can tell this is usually based upon demand and not poor management.   In sum, I'm a local and enjoy Eat every time I go. Highly recommended!!!   (The grilled cheese with tomato soup is also quite epic - great lunch choice; the veggie chili is hearty and flavorful, both healthy and filling, but probably not for those meat eaters who will likely miss the meat - I loved it, but am a vegi so take that as you will)

N-XJN7QxCD5cQmFJtHfaow.text: I tried this place for the first time, and I was pleasantly surprised by their fun and exciting dishes. I ordered the Huevos Motulenos, which is a traditional Mexican dish from the Yucatan peninsula. The sauces were delicious, as were their avocado (extra), and the potatoes on the side. The bananas were the black sheep of my plate (I expected them to be fried like "platanos fritos", but you only notice they're regular bananas if you're an obnoxious Mexican customer who knows real Mexican food). I am giving a four stars, because I don't know at what point our waiter decided he hated my guts. I loved that he offered to add avocado to my dish, and I love that he gave me some sass on the side too. I'm down for that kind of attitude in a chill vibe like the one you breathe at this place. At the end however, he decided to sigh at my request to split the check. That's the kind of sass I don't need with my brunch. I will come back, because the tomato basil soup my friend ordered was as amazing as my huevos. I think this place is amazing, quaint, and unique. I just hope I don't get more sass for dessert upon my return.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Felt at home with this dish from the Yucatan Peninsula---Huevos Motuleños. An absolute must try at Eat.

2jy0zFOjOwAw79S442fYkw.text: So I like Huevos of many styles but had never heard of Huevos Motulenos so I got those on my first visit to eat. I sat at the bar on a Thursday around 11am with no wait. Listening to the mostly Hispanic staff conversing in Spanish gave me comfort that it'd be good and even though I'm not a huge banana/plantain fan this dish was pretty damn tasty.  The eggs were nice and runny and the potatoes were perfectly cooked being crunchy on the outside and soft inside.  It was a good size and the service was attentive and prompt - a good find downtown that I could easily walk to from my stay at the El Cortez nearby!

VC52UKwo-AGynCJC2ripyw.text: Had breakfast here....granted I did have the basic eggs & bacon so mine was nothing special. My husband has the shrimp & grits which he said were pretty good~Beignets on the menu...sounded wonderful!! OOOOPS! They don't have them any more. THEN TAKE THEM OFF THE MENU!!! I mean your menu is a typed piece of paper~    The location is good IF your in the Fremont area otherwise i would not make a special trip. Our server was enthusiastic however not a very good server~ Said the coffee was great!! No mention of the brand, AND it isn't good either!, I had toast asked for jam.....he did bring about a tea spoon amount????! And did specify it is made in house......again not great and isn't it customary if toast is served would jelly/jam be included???       It just seemed all odd? Granted the staff was all friendly, maybe since we're not regulars that was the difference. Even the chef/owner came out to the floor....no smile, no acknowledgement to any guests...WTF?

mpuhWUgZy-gy1LL7HyXNjg.text: First time here.. It's a really cute brunch spot located downtown. I loved the decor and the overall vibe. The food and coffee was delicious. The service could be a little better but they do get very busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bay-Rw34wK1jDUqwHz9BPQ.text: Came here with a couple of friends on my first trip to the U.S, and boy was I impressed. It's a smallish place, very friendly and seems to be popular with the locals. The staff were welcoming and chatty, the drinks and food delivered very quickly, and they even helped me translate the menu (for me an egg is an egg, I didn't know I could actually choose how it was presented :) )  The food was simply fantastic. The fried chicken in gravy with over easy eggs, and a stack of pancakes to share with my friends.. The presentation was beautiful, the food perfect, and the drinks plentiful.  There was live music playing by Sabriel, a fantastic group I've now followed on Facebook, and was really great atmosphere.  Prices very reasonable, and worth every penny. I'd bring friends here in a heartbeat. I hope to come for brunch again soon

CrDyxQbhva-E4vGTuQ41hw.text: eat. is the kind of restaurant you feel good spending your money inside of.  Far removed from the Food network portraitures and triple digit price points of your typical strip-side steakhouse, tapas bar or italian eatery this down to earth downtown cafe is a refreshing change of pace for the adventurous LV visitor.    The menu offers some familiar treats done right and some not so familiar items for the more daring of palettes.  Firstly, the pancakes were praised by everyone at my table for their perfectly crispy edges.  The beignets were warm and soft, as fresh as any Bourbon street bakery, and served with sweet homemade jam and mascarpone.  My dish, the Huevos Motulenos, was an inspired new take on the classic huevos rancheros, with the addition of banana (a subtle addition mind you) making this one of the more memorable and unique breakfast dishes I've had the pleasure to try.  Natalie, the chef and owner of eat., was in the kitchen for most of our visit cranking away on orders and running the staff but we had the pleasure of catching her taking a much deserved break on the bench out front on our way out.  She was happy to chat with us for a bit and I'm happy to say embrace us with as much warmth and authenticity as her menu exemplifies.    I look forward to any future endeavors Natalie brings to this lonelier Las Vegas neighborhood and hope to return to eat. in the future for more tasty culinary delights.  Thanks again, Natalie!

gLXs83u3zalYQVDUCYC3Rw.text: The homemade bread is over the top.  Best grilled cheese with bacon Ever.  All of us enjoyed our breakfst/lunch so much.  Another must return when in Vegas.

6O_EWODQxO9iVhZOdPfJPQ.text: Best brunch place in DTLV. I tried the Chilaquiles for the first time and fell in love. Very good taste. The hash browns, pancakes and turkey bacon was by far some the of the best I have ever tasted. I am definitely a fan of this place. The decor is very hispter/ modern. I would strongly recommend this places to any one visiting Vegas. Can't wait to return!

snh8ViryiaKcdrEmTBDoMQ.text: Chef Natalie knows how to cook...Chef Natalie knows how to hire a top notch staff...Chef Natalie knows how to run a restuaurant and pleasse the public...Chef Natalie has her act together...EAT is a stunner...Breakfast and lunch done the right way...Reasonable and always packed because it IS a winner...Stop by and discover why EAT is tops on everyone's list...

fRR-xH2OC--wT1V2WsZtyQ.text: What a great place. I had the chicken fried and eggs. It was far better then any I have had before. The service was great. And the best part, the owner/chef sits out front and talks to everyone as if they were family.

hDUYYZZTuQVo0WJlD0gCgA.text: I love eat.!  It's my favorite brunch place in town.  Everything I've had there has been absolutely to die for.  Upon my first visit, I had a waitress recommend the pancake - she said it would change my life.  She was right.  It's a sweet (but not too sweet), fluffy pancake with a nice buttery crisp to the outside.  I'm not sure what they put in it to give it a creamy flavor but omg I wake up thinking about going to get one often.  The potatoes (so yummy), eggs, bacon, toast & everything else I've ordered is always fresh & cooked correctly.  I've also tried their cinnamon biscuits with the berry compote - freaking brilliant.  The waiters/waitresses are always so nice & accommodating.  Do yourself a favor & get yourself over there for breakfast/brunch/lunch soon!

oQTYEuSvx0T40tsFc_tJhw.text: eggs benedict was sour, skip it, not worth it at all comes on wheat and turkey meat  biscuit with strawberry jam was not worth it, skip it jar jam - cheap kind too biscuit was crunchy and dry which was good but they need to get good jam

GP5wBTKYo07UOKg_mfMnBQ.text: This place. Ohmygoodness. Delicious. Hip. It's my favorite place to bring out of town guests for brunch!

VWekXdCi-YpPBa0iVrUFlQ.text: What a great place to eat after a hard night of Vegas!!   We had to wait about 20-30 minutes on a Sunday morning, but hey, that sounds about right.  The diner seemed a bit "hipstery" but I didn't mind too much.  My Cousin and I had the country fried steak and eggs.  I had bacon and he had the apple sausage on the side.  And WOW!!!! This place is seriously delicious. Everything was cooked exactly as ordered, and the service was great  too.    The coffee was a bit on the normal side, but at least it wasn't horrible.  All in all this place deserves a 5 star rating and I will definitely come back if I stay in the area again.

4tVVYZ_2O5Cb-kjgiZzAWA.text: Was really disappointed when I came here the 2nd time. The food was good last time not going to lie. But the manger was just so rude to us that I don't want people to come in with a wrong impression. We called to see if they were open on Memorial Day, as yelp suggest, they said they were. Walked there and said they were closed. When we asked she said tough luck and that they didn't know they were going close. No communication and no remorse. As a server myself, not communicating with your staff is a bad business practice.

qeuuU3L4B5oRJIj-CyR1Fg.text: Came here without reading any reviews. Ordered shrimp and grits and added cheddar cheese. It was delicious. Sat at the counter and received great service from Lesley. Ask for any specials as they have an eggs benedict special on Saturday and Sunday. Would definately return for another visit.

IqnI9fZfTBte98jyvi8kCg.text: EAT your heart out downtown! 5 Stars on my first visit because they are doin it and doin it and doin it well here.  I went on a weekday at 12:30 for lunch. Place was packed and I'm thinking I will never get in. The hostess said the wait time was ten minutes and I still thought yeah right. She is just saying that so I don't leave. NOPE. I was seated in less than ten minutes. Awesome.  Instantly I am greeted with menus and our drink order was taken. As a foodie I had only been studying the menu online for weeks now so now I play the game pretending to read the menu and waiting for my friend to decide. It was hard to decide because truthfully I wanted to try like five things. I settled on the grilled cheese and chips.   GRUB: Grilled Cheese. Cheesy, buttery, crunchy heaven. It's on thick sourdough bread and served with a delicious, intense tomato soup. Dip that shit and find an instant happy place. Suddenly the restaurant didn't seem so noisy. The food was THAT good. My friend also enjoyed her grilled cheese just as much. We also ordered a side of homemade chips which were perfectly seasoned and crisp. Good stuff.   On top of the killer food they also played some of my favorite music: The Killers, Xx, Vampire Weekend and Morrissey. I loved everything about this experience.  The only negatives I could see people having would be that it is very busy and gets VERY loud. It would be the perfect spot to fire or breakup with someone. Parking sucks orangutan taint, too. Mostly metered parking around, but I did find a side street with no meters. I am not use to carrying change around. This isn't LA, fools.  Overall I am in love with EAT. I feel like it was made just for me. I hope it succeeds and attracts more businesses just like it. More reason for all of us to kick it downtown.

HjXIgi0SckkDxlaQCaqROQ.text: Great food and atmosphere. Dining area noisy so not best for conversations. Chicken fried steak and gravy recommended!

B2j8XWNI-udlGSPhNUWA6w.text: This place is an absolute must for breakfast. Prices are reasonable and within walking distance of the Fremont Experience. I ordered the Truffled Egg Sandwich which was savory and satisfying. The staff was friendly and the food came out fairly quickly. Bring your appetite and as this restaurant week be sure to please any palate.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Egg Sandwich with chive potatoes

Y-1zo7xvTT-DQddEd5EEPg.text: Any place that opens up their patio just so I can eat with my dogs gets an automatic 5 stars, but the food and service deliver too.  My sister and I tried eat last summer when we were staying downtown. I remember it being a great breakfast with delicious coffee and friendly, hip servers. I suggested eat to my husband during our most recent Vegas trip. We had our dogs so I called to see if they were allowed on the patio. The person on the phone said the patio was closed due to cold weather, but she could accommodate us.  When  we got there, the hostess directed us the the patio doors and a staff member seated us. It was a little chilly, but the wonderful coffee kept us warm while our small dogs snuggled in our laps.  My husband tried the same dish that my sister had loved on my last visit, the shrimp and grits. He loved it too. I tried the huevos montulenos. Previously, I had the eggs bene with avocado subbed for the meat. The hollandaise was excellent, but I wanted to try something new. I really liked the dish except the sweet bananas were a little weird. If they replaced them with plantains, the dish would be a knockout.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the dog friendly patio

jKYwPBKiDKayU0Foj2zz4A.text: The place is good. No free parking for the customers. You have to park at metered parking. Unique twist to breakfast and brunch. Good serving size of great food. I ordered pancakes with chicken sausage. The service was alright....The host could been friendlier. Overall, it's a nice place to experience different breakfast atmosphere..

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DAd9QSalqV42tDxw6Em-Yg.text: Super hipster breakfast/ brunch place. It's very cute and lots of great photo ops. I liked that they had picnic tables outside.   I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup which was okay. The portion was gigantic, but for taste I would give it a 2.5/5 because the grilled cheese was very oily and greasy and the tomato soup was sour. I added some cream to it and it was a whole lot better.   During my experience there, the service was not the best. The waiters/ waitresses seemed inexperienced and were not communicating well with us. When we came in to get seated, the hostess led us half way and we were confused on which table to sit at until I asked her and she was like, "Oh, yeah. This is your table." Then the waiter came  and I asked for water and he just put up 2 fingers instead of asking if I wanted two waters for my mom. Throughout our meal, he had the attitude of "I'm so done with working." Later he went to the other waiters to talk and mingle and completely forgot about us but one of the younger waiters came to us and got us our check and to go boxes (only nice thing about our experienced).   Not sure if I would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

LmXxX4AhGsACit54-578rA.text: This place was not great..at all. I was SO excited to try this place and I am walking away dissatisfied. If you come here on a weekend you will be waiting at least 30 minutes and this place is totally not worth the wait at all. I got the strawberry cinnamon biscuits and the shrimp and grits. The cinnamon biscuits were cold and dry. The shrimp and grits was bland, did not all any seasoning at all. On top of the bland food, some of the staff was rude. Like other reviewers said, you are better off going to Denny's.

nNK1jIF3xCPqs4z_vKV-jw.text: Wait wasn't bad at all.  Eggs Benedict was on special and was delicious!  Would definitely go again if downtown

V_ZA5tFbZhj2K6UiyyB3QA.text: My wife, who loves breakfast, tasked me to find a new place for us when we last visited Vegas. This place had been in our bookmarks for some time and we decided to finally try it. It was good but not great. Some of the food was interesting and different, but overall it lacked flavor and seasoning.  We had the shrimp and grits: bland. The shrimp were way over cooked and tough. The grits were soupy and not much flavor. The bacon was a limp Mess and it was on the bottom of the plate and would have been better chopped up on top IMO.   The egg and black bean tostada: just ok. Would not order it again. Large portion for sure, but bland. A bit soupy.   The side of smoked bacon was very good. Thick but and not too crisp.   The English muffin was nice, but a bit bland. It was made from scratch which was nice. It just needed some more salt in the dough.   The country fried steak: really wanted this to be good but the meat was just too tough. It needs to be tenderized more and maybe a tad thinner. It had a great crisp breading, but just was like shoe leather in the mouth. Too bad.   What looked really good was the scratch made biscuits with strawberry compote. We wish we had tried this.   The coffee was OUTSTANDING. No bitterness and just so good.   Service was 5/5. Food was 3.5/5 for an overall score of 4/5. We probably won't be back as there are so many other places to try in Vegas. We would come back just for the coffee though. :)

XiNa_RQ1oAc4mDTzzpMkug.text: Since my first visit to eat. I was dying to come back. I love everything about this little breakfast and lunch spot in Downtown Las Vegas. Customer service was just as good the second time around. I had to have the pancakes again and luckily, they serve pancakes all day now instead of just for breakfast because I went a little later in the day. They had this tasty new thing on the menu-deep fried deviled eggs!   It's great to see the new Container Park across the street because there wasn't much of a view the last time I was in town. This will always be my go-to breakfast spot in Vegas. They're always busy but the wait's usually not long to get seated and for the food to come out. Customer service is great and the food is even greater.

zi0cjV9xWfbXytoVR_sf7g.text: This wasn't my first choice( the place we went had no A/C or ice), but it did the trick.  My wife is picky mrs. mcpickerson so we stuck to the classic American breakfast( done very well) with 1 pancake( 4.00).  My wife said it was the best pancake she's ever had.  I felt like it was really thick and dense( I like thinner and fluffier).  On the bright side, I only ate 1/4  the pancake before I was full.

UVQqba7u7Rm2t1aOLI1bKQ.text: Mixed feelings about this place. The wait is monstrous (even for a solo diner, due to rude fools hanging out at the bar when they're done) and they "don't do takeout when they're busy" so I couldn't just give them my money and leave. Food was good, but seemed like it wasn't their best effort.  Host was friendly and polite, despite being frazzled due to the crowd- a 10 minute estimate for my seat somehow turned into 40+ which was more time than I spent ordering, waiting for my food, eating, paying, and visiting another store, but I digress- with business this busy, they must be good, right?  Torn between the shrimp and grits or the truffled egg sando, I opted for the former and was only half-satisfied with my order, but by the time I got my food I was too hungry to complain. Grits were okay, bacon was crispy and added both flavor and texture, eggs were cooked perfectly, but shrimp were small and overcooked- should have been blackened, not precooked and tossed on like an afterthought. They lacked flavor and the pico was the most stand-out element of the dish, and there wasn't much of it.  I'm not generally a fan of community tables, though they're not much different than sitting at the bar- but I did make friends with the super-sweet couple who dined beside me. They ordered the egg sando and insisted I get it on my next visit. I'll eventually get around to coming back but it sure as hell won't be on a weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TP6GH90lrB3kGHvwSmItrA.text: This place is the bomb.com this was my first time visiting and I loved the food and the customer service. Our foor arrived quick

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first time visiting vegas and I came to this place to eat and the food was magicly delicious

FSdnR4wQzkNeSOAuewRIFA.text: Good food the waffles and pancakes were really good also had the shrimp and grits I needs a little  salt

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OsSJkacjYbHOngNIZ_Z7yg.text: We stopped here for brunch before getting back on our road trip. The pancakes are fluffy and yummy! The potatoes are crispy and delicious. I had to try the fried deviled eggs based on other reviews. They did not disappoint! I would definitely eat here again next time I'm in Vegas...

KPfAHuM8JUYOPoJUSexazQ.text: For starters when we sat in the waiting area there were two dead cockroaches flipped upside down in the middle of the floor. I wanted so badly to take a picture but realized how awkward that would be. Service wasn't good at all. Not attentive, friendly, or nice. I ordered an Arnold Palmer and I was given lemonade. I see things like this as a simple mistake so I kindly asked for tea since I ordered half and half. The server (we actually had three people just rotating the whole time) told me that there was probably tea in it, and I just can't tell because the tea is very subtle. I continued to tell her it was just lemonade but she said "yeah it's just the tea isn't really prominent" ... Then when another lady came to refill my drink, she topped it off with the house tea that I asked for. Seeing as how I barely touched my drink... It was weird to me that the tea instantly made my drink darker and the taste was definitely prominent. But I guess that was too hard for the first lady. Our food came out within fifteen minutes which really surprised me because there were quite a few others there as well. No complaints with my eggs benedict, just thought it was a little pricey. The chicken fried steak was cold and soggy. Almost like it had been pre cooked and re heated. I could tell the flavor was there but overall it just wasn't appetizing because it didn't taste or feel fresh at all. We had no one check on our table to see how the food was. But of course they didn't hesitate to drop the check at the table and walk away. Overall I'm very surprised and disappointed. I saw all the awesome reviews and also recognized it is Zagat rated which inclined me to go here. But after paying so much for lack luster food and terrible customer service... I'll pass on returning.

7j0AouGdCbd3Y-kBTo74jg.text: Food was amazing  I could eat there right now!! You must try the deviled eggs  all I could say is yesssss!! Can never have another deviled egg anywhere else by far they are

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XgC4cEYvqFDZ3k7Cqb049w.text: Wow! If you find yourself in Old Town Vegas and are looking for a place to nosh, then look no further. Eat was such a wonderful experience. From the kind staff to the delicious "kick ass" tomato soup, you surely won't be disappointed with your experience. I highly recommend you order the cinnamon biscuits and a cup of their coffee.

1nXUCiKzeHK5UrpdREFgDQ.text: This place has a friendly atmosphere! We were seated immediately (granted it's on a Tuesday afternoon). The server was pleasant and attentive. Now about the food- they are amazingly yummy! My husband ordered the Killer Grilled Cheese sandwich and tomato soup. I ordered the Po Boy sandwich and tomato soup, and my daughter ordered the corned beef hash with poach egg. On top of it being delicious, their portions were also very generous. We are definitely going back to this place!

SwaFr1Ufhc3fBrtCdFJxgg.text: The service is fast and friendly. I recommend the cinnamon biscuits and the corned beef hash. The sandwiches are awesome. Stop in and support a former Colorado chef.

N7By6VEaTWRl6ntaDwI6pg.text: Stopped in here for brunch and it was amazing! Started with the cinnamon biscuits covered in strawberry compote. I had to order it because I had never seen it on any menu before and it didn't disappoint. It was as delicious as it sounds. I also had the truffled egg sandwich. Of course it was amazing because it had truffle oil, but I was pleasantly surprised that the sandwich was the size of a sub sandwich. Everything was yummy and I can't wait to go back and try some other things on the menu!

_1JH7OXsMZq99W9SL0vQdQ.text: wow!!! just wow!! this place is great and the ambiance is so cute. we went here on the way to the spartan race, and we weren't disappointed.   the pancakes were big, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. and with two toddlers (12 month & 20 month) with us, they liked the food too. the corn beef hash was delicious.   too bad we couldn't enjoy it as much as we'd hope, had to eat & go (time crunch), but will definitely revisit again when we're back.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the golden pancakes with chicken apple sausage

Qal4K4D2n9mR32sls523NA.text: I had lunch with my mom and grandma today because it's less than a mile from my office! I walked into Eat with a 5 star mindset. Unfortunately, I didn't get a 5 star experience.   Eat is decorated beautifully. It is rustic and urban and modern and east coast meets west coast all at the same time. Brick walls and simple art and a few rustic wooden tables and I'm in love. One star for ambiance/decor.   We sat down and our waiter came by to take our drink order. He wasn't very nice and had this look on his face like "I can't wait to walk away from this table and I couldn't be less interested in what you want to drink." The drink prices are a little ridiculous. Grandma ordered tea: $4 for a cup? And $3 for a soda? Hmmm...  Also, they DO NOT have bottled water. I don't understand this. My mom tried to order bottled water and the rude waiter just said "we don't have that." I asked if their water was at least filtered and he said "well, it's not tap water but it comes from a fountain." ::blankstare:: What does that even mean? We ordered a glass anyway and it definitely tasted like Vegas tap water. Mom ordered coffee instead and believe it or not, the coffee tasted stale.   I ordered the DWBLT. It was DELICIOUS. I'd give 5 stars just for this sandwich if it weren't for the shitty service and awkwardly unhappy waiter. It came with lettuce, tomato, bacon, avocado and chipotle mayo on toasted sourdough (but it actually tasted more like lightly fried bread?). The flavors were amazing and the bread was soft, but crispy. Also, the bacon was out-of-this-world good. The sandwich was oozing with freshness and definitely one of the best BLTs I've ever had! It came with homemade potato chips which were pretty good too.   My grandma had the chicken caesar salad. She seemed to enjoy it. Mom ordered the chicken sandwich and she loved it. She got potato salad with her sandwich. I took a bite and it was pretty good - not as good as the DWBLT though!   Before we were even finished eating and before our table was cleared, a waiter who wasn't ours walked by and placed our check on the table. I REALLY hate when this happens. I didn't ask for the check yet and it makes me feel rushed. And, how do you know I didn't want to order something else?   I'm not usually this critical, but this restaurant has a lot of potential. It's already popular and the food is wonderful - that's the hard part! The easy part is good customer service... and Eat is severely lacking in that department.   I'll give it another shot , though!

-yxCpDwBnxzDufAUL-039Q.text: Early Saturday morning breakfast and wanted to finally try Eats since we were already downtown for an event. We won a gift certificate from a silent auction that was a Zapoo fundraiser, but sadly we couldn't find it...which would have been nice to offset the cost.  The location is horrible--on a corner in front of an old apartment building that makes it seem like the restaurant is the motel cafe. Parking, like anywhere downtown is a big pain with the unpredictable parking meter machines.  Looking around the dining room, we could tell it was filled with a lot of Zappos Hshieep. It is a typical hipster type of establishment where concept is good but execution lacks. The menu is presented on a clipboard and features breakfast and lunch items.  I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak with 2 eggs, country gravy, Chive potatoes and toast. I opted for over easy eggs and sourdough toast. The best part of the meal was the sourdough toast...thick slices toasted perfectly. The chicken fried steak was bland and the meat was NOT good. I know cubed steak which is typically used for chicken fried steaks, is the ornery brother of meat cuts which must be tenderized/beaten into submission to properly achieve a chewable consistency. This was not. The meat under the flavorless breading was like an old shoe. The gravy was scarce and made the shoe meat too soggy (note: always get the gravy on the side), the potatoes were also flavorless and boring. The eggs were cooked right. I would not get this dish again nor recommend it. My wife ordered the 2 eggs any style with bacon, toast and chive potatoes. It was ok, nothing special and not really worth $11. Most of the menu items seemed overpriced.  Service was friendly enough but one of my pet peeves is when a server sees that most of my meal is uneaten, yet doesn't acknowledge that perhaps the meal wasn't to my satisfaction and at least offers an alternative, then goes about like a robot (Hshieep) to bring the check, box the meal etc. No thank you Eat, there too many other better places to eat. Next!

RTsza1KtjYL3xAoJWIElfg.text: Friendly staff, fun music, spacious table density, pleasant wall art.  Pancakes were huge, ask for extra syrup though.  Chicken fried steak was a bit tough and bland.  3$ soda seemed steep.  Service was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious golden brown pancakes and Apple sausage
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs

eA9IqsWZiDOd9fX6BwgBew.text: Love this little restaurant !  Started with strawberry/cinnamon busquits.  So yummy with compote strawberry on top.  I had amazing scrambled eggs, like what did they so to make it taste so good!  Then a pancake that was the best I ever ate.   Moist and fluffy on inside crispy on outside.  I forgot to mention the coffee is outstanding .  Service was great.  Cool local feel.  Would go back for sure.

AJKuGpFYQD6lvAgPuETknQ.text: Decided to try eat for brunch on a Saturday. We had a group of 7 and the wait wasn't too bad. Food was okay, nothing spectacular. Service was good.

TVB7EhItMtq4dSf3OZYpzA.text: What a great place to eat in downtown Vegas.  We decided to avoid having the breakfast buffet at our hotel and decided to put Yelp to the test and found this little gem.  Mind you it's in an area of downtown that is going through revitalization so do not let that stop you from eating here.  Staff was pleasant, food yummy BUT the portions are deceiving so SHARE! We got crazy and ordered the beignets (Smear them with the yummy mascaprone they serve on the side) and breakfast plates for each of us. UGH , too much and I was so glad that we were walking back to the hotel.

17I6rsHqzUupYfx_3zdASw.text: I was extremely eager to try this place out after seeing so many good reviews and comments. I tried to make it to breakfast but did not. I took my mom and siblings around 1pm. The choices are minimal which is nice. The set up if the restaurant is very hip and modern, if it wasn't for the windows you wouldn't know you were in the 'hood. I

XRJftezBXCbzO1AUnTL8OA.text: This is a great lunch spot for those who work downtown.  The service was quick and friendly and the food was average priced.  I got a grilled chicken salad.  It was delicious.  I just updated my review and changed it from four stars to two stars after eating there again.  I think this place is over-hyped.  My chicken ceasar salad was eh.  It tasted very fishy and the rubbery chicken skin flaked off into the salad.  I paid $14 for a salad and an iced tea.

CJYtpqunlKFm1rf8hsOC2Q.text: Best Breakfast Ever in Las Vegas! Cinnamon Bisquits with berries and huevos motulenos! Yummy coffee. Fast service. Pleasant staff and kind manager!

Ullq8BvetDVGrgSDj37rug.text: We woke up this morning feeling like a celebratory breakfast was in order, considering the positive outcome of the Presidential election last night! It seemed like the perfect time to try eat, downtown's newest chef-driven hotspot. I'm happy to say that chef Natalie Young's restaurant fully met my expectations, and the waitstaff seemed slightly more friendly than anticipated. I noticed mixed reviews of the service, but I'm guessing that Romney's loss put everyone in a good mood!  Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young was playing when we arrived, and Tony Hsieh was dining at a table in the front corner of the restaurant that I will assume is reserved for him. The soundtrack continued with the 60s/70s folk theme, which suited me just fine! Choosing between the creative egg dishes and scrambled tofu on the breakfast menu was tough, but I was most interested in the truffled egg sandwich. Served on a buttery croissant (presumably from Chocolate & Spice, like the other pastries served at eat), the sandwich featured a flavorful melted cheese, perfectly scrambled eggs, sauteed wild mushrooms, and a side of tasty breakfast potatoes. I won't be surprised when I see one of those Food Network "stars" describing this dish as The Best Thing They Ever Ate, as it is certainly worthy of the praise. My request to leave the bacon off the sandwich was granted without attitude. The wild mushroom mix likely included some pesky shiitakes, but they were tastefully prepared.  I love the feel of this restaurant and can't wait to return to sample the huevos motulenos and explore the lunch menu. My only complaint would be the difficulty of obtaining a coffee refill, but I'm not inclined to subtract a star for that.

gqfL1b0CmkAA-2hmtu_Rlg.text: Very chill vibe (a little on the hipster side of the spectrum). If you have a big party get there early, it's a very popular spot. My favorite dishes are the Shrimp and Grits and the Berry Biscuits. If you are a visitor I recommend an Uber to this spot for brunch; waaaay cheaper than the strip and much better quality.

0avA0pDeXO7_RM3-pMGujg.text: Fantastic place for breakfast! The Huevo Motelenos were warm and filled the palate with Mexican flavored and spices with just enough heat. The shrimp and grits was phenomenal!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (Clockwise from top left): Huevos Motelenos, shrimp and grits, coffee for brunch.

7t8QQumksgoeRodf_fU94w.text: I've heard really great things about this place and finally had the chance to make it downtown and try it. It was definitely worth the drive and wait. I had the two eggs any way and one pancake, the pancake was just like I like it kind of crispy on the outside but nice and fluffy on the inside. Will be back to try their sandwiches, everyone around us had them and they looked delicious! Is a bit noisy in there though, I felt like I had to yell to my friend across the table, only reason I'm not giving them a 5.

aW3iCj_kqIL1q0gA6WKMMA.text: Good food. Good menu. Friendly helpful staff.   The chicken pot pie with a fried egg on top was good. Better than average coffee. Clean place. Neighborhood seems a little rough if you're an old lady. But thats cool.   It's very loud inside. So loud u can't hear the people sitting across from you. They need to add some soft surfaces to soak up some noise. Cement floors, ceilings, walls. Noise just bounces all over.   Small complaint tho for a very good ,friendly restaurant.  Burt  recommends it .

v5CCrhwQqWkmqHUlylE_Hg.text: I was surprised by the small menu but was happy with our food once we got it. The eggs benedict was very good, with the combo of crunchy toasted English muffin, spinach, tomato and hollandaise sauce. Our waitress gave us fair warning about the smaller portion of this dish so no shocker there.  Free range chicken sandwich was also very yummy. Service was fast and staff was super friendly.

K_CE_1KvsWhGFmD90bPmRQ.text: I've never had better pancakes, and I didn't even order the pancakes.  I ordered the eggs benedict, and though filling, I wish there were more. It was delicious. Melt in your mouth, perfect proportion sauce to food ratio delicious.   My friend shared with me the most delectable, delightful, fluffy but not too fluffy pancakes EVER. I thought I didn't like pancakes. Apparently other establishments have just served mediocrity.   I can't wait to go back to try other foods! I wish it was open longer--waking up to trek downtown on Saturday or Sunday morning is not my forte, but it will definitely be worth it to make it happen. Also, super dope bonus points for it being woman of color owned! Yayyuhhh.

wxCZJYYWiO6kdeYtlwj06A.text: We were curious to see what this place was like. I'd read about it online and my spouse had seen something about Bourdain having been here. We are almost always looking for breakfasty brunchy things around 11am-1pm and especially when in Las Vegas. We called on a Monday and no one answered. Tuesday we just happened to be in the area on our way to some fair, single deck blackjack at the El Cortez and there it was... eat! Not sure how my spouse got the curse, but everywhere she goes she/we get seated immediately next to the restroom door, service station or whatever worst table they have. No different here. They seated us next to some rolling trays of syrup in little jars right where the servers buzz by on their way out of the kitchen. We've stopped asking why. This time we just accepted it. One of my favorite all time dishes is Shrimp and Grits so that jumped out at me from the menu. Of course, it's a breakfast version with bacon slices, over easy eggs and sauce right on top. It was very tasty and I can honestly say I've never had bacon and shrimp in my mouth at the same time. That was a little different. Visually this dish wasn't that appealing, but considering the consistency of grits... The grits were a bit saucy and considering the fact that they were supporting so much, it might make sense to cook them up a little firmer.in this dish. It got very messy once a yoke was cut open with my fork, but hey, I ate every bite! Probably didn't need to but it felt like toast was needed so I ordered a side of wheat. The slices are very thick and not toasted but grilled. Spouse didn't eat hers. She got the corned beef has breakfast. Said it was delicious! Overall the place a a trendy, young professional hang out with lots of young techie types eating together, talking business and checking their devices. The staff was accommodating although they were a bit rushed and didn't have time to understand that the spouse wanted nothing on her grits because she like butter and sugar on them - ugh! - so they brought hers with chives on top even though all she asked for was extra butter. It's not one of those "best biscuits & gravy" type of breakfast/lunch places. They are the same everywhere. This is definitely a more upscale type of establishment and given the opportunity to eat here again, I would!

L65khcXo3E_ro0ap_nw1Lg.text: We walked over from the Golden Nugget, it was 1/2 mile away.Nice walk down a dilapidated part of Vegas. But once we reached EAT it was all worth it. I had some tasty breakfast.   1.)**Huevos Motulenos Two eggs over easy with red and green chili, black beans, peas, feta and sauteed bananas on corn tortilla  2.)Made-to-Order Beignets Seasonal jam and vanilla-scented mascarpone 3.)Chicken Fried Steak Two eggs (any style), country gravy, smashed potatoes and toast 4.)Golden-Brown Pancakes Chicken-apple sausage and pure maple syrup  All the guys seemed happy and full when we left. I like EAT and will be back next time I visit Vegas.

FTk-vFXCmRBNuxKSr06OEw.text: An oasis of great taste in a sea of ordinary food.  Foodies - you can call this place home.

uc_ZTr3IXrJ6XvnQOJQzcQ.text: Great atmosphere with good service...very cozy area for small groups to hang and enjoy good food.

fZAiP6xol90MkVpSSW4Wqw.text: Place sucks.  Overly pretentious B.S.  Not worth the wait. Not worth the attitude.   Place is dead for good reason. Wait staff at the bar and empty tables.  Food was mediocre at best, at worst it was half a head of lettuce and some bacon they called a "salad"  there are better places in Vegas don't waste your time.

B2YAQs08uzwVPHEWfZr6BQ.text: Pretty Good! Nice sized portions. I enjoyed the green chili  posole; has a good  kick to it. Sandwiches will fill you up.

5tdkpRBgmZ1nSq13qFzu7A.text: I rarely give 5-star ratings, but this place is definitely an exception.  Came here this morning for a working breakfast with my department's management team.  This restaurant is a hidden gem!  Service was very attentive.  Our orders were taken quickly and before we knew it, our food arrived hot and fresh from the kitchen.  I had the Chicken Fried Steak.  Delish!  The chef/owner came into the restaurant while we were there.  I really wanted to shake her hand and give her props, but by the time we left, I couldn't find her.  The only criticism I can give is that there is no parking lot, but there is lots of street parking nearby.  Don't let that scare you into not trying this amazing place!

PoxrajE-jgVM6zCHcWa2GA.text: Sorry, no pictures from me here... because I forgot to save my snapchat pictures.  I am so sad that I cannot visually recapture my moment at eat.  but at least I have my vivid mental memory of this great brunch eat.tery & the pictures from yelp.  Came here on a Saturday around 11 @ the wait was about 40 mins but it was worth it.  Must get:  Coffee!!!!! Ginger drink!!!!! DEEP FRIED deviled eggs. ---- super must (I swear you not, this was the best thing I've eatten in my life).  Truly was worth the calories. Eggs Benedict (Off the menu) pretty good, but not the best  again... please please please get the deviled eggs. ( View all the pictures of the deviled eggs)

va9Vb1UmSkXxuoZBKVIbvw.text: The food was amazing and excellent! It was a simple breakfast and brunch joint that gave the best food! My friends and I were all satisfied.

67p2dHbQeXmki2x3jN_yEA.text: I like Eat. I like the fact that it's modern, hip, urban, and located downtown. Charm, character, and frankly, they need more places like these downtown. Just across the street from Container Park and down the street from LVA (geez, where were all these places when I was a student?!).   PARKING: There's metered parking galore for around $2 an hour during the daytime around here and DO NOT think you can get away without being fined.   PROTIP: Get a player's card at El Cortez (free; takes two minutes) and you get to park for FREE at either of the manned parking garages (located at 7th and Ogden). Even when they charge $10 parking on Fridays/Saturday nights now, it's free if you flash your card. If you suck at parallel parking like I do even for the after-6pm free street parking, then park in the garages (you don't have to worry about walking too far to get to Container Park or the Fremont East bars).   AMBIANCE: Eat. is a cute breakfast/lunch place. They're only open 8AM-3PM on weekdays and close an hour earlier on weekends. I like the decor and there's a ton of seating here for 2-4 people tables. Great use of space without feeling too cramped. There's a nice breakfast bar area near the cashier but I feel like it's a secret "oh-god-please-don't-pick-to-sit-here-because-you'll-just-stare-at-us"-type thing. Luckily there's another high table bar in the center that you can sit at.   Hip, casual atmosphere. Fun place to meet with friends or a semi-loud business lunch.  FOOD: I ordered the chicken sausage, and the Chicken Pot Pie (they offer it every monday) Every other day than monday, they offer a special off-menu item so be sure to ask!   I thought it was kind of funny listing "free-range chicken" at every mention in the menu. I wanted to ask my server for a profile of my slaughtered hen right there. You know, just to make sure it was a happy free-range chicken when it was living.   Chicken pot pie ($14ish?) was good. Nicely seasoned with the right amount of mashed potatoes, gravy (dear god the gravy), carrots, slices of moist chicken, and peas inside. The pastry encasing it was fluffy, golden, and wasn't too hard biting into it. Comes with a small side salad of mixed greens and sliced carrots. Presentation was nice! Does it blow me away for what it is flavor-wise? Nope. Delicious, yes. Very well-thought out, but not wowing. Portion was decent, but not really worth the price tag.   My chicken sausage ($5ish) side dish was okay. A bit tough, but the flavor was decent. Honey-soaked flavor. Tasted fine but not really worth the price for portion honestly.   Service was good. Checked back on us often and our server recommended the pot pie to me.   VERDICT: Overall, Eat is a few unique steps up from your average brunch place. Presentation of the food is gorgeous and the flavors are good/okay, but the price tag? Ouch. Maybe it's quality of the ingredients that justifies it. The food isn't mediocre by any means, but it's not something stunning as I'm led to believe. It's a great place to reenact scenes from Portlandia. I would definitely come back for lunch with the girlfriends. I like Eat a lot, but I'm not drinking the kool-aid just yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sausage side order ($5.50). Good but not worth that price.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie off-menu offered on mondays! Comes with a small salad. $13-$14...

CxsUJfwY-V5z2aGR54eFtQ.text: In town for work for 1 day. My client suggested it for lunch, but we had too many for lunch rush.  I went for breakfast the next day by myself and sat at the bar. Food: very tasty - just had eggs and bacon. All perfect, as was rye toast and potatoes Service: Fantastic - they work as a team to check in. Very friendly. Room - cool art. Good mood. Noisy, but not too bad  Basically, it started my day out in great way. I would come back for sure.

MvMgYdNrtgegfci9xfBWkA.text: The food was pretty good, the bacon delicious. The orange juice was freshly squeezed, too bad this year's oranges weren't any good. Great coffee, toast is 1/2" thick.  The service was friendly and prompt.  The pancakes were HUGE, well done and tasted like funnel cake (I love funnel cake). A bit salty on the potatoes and I like my bacon a bit more crispy.  Next time I will ask to be seated on the orange chairs. The wooden ones with green fabric have NO padding or support. You have to crawl out of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10&#34; x 1/2&#34; pancakes, make sure you spread maple syrup as you eat or they will suck it all up.

DzT0MMAfsSWDIHu1GZPCOQ.text: Delicious food & great service!! Keep it up Allie, Scott, & Robert & of course the people in the kitchen putting all the flavors together for happy tastebuds & tummys!!   Great big portions, big taste and quality food, just go and taste for yourself!!! You'll thank me later ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg Sammy, added asparagus to it &amp; short stack of pancakes! Yummmm
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. deviled eggs!! So yum!

7bm1jZ0Dd0Q3QWU0NuzMoA.text: Hidden gem. Highly recommended and would recommend the roast beef or the shrimp po boy!

sL4w_K9-Dx8XMPm-FTmyGA.text: First 2 times we went were very good. After going to PublicUs this place just wasn't the same. Service just not as good. The biscuits w strawberry's was drowning in sauce which took away from biscuit. Oatmeal was good but not great. The egg sandwich was highlight with a great truffle flavor in mushroom. Hard to get refill of coffee or water. Not sure about return.

VBXK-z7aL6-lQczWwd5eiw.text: Love this restaurant! Fast, friendly and food is consistently delicious! Chef Natalie you are the best and so happy for your 3 restaurants in Vegas!

qhDN3tQetVPsY_ri9_IZLw.text: We decided to eat here while in Vegas since we wanted something off strip that was fabulous - the yelp reviews led us here and boy were we thrilled! We ended up sitting at the bar, which we really love cause we can see everything going on in the kitchen. We had the deviled eggs to start which were OMG FAB and i honestly can't remember the 2 main course breakfasts we ate but it and the COFFEE was amazing. We loved everything we at - the food lived up to the yelp reviews. We loved coming here for breakfast and we'll be back :)

cGqSQRCwe9uUCbuvA72DYw.text: This place has some of the best breakfast food I have tasted here in Vegas.  I have come here plenty of times, and it is always consistent. Even down to a lot of the photos that are posted here on Yelp, that is how the food always looks when I order it or I see it pass by my table.   I regularly get the pancakes. They are always crispy on the outside and on the edges while being soft and fluffy on the inside. The size is always generous with it filling up most of the plate it comes on. Instead of maple syrup, I normally ask for a side of their homemade strawberry compote to go along with it. I don't normally eat pancakes that way, even if I am at home, but it ends up being a good addition to a already good pancake. Also, while the chive potatoes are good on their own, I would suggest ordering a side of their gravy used for the country fried steak, and pouring some of it over your potatoes. You will not regret it.  Come early since you might end up waiting a bit, especially on the weekends and especially on Sunday, but when you do, get ready for a treat in the downtown area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs, bacon, and potatoes with a side of gravy on top.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short stack with a side of strawberry compote.

83jqWa2nYn_UUXejg24LTg.text: Eat.  Ate.    The two words you'll see on the door walking in hangry, and walking out full.  Very clever if you ask me.  I ordered their chicken fried steak.  This plate was huge.  The CFS was smothered in gravy sauce, came with two eggs (any way you want it), potatoes and butter toasted bread.  The customer service here was really great.  Everyone was friendly, and walked around with a smile.  Very very local spot located down the street from the Fremont Experience.    TIP - they're very strict about not serving the chicken fried steak after 11am.  If you try ordering it at 11:01am, you're shit out of luck.  Trust me, I know.  Was definitely worth coming back the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak

yXoS5gYU4nJA2KoJ3VwRDw.text: 15 min wait turned into 45, which would typically be a bummer but then when seated we find out that the limited breakfast menu is cut in half at 11am - so this breakfast joint won't serve us the breakfast items we wanted because our wait put us in our sets after 11. Now we order off the underwhelming lunch menu with trailblazing offerings such as BLT and Grilled Cheese. Our server Andy never, no exaggeration, checked on us once. However, the food runner was working her butt off and topped off our coffees for us. We couldn't get our servers attention to get the bill so we waved down another waitress that brought it to us. I'm all for hipster little bistros but service and quality has to come first if a restaurant is going to survive. I wouldn't come back to this pretentious yet completely mediocre restaurant.

DeW7ttk1BcdbcMZAgXN64Q.text: Great place to eat a little bit away from the strip. Great food and wait staff are very helpful and friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits...yes please!!!

2I0uI0e6Mpj5EDHF98XhHg.text: I had bookmarked this spot because I saw some rave reviews about it a while back. Finally got around to eating here on my last trip and now I'm wondering what all the fuss was about. It's good, but nothing I had made it rise to greatness. Although, to be fair I didn't exactly order the most exciting thing on the menu.   I got eggs. Two scrambled eggs, to be exact. And they came with smoked bacon and chive potatoes and toast, which was of the rye variety. All of the above was sufficiently cooked and tasty. None of it was particularly noteworthy, though I will point out that I give props to any place serving rye bread. If they really wanted to get on my good side, they'd serve pumpernickel or squaw.   My gf ordered something called a "skinny jenny" which was pretty damn good. I don't know why they give it a girly, low-cal name that makes it sound like a dish catering to women. I would have ordered one, too, if it had a moniker that sounded more unisex. My eyes wandered right over it because it sounded like some health food thing tailored for girls trying to keep off the pounds.

FHBtsWlpMr8lgvw2tlJCmw.text: I hated this place pretty much from the very beginning. It was very busy and not enough staff, apparently. It's a room with nothing on the walls or floors to absorb the sound so it's very loud. After we were seated it took nearly 5 minutes for the server just to get to the table.   The menu is limited in that they are all about that meat and potatoes thing with very few alternative options: no meatless, vegetarian, or gluten free items.   I opted for a bowl of steel cut oats topped with strawberries & pecans and it was ok. Certainly nothing special about a bowl of oatmeal so I'm not even sure what I expected here. No PB and most have never heard of putting it in your oatmeal. But if you don't, all you get is a bowl of carbs for breakfast  Do they even know what bill time is? In all the time I've been eating out I have never had any restaurant not give me a credit card receipt. It is not your position to assume I don't want one and I should never have to ask for it. Always get a credit card receipt to help prevent fraud.   Not going back here. The end.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OSfz1ID-nyR6THA_FZpTXw.text: Went in for brunch and I did enjoy it. I don't think it was amazing but it was good. The only problem was waiting in line for 40 minutes for food that was just average. Not sure I would come back especially with the lack of finding parking spaces nearby.

56ojEHDkVjXlRBylyJtUgw.text: My review for eat. is long overdue. What can I say? I really, really enjoy this place. It's clean, the decor is cute, the servers are always friendly and attentive, and the food is amazing not to mention decently priced. Every visit I've paid, the food is on point - scrambled eggs are fluffy, bacon is crispy but not burnt, toast is never drenched in butter. The food always comes out quick and hot, like it's supposed to! I will always recommend this place to any of my friends or family!

sZwYX4xw8jwxxQMWokk-4w.text: Went here for lunch and was blown away by their sandwiches. I must admit while roaming the area looking for the restaurant, the neighborhood had a "character" that almost made me turn around. I mean I like your average barefoot, toothless, bearded guy as much as the next gal, but maybe not joining me to grab a bite. My friends tenacity prevailed and we found eat, once inside we were glad we had stayed on course. The ambiance is great! Think modern, casual, and fun. Service was prompt and knowledgable. We ordered the posole soup to share as a starter. It was great, the broth was flavorful and it came with all the traditional garnishes and was chock full of yummy hominy. For lunch he had the grilled cheese and tomato soup and I had the arugula salad. The salad was meh, but I ordered wrong. If you come here you MUST get a sandwich! Let me repeat MUST.  The grilled bread is insane, like you take a moment before you devour because it is so perfect. Get any sandwich, any, and you will be happy. Needless to say, I'll be back, and order like a pro.

HJpHPVxhAybdy8xq6hfUaQ.text: I was an early customer of Eat and thought it was an excellent addition to Downtown. Great food and great value. However our last visit was a little disappointing. The food was still excellent but the service seems to be a little hit or miss. I didn't look at my bill in detail until after we left and we were charged $4 for avacado because we asked for it on the side rather than in the sandwich. $4 for a tea bag with no refills also seems pretty steep. Still good though.

96sXUgsH4KZ-4GI5konLDw.text: The lovely chef was sitting outside as we walked up... Service, ambiance, everything was WONDERFUL. The pancakes are beyond words, and I'm a waffle girl. Simply the best I've ever eaten anywhere. Bar none the best brunch in town.

R2urxd7GTP5D4CsEliEVjA.text: One of the most incredible restaurants downtown. Not only is the food amazing, but the environment and the staff are perfect. I wish I could give a rating higher than a five!

NgWN_TMvRUGQbA7b1-66MQ.text: Gee, this place sounds great. I wish I found myself at the Eat these folks are describing, but I didn't. The coffee was so weak as to be undrinkable. The corned beef hash was as bland as I've ever tasted, as if it had been made without any seasonings whatsoever. The eggs Benedict was only slightly better because the Hollandaise sauce was interesting. So ... never again.

DCrv4EE2I1icYmeFHb3H2Q.text: Great brunch experience today at Eat. My pal had the chicken fried steak and I had the shrimp and grits. Service was great and even though we were told 45 min wait time, we were in quicker! Can't wait to return.

fvjj-uFQMb0oZJQXCYbLbw.text: We've been here a bunch. I'm a fan. I really love the coffee. I stepped out of my "normal" and got the shrimp and grits on my last visit. It was really good. I was a bit worried...but I'm going to have to add this to my rotation from now on. You got to try this place...and afterward....step on over to the container park and check that place out.

T-mhJdjiiFQoswBfxpujkQ.text: Breakfast was fantastic! We arrived around 10 a.m. and were seated immediately. The Huevos Montalano(sp?) was spicy and delicious! Thre sweet banana was a nice companion to the heat of the dish. The green sauce was a bit much for such a humid day( I glisten easily). I ordered a side of the highrise sour dough toast.  The homemade jam was awesome!  Fruity and not too sweet...just right!  I love (to) Eat!

kPyNAd3_8UHi4G_f7TrcrQ.text: Do not order the arugula with 2 pieces of asparagus. The salad is super lame, with the whole extension of the word. This salad is so boring, this is how i can describe it: bowl of 95% arugula with 2 pieces of asparagus, 2 cashews and about 3 tomatoes with the minimum amount of Parmesan cheese shavings. For the price, omg, not worth it just don't get it. I finished my bowl of arugula within 3 minutes. Also my "server" Roberto, didn't even help me at all. A black girl really nice helped me out with questions, grabbing my drink, and taking my order, while -----Roberto(0 stars)---- was supposed to be my server he didn't even check if the food was right, how anything was, nothing, all he did was drop off the check and run my card. Just ask for another server when you go there. Also, this might not be the place to get salad but for having only two salads in the menu, they need to step up their game. Id give the restaurant 1 star but I'm doing 2 because the rest of the staff were very nice and happy and the place look nice and clean. I might give it another chance and order a sandwich since i come to Vegas about 10-12 times/month, but I might just also go somewhere else for salads. Sorry my review was long but I had to get my frustration out of my chest. Kuddos!

DSD1SLGmM663jNhhOV2tUg.text: Very busy but efficient!  We sat at the bar and watched an impressive staff.  We had shrimp & grits and truffle mushroom, bacon, egg and feta sandwich; both were excellent.

4wnJPbRHqBWJuOdZbolnuA.text: My boyfriend and I just went here for brunch today. Although it was a Sunday, we did not have to wait very long (about 20 minutes). We ordered the cinnamon biscuits, which were very delicious! Definitely would get these again. I had the truffle egg sandwich, which was also pretty good, but you definitely taste the truffle and you probably wouldn't like it if you weren't a fan of truffle. My boyfriend had the Eggs Benedict. He said that was good as well. Both dishes came with a side of chive potatoes! Delicious. The only downfall is the service, they were not very attentive to our table. Other than that, it was a solid brunch place in Las Vegas.

AXxbTGEIIBM6L_KUxcyrIw.text: We've been coming here since it opened. They have the best pancakes in town. There shrimp and grits are a must try and the service is excellent. Kudos to Chef Natalie.

tg9y6zW2a90PuCel34pwfA.text: Really great breakfast place near Fremont Street. Awesome ingredients, great presentation and delicious flavors. Super positive energy here too. Not cheap but worth it. See you in the flowers.  P.S. There's a cool shipping container architecture styled shopping park across the street too.

aKuD6eT3oRNNO97b1sta-w.text: YUM!  What a cute little place in Downtown LV!  For breakfast I had oatmeal with brown sugar, pecans and apples...so good and healthy!  This is a great place to meet a friend for breakfast or lunch.

H3z06uNTjrjTbJhnOJCb8Q.text: New to Vegas and was exploring Container Park when we were told by a local about eat. We're beyond happy she did! Great feel and environment in the restaurant. Best Iced Tea I've ever had and we both loved our lunches. I got the Reuben and my wife got the grilled cheese with the tomato soup. If you're in the area.....GO!

XKKJk6Ox6y8kQ18jYCLQxw.text: STOP DONT COME TO THIS OVERRATED WANNA BE BERKELEY  KNOCKOFF OF A TYPE OF RESTAURANT... GO TO DUPARS, HASH HOUSE A GOGO OR ANYWHERE ELSE IN FREMONT... First off let me start by saying that the food here was pretty good...BUUUUUUT NOT WORTH THE BS...so I came here when I first moved here cause I live in the same building...ordered a sandwich, orange juice and a soda which cost 27 BUX ...Now was it good? yeah it was good, but there is way too many options in Vegas to come here for long waits and high San Francisco food prices.  I went in this day which is a Sunday and asked can I still make a to go order since it was about 12 minutes till close.  The hostess said we don't do to go orders on the weekend.  This is fine I totally understand not taking a call in to go order, but I'm standing right there. Like even when I'm right here? So I walked away from that stupidity.  Although I walked away, I was thinking about how dumb that was and how if I were to order and sit down and when the food got there I said hey I have to go. Would they take my food away? No they would have given me a box. Why couldn't that have happened? Anyway I was just being lazy and didn't want to walk another block..lesson learned.

mZ4hp3442pTcWbT4I0HW5w.text: I really wanted to like this place tooo....  but shrimp and grits?  not good, shrimp were very rubbery and over cooked,    eggs and bacon?  eggs overcooked, bacon burnt ,.grilled cheese? way too thick bread and hardly any cheese and the cheese was the shredded kind.... not real cheese, tomato soup? very watery, the salad was 98% lettuce, no flavor  oh... and they did that "do you want biscuits?" to us too........ they make it sound like they are free.. but then its $8.00 on your bill... which is shady to do .. you know you were duped when you get your bill... I told the waitress that would have been your tip, no tip for a party of four... sad... I BLAME THE OWNER FOR THAT, it costs the wait staff tip money, this is Vegas you cant do scams like that ! ! !  and the biscuits were dry .

F-0naca2L2HXZ5EZhPI0Ww.text: Really enjoyed breakfast here. Unimpressive exterior and off the beaten path but cute inside and the food was great!  LOVED the fresh bread and potatoes. I would make an effort to go here again when in town.

xMcCRYS3_i0k534jgbF3Kw.text: Wonderful place! Very friendly service, delicious coffee and crazy fast delivery of our tasty food. We will definitely come back the next time we're in Las Vegas.

e0kkl-SvliDWGC1dl59J3w.text: First timer!! Lady comes to get our drink order.  Before I even finish asking if they have drink specials, she immediately says "No."   So I got apple juice.  Gary took our order. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!! He was in such a hurry. My family couldn't even finish on saying what they wanted.  They all seem super pushy and in a rush. He snatches the menu from my hand giving me a papercut (kept it to myself).    Food came, not happy as the eggs were running, WHICH I HATE.  If he would've asked how I wanted my eggs or that they came with eggs it would be common curtesy to ask how I would like them. The only good thing I had here was the apple juice (which came in a bottle).  Not a happy customer. I'm defiantly not coming or recommending this place

IAsC5qfz0yLPuGE6mYgWEw.text: Best Pancakes I have ever had....  I could eat their pancakes without any syrup....it just melted in my mouth, and I would go back here (before 11AM) just for the pancakes.  The place reminds me of CowFish (in Charlotte, NC), so the atmosphere is pretty cool.  It is in a strange location in terms of the area, but do not be fooled, it is very nice on the inside.  Never had a chance to get lunch here, but I see no need for that, as I have already found their superstar menu item.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i6ylv_Ao3h7iPkaV5_xaHg.text: In town with friends for a quick weekend get away.  We were looking for a non-buffet breakfast option and an Uber driver suggested Eat.  Thank you, Mr Uber Driver, for the tip.  I had the special - Eggs Benedict.  So so SO good.  I consider myself a poached egg connoisseur and these did not disappoint.  The sauce was a fantastically tangy explosion - unlike any other I've ever had with this dish.  My friend had the truffle egg sandwich and she really enjoyed it.  I think I'd make this a weekly stop if I lived here!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Today&#39;s special - Eggs Benedict

wIQllUL7sJN0UAAlxER5_w.text: Originally went to Dennys down the street, but was closed due to their water was not working. So my boyfriend started browsing through Yelp and found this gem! It's absolutely DELICIOUS!!! We are from Southern California and visit Las Vegas pretty often. You bet we will be coming for breakfast from now on whenever we are in town.   Service was great as well :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting on our food

eJMIYtVV2q1CjLOm_gWbzQ.text: Wow go to Vegas a couple of times a year and we like to stay in the downtown area.  Most of the hotels (even the Nugget) have ordinary breakfast.  So we were so exited when this place opened a couple of years ago.  Not the best neighborhood, but getting better.  In the beginning we would wait on lines to get in and it was all worth while.  The food was very well prepared and the service was too.  This time we went on Nov 13th.  The place was less than half full.  We got our coffee quickly and I noticed it was not was I was used to...maybe they changed the brand.  The we ordered our breakfast, eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes...the works.  My eggs were not fresh off the grill.. one of the yolks was broken and my toast came after I had eaten the eggs and potatoes.  I asked three times for a coffee refill and waited almost ten minutes to get it.  Meanwhile I could see the wait staff chatting in the kitchen area not really paying attention to us.  The pancakes came out dry as if the were made an hour earlier and then reheated.  Bottom line.  I can do just as well at the hotels or better.

uHSDpR0RGtDOlN_a_BTMxg.text: I spent the New Year in Vegas and decided to venture off the strip for breakfast in the downtown area. Came across the restaurant EAT on Yelp. I read the reviews and decided to give it a try. So glad I did. The food was absolutely delicious! I ordered coffee, cinnamon biscuits, bacon, eggs, & potatoes. The portions were hearty and the food was fresh and tasty. I gave them 4* because of the floor. It's a cement floor with a glossy slick finish. I almost slipped on it. Be careful when walking inside the restaurant could be a serious safety hazard.
