qZJTKgFr_exSZk1hKq5XIA.text: We've been here twice now when in town from Phoenix. The food is fantastic! Be prepared to wait to be seated but all good things come to those who wait!! To the couple who walked in then left when they saw the line, it sucks to suck! You missed some killer food a-holes.  The chicken fried steak is awesome!

jaa_QNBJ0ZnEaNYq5DY5RA.text: I remembered when I used to love this place. But over time it has gotten worse and I am only writing a bad review because after the first two times I came it was not a good experience. Let me start off by saying that at this point it is over hyped. The only thing I crave about this place is their pancakes. Previous time I came w/ my mother we waited for over 30 minutes which is fine w.e. Our waiter seriously only checked up on us about twice and what made me so angry was that they gave us the check before our food even came out!!!! Are you effin kidding me? I let it go and didn't say anything. For some reason I felt like we were treated as minority's since everyone else in the room was white except us. I had their shrimp and grits and it was okay, lacked a lot of flavor. Today we went back with my family and waited for over an hour! The host kept seating people left & right instead of trying to hold a table for us since a lot of people came after us. I understand smaller parties get seated quicker but it was only 6 of us. Anyways we finally got seated and our waitress was great. Can't complain we were checked up on multiple times. But the food was not what it used to be. Very sad to say that I probably won't be coming back here again and deff not recommending it to others any longer.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks delicious, but it was mediocre.

pT2Ue6QGX9OEpT7HT9b_pQ.text: Man this place cranks out the food. Not very big and sometimes a small wait, but worth it. Allie runs a tight ship and her crew knows how to get it done. Once seated and order is placed, it doesn't take long to get your food. The eggs Benedict (special) and chicken fried steak is comfort food that tastes like mom made it. Prices are good and always a favorite when we're in town.

hZxWt59No6tyYQJZxZtfLA.text: All of our plates were awesome. Went on a Monday seated right away, weekends,we heard,is an average 2hr wait!! Downtown Freemont, love the location. Always prefer giving to local spots!!

XGoTJpgeUpewHUy7QkzZMA.text: We were seated immediately, food was super fast and delicious and our waiter was awesome.  Highly recommended for a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7hBb0WLIN0gEvwNTdgOBnQ.text: Wow I had to come to vegas to have the best breakfast in the world. I'm being dramatic but holy cow the food is amazing and the coffee is up there as well.   Well worth leaving the strip for the place.    Enjoy!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast paradise.

MSv3dUAy3rRcrrY0tl5QSQ.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. Bad service and bad food. The hostess told us it would be an hour to sit even though there were open seats. When they did try and seat us they argued about what name was listed as if we were lying to them. The waiter had an attitude, as if it was our fault he hated his job. I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was so disgusting. Floating in oil/butter and topped with pico de gallo. Why would I want pico on shrimp and grits but they refused to remove it when asked. The other guests with me ordered pancakes that came out burned. There were several employees that looked like they were 16 and were confused about what they were bringing us. I could go on with more poor service we received, but you get the point. Terrible!!

FikVApefsb6v2VnzwIgqCA.text: This place is really unique and worth any weekend afternoon wait. They have fun spins on traditional dishes and might I add, cute little tiny maple syrups made especially for them.   I love restaurants with inspiring stories and it's been nice watching them kill it.   This is a good place to go with friends but be careful of the line. I don't know if I would suggest it for large groups, either, unless during an "off" time - just because the space is intimate and homey. I love that!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have their own maple syrup! Love things like this.

8Njjpjz5VyxO4C5oCoX52g.text: Im sorry i didnt get the chance to review this place but its nice to see that Downtown Las vegas has some life in the area. So I came here with my wife and good friend to have some breakfast months ago and going there i realized pulling up that i had to pay for parking. I think all restaurants should have a designated area to park or offer free parking with a punch card kind of like going to a casino and having validated parking.  Lets get to the meal we ordered alot of things. My wife had the Shrimp n Grits (4/5 stars) I had my usual Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs which didn't really wow me so (3/5) Also Ordered Grilled Cheese and A Order Of pancakes Both (3/5).  Nothing here is really memorable besides the shrimp and grits so i definitely recommend it. Other than that service is solid and i know this place will do just fine because people love to come eat breakfast. And as long as they keep their ingredients fresh which they do they will be a popular eatery for a long time.   Thanks for a solid meal. Not sure ill be back anytime soon but  we enjoyed the place.

Mv3m5eGS05NuI4oKGJ8Eqw.text: I heard a lot about this place., so we decide to take a shot. Every time we come to Vegas we end up getting ripped off on some so called 5 stars reataurant and paying lots of money for average food. we want to try something different. Something local. I was disappointed the food was different but nothing extraordinary. And the staff was focus on their local clientele. We DID FEEL like outsiders. I need a refill on my coffee it took 10 minutes .? We went on a Tuesday at noon it was full. Would I come back nah o don't think so. I had a shrimp sanwich.it was ok o guess. Mi wife had their famous cinnamon biscuits she didn't like it . I know they use fresh ingredients but you have to add some flavor to the dishes .

dpcuxcd0_7AmfvCb1F-UIw.text: I feel like I used to love this place more. We came in for brunch today.  It was only half full but we were told we could either sit at the bar or wait 10 mins for a table. (half the tables were open). After sitting at the bar and not enjoying the heat / overhearing kitchen drama we complained and finally got a table. Then nobody came over for 5 mins to take our order. You can't modify any orders (not even cheese on your sandwich). The food IS good, everything else just needs a little more effort.

HqiVY6pNnVWtdEQkyGslmA.text: After recommendation I run to this place, and ask bast food for vegetarians, but I was disappointed with this strange plate  not tasty for me(((

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RN2ErKt4JR2v87El4GKT8w.text: THEY ARE SO FAST! I think we had breakfast, paid and even had an extra cup of coffee in less than thirty minutes. I wasn't prepared for how efficient, attentive and accommodating they were going to be. I paid for an hour parking and almost thought I needed an hour and a half. The food was great and I definitely recommend trying the cinnamon biscuits, they are very unique to this place and very tender and delicious. The presentation is gorgeous and they provide a lot of fresh fruit with it; However, the jam that they use for the biscuits is very high in sugar and hurt my teeth (but none the less still delicious). I didn't taste a lot of truffle in the truffled egg sandwich and the corned beef was more potatoes than beef. I still would give them the five stars because I appreciate how fast and attentive they were!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-LvD8FNAbeFLpxpb-ZJasQ.text: I've been to Eat a few times before since it's pretty close by. It's a solid place for breakfast foods/brunch with a twist. Everything I've ever had at Eat has been great, and I look forward to trying new things from them.   The restaurant itself is decently sized, but seeing the amount of foot traffic this place gets, it's clear they should consider relocating to a larger location in downtown. The only negative about Eat is that the wait can be eternal if you go during lunch time. We came at around 10:30 am on a weekday and it was a 25-30 wait. I've been when the wait was 40-45 min, so try to come at a slower time if you want to be seating within 10 min.  We got the Shrimp Po Boy, Shrimp and Grits, and the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote. The shrimp po boy was good, but the shrimp to vegetable ratio was very skewed towards the vegetables. There was barely any shrimps in the sandwich.   The shrimp and grits were very good, and when the egg's yolk breaks into the grits, it's rich and heavenly. The pico on top gives it a nice fresh flavor and gives it some texture.  One of the best things they had there was the OJ. It's fresh squeezed and sweet, and it's everything you could want in a nice OJ. The only downside was that it was $6. Kind of pricey, but if you're feeling zesty, it's a good option.  Overall, the food is good. The wait sucks. Get the shrimp and grits or the grilled cheese. Don't forget the OJ.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp po boy, in reality it&#39;s more of a vege sandwich with meager bits of shrimp
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits

zoQNhpsGR096Xf7EoLcr3Q.text: Food is amazing!! Servings are large, so you can definitely split plates. If in Vegas, MUST TRY!

3299HowjkvKRSg63OYgUIA.text: Ok, so this has been one of my favorite places hands down for at least 2 years. The truffle egg sandwich is to die for, hits all the right spots. They  have the best killer grilled cheese sandwich hands down, no one can compare. The bread was buttery, light and fluffy and the cheese melts without that typical  oily build up. The shrimp Po-boy is light and refreshing not the usual New Orleans style Po-boy, I've become accustom to. My only critique, are the limited weekly hours.

PPQKtTPwM3VHLXBKzpLr8g.text: This was a unique little find. We tried the famous deep fried  deviled eggs and they were delicious for the adults but a tad spicy for the 10 year old. Her pancakes and sausage could have fed two people. The corned beef hash was very good. The shrimp and grits were okay but could have used some oomph the balance the bland grits.  I would definitely eat here again.

x5l_uYlGTszf1A12xiI_zw.text: Visited for the first time a few weeks ago, were the first ones in, early in the morning, it was yummy! Very pleasant atmosphere and good food. Then returned with my hubby a couple weeks later to show him downtown is coming back. The food is good and it is great to get away from the usual big restaurants. Their service is very good.

rLVNRpdXxStIfriWb5fT7A.text: Food was great! Big portions that are cooked in an open kitchen. Everything was very fresh, made to order, and was creative without being over the top. Semi-small place, but great atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich, just half!

8ZNITkaEORB0jS4gDRBBzA.text: The best breakfast I've had in forever!!!!!!! And I LOOOOOOOOVE breakfast!  From atmosphere, to service, to food!! They deserve all stars!!!!  We wanted something other than the regular Boyd casino buffets and found this place a hop, skip and away next to container park.  We walked in and they had a good crowd inside. We thought the wait was gonna be long, but it wasn't. They sat us right away.  I'll get straight to it.....  LOCATION: convenient, close to the Fremont experience, about a 3 minute walk.  PARKING: lots of street parking everywhere   SERVICE: quick, friendly, fast.... they got everything we ordered correct.  FOOD: AMAZEBALLS! truffle egg sandwich! The food here was sooooooooooo delicious! Truffled egg sandwich! Truffled egg sandwich!  PRICE: worth every penny... affordable but not cheap. Like I said, worth every penny. This place won't break your wallet :)  My next trip back to Vegas, I'm definitely stopping by here for breakfast!

pcvJQCcJkGJgdT4q0ZVEdg.text: I got very impressed. The food is REALLY good. I loved the pancakes, eggs, bacon everything was perfect!

oHfOGgCRe0g_fHR1bnvH6Q.text: Really good energy at this local cafe... low-key but attentive staff.   Excellent food... I had scrambled eggs and grits, the grits were fantastic!  We had bacon, thick and crunchy, and the herb roasted potatoes, a nice variation on hashbrowns.  Also, they use Mothership coffee, one of Las Vegas' best local roasters. Go and enjoy your time, it is lovely!

NUmBxrSrszTD5T-tGfA1ng.text: This place would fit in easily in Brooklyn! Very cool alternative vibe, not the usual Americana brunch. The service was on point, coffee was great, and they have gluten free and nondairy options. The menu is a well-thought out gourmet twist on breakfast!!  Huevos Motilenos and shrimp and grits were fantastic. The cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote was a nice variation of biscuits.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote

ZHYDUoHepdv7FUUtjZ_0cA.text: Horrible service. Have gone 3 times bc the food is good, but the service always sucks. I really love supporting downtown so that's why we have given this place so many tries. But the service is always rude. Sad to see locals treat other locals so terribly.

EAXFdtkruIwvzsDQqME3lQ.text: Cool decor. Yummy food. Went here for a girls breakfast on a Saturday morning. The wait was surprisingly short, but business was steady the whole time we were there. I ordered the truffle egg sandwich with avocado....so yummy! Would definitely go here again and would recommend to everyone!   About 10-10:30am, they cleared out a table or two in the front and there was a woman playing the acoustic guitar. Again cool atmosphere and yummy food.

EwqKDal3y-0576mExUga7Q.text: The menu seemed pretty small but almost everything on it sounded delicious. I split the roasted chicken sandwich and chive potatoes and was very full by the time we finished. The sandwich was excellent and the chicken wasn't even a smidge dry. Great flavor combinations and wholesome food.   The only thing I found a bit odd was that there were four or five different people that served us, the actual waiter only came to take our order and the bill. Also, for you picky eaters this restaurant does not allow you to customize your order, take it as is or not at all.

lx_p26AOnPalfU3zWNgjEw.text: Good morning world!!!! Let's start by eating the most important meal of the day BREAKFAST!! :)   Eat is co convenient. They open at 8 in the morning and it's by the court house where people usually have to be there so early in the morning! And the food is delicious!!!   I always get grits and side of bacon! Just because that's the way I roll! :) lol. But at time I order their devil eggs which is a MUST TRY!!! it's a fried devil eggs so delicious! It's rich, but crunchy and the way the play with food texture in this particular dish will blow your mind! And your taste bud!   Their sweet biscuits I believe is their most popular items! It's pretty amazing itself! It's sweet but they put tangy strawberry in it which helps with the sweetness of the syrup they drizzled in it! And the saltiness from the biscuits brings it to a different level.   And one must say they have a pretty strong coffee here!! Just perfect to start your morning!! :)  Service is pretty on point! Fast and never disappoint!   Over all pretty awesome place! Keep it up!!

utoVeSTjTyhhv6EYnfbMcw.text: Have been working downtown for a year and visited this location.  Was disappointed today that the chef refuses to do a protein modification.  I wanted chicken instead of corned beef on a sandwich.  Offered to pay an up charge and was told no the chef won't allow. An outright no tells me that I need to not come here anymore.

w6JnpexbHi990vYTnR8WbA.text: Great, welcoming atmosphere. Friendly and attentive staff. Owner mingles with the guests and is well known among her community, sitting outside and everyone passing by and saying hi. Food was good and served in big portions and reasonably priced. Will return next time I come to the Fremont area. Also eco-friendly and plastic free! All the containers were glass and the no plastic straws

LqW1PPYVK_E-htvlliWv5g.text: Decided try this place out. Best things on menu aren't served after 11am. Anyways nothing is able to be substituted even if you can't eat something. Tried food and very disappointed, deviled eggs and the biscuit compote ate very little of and returned. Had to order from side order menu for meal due to no substitutes Then food was average, which bummed me out was excited for tho place. Service was average bit slow

AP9PToYN9aADAEeQAou0Sg.text: Located in downtown Vegas, a spot revisited by locals and extra brownie points if found by tourists. It's a local spot that has a great sense of community with emphasis on all things comfort. All ingredients are responsibly sourced with leafy greens locally sourced. The space comes together with different elements from the green colored walls, to the exposed brick with the mixture of mismatched paintings and decor. Bringing in a bright and relaxed atmosphere, great breakfast brunch vibe that's rumored to push out pretty damn good comfort food.   We all ended up getting sandwiches which were all served on their ciabatta bun, let's just rave over how perfect this bread was. Crisp outer layer with the soft spongy interior that soaks up all the juices and sauces that are layered on. Talk about levels of flavour. Who knew the bun that a sandwich is served on could elevate the meal so much more.   Shrimp Po'Boy - ($14) - Juicy sauteed shrimp topped with spicy napa slaw and cilantro finished with a sriracha mayo. This was a darn good sandwich. Spicy mayo and the spicy slaw gave a really good kick in flavour and there was a hefty amount of shrimp stuffed in between. Recommend 100%  Roast Beef - ($14) - The flawless layers of roast beef with another flawless layer of arugula, presentation alone was captivating. Served with mayo with sprinkles of pickled red onions, this was a heavy sandwich compared to the shrimp but flavours were awesome and also really satisfying.    Free Range Chicken - ($12) One of the more basic sandwiches with the added addition of their pesto mayo; which was probably the ingredient that stood out the most. Added with that ciabatta bun and boy, this basic juicy chicken sandwich just leveled up to a whole new experience.  All of the sandwich choices had a slice of pickle and the added option of choosing between chip, soup,salad or potato salad. I opted for chips and the other two got the potato salad. My chips were yummy, but the potato salad wasn't a crowd pleaser for us. Not creamy enough to our liking I suppose.   Service wasn't spectacular. Had to ask our server twice for a water refill, huffed when we wanted to clarify the brunch menu items and all in all didn't seem pleased that she had to serve us. she also didn't remember to add our orange juice to the bill, which made up for the shoddy service.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ig5rU54vOHKfYTVyiIAlmQ.text: Wanted to try a new place for breakfast so decided to come here after reading great reviews online and I'm glad I did. Service was excellent and the food was fast, fresh and delicious. Ordered the grits and shrimp and the menu said bacon and eggs also so I thought it was coming on the side but they actually mix the shrimp bacon, eggs and grits together in same bowl which was a great combination and complimented each other well. It definitely hit the spot. Can't wait to go back and try something for brunch!

BaMWIY3eejNg_AUBl2BDIA.text: Not a local but when I'm in town for the music festival, great brunch place in the downtown Vegas area. It's a quaint restaurant and it does get packed but definitely worth the wait. If you're in luck like me this time around, the bar area is first come, first serve so score! The bar area has about 6-8 seating? Can't recall exactly.   The 3 dishes my party got were the Golden-Brown pancakes with strawberries, Chilaquiles and Corned Beef Hash. All were delicious but the top favs were the Chilaquiles and pancakes. The Chilaquiles had a lot of flavor and the jalapeno mango sausage has a slight kick but not spicy at all. The pancakes were fluffy and very breakfast.  When you're walking through the crowded room, scoping out what others have ordered, you can't help but be drawn to the pancakes.   2nd time here and planning on coming by when we're in downtown!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden-Brown Pancakes with Starwberries
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hasg
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles

_TX_Y_B2keZXZiKLqWR_XA.text: I absolutely love this place. I been coming here for  years and they never disappoint. It can get busy at times but it's definitely worth the wait. The food is delicious and the service is great. The place is hip and clean. The main thing I recommend is the pancakes. I wish I could have the recipe for them. They are buttery crunchy but soft and warm on the inside. They are definitely the perfect breakfast. They give you maple syrup to go with.  Today tho, they surprised me with the special of the day! Biscuits and gravy! The biscuits are out of this world !! I got them with the sausage but you could get bacon  I couldn't get a good picture because I started eating but you have to try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2SMUa53dK4yjg3OsQojzHQ.text: I've always said never judge a book by its cover and "Eat" is a must read. It's in downtown Las Vegas a block or two from Fremont Street. The place is nice and small and quaint on the inside with lots of charm and character. The music they are playing is relaxing and feel good and the customer service is not bad at all either.   Now the food, I had every thing a la cart which was a little cheaper than ordering the meal. I had bacon, two eggs, potatoes and toast. It was more than filling to me and two large glasses of OJ which was very fresh. I would definitely recommend this place to eat and it's off the hustle and bustle of the Strip. I will be returning here on my visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view on the way there this morning

7ag4a-1YEM73uo7uQe240A.text: Went to Eat to have a filling breakfast before starting a roadtrip through Arizona and Utah. Super glad we picked this place!!  This place has great reviews, and Eat lives up to the expectations. Super cool vibe, plenty of menu choices for all tastes - from savory deviled eggs to the sweetiest, fluffiest pancakes.   Also great service, good coffee and the pancakes I ordered were absolutely delicious - They came with strawberries, banana, and a chicken sausage - I had my doubts about the sausage at first, but it was a perfect flavor balance!!  If you're not in a rush and want to check the surroundings before or after coming here, there is a cool Container Park right next to it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gon6SpfIr_X4qWvev7Zhxw.text: I loved this place and would definitely go back again. The menu is one page so it's not overwhelming. You can tell they put a lot of thought into every single dish they make.   You can upgrade your toast to a pancake  for only $1 or add on a short stack for $7 and if you go here and don't have a pancake you are missing out.   I would go back here every day and be happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee

Hy06VrCzXqvVEM2n5fY9Dw.text: Eat is my favorite brunch place in Vegas so far. As a Phoenician, we travel to Vegas a few times every year and always make a stop somewhere for brunch. I was impressed by the food which I can't say about all the other places we've been to. I ordered the corned beef hash and loved it. The corned beef was nicely cubed, along with the potatoes. It was crispy and absolutely delicious. I'm not usually a fan of poached eggs but those were a nice addition. I had pancakes on the side which they served with individually packed maple syrup jars. The pancakes were fluffy on the inside and nicely crisp on the outside and were topped with strawberries. We also shared the deviled eggs and liked it. A friend of mine had a side of the potatoes and for some reason, they weren't all that great.   We were lucky for not having to wait too long - about 20 minutes for a table of 7 on a Sunday afternoon. The service was okay; most were fantastic while one particular server wasn't very courteous. Prices were affordable and lacked the pretentiousness and overpriced dishes that lined the Vegas strip. Needless to say, we will definitely be back for brunch.

bU4C_P2F14BDGc_tHBwFJA.text: Excellent brunch experience!  Wait was short (15-minutes) and well managed.  Team service was outstanding.   And the food was awesomeness.  I had corned beef hash with poached eggs and my better half just ordered home fries and sausage.  Coffee was fresh and tasty. The location in downtown Las Vegas is easy to get to (hoping the construction on Carson is done soon!), and located across the street from the Container Park.  Metered street parking was easy to obtain and inexpensive too.  All in all  Eat is a great spot for breakfast, lunch or brunch!

1lRJPTHEo5XDo6Q-UvqoPg.text: Service was excellent, food good, and clean.   About a 7 minute walk from the Golden Nugget this place was open early.   Wait staff was friendly and prompt without a wait on Sunday morning.   We are the pancakes with mixed fruit and sausage on top.   The syrup was amazing served in cute little personal jars.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes, mixed fruit, and sausage.

3Na3JiXlaQImluzC3-rsYw.text: Looking for a bite to eat before our EDC weekend, we found Eat. on Yelp as one of the nearby restaurants close to our hotel. After reviewing the menu online, we decided to give this place a try. Luckily when we arrived, there was a table opening up for our group of 6 so we waited at most 10 minutes. We were seated promptly and after deciding on our food, ordered with the waitress. After putting in our order, she asked us if we would like to try their Fried Deviled Eggs. One of our friends perked up as she was debating on trying them, and we all decided to share an order.   La 'Kat's Deviled Eggs (4pc - $8.00): These are basically what they are called - fried deviled eggs. They are topped with small pieces of bacon and chives; the egg is entirely breaded and fried. Many other reviews raved about these, but I didn't see anything special to them. They were good, but not $2.00/piece good.   Tofu Scramble ($11.00): Pretty good serving size - they give you plenty of potatoes that had some salt seasoning on top of them, with the Tofu scramble mixed with mushrooms, green onions and sprouts on top. The flavor was delicious and everything worked really well together! I'm an extreme bread lover....their bread is SO GOOD. It might be silly of me to be so enthusiastic about just bread, but THIS ISN'T JUST BREAD! So fluffy and thick, whichever kind of bread you ordered whether it be wheat, sourdough or white, these slices of bread are AMAZING.   Corned Beef Hash ($15.00): My boyfriend got this and of course I wanted to try some. This is a bit different from other Corned Beef Hashes we've had - they had cubes of meat, almost similar to ham cubes? Still it was very tasty, but not what we're used to. The eggs were cooked amazingly though!  Definitely filled us all up for the long day after. If we ever stay Downtown again, I'd definitely come back for that toast!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wheat Toast
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash ($15.00)
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu Scramble ($11.00)

GKsQIAyORuhAn2j_luBd2Q.text: This place was great! We were a group of 5, we parked on the street and paid for parking. We had to wait about 30 minutes. We had enough time to walk through that container area across the street and came back and still waited about 10 minutes more.  We got seated at a table that was meant for 4 people but they added another chair, so it was a bit tight once all the food was on the table. I ordered the Golden-Brown Pancakes which were some of the best pancakes I have ever had. I also ordered the La 'Kat's Deviled Eggs, it was like there was a party going on in my mouth! They were so good! Our table shared an order of the Cinnamon Biscuits which was only okay, nothing great. My aunt ordered the chicken fried steak and they brought out her plate with everything but the chicken fried steak! It was pretty funny and our waitress took it back once we pointed it out and brought out the full dish, chicken fried steak and all.  They have a cute outdoor area that looked like it would be nice to sit in. I would recommend sitting out there. It felt like too many people inside the restaurant at once.
