gk0VLYjldTKEtY8m63ymQA.text: I have been coming here for years even though the service is the absolute worst.  The FOOD is all that saves this place.  Had a terrible experience this morning and sent the following email to the management.  Who knows if they will respond.    My email:   Hello.  This morning my husband and I ate at your place, which we have done many of the years of living here, and had some of the worst service we have experienced from you all.  The truth is, we KNEW coming in we were going to get bad service because over the years it has seemed that the more popular EAT gets, the less you guys care about showing a little hospitality towards people who come in.  I always recommend EAT to people (I work on the Strip), but I always warn them about what a crap shoot it is going to be service wise.  Today was the bottom.... :(      We got to your place around 10:24am, and you had your typical brunch crowd, busy but not balls to the wall in the weeds.  We were quoted 20 mins, no biggie, and after about 8 minutes I realized there was a counter near the kitchen that seemed to be first come, first served.  So I ask the hostess if we can sit there if it is first come, first served and she was super reluctant saying, "Yeah, I don't know.  I'm gonna have to ask.  There are people in front of you."  Really.  No kidding?? I couldn't have fathomed that the other people waiting were NOT before me.  An 89 person place isn't big, so I watched her NOT EVEN MAKE AN EFFORT to find out the information (which she already knew), and to the minute that I type this, she STILL hasn't let us know, "Sure.  You can sit there," or "No.  You can't sit there," or even "F you, we decide who sits there."  NADA      We continue to wait, get seated after our quote time by ten minutes (which happens), and then a first server comes to take a drink order, but doesn't say anything welcoming.  No "Hi.  How are you?  Can I get you started with something to drink?"  Instead it was:  walk up, "What do you want to drink."  Very off putting.  Then she brings the drinks back and informs us she isn't our server (which working in a restaurant, I know when people are helping each other out).  Then Jessica, our server walks up and says, "Looks like you've decided, what are you having?"  No, "Hi! Thanks for waiting,"  or "Hi!  I'm Jessica.  Did you have any questions I could answer about the menu?"        These people are straight up order takers.  Why do you need them?? Why not do what MTO in Summerlin did and just install an order counter and let people skip the awkwardness of having to be polite and tip your completely oblivious staff???       The food came out fast enough and was as amazing as it always is (which is the ONLY reason we keep coming back), but we didn't see Jessica until she presented the check, and had to ask another server to refill our coffee.  I saw the kind of service she was giving... silent service.... but again, we were ignored.       The check came as we were only halfway through eating (we've been at your place at this point, seated, for about 30 minutes, and that includes menu looking, ordering and waiting for the food).  I felt like I was at Cracker Barrel, except that Cracker Barrel at LEAST does a two minute or two bite check back to make sure all is ok.  That non-hourly counter top idea is looking pretty good now, isn't it?       I get it.  Bourdain has been to your joint.  You've got a super talented chef who makes kick ass food, and over the years this community has really taken notice.  I know.  I am involved in this community.  But the only two things saving you at 7th and Carson is that the food is amazing and you get a lot of tourists.  Let's be honest, the level of service in a lot of Vegas is shit because we always have volume (which you make clear in that note at the host stand asking for patience while you are slammed, but said in a way that is fake and uppity).  If your quaint 89 person gig was in a regular town where people really cared to spread the word, you might but your people through better hospitality training.  Breakfast/Brunch is a hard gig.  I've done it.  But you can still be as hospitable slinging $5 eggs as you can an $800 Robuchon.        I left the server a note (which I have a pic of if you want it) where I expressed these concerns, and I unfortunately had to tip 9% (which is an over payment).  Why didn't I get a manager?  Because it wasn't apparent there even was one.  But I'll tell you what the note said:  "Please make your guests feel like they matter -- that their time and money matter -- because they do.  This is for this STAFF, not just you.  Be a hospitality person... not just an order taker.  +Do not rush people when they are only half way through their meal.  This food deserves more respect than that."  I hope someone is listening.

HSf4VV4B7p43vB2fVeCaEg.text: A breakfast, brunch, lunch downtown restaurant serving a delicious eclectic menu. The service is great and the prices are reasonable. Space is limited.

W24ZlSwLFH8g3vwSOqijLQ.text: Great service and amazing food. Pancakes taste just like funnel cakes and portions are plenty to fill you up and have small Togo

pgUCX98YC6PoUl2cG_qfsA.text: First time here. Great food. Impeccable service snd friendly staff.   A bit noisy but worth it!

1ooZlLF1iB8GxBUhwkoW8A.text: This place was one of the highlights of our recent trip to Las Vegas! The food was amazing and I would recommend anyone staying close by to check it out!

IkyYNiHqCBZaJbNKXpbm_Q.text: First and foremost, the seating is extremely uncomfortable. Our male server was very dry, quiet frankly a little rude. I asked him how the corned beef hash was, and he replied with " Umm.. its fresh corned beef.." and i just looked at him like "Geez, okay thanks." We proceeded to order appetizers; which were an order of deviled eggs, and tomato soup. Then ordered our entrees which were corned beef and hash, and the reuben sandwich.  The Coffee we ordered was horrible, bitter, tasteless, just burnt. We couldn't even finish a cup of coffee and usually, we have 3 or 4 cups each.   20 Minutes later we got our appetizers, AND our entrees at the same time. Not only did we make it clear during the ordering process, we figured the server knew we wanted to start with the STARTERS, and after the starters are finished, typically you get your entrees then. The Tomato soup was so sour, it was inedible. The Corned Beef and Hash, not only did it not look fresh, but was cold. The Reuben sandwich, not only was the ratio of meat to bread ridiculous, but the meat was very dry and flavorless. The potato salad it came with was ice cold, and bland.  The only thing that we actually really enjoyed, were the deviled eggs. They were absolutely delicious!  Right when we were thinking maybe this was just a bad day for the kitchen, we decide to give this place another chance, Until we get our bill; and inside reads a message reading " We love and welcome your business, but please be courteous to those waiting to sit with us, when we are slammed."  So pretty much, eat and get the hell out. like..WHAT?! Seeing as both of us live here and work in this industry. This was the most unprofessional crappy note we've ever seen. We definitely will not be returning. Seeing as there is a ton of other places in Downtown that would appreciate our business instead of being snubbed and told to get out.

Hn4Olev-fWz6WZ9p60W6IA.text: I enjoying supporting a small business ESP a Downtown business.  Super clean, super cute, really hip!  Pancakes Yumma but not worth the price but I'm Sure rent is crazy expensive.  They have charging outlets by every still at front counter to charge while you play on UR device and eat or sip coffee!

O8rhvOCFSZQY7euJJK0w1A.text: We showed up there was a bit of a line, and told a 15-20 min wait. No problem with all the positive reviews We were willing to wait, but we were at table in 5 minutes. The food and service were fantastic, my wife had the eggs Benedict with turkey bacon and tomato on an English muffin, the hollandaise made the whole thing perfect. I had the shrimp and grits, that's new territory for me having never had grits before. I have no comparison but it was so tasty. Covered with two over easy eggs and topped with a bruschetta type tomatoes and shrimp. We need to go back before vacation is over.

muBY18tqN86HkvhpF44-MQ.text: OK, this place would normally be 5 stars easily, but I have to be honest.  Lets start with location.  Good luck finding it and when you do, expect to pay for parking.  Not used to that in Vegas.  OK, now inside, pleasantly greeted, seated promptly, got coffee and water quickly.  Perfect!  I really had no idea what I ordered by its name, but it was pretty good.  It had beans, corn tortillas, red and green sauce, sausage and salsa on it.  To be fair, it was ok, honestly, there was a little too much flavor on the plate, my taste buds were kinds confused.  Presentation and quickness of service was perfect.  Waitress was amazing!  Its almost at 5 stars!  Will definitely be back next time in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was great!

GHxAudONYB3L0Z_d9ocdHA.text: This place is aahhmazing!!! My boyfriend and I wanted to have brunch before we headed back home & we were in a bit of a time crunch. They do not tell you the wait time over the phone. We decided to go anyway & saw that it was pretty darn busy. There were at least 10-15 people waiting outside. I almost wanted to turn around and just pick another place. I'm glad I didn't. They said the wait was about 25 minutes when we got there. They took us in within 10 minutes!!!   We ordered the eggs benedict, truffled egg sandwich & the cinnamon biscuits!! They were all super delicious! It literally only took them about 10 minutes (at most) to bring out the food! We were so amazed! We were in and out of there within 35 minutes. Their customer service is great and their food is amazing, what more could you ask for?

VvHlpk4EhLRj4kIiXUh8Tg.text: An Old Vegas classic in the making. The breakfast there was THE BOMB! Had to wait 20 minutes to get a table but it was worth it. The Mothership coffee was good and so where the gigantic pancakes. It's nice to have a meal at these local off strip places. The prices are good and so is the service.

Yqm5rOpPkSkuZ1PdJpUQxw.text: I loved this place. The service was great and I was sat right when I walked in. The server let me know there were vegetarian options and recommended the tofu scramble, which was amazing. I highly recommend eating breakfast at Eat. I will definitely be back on my next visit.

Fx6G_Bs7spiQ4YDljPcU3g.text: So happy Yelp got us here. Off the Strip in downtown Vegas. Great and prompt service, clean, and really cool vibe.   Deviled eggs were something new and they were battered and deep fried. I could only finish one-half bit still loved them.   The truffle egg sandwich is HUGE and shareable. Truffle oil brushed on the bread was tasty but otherwise the filing inside was nothing especially creative.

zQPtU00VFTG-lIfzaQ3hjA.text: Honestly, not sure what all the fuss is about here? Long wait, badgered by hostess about "if your complete party is here" before getting seated (we were all there), prices for breakfast are strip worthy but in downtown and menu states that modifications will be politely declined, smh! It's a simple breakfast/lunch place, get over yourselves! Food is good, about what you would expect at any decent resturant these days, nothing more.

EpeuJgXXCc0D6f72JbUsCg.text: Took the City bus (it was $8 for a 24hr bus pass) from the strip, got off at Fremont Street and walked I'm guessing around 10 blocks to Eat.   We were there on a Sunday and they closed at 2pm as it said on Yelp, I called just to make sure and they told me their last seating was at 1:30pm and yes they close at 2.   We walked in around 1:15pm, party of 2 and were seated right away. I looked over to my left to see this girl eating this huge portion of Chicken Fried Streak...it looked really good and I almost ordered it but after reading on Yelp how everyone loved the Shrimp & Girts I decided I would just have to come back for what she had.   My friend ordered the Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup, she said it was amazing. I enjoyed my Shrimp & Grits , so good I wanted more. Good size filling portions for sure.  We also shared a order of the Cinnamon Biscuits which I didn't expect them to come out the way they did all covered in the most beautiful strawberry sauce. I thought they were just going to be biscuits with a strawberry/cinnamon jam to spread on to but oh no, it was like eating a dessert and since I don't like to share my dessert I was kind of sad I was sharing this...it was soooooo good. Whenever I come back I will always order the Cinnamon Biscuits to start.   The only 2 things I didn't like about the place (and my reason I didn't give 5 stars) was they don't serve alcohol which I was surprised since it is Vegas, I really wanted to get a Mimosa or some kind of fun brunch drink....we just got off the plane a few hours ago and I was dying for something.  What I did get was the Passion Fruit Ice Tea which I wouldn't order again due to not tasting any of the passion fruit what so ever.   Really I give 4.5 stars I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I will always love you bench
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ToYKb_K9qTnpM9tY9uzWTw.text: Great food! Service, food and atmosphere were all a pleasure. Adding this to the list to revisit for sure.

0KCYOzIcqHSxREF5dOXNHQ.text: This place is an awesome little hidden gem back at the east end of Fremont and behind the new downtown container park. Food was amazing and service was awesome! We will definitely make this a regular stop to eat when we visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DWBLTA sandwich with in house made kettle chips

OnG4sclZfk0pH3CllM6j7g.text: Great little hole in the wall joint. Not too far from Fremont St. Watch out though cause it can get a really busy.

I7kU6RACrb-BcP7BDXFfTQ.text: Everything ok the strip is gimmicky. This was a fantastic find for breakfast.  The pancakes were huge - super fluffy and crispy - quite a feat. Funky vibe, nice staff.  Definitely recommended.

5jjJb0K9JBnLGIBtE_JjPg.text: This is a nice little spot to eat. It's a hipsterish environment with a mellow vibe. John Mayer was playing in the background and there were some cool art pieces on the wall. The staff was nice and attentive and the food was delicious and very filling. I went with a party of 4 and everyone enjoyed their meals. Prices were reasonable and the coffee was tasty.  I recommend this little food joint. It's a hidden gem in this city.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and Gravy
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak breakfast
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes

7UDpBMc1KGDUtRXBI6oP4A.text: Pretty gross, tasteless shrimp and grits. Watery and tasted just like water. If this is what the West thinks grits is suppose to be like, it's no wonder people think grits are gross. I had one bite and didn't eat it. Didn't feel like saying anything. The waitress noticed I didn't touch my meal and didn't say anything either. Just paid for for the gross breakfast I didn't eat. Oh well. Now I know. You should too.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watery, tasteless shrimp and grits

NJjO9XTW33TiTmGpASVjgA.text: Dont think. Just order the develed eggs. Omg. This is one of the best breakfasts in downtown vegas. Not cheap prices but food will blow u away. I got the develed eggs and a egg and bacon and potato dish.  Also will mention the very good coffee and this is the first and only restaurant i have found stevia. Go here. Cool joint and amazing food. Breakfast for 2 was $35. Worth it.

Mm0VTUGV-NPgJxIitsgGbg.text: Went back again. Changed my mind, it's a 5. Food is great and comes out in 10 minutes. Unbelievably good eggs Benedict and the best OJ I've ever had in my life.

jPQQUPtFaqFDaONpmKRzCA.text: Eat is a new tradition for my boyfriend and I when we visit Las Vegas! We love finding hole in the wall places and this was a hidden gem! Very nice staff and the food is phenomenal! You get HUGE portions which is great for sharing and the Bacon is amazzzzing! The only suggestion I would make is possibly expanding the seating or rearranging to add more tables, however I like a place that always feels packed and busy! Two thumbs up !

o4-ZE5KMBtV34T6dMoLyfw.text: Every time we come to Vegas this is our first place for breakfast! It's near Fremont Street and I love the menu!  there is nothing on the menu that isn't worth trying.... but please, I do miss the crepes!  Bring them back

wPZS5iIBrjeA3NPlL_ROXw.text: Really good "House" Columbian coffee. Great fried potatoes, eggs over easy poifect! The chic fried steak was a little disappointing, the gravy almost made up for it! Avoid the deviled eggs- the chic apple sausage was yummy too

HShXB0Wg4LUZuIbWaTFsDA.text: We walked up to find the place rather busy with people waiting outside. But we were seated within 10 minutes. To start, we had the deviled eggs. They were fantastic: crisp coating topped with sriracha, chives, and lardons. A unique take on a simple dish.   The iceberg salad was good. It was a decent portion with ample bleu cheese dressing. (I hate when places skimp on the best part.) The truffled egg sandwich was okay for me. I guess I had a different idea of what it would be. It turned out to be more an omelet on baguette.   The service was good even being as busy as they were. Not to sound like a granny who forgot her Metamucil, but the only thing that really bothered me was how loud it was. You really have to speak up to have a conversation.

LxvsBZIv82BLKebV-OIjwA.text: Delicious!! This was my post EDC recovery meal.  It's in downtown, but kind of located right next to some residential apartment housing blocks. Not too much sun cover walking over from my hotel, but there seems to be plenty of street parking. I should have just drove over...  We were seated right away at around 12:30pm on a Monday with a party of 2. Service was quite fast and friendly. Actually, some waitress came over to chat about EDC with us, that was fun! :)  Anyhoo, based on recommendations, I got the Truffled Egg Sandwich. Yeah. It's goood. Eggs and mushrooms are rich and earthy. Bread is soft, warm, and wonderful. Bacon is crispy and delicious. I was a bit too full for the potatoes though!  Beverage of the passionfruit iced tea. It's unsweetened, but with a bit of the raw sugar in it, it's great! Comes with free refills too.  Mildly pricey but totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich!

0ngXnxsBU4Wp8PVz4wnjDg.text: This place is amazing.  Second time here.   Flavors are great.  Save some time on your schedule though because this place will have a bit of a wait on the weekend usually.    Service is great.  Very attentive for Labor Day.  The mood reminds me of a restaurant on San Diego or coastal area.    Only tip, always order the cinnamon biscuits.  Trust me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oesTfkTsA-mLGKMHT2-ulw.text: This a must eat for breakfast if you are Downtown. Located just behind the Container Park on Carson. Pancakes were great, but the bacon & fried potatoes are a must. By far the star was the sausage gravy! Spicy, creamy, the perfect side to cover your potatoes in.  Oh, and toasted sourdough bread as thick as your face. Will most definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RtRTrxJg-BaM77sFWy-qiQ.text: We found this place via four-square & Yelp this past weekend. Its a great restaurant off the strip, definitely a hidden gem to out-of-towners.  We stopped for breakfast before heading back to LA with friends. Everyone was extremely happy with their food. I had the truffle egg sandwich, which they happily substituted avocado for turkey bacon. The pancakes and egg benedict special were also hits at my table.   The portions are on the larger side, which is the perfect cure for those Vegas hangovers.

H7iqfgFWVVj21uBHjd55EQ.text: Atmosphere, decor and ESPECIALLY the food deserve 5 stars! Not having a liquor license is the only reason they are getting less than that. Went for brunch and most people I know are looking for a mimosa or bloody mary to accompany their meal at a place like this. Had the huevos motulenos which was phenomenal! A flavor combination to beat out my favorite rancheros version as the addition of sauteed bananas is truly a perfect pairing with the beans, chilis, Pico, feta, over-easy eggs and fantastic sauces. Ridiculous!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U2rLaYSockMUgLhJF850nQ.text: Fresh vibe, fresh people, and fresh ingredients. I came here for the brunch bc who doesn't like breakfast foods mid-day? Or night? The food is sourced from local vendors and is considerably healthy. I went for the truffled scrambled eggs w/wild mushrooms, chives and bacon on ciabatta, and diced potatoes. You get a LOT of food. I ate the sandwich open-face style and tossed a slice of ciabatta off to the side. The eggs were light and fluffy. I could smell the truffle on them. The bacon was crispy the way I like it. Did I forget to mention that there's feta? They hide it in the eggs so you don't see it at first glance. A nice little surprise that's for sure. I def recommend it.   Summary: Quick service. Big smiles. Social atmosphere. Open kitchen. Fun menu. Tasty eats. Great choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled scrambled eggs with wild mushrooms, feta, chives and bacon on ciabatta, and diced potatoes.

JFFKRPtrKXdXDdtp7AIj5A.text: So glad we tried it, so mad we did it right before our flight. The food was outstanding, the service was great. So much food! This will be a go to spot on every trip to Vegas from now on.

S2EF5WxUincPuRdI-du0Bw.text: Breakfast can be so mundane, but when done with thought and flair, it really is the best start to a great day. Bravo, Eat! I will be a returning customer anticipating my next visit with hopes to try everything, eventually. When we visit Las Vegas, 3.5 hour drive for us, we always stay downtown. How have I missed this hidden gem? Maybe in part that we always stop when we reach the end of the party under the lights. Today we broke that wall of divergent;) Our next visit will be in October for my daughters 21st birthday. We will tantalize our tastebuds again at Eat!  Btw, Staff is remarkable!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In the waiting area

BUvJgBBkOTPdijdlXfFUBA.text: Amazing lunch in a town where the food can be really bad and really overpriced. We had a simple lunch of sandwiches and salads, with very refreshing fizzy strawberry lemonade.

o9kjAFfFN7Sw4Jg-WchR8w.text: Sat at the counter ... started w cinnamon biscuits which are very light and finished w a strawberry topping blackberry s ... Soo good.  The best was the huevos motulenos. Eggs perfectly cooked and with a great blend of sauces and the plantine mixed in.    Wife raved in her Eggs Benedict as well.  Probably the best breakfast experience I have ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen view from counter

cGH4atohSa06sng6eHH4ig.text: I live in the NW part of Vegas, and it's not too often I'm downtown early enough to catch some of this awesome food I've been hearing about from this hip, cool place called (eat.).  Since today was one of those rare days, I stopped in!   Overall, great place! Not sure I'd go out of my way too often to dine here, but I will definitely be back.   I had the breakfast sandwich (oops, I forgot the name, but the menu is simple).  It was a ciabatta bun, egg, applewood bacon, feta, and truffle oil sauteed mushrooms.  Served with a side of fresh cooked potatoes. The flavors were awesome, and you can taste the freshness of the ingredients....and some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever tasted (usually I won't eat them)!  The service was great, and the staff is friendly. Every server said hello to me or checked my drink refills at least once while I ate. Not everyone likes that constant attention while eating, but I loved it. It was my first time there, but I felt like I was a neighborhood regular! WOW! What an impression...kudos to the staff!  Parking in the area is kind of a hassle and you will usually have to pay, but it's not too much of a big deal.  I also might like to see more variety in the menu options, but I'll have to see if the menu changes on my next visit to (eat.).

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Sandwich with potatoes

jEpPPE7yNcV3mAeRnDw7XQ.text: If you can manage to get out of bed before noon.  I know that's hard to do in Vegas, but if you can, you must come downtown and have breakfast at Eats.  The food is awesome and the owner came out and sat with us while we waited.  I recommend the Chicken fried steak.  Awesome.  Eats downtown on the corner of 7th St. And Carson Ave.  A must stop when your in Vegas.

xvRVOdZE60Trim0EaKG-hQ.text: Brad T. and I were looking for a place to eat around downtown and I checked yelp to see what was nearby and saw "EAT" with such high reviews.  Of course, we decided to come eat here!   We went on a Saturday morning and it was quite pack, which was okay since I had time to read yelp reviews while we were waiting. I was getting really excited to try their food here and especially when I read that they had beignets!  ....We got seated and I overheard a waitress saying that they did NOT have beignets due to the fact that the cold weather was not letting the beignets rise properly. ( I was so so disappointed!)  But it was okay, I was still really excited to eat their food!  What we ordered: Country Fried Steak (2.5): Unfortunately, I only took a few bites of this, so I cannot review it the best that I can.  However, the chicken fried steak was incredibly dry and I felt like it needed more flavor in it.  The potatoes were good though.   Shrimp & Grits (3): I, also took only a few bites of this as well because I was also pretty disappointed how it tasted like. Maybe because i didn't like the fact that my bacon was soaked with grits.  But the shrimp tasted delicious and I like how it almost seemed like it was a soup, but it wasn't.  I didn't end up finishing it, Brad T. though finished it for me.  Pancake (5): BEST PANCAKE I HAVE EVER TASTED! I absolutely loved it! I love how the top its crispy golden brown. Once you taken a bite of it, oh man! it its absolutely incredible! I highly recommend anyone to order their pancakes!  Service (2): The service was upsetting to say the least.  I understand that they are busy, but at least just come back to our table at least one time. After our server took our order he never ever came back to check up on us.  For instance, I forgot to ask for maple syrup with my pancakes, so I couldn't eat it until I had to wait for a server to look straight at me so I can wave at them. Overall, the service was just really upsetting.  The only time he came back was to give us our check.   Overall (2):  Even though, I loved their pancakes the rest of my experience there was just disappointing.  However, I would like to come back and give them another chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak

_k6rVCiQr41PORroP-RbFg.text: This is probably one of my favorite places in the newly revamped downtown area near container park, The food is amazing so was the service in the pricing is not bad at all. If you're looking for a local favorite and also something different this is your spot.

xeNhwB6MpdFQrAjDziepFA.text: Fantastic. Steer clear of the strip and give this place a try. We had the Truffle sandwich, pancakes and hash. Everything was great. Manager was working the floor (as it should be) to ensure a great experience.

6EzlgWbYFV2a8Z4PsivoLg.text: Found eat through Yelp and headed there on a Sunday morning. It's in downtown at the corner of 7th and Carson, right across from the relatively new Container Store Park. There is plenty of 2-hour street parking which is free on Sunday. At 10 am, there were a handful of people waiting, so we put our name down for a 20-minute wait. It took a little longer than that, but the staff was very nice and thanked us profusely for waiting and being patient.   The place has a modern feel to it, you would almost think you were Santa Monica as opposed to being about 10 minutes from the Strip. We were seated at a table for two at the end of the counter high table in the middle. The tables were all far apart enough from each other where you didn't feel overcrowded.   I ordered the eggs benedict and K had the corned beef. I loved mine because the turkey bacon it came with what super extra crispy just the way I like. There was a little too much hollandaise sauce for me but for those who like a lot, then you'll love this! My potatoes were booked perfectly with the right amount of crisp (to me they are the perfectors of a nice crisp!) and the portion was plenty filling for $13. K liked his corned beef but it wasn't the traditional kind you might think of, this one had real pieces of meat. And it came with four pieces of super thick delicious Texas toast.   It was a great breakfast especially if you're planning on hanging around in the downtown area. We went across the street to check out the container park and walk off breakfast.

jEs5IBqpgSpyOZJtoOcRjQ.text: f the strip, this place is where it's at great food, great staff  our family of 4 LOVED each breakfast dish we tried and we tried 4 different ones  i will never go to vegas for work or play and not stop in here

vcKcjh-6jTOvRJCjtxMqVQ.text: Of all the new places I tried (9!) during my nearly 3 week jury duty stint, eat is the one that has stayed on my brain the most. At least once a day since I visited there I've envisioned that wonderful chicken banh mi. You've already seen my rating so you should know that this is not an unpleasant thought whatsoever. As a matter of fact I wish I could get some sort of chip implanted in my head that would push out anything negative that entered my mindspace and replace it with the deliciousness that is this sandwich. This is an idea I'm fairly certain I can convince at least Mark Cuban of on Shark Tank. When I went to eat. to eat. (ha!), I was not surprised to see it jam packed full of people. That was one of the more disheartening things about downtown in general: it seems that most of the really good places to eat like eat. require a short wait to be seated or require social interaction to a level I'm generally not comfortable with. Thankfully I tended to venture out to lunch on my own and its much easier to get a table or seat when you're by yourself than otherwise. If there was ever a case to be made for not having any friends whatsoever, it's that you can get a chicken banh mi sandwich from eat. approximately 10 minutes faster than if you bring a friend. I got seated at the bar relatively quickly after I arrived, and after perusing the menu I decided pretty quickly on the chicken banh mi because it sounded good combined with the fact I didn't think it'd offend my lactose intolerant sensibilities. There's not much more I can add to what's probably already been said about the chicken banh mi, and allow me to steal another members perfect picture of it s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com.... The flavors popped, and each and every component of it was welcomed into my mouth. One thing I'll say is that it's not denoted with two asterisks on the menu which is code for "spicy", but the slaw on it did contain jalapenos and I actually found myself drinking quite a bit of their wonderful iced tea to counter this. I LOVE spicy food and still thought it had quite a kick, so something to consider. Service was extremely fast and efficient, and my iced tea never came close to being empty. Price was extremely reasonable for what I considered to be an excellent meal. Bonus: On my walk from the courthouse to eat. (which turned out longer than I expected), I got to see a screaming match between a pedestrian and a driver which provided me a few minutes of voyeuristic entertainment. It's the little things in life.

DNC4m73FFLQiw3aBb3g-Pw.text: Love this place. Hubby read about it in the Sunset Magazine and I questioned, "What does Sunset Mag know?"  Well, was I wrong.  It's in Downtown where the street has posted "Neighborhood Watch", so you know it's not a great place to be at night.  The place is clean, bright and modern looking, located approximately 2 miles from the Strip. The food: 1. Beignets, $8 for a place of 6 rectangles, 2-3 inches.  Very good, like donuts but NOT as good as Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans.  Came with jam and a "to die for" cinnamon butter. 2. Chicken fried steak, $13.  Hubby says it's definitely homemade because the shape was irregular.  I had a bite, good.  But we both agreed we like the CFS better at the Pork Store Cafe in SF. Came with potato chunks. 3. Shrimp and Grits, $12.  I loved this dish.  Layers on the bottom of my dish was creamy, soft grits, topped with a tortilla, bacon strips and the shrimp sauce with large pieces of shrimp.  It was more than enough for 1 person but I stuffed myself and ate the whole thing so as not to waste any.  Milk, $2 and OJ $4.  The chef was working in the back kitchen with 2 other cooks.  This is my bookmark place for local breakfast.  Serving staff were so friendly and were a good tag team, helping each other out, even better than some of the restaurants in the hotels on the Strip.

gyR8MsWJ6r2Dmt3AK8-iEw.text: Loved the feeling inside..very inviting. Host was friendly and helpful in getting me quarters for the meters as there is only metered parking. Be sure to park next to the restaurant as neighborhood a bit shady. Husband and I took our young boys and we ordered two coffees, 2 strawberry lemonades, the pancakes, chilaquiles, granola and fruit, eggs and bacon dish. I wish they would have had a kids menu as we spent $50+ for breakfast. Could have gotten away with only 3 dishes as the portions were big and we ended leaving lots of food which is a shame because bottom line was the food was very good. Service was great. Would go back again. Liked that it was in the old part of Vegas so you can avoid the crowds and explore a retro part of vegas afterwards.

_sHTGNZtc20DPorQh0vdvQ.text: Decided to grab some breakfast on Saturday morning, saw eat. On yelp decided to try it. Waited about 30 minutes but it was well worth the wait. Walked In and sat at the bar area, service was so fast and friendly feels like your family when your there. I ordered the eggs Benedict, and my boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak. We got to see the preparation, because we had seats facing the kitchen. The food was amazing and you get a lot of food for your money. Everything was so fresh and tasted amazing definitely want to go back and try other items on the menu. A must go if you are in the downtown area.

a3tDKWQyrXlsAZ7oWmp0KQ.text: Really good food and nice service. The pancakes are great, but make sure you are hungry because they are huge! Also, make sure you don't come here starving because there is usually a long wait but once you're seated the food comes pretty quick. All of their egg dishes rock.

28PQuUhVe-pJ3HnYNRjUXA.text: This place was such a pleasant surprise!  Everything was fresh, mostly seemed to be local and was chef inspired.  The bacon and eggs were simple but we'll executed.  The truffle egg sandwich was very unique and a must for a repeat visit.  Service was above averge.  Seating is limited,  has outdoor seating also.

ZEhoABPuupCo7w0ecfjrVg.text: The fries meal is flippin awesome and the hunky bartenders in logger outfits are a nice touch. Top ten favorite bar downtown.

134p_xzNZPSRmitVBJszLw.text: Wow!  This place is good!  The atmosphere is modern, the staff are kind (sometimes slow), the food is always amazing. I don't think I've had one thing bad here. However, the prices are a bit high. But then again, it's the only place around where the food is made from scratch. Their homemade potato chips and potato salad are insanely good. I don't normally go for mayo on anything, but it's absolute perfection. Their posole is amazing (love that it's clear broth and not red), Reuben sandwich is amazing, breakfast foods are perfection and those potatoes. This is definitely a comfort food place to go, if you want to take a nap afterwards. No joke!!  It's unbelievable. Pricey, but worth it. I guess. If you don't have the money, you should probably stick with Taco Bell and don't complain about how much it costs. The owner(s) probably want to buy a bigger house, put their kids through college and they have something really amazing here, so why the heck not!!  The prices haven't hindered the majority of clients from going here. So be mindful of what you order. Also know, if you're on a budget, I believe they have an ala cart menu and you can purchase 2 to 3 things and keep it under $10.  Enjoy!!

JpmXhIQj7G3pisUv-Pb_-w.text: Truffled egg sandwich is to die for!!! Went today for brunch and it was great. Just wished they served mimosas, although it is refreshing that a restaurant in Vegas doesn't serve alcohol.

qXayQONadt_gdPkbwVBbUA.text: A little off the beaten path but only by a block. Truffle egg sandwich was incredible! And the potatoes were so well flavored you didn't need to add ketchup or hot sauce. Just an all around great dining experience.

qpyGSsm3j_G1MtnyKczPmQ.text: Yum! Pulled pork lunch special was amazing! Reuben sandwich was just as tasty! Can't wait to try something else next time. Saw some pancakes on someone else's plate and they looked so good. A superb choice for breakfast or lunch in Las Vegas.

o4hDVnzoPfp0A8_Omm6PMQ.text: SO SO SO Disappointed. I am usually one who writes positive reviews, because being that I am a business owner, I like to praise others for what they do right..rather than only the wrong. WELL today I was SO upset that I vowed to write a review because any place who treats their guests this lousy is not getting my business.   My bf and I came in around 10:30 am.. the hostess informed us that the wait was about 20 min. COOL. then she said oh wait, are you two OK with the bar top? That is open now.. we said sure. She said ok, Ill get it cleaned and you can go over. We misunderstood and walked over to the bar top only to be confronted by the server who basically asked who sent us, and we were escorted back to the hostess where this waitress whispered to the hostess in front of us. SORRY didn't know it was that BIG of a deal. Then we waited an additional 30 minutes while we literally watched the waitress and hostess clean off all the tables... SO the restaurant was practically clear and clean and un-seated while we and MANY others waited in the waiting room. It was just ridiculous. Why would you wait to seat people who have been waiting, and clean the whole place up. Mind you the bar top had already been cleared and was clean and we were still waiting waiting waiting. WE LEFT and I cannot tell you how upset I am still. Drove over 25 min to get there for that RUDE and horrible customer service. Hope they clear that strategy up asap.

MZbk_GBUrnlQXbGEbIFJKg.text: I was looking for a place to get a quick breakfast and Yelp directed me to eat. The name is interesting by itself, but the interior of the place is nicely intriguing as well. eat. is a small, clean restaurant with a 'young' vibe. I was seated quickly and ordered a pretty standard meal- scrambled eggs, bacon, and toast. Although it is a simple order, eat. managed to impress. The eggs were very smooth, the bacon nice and crispy, and the toast was perfect- it had a very 'homemade' flavor. In addition to the great breakfast, our waiter was very friendly and helpful.  A unique, simple, and tasty place to eat.

xMatmimIAgdndd53khwOGA.text: Came here a few days ago for lunch. I had literally just bought an extra large ice tea at a local coffee shop before we walked in. When I put our name on the list, the hostess said "I'm going to need you to finish that ice tea before you get seated" there is no way I could finish it that fast. I found this completely ludicrous. I only drink a certain kind of tea that most restaurants don't serve. If they don't have it, I always order water, so it's not like they were missing out on a huge beverage sale by letting me bring my tea in. I completely understand if I came in with an alcoholic drink but that wasn't the case. I was so annoyed by this that we decided to leave and went to another nearby restaurant instead, one that could've cared less about my tea. So they lost out on much more money by us leaving than they would've by just allowing me to have my tea. I go out to eat several times a week. I have never, ever been told I cannot bring my tea in. Very disappointed

LTpGNDNTuKOJ-3H0IYYnYg.text: Great food. I absolutely love this place. Had the shrimp n grits and will be back again. Quick prompt and attentive service.

ihe3yTHdqqr1iA6htWWZDg.text: Food was fantastic! I got the daily special which was Prime Rib hash which came with a green chile sauce and two poached eggs, and giant toast. It was all fantastic! I highly recommend this place.

Fj47Tzt1Zo4eroBADQz-Rw.text: The food, well I was not given the opportunity to eat it. The hostess, Donna, took our name, party of two. She said wait 15 minutes, 30+ minutes later she had lost her list, skipped over at least 3 parties and was seating people who had come in after us. I asked her if she had lost her list and with a stunned look she replied yes. We left and went to Pizza Rock which was great!!

1CbsmdZ_r3Kk-smPh0K2ag.text: I have been here twice and I want to love it, super nice place but the service I have gotten was just blahhh and snooty.  I don't even remember the food just that the menu was totally truncated for Brunch on Sunday.

JAsJ--FDf9rwJFC7YabrCw.text: I would give it 3.75. Never would guess a cool little breakfast spot would be located under some shady apartments on 7th street. Sat at the bar and ate. Could see right into the very small kitchen. I only had scrambled eggs and bacon which are nothing to rave about but it's hard to mess those up. Some of the other dishes that came out of the kitchen looked great!  I'll have to try the pancakes next time!  Would definitely come back.

pEKvDa7TomdR_JJatY7LtA.text: Ohhhhhhh brother...where do I start....really... really bacon that was pre cooked before...SMH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I can stop but !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! No No No CHEWY!!!! for upscale foo foo restaurant who yuppies say greatness don't know breakfast.  With sooooooooo many great breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas this one is leading the back of the pack right under omelette house in Summerlin.  I really wanted to like it but at $50.00 for breakfast I expected AWESOME but the award winning huevos motulenos I can strongly say the judges were paid off banana really??? The deviled eggs were good the coffee was strong...I quess that was it...the service was great and I say the pancake was good not spectacular but ok.  Sorry but I had to write this up...with all these downtown revamped restaurants...I haven't found anything more than you are paying for Foo Foo food

xcqbqJM46HYo4gzj7RDJiA.text: Jeez. Slap your momma good Mac and cheese and being from georgia that is comes with a lot of test trials

kW8HbWs-O6_a1QVZ1UZ3_w.text: I am so happy to have this place within walking distance. It is exactly the kind of locals place that I have been missing since moving to Vegas.  The menu is very creative and the food is really good. I'm not a meat eater so most of it is off limits to me but I am hopeful that they will offer more veggie friendly options in the future.

NRTi0M-xg-mzurkrR19xeQ.text: We found this place completely by accident. I had Yelped another restaurant in Downtown Las Vegas but when parking proved to be a bigger pain in the ass than it was worth, we just drove in the opposite direction. THEN we stumbled upon this gem. I was pleasantly surprised that as "hip" and "cool" as the setting and staff were that they were super friendly. I had my grandparents with me and truth be told, they hated the setting and felt a bit out of place but when the food came, their tune changed. I ordered the Grilled Cheese with Bacon and Tomato soup. Lovely flavor, would have preferred if it was actually hot though. I understand that restaurants get busy, but really? It's soup. Luckily, it was super tasty so I didn't stay annoyed for too long. But again, the staff was super friendly and were very speedy with recovery when part of my order managed to get lost. All around, the meal my family and I had here was pretty damn good. We all took turns trying each other's food. The chicken pozole was tasty, the corned beef with poached eggs was insane, the menus were short and to the point and it really is a beautiful setting in a kinda blah part of town. If you come here, you'll have a great meal and maybe you can flirt with the server with the amazing beard. (Seriously, he was so good looking it was distracting) I'll definitely be back. I'd love to meet the owner next time. From all that I've heard about her she seems pretty awesome. See you soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with bacon and tomato soup. Delicious and crazy filling.

cxt2rX4ImJHVGckOcniwyA.text: My visit to "eat" was as much an experience, as it was a meal. I had heard the chicken fried steak was awesome, so when our Friday morning Breakfast Club opted to check it out, I was pumped. I was really hoping my excited anticipation wasn't setting me up for disappointment. Located at 7th and Carson, this delight of a dining establishment is part of what is rapidly becoming a revitalized downtown and put off a trendy and hip vibe. I was anxious to read all about the chicken fried steak, but much to my dismay, it was not on the menu. What now? I had my heart set on CFS. No worries. They still have it. You just have to ask. It was, up to this point, the best chicken fried steak I've had in Vegas. It had a flavor like no other, and I have yet to figure out what it was. The tender, tasty meat was surrounded by the ultimate breading. The potatoes were cooked to perfection and the eggs, well, they were just eggs. However, there is something they do with a pancake that words cannot do justice. Thick and hearty, with just enough crispiness around the edges. The service was friendly and attentive, with the beverages kept at the optimum level for consumption during the meal. Our party was split down the middle on the coffee. Some were impressed, while others weren't big fans of their joe. Expect to pay a little more, but it is well worth. Will I return? You betcha!

iXI2Mms2evdecrsflYaXig.text: This place looks like the sort of place you'd find some unique eats.  Not so much.  Decor is cool,  sort of an urban style concrete floors and exposed air ducts vibe. As for the food, I ordered the huevos motulenous with black beans peas bananas tortilla and feta cheese.  Just way to much going on in regards to flavor.  It tasted like they just put a scoop of 5 different sauces and put it on top of eggs. My wife ordered the truffle egg sandwich.  It was so so,  tasted no different then any other.. all in all nice place good quick service but not worth the taxi ride to dt vegas..

K8fsK7Trw0vVToPoca1MQg.text: Been here several times for lunch and its a solid triple with one man on!   I always walk away happy.  Got great sandwiches, soups and breakfast and lunch is the specialty, with a hip downtown flair.  Need a quick meeting with a business lunch, get there EARLY to get a seat, there is a wait sometimes, but not long.   Also, weekends I am sure are slammed.   I go during the week for my trips and its a great hipster trip every time.   Solid grinds!

_xXnqeGF0F5C_LZyzX3fgg.text: My mother wanted coffee and since we were across the street at container park I told her let's eat at Eat. It was going to be our first visit. We walked in at 245 which their sign says open until 3pm and told they were closed. So next time  maybe i should be there by 2 just to make sure I'm allowed to stay if I even go back. They get 2 stars for serving my mother a coffee to go anyways!

VTEMK_GdpTM0igcfPciczA.text: This place isn't great it's PHENOMENAL!!!! The staff is courteous and fast. The choices of food are unique. Sitting at the counter was fun! The iced coffee was great. They have Truvia as a sweetener choice. Definitely coming back next time we're in Vegas!

xqktJz4m5cBe1lhaE_n2IQ.text: Everything was delicious, very fresh and vibrant flavors. Loud indoors, quieter outside.

blbkUX-NbSBnsR9mXFtWaQ.text: This place is 5  stars hands down in my book.  Walked right in, got seated right away.  Intimate setting.  Had 2 waitresses helping us, 1 to take and bring drink order, one to take food order.  Coffee was black and strong, just the way I like it, and the food came out super fast.  Had the shrimp and grits and it was amazeballs!  Complete soul food.

PE8tn088bBcJPeP8rO6oKg.text: Delicious and regular human portions! We shared the corned beef hash and an order of eggs benedict.  Both were so good!  My only disappointment was that the poached eggs were a little overdone.  The service was awesome as well!  This was by far the best meal we had in Vegas!

vz2sAZVDVoTaUzDW9o4lIg.text: Great atmosphere, even better food! We came in for lunch, I had the blt with their homemade chips mmm. Would definitely go back!

z94O4CLPXI116JIlM9IcdA.text: My husband and I came for breakfast we were told wait would be about 25 minutes it ended up being about 15 or so. But people that came way after us were seated before us and they had the same amount in their party.  A lady even noticed and said were you not here before us we shook our heads. I personally wanted to leave because I am all about customer service and equality but my husband said lets just eat and make sure not to come back.  I got the juevos motulenos which was good. My husband got pancakes they were good as well.

Uh9yds8S_eIj7zhpKBNiOg.text: Loved the grilled cheese with tomato soup! Also there chicken pot pie, which I thought was a little on the bland side but the crust was perfectly crispy yet flaky. Wait wasn't too bad--we did there close to 12 on a Friday. We did note a long wait later as we were leaving. Place was crowded and the you can barely hear yourself talk amongst the noise level. Pricey for what you get. May come back to try there breakfast selection, but too expensive of a place to dine often.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie, on their winter goodness menu.

WxRF9AA219z7QpJl5qQzNQ.text: I have been to eat a number of times and I really enjoy the Reuben sandwich. Last time I went we got a pancake for my daughter and I ended up eating the entire thing because it was that good. Next time I go I honestly will just eat pancakes.

lw5qdp-zPjT49Dn4HzeOSg.text: Terrible. Waited over an hour and service was extremely bad. Not worth the wait. Go to MTO!!!

fAFRzPwzjHiRKEVpS4_KjA.text: Loved it! The food was amaze balls and the menu size is perfect. While some complain its small and limited - it keeps things special and Delish. Maybe I'll change my mind once I have had an opportunity to try everything at least once. Great vibe - staff was friendly - and portions were hearty. I cannot wait to return. I support independents most of the time and this one should surely be supported and not just because its Downtown - support it cos its good food! No one we ate with was disappointed with squat!  Two things I'd like to see change - the in your face policy about check splitting or CC dividing  - it's everywhere including your bill folder.  Second - while I still have food on my plate - don't bring the check. Small improvements - and honestly if those are the only two complaints- it's me who needs to get over it!

L-P9oe5c8kqTjoGcTjuYkA.text: Wonderful breakfast and great friendly service. Everything was fresh, and the coffee is roasted locally.

TGIXUq-biDYy0bUoVmpvpg.text: Truffle egg sandwich was amazed amazing!  Went on Sunday and expected to wait at least 30 to 45 minutes we were seated within 10 minutes. The coffee was smooth yet a good bold flavor waiting staff was excellent place was clean but the best part was for sure the food. The seasoned potatoes were outstanding as well as the truffle egg sandwich!  I regret not getting the cinnamon biscuits as the tables on both sides got that and it looked amazing. Next time for sure.

lwnK_IXNaCrvDlmpbE28KA.text: Perfection for a place like this in every bite. We love the staff and kitchen peeps.

rpqDRVEMRtNCl1P0pCPrEQ.text: I remember the days when I used to long for the hole in the wall breakfast joint in Vegas that i would go to in other cities like SF, LA, SD, NY, and MIami. The longing is over for sure. This is a very quaint breakfast and lunch joint that serves excellent food in a very approachable, no frills atmosphere. You can tell that the person that owns puts their heart and soul into it daily. How can you not love a place like that? The food is definitely good, just needs a little more refinement. Not bad in anyway, but the mexican eggs dish was good, but a little too saucy. It could have had a little more focus. The music could have been a little louder giving more atmosphere. Small things, little tweaks will take that place into legendary status. A definite must try.

4VBUklXQZ41hD3EhaxXJNw.text: Wow if you are in Vegas and want a great breakfast or lunch this is a must! Fantastic sandwiches and soup. I split a Rubin and it was just the right amount, I also split a Lettuce wedge. The blu cheese dressing was fantastic.  Please do yourself a favor and stop in for some great food!

q0afh0HfnrMj3wllSE6-_Q.text: I enjoyed the food. I had the shrimp and grits...yummmmers!!! The staff was kind of slow. Took the waiter 15 minutes to take our drink orders! The place is cute and a little small. The girl at the next table was SOOOO loud, we were unable to hear our own conversations. The food was delicious.

RYk2xkYUeYYSRBkFeNRVfA.text: Started off looking promising but poor service and cold food sent our experience spiraling downward. Chicken fried steak was fried way too long and seemed to have been plated out from under heat lamps, making it a barely warm dry mass of over-breaded mystery meat. As a forced substitute for the beignets which are not on the (just printed on plain white paper) menu for the winter, the cinnamon biscuits with berries were good, but again, the biscuits were cold and this fell apart like dry cake. And, staying with the theme, even the coffee was luke warm. Maybe the hipsters are going too far with projecting the Coolness into everything.

BLQwX-d9ZGPz8BQfQC-jEw.text: Excellent little breakfast and lunch place. Friendly and fast service with a nice atmosphere. The brunch special breakfast burrito is fantastic! Definitely recommended.

UhbYfRoUinYqHew5bZShiQ.text: Went to eat there this afternoon service was great food was good but I was in absolute shock by the way one of the managers was scolding the employees in the middle of the dining room..... I will not be back!

VqINlbwfCvrbAg_qrRtdCw.text: Delicious chicken sandwich. Wife loved the arugula chicken salad. Great staff and atmosphere for a 2 year old. Get more than 1 high chair though!

tJlaFacyqcJyfMcZodhb9g.text: Stopped in here because we needed to grab a bite to eat while charging the car.  Super-tasty food.  Foodie worthy.  Lively (noisy) ambience, great service.   Had the truffle egg sandwich and the arugula salad.  Perfect to share for lunch.  Apparently they just opened another restaurant down the street called Chow.

EkDNBDfv7yjNlBrQZTccKA.text: Eat was quite good. i had the corn hash and toast and it was pretty good. My friends and i went there for breakfast and we were impressed. The atmosphere is pretty laid back and it feels and looks clean. The food amazing. You will like it. It would be a nice breakfast date place too :)

xmyg3xo4dj9ZOUtDU8AfAw.text: Food gets a 5.  Noise level at community table gets a 3.  However, I went for the food and it did not disappoint.  I had the oatmeal, my Friend had a salad and my husband had one of the egg dishes.  Everyone one individually would have us come back.  I have been wanting to get to EAT since hearing Chef/owner Natalie Young present at Inspire.  Her passion for cooking and her business model were interesting -- her food is outstanding.

Fhfgh1HOxH6qQR0qgRXOfg.text: WE LOVE THIS PLACE!  OMG!  The food and service was fabulous!  The eye-candy all ofer the place was FABULOUS!  (wink) we are a fan for sure!  Cannot wait to get back to Vegas to try this place again.  Congratulations EAT!  xoxo

lzcQNL25Lqw-VV3iz9yzxg.text: Delicious food, great service, and Chef Natalie was there managing the front of the house. I was disappointed that the 2 things I wanted to order were not on the menu that day (the beignets and the truffled egg sandwich). I had the downtown benedict which was delicious and the side of potatoes were actually crispy not soggy! My husband had scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast. The sourdough toast was thick cut, buttery and delicious. My son got the pancakes which by far out shined everything. The pancakes were the best I've ever had, and I am not a pancake person. I have not had pancakes in years. I prefer waffles because I like a crunchy outside with a tender middle and pancakes are usually just soggy sponges. But these pancakes were absolutely amazing. They were crispy on the edges and so fluffy in the middle. The flavor was perfect - buttery and light, just needed a dab of maple syrup. I could not stop taking bites from my son's plate. Luckily, he could only eat 2, so I could eat as much of the 3rd one as I wanted to. This dish has made me rediscover pancakes!  We also had the strawberry cinnamon sugar biscuits. The biscuits were nice and tender but the strawberry sauce which was poured all over everything was too sweet and overpowered everything. I would have preferred a side of the strawberry sauce to dip the biscuits instead of it being dumped all over.  For a small place, it gets quite loud. It gets crowded too so expect a wait. The wait is worth it though, especially for those pancakes!

UkfkLd6y2ZModoyR5delcw.text: As good as you've heard.  Bloody noisy though.

bylXIzt3_uWvAK2d5FgbSQ.text: Hardly find a place like this in Vegas. Trendy, fun, great food, and awesome service. We waited for 45 mins, but you know what... it is worth a wait!! 2 parties came out from the rest and told us this. " It's worth a wait!!!".  And, they let this teenager band playing on Sunday morning, they were great, and better they were given opportunity to perform in public. Good Karma, good energy.

a_Tn4vk-s6lmSCkg4qR1hQ.text: Place is amazing. No better breakfast/brunch in town-- the Huevos Motulenos were out of this world. Good coffee, great service, and awesome space right in the heart of downtown. I hope they expand to offer dinner at some point! Give it a try.

FT5gQO_zcsVPv5CiMWhmrg.text: I just had the best breakfast I ever had. Great atmosphere, Friendly staff. Unique dishes that explode like diamonds under your tongue.

GlkpRmqsC9pno9JwUkg3Pw.text: very good food, easy comfortable atmosphere. tends to be crowded and a bit loud.

_TEyl0Nj94MjxscF3ZFBYw.text: This is the best American/comfort food for your dollar you're going to find in Las Vegas, where everything is outrageously overpriced.  That does not speak to how good the food is, so I will say directly that it is downright delicious.  It's definitely comfort food.  During our week in Vegas, we ate breakfast here three times.  The servers are offbeat types, and the decor seems to invite hipsters, so beware of pretentious hipsters, but we didn't do much about it except laugh a bit. From the chicken fried steak (eat the potatoes with ketchup, they taste much better), to the shrimp and grits (cheese or no cheese, both good), to the Kat's deviled eggs (deep fried and unlike any other deviled egg you've had), to the eggs chilaquiles, the food was prepared with an attitude of indulgence.   Basically dishes cost around $15.  I was not a fan of the coffee.  The servers were friendly, although one of our waiters behaved more like an actor trying to make an impression than anything else.  Overall, huge recommendation for this place.  It closes at 3pm I think.  We did not have to wait on any of the mornings we went, but we also tend to get up early (it opens at 8am).  By the time we left, there were sometimes people waiting for a table.

62nwOqhpk5JSyuGt0DK4vw.text: I have yet to find a great breakfast restaurant in town until I ate at Eat!  Everything a breakfast lover would want with a big emphasis on freshness.  Chef Young did a great job with a funky space that has had a line for tables which is a testament to the execution and wholesomeness at Eat.  Lunch is great too with great salads and sandwiches and make sure to try the Posole!  It is absolutely delicious!  I am a fan and can't wait to go back!

XdBbTA9d1mU1k-k-Bah7MQ.text: Let me start this by saying that I'm not the biggest fan of Vegas in general.  A few friends and I stopped through on the last leg of a 10 day road trip for some much needed R&R--yes technically the road trip was supposed to be the R&R but something about driving 2000+ miles warrants a fun night somewhere.  After the debauchery had taken place, we needed something to eat. One of our group had been here once before, and highly recommended it.  I ordered the chilaquiles and was not disappointed..We all had some great coffees, and good conversation.  It was nice to be able to walk off the main strip and find a nice, calm, place to eat, with quality food.  I would definitely go here on my next trip to vegas.

qDRJGA8VH1M4sHHVyQiLYg.text: I missed the field trip for a co workers bday here when it first opened.  Naturally, I had to redeem myself.  I just got back from a long drive to Amargosa Valley, so you can bet I was ready to EAT!  I had no idea that this place was purely a breakfast and lunch joint, tucked away in old downtown Las Vegas.  You can find Eat on the first floor of a small apartment complex where the area has been sprawling into an art district.  I only could find street meter parking, so if anyone else knows of any other parking options, do tell.  As I walked in, I wasn't sure what to expect.  I heard of this place from Anne, who is an amazing foodie expert that is not on Yelp and I been trying to proselytize her since.  The last thing I remember her saying is that they had an enjoyable experience except for the fact that the owner gave everyone a hard time about splitting costs between multiple debit/credit cards.  Other than that, she rated the experience a 3/4.  I was expecting more of a southern fusion breakfast lunch place.  Boy was I surprised to learn that this place is a trendy and modern eatery.  I was solo dolo so was seated at the counter.  Staff was friendly, but I already had my guard up waiting for the owner, whom I never ran into at all.  I still won't judge character based on anything but my own assessment, so was eager to meet her.  Maybe next time.  At the counter, I asked the nice girl across the counter what was good and she recommended the range free chicken sandwich topped with arugula, tomoatos, basil mayo and paired with a dill pickle and potato salad.  The Potato salad was one of the better ones I tried that ain't homemade.  The sandwich was delicious, but a bit drippy.  Still very tasty and I am a huge fan of arugula so you already know.  It was hot off the press and went well with my fresh (bottled) ginger ale by Bruce Cost.  A hint of spicy notes got my tongue's attention, but $4 is much for an 11.5 oz. beverage.  I love the decor which provided a hip yet serious look reminiscent of bustling citified diners in larger metropolitan areas like Seatown, Frisco, LA, Diego, etc.  Something I find foreign in LV and glad to see it finally arrived.  I can't wait to try other menu items and anticipating the next time I can share the experience with friends and fam.  I recommend y'all check this out if you are visiting or just hungry...a great representative of the LV foodie scene!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie with arugula salad
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Range free chicken sandwich

aCnibnDAIazAUVRgB41DNg.text: Great find for us.  So, so tired of the hotel food, if I have to go to another buffet I think I'll croak.  Great food, fun atmosphere.  Cost in the $10-12 range. Definitely a do again

f5hVx3VRCRynS-5IFCkEOg.text: The food was fantastic.  I came in for breakfast and got the Chicken Fried Steak with eggs over easy.  I have read some reviews before hand that were kind of bagging on the service.  That was not my experience.  The server I got was attentive and friendly.  Definitely going back.

NsoEj8Zc5MBbf4227aj6yg.text: If downtown I suggest getting away from the hotel restaurant thing and trying Eat. It's a 5 minute walk from the Fremont area. Fresh food, well prepared in a nice, friendly environment. We ended up going for lunch one day (thanks to Yelp) and returned for breakfast on another.

XTB2_X8J7-dXnNk2Iyf2WQ.text: Perfect meal! Fresh ingredients, extremely nice staff, cool atmosphere, fair prices. Well worth the trip off the Strip. Hidden gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stitch Factory
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JpC_PQPovbKKHzYhSKRP-w.text: DTLV hangovers cured. Eat is fuego. One of my favorite breakfast spots in town. Get there EARLY. Truffled Egg Sandwich... Wow. Pancakes were delicious and I loved the Cinnamon Biscuits. Easy to find and worth a second.. third... even fourth trip!

mjXvMa7_I0GNNhvKY6CyFw.text: This place is such a hidden gem!!! The atmosphere and decor is amazing! The truffle egg sandwich is to die for and the grilled cheese was enormous. Robert, our server was super knowledgeable and helpful in guiding us through the menu and making recommendations! If you have a chance to stop here you won't be disappointed!!

QhtoUt8XotCPDEHylkM2hw.text: One of my favorite places in town. Love the service, the staff there are awesome, and the food is amazing.

NsnGq8W1KkyC4M-jTFA-vA.text: The food here is nothing short of spectacular. The flavor profile is sophisticated yet comforting. I had the pleasure of ordering the brown sugar biscuits, just enough sweetness to them...I also ordered the truffle egg sandwich with chives potatoes. Oh my was it delicious!!! Truffle can at times be overdone but this was just enough. My husband had ordered the huevos (rancheros?) we forgot the name but that as well was amazing! We were very happy to have stumbled upon this place while in Vegas! Kudos to the chef!

Pe2wETSc3cQwg7Azay_Y8Q.text: This place is lovely and definitely a go-to spot downtown. The service is always very friendly and helpful when ordering. The decor goes along with the new atmosphere downtown is trying to create: trendy with a little bit of vintage to it. Everything on the menu sounds good to eat. The service is always fast and the food is fresh.   My favorite is the grilled cheese. It's enormous, and the bread is fluffy and perfectly toasted, and the cheese is good quality. I also enjoy the truffled egg sandwich if you feel for a breakfast mood. Both are completely satisfying and worth a try. My boyfriend loves to get the huevos motulenos. The combinations make it sound interesting, but the flavor is amazing. The waiters love to recommend to start off with the cinnamon biscuits, and I would, too.

scRllRTutZ9NlDiGvu1ouA.text: Tried this place with my wife for Brunch. The food is just ok. My wife found a couple of Bristles from a brush in her food! And they burned one of my pancakes. We brought that to their attention with the intention to improve their service but got taken with one of the staff as if we wanted some sort of a comp! We can pay for what we consume and don't need a Freebee! Still left a decent tip after all of that! Not good to judge like that!

RTQnmDx2PI118w_WZ7lTeQ.text: Came here with my mom and beau. I the place was packed, and still received a warm welcome from the wait staff. Seated promptly and was served in a timely manner. The food was piping hot. I ordered the shrimp and grits, which was a big hefty serving.  My mom and beau dishes week equally delicious.  Great addition to the whole laid-back vibe of Downtown Vegas. Yummy!!!

kU53d-0ZJYh0YdpIHoZ0nA.text: this is a really creative and delicous restraunt. really enjoyed the deviled eggs. like how they seperated the eggs and turned the yolk into sauce and put it on the fried egg whites.creative! - by A.T.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1V2gomsaj5sDIMb0fBUz2w.text: Came to eat with my sister for breakfast! As soon as we arrived we got seated quickly. Our server was Allison, very nice server, she recommended the Green Chili Chicken Posole, which in fact was really good! It isn't a traditional posole, but it does have a hint of spice that makes you keep going back for more! Just wished they gave me one or two more tostadas and chicken. My sister had the Cinnamon Biscuits which are always lovely to have! They were soft and the strawberry compote wasn't over powering which made it sweet and savory! Last but not least my all time favorite deviled eggs (couldn't find the name)! Those are to die for! They are amazing! Its a creative and upgrade version of deviled eggs! Overall, the experience was great!

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Biscuits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Chili Chicken Posole

FtbEaoqkOG1LDXnkT_YCCg.text: This is an off-the-strip joint for brunch. It is definitely a hidden gem - from the smooth yet strong coffee, to the reuben, to the breakfast items. Quality ingredients, flavorful masterpieces.

XAUC_fxVF9RGSJ1d3fSvqQ.text: Fantastic breakfast! Went to breakfast on the main strip our first day, wish we came here first so we could come back! We started with the cinnamon biscuit. Four nice sized biscuits to share. A great start. I had the egg truffle sandwich, my husband had the chicken fried steak, dad had eggs benedict and my mom had the pancakes. We each had a little of everyone's and meal and all were excellent! Highly recommend this place to any and all.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IakCF-o-CWCZ35obaM-XHw.text: Too much hype for the price.  Portion size not that great.  Cool place if you're a hipster.

hc-YNG-UKrUTcU4IwY4Aaw.text: Hit up Eat on a Tuesday morning after Punk Rock Bowling and it's a well deserved 4 stars - wish I could have given them 5 but they pulled a boner in my book.  Really nice looking place - modern/industrial look.  Solid breakfast menu with American and Mexican items - everything was around the $8 - $12 range.  My brother got the chicken friend steak and I ordered the chilaquiles. The food came out quick and it was excellent.  Now, I have to start off with the fact that if you're looking for traditional chilaquiles you're going to be disappointing, luckily the menu was pretty clear what I'd be getting so I knew what to expect.  A few things that you could call non-traditional -  they used cheddar cheese (not cotija or fresca), they poured the salsa on the chips, the chips aren't cooked in the salsa, and finally they topped it off with a big old turkey sausage!   So you're probably thinking why I'd give 4 stars to this abomination???  Because it was delicious and it filled me up - what more can you ask for?  The chips were good and held up on their own, even without the salsa.  The salsa was delicious!  Spicy but not too hot - just enough to help with the mild hangover.  The eggs were nice and fluffy and they served a good amount of them.  The Sausage was a little on the sweet side, but still really good.  I tried a little bit of my brothers chicken fried steak.  The breading was nice and thick and tasted amazing.  The steak was a really thick cut - none of that thin milanesa type steak.  The home fries were top notch - nice and crispy on the outside and light on the inside.  Oh & the coffee was excellent as well.  So what was the boner move?  They brought the check about 5 minutes after the food hit the table - I hate that...  I don't care if they say "no rush" I still hate it.  Other then that the service was good, they checked on us a couple of times, coffee cup never went empty.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in downtown for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles

_h2ZQyHx4SXuUW4MVLAjzA.text: Every dish we have eaten at eat has been amazing. We've been many times. Our kids afore their pancakes, and I, the non pancake person do too. They are divine.   Gets crowded on weekends, sometimes quite loud inside.   I often recommend this to out of town friends visiting Vegas and I have never heard a bad review from anyone I've sent here.   If it's open (its a brunch place) you should go now. You won't regret it.

fXO1FlsLIZXhy6xdl0Nf2Q.text: I'm sure the place can be better but i had such a horrible experience that made my family upset. We waited the longest time for a table. We came in at 1PM and didn't get seated until 1:40PM when my family of four agreed to sit in separate tables for two people. We were told the wait would be 20 minutes and were continuously told we were "next" while many other parties who came after us were seated before us. Sitting down, they wouldn't even take our order and told us to order drinks first. The food was slightly overpriced, and I wasn't able to enjoy the food due to the service experience.

YTCdlTvNS8Vo6n9t5QOhXA.text: The manager, Michael, wasn't very accommodating. It was a little busy but when we came in so they weren't able to get our whole party together (8 people). A few minutes after being seated at separate tables, a table opened up next to the other half of our party so we had asked the manager, Michael, if we could all sit together and he said (under his breath), "why does it matter?". After moving to the table next to the other half of our party we asked if we could push the tables together and the manager said no. Doesn't seem very customer friendly..

I_2d2FUIQM2mhkUIFxWC7w.text: This place is great.  It's a bit pricey, but, the food is very good.  The deviled eggs appetizer was amazing.  I will definitely visit again in a future trip.

56H00cWez1_gQ8prNVkzKA.text: Sadly no gluten free options...Coffee was good. Everyone enjoyed their food some what the chips where old on the chiliqules

aYKiDXLwQPi92EytVbOmYw.text: an amazing find. Even though it's far from the strip it's definitely worth a visit. You can always stop by "old Vegas" afterwards.  I got a mushroom sandwich with eggs but my friend both got a Reuben. My sandwich was delicious but nothing in comparison the the life changing Reuben. If you're a fan of Reuben's it's a must. The bread was so airy and big and delicious, that it just melted in your mouth.  The atmosphere was very hip and trendy definitely felt nice to sit down. The writers were fast and gave good recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom egg sandwich

H0Jo9hL4YStFs-ttSPt4-Q.text: This is my new favorite breakfast spot. I'm so in love with the corn beef hash and pancakes it's amazing.  My family and I have been here the last to weeks and we love it. The service is good and the restaurant is nice and intimate. Our server Laura is also great!! We will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs any style

Vhi5ioqlYx36tWQ1etIzgg.text: This place has friendly service but has a very limited menu. The potatoes were really salty, coffee had a bitter taste, and the house made jelly was runny and bland. I had their version of huovos rancheros and it had some bananas in it which was really weird. None of it taste bad bud it wasn't good either.

DC-Fz0LU9hIfTzdzCiP-gg.text: if you want to be rushed through your meal by an incompetent waitstaff more concerned with turning over tables than the people they're serving, this is the spot for you! bonus points for your flighty waitress forgetting to put your order in along with the rest of your table and then bringing the check to you 5 minutes after everyone has started eating! try harder, be better.

dmyIwOCQUZntrpjPDu6YTw.text: First time here. From out of town. Just drove by and looked online to see what food they had. Saw the deep fried deviled eggs. Had to park far away. Got seated right away. Ordered strawberry lemonade. Disappointed there were not refills on the lemonade. They put too much ice in the glass for no refills. It was like three sips of lemonade. And she didn't tell me when I ordered that there were no refills. Had to keep asking server for straws. (She brought me water after I found out no more lemonade) Also ordered to eat ...the pancakes with the sausage on top and the deep-fried deviled eggs. The deep-fried deviled eggs were insanely delicious. :) Loved the kick of flavor and loved the concept of deep fry and deviled eggs. I wished there was more than four eggs. I wanted to eat a whole dozen eggs like that. LOL. The pancakes were dry and tasted like baking soda. We asked for more syrup which was a little jars and were not told that they were $1 each. The whole experience was good. Just put some sugar in the pancake mix and don't charge for extra syrup.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes with suasage
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried deviled eggs. Yum!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice decor

rVQTWYsXm1-q3dcImJ7gBw.text: Excellent breakfast! My first time to Vegas with my boyfriend who grew up here; neither of us had ever had Eat. before.   We had the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote--2 biscuit halves for each of us, plenty of compote, plenty fresh blueberries. Delicious. For entrees we had the corned beef hash (comes with super buttery toast and poached eggs) and chilaquiles. Chilaquiles was perfectly spicy, but the hash was my favorite of the 2.   Service was perfect. Thank you, Eat.!

aGiKrBSejcsjQNulNgs57Q.text: This place is just ok.  After all the hype, rave reviews and etc I guess my expectations were perhaps too high.   The deviled eggs are fabulous, but the positive review ends there.   Went on a Sunday afternoon, the wait was only 5 min. I saw online that the Benedict, truffled eggs and cinnamon biscuits are a must-try. I got the Benedict, my friend ordered the chicken fried steak. I added on the deviled eggs after seeing them go by ( there's 4 pieces).
