My Benedict was fair, the hollandaise tasted metallic in flavor, the English muffin was mushy, tomatoes were mushy, with the spinach and egg it as just a lot of much with a weird metallic flavor. I added a ton of salt and pepper as the overall dish was under seasoned.   The pancakes looked amazing, the chicken fried steak gave my friend diarrhea. Sorry tmi.   The main waiter seems tired and not very engaging. The hostess and cocktail waitress (although they don't serve alcohol) were very friendly, nice, chatty and fun.   Highlight: the deviled eggs were deep fried, crispy, topped with a spicy tobasco sauce and bacon. Sooooo good!   This hipster joint with a staff wearing all black with their messy hair with abundance of tattoos showing is more of a place to say you went to than a place with good, delicious and amazing service. I honestly wouldn't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak was a nice generous portion, nothing special. Sorry to be so negative.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict was bleh
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs were the only good thing.

JfwweIck29mUZVSK638lGQ.text: Great place!  My daughter took us here for lunch.  Good food, great service and friendly staff!

sPNwsJZWce36kfCQzqN1Zw.text: Organic off the strip meal.  Our first time here.  This place is located in downtown vegas.  Street parking.  Small location with about 20 tables.  Food was decent tasting,   the jury is still out on whether I would return.   I had the chicken fried steak, it was ok nothing impressive.   Toast is huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak Breakfast
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the open kitchen from our table

Wa1hvjb23A5ljFBPoPOBDg.text: I have visited Vegas several times and always make a trip to Eat. while in town. The food is always good and it's a staple for every trip.

kPC4yTRYxRqiLA9nIEOYhQ.text: The place was super busy when m'lady and I went, so it was pretty loud. The strawberry biscuits were a little dry but the sauce was perf. OH MA LORD the potato chives were like mini baked potatoes with just the right amount of onions. I like that they serve you grilled cheese with this super thick bread that was crunchy and fluffy at the same time.   Overall the food was great the service at the counter was awesome. We were served by kevin and Kevin is the man. Kevin if you're reading this.. you're the man.  The environment was a little to loud for my liking but hey its a brunch place so its all good.. 5/5  Definitely would recommend to all the homies.

taQ9WA7sqHUDGcRMlex_VQ.text: I had read about this place on fb n newsfeeds n of course yelp...so i wanted to check it out..im glad i did..greeted a nice warm hello when i got in the door..sat at the counter..server brought my coffee right away...i was lucky to get a seat its so busy n crowded..but i can see why..the food! I didnt kno what to order so my server recommended the shrimp n grits...im glad he did..omgg so delicious! Creamy, cheesy, shrimp, bacon=deliciousness! My server was nice n funny he made my dining experience gr8..Excellent food n service..i will definitely b back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stayed in downtown caifornia hotel...it was easy to find using gps on cell..walking distance
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp n grits..delicious!

B0Q3-LIDOwMy2q3APNuzCA.text: Reminds me of many other hipster places you'd eat brunch at in LA (that's a good thing)  +Food: Brunch with a little twist.  Very good. -Huevos Motulenos: This was my least favorite of the things we ordered.  It wasn't bad, it just wasn't very memorable.  Sauces were nice, eggs were cooked well, plaintain was a nice surprise but overall it was okay for me. +Cinnamon Biscuits: Plated really beautifully with berries and warm strawberry compote.  The biscuits were fluffy and delicious and the compote had just the right amount of sweetness. +Corned Beef Hash: If you're a corned beef type of person, it's the right dish for you.  It wasn't overly salty, it was cooked well and crispy, eggs were perfection.  Also the fluffy sourdough was just awesome to eat with it.  +Price: I think it was affordable (~$15+ a person)  +Decor: Very cute and hipster.    +Wait: Wasn't too bad actually.  I expected a huge wait on a Sunday but for 8 people, it was about 30 minutes.  The food came out very quickly as well.  Overall, I'd definitely eat here again.  I like getting away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

eLBb0rYecGetWc0Dx1r2kQ.text: While visiting Vegas we were looking for great, local eateries... places off the strip, away from the tourists and the nasty attitudes of those who cater to the masses (who don't seem to care as much about great food and service and really only want a huge buffet.). We came across Eat. and saw that the rating was in the top 20 of over 4200 restaurants in Vegas and just HAD to try this place... we were soooo happy we did and can't wait to go back for more on the next trip!  Upon entering, it's got a unique look and feel, like a kitchen and dining room.  The staff was all very happy, smiled and gave great service.  Restrooms are clean!!  The menu is AMAZING!  What I did was look around, quickly saw the Reuben that someone was eating and said I wanted that!  Otherwise, I'd still be sitting there trying to decide, because the menu was THAT GOOD!  We also tried their soups, the green chile chicken posole and the Black Bean Chili.  Both were very nice, but that green chile chicken posole blew me out of the water!  The many fresh flavors coming together in that soup were truly AMAZING! WOW!    The Reuben was one of the BEST I've ever had!  The corned beef on it was perfectly done, but the bread knocked it out of the park!  It was a HUGE, THICK and SOFT coupling of rye that resembled sour dough in it's softness, texture and size, but tasted 100% like a grilled rye - it was AMAZING!  The perfect amount of condiments were also on it, to include their amazing house-made sauerkraut!  The arugula Salad was very nicely done... lots of fresh veggies, greens and great flavors all coming together in a salad bowl - get it with chicken on top!  In all, this is an extraordinary experience... one that'll leave you wanting more!   EAT HERE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula Salad w/ grilled chicken on top
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Chile Chicken Posole

kH7ZNF7I1A-xKP919uKNZw.text: Omg, so delish! A friend was raving about eat, and I saw it as we passed through downtown Las Vegas during the RNR Half Marathon. We returned the next day. Of course, I still had the rungries. My biggest challenge? Picking what to order!  I settled on breakfast (because breakfast is the best!) and ultimately decided on the Truffled Egg Sandwich. First of all, it was ginormous, and came served with a GENEROUS portion of potatoes. They were more than happy to sub turkey bacon for regular bacon (thank you!) and it was great... not the kind of turkey bacon that leaves you feeling deprived. I did polish off the sandwich, but couldn't finish the potatoes, even with help.  For some of my friends who got toast with their dishes, wow, I have never seen toast so thick! It looked like thick cut French toast, but was just regular old toast. The ginger ale was also fantastic and I heard the coffee was, too.  Our server was delightful and knowledgeable about the menu.   My only wish is that I had time and room to eat through more of the menu, but I guess that means I will have to make a return visit. :)  Thank you for a fantastic meal!

AGk1qaNer6giH4Rvyje2eQ.text: Once again never a disappointment love the food and atmosphere.. the attention to detail in every plate and dish as well as staff is phenomenal

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mPIwzShYl-Of5EnkIQVQBQ.text: First time trying it and it was amazing! Needless to say I finished before I could remember to take a picture. They had the tofu scramble and I wasn't expecting it to be this good. The dish was well flavored, and the employees were extremely helpful. Thank you for having that vegan option, will be coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LuFQyIsDVtwqKSvpTuAi8w.text: They have the best pancakes in town, they are crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside!

3voj34S1Pxsqvj4jUFzqMQ.text: Absolutely amazing food.  We had breakfast here on a Saturday morning around 10:00, and it was pretty busy, but there wasn't a wait.  I had a fried scotch egg on top of pancakes, and my wife had eggs Benedict.  Both were some of the best food we have ever had, and we weren't hung over so our judgment wasn't skewed.

-MoNnQie1eNUtk8fljl-yA.text: We decided to come here the last time we were here in Vegas. I decided to go early to get a table and it was about a 45-minute wait on a Saturday's morning. We were able to find street parking. I think it was $1 for every 30 minutes.  There is a waiting room inside with a couple of chairs and some people were waiting outside. It was a very windy cold day so we decided to wait inside.   I decided to go with their special of the day. The special was an egg Benedict. It was two beautiful poached egg with spinach and tomatoes with sauce. I thought the tomatoes and the sauce didn't go too well together. The potatoes were okay.   I also ordered the cinnamon biscuits. This comes with the warm strawberry compote. I only enjoyed the sauce. We didn't even finish this dish.   However, my friend ordered the corned beef hash. This dish was good and tasted like Chinese sausages.   Overall, there are tons of options and compare to others places I been to, this place is just okay to me.   Love the hostess, she was super nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9qgZjocWq98LgaK8BRTYUw.text: We ate three different thing off the breakfast menu. All three were the best I've ever had. So good I had to talk myself into not finishing it because it wouldn't fit. Our server was wonderful and the Manager really paid attention to the customers, detail and cleanliness. Wish this place was in my home town.

bexTu9x-QD6teDrn-8X4TQ.text: At a recent visit to Eat for breakfast we had delightful servers and delicious, fresh food.  The chilaquiles were lick the plate delicious! As were the fluffy pancakes, corned beef hash and chicken fried steak.  Was the best choice for breakfast for sure!  Glad we found you.  Keep up the great service!

P-tXSwYFVmfoj0Q73OI8NQ.text: This is one of those modern trendy spots that delivers in quality. After eating at some of the more unsavory spots stinking of cigarettes over the smokey gambling floor, it was refreshing to experience some quality food.   There was a little bit of a wait, but luckily we were waiting inside with a little air conditioning to keep us alive. While we were waiting we looked at the menu which was small and focused on a few varied crafted objects.   The place has a polished concrete floor. It has a modern factory look. However, something I thought was really cheesy was seeing someone's journal or notes posted all over the place. This was posted on a wall, taking up the space of the whole wall going on about some nonsense about seeing a flower or something. Here is where they were trying too hard to be cool. Another unnecessary decoration thing was the separate large bows for sides. This had a dramatic effect, but was awful when it came to actually eating the food.   I got the spin off a BLT. The bread reminded me of Texas Toast without the cheese. It was cut in very thick slices and was grilled on either side. When eating it, I felt it was a little too greasy because there was too much oil added to the bread. The sandwich had bacon, lettuce, tomato, and something else... I can't quite remember. I got the breakfast chive potatoes which were good in flavor, size, consistency... mmm.   There are several more items on the menu that I would have liked to have tried if I were to be in Vegas again sometime. I will return if I actually return to Vegas.

E1GlqB-aE-oinDPhmRfnaA.text: We always make a stop here for the pancakes.  It's the best.  However this time it was not.  Still the same yummy goodness but the cook did not seem to know how to cook it.  He kept chopping into the pancake with his cutter.  Why would you do this?!  The poor pancake was literally chopped to death and fell apart when you ate it.   Service still wonderful.  But the pancakes was a disappointment.  Chef Nat, please teach your cooks how to create your beautiful pancake.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula Salad, Marcona Almonds, with Chicken
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Reuben with Chips
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Chopped Up Pancake!  Chef Nat- please teach your cooks your magic.  Don&#39;t be choppin the pancakes

thjlOLEQKrsD98RmFrUFkQ.text: I was in Vegas for two nights and considered doing a buffet while I was in town. But this particular morning I didnt feel like going to a buffet but rather wanted to go and try something local. Went on yelp to find breakfast or brunch places and Eat. Came up on the search. Given how they had outstanding reviews.. I knew it must get busy as the afternoon came closer.   Decided to try this place out. Located close to Fremont St. Street parking isnt too bad. $1 an hour pretty much to park at a meter. I got here around 915am. Though there were plenty of people inside already Im glad we made it before it got even busier.  Ordered two appetizers since I wasnt sure how big portions were and I wasnt too hungry. This place takes Deviled Eggs onto a whole new level. Deep fried deviled eggs was worth the order and the picture. Actually wished I had more room for a second order lol. The consistency was light and crunchy. I loved how there was different flavors giving each bite a bit of a kick to it. Very delicious and very well presented.  The warm strawberry compote cinnamon biscuits were amazingly delicious. Im not really a biscuit persoj but the texture of the biscuit was just perfect. Not too sweet or salty. Really hit the spot with just the right amount of cinnamon & strawberries. This appetizer was actually a big portion. Good enough to feed 3-4 people in my opinion if shared into smaller portions. But if ordering for yourself..  its enough to be a plate on its own.  Service here was really good. Very nice and came back to check on us a few times. Would definitely recommend this spot to any locals or even visitors. Just make sure you come early because this place gets packed pretty quick. Well worth the wait too if you had to wait for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Biscuits with warm strawberry Compote
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled Eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Sandwich

UJH1DIfHysLzbexy29Mwnw.text: Fantastic food! We had the Mexican egg dish (the banana part was a bit strange, but I'm glad I was adventurous and gave it a try!). The granola was great, cinnamon buns delicious (the berries were a bit disappointing), BLT huge and so good!   And the coffee! It was fantastic!  I highly recommend it!

QiV7fHIBWTPf8haVP688XA.text: Delicious. Timely. Great food. Great service.   Came in around 11 on Tuesday. Still wanting breakfast (which I was happy to see they have certain breakfast things all day) we were quickly seated upon arrival.   Waiter was attentive but not annoying.   I got the shrimp & grits and my hubby got two eggs any style (comes with homefries, bacon & toast). After seeing the toast coming out of the kitchen I too ordered a side of rye toast.   EVERY SINGLE THING WAS DELICIOUS. The eggs tasted fresh, grits were good, pico on top of tasty perfectly cooked shrimp was delicious. The texture & flavor of the bacon was spot on. Even hubby remarked that sometimes one thing on the plate is the "good thing" that saves the dish but the potatoes, eggs & bacon again were all very well done. The toast is a very thick huge slice of tastiness! Even saw another guy at the next table holding a piece of toast shaking his head "yes" telling his friend that the toast was tits.   Would definitely recommend & return.    Added bonus coffee was really good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits side of rye toast (had to have a bite before pic)

66Da6g5XSmhHmpGUPb219w.text: I was very impressed by this restaurant. The food was delicious and moderately priced. The coffee was great! The service was friendly and efficient! I had the corned beef hash and my sister had the eggs Benedict and both were tasty. I'll definitely be back.   I have noticed that this restaurant has a long wait on the weekend. We were sat right away, but we were also there pretty early (8:30 am).

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs benedict!

Hs4xgK92uUb8q6YYQqO9lA.text: Really good food and very cute decor! I like the theme of the restaurant as well as the convenience  of being a good breakfast spot away from the strip where most restaurants that offer such selection are located.

9C3NvEgMT8ij9tuisji-Bg.text: Great place and 5 stars on the great customer service. The wait was not bad , it was like a 20 min wait. All worth it, food was tasty and good portions.

JXE6sdl97FT491OWUo4TiA.text: I wish I could give this place a better rating because the food was good. I enjoyed the food but the waitress seemed forgetful. Forgot things in our groups order. And at the end when I paid my bill, I gave her a large bill with the exact change(coins). She took the bill in a rush with the money before I could explain how I wanted my change returned. So I wait, and continue to do so u til she doesn't come back. I was expecting $20 change but didn't receive it. So I go look for her. I ask her for my change and she thought the rest was tip. So I spoke to the manager handling the register, and she wasn't too nice. But said to me, why I would give more than my bill in an accusing way. I only had a large bill and had no small bills. I won't be coming back here and will be advising others to stay away too. After an extended discussion I eventually got my change back.

LesrBWXa3-L7buy-71Wb3Q.text: Went here a few months back but forgot to write a review so Im doing it now. Had the pancakes with the apple sausages, it was really good and really filling, the pancakes are quite heavy on the stomach so come with an empty stomach. I really enjoyed the sausage which had great flavor. You are definitely getting your moneys worth at this establishment with its big portion sizes. EDIT: updated review, added picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EyoSLVX8I_Tks3_64XnoKA.text: I'm actually being quite nice for giving them 4/5 because of the mediocre service.  Came here on a Saturday morning , so there was a bit of a wait (around 25-30 min.) but I didn't mind.  Atmosphere-wise , I love the charm this place has , just exactly what downtown needs :) It's located across Container Park so it's a pretty popular spot.  Food-wise , I already had my heart set on the cinnamon biscuits (w/ strawberry compote and powdered sugar) 8$. I don't think I ever had biscuits in my life but this is probably my new favorite breakfast food. The strawberry compote wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. DEFINITELY ORDER THIS. My friend who recommended this place to me also told me to order the truffled egg sandwich 12$. It was super good , everything was put together well. The scrambled eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly , and the mushrooms and feta cheese complimented the sandwich well. The chive potatoes were great , but taste better with the hot sauces provided on the side. If you don't like breakfast foods , they have soups , salads, and sandwiches available.  Service-wise , hostess was very kind and she reminded us of the breakfast specials today. Our server Roberto on the other hand , not so much. I don't like bagging on servers but we just got the vibe from him that he felt disinterested the whole time. Right after we were seated , he jotted down our orders and that was the last time we saw him. At least our food came out quick but he never checked up on us , asked how was our food , or any refills. Literally three different people asked me in less than a span of 5 min just to ask if I was done with my potatoes although I was still eating them and even had a fork in my hand. Three people can ask me if I'm done with my plate , but not notice my glass is empty.   If you're looking for a breakfast place , I recommend this place because the food was excellent. Best breakfast I had in a long time. Just don't have high expectations about service. Also note , when it's busy they will only accept one credit card. Hostess offered to split the bill in half for two cards though.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry lemonade 4$ and orange juice 6$
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free lollipops out the door
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits 8$ - a must order !!

6pXmB8flTV2ZPDg7-9gLRA.text: Located in LV's hipsterville area by Container Park, eat. is a delicious little spot for breakfast or lunch.  Arriving on a Saturday about 11:15 we were immediately seated at a small two person table and given menus.  Looking around at the cute interior, I noticed the plant boxes and old bottles, kind of a mid century modern lighting and mismatched chairs. Not feeling very Vegas in aesthetic, which I can very much appreciate, I looked forward to our meal with anticipation that it would be equally appealing.  Orders placed were the huevos motulenos, delish, both green and red salsa atop over easy eggs, crispy country potatoes joining the plate. My hubby had turkey sausage, country potatoes, scrambled eggs and a few huge pieces of Texas toast. We started off with the flavorfully airy and decadent cinnamon biscuits with a sweet strawberry compote, wow!  We noticed the other plates brought around looked very good also, the pancakes were ginormous and the chicken fried steak looked good (or so says my hubby, I don't fancy red meat).  Service was quite good, the place was clean and well maintained.  Total bill was $39, minus tip.  Will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy m-fer.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits with delicious strawberry compote

UmrIBaN76BoQHh24XKJVFA.text: Disappointed. After reading the many great reviews I was expecting a great breakfast. The place has a nice vibe, is clean,  and the staff is very friendly, but the food was nothing special. I ordered the Thursday special. Paid $17.00. It was good but I didn't think that was a good value. Sorry Eat.

vNQnY4ZKrmrtwvw4wdDlkw.text: Utterly outstanding breakfast in every way. We had a good sampling of items.   The pancakes: thick, fluffy and indeed perfectly golden. So tasty, they didn't even need butter or syrup (not that we didn't add them!).  The truffle egg sandwich: rich flavor, crusty good ciabatta, huge.   The chicken fried steak: not greasy and surprisingly light, with a crispy breading and just the right amount of (sausage?) gravy to not overwhelm.   Then, my faves: the cinnamon biscuits--like their version of French toast in biscuit form, and SO GOOD. The sweet (but not cloying) compote and fresh berries made it a delicious treat. Tasty bacon perfectly cooked, crispy but not crunchy. DEVILED EGGS! The white fried in panko, the devil on top with bacon crumbles. You can't miss this dish, a good appetizer or dish on its own (I ate most of ours).  The space was perfect to enjoy the food in, open and roomy, with great creative touches on the wall. I like the open kitchen and bar seating. Everyone there was also friendly, our server was so fast and also helpful, and the food came out fresh, hot, and quickly. Good for my hungry self.   I hear they get packed on weekends, so get there early. On a Wednesday morning, we got right in, and there was plenty of seating. Even with a wait, it would be worth it. I hope we can squeeze in another morning visit before we leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes and sausage

N2ttaPcu_wOtSGRRW2GUCg.text: Went back and tried the biscuits and fruit!!! I'm not a morning person but this was worth getting up a little early (I think the stop serving them at 11) I'm also not a biscuit person, these have changed my mind, so incredibly tasty and moist!

UjMhu4FBIV1qlSVc3hKDtQ.text: I have never been a huge fan of breakfast food until now.  Every single thing, every single thing , is beyond delicious. Just ridiculous how amazing everything tastes. I ate my entire plate and then finished most of my boyfriends and still wanted to try more. It's all so light and filling and so wholesome. Some of the combinations are a little strange, but once you get it on the table you wonder why you've never eaten it before. Eat here!

9YH5-ukwI00OxLZ-93Oebw.text: Don't go here for the French Toast reviews- none on the menu and server had never known of it there Not a traditional breakfast menu and No Substitutes but food is good and atmosphere is relaxed and friendl - a bit pricey

AA-pAxGhb8vYk00cDo2LoQ.text: This place was so awesome for a small good relaxing  breakfast spot! I felt like it's a little secret inside the heart of downtown... tried it for the first time today &I would totally bring other local friends here.... certain breakfasts served until 11am but other than that no bar (alcoholic beverages) which is the downside but still totally worth it ! Our server I don't remember her name ,( petite with really short hair ), was so nice ! Thank you !!

CFalfr8llVAKn9tIdGW39w.text: The cinnamon rolls are amazing and the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup is awesome.

r_ufqK9T4hpcq5jCS7jUPA.text: Stopped here for a break from the road trip and yelp, you rock, and so does EAT! It has a deceptively small menu, but the food's flavors are fresh, exciting and mind blowing. This is anything but one-note food. Rock on!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ben-yeahs!!!!

4nlSTfw5YxDd-LGcYBsyew.text: We arrived and the wait was out the door. Luckily our party of 13 wasn't in a rush:))). Had an opportunity to meet the owner during the wait. She guaranteed me that the wait would be well worth it. And boy was she right. Not one complaint from anyone in our group!!!

jU2eCfaaEgdBbE0R_YSyKw.text: Hipsters can cook! Fantastic spot for breakfast/brunch in downtown. Service is friendly, but we did have to ask for coffee refills twice. We had the corned beef hash and chicken fried steak. Both were great choices and the food portions were reasonable. They felt like they were made from scratch and they did it right. The accompanying sour doe bread is really good too.

tZcz1kTOvgPt016RVExNeg.text: BEST breakfast I've ever experienced. The people were so incredibly cool, and the food was memorable to say the least. Get the truffled egg sandwich and/or the huevos. Ahhh-may-zing.

9vjbAAKsOlDcGBnrptiCXw.text: Great food in an urban atmosphere!  Excellent service. Highly recommend this diversion from the corporate strip.

WqN59HKdEgqzEKPIT6cbjg.text: After living down the street for the entire six months that eat has been open, my wife and I finally made it in there for brunch today. It was pretty good, with some hiccups.  First, food and drink. My wife was accidentally brought an iced tea instead of coffee. That turned out to be a good thing, because the iced tea is awesome - I ended up drinking more of it than the pop that I actually ordered.  After a bit of a wait after ordering (the place was almost at capacity but there were a handful of tables free), our breakfast arrived - beignets for my wife and chicken fried steak for me. The beignets were good if a bit doughy. My wife said they were better with the jam. I assume they're made from Cafe du Monde mix since there's a box of it on display behind the counter - I'd rather see them make them in-house.  We both thoroughly enjoyed the sourdough buttered toast, eggs and "smashed" potatoes that came with my chicken fried steak. The gravy was more flavorful than other places I've had it (which is a lot - I'm on a kick for it lately), and the meat was obviously freshly breaded. But, it was really quite tough! Whomever is back there making it needs to smack it with the tenderizer a LOT more. A LOT MORE. BEAT THE CRAP OUT OF IT. SERIOUSLY.  At the end of our meal, we got to talk to Chef Nat personally and hear about her plans for eat's expansion - including the dog-friendly patio outside!  For me, the experience was more like 3.5 stars - but I'll round up! It's on the high end of "good" with lots of potential to be great. eat doesn't need Downtown Project's money to prop it up - it's strong enough to stand on its own. We will definitely return when the patio opens to give it another try.

IQZTKXsmkuNxpivye_TgkA.text: This was my last meal for my trip to Vegas and it was so good! I'm so sad that there isn't one in CA but I'll be sure to come back here anytime I come to Vegas ! Great food and service !

Wmn5wla5Yjhse9iLDBlUVg.text: This place is part of an art and food revolution taking place in a part of Las Vegas that one would never have set foot in 5 years ago.  It's located on the ground floor of a divey motel but don't let all that fool you.  The food is outstanding.   Everything is prepared in a gourmet fashion so if you're looking for diner quality food go else where.  I really enjoyed the Juevos - it had New Mexico green and red chile in it!  Talk about yum.  The bacon was applewood smoked and cooked to perfection.   Great coffee too.  Service was friendly, not too quick on the draw my friend was complaining but I was ok with it.  Definitely recommend over all the tourist traps.

pV_T_VXbO8njiCiiUWbsbQ.text: A friend of mine that lives in Vegas suggested we eat here for brunch as she has been wanting to try it for sometime. I'm so glad she did! The food was incredible and the service was good. Get here early because there will be a wait ( so worth it ) if you can; sit at the bar tops facing the Kitchen. Their bread is to die for!!

BXYq2Ys5CID3UgEejPAzQQ.text: Stopped in here for a late breakfast. After being seated asked the server how they brewed the coffee. "Ugh in a machine." Yeah thought I could possibly get an espresso or pour over. Order the downtown eggs Benedict. Came out soggy and over salted. Husband ordered the chicken fried steak and say he won't be back.

F0Io6LXweopYYh_dkKQuSg.text: Cool vibe. Kinda "foodie Diner". I would eat here again but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.

_i9KujHOV23ZZXrT5X0czA.text: Hostess will not serve you unless All your party is present. Found out later that there are open spaces at the counter. I had the Huevo dish it was good not great unusual combination hoping it would be a taste sensation with the black beans , bananas and peas over the egg and tortilla. Shrimp and grits. The shrimp was delicious but the grits were tasteless and runny. Perhaps it was an "off" order. The pancakes were amazing perhaps the Best pancakes ever. Will come back but will stick with the more traditional breakfast items.

ZvWolwq24PGKtOP14B5Txw.text: Wow, another amazing find in Las Vegas that's off the strip and well worth the visit! Went here for lunch and the place was packed with only a few tables open. There were a lot of locals, which immediately made me feel like we made a good choice. We didn't have to wait as the hostess happily seated us near the kitchen (which by the way is open, so that was fun). We ordered drinks and then placed our order with a friendly waiter. I chose the "killer" grilled cheese with tomato soup and my boyfriend had the BLT with avocado. They both came out of the kitchen in record time... we were not expecting them to be so quick, especially with a packed house! Both dishes were amazing. The bread is to die for! It really made the sandwiches. I loved both dishes (had to sample) but I will say the BLT may have been the winner. It was also served with homemade chips that were especially good. The prices were also refreshing to someone who has been gouged by restaurants up and down Las Vegas Boulevard. A new "must visit" in this city for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer Grilled Cheese

QyrbGfcohif_s6ShTpRamg.text: Finally a restaurant with attentive but not interruptive servers. Excellent breakfast. Eggs bacon toast potatoes. Nothing trying to improve (ruin) the basics, just very ecxcellent food.

Xl5xLPZIYJteRYZRu-wCgw.text: I ate at Eat and it was delicious.  I tried everything because my family and friends all ordered different menu items.  I could not recall all the names of everything we ate;  however, I do recall a great meal for a great price;  most of Vegas is giant fast commercial in your face; yet, when you get to Eat, it is a calm atmosphere with great people.  Around the area of Eat is Old town and you can't go wrong spending time in this area;  moreover if you like Roulette go to El Cortez .50 chips, 2 $ min...you can take $20 and if you play your game right you will have paid for break fest at Eat !  The staff was as good as the food!   Sometimes if you are lucky the head chef and owner will be sitting outside just listening to comments to figure out how to make Eat even better!  ENJOY!

fakFKiySkaEiRpAtf4H55w.text: Poor service. Had to get the waitress attention and ask for drink refills.  We were a party of 3 they messed up 2 of our orders. The one could have been deadly due to a food allergy.  It was over $50.00 for 3 to have a simple breakfast. The chive potatoes were burnt on the outside and raw in the middle. I would not recommend this place. Poor service and over priced.

8QPW0c5U_A4e0pCSoJLuAg.text: Delicious! Fantastic service. Came here MDW 2014 Saturday morning at 9:45am, seated for a party of 2 within 5 mins. They were already busy when we arrived. Right when we sat down, they asked if we wanted to ordered our drinks. Maybe less than 10 mins, waitress checked back to place our order for food:  large orange juice- $6, it taste fresh, so I'm not sure if it's freshly squeezed or pre-made  chicken fried steak- $14   Downtown eggs benedict $13-  Side of turkey bacon $4  Coffee $3

A2_Bx5QOx9Va8hIAQDqMqQ.text: The food is good, but not great.  I was in town for a conference last year around the same time, and drove from the strip to this place to eat every single day.  Fast forward one year and things have completely changed: 1 cup of coffee 1 (single) pancake 2 eggs with bacon Grand total: $20.55  After inspection of my bill, I noticed that I was charged $4 for a single pancake.  Really???  Needless to say, that was my last day eating there and I will never go back.  This is unfortunate because I would have brought many of my fellow colleagues with me as the week went on and now I will never patronize this place again.  I am, by no means, a cheapskate; however, there are other breakfast places in Vegas that will offer much better quality and value for their product(s).

pa_WnPZDgkGMh_oiXqFcxQ.text: Really good place to eat. No pun intended lol   When I got off work I was really hungry. So. I decided to go eat at eat. The service was amazing but I will have to get my own silverware. Not meaning to sound like a prude. Plus the end of my toast was too hard.  On the bright side it wasn't that much for all that I got. Side of eggs. Side of bacon. Side of toast. Plus an entree salad. (Of which I forgot the name but it was their special.) Goat cheese, almonds, greens, strawberries, buleberries, and their housemade special vinaigrette which I also forgot the name. Oh, plus water and an Arnold Palmer.  I also wanted to add, every server came up and asked if I was okay at least once. *thumbs up* That's good service.  I'm pretty sure it was a simple error to have forgotten the silverware. I mean, I did get there 30 min before closing.   All in all, delicious. :) second time here and I'm digging it. Definitely will be coming a third time.

qB8gpkAJnxJCKCkqne9aWA.text: Have made it a point to have breakfast there the last three trips to LV.  Good food, good service and easy parking in the morning  It is busy but never had to wait more than 5 minutes as most there I think are working locals and having to leave for work.

kNR9yVWkRX0CkAxECKg0Pg.text: Was in town for a few wanted to see if the food matched the hype.  Eat delivers. They care about the food and it shows. If your in town it's a must and ask for the deep fried Deviled Eggs.  Crazy good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NNqnKnaBm78qD5nJgQtfig.text: This is a really cool place. The food was fantastic and the service was great . I had a breakfast sandwich which was DELIGHTFUL! It felt like I was in a Manhattan restaurant. Nice little outside patio as well. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!

Vh_30_DTKPqmHsIOjEqgPA.text: Mixed feelings about this place. There seems to be a good amount of servers floating around, but the service is not all that good. The chilaquiles were bad,  no flavor. Overall the food was decent and the price was fair but the service needs some work. I should not be waiting fifteen minutes for a refill on water.

8watevgQA1_yHUgkxv36iw.text: Food was ok but service needs to improve. Giving 3 stars and hoping it will get better next time I'm in town.

qQcTTtCAsRBkx6fYWJdSkw.text: It was a long wait to get seated but it was well worth the wait. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs, it was a big ass steak, very good ... I'd recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak and eggs!

OM2EAAeA5NTv8o57iQkvQA.text: We walked in and got lucky and got seated immediately right next to the kitchen.  I love that it is open and you get to understand the bust ass work they do.  The food and service was excellent.  I will go back.

1j2YIDJTET9tjijFpEg9Hw.text: All I have to say is that my boyfriend said the truffle egg sandwich changed his life, he hasn't stopped talking about it all day. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits

1QRW-H3dAP9kc9Y-_M9TdA.text: Had their breakfast sandwich with avocado, egg, mushrooms, and feta cheese. It was delicious! The service is good and the atmosphere is cute and fun. The wait is usually 15 minutes since it's kind of small inside, but worth the wait. I wish there was more vegetarian options.

cyR8BYZey6uTvtjoFw6Igw.text: Been here a couple times recently. It's a great place for brunch.   The free-range chicken sandwich is delicious. The chicken itself is just really tender and juicy. The veggies were super fresh.   I would like to see a broader menu though. But I'll definitely come back again.

PVUBB9M9bM-vH9NSWKI1_A.text: Can you please open on of these in NYC?!  I fell in love with this place. The food. The service. The ambiance. Even the location was perfect.  It's away from the Vegas strip which can be a bit too loud for one to enjoy a nice meal but at the same time its so close to Fremont St that has a lot to offer. The restaurant is located exactly across from the back of the Container Park, which by the way everyone should go to.   The wait time here is tricky, it depends at what time you show up. But don't be taken back by the amount of people waiting, every second you wait will be worth it once you go in and eat.   The menu is very basic, but everything sounds great and if you are like me you will find yourself looking at other table sot see what people ordered. So everywhere I turned everything looked amazingly good. For appetizer, we had some biscuits with strawberry sauce drizzled with confectionery sugar....TO DIE FOR. As soon as we took a bite of the biscuit we knew that we were in for a good eat.  For main course i went for the pancakes with an apple sausage and my brother and mom went for the breaded steak, yes STEAK. When they ordered they missed the part that said steak so when they went in for the cut they say that it was not a fried chicken breast, it was steak. And holy moly was that a big piece of steak. Both of them could of ate from one plate. The steak came with two eggs and potatoes. As to my pancakes, it was a simple dish, but boy were those pancakes huge.  They gave me three I only ate one and a half. I couldn't do it. And let's just say that for the price I did not mind not being able to finish it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breaded steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes with apple sausage

PE5gsoxIsIykO2zYYq_PzQ.text: Truffle egg sandwich was delicious! For an extra $2 they'll add an avocado. The French toast is huge basically an entire loaf of bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich.

OhAlxC_oBKo7A3ZjFrg81Q.text: Visited in May 2015 and have added Eat to our list of must "Eat" restaurants. I had the DWBLTA sandwich with the house made chips and it was delish! Fresh ingredients, HUGE portions and great service. Sandwich stuffed so thick with goodness I could barely take a bite out of it. Coffee was tasty as well.  Within walking distance of the Freemont Experience.

_l52Dg2F1vYi_zrwT1ebDg.text: The breakfast was delicious. I recommend the corn beef hash and pancakes. I'll definitely be coming back!

ix5FHPrdTK4TfGLB_JlDWQ.text: Love this place! Food is great and the service is excellent. The drive is a little out of the way to be here often as a local but if you're visiting in the downtown area this place is a must go! The environment inside is urban and feels like what the entire downtown area should be going towards. Love it, I'll be back!

CpanmIpu1AWvs04sjJqLnw.text: I had the corned beef hash, which was amazing. It had so much flavor and the eggs were gorgeous. The bread was light and didnt make the meal extra heavy, like corned beef breakfast usually is.  The staff was very friendly and created a very welcoming environment

z0YFrw4U83lZShjDrbRxGA.text: I went to eat. for the second time last week. It's now a staple in my annual trip to LV. This place is the best if you want something special for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. I adore the deviled eggs... trust me, get them. The sandwiches are wonderful. Coffee is mighty tasty. Anything with the green chili sauce is a win. My friend and I like to try a few things and split them so we can try out more items. I would suggest you do the same! it's all so good. Staff is always friendly and you won't wait long for a water or coffee refill. I like the vibe. Close to Fremont but just enough away to know you are in a local hot spot and out of the tourist trap area. Food is REAL. Staff is friendly. Not expensive. Go for it!

R3A5YNN3sXA1Bs8OLyUpkA.text: Great food, Quick service will defiantly visit this place when I come to Vegas. Great place for breakfast or brunch, a lot of food choices.

oAP9WfLUy4s5eZgl0E-d3Q.text: One of the best breakfast restaurants I've had. They can get pretty packed and crowded so one early. The parking near the restaurants are just meters so brig some change! The biscuits here are a must have the cinnamon biscuits come out nice and warm with strawberries covered in a strawberry sauce, it has a great balance and is delicious! We got the special eggs Benedict and the truffle egg sandwich. The eggs Benedict was alright but the sandwich was good. The portions are pretty large so don't order too much. The first time I also got pancakes and couldn't finish so I knew better this time around. The orange juice, coffee, and strawberry lemonade are all pretty good here too. Everything else seems pretty good so can't go too wrong with anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OoJjgOF7sk1KIuOqAVDQjQ.text: My new favorite breakfast restaurant of all time! Everything tasted amazing and was well priced. Two complaints: 1. My stomach wasn't big enough 2. It's going to be a LONG drive from CA when I crave their food   Do yourself and your taste buds a favor and go "eat." here! See what I did there?!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits with strawberry. Freakin&#39; AMAZING!

UsiYrK5hlMf_w2Rmb1Ml3g.text: Great spot for breakfast or lunch. The food is fresh, yummy, & local. I like the ambiance with nice outdoor area as well. The BLT, eggs with mole, & arugula salad were all great. The service was friendly & prompt.

JRaG7e4aRvwXeCtrl_xfAQ.text: All eat. does is breakfast and lunch...and they do it well. I've visited several times and never had a bad meal. Favorites include the Shrimp and Grits for breakfast and the BLT with Avocado, served with house-made potato chips. The grilled cheese with tomato soup is perfect comfort food and incredible if you step up and add some of their smoky thick bacon.   The menu changes seasonally with items rotating in and out. Plenty of vegetarian options for those so inclined. And brewed ice tea.  The clientele is eclectic trending to hipster. Parking can be tricky downtown and be prepared to feed a meter. And expect a wait if you're trying for a weekend mid-morning breakfast. Totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT with Avocado at eat.

0OHOTIJ4SnlOobBiuinKZQ.text: YUM! Enjoyed this place. Will definitely come back! Friendly service. Huevos Motulenos are SO good! I can understand why some people are confused by them, but HOLY COW -- the combination of the huevos rancheros and the peas and the bananas was SO GOOD. I told my dining partner, "This is SO WEIRD. In the BEST WAY." It really was.  We also shared a pancake. YUM! Yum, yum, yum. My dining partner had the chicken sandwich and she said that it was very good. I can't come back here soon enough!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sparkling strawberry lemonade!

QP6S2-3ehAxjuJEM7b7H9A.text: I finally got to try this place out with the little brother on MLK morning! Made sure we got to eat before their big brunch crowd or any crowd that would've gathered before and after the parade. It didn't take long for us to get a table - probably like 10 minutes after giving the hostess our name.  Cute setting that definitely reminded me of a school cafeteria with a hipster spin.  Everyone constantly checked on us during our meal, which was cool to see another establishment have all this teamwork. I think we had Gary as our server, and he was pretty cool. He recommended we have the Deviled Eggs as a starter, and we were not disappointed. In fact, the brother ate 3 out of the 4 we were supposed to split. Anyway... The little brother had Huevos Motulenos, and I had the Corned Beef Hash. LOL. We definitely switched plates at one point to have a taste of both orders. Funny thought popped in my head: "I feel like I'm back in Cali eating brunch... Vibe and fresh ingredients to make scrumptious breakfast!" I gotta admit that the brother's plate was yummier than my staple though. I didn't think capers and peas would taste well with bananas, but it was a perfect combination of sweet and savory. My corned beef was pretty good. I mean you can't go wrong with this breakfast staple when it's fresh and not drenched in some kinda grease. LOL. I loved my Sourdough Bread that came with it! There was the sour taste to it - small yet evident. I liked how it was soft 'cause crunchy edges can get kinda annoying, even if I like a bit of texture to my food elements. Might I also add that my coffee was definitely freshly brewed, and I just appreciated how it didn't remind me of a certain coffee chain. XD

zztTJrT8qt1qv9CrZSnPUQ.text: Street parking was tricky (parallel - not my favorite), in front of a sketchy hotel to boot. But locked up and went into eat, and was so glad I did! Ended up doing both breakfast and lunch here on different days. The waffles were perfect.

G2BMPKuc19VwWxmsdHTwKw.text: AMAZING FOOD. The grilled cheese sandwich was to die for, and their coffee is PERFECT. This is a must go to from now on every time I go to Vegas!

j9w3CuytY0F5oUIQTtnw9w.text: I had my birthday breakfast here. Everything was so awesome. The decor was very trendy, the wait was very little and the food! Don't get me started on the food. I got the grilled cheese w/ avocado and tomato soup & my boy toy got the club sandwich which we both enjoyed to the last bite. Definitely very filling. The atmosphere was very calm. I like going to places where the staff seem very friendly, not only to customers, but to each other as well.  My only recommendation is to get there with time as sometime there is a lengthy wait AND they close at 3. You absolutely want to get there and enjoy it.

EZjanvv53SnaIV3_GuTyNA.text: The restaurant was relatively crowded but not too bad for a Sunday morning. The hostess had an attitude but the servers were great. I got the egg truffle sandwich that BLEW ME AWAY! Seriously, the bacon was so thick and juicy, the eggs were scrambled perfectly and deliciously fluffy, the feta and mushrooms were freakin awesome.   Prices were affordable, food came fast.  Kinda hipster, trendy & modern atmosphere. You'll like it.

WhVN17RgADANOCGVZN5oJg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for some time now, but paying for parking and the location has kept us from making the drive across town. When our friends told us they were staying at The D and wanted to meet for breakfast, it was the perfect opportunity to check it out -- and I'm glad we did.   Location - eat. is in the heart of DTLV, right next to Container Park. Easy walking distance from the DTLV Hotels and Fremont St. If you drive, there is an ample amount of street parking for $1/hour.  Ambiance - The restaurant is small and gives off that hipster vibe (reminds me of a restaurant you'd find in LA or San Diego.)   Service - We were quickly greeted and seated. *They do not take reservations, nor will they seat you until your entire party is present!! Our servers were friendly and very attentive throughout our entire meal.  The Food - We started with the Cinnamon Biscuits w/ the Berry Compote that everyone raves about which definitely lived up to the hype. I ordered the Truffle Egg Sandwich which was also delicious. It had the perfect amount of truffle and the feta cheese added just the right touch. It came with the chive potatoes that they're known for which were seasoned perfectly and very yummy. My husband ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and said he really enjoyed his dish.   We will definitely return!

ZtsG5Say4fR75LO2sPKxAw.text: This place has a really cool hip atmosphere. Very hipster. I liked the decor and little fun touches of their style. The service was quick. The food was tasty with very generous portions. I would highly recommend the tomato soup. The flavors were perfect. My husband had the Huevos Motulenos. Interesting mix of flavors. Even had banana in it. I liked it. I had the blt. It was HUGE! If I could change something on their menu, I would take the red salsa from my husband's plate and use it for the tomatoes on the blt and use a nutty whole wheat bread instead of the fat white bread. Oh, the coffee was delicious and full of flavor. No burnt beans. I always drink mine black. This was a good cup! Two  up.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Motulenos
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT

Y1zXup6JW-MTG-c2PZOVeQ.text: Great customer service! Food was a decent portion. I had the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The tomato soup had an interesting taste and was on the watery side. The grill cheese was tall. I loved dipping it into the soup, made it more manageable to eat. Nothing spectacular about it but very filling. I will be back to try some other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese and tomato soup

mLsH3b1algIJoYI6sZ096Q.text: Breakfast time and it's time to EAT!   Huevos Motulenos: hard tortilla base with beans, feta cheese, bananas and topped with over easy eggs smothered in a tomato base sauce and accompanied by potatoes. A dish that has a good balance of sweet (bananas) and savory.   Shrimp and Grits: pretty much self explanatory, served with bacon strips, butterflied shrimp, topped with over easy eggs and homemade sauce. The eggs were something different but a nice touch.   Biscuits with strawberry compote: biscuits that seemed to be baked with sugar and cinnamon for the crispy top smothered in a strawberry compote and topped with strawberries and blackberries. This was the highlight of our meal and it's a must get! It's usually served before the meal arrives.   Overall great place to satisfy your breakfast hunger.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Motulenos.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits with strawberry compote.

ZO7pvyBhJBk3RvVOOmNVdw.text: It is hard to eat like a local in a place as tourist-centric as Las Vegas. But when my wife and I learned about this place from Yelp, we realized that it would give us a great meal and a respite from the oppressively bright lights and loud noises of Tourist Las Vegas.  Everything is fresh, the staff is friendly and the prices keep the regulars (I'm certain they have many) happy. I opted for a Veggie Burger, which was fantastic. But everything else I saw come out of the kitchen looked similarly delicious.  If I lived in the area, I'd go all the time. But, alas, I'm just a tourist, except for those few minutes at eat.

h-knBdRdXU_zOhFy3xqiSQ.text: All that's written about this place, is True. Lots of food. Lots of good food. I ordered the shrimp and grits, and I'm not a grits fan, but the description sounded so tasty, I took the plunge. Adding the pico de gallo raised the taste level from eh... to get in my mouth you little grit. Will order it again. My husband had the chicken fried steak. The biggest chicken fried steak I've ever seen. He could't eat it all. Stopping at Donut Bar across the street probably had something to do with that. The service is great. The atmosphere is refreshingly charming and unpretentious and clean. Go. Enjoy. Eat.

F9swJWF_6pXL-Fb1OPx-2w.text: Delicious food and great portions. I ate the shrimp and grits, my daughter had the pancakes and we shared the cinnamon biscuits. I love the atmosphere. The food came out fast. We were in and out in less than 1 hour. It's a little pricey but in some respects worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits...add cheese

tSr39IvL2RpB1EG2aDQm4Q.text: We specifically went downtown so we could have breakfast at Eat after reading the rave reviews on YELP. In all honesty, I have to agree with the glowing reviews. Great place to get some good comfort food downtown. It's a bit hard to find, but 5 minute walk off Fremont street. If you're downtown or heading down that way I'd strongly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch. This place has a menu that offers a broad selection from pancakes with chicken maple sausage, grilled cheese on Texas toast with tomato soup to a mozzarella caprese style chicken sandwich. Various side dishes are offered. The food was nicely presented and tasty. Tasty passion fruit unsweetened iced teas is available to whet your appetite. Come early or come late. Usually busy at mealtime. And yes there is counter to eat at where you can watch the creations being made. A pretty good way to start the day. I also think that for the quality and quantity, this place has really good value.

PdBxfyuX-UG7-dhA0T7nyA.text: eat is a really cute, hipster spot for fresh, tasty breakfast and brunch meals. Located conveniently next to the Downtown Container Park, eat provides gorgeously plated and well-thought out dishes (mostly).  He got the huevos motulenos, which is a great menu option. This dish consists of two eggs over-easy with red & green new mexico chiles, black beans, peas, pico, feta, and sauteed bananas on corn tortilla. Vibrant, assertive flavors and nice presentation. The huevos motulenos is also a quite generous portion, as with everything else they serve.  I ordered the tofu scramble with mushrooms and home fries. His dish was definitely better than mine. I thought the tofu was a tad underseasoned, some salt and other spices would have made it less plain. Also, I was expecting tofu scrambled so that it actually resembled eggs; however, their version is actually cubed. I think stringy, egg-like bits would have made this dish more successful because the thinner, creamier texture would have soaked up any seasoning better. Still good, though could be better.  We shared the cinammon biscuits, and these babies were fantastic. The biscuits are smothered in strawberries and blackberries, which I loved. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the biscuits were thinner, and more similar to shortcake. Worked really well in this dish, and again, really beautiful plating.  Looking for an American breakfast with a twist? eat is a great choice. Overall, the food is delicious and service is good. The ambiance is also lively and cheery.

tiwJ6RZEw-YAJB3BtbvKmg.text: My husband and I have talked about coming here the last several times we've been in Vegas, we finally made it! The food and service were excellent!  Well worth the trip to Downtown!

2uy_4hPbv62qkbU4ugsrDA.text: I'd give it 5 but our waitress has an attitude. You would recognize her cuz shes the only one with dreads. We would ask her stuff about the menu and she would give us this side eye look and It really bothered me. But other than that, the food was great. The decor was nice. My favorite was the DWBite and the chive potatoes. My husband ordered the pancakes, and loved them.

Sn2dxoqUu3d13uSkqtkBww.text: Love the food and coffee.  Drive all the way from Henderson :) Had the huevos motulenos (?) and coffee. Looks great, tastes even better. Actually had both people who sat on my sides at the bar order the same thing. Good service, good food, good pricing, definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4qXpj6GEsLGe1BoOCMzCnA.text: Very nice place! Great ambience & fast service. I ordered the two egg breakfast and it was phenomenal. Their toast tastes like they make it fresh daily. So good!   My friend ordered the corned beef hash it tasted fresh and authentic.  The orange juice was delicious too! (Very pricey for the tiny glass though)  I will definitely be coming back here.

EchuoA2P2iz844xtCckEeg.text: My friends and I stopped by for a late brunch while visiting Las Vegas for new years.  Located in downtown Las Vegas, it is hipster, modern, and artsy - quite refreshing compared to the Strip.  The staff was also kind and welcoming, answering all of our questions about the neighborhood and sightseeing.  As for the food - we started with the cinnamon biscuits which were the highlight of my meal. The serving contained 4 halves which was perfect to share, and the strawberry compote topping was divine.  As for my main meal, I got the dwblta with tomato soup. The sandwich was HUGE and I could barely finish half of it. The contents of the sandwich were fresh but the bread was too thick for my taste and heavily buttered.   Overall, I enjoyed the meal and the experience but found the food too heavy for my taste. I'm not sure if I would return given the chance, but I do definitely recommend venturing off of the strip and exploring this downtown area!

CEHRlOs1Mtq8YoXDJocf1g.text: I've been here a handful of times. Here are a few tips if you haven't been:  You're almost always going to have to wait. Some of the food is awesome. Some of it is not.   Here are some favs--  Grilled Cheese w/ kickass tomato soup Chicken Fried Steak 2 Eggs any Style - especially with their sourdough. It's amazing.  Pancakes  The other food we've tried is very...okayish. Especially the shrimp and grits. The grits have little to no flavor. And they're extremely runny. I prefer the grits to be thick, creamy and buttery. That's usually the awesome part about shrimp and grits. Maybe it's just me.   And my biggest complaint here: the service. Not that it's slow. It's just plain fucking weird. From the hostess to the servers. They're so nonchalant, and it's bizzare. The hostess does not greet you when you come in, and they don't tell you "good bye" or "thank you" when you leave. And the servers...one of the guys, we've had twice. He barely even talks to you. He comes up and gives you this look like, "Well? What do you want?"  He's even stuck his head in between ours to ask if our food was okay...and it was literally inches from my face. Who the fuck does that?! Also, we put our card down to pay because he never checked on us...he looked at it, pointed at it, and then looked at my fiance. My fiance responded, "Could you please close us out?" Still, no response. He took the card, knodded and walked off. Please tell me that's NOT weird or unprofessional. No question mark needed. It's rhetorical.   The best thing about this trip: a lady serving us drinks (which she happened to be super nice and helpful) told me about the cold brew they had. I ordered it and it was amazing.   I'm sorry, but when this seems to be a regular occurance here, I'd rather take my business elsewhere going foward. I don't want to go somewhere where I know I'm probably going to feel uncomfortable or unwelcome. There's a few amazing options right across the street if you're looking for somewhere in that area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their cold brew special. Awesome.

OHCz_h4L81vzPlbTZFMedg.text: I love this place! Simple, fresh and super tasty food! I've been here a few times and the service and food quality are consistent. I've tried the truffled egg sandwich, deviled eggs, chicken sandwich, avocado toast with poached eggs and all of those dishes are really good. My favorite is the truffled egg sandwich, super simple but packed with flavor. The coffee can improve but the food is great!

Fut-N-uv1_qLsDXStm2aVw.text: OMG THIS PLACE WAS SO GOOD.   Came here on my last Vegas trip and am excited for future hungover brunches to come. Had the chicken fried steak. Changed my life. Le fiance had the shrimp and grits. Equally life-changing. Wait can be long but mentally prepare and check out the cool park next door!   Going to a bachelorette party Labor Day weekend, and absolutely cannot wait to come back here!

ZchyBCLqkAVHXkCGztfuhQ.text: Came here from LA because I saw a post on the Downtown Project instagram page... (I was in Vegas for other reasons) but it was just as delicious as expected! I have no reason to give it nothing but a 5 except for the reason that there was one bathroom stall, except one of the employees encouraged me to use the men's. I was all for it so I did! Living life on the edge... Anyways. Ordered the truffle egg sandwich,.. was blown away. I'm always nervous to order anything egg in the first place but when you add the word truffle, the game changes. It was delicious! Service? Great! Their to go cups are so cute too. Great experience overall, super cute stop in the middle of ever changing downtown Las Vegas. Highly recommend!  Ps. Eggs Benedict only on the weekends ;(

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friday 9:30am
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friday 9:30 am
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You&#39;re looking at my: Truffle Egg Sandwhich!

Q0nYcs1Sibpa2w4zyZvTxQ.text: Came here for breakfast with picky eaters.   We had chicken fried steak on point if you are southern. Green polzoe, their breakfast burrito, so big.  I had a standard American eggs bacon and potatoes.  High quality, yummy, yummy, tummy!!!!

l0gZ_iaXWGgxZw04KJ8N4g.text: We've visited EAT on several occasions, usually at the downtown location and it was very good, however, upon visiting them the last time we went to their pop up at the World Market Center and the food came out cold, missing items on several plates,(ex: no avocado on the btla) the burgers were not cooked to preference even though we were asked how we would like them, they arrived so well done and seemed like they were pre made and left sitting under heat lamps, the forks and glasses had food debris left on them. All of these things could have easily been fixed and we could have looked past them had the customer service actually been existent. No one would come out to talk to us about the problems,  the chef couldn't be bothered to come out, there was no proper management to handle the complaints. The hostess came over and literally laughed at us for having these complaints, after laughing she said "well I don't know what you want me to do about that." They offered to comp $2 for the missing avocado on two Btla's. We could have looked past all of the mistakes had the hostess not had such a poor attitude. We will never go back to EAT. I would sadly never recommend anyone to support this restaurant simply because the owner/chef doesn't value her customers and doesn't have a proper hospitality team.

t0SDBVOwiYUwVOfhg6OIcg.text: Got the high table for our group of five.  Two of us had Truffled Egg Sandwich which has two scrambled eggs, wild mushrooms, chives, feta, bacon, chive potatoes, on ciabatta.  Delicious! Pam had my favorite- Shrimp And Grits with Bacon, two fried eggs, pico. Tony had Huevos Motulenos-Two fried eggs w/ red & green new mexican chili, black beans, peas, feta, & sauted bananas on corn tortilla.  Looked yummy Luis had Chicken Fried Steak and eggs with chive potatoes, decadent gravy!   Service is always friendly and attentive to our crazy group of life long friends to catch up on our school days thirty-four years ago!   Lovely time with wonderful friend and FABULOUS FOOD!  Thank you!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak and eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits!

iuTIWAmHOCWnbQ5SiOpJCw.text: So other than this being one if the most expensive bfasts I've ever had, it was good, but not worth all the hype imho.  The staff was great, courteous, and attentive and other than me getting chives on my sandwich after asking for none, I had no issue.  I was disappointed that they have a somewhat limited bfast menu during the week (no eggs benedict) and they discontinued the beignets, which were the two things I specifically came for, thus the docked star.  The coffee was good and they have Truvia which is a def plus. I got the truffled egg sandwich, which was surprisingly bland for $12 and could have used some cheese or something for flavor. I made my own concoction of syrup and tabasco, which I know sounds completely weird, but is absolutely delicious! The chive potatoes were also a little too much on the greasy side for my liking.  The stars of the morning bfast show were the cinnamon butter strawberry compote biscuits, which were amazing if not pricey @$8 for four. Maybe it was the fresh blackberries?   In any case, I don't know that I'd go back as you have to pay for street parking and it is in kind of a shady sectionof DT. But, I did enjoy what I did experience for the pretty penny it cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The truffled egg sammich w/chive potatoes!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing cinnamon strawberry biscuits!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clipboard menus

al2HORjfNfAX3dzzW82jsg.text: This place has to be the best in downtown LV (I don't really know cause we practically only ate here). But the service was genuine, kitchen was a well orchestrated machine, and the food was incredible. A lot of times when you walk into a breakfast/lunch spot that's as busy as this place, you expect the worst, but this place is the exception. The only negative I have to say is the portions are a bit outrageous. 1 meal could easily feed 2 people and a baby lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict:Tomato, spinach, perfectly cooked turkey bacon. Sauce a little too lemony for my buy my boyfriend, who ordered it, loved it.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak - Best I&#39;ve ever had

Q5IxQVmeEaO_KKbMaJH6oA.text: I am so glad we found this place while visiting Las Vegas!! The atmosphere is calm, cool and drama free (as it says on a mug in the open kitchen). Very clean, polished and love the design of the restaurant as well. The deviled eggs were to die for (they do make giraffes dance) and the truffled eggs breakfast sandwich was divine. The special this morning, biscuits and country gravy, was delicious as well. The service was excellent and I will recommend this restaurant to all friends and family visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Be nice or leave!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the decor
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled Eggs that do make Giraffes dance

2RD1NmJ3wE8QKZpEDI9GmQ.text: Wow, I'm appalled at this place. Let me clarify my displeasure.  How dare you charge so little for quality that high. How dare you take everything I've ever known about breakfast/brunch and obliterate it. How f**king dare you drop a nuke on my entire world!!!  All jokes aside, I had the corned beef hash and it was amazing!! That's not even a strong enough word, honestly. My wife had the truffled egg sandwich, and I couldn't even describe the beautiful flavor in English. Everything was very well spiced and bold without it being akin to get hit in the face by a car.   Either one of those dishes will leave you a blubbering idiot with no command of the spoken word.  Well done eat!!!

8m3UZV8hB5NNBA9ShCmZog.text: Eat reminds me of a restaurant you'd see in Portland or Austin. I absolutely love the ambiance! If you're into the hipster/artsy scene, it's worth a go.   I have been twice, and both times there was wait. It didn't take more than 15 minutes for us to be seated. The real wait takes place after you're seated. There seems to be a good amount of servers floating around, but the service isn't all that great.  The first time I went, we had the berry biscuits as an appetizer and I order the chilaquiles. The berry biscuits are great. The biscuits are a tad bit dense, but the compote is divine. The chilaquiles were awful. Besides the chips and eggs, the dish was far from what I was expecting. There was some sort of mango concoction that was not appealing to my palate. Just awful!  My next time around I order the pancakes. If you want good plain pancakes, look no further. The pancakes are fluffy and well-seasoned - can you say a pancake is well-seasoned? Anyway, these bad boys don't even need syrup! I also got a side of cheese grits as recommended by the waiter. They were disgusting. Not enough cheese and the were extremely clumpy. They reminded me of instant cream of wheat.  Overall, I do like Eat. I will be back to try other things.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Grits.. skip!

-n9-LJBx7CxqEVaQjFhVQw.text: Can't help but fall in love with this treasure painstakingly crafted by artisans. Upbeat environment and great food. Light on menus beyond lunch, and could use a bigger lunch selection, but otherwise phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits with warm strawberry compote. Delicious, light masterpiece!

reTL5coN4Z_-1BINvo9Iqg.text: We had:  -Scotch egg and pancakes -Tomato soup with grilled cheese added in bacon egg avocado -Chicken fried steak  The service was great, and the food was even better.  Not only are the portions up to par with the prices, but they were I-N-C-R-E-D-I-B-L-E.  Ate beyond our stomachs could handle. Not to mention the coffee was better than your average cup of Joe. Which is just a great top off to something so delicious.   The decor is very unique and hip, the chairs are surprisingly comfortable. The service is quick considering how busy it is. Get here expecting a minimum of 10-15 minute wait, because the food is so good.

VsVYV941CxfQGezyYMEw8w.text: Had a great breakfast this morning! Took my parents.   We were checked on by 6 different staff members.  Probably some of the BEST customer service ever.  Great place

nLaqA--vhXt7NhTsgOy-rQ.text: I really enjoyed this downtown eatery.  We arrived fairly early on a sunday and did not have to wait too long for a table.  Seems to get pretty busy during the late morning and lunch hours.  It was surprisingly nice considering it was below some ghetto apartments.  Also, there was live music that day.  The shrimp and grits is a must!

44iIFJ5TY6myFP4Cc3PDsA.text: Had an amazing breakfast with great service! Will be back when I come to town! The eggs were amazing and the pancakes a very scrumptious! A little bit from the main drag but worth the cab ride!

CeOlsxhZExYhLRLO9yy30g.text: EAT is one of the best examples I've seen of how a neighborhood restaurant should be done.. nice friendly staff, cool vibe and decor, Natalie the owner always there to greet customers and hold down the fort.  The best menu item, in my vegetarian opinion, is the veggie burger.  No big surprise there I guess, but this veggie burger is really something noteworthy.  It's the best one I've ever had, and I eat them all over the country.  Way to go Natalie and team at EAT - you guys are AWESOME!!

lWwx2BiJHZsNnhb8iV0prg.text: Brunch was insane. Long wait. Well worth it. Left super satisfied.

IrIvOwp_Rou1LUK_mv4EqQ.text: Delicious.. 5 stars.. the owner has passion.. we had a first hand exp.  Thumbs up!

n9Smi5Ogqr_Ne16tPZfFiQ.text: Everyone knows Las Vegas is all about horrible buffets and overpriced food on the strip. My friend and I were pleasantly surprised by this restaurant downtown, just a few blocks from the casinos on Fremont Street. It was so good, we went twice over the 3 days we were in Vegas. If this place was in my hometown of Seattle, I'd totally go for brunch or lunch any day. She's vegetarian, but we had plenty of options for both of us. Grilled cheese with a side of tomato salad? DO IT!

H8qq5NUavbdffQnY6cghfw.text: The food was divine! Beignets with vanilla marscapone, shrimp and grits and huevos motulenos made for a memorable meal. Was worth the trip, the parking hassle and the minimal wait. Service was great. I loved the vibe and atmosphere. Had the pleasure of meeting the owner on our way out, which added charm to the overall experience. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits, Beignets with marscapone &amp; jam, Huevos Motulenos

_uua9PWsGVyHfw3WbXFfsg.text: Fast, efficient and friendly service.  Truffled egg sandwich was delicious!!  Nice location away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

6N5lwE1qn5AgUgId4p0ohA.text: Loved it. Ive always had problems finding breakfast to my liking in Las Vegas. Until today. I had the eggs, shrimp and grits and it was so perfect. I look forward to visiting again some day. Great vibe, great food, great service.

zv976ZZvFgiFKDwm7m5FlA.text: AMAZING, it is all great food, the wait can be long but its worth it totally. There is no alcohol in there but not a big deal. Best breakfast spot in town easily.

PN9CLwBSbuiE8PBF_WDsGw.text: I am so excited that a new restaurant finally opened downtown.  I went to Eat on Friday with a group of 6 for lunch.  I really like the decor and atmosphere in this restaurant.  I ordered their flavored iced tea and the BLTA.  Both were very good.  The sourdough bread that the sandwich was served on was excellent and the sandwich was a very good size for lunch.  You will not leave hungry! Sandwich included the homemade chips which I thought were tasty.  I am not ordinarily big on chips but really liked these. The other 5 people that were with me were very happy with their food and the service.  Can't wait to come back for breakfast and try the pancakes.

SfAaKVSkSJ4gcQrZ9nkOuw.text: Great experience. Had a BLT the size of my head. Friendly staff. Quietly tucked away on 7th & Carson, so not easily found, but worth the search :-)

haBoGcP3UueXsq3AVMlqVQ.text: After reading some of these negative reviews my mind was blown. "Hipster aloofness"? Really? I've eaten there at least 10 ten times since it's been open and I have yet to have a bad meal or service. And I've also rarely seen a chef/owner spend as much time at their establishment as Chef Natalie does. If you want breakfast then get your lazy ass out bed and get there before 11. The pancakes with real maple syrup are a revelation. The grilled cheese and tomato soup as well. What I refer to as a basic breakfast is also top notch. Perfectly cooked eggs, thick bacon, homemade potatoes and really delicious, fresh bread for the toast. The chicken fried steak is a masterpiece. I took my friend there and he and the chilaquiles and his reaction was thus "Dude, that might have been the best breakfast dish I've ever had," EAT is the ish and I would recommend it to anyone.

58JbBx5Z5pB1xwHW_VSSZQ.text: My first time at Eat. and it was fabulous service and GREAT FOOD! The prices are great for the amount of food you get. I will definitely be back. Thank you :) I had the pancakes and chicken apple sausage with a side of grits and definitely took a to-go box! :) Ooh and the coffee is AMAZING as well. Great place!

T2bbcZBNgkzT6JTl6zuiSw.text: I am back to only going to places like this. Chef owned and the chef is there not a place they just put their name on.     Now I was amazed right from the beginning the vibe this place has is perfect the wait staff professional and the food just perfect. The Chef Natalie Young has found the perfect place for her food and has done a great job putting it all together. Can't wait for the outside seating. I had the Chicken Fried steak with potatoes,eggs and toast and everything down to the toast was perfect. She puts her love into this place and the food and it shows.
