gaTG7ZrpTRBWLq0olH9_7Q.text: I went for my second visit for lunch there after far too long. I got the BLT... SOOOO good. The bread ALONE on the sandwich is worth ordering. I got the side of potato salad, again, delicious and full of flavor. Service is quick and friendly. I highly recommend for a casual lunch with friends or colleagues. It's also really fun that they keep a few breakfast items on the menu all day.

tJTqGMrl4DNymAUNkZ5M8Q.text: I loved this place. Got the truffled egg sandwich and it was delish. Everyone liked what they got. The servers were friendly and it was a cute, clean restaurant with good options to pick from.

TOBJw77nxrtBuGX2x7Jc7Q.text: it was great food great service. It might seem like it is not enough food. At least, that's what I thought before I got to this place, but I comforted myself that it is brunch so that it should be lighter than regular meal. However, they totally amazed with their generous portions and great taste. Everything was absolutely fabulous. Will be back for sure!

uBmvzTclNUBPeyXSaX5-JQ.text: The food was great, by far the best pancakes I've had maybe ever. However, I was very disappointed in the service my girlfriend and I receive. The guy filling our drinks was more attentive than our actual server. Our server was not welcoming or pleasant by any means. He was very nice to the table behind us though. I don't know if he thought since we were a young interracial couple that we wouldn't be good tippers or what. My girlfriend is in the service industry and used to be a waitress so we are very big on service, most times its more important than the actual food, and if the service is good I can guarantee that the tip will be 30% plus. Not in this case, I don't know if we will go back based on his service alone.

y8dVg5qLblCdzVFBu7doBg.text: Amazing staff and freshly squeezed juice. The bottle giner ale is pretty good. I disliked the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote very much.

_s-BT-xTzeA-sgCRGiOjKA.text: This is a very refreshing option, away from the noise of the Vegas strip and it's tourists. Tried this place for breakfast on a whim and was not disappointed. The day's special was the breakfast burrito and it was a perfect mix of fresh and comforting flavours. The staff is great, the atmosphere is friendly, casual and refreshing.

PyvArhV227zx3orKdCExVQ.text: I ordered the cinnamon biscuits and the strawberries were still frozen in the center and the berries were soggy. My husband ordered the shrimp poboy and it was nothing special, pretty bland. We liked the atmosphere, so gave it three stars.

DQUIS0f0HxArkxzLqkQlzQ.text: I had/have high hopes for this place.  I was pleased to get the recommendation to come here, which got us away from the overstimulating nausea of the strip and get a little local flavor. The place has a very down home and uncomplicated industrial/ modern chic vibe set on the edge of redevelopment zone of downtown.   First off, I was bummed that we had just missed breakfast (stops at 11) and was not that intrigued by the lunch menu. We were completely caught off guard that we had several different servers within a matter of minutes when the dining room wasn't that busy. Then there were a few snafu's in that my gf got the served wrong side dish and I a chicken Banh Mi when I ordered the Tofu.   The food itself was uneven. The chips were a highlight. The Banh Mi was fine. Potato salad was too creamy. My gf's chicken (on the chicken sandwich) seemed boiled and lacked any real flavor. She rarely complains about food.   I am hoping that there are some jitters that need to be settled with both staff and kitchen and that it will be here the next time I come. I would love to see it improve and thrive, but for now, it was really missing the mark.

8jmQYTKqeno_440FZCMTTQ.text: Tried EAT for breakfast today. I was not overly impressed. Based on the reviews, I thought it would be a lot better. They didn't have chocolate milk for the kids. We had the two egg breakfast, truffled egg sandwich, and shrimp and grits. The shrimp and grits was soupy and the shrimp was way overcooked. The rest of the food was so-so. Overpriced and trying too hard.

7OeNU2LkqzHSZDUh3KGEng.text: The most UNBELIEVABLE rude pretentious dushbagial jack shack i have ever been to.  Three times three bad experiences with lame ass pretentious employees and owner.  There are always plenty of tables available but we are always told we have to wait. Each time it was for a party of 2 and when we were finally seated after waiting a good half hour plus each time it was always in a poor sitting area, exp-- lopsided rocking table right next to the kitchen/employee entrances. The food is descent, nothing to scream about but with such a poor experience with the seating every time it is a definite turn off for deciding on places to eat downtown. There are plenty of amazing eats downtown to not have to deal with this each and every time we want to retry this spot. Too bad we don't make this restaurants 'exclusive' special people list. Oh and I'm sure all of these AMAZING review are the eye rolling pretentious looser ass owner lady trying to "bury" the real reviews.  yes and i meant to leave zero stars but it doesn't seam to go that low.  OH YA AND WE WALKED A BLOCK OR TWO AND "ATE" AT RACHEL'S KITCHEN. IT WAS AWESOME  AND THE PEOPLE THERE WERE PLENTY NICE TO US.

MiQjpvtCtlptLHvVQloZ1g.text: Great local b'fast in Vegas. Ignore the neighborhood and run (don't walk) for the tasty huevos multenos, one of the most inventive egg dishes ive tried.  pancakes were the bomb.  Dbl blt and grilled cheese were delish too. The place has a good vibe.

PAaO1W4Gc6y05gN5M_PJDg.text: I had lunch on Friday at around 1 p.m.  I was alone so I decided to sit at the counter.  I ordered a tea and a BLT.  Server was really friendly and prompt.  While I was enjoying my tea and waiting for my sandwich I was watching the cook stations.  I am not sure if the health department would allow all of the cross contamination by the cooks and servers.  It was ugly, I hope no one gets sick.  From meat/seafood to salad or severs whipping off the edges of soup bowls with dirty clothes.  Please get it fixed.

DOjXKYIXogamE5n7nOF27Q.text: nice place. i think that my friends hyped it up too much so i expected more. the bfast is yummy. the blt was a bit much for me and the bread was a little too crunchy for me. would i return yes!

TKxodNW-3r4EEPNjapAqZg.text: Believe the reviews, the food coming out of the kitchen is top notch. Sour dough bread, best I've had anywhere.  The wait staff is friendly and efficient. I would give it 5 but it gets loud, the interior echoes sound, but that's most places, that seems to be consistently overlooked in most restaurants. Just one of my pet peeves, don't let it stop u from going here. U won't be disappointed if u do.

O937kB3UTMrNziw4y3U0ww.text: A friend suggested that we meet here for lunch.  I arrived hungry and optimistic.  While I enjoyed the "fresh ginger ale", it was not worth $4.00.  The grilled cheese sandwich was interesting, but outsized, with Texas Toast bread. The "kick ass" tomato soup was tasty, but the serving was miniscule and was spooned into the bottom 3/8 inch of a bowl that dwarfed this miniature serving.  I enjoyed most a taste of my friend's homemade fries.  I enjoyed least the obvious "rush act", and was horrified when the owner approached our table to verify whether we had been served our check, or not.  Since we had already paid, this was a fairly obvious, and very obnoxious, sign that we were to leave.  Since we had only been seated and had only finished a few minutes earlier, my friends and I thought that this was very inappropriate.  I will likely not return to this very uncomfortable, lack-of-customer-service setting.

QEdv8BsXq5QdAefi5QWbXQ.text: Fantastic comfort food and really friendly staff. The sandwiches are all very good.

K2tciiznogaPXdSIOig8jA.text: This place is probably one of the best places I ate during the 4 days I was in Las Vegas. It's a little off the beaten path, 2-3 blocks from Freemont and off the Strip in general but this place was PACKED on Saturday morning. I came in a group of 6 people and we were told it would be about a 20-30 minute wait; no big deal to us since the place looked very busy. When we did sit down our waitress was super friendly and we got our drinks quickly; the sparkling strawberry lemonade was possibly the best lemonade I'd had on the trip. I got a Chicken Fried Steak and I have to say it was the best one I've had at a restaurant ever. The gravy was what you want in a gravy; those superb lumps of bacon/sausage with that peppery bite. The steak was cooked to perfection, tasty on the inside and well seasoned with an awesome amount of crunch on the outside all served on top of eggs and potatoes. The potatoes were perfectly cooked, soft on the inside and that golden sear on the outside. Waitress was super friendly and had a great sense of humor! The wait for the tables in a big group is worth is 100% and if I ever go back to Las Vegas this is definitely on the list of places I would eat at again.

4VeOuqGxHK9-sgeYmIyPiA.text: I was expecting a lot, from reading previous reviews.  The noise factor was very off-putting.  As we entered, about noon, the music was booming. There is nothing soft around to absorb sound, so don't expect to have a conversation.  The music did tone down after a bit...but not because they lowered it.  Everyone who does talk has to raise his voice to be heard, so the sound escalates as the restaurant fills.  I had to put in the earplugs I always have with me.  My chicken pot pie used puff pastry underneath and on top of the filling.  The filling was okay; I didn't detect a lot of chicken in it, but it wasn't all sauce like some--mostly veggies I think.  The bottom crust couldn't be crispy, and the top crust wasn't either--so I just ate arouond the edges.  The chicken sandwich was ordinary, and the potato salad tasted more like the packaged salad in a regular market.  The one I make myself is much better.  It's unlikely we will return.  Breakfast is enticing, but ends at 11 am.

z8cqZ-sKuv2e6T6N94dSSw.text: Eat has become my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. There's never a problem with parking (metered but always close), though you may have to wait 15 minutes if you go during their busy time (but that would be the case anywhere). The service and food have always been great. All the servers I've ever had are polite, courteous, friendly and engaging. I've only had breakfast there and always get either the huevos motulenos or pancakes, which are both delicious (and perfect hangover food), and generously sized enough that I end up taking some home with me for a second meal later. I can't speak to the lunch menu and have heard mixed opinions. The decor is modern and industrial yet cozy. When I last checked they don't serve espresso drinks, which is a bummer when you're craving a latte or cappuccino, but drip coffee will always suffice when I want caffeine. It's also a great off-strip spot to take out of town guests, I definitely recommend it.

ezf4aeWTi7G_PcNKIj5_Gg.text: We had a party of 9 visitors except for my niece who lives in Vegas. We had both vaguely heard of some place downtown that had good breakfast.  Searched out EAT. We were not let down!  The staff was friendly and pitched in to handle our casual group of mostly boomers.  I admit my memory is not that good so I'll mention only a couple of items.  One of the guys had the chicken-fried steak and he loved it!  Enough for two if you are a light eater. I had the golden pancakes and I WANT the recipe!  My only disappointment was the chicken sausage.  Please stick with pork sausage or bacon.  Others seemed to really enjoy their dishes.  The food quality is tops. Two things kept me from making this five stars: the coffee had a strange taste and the place is noisy, due to the polished concrete floors and minimalist decor.  But all-in-all I will definitely go back.  We love downtown Vegas and are happy to see progress every time we visit.  Don't forget to EAT!

-9scSKANX3m2GAsmhmPSGA.text: Eat is a neighborhood restaurant tucked away in downtown Vegas with a great, friendly atmosphere.  Some excellent dishes.  Some mediocre dishes.  But it's a little hit or miss on the customer service.    I love this place and I love that it's located downtown.  Finally, a great brunch and lunch spot in the 89101.  Finally, a neighborhood place not catering to Southern California tourists.  It's awesome.  It's friendly.  And it's become so well-known that it can be tough to get a seat.    The lunch menu is solid--great sandwiches and salads. The grilled cheese is excellent with thick Texas toast style bread and sharp cheddar.  Simple and awesome.  Nice fresh tomato salad on the side.  The roast beef sandwich is also tasty.  Fresh and thin roast beef with bright blue cheese on perfect bread.  For brunch, there's a lot of excellent options and some that just miss the mark.  The eggs benedict is delicious.  The chicken fried steak was decent, but not brilliant--more of a kitschy choice but not particularly well done.  The main disappointment is  the huevos rancheros dish.  It's an awkward attempt at culinary creativity with peas and sauteed bananas mixed into the savoriness of eggs and rancheros sauce.  This place has an excellent, inviting atmosphere. In a downtown focused on daytime business and nighttime drinking, it's a nice spot for the locals.  A spot to meet and spend time connecting with people.  And there's a charming porch to sit on when it's not baking hot outside.  If there's a main setback, it's that Eat can't handle the lunch rush that happens Mon-Fri.  There's so few great food options in downtown Vegas that Eat is crowded every day.  If you're coming for lunch, prepare to wait.  And try to keep the number of your party to 2 people.  The hostesses have a hard time figuring out how to seat parties larger than 2 in an efficient way.  Know this going in and you'll have a great time.  Bottom line: 4.5 stars for the excellent atmosphere, friendly service, and generally solid menu.  Minus one star for occasionally cranky customer service, long waits at lunch, and some mediocre dishes.

4IK7IrjSlELqmR3omAeHiQ.text: Came here for brunch on a Sunday! It was already packed at 10 AM so that tells you something. It was a 5-10 min wait for three people.   I ordered the Huevos Motulenos, but I got to try the beignets, chicken fried steak, the housemade chips and the benedifct.   I personally didn't enjoy the Huevos Motulenos. I found the flavors and consistencies to be contrasting. Black beans and peas were too hard, salsa didn't complement the dish, there was hardly any egg, the tortilla was soggy, and the bananas confused the entire dish.   The beignets were really fluffy, but they would have been better if made and served fresh. They were barely warm when they got to our table. The strawberry jam was really good, though.   The Benedict was decent. Not bad, but nothing to write home about.   The Chicken Fried Steak was definitely the best plate. The gravy was seasoned deliciously, I just wish there was more of it. A little too much breading but it added good crunch and flavor.   Prices ranged from $11-14 for entrees, so I wouldn't come here on a regular basis. But when I do I'll be sure to order the CFS or Shrimp n Grits.

92StlePcvdP8x7DKv0-CGw.text: If you're looking for a great place in downtown Las Vegas... Great Food, Great Service, Great Atmosphere, get there before the lunch crowd.

WUL0863KAvnTFLe3XHTAdA.text: As someone who's lived in NYC an la and in Vegas for just a year, I love this place. It's got a cute, casual, hipster vibe with great breakfast food!  I literally crave the cinnamon biscuits and strawberries and will venture here just for them! The service is friendly and quick. It makes me forget I'm in a chain filled city and pretend that I'm in downtown la :). So glad they're here!  (Great vegetarian options too!)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qNQ9yOPgLth9TSLzh-9Bng.text: I was in town last week and wanted to try a new place for breakfast so around 11 on saturday i started going through yelp to find something exciting.  So I thought the storefront looked odd and when i drove by it, the restaurant is underneath either a motel or a bunch of apartments which was even more odd because they were kind of run down.  So i parked in the metered parking across the street and ran across to check this place out. When you actually walk, its like you're in a different part of town. Inside its clean and new and actually ....nice? Like hipster nice. It was definitely a surprise.  I sat at the bar and yelp told me to get Huevos Motulenos so i ordered the Huevos Motulenos.  Which are awesome. There is so much texture and flavor going on in that plate that its really hard to describe.  It was definitely one of the best breakfasts that i've eaten recently. And because i knew that i wasn't eating anything for a while i ordered a side of pancakes which i thought would be the size of my hand. They weren't. They were the size of my head. So i barely made it out of there alive but i powered it all down like a champ.  On a side note, i don't know why people go to restaurants like this and just order bacon and eggs and then say "wtf bacon and eggs. I mean..it tastes like bacon and eggs - i can make this at home. What a rip off." If you just want to have a crappy meal like two strips of bacon and an egg, learn to cook and stay home. Go get a 99 cent breakfast burrito from mcdonals or whatever. Don't come in here and wonder why bacon and eggs at a restaurant tasted like bacon and eggs made by everybody everywhere EVER.  I would definitely come back to eat here again.

umnGz9JXmoAq8a3M9KWH9Q.text: Went here for brunch on a Saturday around 10:30 and was told it'd be a 25 minute wait for two. It ended up only being about 15 minutes though. There was a little bit of confusion throughout the meal with service (a random waiter tried to refill my BF's Sprite with water and we were brought the bill twice--once by our actual waiter and once by someone else). But I suppose it's better to be paid too much attention to than the opposite! My boyfriend had the corned beef hash, which was really great. Very flavorful. I had the traditional breakfast and it was fine. The bacon was good, potatoes weren't as flavorful as i'd hoped, and the jam was similarly blah. All in all, we'd go back but it might not be our first choice.

AQAVOB6sxThypCObGsQ37Q.text: Thanks to Yelp again for allowing me to try a delicious restaurant that I would have never found otherwise. This place was the perfect cure for the night after a long Vegas night.The decor is so cute and modern....very hipster in a good way. I had the oddest breakfast...the huevos with red and green chili served over black beans, peas, tortillas and....feta and....banana?!?!?! It sounds so weird, but it was exceedingly delicious. Sweet, spicy, and savory...perfect food. The BF got the pancakes, which were delicious, but was too hungover to eat them (!), he took about 6 bites and then I insisted we take the pancakes back home all the way to AZ...and they were still good! The coffee was also good....it just was overall awesome. I will definitely be back!

8TvUl6DNJMRmeUStin7weA.text: I'm still dreaming about fried deviled eggs.... why has no one else thought of this? They are incredible. A must order. I also loved the truffled egg sandwich..it wasn't too truffle-y, just the right amount of flavor. The addition of avocado made it even better. Coffee is good, service is fast, and atmosphere is clean and comfortable. Fried deviled eggs will be my first breakfast stop next time I'm in Vegas.

QravnDwsqBYlM4zY7Gmq1w.text: This place is great . family and myself go here regularly and never disappoints. If you go during the week I love the green chili chicken Posole must have. Our server has mostly been Gary . Great server pays attention and always seems to remember us

ljJBp2anpdhpiq4tYPr6_w.text: Sometimes, Yelpers can miss and the four star ratings that drew me here is a disappointment.    First it's a breakfast and brunch place and they stop serving brunch/breakfast items at at lunchtime?  Say what?  How difficult would it be to keep your grill open to cook breakfast items?    Second, the waiter appeared annoyed after he was told I ordered coffee (my friend even heard me) and he didn't hear that I wanted coffee and water.    Third, the food was marginal at best.  Maybe because I didn't have any appetite having spent the night and day before at EDC but man, the black bean soup tasted like sea water.  They salted the heck outta that beans till it flew outta the cuckoos nest.    Two of my friends, didn't like the Tomato Soup, which looked like they put some care into it's presentation, but the taste buds don't lie.  Unfortunately, I can only recommend that you don't Eat at Eat.

0eSlRqIgDaicC1KHHzDF6w.text: I loved eat!!! My frustration was to go there and eat the country fried chicken breakfast. Understanding that breakfast ends at 11, we arrived at 10:35 and were told there was a 10 minute wait. That wait turned into 30 minutes, and when I finally was sat, the server and manager were unwilling to grant me the breakfast item I ever so craved.  Not there fault though! The food was so damn good!!!

431zdY0cJA2Uk5ZbhxGDsg.text: AMAZING PLACE and the portions of the plates are great! Definitely recommend and also recommend the DevilEggs.

d0oFTlC3IHRS1g8wpnv_aA.text: I have read the reviews of EAT and could not wait to try it. It was easy to find, just a few blocks from downtown. We arrived at 1pm and had about a 10 minute wait which was not bad for the time of day.   I ordered the food I had read great reviews about starting with the beignets. They lived up to the hype! They were warm and crispy on the outside with a nice fluffy center. They were served with a raspberry sauce and a wonderful vanilla mascarpone. The mascarpone was not too sweet and tasted great with the raspberry sauce.   I ordered the shrimp and grits while my husband ordered the black bean veggie chili. Both were superb! The shrimp and grits are served with apple-smoked bacon and two fried eggs. It is the perfect combo.  I was really expecting "not so great" service after reading reviews of EAT. Our waiter, Justin, certainly proved those reviews wrong. He was super friendly and we never felt rushed. He kept the drinks coming and sat down to chat for a couple of minutes. I will definitely go back to EAT when I am in Las Vegas again.

J4xbNLaxoYO7KOoQCOZpfQ.text: In a word...or two...Yum Yum!!  Very good service and the food was amazing.  I'm Vegan and the options rocked...Left full and fully satisfied!

dEKWI5LL8VOrsunfBmgGig.text: Had a party of 4 and stopped by this place on Wednesday at 1pm.  Waited 30 minutes to get seated.  Once seated, ordered, and ate, food was really good.  Would recommend.   Nice staff and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ap6gyCOpLgOwtDRk9Ebt6g.text: A little out of the way from most vacationer's way but that's what I love about Eat. It's not what I call trendy but definitely seems like it's in an up and coming part of vegas that really appears to appeal to locals and tourists (if you are smart enough to do your homework). The food portions are substantial and taste is above average. Though I have to say they are far superior in the way of service. Everyone is super nice and attentive but with a laid back style I appreciate. This is the place to be if you are looking for that unique find off strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle egg sandwich with avocado. Really good.

pypv3b2L6KeMW2jNsyRBXw.text: It has been a while since my last trip to Eat and I had high hopes it would meet or exceed my last experience.  I saw the new menu and was salivating over a shrimp po boy so I went.  I must say this was my most disappointing visit yet.  Where to begin. 1) The caesar salad was overly fishy tasting and my wife coouldn't even finish it.  2) The Shrimp Po Boy was extremely messy and difficult to eat without everything spilling off the ciabatta.  The shrimp were overcooked and tough. 3) The beignette's were more like grease balls.  I still like this place but I think I am going to stick to breakfast which seems to be much more consistent and worthy of top marks.

4B4xo7xeNRsWO-hHE4g1pQ.text: Don't come here if you have more than 3 people in your party.  I can't comment on the food because we never got seated.  The girl told us our party of 6 would be seated in 30 minutes...over an hour later as every single person with a party of 3 or less came in after us was seated, we were still just sitting, waiting.  The helpless girls at the front were not apologetic at all, saying there was nothing they can do because they can't move tables together, we'd just have to wait until a larger party got up.  Could be 10 minutes, could be another 50 minutes.  We left and they did not give 2 shits.  Will never go back just for the lack of customer care alone

LpPUKsicMgZnP_OAhsqIxg.text: Pros: Got seated right away on a Friday morning Relatively friendly service (our server was not that great, but everyone else was) Good variety on menu  Cons: Food was just okay. Tried the truffled egg sandwich and the shrimp and grits. Truffled egg sandwich was good, but nothing amazing. Shrimp and grits were subpar. Bacon was soggy (who would put crispy bacon on the bottom of a bowl of grits? It's like, why even crisp the bacon at all?), shrimp was overcooked. Grits weren't seasoned well and were too watery.   3 stars is a little harsh. 3.5 is more appropriate. Would I come back? No.

JrmsWPTpMLY3OwqJ1_N1fg.text: Found this place with Yelp's help a few years ago while staying at the Golden Nugget. Great breakfast spot, cool atmosphere, great food. The truffle egg sandwich is amazing. If you're in the area, it's definitely worth the short walk from Freemont.

mi692yfl_w0SdYkoAq1ylA.text: So we did something naughty after realising every single restaurant in this area had 45 minute Saturday morning waits. We walked to each restaurant and put our names in, then checked Yelp to see who would ultimately win our business. It was a tie between Eat and another, but the staff at the other joint was so cold, we went back to Eat. Glad we did! Ended up being worth the 45 minute wait. (Yes, we took ourselves off the other lists in person within 15 minutes. We aren't sooo awful.)   We ordered grits (good), pancakes (great), and corned beef hash n eggs (freakin amazing). The coffee was excellent and the service was fast and delightful.   We found street parking 2 blocks away. It was metered but all of them were broken and okay to park at.   Noise level is high but not off-putting. If you can only get a counter seat here at high peak times, take it. It's still awesome service.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QiicnmSq8FU1eEzloTS7ng.text: We came here for breakfast on a Monday and only had to wait 10 minutes which was amazing considering it was right after the Life is Beautiful music festival. I ordered the truffle sandwich and Jared had the roast beef sandwich.   To me, the truffle sandwich was like the the main act you come for but the roast beef was like the surprise opener who blows your sock off.  Did I enjoy the truffle sandwich? Yes. That's what I came for! But I went in with no expectations about the roast beef sandwich and it was juicy and delicious.  My only caveat about this place is it could use some AC! It was too damn hot to not have AC going. Overall though I was very happy with the food!

_P93ihecv-faLL5WGG8oQg.text: I've been wanting to try Eat for a while, so I was very excited to experience what they had to offer. We got there a hour before closing so everything was pretty quick but not rushed. The menu is quite small compared to other places but they do have a nice variety of items for breakfast and brunch. I love breakfast food, so I had to try the cinnamon biscuits, but i also love a bit of savory too so you can see my dilemma. I decided to solve all my problems by getting a side of chive potatoes and chicken apple sausage.  The cinnamon biscuits were not what I expected but they were a nice surprise. They were more cakey rather than flaky and light. I was expecting a bit more cinnamon in the biscuits but the sweetness from the strawberry compote balanced it out.  The servings of chicken apple sausage and chive potatoes were more than enough for one person and had great flavor. I almost forgot about the sparkling strawberry lemonade which was served with a paper straw, something I hadn't seen in a restaurant before.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Biscuits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The whole meal
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chive potatoes

O6psjua4dc33y7gdwWqkvQ.text: Great BLT and Chicken with tomato salad!  Good organic hot teas.  Excellent service!  Nice atmosphere and classic rock!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great organic tea
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great BLT and Chicken with tomato salad

UUFhKFeOQ-PU5rdFk2Gg2g.text: So with high hopes of good food and "cool" atmosphere, we headed to Eat :/ I had the eggs scrambled, bacon crisp, potatoes and thick white toast.  Coffee was pretty good, but way to HOT in restaurant to enjoy it, or any of the food.  I guess they were going for the Florida gulf cafe feel, they nailed it.  I will not be returning, if you wish to enjoy your meal and not schvitz, don't come here.

Z8K_nygx9Fc01td6QTwJGA.text: I really wanted to like this place and tried it twice to be sure that my sentiments were right. I'm surprised the food here gets such high ratings. The shrimp and grits were horrible. Absolutely NO SEASONING, totally bland and watery.  My husband ordered the grilled cheese and did not even enjoy that. We regretted returning for the second time.  Very cute and trendy and servers are nice, the only reason for 2 stars. Pass on this place if you're in the area. Definitely better options nearby.

hBZCfFkUEJ5qFTVnlLE-8Q.text: Delicious. Lived up to the hype. Get here early and you can avoid the lines.  The pancakes are crispy and a mile high but cooked well all the way through. The shrimp and grits were flavorful and popular. I had the Huevos Montelenos, surprising and good. You'll have to order it to find out! The fresh squeezed juice was excellent, too, and fairly priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WaRi2x4srGlG6exlBrBymw.text: Great non strip local breakfast place, delicious, will for sure go back if I head back to LAS!  Friendly enough staff, small place with street parking!

5X3oN9uqeuCUwe6VH2c1ng.text: This is one of my boyfriends favorites for breakfast or brunch, & he is a TOUGH one to please! So far I've had the tofu scramble & the veggie burger, & BOTH are delicious! I also recommend getting the tomato salad with the burger, it is A-MA-ZING & just bursting with flavor. The service is also always great, despite it being CRAZY busy everytime we're there.  WEIRD tip: but I recommend all my fellow vegans to bring a side of mayo with you if you're getting the veggie burger, it makes it so much more delicious! You can also mix it with the ketchup & you have yourself some serious awesome sauce! LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And the tomato salad - YUM!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious burger

gsrFr8hvzwM-Jng_cpYjtw.text: Hey let's, Eat / Comer / Kumain. Finally got around to try their breakfast Menu recently. Its been 4 years since my last visit and previously only had Lunch before. This past Monday, had the time to visit with a group. We were quite pleased with our items.  Chicken Fried Steak- Deliciously satisfying and was cook just right with out being over or under cooked. The actual batter had a good texture and the gravy was seasoned well and gave the dish a kick.  Beef Hash- Overall, a good dish and paired well with the potatoes. The bread that came with the dish was toasted well and not burnt with butter.  Truffled Egg Sandwich- The was a stellar dish. Consistent flavor throughout with the bacon being crispy in texture but not burnt and paired well with the wild mushrooms, feta cheese & chives on a ciabatta bread. A side of seasoned chive potatoes was really good.  Overall, it was a pleasant experience and our server, Jessie was amazing and his assistant Christopher too. It was a bit busy on a Monday morning but the staff had their A game on.  2018 Yelp Review #14

IExpJg9P5JTqFEauZg1mGA.text: Tired of the depressing hotel grub, smell, and noise. Searched 'best oatmeal in Vegas' and this place pops up.  I know...sounds retarded searching f oatmeal...  Drove up and was a little suspect of the location.   Walked in to Stairway to Heaven (live version) playing.  First impression.... nice.    Sat at community table. Nice smiles and good iced tea... unsweetened.  Trendy menu.   Norah Jones.   The oatmeal 2 scrambled eggs n side of turkey bacon arrived quick..., about the same time Creedence came on just before Gordon lightfoot.   Plugs st the bar.   Oatmeal was wonderful... well presented. Bacon was fat!  Eggs were eggs.   Ask for 'Z' to serve you..!!!!  John Denver Rocky Mountain High....  What a find.  Thanks Dad.

hDt4B6SMOPCrNk7hxUECCA.text: this was my destination on a long hot day of walking and navigating bus system. my new friend debbie told me she knew the owner, and that it was close to fremont street experience, which i also enjoyed. arugala salad yum and healthy. best almonds and copious cheese.  cinnamon biscuits- good. nice mix of strawberry compote and fresh.   great room.  friendly and fun staff. thanks!!!!!

6p5EnC_To4LhO4gc5Hw8ug.text: First time trying Eat, I found it on yelp which seem like great reviews. To be honest it was just ok. I had a blt sandwich which you can't really mess up. My boyfriend had the chicken fried steak which was suppose to be one of their best selections. I will say the cinnamon biscuits were pretty good. Nice atmosphere and the  location is pretty cool. I probably won't be eating here again.

LXS45nPqxQ0VOK9bt9AMKw.text: Every time I come to EAT the food is amazing the service is amazing and it has truly become one of my favorite places to frequent downtown.   I recommend the deviled eggs and the chicken sausage

J_Z2XdkcNoo2fTYjij8X0g.text: The food was great! Their pancakes are so crispy and buttery on the outside and fluffy on the inside! The grits were a little runny for my liking but good nonetheless. We were very happy with our order and being people who were visiting Vegas, this is a great off the strip breakfast spot that is really close to downtown vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U55lRFvU4YUKvklIS4JnmA.text: Surprisingly amazing breakfast. Probably the best breakfast Ive had in the states, almost on par with what you'd get in Canada. Ordered the pancakes with eggs/bacon. The pancakes were extremely tender and crispy on the edges. Was shocked to see they provided actual authentic maple syrup instead. I'm also happy there wasn't a casino machine in there. Only negatives were the wait times. Prices could be better as well. Will definitely stop here again if im in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U7QUBiX5PMb7yA5p4tPCWw.text: We LOVED this place.   We were seated at the bar. It was like a watching a cook off show. The 5 chefs are like a well oiled machine. Making Gordon Ramsay proud.   We had the mushroom sandwich and the shrimp grits. Yummy! Coffee was good too.

QN3k7MkOGUZvQGMArGvzHg.text: Great spot. Fast and easy if you're solo.  Highly recommend the egg sandwich with truffle.  OJ is freshly squeezed. Nice break from the strip and my "go to" on the way out of town

Bs9DenE4jJx3PDVwSUkzYQ.text: Our party of 5 arrived Saturday morning about 10ish. No long wait but we weren't seated until everyone arrived. We all ordered pancakes and they were some of the BEST we've had. Hands down! And the potatoes were tasty with the perfect crispness. Place isn't very big but service was good. I'd definitely recommend and will gladly return when I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HXD22FEIbipsuIXZbE_A5Q.text: Eat. Reminds me of those coffee houses in my college town circa 2005. Hipster, underground, super friendly, and comfortable. The industrial look meets comfy place to hide from the Vegas heat means you feel like you're sitting down for a meal from the family. We tried first the cinnamon biscuits. Homemade biscuits dusted with cinnamon and sugar and crisped up on the griddle with strawberry/ blueberry compote. It tasted so farm fresh and sweet. The biscuit was soft but the outside was crispy which held up to the compote. Then I got the oatmeal with candied pecans. It was warming from inside out. I definitely want to go back and try the burrito- but it was the side of my face so i couldn't chow down that hard this time of morning !!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OBjzRVVpvn8o4Yz2QyxnYg.text: We came here in search of good coffee and brunch and it did NOT disappoint! The deep fried deviled eggs were amazing and the coffee was exactly what the doctor ordered after a long weekend of Vegas fun. I can't wait to go back so I can Eat. here again.

Zw-uz-NGKr_6fXUIkmZkJg.text: Went here for breakfast. Awesome food! Great portions and price. Highly recommended!!!

4skIINSYPpem3MRUC2n5Pg.text: Walked a few blocks from the hotel to find Eat. Let me tell you, I wasn't disappointed about the beads of sweat trickling down my back when I got there!!   The staff were friendly, the menu was clear and easy to read. Really my only complaint was trying to narrow it down to ONE menu item to order.   Eventually, after about 10 minutes of debate, I settled on the huevos motulenos. As I sat there sipping on some amazing coffee, regretting a few of my less than stellar decisions from the night before, once the food arrived... all regret washed away!!   It was just the right combo of sweet, spicy, and comfort masterfully presented on a single plate!! I didn't put my fork down until that plate was clean!!  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND Eat. as a MUST for anyone looking for a truly kick ass breakfast/brunch joint!!

bPb32-09FKzt6GUM_6-Hyg.text: Quaint downtown location!  Non-touristy. Great decor and great service.   I had the truffled egg sandwich and I loved it. I feel like I will never be able to eat "regular" eggs again, after having these.    I had read other reviews about issues with refills, but we did not have this issue on our trip.  Our service, was fast and hospitable.   I look forward to going again for the chicken fried steak.

2KG9RTsUU-Ku0bG1iAJ4cw.text: Very chill in here.  Background tunes not loud at all...perfect for those of us who just woke up.  Somewhere Over the Rainbow by Israel Kamakawiwoole playing now.  The food was really good, and there was lots of it.  Really loved the atmosphere, mostly the fact it was not packed (much busier when we left).  I had the truffled egg sandwich with dill potatoes (well done).  Sandwich was good and big. The potatoes were the bomb, though!  Hubby had the chicken fried steak with 2 eggs, potatoes, and sourdough toast. He was thoroughly happy.  Really good service and really good coffee with fresh cream.  Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak and eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak and eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled Egg Sandwich with dill potatoes (well done)

ltNuUc1v-JUWP9AxwQ45Ig.text: Best place in Las Vegas to eat , good and delicious food , take your friend and families they won't regret

AwDl-0T1AyCEC2kjBsjMyg.text: We stay in downtown Vegas a few times a year and we can't be more thrilled of the quality of restaurants that are popping up here over the few years.  We tried to get into EAT for brunch 6 months ago, but the line was over an hour wait, so unfortunately we had to pass.  This weekend we went for an early breakfast and yea, only a 10 minute wait. Cool decor, hipster type, a tall community table in the middle, we got a small table. We were properly greeted, drinks taken quickly and had really great service. Variety of menu options from sweet to savory, love the quality of ingredients, farm to fork focus and ingenuity of flavors and ingredient cimu I had the Huevos Multalenos, easy over eggs over black beans, sweet bananas, feta, corn tortilla smothered in green Chile and savory red chili sauces - so delicious, served with chive home potatoes. Variety of savory egg sandwiches/truffle mushroom topped, chicken waffles, chicken and grits, huge pancakes and more! Street parking but easy access.  We will be back!

JyS57dpKk84VnvPKcaopfg.text: EAT. UP.   The area looked a little sketchy... but that didn't stop me from eating here. (also because I came in an Uber and I had to get out). ANYWAYS Arrived around 12:15pm on Sunday and there was a small wait. Service was great. Quick and helpful.  My friend and I shared the deviled eggs and truffled egg sandwich. The deviled eggs are SO. GOOD. It's basically deep fried egg white topped with the yolk toppings and bacon. Made perfectly. Could have eaten more but the cholesterol... This was definitely something I've never tried before and for $8, no regrets. The Truffled Egg Sandwich $13 + avocado $2 was pretty good too. I enjoyed the scrambled eggs.  Honestly, this place is over my normal price range for brunch but I'll definitely come back for the deviled eggs!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of 12/11/16

Iy2EHFpOSEEm0-l_h6ekmQ.text: Echoing the great service.  We were seated immediately.  Had 3 kids with us.  Not a problem.  Food was great!  All of their bread uses these huge slices.  Very fresh and tasty.    Grilled Cheese Sandwich: Love the big bread! Corned beef hash with poached eggs: Well done! Reuben Sandwich: Very good, also with that big bread! Tomato Salad: Tangy with small tasty tomatos.   Kick-ass Tomato Soup: Like a tomato bisque.  Amazing!  Cinnamon Bisquits: Not a favorite of mine.  Felt like it was dry even with the sauce and the fruit toppings.  Also got a cold brew coffee which was from stumptown.  Good stuff.  Overall a great experience.  Walking distance to container park as well where you can let the kids run around in the playground to burn off some energy.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with kick ass tomato soup.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben sandwich with tomato salad.

lTIzdriam5RkAXY0hnAR6Q.text: I don't know if it's because I'm not a Vegas local, But this place was average. Shrimp and grits- lacking general gusto & shrimp, while the Cinammon biscuits were fool's gold- terribly executed thick biscuit hockey puck. Service was fine, however you can't split a check when you have maybe 4 tables? Grow up and become a big boy server and change that policy. Overall, not recommending this place to any friends visiting Vegas.

T54zgipOQIxoVRZVonspsg.text: The food here is great, if you don't value good customer service. I walked to be silently stared at at the front door and all other requests made by my party were reluctantly done. None of the employees seem happy to be doing their jobs and it's really a shame because if they were happy serving this delicious good, this would be the perfect place!

SfP8wuTsA8zvTLkgl5brHA.text: Went here New Year's Day for breakfast with a group.  Service was friendly and the food was tasty. Nothing was amazing except the pancakes. I'd say that is definitely something to go there for as they have a nice crispness to them. Some people at my table got the Benedict and loved it.   Also nice decor inside!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict plus avocado
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thick toast!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak - pretty good

eL8aT86i2SBNcB5XKLQnmQ.text: Ahhhhhhhhhh....That pretty much sums it up for me about eat.....just one big delightful comfort food sigh.  My first time here and damn was it good.  A really nice place with some really amped up comfort food.  My dish, the Chicken fried steak with potatoes was very memorable.  The way they make their potatoes really took it beyond the standard breakfast potato from most places.  The potatoes are cooked perfectly and have this nice, light char on them that adds an extra depth of flavor.  Also mixed in with the potatoes are highly caramelized pieces of onion and garlic, adding even more flavor to the mix.  So damn tasty.  The chicken fried steak was super crispy on the outside with a gravy that was creamy and spicy.  I would love a big bowl of gravy by itself and eat it like a stew.  The portion was also pretty huge so it could easily make two meals (or just one meal for someone like me.)  My friend, who's a vegetarian, ordered the truffle egg sandwich which also looked good.  I didn't try it but he said he liked it.  Actually, his sandwich comes with bacon so I got to have that so I did get to try something off his dish.  The bacon was good. :)  One thing I want to try on the next visit are the pancakes.  The table next to us ordered this and those are the thickest pancakes I've ever seen, they were an inch thick each! They looked super fluffy and has some chicken/apple sausage with it.  Next time for sure.  Another cool spot in the middle-of-being-revitalized downtown area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef/owner Natalie taking a break before the brunch rush
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese &amp; tomato soup with a side of pancake.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with a side of bacon.

6c9UuUNXi0QWspHKiagLyQ.text: Very nice place and the staff is friendly and professional. Food was great, we had breakfast that was delicious. I would go back in a heartbeat.

cAUD-gBOidnPOeNX1AQXtg.text: Really enjoyed this place this morning. Showed up first thing at 8am to get a good seat. There was a couple people standing outside before the restaurant opened.  (Definitely come early to get a good seat). Food was delicious. Portions were very generous. Customer service was great. Would definitely come here again. A+++

2PBNWC9oo3x1NLy4fCpAKA.text: Food: average (eggs w bacon, toast, homefries) Drink: above average (iced coffee w a paper straw, bonus points for the straw) Serv: average speed Music: above average (it was all Dave Matthews. every song.) Price: below average ($16 for eggs & coffe) Other: staff was personable. clientele was fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pi5Io8RTx5aIpIHX8WKbwA.text: Host was inviting and sat us fast  Greeted by a super sweet girl with black Framed glasses and tattoos, who took our drinks and was really nice!!   Laura served us who was very attentive and helpful making up our minds on what to get!!   You have to try there fried devil eggs and strawberry biscuits!!   Simple things like there coffee was so good   Easy parking  Fast service  Will come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried devil eggs

ek90CGbi0q9vT8oI7X371g.text: If you are hungry for breakfast or lunch in Las Vegas stop what you are doing and head to Eat. Everything we had was beyond amazing. A few things to try:   1. They have deviled eggs that are dipped in batter and lightly fried. I am not a huge fan of deviled eggs so I was skeptical, but they were amazing.   2. The cinnamon Biscuits. A really good twist on traditional biscuits and tasted more like a really good dessert to me than an an appetizer. Good size portion with 4 biscuits.  3. The dwblt- the best blt I've ever had served with really good kettle style chips. The bread really thick and high quality and the ingredients tasted fresh.   4. The country fried steak- my husband LOVES a good country fried steak and he said this is the best he has ever had. I got a bite and I would definitely recommend. The beading was amazing and the gravy was really thick and delicious.   5. The tomato soup- so good with the grilled cheese.  Our group didn't order a single thing we didn't love!   It's only open for breakfast and lunch and it fills up fast so make sure you plan ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lVt9TYaLF_8o25F39LJTjw.text: I've read nothing but great reviews from my fellow Yelpers, so I stopped by.  For a Saturday morning, we were seated with minimal waiting, but it was at the counter.  The restaurant is small so it gets pretty noisy, but who cares when the food is delicious. Ordered the Killer Grilled Cheese + pancakes on the side. And the bf got Cinnamon biscuits + potatoes and chives.   The grilled cheese was killer on sourdough bread and came with tomato soup that wasn't too tomato-y (which I definitely appreciated) the pancakes came with house maple syrup in a sealed individual jar :)   The food was great, but the service was constantly busy so I guess it was fine...regardless, I'm visiting again when they switch up the menu every so often so I can try others!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer Grilled Cheese (ORDER!!)
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Syrup for the pancakes :))
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato + chives

XBh5LNLdXpCEI99AgJV2cA.text: The food was wonderful !! Unfortunately, the service was less than attentive. Seems that no server wanted a table of 5. The one who did get  stuck with us paid as little attention as possible  until she eased the check on the table without saying anything and took off again. Maybe we'll try some other time, but 5 people  who feel ignored translated into lackluster tipping.

U4HPY5D4j3bW4BD0fd6kUA.text: All the trappings of a great restaurant, just not the food. Pancakes were doughy and the little tiny sausage they gave was insulting. I also had poached eggs, the yolks were cooked solid? WTF?

s5QiB8mHfW0UG-Qyg4yYTg.text: This is another place that I try to visit whenever I am in Vegas and near container park as the food is awesome.   They only serve breakfast and lunch but the menu is unique.  They get a lot of the business lunch crowd during the week so can be a little wait at noon.  To avoid recommend going at 11:30a or 1p.   So although the food is awesome I have found the service is just alright and does not match the food, which is why the 4 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach salad

XjBc9H3hfCpkUSvvbNSFTQ.text: Worth the walk from out hotel. Love the place and the food. Must try their SHRIMP AND GRITS. love it

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

exsDGEqsK4RzioeJTDm4uQ.text: Awesome spot, I really liked the vibe and the atmosphere. The people were very friendly and the food was amazing. We ordered the special sandwich that they have with eggs, mushrooms and feta chesse and it was the bomb! I loved the whole experience and would come back again. Great place for bruch.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g-MxbwMZrN-l9XfE53KTng.text: Another downtown place that rocks!  I am continuing my downtown exploration & finally landed here on a Sunday at around 12:30. Tons of folks were patiently waiting to get a seat and after about 15 mins we got sat inside near the kitchen with a view of the entire place. The experience began outside with a blue grass band which was awesome!   Service was on it and it was insanely busy. Nice job guys!   The food - I was really impressed with all of the flavors and everything we tasted was delicious. The freshly squeezed orange juice started everything off and I was very pleased. I ordered the eggs benedict which were phenomenal, they came with tomatoes, spinach and ham. The breakfast potatoes here were out of this world. I definitely had a food orgasm as the yolk dripped onto them. I haven't had a breakfast this good in a long time. My man ordered the eggs with bacon & chicken apple sausage with a single pancake. All items were really great. They have their own syrup! It wasn't too sweet and very rich, loved it!   Overall we had a really great time and left smiling. We had to walk this brunch off because the portions here are huge. I cannot wait to go back to try something else to see if this place is the real deal. I believe it is :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My perfect breakfast with the best chive potatoes ever :)
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE grilled cheese sandwich &amp; tomato bisque
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshly squeezed orange juice is a must here for breakfast

Ed1lPrPGC_aVME7IwM-h_Q.text: Stopped in one Saturday, with the wife.  Pretty cool setting as they continue with reclaiming of Downtown Las Vegas Project.  Order the Shrimp and Grits and Strawberry Biscuits.  In keeping it honest, everything was truly delicious.  My only ding, is I personally though the Strawberry Biscuits sauce, could have been a bit sweeter.  Besides that, things were spot on.  We got there at around 9am.  Lucky too, because as we were leaving (around 9:40AM) that front door was swinging.  Speaking of front door.  Nice touch on the wording as you exit: ATE!  Nicely played.  We will be back.

gERC2hGU02javoWcls9JwQ.text: Stopped in for breakfast today with my husband and son and was seated pretty quickly.  We ordered Eggs Benedict, Chicken Fried Steak and the Corned Beef Hash along with coffee, water and a soda. Everything tasted good and the only reason for only receiving 4 out of 5 stars was the fact that after our server asked how everything was initially we never saw him again.  We attempted to flag him down and the lady who brought our drinks over initially. Nobody came by to offer refills and we had to ask the lady who bussed our dishes for our check. When our server dropped off the check, he did just that without any acknowledgement what so ever.  I would definitely return for the food, it was delicious but the lack of attention to service did spoil our experience a little.

-W144jEq6ME5jGEgxQeA1g.text: To wake up just to have breakfast is not my style.  To drive downtown is not my style either.  To pay for parking???  Heck no!!!  I'd much rather have an apple and sit in front of the TV or drive to work.  I must have been possessed when I decided to come to eat.  There was construction going on too.  It's a small place so I can imagine the line later during the day or weekend.  I ordered a truffled egg sandwich.  My friend wanted eggs benedict but they only serve it during the weekend so she opted for the Mediterranean egg white frittata.  Truffled Egg Sandwich: Scrambled eggs with mushrooms, feta cheese, 2 strips of bacon and chives with a side of smashed potatoes. The bread was crispy...I would normally skip half of the bread but it was good that I had to eat the whole thing.  The saltiness from the bacon, the creamy mild tartness  from the feta, the earthiness of the mushrooms and chives with fluffy scrambled eggs...I. could. not. stop. eating. 5/5  Mediterranean Egg White Frittata: I normally prefer egg whites and have nothing to do with egg yolks.  This is my idea of a perfect breakfast minus the olives since I'm allergic to them. It has spinach, tomato, sprouts, feta cheese with an English muffin.  My friend was lucky it had olives, otherwise, I would have been all over this too. 5/5  The service was great.  The chef/owner was there.  Each breakfast plate is about $11.  My advice is to bring coins for the parking meter.  To enjoy good food is my style.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled egg sandwich (so good)
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Natalie
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg White Frittata

1ZHPXH0juVPRfZehCGYjOQ.text: Just ate here this morning for breakfast. Cute joint by Container Park. It's not too big or too small and there's even outdoor seating.  Party of 5- 3 adults and 2 children. Our servers name was Gary. He was very friendly and attentive. He even tried to make small talk in between serving the tables.  We must've been hungry because we walked out with a $70 bill. Eggs Benedict, corned beef hash, bacon and eggs, oatmeal, biscuits and pancakes. Oh and 2 coffees.  The oatmeal wasn't the greatest and a little on the cold side, but that's okay. It wasn't all that bad and the other food compensated. Would come back again..

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and eggs (comes with toast too but didn&#39;t get to take a pic)
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancake

Of70fDUv_W9dNrA6Y-Fz3w.text: Good food, brought out fast. Service was adequate, but not as friendly and courteous as a place with 4-5 stars. I got the impression that a large part of the staff was a recovering addict or was given a 2nd chance after doing some time. Kudos to this place for hiring this people.

scM3foBtNku6WwLgeLmFbA.text: Eat. was excellent. The service was on point, and the food was wonderful. This was my first time dinning here. I brought my mom, and she loved it. This place is perfect for breakfast, brunch, and lunch. They do however close at 3:00. Either way. It is the perfect daytime spot. I will definitely be back.

_9gBDDAFcjxVZA7604XEgg.text: Great downtown spot. The biscuit with fruit awesome combo. I over order and also got the truffle egg sandwich. Totally worth the food comma.

QQc_UGlgTBifs-zFj7QFIQ.text: If your server utters anything with the words "deviled eggs" in it, say "yes" and start throwing money at them. Their deep-fried deviled eggs with liquid Schwartz on them are amazing. I don't remember what they were specifically called (they were an orally-described special) because I pretty much blanked out from eating them because they were so good.  I also had the prime rib hash with jalapeno and salsa. It was good, but I was surprised by the cilantro (I'm a cilantro-tastes-soapy genetic type dude).  This place is super popular. It's one of the businesses backed by Tony Hsieh's Downtown Project. So it's bringing new business to a neighborhood that needs some love.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special deviled eggs. Jesus Christ order these.

vkYJVthqFzAp-iemmE-BsQ.text: Nothing crazy, food is good, if Im around the area i will stop by, but I will not drive more than 15 miles for it.

XDEUckeCdQOCIK9KHtDFbQ.text: Holy crap! I'm not usually a fan of the downtown Las Vegas scene, but I heard so many good things about this place, I just couldn't stay away. One of my best friends was in town this weekend and we decided to meet up for breakfast here. Parking is ample, but be sure to bring coins with you since it's all metered. The hostess has lots of change if you do need to break a larger bill, though.   The wait wasn't long and 5 minutes after putting our name in we were seated and perusing the menu. The menu is succinct, but despite how small it is I was torn on what to order. It all looked so amazing, I couldn't decide. It didn't help to look around the room at others either because they only succeeded in proving that it was all great. I settled on the shrimp and grits while my friend got the eggs benedict. The guys next to us ordered the chicken fried steak and I know it must have been amazing since they devoured them in silence with content looks on their faces. I was so excited for our meals to come.   I don't typically dig the hipster vibe, but this place really had a warm and welcoming feeling to it. I loved the decor and hospitality and especially enjoyed the live music quite a bit as well.   On to the food. Absolutely amazing. I savored every bite and so did my egg benedict-eating friend. We enjoyed every last bite and I was also quite a fan of the freshly brewed passion fruit tea. Once we were done with our meals, we couldn't resist continuing to watch all the great things coming from the kitchen, despite how full we were. I cannot wait to come back again really soon. The prices are great for the quality of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live music
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; grits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passion fruit iced tea

oYRR0C8_RHWSMnMI8edujw.text: Great place, very friendly staff, huge portions small eaters can split and big eaters like me can get full on.  Street parking can be hard to find sometimes.  Well worth the trip. You won't be disappointed.

0Z92J86CqN1MT0MpyEp1Lg.text: A hidden gem. I use to joke and say it's the best kept secret to visitors and the funny thing is they're always packed! Lol. The food is so good here. This is a breakfast/lunch joint. I don't eat grits but wow the shrimp and grits is awesome! The portions here are pretty good. The breakfast potatoes are so good. Toast is BIG toast. I love it. Seating may take a while this place is small. They do have outdoor seating as well. We waited 1 hour and 30 min one time for tables so we just walked over to the container park til it was time. (That's how good the food is) I guess you can say it's worth the wait.

wHPexO2m6u9V0aca_jKUeQ.text: Found this restaurant via Yelp!! Good call!! Cab driver asked how in the world we found this place...so far off the strip!!! LOL   So glad we did!! We had the cinnamon biscuits w strawberry compote, the golden-brown pancake (best ever plain Jane pancake) the truffle egg sandwich and the huevos motulenos!!! Everything beyond delicious!! Super large portions...lots of food for the money!  A fantastic LV find for breakfast!! Well worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote

0LZhYD5O3kZZddAkr218iA.text: Pretty busy but a short wait time! Good service and amazing food. The kick ass grilled cheese was honestly so kick ass lmao. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o_9Dm5RhwAiRoMqOUN3h1w.text: Love the coffee.  Tofu scramble is yum.  Gary for the win.

tu308fM9MOQQ5uHDtLZ22w.text: Great find on Yelp! Got there 5 mins before closing and was served by super friendly staff. Menu is healthy and portions sensible. No alcohol license for those of you needing a beer in the 100 degree heat.

nbxFyxf65lbdaKVd6io2vw.text: If you eat at one place in Vegas, make this the place.  Went there for breakfast, and had about a 10 minute wait......no big deal.  After being seated and given menu's I noticed a woman that was bussing other tables.  She came over and greeted my wife and I and introduced herself as the owner.  WHATTTTTTT!!!  The owner is bussing a table, I was impressed and I told her that.  Next up the food.  PHENOMENAL is an understatement. Even the chef came out to refill our water glasses, not sure if this is a new concept but I have never experienced this type of service and I loved it!!!!  Every time I visit Vegas I won't leave until I dine here.   INCREDIBLE dining experience.

7CLKYrNSk1RLMIDsIVvxeg.text: You can't go wrong with this awesome place. The owner is very personable and the staff was outstanding. THE FOOD is off the meter.

l-hzE8B3FnDil_ZRa2zTTA.text: Perfect spot downtown for breakfast or lunch!  We enjoyed the beignets and then the shrimp and grits!  Amazing food incredible service!  Hip and beautiful space!  I can't wait to go back and try more!

UJP8Q0KNM6enjA6w79D1yg.text: Was an amazing breakfast and great service- awesome little hidden gem- had the country fried steak and want seconds!

TdUeQMSlpR-Xk3s0_yc1Nw.text: The food was awesome!  I had the two eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast which was awesome!  I also tried the deviled eggs which were coated in panko, these were so delicious..I don't think I can eat regular deviled eggs now!  My nephew had the short stack of pancakes with blueberries..they were able delicious!  Had the fresh strawberry lemonade to drink..yummy!  Excellent service from our server sheana to the host and busser!  I will be back!

O7tfMr0KDeHiKuHLLDiA0A.text: Highly overrated. Biscuits with strawberry were good, not amazing. Tofu scramble was completely flavorless.

10potBhOhOOQemw4VXOsFQ.text: We stumbled upon Eat while waiting for our Neon Museum tour and took a chance with its very nondescript exterior.  The decor and ambience inside were a pleasant surprise.  The food was very good.  We had the herbed eggs benedict, the eggs, bacon and grits and the waffles.  I would definitely order the benedict again.  The only negative thing was that our waiter was not so friendly or even prompt.  The hostess ended up rescuing us with taking our drink order before he even stopped by.  Someone else brought our food and I cannot recall him ever speaking to us.    I realize anyone can have a bad day and overall it was a good experience.  We will be back.

3enVvKmlSssRRjBBu6SR7w.text: What a pleasant experience in downtown Las Vegas.  The truffled egg sandwich was superb, the feta really made the dish! The bacon was perfectly crisp- almost fluffy- and the bread had the perfect bite, chewy but not tough.  The coffee was excellent, the staff professional,  the entire breakfast was 360 degrees of perfection.

qbRUb6dEksKyZd427WmPfg.text: Just had breakfast at EAT... best breakfast ever! The food was excellent and the service was phenomenal! Pancakes to die for!

XkBh5D6wj6KOaxGBdmqxzg.text: This place deserves more than 5 stars! I stopped here recently and the food was amazing. The owner said she's been open for only 105 days and I couldn't believe it. The place ran smoothly, was extremely clean, and the staff was super nice. I wish them much success. Whenever I'm back in Vegas I'll visit here!

9sJHxx-aW0o29l6LsUwgoA.text: Very Good...impressed with service and food. Shrimp and grits were great with an order side of sour bread toast! Just was not impress with having to pay to park.

mC2fsppFQAjRmXTIBagj2A.text: The pancakes are great. I had shrimp and grits, the shrimp and grits was BAD! The grits was soupy and very plan. For two adults and 1 child we paid 70.81, not worth it. The restaurant is well decorated and modern. This place is over priced for what you get.

N8HlV_ywQkHi2zmL8DjP3Q.text: I love Eat. Been there 3 times and it never disappoints. I'm a big fan of breakfast and am very picky about where I go. Eat is at the top of my list (along with Bagel Cafe) in Vegas. Chef Nat is terrific: welcoming and hands on when she needs to be.

8IYnRowPJUteD26URFOzOg.text: Incredible food, enjoyable vibe, pleasant staff, timely service. Loved the art. Loved the seating. Loved it all. My eggs were cooked perfectly. Go.

zUCsyODuAGUe1nffwlY3vw.text: I was completely disappointed in the quality of the food.  I work downtown and my office mates and I order from Eat quite regularly, but today we were shocked to have received some of the worst food we've ever eaten from Eat.  We ordered both of the chicken sandwiches that are on the limited menu only to discover they were obviously made from frozen chicken breasts that were rubbery and tasted like plastic.  The bread was soggy which, when combined with the disgusting chicken made our sandwiches inedible.  My co worker and I ended up throwing both of our lunches away.  We were also told they no longer are making beignets, which we came to really enjoy.  We vowed never to order from this place again as the food definitely does not match the prices charged, and as there are so many other lunch spots to pick from, we won't miss this eatery.

Wyipe5zaaPi_PtJTGr-I9w.text: Great food, great ambiance.  Had a BLT on crack with avocado, chipotle mayo and the most buttery, decadent sourdough bread around.  Staff was courteous, attentive and the pricing for food was great.  $3 for a soda is a bit high in my mind, but I'm willing to overlook since everything else was so stellar.

U-tVXnEQu5iHiQ8f2wvE8Q.text: Went on a saturday so we had the brunch menu. I had the arugula salad with chicken and my boyfriend had the eggs benedict. Both items were delicious. It is a very limited menu though.

AmdVNGLE6pflaCjm5GYgLg.text: The food was good; however I believe restaurants in Las Vegas have forgotten the meaning of customer service. We went in around 10:30am on a weekday because this place gets really busy during peak breakfast and lunch hours. We got our bill and put 2 cards for them to split the check. They ran both cards and included a note about check splitting, i.e. "Dear check splitters, when we are slammed we will only take one card per table." I found this note after-the-fact quite rude, especially since they were not slammed. I see that it's a small place so a quick turnover is necessary. Still, this was an absolutely rude way to enforce a no check splitting policy. The policy was posted nowhere prior to paying our bill, nor was the note there when they brought us the check. I find this to be a ridiculous policy as far as customer service goes, but what was the point of telling us AFTER they split the check. Was this meant to "shame" us? If they are trying to let us know for "next" time, no worries with the multitude of restaurants available in Las Vegas, neither one of us will ever go back, that was so rude.

JpGoEN88NZmvCcL2FLqOGQ.text: We found Eat through Yelp and it was a GREAT find.  Food, service and atmosphere were just what we were looking for.  Great change from the casino restaurants and worth it.  Pricier than the normal Vegas breakfast, but you get what you pay for!  We went twice - once by ourselves to check it out and then brought the family back the next day and they all raved about the food and service.  It is very convenient - one street over from Fremont.

83LPok5vTwJ8HeckV1J_Uw.text: Was disappointed they replaced the beignets on the menu, saw it on yelp and that's what made my decision to go there...  However, menu options were amazing and tasty! Large portions, should've shared because I don't have a microwave in my hotel room.   Server in particular was NOT very nice, the rest of the staff was very nice and accommodating-didn't look at me like my requests were ridiculous.   Over all, thumbs up and I would try this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs-over easy Chilequiles-eggs over easy  And  Pancakes!!   huge portions!

3jEbwEn2CCQwF-UXMxXC7A.text: Eaten here (no pun intended) twice in the past couple years and I haven't been disappointed. Quality food at this very hip and tucked away spot. The seating arrangements leave a little to be desired; small tables and big food portions don't compliment each other. Same with their service as well; I didn't feel as though the server I got on the most recent visit was very attentive or interested, but this was only one of two visits, so I'm will to give this spot infinite chances as their menu has a lot to offer. Tofu scramble all the way!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1. Buttered wheat toast &amp; chicken apple sausage. 2. Tofu scramble w avocado. 3. Biscuit, mixed berry compote, coffee &amp; OJ!

f32qLmVunvE_Zqfx3nirug.text: I have to say with all these excellent reviews I expected better.  The staff here was super friendly and that I have no  complaints about. We were helped in a timely manner, placed our order quickly and even our food came pretty fast. The place wasn't super busy though so no real surprise there.   The food was the disappointment here. My server said the grilled cheese and tomato soup combo was just okay even though the host told me it was awesome. I should have listened to him because I honestly was not impressed. The soup was watery and didn't taste like a homemade tomato soup. The "grilled cheese" which was too huge to even fit in your mouth was covered in butter...gross. I actually got it with eggs and turkey bacon to try and make it more of a full meal. To be honest it was okay, nothing I couldn't make at home though.  Overall I would say my experience was average and probably would not run back for multiple reasons. No free parking-you have to pay to park to eat here, no validation what so ever. Plus the food was just average, nothing blew me out of the water here. The staff was quite nice to deal with but that is not a reason to come back to a place wouldn't you say?

Os5jfntIHJbP8-tXUAMaww.text: I'm like a pig in s*** when a new place opens up downtown for lunch.  Granted, this place isn't BRAND new but still, I was one happy girl!  First off, location can't get better. There's plenty of parking which saves me a headache.  Unlike Le Thai or that awful "La Comida," you don't have to walk several blocks. The decor is adorable and the music is awesome. Just an all around great atmosphere and the staff is super friendly.  Now to the food- This place has the BEST chicken caesar salad in town!  Its amazing...sliced chicken breast, shaved parmigiano, real bread croutons, and a tasty dressing. The arugula salad is a close second. Chef Nat's version of the shrimp po boy is delicious as well.  Its healthier than a real po boy (Lola's still has the best) but its definitely legit.  And let's not forget the green chili chicken posole.  Its a MUST try!  I'm latin and love a good posole and Nat's version is pretty f****** amazing!  Oh yes, and last but not least, the passion fruit iced tea!  Love.  I'd give this place 5 stars if it wasn't for one thing.  They supposedly do not take rezzies.  Funny, every time I walk in I see "reserved" signs on several tables. Its quite annoying but I take a sip of the yummy iced tea and all is quickly forgiven. :)

DR_C734VjjpJOkqydQ3hZQ.text: eat. was good, and I'd definitely come back. I wasn't wow-ed by my meal, but overall, I was happy with the experience here.  One of my friends described it as ,"a diner with a good attitude" and that fits it almost exactly.  It is urban-hip in decor, and a pretty small restaurant overall.  On a Sunday at 1p, expect a 20 minute wait.  I don't know if it was the acoustics, but it was pretty loud in there, so we chose to wait on the benches outside.  The servers were friendly and pleasant, and the coffee was strong and hot. I'd already scoped out the menu online, but alas, the menu at the restaurant was not exactly the same (no Shrimp Po Boy?! GASP!)   Luckily, I had a second choice in mind.  I ordered the Shrimp & Grits, and yep... My Yelp-ers were correct, those are some runny grits!! I generally don't like my grits so thin.  However, it comes with a lot of shrimp (no tails, either!), big slabs of bacon, and an egg (it comes poached, but they ask how you like it, so I ordered it cooked a little harder).    Because the grits were so thin, I stole my friend's delicious sourdough toast, which was soft and buttery, just the way I like it. The bread helped to sop up the grits, so maybe this meal should come with bread?  My friend enjoyed her corrnbeef hash, and loved that it tasted fresh and homemade. Our other dining companions got the grilled cheese and the huevo ranchero and both said they were delicious.   I'm glad to have a brunch option downtown, and eat. did the trick!

7EjdEea00T_xskqr851HZg.text: I would describe this restaurant as simple and trendy. I appreciated the portion sizes because you don't leave feeling overloaded with food, but full. The customer service was great and the thing that stood out like no other is their THICK CRISPY SOURDOUGH BREAD oh my god soooo good! I wasn't a huge fan of the fact that their menu says they "politely decline" any substitutions/ changes to their food especially because they have a limited menu. Probably not the best place for kids, picky eaters, or people with food limitations.

D-XLhXfbWS_BSWxXK4x2FA.text: 25 minutes wait to be seated but you don't feel it's that long..Robert our server has good suggestion my daughter ordered Truffle egg sandwich & requested a side of their homemade potato chips he suggested to just substitute the potato salad to the chips if she doesn't want the potato salad. Servings are good for 2 people. Price is reasonable ranges fr $8-$15.Defitinely going back w/ out of town visitors!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V5jUb352ENWlbVxNuY63Ng.text: Very nice brunch setting, I ordered the pancakes, felt like something was missing though... Would have paired perfectly with 3 eggs and potatoes Overall good visit, would likely come back

lOx_JdPhUQmLJ4VRoDl6-g.text: Downtown Las Vegas gem.  We had a group of eight and service was excellent. The Downtown Benedict was yummy. I love the turkey bacon, whole wheat English muffin and spinach. I also had the short stack pancakes! Yum! We also had the corn beef hash. It is a must when you come here. The coffee is great.  If you are staying downtown or entertaining family and friends you need to visit this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash!
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short stack
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Downtown Benedict

0TZj8I0kRoK67aWLyWAcqg.text: I highly recommend he egg truffle sandwich. It is seriously out of this world. Do yourself a favor and go there and eat.

9oMGF-1znMqHu_GPCkA0QA.text: The best brunch place in Vegas. Loved the pancakes, deviled eggs and tomato bisque with grilled cheese. We went here twice because of the great experience we had here. Love love love this place!

7h6dPX0nyrlkW2KLvOlZIg.text: Very fast seating...food came out in 5 minutes literally..best breakfast ever  The two eggs any style, potatoes, bacon, and super thick toast were all amazing. The toast especially was so tasty.   The short stack of golden brown pancakes...heaven. Literally some of the best food in my life-and I've been around the block and back. I highly recommend this place.

w8Hda_SAubH57_72VXRY_Q.text: Cute little spot with great food. Slightly snooty attitude from one of the servers when I asked a question but everyone else seemed fine. No wait since it was a weekday and late morning. Had the corned beef hash and a lemonade and both were great. Boyfriend had shrimp and grits and they were good but being from the South, I have high standards for shrimp and grits.
