Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vOKwInreOYgDri_HOtHCkg.text: I need to start off by saying I LOVE the concept of eat and the fact that it is a thriving local business is down right impressive.   My family and I have eaten at eat twice now. Once for brunch and once for lunch. Ill start with our brunch experience: 3 out of 4 of us ordered chicken fried steak. I ordered shrimp and grits. I had their iced tea and it was delish served with an orange slice and mint. Now I LOOOOOVE tea so to be wowed by my usual beverage was awesome.  We shared beignets and they were FABULOUS. I see a lot of reviewers claim they're greasy/oily and that is far from the truth. They're topped with powdered sugar if they were greasy the sugar would be clumpy or at least look wet. They were delicious. The chicken fried steak was the best I had ever tasted and I regret not ordering it too. My shrimp and grits was tasty however the pico de gallo was overwhelmingly onion-y and I hate onions so maybe had I had no pico I would have enjoyed it more. Our service wasn't stellar however it didn't put us off either.   Now on to lunch. We decided to go and try out their sandwiches and have some still NOT OILY beignets. Our server greeted us and got our drink orders a dr. Pepper, apple juice, and 2 iced teas. He came back without a tea and a water instead. Little mix up no prob. Our tea wasn't garnished boo hoo "( still nice flavor.... my daughter received a small glass of apple juice instead of the glass bottle it had come in on our previous visit. I wonder what happened to the rest of her Apple juice. I ordered our beignets and we waited and waited. Got our beignets and devoured them, stacked the plates, and waited. He came over apologizing and said the PC'S were down okay technical glitch I understand. We ordered the free range chicken sandwich, a reuben, a grilled cheese, and a DWblta. Our food didn't take too long and my chicken sandwich while not having a TON of flavor I could taste how fresh each component was. My mom and her wife loved the reuben and blta. My daughters grilled cheese was supposed to come with a tomato salad and chips and while they clearly put ALOT more chips then the rest of us the salad was missing. I would have said something had our waiter ever come back to check on us....my daughter didn't like the sandwich at all. The bread was way too big. Like an inch of bread with a thin layer of cheese then an inch of bread. We decrusted the sandwich then squished it down and she still barely ate more than 3 bites. She didnt even put a dent in tge chips either. When our waiter finally came back he offered us a box and I let him know about the sandwich his response was "do you want me to take it off?" I replied "yes, as you can see she didnt eat any if it." He took her plate and left. He came back saying they would take half off. I'm not one to argue so I said thats ok. This 2nd trip put a big sour taste in our mouths in terms if service. I feel very let down because I was telling people to go try eat!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 311 lyrics on the benches outside

IVF2PnAYExb5HyjC0OSWRg.text: Lively, fast service, great food, and cold brew.  Great for lunch brunch or breakfast, the perfect place for hangovers.

jFa5nCo64gD0ldCGgHd1QQ.text: On Valentine's Day we wanted a change of pave of going to dinner.  So we decided to try brunch.  We were pleasantly surprised!!! We were seated within 10 minutes of arriving. George was our waiter who was versed in the menu options and gave great recommendations. We ordered the deviled eggs as an appetizer.  We then ordered shrimp & grits,egg truffle sandwich, and a single pancake.  All the food was absolutely great.  Food,  service, and atmosphere was personable.  As locals we'll be back again.

XCsq3jIYGcYJpo3RfsoPXA.text: This place is a short walking distance from the downtown casinos.  The restaurant has a cool and hip vibe to it.  I had the Truffle egg sandwich and it was as good as the other reviews.  What impressed me most was the attentive service by the employees.  The quality of the food and excellent customer service makes this a great place to check out.

FpZO4qsavMLN70ugkYGugA.text: So incredibly delicious. The pancake was the perfect blend of crispy and soft. I had the truffle egg sandwich which was amazing. Deviled eggs... Get out of here they are so good. Staff is super cute!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most amazingly delicious little hidden gem in old downtown! Worth the drive off the strip

FyPm70-LXklDybSOhxf6xQ.text: Limited items on the menu but more importantly, nothing spectacular. We had a difficult time picking what we wanted and ended up deciding on chicken pozole that lacked flavor and huevos motulenos with an interesting combination of sweet bananas and savory mexican chiles.   I would pick egg works, another local breakfast joint, any day.

vf6_eGyki3dAUbR5_CmfAg.text: On 07/05/2013, my fiance, BFF Lily L., and I came here for brunch. It seemed busy for a Friday, but we were sat immediately by a very friendly staff member! The atmosphere is cozy and the decor is fun. We started with waters and their Colorado River Roasters fresh-brewed coffee. Crazy fact: I don't enjoy coffee. I don't hate it, but after I quit it cold turkey in 2007, I never went back. I've had a cup here and there, but can't find satisfaction in the bitterness or after-taste. This Colorado River Roasters coffee? SO good. I drank it black with just a sprinkle of raw sugar and it was delicious.  Plus, the coffee went deliciously with their housemade Beignets. Oh, these beignets were good. Lily and I are huge beignet fans and these did not disappoint. They were served with housemade jam and vanilla-scented mascarpone. YUM! For entrees, Lily and I shared the special of the day: BBQ Pulled Pork Hash (tender pork, good BBQ sauce, delicious breakfast potatoes, and beautifully poached eggs on toast) and Shrimp and Grits (perfectly cooked shrimp, creamy grits, thick bacon, fried over-easy eggs, and pico de gallo). My fiance had the Golden-Brown Pancakes served with chicken apple sausage and maple syrup. He was super happy with the pancakes and for good reason, they were some of the best pancakes I've had.   Everything was delicious, but those Shrimp and Grits were out of this world. It had a crazy amount of "soup" with it that seemed out of place (I've seen photos of that dish without the soup), but it still worked. Throwing the bacon and eggs in there was a very good call. I wasn't crazy about the hash dish, but I wouldn't complain about eating it again. Ether way, I can't wait to try some of their other menu selections. Oh, and our server was crazy nice and super awesome! Overall, wonderful experience!

gZd_s13k4bj9DrXv98FzOw.text: Food is deliciously comfortable.  Small local charm is evident in the dining room.  Local ownership has been here during both of my visits.  Feels good to join them for breakfast.  Oh and yeah those Deviled Eggs are the most wonderful thing since before sliced bread.  They weren't on the menu but they were so yummy we could have had more of them as our meal.

Ubl4tL2AxpTHKOvKpqJaMA.text: Small joint in the corner. Wish they had more space though. The fried devil eggs were delicious! I literally would go back just for that. The chicken sandwich was also pretty good. & pancakes . The maple syrup in the little jar were my fav I just wanted to keep it as a souvenir  .

oXOM1v_7rHPQhYXRlqIFVg.text: Great service and food! I was so impressed by the staff! Very trendy yet affordable.  The food was absolutely delicious! ! I had the shrimp and grits, my husband had the chicken fried steak. BEST breakfast we ever had, and everything was from scratch!

D0DwvsOeRaLdJVrctfEZRw.text: Soooooo glad boyfriend and I decided to try this place while vacationing in Vegas. It's about a 10 min can ride from the strip, but so so so worth it. Trust me. We were sat immediately, even though it was a busy morning. In my opinion, they had quite a surprising amount of people working for a Monday morning, which showed. The service was impeccable. Both glasses never went below half empty. The iced tea was phenomenal. We started with the special of the day, their deep fried deviled eggs. UNBELIEVABLE. At one point, I think every single table in the restaurant had one on the table. management: take note that your servers clearly push specials well, and know how to sell them. For brunch, boyfriend had the Reuben with chips, I had the two eggs breakfast with their special sausage, sourdough toast, and a pancake on the side. Everything was incredible. His sandwich was heavenly, served on thick bread, with the best housemate chips I've ever ever had. My breakfast was perfect, the chive potatoes living up to its reviews. My toast was served with a house strawberry jam that was so good it ended up all over my perfectly griddled pancake. All in all, it was a perfect perfect breakfast. Boyfriend and I wished we could have taken it all home, but it wouldn't have survived our day on the strip.   Thank you eat! We both vowed to come back any time we visit Vegas.   Trust me partiers, absolutely worth the 12 dollar can ride from the strip. ESPECIALLY if you're hungover.

jRuFfImdtYvAyhzUT_fUng.text: Yummy breakfast, great service, and cool atmosphere! And the toast is amazing! Highly recommend!

54SsQ5_JwuC_9mwwIRrQGA.text: The meal was fantastic. Service fun and casual. The eggs with banana (huevos mutelonos (sp?) was the best I have ever had.

JOyZ2MKRD2SutTawkrMJGg.text: Really cool hole in the wall place.  Ordered the huevos motulenos.  It was good.  A little heavy on the sauce but good.

lL-sBHYQg0j_YhOUVCnMLw.text: Food was delicious! I had the hash and eggs and the cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote. Service was prompt and friendly. The food came out quickly. Worth driving off the strip for!

mcltTbLhN8sAtrezM1C3xg.text: This place only serves breakfast and lunch but everything that we ordered was delicious! We tried the "chef special" deviled eggs which had deep fried egg whites which was great.  The best thing we ordered had to be the shrimp and grits, it was creamy and flavorful. Our servers were very attentive, checking in on us often.  This place is more on the pricey side for breakfast/lunch food but the quality and freshness of the ingredients makes it worth it.  Good sized portions, our family left the place more than satisfied. Definitely check out this place if you're in the area and looking for a good place for brunch/lunch.

g66xYgkXeCvPRs9dch6eyg.text: Absolutely amazing. The best food I've had in a long time. Excellent service. Cool atmosphere. A MUST-GO for locals and visitors alike.

U4Im_riwiVmsdwZDBQtP-A.text: Came here due to the crazy amount of reviews and was totally worth the drive. I really underestimated the portions due. Usually it's quality over quantity but their portions were huge and their food was amazing. I had the truffle eggs, shrimp and grits and even the pancakes are a must try. My pancakes were fluffy and huge taste amazing. The prices are very fair for their hugeeeee portions. Must come back and try their earlier breakfast menu.

aGZKzIGxpbfn4x25doyhJw.text: eat was a happy find in vegas. one word though - hipster. haha it was totally reminiscent of all the hip spots out in the west coast - only in downtown vegas. along with the hip decor and staff, the service was excellent.  everyone loved their dishes.   - biscuits + jam: we started off with these and they were great. the biscuits were flaky and dry which balanced perfectly with their homemade strawberry jam (it wasn't too sweet). win!  - huevos motulenos: it was such an interesting mix of flavors that i was surprised that i enjoyed it as much as i did. the two different salsas with the eggs, beans, bananas, peas & feta - it was almost like a breakfast salad (minus the greens haha). the potatoes that come as a side were amazing, sprinkled with chives and perfectly crisp exteriors. - pancakes: these were the star of the show for me. their pancakes were SO good and the maple syrup that came with it an excellent complement. they were so fluffy without feeling heavy and crispy on the outside edges. i don't even like pancakes so that's saying a lot!  portions were a bit on the larger side so we didn't clean off our plates - but we left super satisfied and happy. this was my favorite brunch in vegas.

Ik2BQlTSmo0GmACZ_hyV4A.text: Great breakfast spot in downtown with decent prices. Shrimp and grits we're awesome, egg sandwich was just as good. The fresh squeezed OJ was spectacular. Would definitely go back!

86uu4uYOFbOtZmcWGSmVug.text: We have been here about 5 times and each time it's just as good. The menu looks simple but each item is made from heaven itself!

SM0OxVZSlfzVD0O2VST9Kw.text: We (my office) eat here (to go) all the time. Went in today and Andrea, server, was horrible - especially to her fellow worker.

BAD3OwYOU0M4sL_NT85m3Q.text: Amazing breakfast. Eggs Benedict special was awesome. Cinnamon biscuits were great.  Pancake with special syrup was awesome. Wheat toast was the best!!!  All around great place for breakfast with the family.  Servers were friendly and very attentive.

uC33INimATbHVi9oPELN1g.text: Great option for brunch/lunch in the downtown area!  I first learned about Eat after taking a Downtown Project tour.  After hearing Natalie's story, I was sold on having to check out her restaurant!  So our team (a group of 5) showed up around 1pm for lunch.  We weren't in the heat of the lunch rush, but there were no tables available, so we waited about 10 minutes for a table to open up for us.  Everything on their menu looked great, and I was debating between the Grilled Cheese/Tomato Soup and Chicken Pot Pie.  I ended going for the Chicken Pot Pie, which was amazing!  The crust was flaky, and the filling wasn't too liquidy.  The portion was great, and even came with a large side salad.  I finished most of the pot pie because it was so good, but I felt a bit guilty after (but I guess that's why it's comfort food, right?)  I probably should have eaten more of my salad to balance out my meal...oh well...  Can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu!

qeIblQPavNEKQyaMuqvo0Q.text: I've been in search for a good chicken fried steak, and theirs is on top of my list. It's nicely battered and come with sausage infused gravy. All in all great flavor! Oh and their sourdough bread was amazing.. thick and fluffy. I would definitely recommend this place. Also check out the container park across the street!

zIEvvJyR3iujFg0znfAy_A.text: Tried to call to make a reservation, no go. We arrived with our big party and it was an hour and a half to two hour wait. It makes no sense to not offer big parties a reservation option.

mYbdjS2t0tajB8JUBvYX8g.text: Second time enjoying brunch here. It was delicious. Even though they were packed to the max the server was great and super friendly. I will come back for sure to visit them again.

4RjsQWptEbQuZHAGkzAKyw.text: This place is so good! Wanted to try something off the strip before going back home. The truffle egg sandwich is amazing. Definitely will be back on our next trip out to Vegas!

Wlh7vVuK6W0Gpbc4FvsUBA.text: WOW!  after a horrible night at four queens, we googled places to eat and found this gem!  at first it was so crowded, i thought it would be a long wait but we got seated (only party of 2) within 3 minutes!   food is amazing and trendy and delicious!   great service and great prices!  food came within 10 minutes too!  YUM!!!

p57xbo6-U9e18WNJMFnPbQ.text: I can't seem to get away from ordering the chicken fried steak! The gravy with it is awesome. Now if you have a large party the service may seem slow but the food you get is worth it! Another highlight is the strawberry puree, which goes with your toast, pancakes, hell you could put that on anything and it would taste amazing.   I've had the corned beef hash and eggs and they are great aswell and my friend ordered the eggs benedict and she really enjoyed them aswell. They have healthy alternatives if you require that for your diet.

kQUEQe6Pb5vdnloQRdUFsQ.text: Here's the deal: I want this place to do well. I thought it was in the plus side of mediocre but I saw so much potential in it. And I LOVE Las Vegas is starting to offer unique, local, off-Strip places like this that try hard and do a good job.   I had the chilaquiles and they weren't spectacular, but they were good.  My friend's daughter's biscuits looked fantastic with the strawberry jam on top, but I wish there was more fruit and less jam.  Service was very attentive and sweet.  I liked the place a lot, I just wish the food were a little bit better.

Xbg4GfWrtQkKwl9u9MXMjQ.text: I couldn't wait for the Summerlin location to open!! The first time we went there Excellent!! The second not so good from the food to the wait staff.. The manager said the chef was new.. I love this restaurant and I really want Natalie to succeed!!

cXQmdXYeo3GnkAnvrBEhmA.text: Best Breakfast/Food/Atmosphere in downtown Vegas!  Menu is different with a great selection of things you would not imagine... Short walk from Freemont St with a vibe any local would enjoy. Very clean, excellent service and friendly staff ready to help you enjoy some good eat... Worth it!

5RARr34qlQ24UXRKr4JLEg.text: The bf and I went in for our 'Valentine's Brunch' (the weekend following Valentine's Day) We waited no more than 3 minutes to be seated. The restaurant was filled with patrons but not in an overwhelming sense. We were seated at kind of an awkward table. It was a tiny table RIGHT next to a bar-like seating area. We sort of felt weird sitting in regular height chairs right next to people sitting on bar height chairs, but whatever. Definitely not enough to keep us away. I ordered a hot green tea (which was organic and didn't turn the water a lime green color, I hate that!) and the shrimp and grits. Boyfriend ordered their country fried steak and eggs with a side of pancakes to share.  Shrimp & Grits: SOoosososososoo delicious. I love the smooth texture of their grits  and the hints of crispiness from the bacon and pico de gallo. The shrimps (which they gave an abundant amount of) were cooked perfectly and the over-easy eggs they topped the whole thing off with gave the whole dish an extra creaminess that nobody can get mad over. They give you really big portion so I didn't end up eating the whole thing. Boyfriend didn't mind finishing it off at all :)  Country Fried Steak and Eggs (with seasoned potatoes): I had a bite of the steak and it was delicious. Not to much breading and the meat was tender. The gravy was perfect. Thick but not pudding-like. (gross)  Pancakes: The pancakes were sooooo fluffy and delicious. They had a yummy crispiness all around the edge and had a beignet-like texture and flavor to them. They soaked up the syrup like nobody's business so I suggest you do the 'pour and eat right away' method.   The service was OK. Our waiter checked on us to fill up our drinks (once) but then forgot that I wanted more hot water for my tea. It's conveniently located right beside the container park so I could see us having breakfast/brunch here again.

ywa0wZQBX-WdFWEbnvTSuA.text: Holy crap this place was good.  My friends and I took a walk here from Fremont Street during our guy's trip to Vegas because of the great Yelp reviews.  It did not disappoint.  We sat at the common table and were immediately greeted by the friendly staff.  Shortly after we sat down, a woman over-heard us talking about appetizers and immediately interrupted us to tell us we had to order the deviled-eggs.  Wow was she spot on.  The egg whites were deep-fried while the yokes were mixed with amazing-ness and put back onto the newly deep-fried egg whites.  We found out later that the woman who suggested it was the owner of the restaurant.  Turns out she knows what she's talking about.  After that I had the veggieburger which was by far the best I ever had.  I don't even know what else to say about it, just get it, or anything else on their menu.  I would definitely come back here.  It's also conveniently located next to container park which is always fun to walk through.  Bring your llama.

HfrZA_awl3y6TPyiInmVhg.text: Overpriced and unimpressed. Ordered the chicken fried steak and oh so horrible. Worst piece of overcooked and underflavored piece of rubber I ever attempted to chew. And they didn't even serve it with a steak knife...poor butter knife tried but couldn't. The place was crowded on Sunday AM and the host staff a bit unfriendly. Must of had a rough Saturday night. Anyway, we won't go back.

m5bDk4gJ-61fCoACuD6hRg.text: Kudos the the Green Eye girl working the bar today ( I really wish I could've saved my receipt to know her name) , I was super nervous going into court today, I just wanted a good meal. I was all over the place couldn't figure out what to eat , finally just decided on the 2 eggs bacon and toast. Really wanted mushrooms but the chef well let's just say she wasn't on the greatest mood, said no. Ok whatever, ate my food so basically delicious! I snapped my food and my gf decides to last minute tell me she's on her way to join me, I tell the waitress ( green eye girl) to get me another plate, being the awesome waitress she is she puts my order in and BAM my gf says she stuck in construction traffic! I tell the waitress who then tells the chef who then rolls her eyes at her and throws the receipt. Oh my gosh! I feel horrible now! I just want to Apologize for my hectic day and having a co worker give you that dirty look because of me. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a chill vibe and some good breakfast or lunch. Just a tip to the staff; everyone is watching you too ! So careful with expressing so many facial features, remember it's not the waiters faults people can't get their life sometimes. Tip to me come here not so nervous and get the country fried steak next time! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you for the bench EAT. Let&#39;s add a cooling fan now lol.

_o4zDsBVjzevJEM-gHOmog.text: The food was fantastic!  No kids menu, but kids can share an adult entree w plenty to eat. Great coffee! Best was tofu scramble option for my egg allergic daughter on egg all day menu! Yum! Corned beef has delish!

QmeKwvQkUB5o7aKDCR6JRA.text: The only place I've ever been to where they seat 3 parties of 6 before my party of 4.  I don't mind a little wait but 45 minutes was pushing it and watching groups show up AFTER you've been waiting is unacceptable. I'll Take my business up the street to Dupars inside the golden gate where their pancakes are way better than eats.

txMfa6Qij_dfVSIMV8R9vg.text: My BLT sandwich was really good and the chips were amazing. I am bumping a star because I feel like they should really serve breakfast all day. They are only open until 3, it shouldn't be such a big deal. I was really looking forward to breakfast but was too late for it. It was also a bit noisy but that's no one's fault.

p-bVx-ZRhF-7fftjq0mFnw.text: I have had Eat. Bookmarked for some time so I was very excited to finally try it out. The place is bigger than it looks from the outside and the atmosphere is very welcoming.  The host staff was doing a great job. Got to see them deal with a very disgruntled lady and they handled it very well.  We got to sit over by the kitchen which was bustling and sending out plates super fast. The service was great, they got our drinks as soon as we sat down and our server Roberto was very attentive and the rest of the staff made sure we had everything we needed.  I'm a huge tea drinker and always judge the service by how well they keep up with me. My iced tea was never empty no matter how much i drank.   I had the chicken fried steak and got to sample a bit of my wife's pancakes. The potatos were just right with a nice layer of crispy goodness.  The steak was very good and the gravy had a little kick to it.  The toast is seriously 2 inches thick and I'm pretty sure they prepare it on a griddle. Only miss for me was the poached eggs, they were overcooked so didn't have the yolk to dip the toast in. The pancake I sampled was light and fluffy so I'm putting that on deck for my next visit.  Overall we had a great experience and can't wait to go back.  I would definitely recommend this place if you haven't tried it yet.

XobRVc9FDfxCygCGOjqmFw.text: Not a good experience today. Our waiter was rude. Food was okay but missing elements promised on the menu. One of our napkins had a hair ball. After we reported it to the waiter and the supervisor we still got no apology. So disappointed because the last time we were here we had a wonderful meal.

ZPQeJTsau0P-5yc-M2qiKA.text: Across the street from the Fear and Loathing wall of the Container Park, eat. is simply the embodiment of what Downtown Las Vegas is becoming: popular, fresh, foodie oriented, and absolutely unique!  Yes we did have to wait, but that's only a testament to how great this place is. It's a slightly sketchy intersection to be sure, but... it's all just so lovely. I'm so into it. A pair of benches with the lyrics to "Love Song" etched on them just outside eat.'s windows immediately signaled to me that this was a special place indeed.  I ordered the chicken fried steak with a ginger beer, and the bestie got the huevos motulenos with soda. OMG. Portions were not overly large but everything came out perfectly and just off the line. My chicken fried steak could have used a bit more seasoning, but the smoked sausage gravy on top of it was divine. The bestie definitely preferred the green sauce over the red sauce on her eggs, but put together with the salsa, black beans and plantains, and everything together was ridiculously good.  To add to the awesomeness of it all... our overall bill + tip was much MUCH lower than we really expected for a brunch of such great caliber. Our server was kind and efficient, and everyone around us was just so happy and full like we were. Icing on the cake: the door out says "ate." LOL cool.

CtRTg56Sh3ymKy2Se5pKFw.text: Their costumer service sucks!!! Our waiter (his name was Gary) treated us like trash. He was extremely rude. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Their food was decent though.

o4T6twUNot4oPoaP3b6GHw.text: Clean hip place with a fantastic menu. Best eggs Benedict and potatoes, you also have to try the cinnamon biscuits

yOqgZR-T0o00u8VMTQmH8A.text: Been here a few times and I have to say something. Such care is put into the dishes that's it's hard to ignore. One could say that a pancake is easy to perfect, but that's not True. When a restaurant pays attention to perfect execution of a simple dish, that deserves recognition.  I've eaten several dishes here and most recently had the chilequile. I've never been disappointed with the food or the warmth of the staff. Kudos for bringing such a great little eatery to my downtown neighborhood.

7Ed2vefjqPeUEvEcnwNm6A.text: Food is usually pretty good. I've had the shrimp and grits and country fried steak. The customer service is a little different. They are usually very attentive but give off the vibe of being uppity and too good for you. We will still go there since the food is still good.

9U6UIMr2Er74KrCuhyp1Sw.text: The BEST grits in Las Vegas, by far. Very cool inside. There is seating outside too. Great place for breakfast. The toast was perfectly made - thick bread, perfectly cooked on outside and soft on the inside. Bacon is thick and tasty. Potatoes are amazing. Service from start to finish was great - thank you, ANDREW!  Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bZZdrXfR3WOlS1eKNuqC1A.text: I have been here about 3 times, and yes I like others heard about it by Anthony B.   Parking: It is metered on the streets Pricing is reasonable  wait time: kinda lengthy but worth it Service: very personable and everyone is very helpful. The owner is there often and is seen assisting and greeting people. Thanks chef :)   now the food: the portions are sized well, I have tried the egg truffle sandwich and it is incredible. I like the hash. The menu is small and simple but the food is good no let me say great. I have enjoyed everything I have had here. The pancakes are hard to describe but just try them because it is delicious.   I try to go there once a month just because it is a place that is consistently amazing.   I will be back again and again as long as Chef is there, the food quality stays and the service is friendly.   This is how breakfast should be :)

PxOMLWTdV6LGD6lnD6JPIg.text: After finding this place on Yelp I made sure it was one of my first stops, and wow what a awesome experience! Had the fried deviled eggs to start and the chicken fried steak breakfast with very thick sourdough toast. This place met and exceeded all my expectations. My go to spot for breakfast hands down, now ready to try the lunch and dinner menu.

BCgoXvv3BwqolbiTt8xLJg.text: Came for lunch on Thursday, no wait for our group of 6.  Lots of breakfast options, though I had the: - Skinny Jenny salad: pounded chicken breast beneath arugula, served with balsamic dressing + drizzle. tasty, though nothing out of the ordinary (~$12, cheap!) - Strawberry biscuits: would probably skip these next time, was hoping for thicker fluffier, more buttery biscuits but these ended up being a bit too sweet and not particularly special   Reasonably priced food, hipstery and relatively good service.

PHHRNnaSW6PkvlMRM_ja_g.text: Exceptional! A gem downtown sin city. My family loved breakfast there. The food can swiftly and tasted magnificent. I ordered thr shrimp and grits, my daughter the pancakes and a side of turkey bacon and my husband enjoyed an omlete sandwhich with out thr bread. Service was normal nothing worth sharing but the food was #Yummy.

tprcSOrhQ4AI-vLj3jPurw.text: First off - you do not need an appointment to go in. You can just walk in and wait for a table. The inside is super cute with live music, but it fills up fast and is really warm inside. My group was seated outside and it was pretty much the same temperature. Their food portions are laaaarge but they also don't allow substitutions so you get what you get! They do allow you to put sauces and stuff on the side if you wish - I got the strawberry cinnamon biscuits and got the jam on the side. I'm glad I did, the jam was kind of sour but the biscuits were really good!

Mymb-LKMCM6dr3MaW-YKkg.text: This place never disappoints! Best lunch spot downtown time and time again! My faves are the chicken sandwich and  huevos multonados (sp) no appointment needed! That is a error. They are open from 8am-3pm on the weekdays and 8am-2pm on weekends. I also love their egg and chive croissant sandwich with truffle oil. Mmmmm Pavlov's dog here haha!

OoNUa6-a8f3ZO2GCbO52-g.text: I had a great experience at breakfast here at eat. Our server was very friendly, attentive, and helpful. I ordered coffee, juice, and huevos motulenos. Coffee and juice here are very good but the huevos motulenos was the star. Tortilla filled with beans cheese eggs avocado peppers and spices. A new take on my old favorite.  I would highly suggest you give EAT a try. You will come away full and smiling.

Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deviled eggs. Best I have ever eaten.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cc85czsTSt1U51EfypGB6A.text: The name says it all... this is where you come to EAT. I am always looking for something new in Vegas and this place checks off all the boxes. Innovative food, hip atmosphere, in an unexpected location. We came for breakfast and we were not disappointed. We came at opening so parking was not a problem and we were seated immediately. I had my 1 year old grandson with and it was very comfortable for him too. Our server suggested we get a starter... I have to be honest, I have never ordered a starter for breakfast. He urgently suggested we try the fried deviled eggs. So we complied and ordered them. I will be dreaming of these eggs for a very long time. They were delicious. The whites are breaded and fried, and yet they were light and not at all oily. Then the fried whites are piped with creamy, flavorful egg yolks, topped with bacon, sriracha and ketchup. The combination of hot/cold/crunchy/creamy/spicy is FABULOUS. All I know is this is a must have next time we go (and THERE will be a next time). yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... For my main, I ordered the huevos motulenos. I can't even begin to describe this dish. The description on the menu didn't make much sense, I just trusted and jumped in. It was superb. My eggs were done perfectly, the flavors blended in a way that I never imagined. I do not like peas, but the notation on the bottom of the menu told me that NO changes to the dishes will be made and after eating this dish I understand why. Unless you have a life threatening allergy, trust in this chef and just order the dish that appeals to you. She has put together flavors and textures that we would not normally think of, but they work perfectly. This dish was a perfect example of this. I especially loved the banana sauce on one of the eggs. The chive potatoes were delicious as well. yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... My daughter ordered the chicken fried steak and was not disappointed. The breading to steak ration was very good and the gravy on top wonderful. She ate the whole thing and it is not a small plate. I never finished mine, but it was not for lack of trying to. yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... The one item that comes with the chicken fried steak is toast, you choose what kind. She chose the sourdough and it turned out to be a star all on its own. LARGE slices of fluffy, airy delicious bread. We both decided it was something that would have to be ordered again, regardless of which meal we chose. I would love to see this as French Toast (hint hint) yelp.com/biz_photos/eat-... The location is not what you expect from Vegas, although I see the eateries popping up in this neighborhood and I think we are seeing the beginning of a wonderful future. The staff is friendly and helpful, they are also very playful, so come ready to have a fun time. The ambiance is very new, different. Very comfortable. Loved the decor and they even have a patio area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tqrDV665PfaUUI0C2szkKQ.text: I have visited Eat a few months before and all I remember was how amazing the pancakes were-simple buttermilk plain pancakes.......It wasn't a fluke, their pancakes are the perfect amount of crispiness and fluff. By far makes the drive downtown worth it. Other highlights are the deep fried deviled eggs, tomato soup, and the local Mothership brewed coffee (could have skipped the grilled cheese.....unless your looking for 2 xxl pieces of Texas toast for lunch).   My only gripes about Eat is they have a selected breakfast menu that is only available until 11am (I am dying to try these chilaquiles) and I really wish they offered espresso based coffee drinks. But for those pancakes I will gladly spend 10 minutes rifling through 6th street looking for a parking spot.   Also, they have an awesome outdoor patio with picnic tables set up. Perfect for a private event

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese and tomato soup!

rNRcGJ_9zGeKa11TyA3jzw.text: Pretty decent place for breakfast.   Wifey and I were downtown a week or so ago and decided to have a late breakfast / early lunch.   After paying for parking, we got in line there.   It appears we hit the lunch crowd, but hey that happens.  We opted to share a high top with another group, not a big deal.     We both ordered coffee which was good, but not life changing.   I had the truffled egg sandwich and wifey got the hash.   Mine was good, but as other have mentioned, it was heavy on the truffle oil.   The potatoes and toast was good.   Wifey enjoyed her hash which is always a good thing.    Overall, it's a solid place.   I think it's a little over-hyped at the  moment.   I'd like to see if this place can find it's groove.   I have high hopes for EAT.   Yeah, I'll be back.

C11NPcDkbKsHW05hM8m_Qw.text: A great little spot off the strip with a neighborhood feel.  Helpful and friendly staff.  Kept it simple with eggs, potatoes, bacon, and toast.  Fresh and perfectly seasoned.  Locally roasted coffee.  So good I took a pound home.  Sadly, I didn't discover La'Kat's Devilled Eggs until after.  Oh, well, guess I have to go back.  Make this your go-to brunch spot and please don't tell the tourists.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La&#39;Kat&#39;s Devilled Eggs

9JQGefbvY8DVyL29UHFEbg.text: I'm always craving brunch. Since we're in Vegas, I was sure there's a good spot around downtown.   Yelp said this place was good so went to try it out with a few friends. Coming inside the restaurant, Instantly enjoyed the environment.   Got to order the corn beef hash. The corn beef is chopped into small squares along with potato bites and pieces of sourdough bread along with one egg. Maybe two eggs would of even out the plate in my opinion. The food tasted really good and I enjoyed mixing little bit of everything on one bite  Great customer service!  Cool thing we caught was as we walked out, there's another sign that said ate. You guys are clever

L10hHVi7LmvgkUjdoYRgiA.text: Always good food. A little on the hipster side, but nothing beats comfort food made from scratch. The restaurant is always clean, staff is friendly and accommodating. Does get a little loud when they are packed, but I guess that's a sign of a good time!

AuXIsl7HWztFzm-xISiV9A.text: Quality of food is really good. I had the strawberry salad and added avocados - strawberries were super sweet and avocado ripened just right, and super green that it blended with the salad. Pricey just a tad, but quality really shines through. Having a rare alone mommy time and I'm loving it:) I love brunch, cafes, and coffee. And I support my Vegas business owners in the grind just wanting to share good food culture with the community:) keep up the quality work!

DQIR0ty54mEnfHRCjFVGUQ.text: Really good breakfast, Huevos were great and so was Truffle Bacon and Egg sandwich. We had to wait 25 mins but there was some Santa run happening and thousands of people around so I thought it'd be worse. Coffee also great.

l6CjRpSmuqfK1VuprcF5DA.text: I searched for breakfast restaurants during my stay at Las Vegas and this place stood out to me by looking at the pictures and reviews.   It was a busy day so we did wait a good 20-25 mins, besides, the restaurant is kind of small; however, the hostess was very attentive and kept letting us know he'd sit us in as soon as he had an opening.   The food ordering process and the food itself was great!   The service was the best I've had so far -- everyone was super attentive & even though they were busy, they managed to attend us all.   10/10 recommend this place.

_yrUGuNvDc7k0CESGx45kg.text: So I could finally make my visit for this place. That it was pop out from my google search- best food in Vegas.   If I could give 3.5 stars then it would be my rating. I wasn't sure if I was having too high expectations or.. it turns out an alright place to me with services, interiors and food.   I had ordere the chicken fried steak and the special of the day- burrito. The chicken fried steak was pretty good but it wasn't amazing delicious. The burrito was pretty disappointed with the flour wraps were dry and not fresh.   They provide different menus on weekends so maybe it's better.  I guess I would come back only if it's not crowded on weekends.

pgFS96oa-9wrf8OY6rrDVw.text: We went to check Eat. after the Breast Cancer Awareness walk and we were glad we did.  The menu was simple and made total sense.  We started out with the cinnamon biscuits with the strawberry compote.  I expected it to be sweet but it was just a tad sweet, so perfect.  Then I ordered the corned beef hash while my husband ordered the truffle egg sandwich, and my mother in law ordered the pancakes.  My favorite was the truffle egg sandwich.  It was just bursting with flavor!  Also, the chicken sausage was pretty darn good too.  I can't wait to return and try out other items.

WETfgsR9fIjC-mtP60OXPQ.text: Here right now and was curious why a group was seated before us. Innocent enough question in my opinion. I was given an answer that they seat 3 people before 2 which I understood. Then when we were seated the host or manager or who ever he was said "I know what I'm doing I've been doing this a while" lol for real man? You mad or something? Won't be back.  Edit: food was solid as hell. Dude was a douche

nalMgP9Abp_9p0zV2zuIPA.text: Visited Eat around noon for brunch. There were two of us and we had to wait 20 minutes for a table, which we thought was ok. We put our names on the list and waited outside where there were some benches on the sidewalk. While waiting we looked through the menu.  When it was time for us to be seated, the helpful greeter inside called my name loud and clear both inside (I heard it, even though we were outside) and then they came outside too! Great service for this part.  We were seated quickly and someone came to take drink orders right away. Coffee here was average, but there were other options like lemonade and many teas in the selection.  The menu is pretty standard food for a brunch spot. I ordered the corned beef hash, but it came as meat cubes, not hash. The poached eggs were average and presentation here is clearly not important. While the food tasted OK, it was not outstanding or memorable. There's no reason to wait in line for this.  Service was prompt, but I was surprised that nobody offered water for our table. Just bring water - it's the most basic thing humans need after air. Bring it, or at least offer it.   Overall this place feels rushed and driven by turnover. It's clean and the food is OK. The servers are friendly, but they are moving fast and that is their main focus.

KPzQ6lpiSTP3TTGesHlfzg.text: I took the journey from the Strip to come check this place out based on a recommendation in a magazine. Overall, this place def deserved the magazines spotlight, and the journey was validated.  The decor is that sort of new modernist industrial, lots of wood and metal, bare bulbs, etc. as I enjoy this ascetic, it worked for me. I was solo, so immediately got a stool at the counter, and within a minute had my coffee and water, and less than five minutes after placing my order, had my food. Fast, friendly service!  I'm docking one star because my only complaint was the food. I got the Chicken Fried Steak, which came with eggs, potatoes, and toast. The toast slices were thick and delicious. The potatoes were solid, so too the eggs. My only minor complaint was the CFS. Being from the south, I'm a bit of a perfectionist for this dish. The fried batter came out just a tad too soft; I prefer a crush. As this is a personal preference, I don't dock it too much, but that's what keeps this place slightly from getting ready a full 5 star from me.  That said, I saw some of the other dishes people next too me order, and I could imagine some of their more specialty dishes earning the full 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak, 2 eggs, potatoes, toast - $14. Solid, not spectacular.

EZvpS32KvnYcB41BlE22Nw.text: I am usually too tired for brunch and can't get myself out of bed.  eat. is a good reason to get yourself up in the morning.    I got there 15 minutes after the breakfast menu ended but I was happy that the beignets were served all day.  Beignets with vanilla marscapone and homemade jelly?  Uhmmm yes please!  I had the truffled egg sandwich which was omg good!  It is served with wild mushrooms, chives, feta cheese, and potatoes on ciabatta bread.  It was delicious.  It is like an elegant farm breakfast sandwich.    The vibe here is hipster-y without being super pretentious.  I felt like I was in LA but you are actually in downtown LV haha.  This restaurant is a random escape from the grunge of downtown.  I have to give dtown credit though.  There are a lot of cool spots that I need to explore further.  It is like an up and coming neighborhood.    I was impressed by my beignets and egg sandwich.  I need to come back and get blown away a little more by eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg sandwich with truffle, feta cheese, bacon, and mushrooms
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets!  Served all day.

oXwkY5N7ZxoL-iJAcZM4Lw.text: We were seated right away, which I'm guessing is unusual because when we walked out, there was a line of people waiting! Our food was delicious and coffee was great even though we were ready to leave before anyone refilled our cups. The pancakes were fluffy and chicken sausage was good.  We got our food quickly but the toast and pancakes were cold.

hHylQkuIvF8RA1j_14h3KQ.text: My husband and I came here for brunch after visiting Zappos headquarters plenty of metered street parking  We were seated quickly, and service was friendly  My husband ordered the shrimp & grits $12, and he loved the dish... fresh and plentiful amounts of shrimp on a bed of creamy grits with several thick strips of crisped bacon and 2 over easy eggs. homey goodness.  I ordered truffled egg sandwich with wild mushrooms $11, chives, feta, and bacon. the egg sandwich was ok, but the side of country potatoes shines. I had to fight off my husbands fork as I gobbled these savory delights up.  This joint is the cure to common diner food.  (this entry was written by my husband)

7iFcOq7Q5vo9W-U0-2lJng.text: At first I didn't really wanna order anything but like light snacks or something. The menu looks good but it's just menu was all about eggs and I'm pregnant, for some weird reasons, eggs lately make me puke just by the sight of it. Anyway, I tried the tomato soup full size, serving was pretty good. The food itself was awesome. My husband had the shrimp and grits, I dont usually eat grits but their grits are so surprisingly good. It was so tasty, full of chopped tomatoes on top and the shrimp you can see that they're really fresh.

NaeaZRSkpLc21oTeLD8uDw.text: Come here all the time !! This place is absolutely nothing but amazing. My mouth waters every time I think about this place

enLmwpRLq8wlu9gvOxPlhg.text: Looking for a GOOD breakfast in Las Vegas? Then go EAT...located in downtown Las Vegas a Hip New Joint, Eat is a must Stop!  So I said NEW, but Eat just celebrated their 4 year anniversary! Congratulations Chef Natalie Young!  When you first walk in, you are greeted with an open and roomy dining room with that hip feel of Vegas. And when you are greeted the minute you open the door with a smiling face, even better! (Eat has some of the BEST service in all of Vegas)  EAT the special of the day...so with a full menu loaded with all the goodies, our waitress was super fun and excited about the specials of the day. She started with Corned and I said YES PLEASE...Eat had homemade corned beef and hash with two eggs and Texas Toast as the days special (I told you I said YES after Corned)! Homemade corned beef and hash, BEST BREAKFAST IN VEGAS!  Don't forget the Passion Fruit Iced Tea...OOH YEAH!  Thanks Chef Natalie Young for doing it right and showing your LOVE in your FOOD!
