6yj3LDjcsqppMcuq3FEO-A.text: Best Veggie burger and tomato soup ever! Burger was made to order, fresh sprouts, tomato avocado and what tasted like homemade wheat bread lightly toasted. Husband got the oven roasted chicken sandwich and it was really yummy too!

YxKIVJtVEkN289LiNknQVQ.text: Environment was wonderful. Our table next to us we're rushed by employees in a nice way I'm sure they didn't mean it in a bad way but still. However our experience was great . Got seated fast and the food was brought to us so fast! They have a great system so keep doing what you do !.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z29HgdASF-MS0FGTZ115FA.text: Love their food and we come here often. It was great today as well.  However when we walked in today we were told I couldn't bring in my Starbucks which I had gotten at the casino before our walk over. I even asked if we order coffees would that then be okay?  We drink a lot of coffee so we would have. Instead we waited outside until most of it was gone. Nothing like chugging a coffee. Then we ordered 2 waters instead of coffee. It's not a great way to be greeted and no one likes to feel nickled and dimed. This isn't friendly or great customer service and effects the entire experience. .  However the staff was great. Management needs to rethink it or allow hostess to use discretion. We probably won't return just because of how it made us feel. Too many other great foodie places to go to because it is about the experience.

G__aYkxDObaxImykFSPKMw.text: My bf and I went here for breakfast. He lives in the downtown area so it was convenient. There was about a 40 minute wait but I can honestly say it was well worth it. We got the pancakes and chicken sausage and also the fried deviled eggs. Now that Du-par's isn't downtown anymore its hard to find another place that does that crispy golden pancake with a soft center. But not anymore. Eat does it even better. Plus the addition of the chicken sausage makes it feel like a more complete breakfast. As for the deviled eggs, frying them takes them to a whole new level. The service was great, the environment was chill, and the price is what you'd expect from quality cuisine. I highly recommend this restaurant.

vdIGYFKl8ws8tb7IfhBm7g.text: 4.5 stars. The food is incredible. The cinnamon biscuits are a must order. Its heaven on a plate. Make sure to eat them while they are still warm. The tomato soup is fresh. You can taste they made it homemade; very light and flavorful. The grill cheese is a monster of sandwich, like you have never seen before. The bread is soft and buttery with plenty of cheese. Perfect ratio. The deviled eggs were crunchy and very tasty. And the lemonade was right on. Half a star goes off because the service was a little unorganized. Three people taking the order but they were all friendly.  This place is hidden and off the strip but worth going to, to grab a bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato soup and grilled cheese
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes and chive

OfHZln8H0KO6Tg65y-Iz9g.text: Without question, Seriously, Hands-down, It's the best breakfast spot in Vegas.  Let me first say, I can't cook but I can make a few breakfast dishes.  Now, I'm no chef, but what they do here at eat is culinary excellence.  How they pack layers of flavor from the first bite to the last makes me want to quit cooking and just come here every morning.  Tip: Eggs Benedict is not on the menu but if you go on the weekend like I did they can make it special for you.

LvjTurgkAlinrNOstOCRCg.text: Fact: I schedule meetings here once at week  Fact: I call 'timeout' during the meetings so that I can enjoy the food, free of chatter or negotiation Question: How can I schedule more meetings?  Across from the new container park, eat. is a casual spot to grab some solid lunch and breakfast fare. I'm a sandwich first, ask questions later kind of guy, so I've yet to test out the breakfast, but everything I've had on the lunch side of things has been excellent. The free range chicken sandwich is served on a light, crunchy ciabatta with a juicy chicken breast and fresh toppings. The reuben is large and the best I've had in Vegas, the veggie burger is made on-site and the passion fruit iced tea is unsweetened, so it just has a hint of tropical flavor in it. Sold? I thought so. See ya there.    Pro Tip: Expect to wait for a few around noon

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sammie
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben.

5SE6BNJfFOvikM_Gywm7uQ.text: Because of the manager, Michael, who worked on October 26, 2017 at 11am, this will be my first and last time dining here. My family and I ate here as out of town guest expecting a great experience after hearing wonderful reviews. However, it immediately went down hill when the manager did not accommodate a simple request.. to have my party and I be seated together. We were a party of 8. He initially sat us in separate tables that were no where near each other. Hello?.. we came here to eat together. When a larger table (2 standard tables that was push together) opened up, we kindly asked the manager if it will be okay to sit there instead. He agreed and as he walked away, he whispered "what's the point?". How rude is that? We were expecting for our whole party to sit at the larger table we requested  but instead the manager pulled the tables apart. Uhhh..We wanted the tables to be pushed together so my party and I could eat at the same table! When we asked a staff if we could push the tables together, the manager overheard and yelled "NO!" How unprofessional is that? So rude. Luckily the staff here are attentive and polite. They kept apologizing to us for their manager's unprofessional behavior. But they seriously need to fire Michael for being such an asshole to his guests!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Michael, the manager, was so unprofessional and rude to my party. He couldn&#39;t accommodate a simple request.. for my party to sit together.

HQHAhSYnoXTxDa1c6PMjeA.text: I had the breakfast nacho with turkey mango sausage (you read that right). Had cinnamon biscuits with fresh strawberries, blackberries, and strawberry compote.  Coffee was amazing. Server never missed a beat. Great place,plan to be back.

uEDY7hY-MJ2EFYwXc1Ob0A.text: This has quickly became one of my favorite spots in town. If you're going to do breakfast, do it right by eating here.   The service is typical and nothing out of the ordinary.   The only thing that didn't meet up to my expectations when I came here for the first time was the menu. The menu is about three pages long with the last page being just of sides and drink selections. But I shouldn't have expected much since the place is smaller than average.   I really love ordering the golden-brown pancakes, one egg, and bacon all from the sides menu. The golden-brown pancakes are PHENOMENAL!! The best pancakes I have ever had!! They are so filling and so delicious. What I ordered is seriously a great combination and I wish it was a combo that I could order from the menu. The killer grilled cheese ordered with tomato soup is fantastic. I've never liked tomato soup until I came to eat. The grilled cheese is delicious on its own as well and I think about it occasionally... LOL   I'll definitely be coming back to eat. time and time again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOOOVE the grilled cheese. Not a fan of tomato soup, but this is the first that I&#39;ve somewhat enjoyed.
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden-brown pancakes, one eggs, and turkey bacon = the best combination from the sides menu EVER

2wd-dU0x9pbyWaeXFRLbgA.text: Eat your heart out!  I absolutely enjoyed brunch!!!  *Shrimp & Grits *Cinnamon Biscuits *Chive Potatoes *Pancakes *Short stack   Definitely a must try and I will be back indefinitely...   Short wait... Fast and friendly service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Biscuits
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits

b8SqMyPViLQqeR_fyFMt0A.text: Where the hell do you park for free nearby??  Why is Tony in there every time I'm there?  He steals all of the good service.  My last visit at eat. there were extra tons of people with cameras and video recorders.  Looked like they were setting up to film a show inside because even a dude was getting his make up Did.    $4 orange juice.  But anyway the last two visits were on weekdays, I really need to go on a weekend because the menu is different.  But so far I've had the Mediterranean Egg White Frittata Spinach which came with tomatoes, Kalamata olives, feta and basil with whole wheat English muffin.  That was good, so healthy.  When I saw the English muffin I tried to sneak in and ask if they can make me an eggs benedict, but nope.  Then for my latest visit I had the Smoked Salmon Cream cheese, capers, sliced tomatoes, red onion and rye bread.  It was laid out neatly but I made a mess of it, it's a normal dish that can be found on your weekend brunch but I was honestly craving for their weekend brunch items.    It just means I need to go back, park somewhere free, sit down, eat while taking my time rather than rushing.  And don't be fooled by the appearance of the neighborhood, when you go in you are in a completely different environment.  You wouldn't think a restaurant like this is located in downtown Las Vegas.

C4N7yYPL1R6vX_a7DfcKAA.text: Must try the freaking best BLT EVER!! Super good. Literally the best thing I have had between two pieces of bread. The shrimp po boy was good too! Tomato salad. Delicious!

uX8dNShXO0k0r8DNqx5c4g.text: Nice vibe in this downtown space. May I suggest Truffle Egg sandwich, she chased  with Coffee,  I chose Bruce Cost Ginger Ale. Delicious and the price...doable!

eaWZkAhaQJQYCY3PgqTJYg.text: Great place to eat,  very nice staff.  Food was top quality and a very good value.   Do not typically write reviews but thought this place was worth the time to tell people about it.   3 of us went and needless to say the plates where clean

h6gqd2zcWi0BViPLYkR7xQ.text: We were staying at Main Street Station, so this was a simple 3/4 mile walk.  Coming from Reno, we're not huge on casino food, and I was intrigued by this restaurant, trying to contribute to the re-development of the downtown area.  We had the beignets (delicious pillows of light, fluffy flavor, with just the right amount of sweet), and I ended up getting the huevos motulenos (an interesting mix of peas, feta, egg, black beans, salsa etc on corn tortillas), while the GF got a grilled cheese. The GF liked it - inch-thick pieces of sourdough, with generous amounts of cheese, and there was definitely that nice blend of buttery, grilled toast, contrasted by the almost gooey cheese.  Definitely worth checking out if you're staying in downtown Vegas.

zeWYfk8maB1zFa_uoszpFw.text: Good food, place and service!!! My hubby and I ordered truffle eggs ciabbatta  sandwich and motulenos eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Motuleños eggs
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffed egg ciabatta whith potatoes

I78sVsM_9_rQx51mOrwksg.text: They were extremely busy when we got there.  They had us seated in less than 10 minutes.  Our order was taken promptly and the food came out extremely fast.  It was delicious.  It was my first time coming here and I'll absolutely be back.  We had the BLT and the Chicken Fried Steak.. Both delicious.  I recommend it to anyone who likes food.

n37sT0gQEr8yk9wWv307eA.text: Stopped here for breakfast on a very quick trip to Vegas and I'm so glad I did. We were in on a Saturday morning (maybe around 10?) and only had to wait 5-10 minutes for a table for 2 which for brunch rush hour is nothing. The space is cute, hip and modern but warm, and the food was solid. I had a truffled egg sandwich absolutely loaded with mushrooms and a side of stellar potatoes. They were perfectly crunchy, and well seasoned - basically my ideal breakfast potato. My partner in crime had the shrimp and grits and liked them. Like a fool, I forgot to steal a taste so I can't comment on them beyond that. I also loved that it was off of the strip and in a much calmer, less crazy part of town. The menu is relatively limited, I think there was one short-ish page of options when we were there, but still enough to find something you want. Though I wouldn't have objected to maybe one more vegetarian option on the menu. Still would definitely recommend, especially if you're visiting Vegas and looking for something a little more chill and less wildly overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled breakfast sandwich after I ate 1/3 of the potatoes and most of the mushrooms off of the top

pwuz0Erei8o0gjqcpC-k8w.text: This is a good place to eat. I've been here a couple of times for lunch. Always been happy with my choices. They serve healthy flavorful dishes. Last time I was there, which was Wednesday with my son. I tried breakfast. All I can say it was delicious. The toast was so yummy. The eggs were cooked to perfection and the hash browns crisp and seasoned just right. So next time your out for lunch at Eat don't be afraid to order breakfast!

jamGF_9hjx4ODS7HHRWLJg.text: My boyfriend and I went here for brunch last Sunday and it was delicious. It seemed very busy but they sat us down in about 15 minutes. I was a little disappointed they didn't have mimosas, but that was my own bad for assuming and not checking.   I had the frijoles and they were pretty good. They could have had a bit more flavor, but hot sauce helped out with that. My boyfriend had the truffled egg sandwich and said it was delicious.  All in all, it's right next to the Downtown Container Park and it's a fun little area to walk around in.   Last but not least, they had the Toys for Tots drive going on when I was there and it was really cool to see all the toys they were able to take away!

w9IyguHMZIcpAqQ5urhoFg.text: I LOVE the truffled egg sandwich. Eggs, bacon, mushrooms, onions and feta cheese on ciabatta bread...holy mother of food:() Its light and Im not a big eater at one setting but I scarf that sandwich down not feeling over stuffed. Service has always been good as well!

neZc0TkIG98weCO92sUwuQ.text: Great place great vibe great local Vegas coffee such a great place. Great service. The chicken Fried steak with pork gravy the best over easy eggs incredible ..potatoes were some of the best in brunch scene.   Have had CFS many states citiez,and places this is some of the best.   The toast is,off the chart so good thick wonderful heavenly bread toasted just perfect.  Great seeing energy great vibe great service. Good $

XIID9T6wroncGQvszqpYxA.text: I had the shrimp and grits. It was decent not very seasoned but was still good. Service is good, the only thing that bothered me was how close the tables are, it's hard to hear the person in front of you because you have people to your left and right speaking loudly.

bN-VrNKPE2VAX1zKbmGaog.text: Had breakfast here on a Sunday while visiting Las Vegas. My SO had the chef's special, eggs Benedict which was off menu. He said it was delicious" although the hollandaise was just a little bit too lemony. I ordered the Huevos Montulenos--based on Yelp reviews. I really couldn't imagine caramelized bananas and peas in the same egg dish, but somehow it works! And by "works" I mean "wow". Great house potatoes accompanied both dishes. The coffee was dark and powerful, the atmosphere urban and energetic. Great and attentive wait staff too.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Montelonos

3k952H39FafDHijvblAkpA.text: Their shrimp and grits is OMFG good, but make sure to make a reservation before you go, or go earlier, it's gonna be so packed! :)) highly recommended

qJywFy6G_wjSkU0PRSZyuQ.text: -located in downtown, so it is off the strip -no reservations, long wait -the food is good, and you pay accordingly

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes with sausage

zTevgPTen6HavuMQ7Bb34w.text: A hidden gem just outside of Las Vegas - on the floor level of all things - a motel!  A little seedy from the outside, but that all dissipated when you walk through the door into a modern, chic diner.   They don't take reservations, but come early to avoid the wait.  We got there just before eleven on a Saturday and were able to be seated right away.  There was a bit of a wait (in 100+ heat!) by the time we left.  On to the food - in order of yumminess, BOLDs are HIGHLY recommended:  GRILLED CHICKEN SANDWICH on ciabatta - This was the highlight of the meal.  Stuffed with tomato and arugula, - warm, tasty, and fresh.  I would definitely recommend this.  BIEGNETS - SO yummy!!!  Probably best to share, since they really are just donuts, but so soft and warm, and perfect with the jam and cream.  SHRIMP AND GRITS - This was really good.  I can't even explain it - it really just looks like a bowl of runny grits with shrimp, but the flavor was superb.   Huevos montunlenos - I know these are a big hit on Yelp, but maybe I'm just not a Mexican breakfast type of person.  I recognize that these had a good, spicy flavor with the salsa and tortillas cooked in, but just not my cup of tea.  Now, if you LOVE your Mexican breakfast, go for it!  Tomato soup - I agree with the other reviews - really salty.  We initially had wanted the tomato salad, but were told they were out and only had the soup, which we settled for.  Oh well.  All in all, a great meal.  My dad still talks about it weeks later.  Street parking was not too difficult.  And it's just down the street from where they shoot Pawn Stars, so you can spend a little time walking off your food perusing there!  :)   (did I just embarrass myself by admitting we watch that show so much that we recognized the shop driving by?)

92O1OiqR4NjmCUublmQd7w.text: Came here with my sister in law on a Sunday around 12 and was surprised to find we only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated.  Everything coming out of the kitchen looked and smelled amazing and I couldn't wait! They serve coffee from a local roastery. It was fabulous and helped hold us over until our meals came. We tried the pancakes with chicken apple sausage. The sausage was so flavorful and the pancakes were the perfect texture.  We also ordered the deviled eggs which were flavorful and a little spicy. Delicious! We were very happy with the food, the service, and the atmosphere.   The bill came to $40 which is the only thing keeping me from leaving a five star review. I think it is a little on the high side considering we had pancakes, two sausages, two eggs, and coffee between us.

ubD7UwOM7fclt1ML3HZ2_g.text: I was looking forward to taking some out-of-town guests here but after having a couple bites of the food I was completely embarrassed. We could have went to a dive coffee shop and had better food. I actually apologized to my guests because it was that horrible. Stop trying to hide bad reviews and improve your damn food instead.

K35eUCbLEh8qps-uIqu8tA.text: This was one of the best places I have been in Vegas. The food, atmosphere and service were excellent. The hostess and servers were very attentive and friendly. The location could not be be better for walking off your meal through container park and Fremont East

4YOhNdGyV3-kiAyU29eO5w.text: We came in on Memorial Day and were disappointed to find that some of the things we had seen on yelp (like eggs benedict) were only available as part of their weekend menu. But, we were in early enough (around 9:15am) that we were seated immediately at the community table. By the time we left, there was a decent amount of people waiting outside. So, as for the food, it was good, but neither of us was particularly impressed. I ordered the pancakes, my husband ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs. The pancakes were golden brown and fluffy, and served with two small containers of maple syrup and butter on the side. Perhaps because I recently had a great experience with plain buttermilk pancakes at another restaurant, these pancakes, while good, were nothing special. If there was no wait, I'd probably come back. But I don't think it lived up to the hype, and I wouldn't be willing to put up with a long wait to eat here.

I1oM9a6qGF2ubGM8Z9pODQ.text: What a great place in old downtown. Shrimp and Grits were awesome. Love the design on the inside.

NLCIyVF9Mpxa2zoH-uefkg.text: Had heard a lot of good things about this restaurant; tried it today for the first time, and was very impressed.  Interesting decor, and a vibe like being in a big-city restaurant.  Interesting menu with lots of good choices.  I had the eggs benedict and thought they were some of the best I ever had. My partner had the chicken fried steak and really enjoyed them.  The potatoes that came with our entrees were excellent-- flavorful and perfectly cooked.  Can't wait to eat there again

hH9B862m5PPRTI85_UwdSA.text: Just had breakfast with my boss here and the breakfast was very tasty. I had the spicy eggs with tortilla and banana. The atmosphere is nice. Even though they only had 1 waitress waiting on people and pass by us twice forgetting our toast. She was not that attentive to us. Yet I will most likely go back.

uzAO_8vre_NOZA86XX614g.text: Killer Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup. Great atmosphere! Glad I found this place. You won't be disappointed.

Nos26KhSymIB-ilW9ORxQw.text: Every dish here is great. I love trying the specials, they're always different and tasty from Chef Natalie's reinterpretation of comfort foods. The staff is nice, even when they're busy. The coffee could be better.  My only complain is that it's so darn loud in there. The acoustic is awful there for some reason. Maybe once the patio open it'll provide a quieter forum to sit.

gZGJlbM746XaCBMEG3qdMQ.text: Great food and great service. Stripped down decor is appropriate. Place was jam packed and kitchen was slow, but servers were warm and attentive so it didn't matter. Eggs Benny were possibly best I've had. 42 for good coffee, fresh OJ, and three dishes between two people. Good value, great job.

r6xqmDV1jz60ICccubUQcg.text: It all started when a friend made the mistake of inviting me to eat. in early March. I ordered the chicken pot pie and immediately fell in love. The pie was covered with a golden brown, flakey phyllo dough crust and then topped with an egg...AN EGG I tell you. So simple yet I never thought of that for a pot pie. While I thought the filling could use a little more salt, the pie overall was outstanding. That lead to a few more visits and a lot less time in my own kitchen.   I can't stop talking about this place. If you're contemplating eating here, just stop. Head over to eat. and enjoy a great meal.

I7BAQRo54nEFY-YtOzktpw.text: A nice, quiet spot to grab a good breakfast.  We ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and the Huevos Motulenos.  The food and the energy were good.  It is a little hard to find both the restuarant and parking.  Overall, a nice change of pace for a Vegas morning.

4O-cS7ijk8c2VWepUun1CQ.text: First time eating here and the food was amazing!! The customer service was spectacular!! Definitely a place to go!!

tDDNeMRMzWgqRdnRMewxBA.text: I was excited to check this place out, and in the end, was happy with the experience overall.  I like the ambience, but I felt the customer service lacked.  The hostess who sat us, barely made eye contact and showed us where to sit by waving in the direction of an empty table.  Our waiter, Robert, seemed rushed and wasn't friendly or pleasant.    I ordered the chicken friend steak and asked for the gravy on the side, but when it arrived, my food was covered in gravy.  Before I could ask for a change, the server who brought the food already rushed off.  I relented and ate my food as it came, but was pleasantly surprised.  I normally don't like too much gravy on my food, but the gravy was delicious.  My party also ordered the beignets for the table.  The other reviews on beignets were mixed, so we wanted to try them out for ourselves.  As most reviewers noted, the beignets were dense and not flaky and light like they're suppose to be.  That being said, they still tasted pretty good.  I intend to come back because although it was just an average visit, I see the potential of this place turning into a great local spot.  I think that the staff have to be more friendly and attentive, but otherwise, this is a place that I would still recommend.

Sctt6VAcVv9xedoJOr3I3A.text: This was our second trip to EAT...we LOVE the food here. The coffee is YUMMY too! Both times I got the egg/ truffle sandwich which is amazing. My daughter got the delicious cinnamon biscuits...my son got the fabulous pancakes and my husband got the chicken fried steak and eggs (the best I've ever had-WOW!). Service is always friendly and it's in a really cool part of town across the street from the Container Park. Will def go back.

QCynyKbr1IX5lqGb2ya_1Q.text: Extremely rude staff. My wife and I came to eat and not only did the staff look they just woke up but they had matching attitudes. Don't waste your time coming here for mediocre food and horrible service. My wife wanted to slap everyone there, and she's crazy... She'll do it. I had to calm her down.

OyfdOrRlYy4fnhnx8-9SFA.text: Loooooove this place! Everything I've had has been amazing. My favorite is the blt and I always always make sure to get the tomato salad. So bomb!

mSENbQlv1XicsEh2A08zUQ.text: The decor is adorable. The five of us got right in at 11:30 on a Saturday. The waitresses are attentive. One of us is allergic to gluten, and the waitress was really nice about checking on the potatoes for us. Highly recommended!

fiB3SFxo5_nC7bPBEMGSEQ.text: 'Eat' is on the top of my list of places to, well, eat when I come to town. The menu is great and the quality of food is exceptional. The service, ambiance, and experience are also top-notch. Always ask about their specials! They're always amazing.

cL-PhRNPYK1LwzD9YNrr7A.text: So yummy we had to go back the next day! Really good food. Fun and modern atmosphere. The staff was really friendly and helpful. They really make you feel welcome. The food was out of this world!!! Their deviled egg special was insane! Like nothing I've ever eaten. Will definitely venture here every time I visit Vegas.

7inyJTDjirm2iDU-a3-i3g.text: The food is very fresh and the energy is always cool. Great atmosphere

8xz-mx9omvzUyLkhm7afBw.text: Great spot to eat in a land of overpriced casino restaurants and chains! Pretty much everything we have tried has been excellent (beignets, pancakes, chicken-fried steak, shrimp grits, etc etc). Nothing has been a let-down so far. Coffee is also generally good! The fact that it's all farm to table is just icing on the cake. Pricing is also very reasonable, so no complaints there.  I have absolutely no reservations about recommending this place. One thing to keep in mind if you are coming here is that it is very small, so expect a wait (10-30 minutes is typical around 10 am on a Saturday in our experience).

QUeHdzrChb4mdPBsrpZEjA.text: I've been here a total of three times. Once for the lunch menu, second time for the brunch menu and lastly for the breakfast menu. Everytime the food was absolutely delicious. Wait staff was at a B+, nothing over the top and went a few minutes needing a refill. My only complaint is the three menus. I wish I could get the breakfast menu a little later in the day, say til about 11am.. I am in the service industry myself and am not usually an early morning person. But, when I am up that early, I eat at... eat. :-)

c8wqccJvfX4ffgXmjY45hg.text: The cinnamon biscuits are awesome, and I almost always get the farm raised chicken sandwich.  I normally hate potato chips with my meal, but Eat.'s are seasoned amazingly and always cooked to perfection.

EsgCItPNmeywxKWzzHoqTg.text: Passion fruit iced tea was awesome. Veggie chili with black beans mushrooms and sprouts pretty tasty. Skinny Jenny was good too. Grilled cheese was a disappointment. Bread was buttery and perfectly toasted but way too thick for the little amount of cheese in between. Plus i asked for tomato and when i indicated to the waiter that there was none, he promptly took my already bitten into sandwich and came back with the same. Basically they pulled apart my grilled cheese and placed a sliced of tomato inside and gave it back to me. NOT what i expected. The tomato soup that accompanied grilled cheese was ok. Not creamy or overly sweet. Good for dunking the bread. Overall food was ok nothing special.

0xETEq26EpJ3fecwDdsUJw.text: Overpriced.  Coffee is good, turkey bacon is Jenny-O from Smiths, some other weird things like bananas in huevos and some hard selling on upsells like adding avocado and mango jalapeno sausage (which is tasty)  Here's the rub, breakfast for two shouldnt cost 40$+ unless it has top notch ingredients and if avocado is a must have on a dish it should come on it.

B74blWSNnluRmNICUgyc8A.text: Brought our baseball team down for lunch between game. It was a home run with the kids and parents.

plLzT4P0vDsPoAIlf856jg.text: Always good food, nice atmosphere, and friendly service.  The drawback is that you probably have to wait for a table on the weekends.  But the food is delicious!

-n6lZI8OrwuEbI9-1DPgug.text: Disappointed again!!! Crap service, small order size, single layer of hash, tasteless biscuits , watered down tomato soup, not a smile in the house, and really I have to wait 10 minutes to get a water refill ...really sad with so many good things happening downtown!!! $50 for this , I'm done!!!

hz5r5x8Abniv_pls-nRP-Q.text: I came here on a recommendation and was not disappointed. We were lucky to be seated right away, as we understand there is always a wait because the place is that good. Loved the deviled eggs and the cinnamon biscuits.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Cinnamon biscuits with strawberry compote

5ItDEdUUwjpvBSgeStI7Pw.text: FANTASTIC! In from out of town and saw the great reviews so we had to try it. The food and service was perfect. Don't miss out!

h3z6gg5yUWGEOALzM4WmYg.text: My favorite place to come for breakfast! Food is delicious! Best pancakes I've ever had.

f-EzN4UJxhmcEjMGYCfZcQ.text: Pan seared chicken sandwich was delectable. It's a great interior space, friendly staff and cool location.

TXo1XCs1GSdW9jWyEBA_9g.text: Had breakfast on May 17 while in town vacationing. The eggs benedict was fantastic - the most delicious hollandaise sauce. My friend had the breakfast sandwich - just wonderful. The breakfast potatoes were tasty with onions and light seasoning. Coffee was strong and flavorful. Our only regret was our stomaches weren't bigger! We will be back for a meal next time we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict

5m_dhTjbcDqI5hOQb73ojw.text: Love it, Love it, Love it. I come here on every trip to vegas for breakfast- shrimp and grits or the the hash- both the best I've ever had, excellent coffee and delicious pancakes too- the food is made and served with pride,

61osHibo--yZBAeIHOnGjQ.text: After looking forward to a nice brunch we were extremely disappointed by the managers rude attitude today. We were a group of 10 and she tried to sit us on a table for 8 and when we asked the server if they can add the empty 2 person table to our table the server said let me ask the manager. She then came back & said ok but the manager immediately came to our table and said no no wait I cannot give you the table unless we don't have a waiting list. There was at least 3 empty tables.  I have never been in a restaurant that the manager was so rude with no customer service. However the severs were great & food was excellent despite the managers rude service.

4Gm1ln8pgp9PiEW4FSmw0w.text: Wow! What an amazing place. This is a hidden Gem! Best food I ever had. No Lie!! Service was excellent as well. Thanks!!

mmCY4yexiHczrnS_HpUKOg.text: We had the Chicken Fried Steak and it was delicious, the potatoes was a tad burnt on some pieces. The pancake was awesome and the Shrimp & Grits was Superb. I had the Ruben sandwich and it was perfect. I had to say that the bread were delicious. The only thing that was slightly upsetting was the amount of time to plaxe our orders, they sat us down but took almost 10 minutes to ask us what to drink, let alone say hello. On the other hand, after ordering, it took less than 5 minutes for the food to come out, and it was very large portions.The atmosphere was excellent and clean place.

12wEBX6Wg3RmPvW_VII4Sg.text: Great food. Great service. Egg truffle sandwich was amazing. Definitely coming back when we're in Vegas.

n6_SEnqzv8FJxnt9vVH-iw.text: Just, perfectly good! Our Server was simply AWESOME which made the food & the experience that much better! The cinnamon bread brunch "app" was just pure YUMMINESS!!! The Chicken Fried Steak was GREAT but that gravy was AMAZING! The grits, were GREAT!

HaR3KxvtmMA3kNzYlH2-VQ.text: Love this place. We were greeted by Jazz with a huge smile and a lively good morning. Blonde Ali hit the table with drinks in second and we were off. They are very willing to substitute, then green eye Ali took over. Everything was fantastic, I give this place ten derby tips and a right eyebrow up

hAZB-cYJYcqxXHle3TYB0g.text: Let me begin with this...if you like deviled eggs you MUST try the deep fried deviled eggs! They were the best little piece of heaven I had in years. The egg whites  are fried perfection and the filling is topped with a bacon and tomato chutney essence. I am a fan of Cracker Barrel style pancakes and this is the first place in Vegas that I have had the  fried edged griddle style cakes! They were awesome. There was a 30 min wait but container park is directly across the street and made the time go by. You must check this out for a brunch option.

jCGM7yexQNMj5Ss0xmy8OQ.text: Friendly service & BOMB food!! I'll drive downtown to Eat anytime it's totally worth it!
